review_body: The hotel is nice and cozy but the rooms are too small, staff were very friendly though. Location is not bad, a lot of nice small eating place and every place is walkable. just a little scary on the other side of the street. There was a little hotel or apt that we noticed that police is always there bec people are always hanging out.

We have always cherishedOur stay at the VIVE.It is not just a place to stayIt is our home in Hawaii. We have always stayed at the VIVE. My wife and I celebrate our Anniversary There every year.We are treated like Royalty. We have got to know almost each and every member of the VIVE Team.They have treated us like family year after year.This year was especially a great year as we got to reward them for the great hospitality they always show us.My wife and I got to enjoy a Pizza lunch with the housekeeping staff.Lots of laughter and great Pizza. So nice to show our Respect to the wonderful Crew that make the VIVEa wonderful place to stay, While also enjoying the Beauty of Hawaii. The Consiere always arranges our entertainment and we always get great 1st class service.Our Sunset Dinner Cruise and Luau experience was outstanding. We also got to enjoy the beach everyday as it is so close to the VIVE.Within walking distance.All our beach items were provided by the hotel...Free if charge..And we started out each day...with a healthy and delicious breakfast provided also by the wonderful kitchen staff.In all our stay there was So pleasant and we were Thoroughly pleased with our two weeks in Hawaii...Again...Thank You VIVE ...For making our Anniversary... 45th , very Special .

Absolutely Recommend. We will stay here next time we go to Hawaii. Front desk staff are amazing. Roger was extremely pleasant and helpful. The hotel was was one of the best highlights of our vacation. We Love this place.

I had a trip scheduled with a group of friends (all health care providers) when the covid19 pandemic arose. VIVE adapted their refund policy and was able to fully refund my deposit for this trip. They were easy to talk to and quick to respond. I look forward to rescheduling this vacation and won't hesitate to book with VIVE again!

Vive hotel has VERY QUICKLY become our “home away from home” in Honolulu.From the moment you step foot into their bright lounge,you feel yourself at home!!After 11 hours flight, we thoroughly appreciated those wet towels and refreshing pineapple juice offered by a kind “blonde” receptionist. Soon after,we were in our 21st floor junior suite,absolutely worth the extra money we spent on it. Large and inviting, lots of windows (we could spot Diamond Head and the ocean!!),and enormous walk-in shower and walk-in closet,armchair and a looong sofa … RELAX , here we come!!We also found a pleasant surprise:the WELCOME wishes from the staff (as we were celebrating our 45 wedding anniversary) : towel swans and chocolates made our evening!!It was so convenient to start the day with Vive exceptional buffet breakfast,all you can see in the pictures is true … and you get some more, like those yummy croissants with pineapple and hot dog inside or the soft cheese omelettes. One of the attendant,Kathleen (maybe Kaileen) , was always smiling,while making sure that guests had all they needed,she even helped me with my toasted bread!The lounge had plenty of room for everyone to enjoy breakfast, or, during the day, to relax in an comfy armchair with refreshing flavoured water ...or a cup of complimentary coffee or tea or chamomile. Everything at Vive hotel is well maintained and sparkling clean,all the staff is very committed and myself and husband really want to extend a big THANK YOU to each and everyone.The only (small) flaw is that a couple of days our room was not cleaned. I suspect that this was due to a malfunctioning of the very sophisticated in-room tablet, where you were able to “program” the requested time for your room cleaning. As a matter of fact ,if you were programming the room cleaning at (e.g.) 11:00 AM, at 11:05 a message was automatically generated by the system, informing us that the room was cleaned … but actually it wasn’t. I assume that this message was “marking” the room as “cleaned” in the housekeeping database, so actually they didn’t come to the room anymore. This happened twice, so it’s more than a suspect … no need to say that we avoided to use the tablet the following days and the room was perfectly cleaned per our request. It’s worth to note that, the day after the missed cleaning, we found a nice “Forgive us” card and gift in the room. Agatha ,from housekeeping,always left us fresh towels, all necessary toillet items and a sparkling clean bathroom; bedroom linens were changed every day, all in our room was immaculate!The hotel is just steps away from Waikiki Beach,but at the same time so far from the hustle and bustle of Kalakaua Avenue,it was our little Hawai’ian paradise in the middle of Waikiki.Can I say more ? YES, we are planning to be back asap!!HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

I reserved the room for my son who stayed an extra day to enjoy Waikiki.Location is perfect. Enough light to enlighten the room. Awesome view to see the city. The offer of breakfast is greatly appreciated even though my son skipped it.Overall, it is just about right except that the room door is so closed to the bed.

My wife and I stayed here 2 years ago and decided to stay again for our mini moon. The service is always excellent here, from receptionist to valet! Rooms are a bit small, but pretty clean. Breakfast buffet is pretty decent, not a lot of protein options, mostly carbs. We love how the hotel’s amenities! They let you borrow beach mats, towels, chairs and even GoPro cameras! And last but not least, the location! Just two blocks from Waikiki beach, a few blocks from the International Market Place, restaurants and shopping all around! Great place for its price!

My wife and I recently celebrated our 5 year anniversary at your hotel and I have to say that your entire staff was on their A game at all times. Concierges` KC and Francessca were very knowledgeable and helpful at planning our to do list. Front Desk, Trey, Aude, John G, Emily, Amy, and Roger exhilarated professionalism throughout our stay. I use to be the Guest Service supervisor at a four star Resort and Spa and I truly appreciate customer service and hospitality. The Supervisor Alex was wonderful as well. The Breakfast attendants were remarkable and very hard working. The Hotel was very clean and our room was even cleaner than expected. Thank you very much for the anniversary gift and kind card. We will gladly stay at Vive Hotel on our next visit to Hawaii

We had Room 1508 which is very large. The Room complete with wheelchair acessible shower. Ample room to move around and to store luggage.Walls would need a bit of paint, its dark to our tasted, and carpet is very industrial looking.It is a corner room with views of the mountain and view of the beach. It is close to the beach, kapiolani park, zoo and aquarium. Everyone is super nice and understanding. With the covid virus many like us, had to cancel and go home. No fuss nor hassle.They served breakfast box instead of a buffet breakfast. Great idea.All day coffee and tea, and water dispenser. No coffee machines in room.The city bus passes conveniently in front of the hotel. Great stay.

Excellent , location is good as only 2 blocks away from the beach. The room is very cleanBreakfast is excellentStaff is very helpful and freindly Overall, we are very happy with the choice we made.Roger is very nice and helpful in response to emails and my questions

Loved my stay at VIVE. I stayed in a 2 twin bed room with city views. The room was a great size for two people with enough space for each person to have their own space for luggage and the bathroom was roomy as well. Place was well stocked with soap, shampoo, body wash. Check-in was super easy with the room being avail a little earlier than anticipated. They provided cold hand towels and yummy pineapple juice upon check in which was nice after a day of traveling. Our guest services manager, Trey Kelley was very friendly and informative - super helpful and always provided service with a smile! I loved that the hotel had free breakfast with tons of fruit, tea, coffee, pastries. VIVE also provided FREE beach towels, beach mats and beach umbrellas. These factors really made the resort fee worth it even without a pool. The lobby is always stocked with coffee and fruit water as well. We didn't pay for parking but the hotel isn't too far from Ala Wai blvd where where there is free street parking on most days. Also the hotel is in a GREAT location - across the st from a yummy poke bowl spot (Maguro Spot) and delicious Musubi cafe (Musubi Cafe Iyasume). Would 100% stay here again. The beach is about 3 blocks away and you're also a short ~10 min walk away from the International Marketplace with tons of shops and a food court. Thanks for everything, Trey and VIVE staff!

I had a very good stay, now my 4th or 5th time and as with every other time all the staff are very friendly and very accomodating, the hotel has just about everything you'll need to make your stay comfortable and easy, I highly recommend the Vive Hotel Waikiki.

The Vive Hotel is a short walk from the Duke's statue on Waikiki beach. The hotel staff were great, the room was nice, clean, and quiet. On the 19th floor we had views of the ocean and the Waikiki skyline. The buffet breakfast was simple. Compared to the neighboring hotels, the Vive was a good value.

From the start of our stay, we appreciated the wet towel, fresh pineapple juice, chocolate coins, and flower at check in. Room was relatively small but adequate and well supplied. The bath tub drain plug would not close. Breakfast was included. Lot of seating and food items were enough with fresh fruit. Lounge had coffee, tea and pure water 24/7. Location was excellent in Waikiki area. Beach gear like umbrella, chair, and mat were free of charge. Parking fee of $30 per day was a little steep. No daily resort or amenity fee. We appreciated and enjoyed our stay in a home away from home. We will return if we visit this area again. We felt safe amid the ongoing coronavirus outbreak.

Staff...wonderful.Continental Breakfast...wonderful.Room (Jr. Suite)...nice!Location (see pic).Value...no words to describe. Minutes from the beach and those paying 3x as much. Recommend highly. You won't be disappointed.

We had a great experience. The bed wasn’t wonderful but the service and location more than made up for it. They gave us chairs, beach towels, etc every morning and they had a complimentary (post check out) room for us to shower and change before catching our evening flight. The breakfast and coffee were wonderful.

Vive Hotel is located one block away from Waikiki beach - about a 2 minutes walk. Quiet and handy to walk into the town. Stayed in a Family Room which was lovely. There is no bar but for us this was not a problem as you can either buy drinks to leave in the fridge in the room, or go out to explore the town, the latter being the best option I think! You can have towels and beach kit from the Vive, depending on your room rate this may be included.Breakfast is really good with copious fresh fruit, pastries and hot food but get there early. Check out the fab mural in the Ladies Washroom!Staff are wonderful. Particular shout out to Alex and Roger on the Guest Services Team. Nothing was too much trouble. Alex is lovely and so helpful generally -- great in recommending places to go and he welcomes feedback. He has great penchant for reading the customer and there really should be an 'Alex' in every establishment. Roger is a delight and quietly sorts out anything that is asked of him. He was so helpful in a polite and courteous way. An asset to the Vive.Thanks to you both as well as the rest of the team at the Vive.We hope to see you again.Lorraine & Linda

The service was very good both in cleaning, front desk, kitchen. I liked the beach mats, towels and other accessories. The front desk was great...good attitude. But the breakfast was minimally acceptable. Fruit was not good quality, other options were not much better. .

Nth return visit to Vive! Super friendly and effective staff; very comfortable and clean room. Included breakfast and (for fee) valet service impeccable. Rooms can be on the small size and breakfast area crowded at times. 24x7 coffee and tea available in lobby. Beach gear recently refreshed and completely satisfactory.
user_name:
Nagui H
Yorktown Heights, New York

review_body: My friends and I stayed at Vive for 10 nights, we booked 3 rooms and they booked us close to each other. I only have good things to say about this hotel. The lobby is very cozy and always fragrant. Upon arrival,we were greeted with a glass of cold pineapple juice and fresh towels to cool off our hands, which is lovely ( I have to tell you that, my sister thought the towels was burrito wrap served with juice!). Yes, the room is small, but I was only there for shower and sleep, it didn’t bother me at all . All employees are extremely polite and pleasant, no exception. I really enjoyed the breakfast, love the fresh and sweet fruits this was a very important point for me! You can’t beat the location !! 3 minutes walk and you are facing the central point of Waikiki, breathtaking views, nothing beats this location! They also offer towels, chairs, beach umbrellas to take to the beach. 24 hours infusing fruit water and coffee at the lobby. Saturday , Live music on lobby with a snack basket. On my birthday, what a lovely surprise! They left some cookies and cards on my bed, love it!! Something that really impressed me and hadn’t seen in any hotel, was the hospitality room, it really made all the difference ,be able to enjoy the beach after check out and go back to the hotel and have a room to shower and finish packing was amazing,we left around 6:00pm happy that we could enjoy our last hours at the beach ! The air conditioner was really noisy, but I still give Vive 5 stars!!Thank you so much for having us , if one day I come back , I would love to stay at Vive again!

Very good customer service.Good location. But the air conditioner was too noisy for good sleeping.Room cleaning was fair at first, improve afterward.Overall the living conditions are good but the air conditioner should be replaced or improved.

I stayed here based on a friend’s recommendation. The walkway leading to the room was tattered and had bits of debris everywhere, even in the mornings. Room was very small, but the layout is fine. It felt like they tried to add a bunch of small amenities like a tablet with your name on the wallpaper, a decent sized flatscreen. However, the window sills had holes in them, and didn’t seem quited sealed off. The room came with a small window-mounted a/c unit that was very noisy and left the room damp for the duration of our stay. I would be okay if this hotel were half the price, but at roughly 200 a night, it is simply not worth it. Legit beachfront options are available at the price. The only ok thing was the breakfast. We had five nights booked, but left after one night to go to our usual hotel by the oceanfront.

This was my first trip to Hawaii. It will not be my last. My stay at Vive hotel was good, I felt the parking and price needs work, but overall it was enjoyable. If I were to come back, not sure I’d stay

First time visiting Oahu, and we were here for a family wedding. I had researched many hotels before deciding on Vive, and Daniel (manager?) was super warm, kind, and helpful in helping us with the code for the wedding website, and staying on top of the room arrangements. The location was great - a short walk to the beach, without being too close to all the noise and bustle. Short walk to all the restaurants and malls in Waikiki, as well as to the zoo if you’re heading that way. Very close to bus stops as well, useful when you don’t have a car. On-site parking is available, and the hotel was fine with us parking the car there even after we checked out - we just needed to take the car before 10pm. The hotel offered a complimentary hospitality room for one hour, and that allowed us to re-pack our luggage as well as shower off (we hiked and went to the beach on our last day). We made good use of the water filter station (we brought our own water bottles), and the daily free breakfast in the Vive Living Room. To everyone at Vive - thank you so much for your hospitality, it went a long way to helping my sister have the Oahu wedding she wanted.

Vive Hotel Waikiki is in a very nice location just a block or two from Waikiki Beach. The lobby is nicely decorated and there's plenty of space to hang out while waiting for your room to be ready. The lobby was also home to a wonderful breakfast spread which was included in the price of the room. The rooms were clean but not very spacious. The reception staff were very pleasant and provided me with great information about events happening in town. Be sure to review the info they provide or you'll miss out fun free events! Overall I enjoyed my stay at the Vive Hotel Waikiki!

This hotel is not far from the beach and who needs the pricey view? I like the chic decor. Terrific, friendly and efficient staff. Nice breakfast buffet with a wide variety of items to choose from. The Bus is right outside and made getting around pretty easy.

Delightful people work here. The service was wonderful. It’s a 3 star hotel similar to a holiday inn express. Adequate but small rooms with a mediocre bed and mediocre continental breakfast. Short walk to the beach. I gave 2 stars instead of 3 because they slide in a $25 daily “amenities” fee if you book through a discount hotel app (Expedia). That’s a bait and switch and it’s not acceptable.

Vive was a great hotel for our family of 3. We rented a Jr Suite with 2 bedrooms/2 bathrooms. Totally enough room for us. The rooms were quiet, made up expertly every day and the complimentary breakfast was excellent. One drawback that I can mention is the valet parking area. It is very tight so if you are having a Lyft or Uber drive you request that they meet you outside the building. We walked to teh beach area every day we were there and even to the zoo and shopping.

A very bad start when I tried to pay up front for the room in cash. You wanted to charge me the amount on my credit card as well. You wanted me to pay twice for the room in effect. I then had to argue my case with your inflexible employee who I was not impressed with. We eventually came to an agreement where by you put an authorisation on my debit card for which the funds have still not. been released and I still believe to be an excessive amount. Due to this I will never be back.

Loved VIVE! Travelled with my husband and another couple. Great location...central to everything, shops, beach and public transport. Don't need to worry about packing beach towels as the hotel provided towels, beach mat, beach chairs, umbrellas and snorkelling gear. Staff were exceptional. Booked direct with the hotel with no issues. Highly recommend and will be staying at VIVE again.

The place was great. It is only about a 3 minutes from the beach, they let you rent out chairs and towels for free. The staff was amazing always willing to help out with what we needed. Breakfast is good too, other hotels didn't offer these services. For the money you can't beat this place. You will hundreds of dollars to stay at a chain hotel and it will be more crowded.

The Vive Hotel was a great choice we made. Staff was overall wonderful, professional to make your stay nice.The breakfast included was perfect to start your day, purified water for reusable bottles delicious flavor, facilities clean with original local artwork on every floor and our room was on higher floor being clean and comfortable!We would stay at Vive Weikiki Hotel again and will recommend to family, friends, everyone...you can't beat the price for the amenities offered.

Though it is an older hotel, they have redone it with a great vibe and their customer service was the best!! They helped with special reservations, had games, every beach accessory needed, really close to everything. Loved it!

No one was at front desk for atleast 10 minutes when we were first checking in. Had no way to ring bell for them or anything. We were hazard parked out front for concern that our car wouldn’t clear the parking garage, clearance is very low and looks like your car may not clear if it it’s a Jeep or SUV. Breakfast was great every morning and complimentary. The rooms and bathrooms were very small and reminded me of being in Europe.

Great location and good customer service. Junior suite was great for couple. Had beach chairs, towels, and umbrellas for beach. breakfast in the morning was good. Valet was a bit much 30.00 a day. Booked thru website and received a great deal.

KC at the information desk was the Best!!!! Any request we had was fulfilled without delay!! So Beautiful!! So close to the Beach!!! Always a big breakfast with lots of variety! Definitely a must stay again!

My boss said I could pick my hotel (within gov limits) for a 12-day business trip, and I got lucky! Great location, service, breakfasts, live music, wine tasting, views, room...and Dufy and Picasso!Mahalo boutique Vive Hotel Waikiki!

location is good, close to the beach, easy access to public transportation. Service staff is very friendly, price is reasonable, however, it's a little bit noisy at night time. We probably will stay for the next time and recommend it to our friends.

5/5 great place for their customer service. Very friendly, Very helpful and understanding, they took care of every need. Big shout out and thanks to their concierge KC.! Would come back and recommend!

Great location, walking distance to beach, bus stops are almost right at the entrance. Close to shopping malls and restaurants. The staff are very friendly. I also like the living room at the lobby. You can easily kill time by playing various board games provided by the hotel. There is also a small library in the living room. They also have live music twice a week. Loved it! The only complaint I have is there is not a laundry facility in the hotel but you can find a coin laundry 2 blocks away.

First & foremost I want to thank Vive Hotel for their professional & amazing customer service!!!The breakfast bar is another 5 stars on my list! The amenities are excellent It’s conveniently located close to everything you’re looking for! I would say when I come back...,Vive Hotel is the only place I would stay!!! I also would love to give a special shot out to KC the concierge( which is another perk Vive Hotel has), she’s guided me in so many ways....she takes pride in what she does ensuring that my stay here was convenient, resourceful, & memorable!!!! Thanks Vive Hotel *****

A great place to stay. The staff are friendly, although there was one occasion when I observed a front staff member being professionally curt. The place was clean. On arrival there was a funny smell in room and corridor. Staff fixed the issue immediately. I used the courtesy room on the day I checked out and that was an awesome service. I wish more hotels would offer that service.A great location, minutes from the beach and seconds from the bus stop.

My husband and I took a quick trip over to Waikiki to spend time with family visiting from the Mainland. We chose Vive because it was close to their condo. I've walked past Vive many times, and found it to be a charming, boutique hotel, so wanted to give it a try. The Staff were friendly and helpful. The morning breakfast was impressive, the rooms are tiny but ours did come with a bathtub, which I prefer and was thankful for. The location is in the heart of Waikiki on Kuhio Street, so only a few blocks from the ocean. Our room came with a Queen bed, which seemed really small but cozy. I felt like the hotel was pricey compared to other small hotels close by, but chose it for it's ambiance. Once we checked out, we were still able to use the hotels beach towels for the day, which was appreciated because we didn't leave until that night. We're glad we tried it and was thankful for the convenience.

First things first. I HIGHLY recommend Vive Hotel Waikiki!! I give it a full 10/10. I like that there are so many variety of rooms to choose from! I believe most of the rooms all have a great view of the city as well and it was breathtaking. The lounge area is wide and has many board games, food, and a cute gift store to visit. Overall, they have everything for you! During my stay at Vive Hotel Waikiki, it was always a very comfortable, fun, warm, and adventurous experience for me. I really like that they offer free breakfast in the morning! So kind and thoughtful of them! There was a lot of food and drinks and plenty to share. I couldn't believe that they also offer free rentals for beach mats, beach umbrellas, and other items I may need as someone who's traveling there. Already you're saving so much money just by choosing your accommodation at Vive Hotel Waikiki! Cleanliness is huge for me and they're always clean. The hotel looked very clean and perfect. You can tell they take good care of there hotel.Another huge one for me is customer service. ALL THE STAFF AND MANAGER ARE SOOOOO kind and friendly. They were always smiling and made sure I had an amazing stay. Honestly, the people that work at Vive Hotel Waikiki are the ones that made me feel so comfortable. My whole experience at Vive was extremely relaxing. I like that they want the best for every one there. They are all professional as well. Great management!If you're debating on where to stay in Waikiki, no worries now because you found your place at Vive Hotel Waikiki where they provide what you need. I will most definitely be back and always recommend.Thank you Vive Hotel!

Fabulous friendly, clean, and well located hotel. Rooms not too large, but who stays in the room all day in Hawaii anyhow? Great staff, great decor, great breakfast, great valet parking. Stayed here on 4 trips and will continue to do so on future trips.

The staff were very friendly and eager to help if we needed anything. The room was very clean and the walk to the beach was short. The location overall was perfect; a variety of food and mall were all in the surrounding area. It deserves 5 stars.

Overall a great place to stay in Waikiki! Had some issues with the elevator a couple of times but the team was working hard to get it fixed in a timely manner. Housekeeping was quick to your room if you scheduled it on the room tablet. The rooms were small, but cozy and perfect for two! I just wish there were a little more drawers for clothes, instead of a desk. Mini fridge was great, but no microwave, however there was one in the lobby! The breakfast had yummy fresh fruit, but I wish there was a little more selection on the items each morning. Adorable decorations for Valentine’s Day week in the main lobby and a cute shopping boutique where I found almost all of my gifts! The valet parking was quick and the staff was extremely nice and helpful! Can’t forget the short walk to the beach, restaurants and shops was a huge plus! Thanks Vive for a great experience!

Excellent location, service was delightful, when we first came in they gave us a delicious pineapple juice and a towel to freshen up, I thought it was a nice touch. The breakfast was perfect too, the lobby is very pleasant. The room is fine, clean, comfortable.

A tall hotel with valet parking and breakfast. It's within walking distance to Waikiki beach. We were greeted with pineapple juice on check-in. Though the room and bathroom were small, we could still manage to relax. Air conditioning was a bit noisy but we switched it off at night as it was rather pleasant in the evening in February. Selection for breakfast was mainly fruits but we didn't mind that as we were planning on bigger meals. The hotel provide mats and beach towels and has events throughout our trip which we didn't manage to see as we have other plans elsewhere.

Only one small thing I forgot to report before leaving: The bathroom sink in room 1805 was smelling and drainage quite slow. Otherwise we had no complaints. The staff were all very friendly and accommodating. The addition of omelet, bacon, sausages and eggs was a very good addition to the breakfast feast. MaholaMahl

Very good breakfast! Thank you to the ladies who prepared breakfast every morning.Clean rooms although somewhat older, in good shape!Air-co somewhat noisy. Good location only one block from beach, very helpful staff.

Made this trip very difficult as we were staying on the 14th floor. Good breakfast, fresh fruit and croissants. Allowed umbrella and towels for the beach. Clean hotel, helpful concierge. Elevators broke down twice during our stay. Only 2 elevators for entire property so this was extremely painful. Also mattress was too soft

Location is the name of this hotels game. The shops around are all of awesome value, the beach is so close I don’t bother bring changing clothes for my little toddlers! The only downer was the elevator went out of commission on the day when I am due to depart and bell boy didn’t show up in the midst of all the chaos! Everything else was really great and can see attention being paid in all the details.The air conditioner in my room was a window model; which isn’t quiet at all, but for me it really added a nostalgic note to my stay but some may find it annoying.Oh and they really need to add staff to the valet parking or let customers park at least on one floor to save some time. I feel for the valet drivers when it’s busy!All in all we will be back again as the room gave space which is quite a premium in Waikiki especially a godsend for families with two sets of bathrooms.

After a few leaks sprung in the roof of the Air B N B we were staying in, we relocate to this hotel and it was amazing. The staff were all friendly and greeted us daily with a smile. Although we were only there two days, it was one of the highlights of our trip. The room had amazing views of the ocean and city. I would definitely recommend staying here if you can. Great location, 2 blocks walk to the beach.

We had a great stay. The hotel does not look very nice from outside (no balconies, first floors are garage, hallways are narrow and it feels like a reconstructed apartment building), but they sure did the best in the lobby and breakfast area, which is nice and funky. Breakfast buffet is included (a rate find in Waikiki) and is pretty decent. Can get crowded (only few distinct tables and couches). Beds were too soft, rooms are really tiny, bud clean and furnished by modern standards (hotel tablet). The lack of active ventilation in the bathroom makes the space humid (that was probably a reason for small mold spots on the lamp shade). Apart from the details, we had a great stay - location is excellent and staff very friendly and helpful. Bonus items were free beach gear (mats, towels, ...) that you could borrow for free at the front desk. Valet parking only ($$$).

The hotel was nice and clean overall. The staff was nice and helpful. The rooms were kind of weird in the setup, the head of the bed perched directly next to the bathroom which did not have a fan. There was water trapped under our bathtub also, every time we got in to take a shower you could here is squishing and feel it under there. There is an in room fridge but it has a warning inside “ this fridge may not keep food at safe temperatures” they were right, it didn’t. So what’s the purpose of the fridge if it doesn’t refrigerate? Weird. Air conditioning was nice and cold, and easy to operate. Staff brought me an extra blanket because hubby likes the room extra cold. And when he burned himself on a beach day, they brought us extra lotions to soothe his burn. Very nice staff. The pool in the photo does not exist, it belongs to another property but you can see it from upper floors of hotel. This hotel felt like the renovation was rushed and done cheaply, atleast in the rooms. The lobby was very nice and the breakfast everyday was BOMB! I only wish they would have offered the fresh pineapple juice all day long instead of just at breakfast. It was honestly the best pineapple juice I ever had and mixed nicely with the bottle of rum I picked up from the ABC store down the block. Be careful when booking from other sites such as trevelocity. Even though you book and pay in full, they still charge a daily fee. We were charged an extra day of parking but had it removed and it wasn’t a problem for them to remove the charge. Our experience overall was great, but if you need a larger space and want a balcony this hotel likely isn’t for you.

Vive Hotel is a great location--about 2 minutes to the beach; right by a city bus stop; one block from Alamo car rental; and right beside a number of top hotels which may cost much more. It is relatively newly renovated; the bathrooms are new and designed well with all amenities necessary, including robes. The size of the room we had, with a large queen bed, closet, luggage rack and extra stuffed chair, was more than adequat; also had a safe, mini fridge, desk, charging stations, great TV, and ok view. Towels were newish and fluffy; and the concierge was really helpful and assisted in a car rental, suggesting activities, and helping us book them. The hotel provides towels and mats and umbrellas for the beach, and has a nice breakfast, with coffee and water available 24/7. A nice lounge area and reception area, with helpful staff made us feel really welcome. The housekeeping was friendly, but the cleaning could be a tad better--a few crumbs, hairs, were found left--but this was very minor. The air conditioning was older, and we might have preferred it cooler, but again, this was not a deal breaker. For the price, we couldn't have been happier or more satisfied. We would definitely stay there again.

Two blocks from the beach is just right: an easy walk but not full-on crazy busy. The rooms had just what they needed, and the bright colors and welcoming staff in the lobby were perfect. It was so easy to use the valet park at the hotel. Lots of fresh fruit, good coffee and other foods at the complimentary breakfast. Good spot to refill our water bottles each day, too.

I came to Waikiki for a conference, and was looking for a hotel with a good location, free wifi and breakfast, and within my budget. This place exceeded my expectations! The staff was amazing, we had everything we needed, breakfast included lots of fresh fruit, and we were just blocks from the beach.

We spent three nights and two and a half days at the Vive Hotel Waikiki. It was great. While we were not on the beach, we could see it from one of our windows and see Diamond Head from another. The hotel was clean and comfortable. The breakfasts were delicious and filling. The hotel offers towels, chairs and body boards for use on the beach. The staff was extremely helpful at the desk and throughout the hotel. The concierge, KC, was fantastic. She gave us lots of suggestions of where to go, how to maneuver the public bus system (with an realistic idea of the time it might take), and was friendly and excited for us to love her city the way she does. I highly recommend a stay at the Vive Hotel Waikiki.

My husband and I stayed here from January 25th to February 1st 2020. Overall, a good hotel. The only negative? It's a very old building that could use some renovation. Apparently it was recently taken over and the previous hotel didn't get such great reviews. It's definitely showing its age. The lobby seemed newly redone but the corridors and our room were in desperate need of a coat of paint as there were scratches all over the walls. However, everything else was great. The staff are extremely friendly and accommodating. Our room had some spilled popcorn and items left by the previous guest when we arrived. The staff immediately took care of this for us and then left us a bottle of wine with a box of chocolates! The continental breakfast is good value for what you get, and you can borrow as many beach items as you wish. The beach is less than a five minute walk away. And KC the concierge was super friendly and helped us book the Paradise Cove Luau which was a great experience. By no means is this a five-star hotel - nor is it trying to be as there are enough of those around! - but it's the best bang for your buck in Waikiki where everything is ridiculously expensive. I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone headed to Waikiki.

Staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was basic and of fair quality. Repeated hard boiled eggs with bacon one day manufactured omelette and sausage the next. One day when we returned to our room at 4:30 it had not been cleaned. Another day the smoke alarm started chirping at 7:00am. Shouldn't you have a schedule to change the batteries regularly.

We had a wonderful stay. Friendly staff. Clean rooms. Great location. We called for room service one day, the staff forgot but immediately attended to our needs and left us chocolates for the error. I would highly recommend this hotel.

The concierge, KC, helped us out getting tickets for the USS Arizona Memorial when it looked like we might not have a chance to see it. We didn't know it's best to get tickets online way in advance. KC worked with us to figure out how to get the tickets we needed. Thanks, KC.

Our stay at the vive was pretty good, The buffet breakfast was great, and the service was very good. Only downside was that the room didn’t have windows you could open for fresh air, other than that we were pretty pleased.

Room is very small. Very little storage for even two people. No coffee maker even. Clean enough. Lamps and vents need dusting and at night AC give musty smell. Continental bkfst doesn’t even have cereal. Service good and beach close.

Suite is nice and exactly what it is appeared on their website. Staff and concierge are friendly and helpful. Location is excellent to the beach, bus stops, restaurants and shopping areas. Reception provided area map and weekly events list are a must to have since it gives you all you need to go and do for your stay. However, deluxe continental breakfast is not so deluxe and indeed quite disappointing. Not so much of hot items either. Stayed for 6 days and only had papaya once. Suite size does not appear to be 440 sq ft as suggested and bathrooms are small with no elbow room, and fan. Hotel is surrounded by other buildings so not much of a view either. But make sure you go to the balcony behind the elevator on top floor to take a photo of the partial Diamond Head you can see!

Had an amazing view of the city, Diamond Head, and even the ocean! The staff was very pleasant. Easy walk to the beach and dining. Good breakfast each day. Only wish is that the refrigerator in the room would have been a bit bigger.

Great overall! best value.. great location... kind staff. The rooms are small but you don't go to Hawaii to stay in a room. Complimentary breakfast is always a plus. The valet and front desk staff is awesome. Upon arrived you are greeted with a cool towel and pineapple juice.

This was our second time staying here. It’s such a nice, friendly hotel. Lots of places to sit, good breakfast, cold flavored water in afternoon & comfy bed. There’s a helpful concierge. They offer a courtesy room after checking out where you can freshen up before your flight as well as store your luggage. It’s close to Waikiki but far enough away to be quiet. It will be our go to place to stay when we return.

The Vive was perfect for us. We wanted a hotel with breakfast and those are hard to find. The breakfast at Vive was simple but perfect. The fresh fruit was amazing (just as the picture showed). We had hard boiled eggs one morning and plain omelet style eggs with sausage the next. They also served bread for toast and some other breads along with tea, juice and coffee. It was perfect way to start our day. They had a water filter station that you could access all day - loved that!! The location, just 2 blocks from the beach and restaurants was perfect. They have beach towels, etc that could be checked out to use at the beach, we didn't use this service but love the option. The hotel room and bathroom was clean - ours was a little small but we weren't in there much so it didn't matter. They had games and books in the lounge area and a computer to use if needed. My only complaint was the bed - mine was not only soft but saggy. On another positive note, we were asked when we checked in why we were there - it was a belated 30th wedding anniversary - the next day we came back to the room with the towels made into 2 swans, a note and a box of chocolates. What a nice gesture - we were totally surprised!

Pros: Great spot with quick short walk directly to the beach. Beach chairs, towels, mats are perfect and easy to check out. Bedroom and Bathroom was clean. The shampoo, conditioner, and soap in the shower was really nice. Cons: The free breakfast was not good and the TV remote wouldn't jump to a channel, you had to scroll 1 channel at a time. The roller shades were installed incorrectly and wouldn't roll up all the way.

Good location and near to Waikiki beach. Friendly font desk and good amenity. However, a little shortcoming is that bathroom is facing to the bed in our room. That is perhaps related to the promotion room we booked. Overall, that is a good hotel.

Nice hotel. Rooms a little small but good for the price. A little noisy at night as the in-window air conditioner lets in a lot of street noise and wind noise. If you're a light sleeper bring ear plugs! Location is good, just a short walk to Kuhio beach. Also not too far from the shopping and dining further north on Kalakaua Ave.

Great stay Staff very friendly excellent breakfast. Greeted with fresh juice and wet fragrance towels. Breakfast boxes prepared for us on a day we had a early morning tour Staff helpful to make reservations .Small room but everything you needed.

Convenient location, close to the beach and shopping centers and eating places. Very helpful staff and nice lobby. Good free breakfast. However a bit noisy with traffic at night as our room is facing the city.

We stumbled upon a gem. We got a nice deal on top of an already reasonable rate. The service was great, the rooms were small, but clean, and overall was a good experience. They knew it was our anniversary and included a little gift on our bed with towels shaped like doves. Great for people wanting a clean and reasonable place to stay with free breakfast, and not interested in a resort with a lot of amenities. We felt the beds were extremely comfortable.

Overall very happy with our stay. Small hotel not too expensive, small rooms lack storage and hanging space but comfortable, close to everything in Waikiki. Welcome desks and parking staff very friendly.. Room cleaning service sporadic, not top..... Windows and/or AC installation not well sealed / soundproofed

I was charged with New Amenity Fees when I used no amenities at all. They said there was bottles of water in the room when there was not. I will not ever book another room here for any future returns.

First, the good. Great location with easy access to the beach. The majority of the front desk staff were helpful and friendly.The two things that disappointed me the most were the condition of the room and the breakfast. My room was in dire need of updating and was quite plain with no style. The overall presentation of the room seemed like it involved almost no thought. I get that this is not intended to be a high end property but I expected more.The breakfast was a huge let down. Not much selection and average quality food at the best.I will definitely look for another hotel option the next time I am in Honolulu.

The rooms are smaller than the photos show, but are very comfortable, and the place has a modern scandinavian vibe. The room was plenty big but no excess room and very clean. The staff was great, very helpful and pleasant. Breakfast was good, fresh fruit and baked goods, but get there early as there are not a lot of places to sit and eat.

Excellent location, great service and very helpful staff. Breakfast nice addition. Booking directly to save service fee great! Bus stop next door to hotel. Casey always friendly and very helpful with information about the island and booking of any trips needed.
user_name:
Darren James C
Bvrleigh Waters, Queensland

review_body: We just spent a month in this hotel again for a reason. The staff, the rooms, the breakfast buffet at their prices is a bargain and we already made reservations again for our next month long stay there.

Vive Hotel Waikiki is only a few blocks away from the beach, shopping malls and restaurants making it very convenient. The service was good. Rooms were pretty spacious. Wish there were more food options for the breakfast, but can’t really complain since the breakfast was free. There was also a water fountain in the lobby to refill your water fountain which was nice. The hotel also offers free beach mats to borrow. Overall, I had a pleasant stay at Vive Hotel Waikiki during my time in Hawaii.

Amazing experience. Hotel was close to the beach, shopping centres, restaurants, bus stop. Clean hotel and we enjoyed the tea and coffee ready all the time at the lobby. Very friendly staff and specially KC was so helpful.

This hotel was excellent. Room was a bit small but totally worth the money. The vibe is great, it's clean, and the staff were very professional and kind. Roger mostly took care of us, and he was fantastic in every way. We were also able to store our bags and use a courtesy room after we checked out, so we could shower and freshen up before taking a long night flight home, which really accommodated our needs. The lounge was beautiful and fun to hang out (with 24-hr coffee and tea available), and they also have a cute shop featuring local artists' products. Totally recommended.

Good breakfast, super service with early checkin, bag storage, use of hospitality room. Wind was noisy as it hit side of building we were on. Saw rainbow from our 14th story room. Room small. Overall great stay

I appreciated so many things about this hotel. The service from the moment you walk in the door (yum to the fresh squeezed pineapple juice you get at check in) is amazing. They offer games in the lobby area and the breakfast that is included was so delicious! My only major complaint is that the room was more like a 2 star rather than 3. We had a view through the buildings which was nice but the bed was extremely uncomfortable and the carpets were dirty. If they just upgraded furniture this place would be on the top of my list!

The vive hotel has a nice appearance downstairs with plenty of seating and nice decor. Breakfast was good. Plenty of nice fresh fruit, bread for toast, hotdog bagels, coffee and juice everyday. You can borrow beach towels and umbrellas at not extra cost. We found the staff easy to approach and helpful when asked. The room was average but had everything you need. The issue we had was we slept so badly here. The noise from the AC was really loud, the wind hits the side of the building so it sounds like you are sleeping in a tent and in the morning you can hear the street noise. We found ourselves rereading the hotels reviews at 3am to find that many had faced a similar problem. For this reason we did not request a room change and just accepted we were only there for 3 nights. We were woken every morning to a beautiful view of a rainbow. We let the staff know on the way out that we had trouble with the noise and they said they would get the maintenance to have a look. We would not expect anymore at this point and feel if we had mentioned it earlier we probably would have been offered a room change no problem because the staff were accommodating in all other aspects... We just couldn't be bothered with the hassle and expected another room may still be noisy.

Great spot with short walk to the beach. Helpful staff. Clean room. Nothing fancy but quite adequate. They have nice breakfast. The only disappointment is there is no outdoor space. If you get a room facing the busy street you might want to purchase ear plugs. We were on the eighth floor and between the air conditioner and sirens and traffic it can be noisy.

We stayed here 5 years ago for a wedding and stayed in a junior suite. Enjoyed our stay and wanted to be nostalgic and stay here again. Got a regular room. Found the rooms to have been poorly maintained with paint chips all over the walls. The room was miniature and the bathroom tiny for 2 people. Bed smelt sour. We checked out of our 6 day stay after the first night.

Vive is a wonderful property located less than five minutes down the street from Kuhio Beach at the Duke Kahanamoku statue, and since they are so close to the beach they have beach mats, brellies, and towels available for you convenience. They give you a cold glass of pineapple juice and a cold rolled towel which is so refreshing when you check in. The front desk clerk Roger was very professional and helpful for the check in process.If you are expecting the "resort" experience, you will be disappointed with the 275 sq foot rooms without balconies, but the rooms are long and narrow and the queen beds work for singles and couples. If you have a baby or toddler, they offer a pack n play which will make the room seem very small. There is a family room and suite option at 450 Sq feet, but still pretty small compared to other suites. The main reasons why I booked the Vive, was the free Breakfast, location down the street from the beach and surfboard rentals, and the free breakfast which was a decent breakfast. If you need to leave before they serve breakfast, like to go to Hanauma bay, you can order a take away breakfast the day before.The only issues I would say is that the downstairs lounge, as beautiful as it is, is not functional as a breakfast space. Additionally, the property know in advance the occupancy so they could provide an overflow for breakfast when the hotel is full, since going up to your tiny room and eating you breakfast on your bed isn't a good option. The hotel was overall a great value compared to some of the other older run down properties that cost more over the winter holidays.

Was very clean, friendly staff. The room was a lot smaller than we had expected but overall it was a great hotel. Breakfasts were good and the kitchen staff was lovely. I would definitely stay there again but would like a bigger room. The location is so close to the water.

Really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It's very close to the beach. Good breakfast. Tea, coffee, fruit flavored water available. Wonderful staff. Beach towel and mat available. Concierge Victoria was very helpful to build 3 tour packages for us in a short time. Thanks Victoria.

We really enjoyed staying there in your Jr. family suite. The location is great for walking to the beaches or around Waikiki and the people who work there are all so nice and friendly. We were so surprised to come home one day and find a lovely "happy birthday happy Anniversary" note with some Hawaiian goodies waiting for us. That was so sweet of them. The Vive is one of those old hotels that they have turned into a boutique hotel. Yes, the building is a bit dated but they have done a great job at making it feel updated and "cool". We would stay there again.

The location of this boutique hotel was great. It was just a few blocks to the beach. It was surrounded by good restaurants and retail shops. The staffs are very friendly and helpful. It was a great experience overall.

Location is great for the price. The rooms however are what you pay for - absolutely tiny. Customer service was lovely. We arrived early and they helped us get into our room at about 11:00am rather than the 3pm check in time. The breakfast wasn’t great. We never had breakfast at the hotel. Little to choose from. Would’ve been nice if there was a pool or a rooftop bar or something extra.

Another year to celebrate the new year! This place has the BEST continental breakfast. We have a the best comfortable n pillows. Staff has the best friendly attitude. The doing some thing but doesn't affect our stay. We will come back again. Mahalo! Highly recommend!!

Stay away from this hotel. Cleaning is definitely not a priority at this hotel. There were old blood stains at our pillow and the top of our closet had not been cleaned for months. Also, the breakfast is horrible with very only a few items.

Vive this hotel go ahead and sign up on their email list because I got a blast about a flash sale they were having. Being I have no permanent place of residence, I took them up on their offer and boy what a pleasant surprise

Not at 5 star , but much better than over rated hotels in the area. Very clean . Breakfast basic but is included in your room price . AC a bit noise at night, we just turned it off . Christmas time is not that hot . Front desk and conserge staff very helpful .

酒店位置很好，离海滩走路3-5分钟就到，吃饭也很方便，周围有许多性价比超高的餐厅。大厅服务也很好，还有早餐和24小时咖啡供应。The hotel is located in a good location, 3-5 minutes walk from the beach, convenient for eating, and surrounded by a number of cost-effective restaurants. The service in the lobby is also good, with breakfast and 24-hour coffee. It's just that the room is a little small and the window machine is making noise. Hotel lobby towel straw mat and sun umbrella can be borrowed at any time, very convenient.

This hotel offers great prices for its location. The staff is also very friendly and helpful. There is 24/7 good complimentary coffee in the lobby. Breakfast is also included. Everything in the area is walkable and safe. We did rent a car and hotel offers only valet parking which is pricy. The rooms are a bit small but that was not a problem for us, there is a bathtub in the room which for me is always a big plus. The only minus however, and for me its a big minus, is that although we slept on the 15!th floor it felt like we were sleeping on the first floor without windows. A LOT OF NOICE! I suspect that the glass is very thin and there is also an airco that is placed in the window. For me it was impossible to sleep without ear plugs. That would be a reason sadly not to stay here again, unless they change something about that

Great location!! Great food!! Great service!! I love coockies on the bed, it was so lovely.Bed and pillows are comfortable. Bread for breakfast is so delicious!! It was really a wonderful experience!!

The hotel is convenient and close to the beach. The air conditioner is very noisy and the mattress is too soft. The windows are not soundproof so you hear lots of wind blowing outside. The breakfast is good overall. It would be better if they serve milk and hot cereal. The room service is very good, replenishing Kleenex and towels.

Stayed at Vive for my first solo trip and it was amazing! Victoria Ulima and Amy Adams in particular were super helpful, hospitable, patient and friendly staff! The entire Vive staff were amazing as well.

This hotel is off the strip, only 2 blocks, great spot near Waikiki beach. It's a pretty basic room, but clean, most important to me. The morning breakfast is great, all you need to get started. The staff are super friendly and helpful, and on our last day, after we checked out at 11am, they offered a complimentary hospitality room where we could return to shower and change before our evening flight. This was excellent. They also offered plenty of beach towels, chairs, mats and boogie boards to take with you to the beach, this was fantastic.One downfall, there isn't alot of storage. We were there for 11 nights, so unpacked, but there are only 2 drawers to store clothes and a few shelves. We hung what we could, and they provided more hangers without a problem, but I would have liked more drawers.Being in downtown Honolulu, we also found it very noisy. I know this is on par with a city, but lots of sirens through the night to be aware of and garbage night is Thursday! Trucks come during th night to collect the big bins..woke me up both Thursdays I was there. The bed was comfy, the pillows, not so much.Overall a good stay for a reasonable price in Honolulu.

This review is of a Junior Suite with Ocean Views room. We stayed 7 days. Let me start by saying this is not a luxury hotel. There are plenty of those along the beach. That being said, it fits the bill in every way possible. My wife and I have traveled all over the world, generally staying in boutique hotels that are highly rated on Tripadvisoir. We believe it is better to spend our money enjoying the country we are in rather then the place we sleep for a few hours. This hotel checked all the boxes and was exactly as reviewed by others. The room is on par with a Holiday Inn or Hilton Garden. Comfortable and clean,. The bed was very comfortable with great pillows. The bathroom was big with a huge shower and real nice towels. That is one of the things that make a hotel for me, The only thing that surprised me was that there was no dresser. There was plenty of room for one. They did have pull out drawers under the bed and a huge walk-in closet. Other than that, I loved everything. about the room. Laying on the bed, I had a good view of Diamond Head and out another window a view to the beach. The Junior suites are very bright and sunny! I highly recommend the upgrade. One thing I did see commented on by other reviewers was the street noise. Yes, you can hear it but it was always quite by 10-11pm. There was zero noise from other guests in the hallways, something that always annoys me.The staff is outstanding in every way, friendly and always willing to help with any request. The free breakfast was OK. Not a lot of hot options. I am a little spoiled having experienced the breakfast spreads in Asia and many places in Europe. But, it really wasn't an issue since we wanted to be hungry for lunch at the incredible number of outstanding restaurants in easy walking distance. Try the Korean BBQ right across the street, it was great! Speaking of walking distance, that is the number one asset of The Vive. It sits smack in the middle of all the action but just far enough away to get away from the throngs and steps from the bus system which we took everywhere around the city. You really don't need a car although we rented one for a day to circle the island. You can get cars thru the hotel or an Enterprise location a couple blocks away at the Hilton.I stayed here on a recommendation from my brother who stayed last year. I would not hesitate to recommend it to others. It's an outstanding value in every way!

We love the Vive Hotel!The staff is very friendly and helpful. The daily breakfast was very well presented and allows for guests to get acquainted if they wish. Our junior suite was a good size and had a comfortable bed.We slept well enough but felt a mechanical upgrade would eliminate noise from the air conditioners and plumbing. The entertainment in the lobby as well as the availability of water and coffee all day contributed to the overall feeling of aloha that is difficult to achieve in a large enterprise.Keep up the good work. We hope to see you again!

Greeted at front desk with pineapple juice and cold wash cloth. Check was quick and valet parking worked well. Overall great experience for short stay. Had to leave very early for airport and car was ready as expected.

I like this hotel’s location, and the free coffee and water at its spacious lobby. Good WiFi in this hotel. Decent breakfast. You can borrow beach supplies. Very good value for the price. I recommend this hotel.

It was most awaited trip for us and glad we stayed with in Vive. Great location, great breakfast and service. Rooms are of decent size and beautiful. Covered valet parking and easy access. Beach is .1 mile away

The location of the Vive hotel is very convenient. It is very close to the Waikiki beach and the shopping area. As I travelled with big group, it is very easy for us to have a meet point when we have separate activities. I was very impressed by their responses to my requests which I found it very helpful. Though the hotel room is quite small, and the air conditioning is quite loud which i hope it can be improved. But I think it worth the value. I like the lobby which is very lively and modern, they serve good breakfast too. I will recommend the Vive hotel.

We are so thankful for the hospitality of every single staff person we encountered throughout our stay in Waikiki. Amy was the first to greet us upon arrival and the welcoming kindness of the entire staff made our experience at Vive Hotel comfortable and memorable. We hope to be back. Thank you!

Overall my stay was fine. The staff was attentive, the beds were comfy but there are almost no amenities. No pool, gym, room service or bar. The rooms weren’t in need of attention to paint, carpet, etc and the walls are paper thin. I heard my neighbors arguing every night.... in detail.

This hotel is not right on the water, but it’s only a couple blocks off the beach.The staff was very helpful and friendly. Greeted me every time I return to the hotel and said hi when we passed in the lobby. Plus they were able to answer all my question about transportation and local activities. I stayed on the 21st floor and had a nice view of the ocean. It was quiet. Not a lot of rowdy kids. Breakfast in the morning was a plus for me when I booked a hotel. It was nice to have a very healthy breakfast, that consisted of eggs, a meat (sausage or bacon) plenty of fruit, a wide selection of breads, coffee, tea, and juice. Also, located within walking distance of plenty of restaurants and shops. I would recommend this place!

We only needed a hotel for 1 night and the Vive was perfect! They offered an online upgrade to a junior suite for $20.00, which I did , and I am glad. The room was bigger and brighter with a view of Waikiki. The king sized bed was fine for my sister and I to share. Upon checking in, we were given cold pineapple juice and a wet cloth to freshen up. The staff is friendly and helpful. We asked for a kettle for our room and it was delivered in minutes!The included breakfast was plenty, offering 4 kinds of fruit, 3 kinds of pastries, 2 kinds of bread for toasting, bacon, hard boiled eggs, juice , coffee and tea. My sister left in the morning but my flight was not until much after the 11am check out time. No problem! They stored my bags and gave me beach equipment. I had booked the hospitality ( no charge) to shower after the beach.! The room was clean with a small fridge. I will stay there again! Mahalo Vive!

My wife and I stayed here for two nights before cruising on the Pride of America. We also stayed the day after our cruise before flying back home. Hotel was in an excellent location, only a couple of blocks to the beach (and provide you with beach related items if you need them), stores and restaurants.Strongly encourage you to book directly with the hotel as you save the amenity/resort fee. Valet parking is not an option if you have a high vehicle (over 6’) but both our rented minivan and four-door Jeep fit no problem. Staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms were fairly basic but certainly comfortable and clean. The common room in the lobby, where coffee and water is available throughout the day and breakfast is served in the morning, was a great place to hang out. They have boardgames and a library to borrow books from.

The Vive Hotel is as advertised. The rooms are fairly small, my room had an ocean view as promised. Room was clean and quiet. Breakfast every morning includes lots of cut fresh fruit. The location is perfect- just 2 short blocks to the beach and at the quieter end of Waikiki. Convenient location for buses. Plenty of shops and restaurants nearby. Staff at the hotel was friendly and helpful

Vive Hotel is an amazing place to stay. Great location, easy to walk places or catch bus right outside. The staff are super helpful and friendly. Room is clean and modern with some great touches. We loved our stay.

The all day access to free coffee, fast wifi throughout the hotel, free beach supplies and friendly staff were lovely! Gym access cost extra which was disappointing. Nice walk to beach (about 3 blocks). Bed too soft for my liking.

Excellent hotel. Would recommend the Junior Suite for an extended stay. Hotel was clean, staff couldn't do enough for us. Central location made getting around easy. Breakfast was excellent each day. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Look, there's no getting around the fact that it ain't cheap in Hawaii. We chose the Vive for the combination of proximity to Waikiki, the cost and the value. We stayed 4 nights during Thanksgiving and really liked it here. We upgraded a little and got an ocean facing room (though our view was a little limited by the taller buildings between us and the Pacific). Our room was spacious, had a safe, fridge, large bed, 2 chairs and a table in front of the TV, a desk and desk chair, iron and board. Our bathroom had shampoo, conditioner, bath gel, small bars of soap, hairdryer and lotion. Breakfast was included - including fresh fruit, breads and pastries. Hard boiled eggs/bacon and steamed eggs/sausage were served on alternating days. Coffee, teas, OJ and water was in abundance. Not many hotels include breakfast in the rate but Vive does. In fact, I walked into the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani and saw their breakfast buffet was going for 30 per person. The Vive also gives you beach towels, bamboo mats, chairs and umbrellas for the beach with no charge. Check in was easy (front desk person with the tattoos, sorry I didn't get your name). Check out was, as well (thanks Daisy). Breakfast guy hooked me up with a take out box with fruit, croissants and mini cinnamon buns to take to the airport (guy with the moustache and glasses - sorry didn't get your name either). Breakfast lady was nice too - think her name was Atne? Complementary fruit infused water and coffee all day in the dining area. Live music from local musicians a few times a week. Also, no downsides to think of - parking was for a fee but we didnt have a car and no gym but they do offer a day pass for 15 bucks at a partner place. Lastly, no dumb ripoff resort fees that other folks charge nowadays if you book direct with their site. We would definitely choose the Vive again.
user_name:
StephenN1694
New York City, New York

review_body: I just want you to know that my wife & had a great stay at the Vive Hotel in Waikiki. The Vive is a short walk from pretty much everything - the beach, restaurants, shopping and The Bus practically stops right outside the front entrance. The staff at the hotel were excellent. Victoria at the reception desk , and all of the other team members from the other folks at reception, kitchen staff & the wonderful ladies who look after your room, are always cheerful and treat you like Ohana - the best !My family and I have been to Hawaii a few times but this is our first stay at Vive and I would not hesitate to return - they offer a buffet breakfast in the morning and have infused water and tea & coffee available throughout the day. The beach towels, mats, chairs, umbrellas and boogie boards are a HUGE bonus.Thank-you for making this year's vacation a memorable one.I would highly recommend this Hotel to anyone interested in visiting Waikiki.Mahalo !Wayne & MicheleOntario, Canada

I don't like the false alarm part. The eggs serving at breakfast taste strange sometime. Everything else is good. Like the decorations at lobby. The beach supplies are very helpful. The location is great.

This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in, and my entire family agreed. Here are all the things I have to say about this wonderful hotel!Staff:Every staff we encounter is wonderful. They are friendly and helpful. I started asking questions via email 6 months prior to my stay, and they always reply back with a quick response. When I need something at the hotel, everyone is very helpful. All the staff are great, from front desk, room service to valet. They left us a little treat for our 10 years anniversary, and I just received an email wishing us happy anniversary after our stay. Great attention to details and making guests feel extra special. Cleanliness:One of things that is most important for me is the cleanliness of the hotel and room, and Vive is one of the cleanest hotel I ever stayed in!!Location:The hotel is only 8 mins walk to the beach (with my 2 kids), and it has many great eatery and stores around the hotel, it is so convenience especially you need to grab a quick bit before the young kids snooze off after a long day. Amenities:120% happy for what they've offered. Breakfast was great!! We had breakfast there every morning, and my kids love the fresh fruits. We had breakfast there for 7 days straight and still enjoy every single day of it. They are not short of stuff you can use on the beach, from beach towels, mats, umbrellas and chairs. Extra bonus for the kids to have the beach toys and child size boogie boards. On site parking is another bonus, very convenience and don't have to worry about finding parking far from the hotel and walk back with two tired kids. I also enjoy having water/fruit water and coffee all day long. We used the dining area a few times for dinner, as we got some take out and enjoyed having dinner at a comfortable area while it was raining outside. The room we stayed in was excellent too. A lot of space and the kids actually can move around comfortably.I can go on and on about how great this hotel it, and I am going to recommend this hotel to all my friends who will be traveling to Oahu in the near future!!

No microwave, fridge would not keep drinks cold. Still looking for a ice machine, parking very high. the rest of things were ok, why are you making me make this statement sooooo long. Again not long enough, also no dresser.

We had a week at the Vive. The location was great, close to the beach and shops. The staff were friendly and helpful. Book directly with the hotel, and there are no resort fees. Breakfast was good, I was surprised and a little disappointed in our room. It was much smaller than I anticipated, more like a ships cabin. And there is NO POOL at this hotel. And yes, I know I should have done more research. We were comfortable enough and enjoyed our stay here.

This hotel was very clean, excellent service. Convenient location in Waikiki, very close to the beach. They provided all beach amenities (towels, beach chairs,mats, umbrellas, and boogie boards). Very nice decor, comfortable rooms and very friendly staff. Would definitely stay again.

Stayed in Penthouse which was really just specially decorated hotel room on the 22nd floor. Fire alarm went off at 1 Am so we got up, got dressed and started to evacuate. 20 min later, they come on and tell us it’s a false alarm. Too late we were wide awake for hours. Stressful and no apology by hotel. Also, the room was so bright, clothing curtains with a city. Behind them. We didn’t even go back for our other nights.

Great place to stay, close to everything.Beach just a block away.We were glad that chairs and umbrellas were available to use at the beach Really enjoyed the breakfast lots of fruits Would stay here again, for sure

It was a stay for my last night in Honolulu. They offer a very good service for that purpose. My flight back to Germany went at 11pm. I got a complimentary room for one hour at 6pm for a shower and change of my clothes. Perfect! Also: beach towels and a cooperation with a deluxe gym close to the hotel. And they arranged an in-time-transfer to the airport for an affordable price (12 $). I would rate the service 5 star, if staff would smile. Value: additional amenty fee is too high (25 $). Rooms: very small, but not bad.Nevertheless: A great stay.

With the vast amount of accommodation available on Oahu, it was difficult to choose. However we went with this smaller hotel which included breakfast, had no resort fees if booked direct and had great reviews.. We were not disappointed. We arrived at 9am and although rooms are not normally available until 3pm, were were able to store our luggage and were greeted by the lovely staff with a cold face towel and a refreshing glass of pineapple juice. Our room was available by 1.30pm and we found it to be compact but modern and comfortable with everything you would need - the small bathroom even had a full size tub! Toiletries were supplied and replenished as used. The included breakfast was substantial with some changes made each morning. Tea, coffee and water were available 24/7. We loved the free entertainment in the lounge, the complimentary beach umbrellas and mats and the initiative of collecting groceries for the disadvantaged by the placing of a box in the foyer for donations (overseen by Hank, the Thanksgiving turkey!) It was less than a 5 minute walk to the beach and shops and the bus stops are right outside. We would be happy to stay at Vive if we visit Oahu in the future.

Nice hotel. Rooms are small and the A/C units are noisy but the staff is great, the rooms were clean and the breakfast buffet was good. Good value for the price. We did experience a false emergency alarm at 3am but was corrected before we had exited our room.

Great hotel, the room was perfect for couples, and the whole place was clean and tidy. Location was fantastic too. Super close to the beach and bus stop just a few steps making it convenient to go where we wanted to get to. Love the hotel breakfast, rotating menu but it was all good with the fresh fruits and awesome coffee you can actually take out with you on an early day. Helpful staff, good service.

Thank KC and Karrice for helping me booking activities by excellent service. Thanks to you guys, I really enjoyed my trip. I will recommand this hotel to my friends planning to travel to Waikiki, Hawai

It is good , nothing so bad maybe room must be bigger and staff must look at breakfast because a lot of homeless go to breakfast with guest of hotel but nobody see this .And in the end if you want to eat all what is possible must come till 8 AM, after this the best eat is finished

A great place to stay on a budget. Great location to the beach and other main attractions in Waikiki. The staff was also accommodating during our stay. The only issues were the room service cleaning times were not consistent. Other than that, I would recommend the hotel.
user_name:
rasaqbalogun27
New York City, New York

review_body: KC concierge was excellent!! She was helpful my entire stay. Amy front desk was very helpful as well. Room was a little tight. Space between the bed and bathroom very narrow. Ocean view was good but partially blocked by the hotel across the street. Room was kept clean and hygiene supplies provided daily. The Vive provides all the beach supplies needed.

Staff was very helpful: valet and reception. Excellent location. I would prefer the room a little bit bigger but it was fine. The view was not as expected but we didn't stay too long in the room during the day so it didn't bother much.

Staff very friendly (Front desk and Valet) always want to help. The room is small, but I did not stay at room too much, so did not bother me. The location is excellent and beach towels and chair are available for the guests. The breakfast has a very good quality, of offer of different types of bread, muffins and fruits. Always has some proteins such as omelet, eggs, bacon and etc. I enjoyed a lot my stay at this hotel and I recommend

to Ms. Daisy :.Thank you very much for your assistance. you were very helpful. individual and comfortable was your breakfastroom, and of course the included breakfast. best regards Sylvia and Andi from Germany

Good hotel very close to the Waikiki beach. Really central location with everything close by. Staff are good.Breakfast is Ok. Eggs and bacon with fruits. All day complimentary coffee was a welcome. Enjoyed the stay.

I booked this room because it was so highly rated on Trip Advisor # 14 / # 15;- Location is great....3 short blocks to the beach and to the heart of the activity in Waikiki. - When we first walked in the room, we couldn't believe how small it was & even worse than the small size, there is extremely limited space to store your clothes. There are 2 small drawers under the bed and a clothes closet. What the hotel needs to do is remove the desk and desk chair and put in a dresser with drawers, this would make the room much more functional. - The front desk staff were all very helpful at all times. - The hotel provides a free breakfast each morning which is great, however, they often run out of food items probably because guests over consume. There are so many guests, it is often hard to even find a seat to eat your breakfast at. Also, my big complaint with the breakfast is the staff must put the peanut butter in the fridge? Not sure what else it could be, but someone needs to tell them that peanut butter is not meant to be hard. - Cleaning staff are probably over worked / overwhelmed because my room did not get cleaned for at least 3 days in a row and about 4-5 days of my total two week stay. That alone will earn a bad rating in my book. - The concierge was not overly helpful or knowledgeable. Not sure she is the right fit for the role. Overall, love Waikiki. Never regret visiting beautiful Hawaii.

The Vive hotel was situated in a very nice spot along Waikiki - only a 5/10 minute walk from Waikiki beach and the main road (Kalakaua) where all the action is happening in terms of restaurants/bars/shops etc. The front desk and concierge were super helpful and accommodating!Highly recommend this hotel over the name branded, overpriced hotels along Waikiki beach.

The Vive staff was very friendly and excellent, and the perks offered (like free breakfast, which was actually substantial) made the whole thing feel worth it. We were less enamored by the rooms. Window AC units meant that we were either damp or freezing, which wasn't too much of a bother one we adjusted, but definitely annoying. They also definitely focused on the stuff folks were most likely to see: the lobby was beautiful and clean and full of games and books and activities, but the stairwells, for example, were extremely dirty.So: a study in contrasts but overall worth it to be a few blocks from Waikiki.

Great location, friendly and helpful staff.Very crowded at breakfast with limited seating, food average.Coffee/water available all day in lounge area.Handy to public transport, close to beach though not on waterfront.Laundromat close by.

Upon arriving to the Vive hotel we were greeted with an incredibly friendly staff member where our Lyft dropped us off. The entire customer service aspect was fantastic in general. The lobby was super hip and modern and they had great offerings like towels and beach mats etc. The breakfast was not a complete hot breakfast but certainly wasn't lackluster.The room had so much potential but the overlooked attention to detail really destroyed it and made it feel like a cheap motel that was slapped together. I think we expected a lot more because we opted to pay more to get the junior suite instead of the basic room and it ended up being the same as a basic room in every other hotel.
