The furniture had scratches and even corners that looked like an angry puppy was gnawing on it for hours. There was dust behind furniture (not just dust but actual thick coats of it). There was a mounted wall lamp above one nightstand but not the other which made it look really bad (clearly intended to have a matching lamp on the other side - which was conveniently randomly located on a different wall in the room completely out of place) and the multi-piece art work hanging directly above the bed was crooked and off-centered. The bathroom was beautiful and high-end but the toilet was beat up with a lot of imperfections making it feel gross. Overall the room had so much potential (and the bed was very comfy) but they dropped the ball with decor and maintenance. If the room quality matched the quality of the bathroom or the hotel's lobby then this place would have been amazing. But when you enter the room the veil is lifted and the reality is revealed.We felt the room was bad enough for us to spend our first night in Waikiki going hotel to hotel to find something better. The Hilton Village was only $15/night more than Vive and Vive isn't on the beach and has no pool/hot tub while Hilton Village is literally the beach and has multiple pools/hot tubs, beachside bars, and is ultimately in its own world. It has everything the Vive has and then some. If Vive was $120 for a basic room and $160 for the suite I wouldn't have been upset. But it was priced as much as some of the best hotels in Waikiki (not counting four seasons/disney/ritz etc) but didn't even come close. I have NEVER checked out of a hotel early in my life until Vive. Their pictures tell a much different story than what you actual get. Don't be fooled by camera tricks that are used to make mediocre places look stunning!

Excellent Service and great location. You don't realize how close you are to the beach until you get there. Close to all the BIG chain hotels and not have to spend BIG bucks on hotel accommodation. Breakfast is very good, except I would suggest to be less predictable on breakfast menu. Boiled and omelette on alternate days. More variety of egg preferred. Rooms are small and tight but very modern.

Can't say thank you enough Vive! Super friendly staff and service professionals...always a smile and family like love given...loved the extra benefits...goes a long way making us super happy travels...❤!!!

Me and my partner booked our honeymoon Vive stay through Amoma.comA month later we received an email stating that Amoma had a cease trading and were shut down from any more transactions and our reservation would be terminated. I immediately contacted Vive directly to see if my reservation was still honoured. I explained everything to Vive in an email and they stated that they still have our reservation. Me and my newly wed arrived in Honolulu to find out our reservation was cancelled and Vive didn't even bother to contact us after I already made contact to see if our reservation was still okay.All I was told by the lady at reception was that out reservation was cancelled a day after I emailed them. I understand we ordered this through a third party but feel massively let down by Vive and its staff after I contacted them. The least they could do was contact us after it was cancelled so we could plan accordingly. Instead we had to pay again for our accommodation.

We absolutely enjoyed our stay with VIVE! The front desk employees are always friendly and helpful. We love the free breakfast and the beach essentials (towels, mats, umbrella and etc) the hotel provided. Another plus is the location. There is a bus stop to the side of the hotel we used often to get to places around the city. The room is smaller than usual but we didn't mind. However the water AC was really loud and kept us up at night...we eventually got used to it. Overall, we will definitely stay with VIVE again!!

Super friendly and helpful staff, great and safe location, clean and well equipped rooms, breakfast was amazing with lots of fresh fruit and pastries. Beach towels and gear provided. Would definitely stay here again.

The staff was fantastic, especially the valet service. The breakfast was great every day. Access was good, close to the beach, yet easy to get on main connecting routes for around the island tours. It's close to all of the Waikiki attractions.

We stayed at Vive Hotel in a junior suite for over a week and enjoyed our experience there. Sirens were loud at night, but we had no other noise issues. It was easy to walk anywhere around Waikiki and there were bus options nearby (both city and hop on/hop off). All staff members we interacted with were great - breakfast staff, front desk, valet, housekeeping. While breakfast was good, it quickly felt monotonous and lacked variety. The fruit and croissants were tasty, but the hard boiled eggs and occasional sausage were only okay. Adding some sautéed veggies and scrambled eggs would have been great. However, we always enjoyed having something quick at the hotel for breakfast. If you're looking for a hotel in Waikiki, I'd highly recommend Vive.

This is the second time I've stayed at the VIVE Waikiki. It's a great value, and only two blocks to the beach. It's not perfect, but the staff always makes a concerted effort to correct problems and make you happy. This time, when I checked in, I noticed that the carpet to the side of the bed was wet, apparently due to a leak in the wall and floor between the shower and bed area. The staff was quick to change my room. I appreciated the quick response and customer service. Another plus is that the hotel provides you with beach towels, chairs, mats and umbrellas, all at no extra charge. That's a great bonus.Generally, the hotel is very nice, in both guest rooms and in the lobby and breakfast area. However, this is not a new building, and portions of the hallways where the guest rooms are located are open to the outdoors. As a result, weather has effected the carpets, walls, and hallway decor more than you would see in a more traditional hotel where all the hallwyas are internal. It's just harder to maintain, and some of it looks a little shabby.The only other complaint I have is about their breakfast. There's a nice display of fruits and melons, and attempts to provide a nice selection of breads and pastries. However, there are no signs telling you what type of bread and pastries are being served that morning. For example, some pastries have meat inside (surprise!), some have fruit, and you never know what you're getting until you bite into them. Similarly, they often serve bread that looks like it has raisins, but turns out to be dotted with blueberries. Simple signs labeling the food items would be helpful. Also, there is a distinct shortage of hot items providing protein. And, the kitchen is often understaffed in key morning hours..In spite of those shortcomings, I enjoy the hotel, and consider it to be of great value and excellent location. I will stay there again.

The hotel was very clean and very accommodating. We read reviews about many hotels out there are very small so we opted for the junior suite. It was worth it! The staff was very friendly and very helpful. Didn’t have a pool, indoor bar or restaurant but they did have a kitchen and offered room service and an excellent breakfast spread every morning! I won’t hesitate to book here the next time we head to Waikiki!

This hotel was a great find. Only a 2 minute walk to the beach and all amenities. Breakfast was good, rooms although small are clean and tidy and staff really helpful especially When they took time directing us to a ‘safe’ new and clean laundrette which was only 2 blocks away.Only disappointment was the $30 per day car park fee for guests which soon mounted up. We have travelled 4 of the Hawaiian islands and this is the only one with a car park charge. Would recommend for a comfortable stay.

Location was good if you wanted to hang out Waikiki. My sister and I wanted to do staycation but staying closer to Waikiki for Halloween. Room was decent size for just a party of 2, just city view but our room was facing the streets and other buildings. Can see a glimpse of the beach but mostly just buildings and busy streets. It gets VERY noisy at night, even not on Halloween night with the partying and people hollering. We stayed on 5th floor, think highest is 6th? Got woken up by large trucks cleaning the streets between 4-5am, sirens and car roaring down the streets with their engines and then occasional drinkards screaming. Not very ideal if you have kids or want true peace and quiet, maybe opt for room that isn’t city viewing or beach viewing because to be honest unless you’re stuck indoor all day, beach or city or none wouldn’t matter. It’s the quality of sleep that matters the most when you’re on vacation to rejuvenate for the next day. Pillows and beds were definitely lacking, I meant in terms of pillows x 2 stacked were still laid flat against neck and it just stumps down instead of providing support. Bed was a bit too soft too, also sinks down on lower back. If you’re someone with lower back issue, this may not be the place for you. We’re both in our late 20s weighing mostly close to mid 150s so If we experienced back problems and we didn’t trip or fall or went on excessive hiking trips that predispose our backs for back pain. Bathroom is too small! Enough space for only one person to sit on toilet and get up, cannot have one on toilet and one showering or getting in and out to grab stuff/use mirror. There is also no FAN inside bathroom, so be prepared for your own sake and others because other than A/C, that is a lack of ventilation to air out room/toilet. Only thing plus is breakfast bar with hot food and pastries and fresh fruits! 24 hour access to coffee and tea but they do have juice bar and hardbroiled eggs daily not including hot food with egg omelette and sausages and bacon. They do have board games and card games in the main sitting area so that is also nice If you ended the night early and didn’t want to see just yet while enjoying a cup of tea. Free beach towels and beach chairs etc are nice also. If you’re a Hawaii’s resident you also can use kamaaina discount to waive parking, so free parking daily which is the #1 reason why we chose Vive. It’s my second time returning to this hotel.

My niece & I stayed at Vive Waikiki. It was a nice hotel for the size. Rooms were small, but clean & comfortable. Staff was very friendly. Breakfast were pretty good. It was close to the beach, & was handy to have beach towels, chairs, etc. available to us. I also appreciated that they had a hospitality room available on the day I left, so even though I had checked out, they stored my luggage, then allowed us to use the hospitality room to clean up & rest before going to the airport.
user_name:
Terri P
Fort Worth, Texas, United States

review_body: We stayed at the Vive for the final week of our Hawaiian holiday. We booked direct with the hotel so no resort fees. As we paid up front more than 60 days in advance we saved 25% off the room rate and as a result upgraded to a Lifestyle Junior Suite. We were given a room on the 21st floor with a beautiful view of the mountains. All the staff were amazing. Every single time we arrived back at the hotel we were greeted warmly by the desk staff. We left at 4:30am to make our flight home and check out was so quick, ensuring we had plenty of time to make our flight. Breakfast choices were limited l compared to some other buffet breakfasts we had on our trip but it was plentiful and the food was great. There is no dining area as such so you grab a spot on whatever chair or couch you can find and quite often you may find yourself sharing with other guests, which is a great way to meet people. The hotel does not have lanais, a pool or an actual restaurant on site. I don't think this is a bad thing, it is just something to be aware of. Overall we really enjoyed our stay at the Vive and if we are fortunate enough to come back to the amazing state of Hawaii, it will definitely be our hotel destination!

This was the 3rd or 4th time I have been to the Hotel Vive Waikiki. Each stay seems even better than the last---if that were possible !This time my room was spacious, the breakfasts better than ever, the staff always cheerfuland professional. I am very happy to recommend the Hotel to friends who need a rerstin their travels between Australia and North America. And I tell them,"Even if you've been to Hawaii before, and seen the sights, do include a stop over again,just to rest at the Hotel Vive Waikiki."A special thanks goes to Alex, who processed my application for a room, at a timewhen telephone contacts from Michigan were interrupted.See you again in October or November of 2020 !

Convenient location for The Bus and the beach. Recommend junior suite ocean view room. Good selection of fresh fruit, pastries, eggs, bacon, sausage and toast for breakfast. Lots of coffee, tea and purified water available at all times. A nice feature provided by the hotel is live musical entertainment twice a week. Hotel provides free use of all beach gear for guests. All the staff were super friendly and helpful. We appreciated the recognition on our Halloween Birthdays.

It’s so nice to walk into a hotel and feel truly welcomed. The pineapple juice and cold cloth offered at check in is so nice after a long flight and high temperatures outdoors. Hotel staff: Daisy from the front desk made my stay here so relaxing and the fact that she personalized the note in my room wishing me luck on my job interview really made me feel special. KC from the concierge was a huge help to me as far as finding the correct bus stop to go to Ala Moana Center and tips on places to eat. I am not tech savvy so she was kind enough to show me how to find certain things on my smart phone. I have to say Daisy and KC were both sweethearts and I believe an asset to the hotel.Breakfast and beach gear included was a huge plus. Location: they are just two blocks away from the beach and close to the international market place as well as the bus stops. Love, love, love this place and it’s staff. Thanks again to all those who made my stay so enjoyable. You guys rock!

Room was nice but was smaller than photographed but was clean , breakfasts were excellent and all the staff we came in contact with were pleasant and helpful. Would recommend to anyone. WOULD HAVE OPTED FOR A LARGER ROOM WITH A BETTER VIEW in hindsight.

We really enjoyed our stay at Vive. The room was clean and the amenities great. Vive had everything we needed for our stay including beach accessories and a satisfying breakfast. They even had entertainment and other activities. The staff were all very friendly and accommodating. I will definitely stay here again. It's my new favorite (and I've been coming to Hawaii regularly for 30 years).

How are you? Thank you, vive hotel staffs hotel is very good. We have a good time and nice day. Your hotel has good location. Staffs are very kind. Your food tastes good. Vallet parking is good system

We had a great time at Vive! It was a great value (even with the amenities fee as we didn't book direct), but we still had an awesome time! The fact that breakfast was waiting for us after waking up, the fact that we could ask for towels, beach umbrellas, mats, and more on our way to the beach, and the great customer service we received in Vive made our first time in Waikiki an unforgettable experience.

Very little negative to say about the Vive and their entire team. The breakfast was beautiful everyday with enough selection to start off the day and I'm sure we saved alot of $. Daisy and Victoria were extremely pleasant and helpful at the front desk and with arranging things when we needed help.The room although small was fine for us. The air conditioner didnt work properly but was replaced quickly and we were given a little gift for any inconvenience which was a nice touch. I am a light sleeper and the room was a little noisy but if you're tired enough the comfy beds will get you to sleep.The hotel provides towels,chairs, umbrellas and boogie boards for the beach which is 3 minutes away.I honestly thought this hotel offered good value compared to many other Waikiki hotels and the location is perfect, right on the bus route.Would go back for sure!

We stayed here for a week. The location is excellent (apart from there are some apartments across the road the road that appeared to have quite a criminal element - our first night here we saw 8 police cars do a raid which arrested several people - I digress). It is too blocks from the beach and close to the centre of Waikiki so you are never too far from a good restaurant. You should know that street noise is quite audible, although you will get that everywhere in Waikiki. The rooms are a little cramped. They could also have done with a little bit of forethought on the design - I.e. putting the bathroom door by the entrance rather than by the bed, so you don't have to share your private bathroom moments together! However apart from the size it was very clean, comfortable and modern. Breakfast is included and was also fresh and appreciated although not overly varied. The lobby / restaurant is very pretty although not quite enough seating so breakfast is always shared with other people on a table. All things being considered I would have probably given this a 3 start review if it weren't for the nice touches. All day you can help yourself to coffee, tea and fruit water as well as their being a water fountain to fill up your water bottles. The lobby is a great place to sit and they have games, library etc. The staff are very helpful and provide beach equipment which really makes a difference. All in all we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. Thank you to the staff.

The Vive is centrally located, 500 metres to beach and shops, buses within 200 metres, light breakfast provided, concierge on hand to help u book activities, rooms are large, modern, air conditioned and clean

My husband and I stood here for 5 days. I enjoyed it very much. The staff was very attentive and awesome. The hotel was nice and peaceful. Amy at the front desk is awesome she always had a smile and greeted us very warmly. I would definitely come back to this hotel.

Me and my wife stayed here for 1 week. This has to be one of the best hotel stays I've experienced in my travels. The staff are very friendly and just give that extra great service that makes you want to come back again. There are just lots of little perks such as: great check in with complimentary drinks and cold towels, music performances on certain nights, valet that is worth the extra pay, and others. The hotel is also in a great location.

My husband and I stayed at The Vive for 3 nights while in Waikiki. We arrived later in the evening after a long flight to a smiling face, welcoming common area, a cool cloth and fresh pineapple juice to help refresh ourselves. We had asked for a ocean view room, which didn't disappoint with a lovely view from the 21st floor. Our room was small, but it doesn't matter, your never in it! The room was clean and a very comfortable bed. It was very quiet, we never heard another guest door, or voice in the halls or from other rooms. Very peaceful! The breakfast was lovely with a variety of pasty items, fresh ripe fruit, protein items, fresh juice, coffee and water, Which is available 24x7. My tip for breakfast, go early and find a nice sitting area, it's not a dining room, and it doesn't need to be, your eating and leaving. This was our first trip to Hawaii, and we were not sure what to expect, I can tell you we could not have asked for a more centrally located, lovely boutique hotel. It met our needs and then some, but to be in walking distance to the beach the way it was ( two small blocks away), and walking the strips in the area were so enjoyable and safe. TiP; Hoku tours ( ask for Cousin Kev as your tour guide), picks up just a block and a half from The Vive at the Hilton, I would suggest this tour company. Pink Line Trolly, is a great a great way to tour some of the area and do some shopping at the local Mall. Check out the Yard House for great service and food (make a reservation). Later evening meals at the Hilton just a few blocks away they have a diner, called M.A.C 24/7. Very good food, and again great service. We found that there were not a lot of options for dining after 9pm. Aloha~

We enjoyed our stay at Vive. The hotel was stylish, the rooms were clean and comfortable, and the service was extraordinary. Waikiki beach is only 2 blocks away and there's plenty of food and shopping within walking distance.

Great hotel staff the whole week we stayed which started with the fresh pineapple juice provided upon arrival. Our room was as booked with a nice view of the ocean and the mountains. The location of the hotel is awesome. Just a few minutes walk to the beach and to tour operator pick up locations. Also only minutes walk to great food and shopping. Really enjoyed walking and driving around the Waikiki area and the island of Oahu in general. Felt safe the whole time. Really lots to do and definitely coming back.

I’ve stayed there twice and intend to be returning in Winter. Best service. Cool rooms. Incredible breakfast. Great coffee. Good value. The staff exceeds my expectations every time I deal with them. Fantastic! Location is so convenient. I can’t think of anything negative to say. Can’t wait for my next trip to Vive!

A great location, very helpful and friendly staff. Best parts was valet is available 24/7 worth the money parking is horrible anywhere else, loved the 24 hr coffee, water and tea, the breakfast was delicious and filling, loved the free beach towels, mats and umbrellas, literally 2 short blocks from the beach, I almost missed an tour but the concierge helped me get there on time and I made the tour!!! Staff was very helpful and attentive, great family feel met alot of fun people at breakfast every day. Downside rooms were a little small and the ac unit is small. BUT the complimentary room for late departure was soo great. Got to spend more time on the beach and showered before the plane ride. Would definitely stay here again.

I go to Oahu once a year and this was the first time in this hotel. I was there with my son and his family. We were five adults in total in two rooms. The rooms were lovely and the bathrooms had all the amenities one might need. The staff was very helpful and friendly, the breakfast was excellent with fresh fruit, juices, eggs, and many different kinds of bread and pastries. There were many places to sit in the large lobby (where breakfast was served). Tea, coffee, and water were always available.There was also a very nice little gift shop with tasteful merchandise at a reasonable price.The rooms were on the small side however which might be a problem for large people with lots of luggage. However, we were very happy and would stay there again.

Great location. Two blocks from Waikiki beach. On the bus line. Food trucks one block away. Great breakfast buffet in breakfast lounge. Can bring in food to lounge for lunch or dinner. Supplies beach chairs, mats, and umbrella. Helpful staff. Near shopping.

We loved our stay at the Vive Hotel. The staff were so friendly and welcoming. They always helped us out whenever we needed something making our first time to Hawaii so memerable and enjoyable. Our room was made up and cleaned daily which was fantastic! The room itself was kept so clean and a perfect size for my husband and I. It had everything we needed. Breakfast downstairs was perfect to kick start our day along with all day coffee, teas and cold and hot water. We are coming back to stay again!!!

I stayed 5 nightEvery Day I got Hot Coffee.I enjoyed Halloween Event, sooo happy.And I rent the road bicycle and keep in my room, no trouble.Thanks.日本からの旅行です。毎日いつでも暖かいコーヒーが準備されています。朝ご飯も十分です。ロードバイクを5日間借りて、部屋に保存もOKです。ハロウィンも楽しめました。ありがとうございました。

On the whole, I was satisfied with everything, but I was disappointed that the pillow smelled on the first day. It smelled less dry and I liked the fact that he responded right away when I asked him to replace it. It is the best hotel for the price as it is rumored.

Well located in the center of Waikiki. Hotel is pretty bad otherwise: smelly entrance, small room, small bathroom. AC is loud. There is nothing to eat for breakfast, actually there is not even a proper room to eat. Would not recommend for the price.
user_name:
lhfranc
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: My partner and I absolutely loved Vive Hotel Waikiki and would without a doubt only stay here when we next visit Waikiki! From the initial booking to our check out the staff were helpful and friendly, and attended to our every request. We are a couple around our 30's and found the hotel perfect for our needs - we don't often use resort style facilities (pool, spa/massage, etc) so not having those amenities wasn't a problem. We do like having gym access which the hotel doesn't have, but they offer a reduced rate at a fully equipped gym a short walk away). The room is comfortable and enough space for a couple. Valet parking is offered by the hotel if you have a car, but I would suggest looking for cheaper parking close by which is what we did. It's worth checking out the hotel's website and booking directly to avoid paying resort fees, and also for good deals (we took up the book in advance deal). The breakfast is yummy and for us (who were trying to budget a little where we could) was perfect! Fruit and pastries every day, with sausages and eggs added every alternate day. The beach is a super close walk (less than 5 mins) and the first part of the beach that you arrive at is perfect (sandy and not much coral or rocks once in the ocean). The hotel offers free use of beach towels, umbrellas and mats which we used every day. There are also multiple bus stops close to the hotel that connect you with various parts of the island that you may want to be travelling to. All in all a hotel that is perfect if you want a cost effective, well run place to stay, with breakfast and basic hotel services provided - awesome work to all the team at Vive! We'll be back :)

This was a great location walking distance in flops to beach and to DT Waikiki. Filling breakfast that lasted us until midday! Comfortable beds, cozy rooms, and quiet location. Would absolutely stay here again for the right price. Be sure to check that daily amentity fee and the valet parking is $30 We had an issue with the AC unit in our room and had we known they were going to be so attentive, we would have told them sooner!! They replaced it immediately - still made noise but nothing like it was.

Alex and the team at Vive was awesome in our experience. Thank you for the wonderful time and awesome breakfast! Location is 10/10 and will be coming back to Vive again and again and again! Highly recommended for all travellers to the Waikiki area!

Very comfortable accommodations and a very nice breakfast. Quite close to all the famous Waikiki beach and area. We were pleased with the very friendly greeting at the reception desk and were handed a cold glass of pineapple juice as we checked in.

Fantastic experience! Came to Waikiki unprepared with no itinerary. Was referred to KC, the coolest concierge ever! She helped arrange all my tours on the spot making the short time i had on the island count! Turned out to be the most unforgettable trip ever! Can’t wait to go back and will definitely stay at the same hotel. Great location with friendly staff. Feels like home away from home. So modern and hip. Shout out to all front desk staff who have been so courteous and helpful - Roger, Daisy, Ryan, Amy and Angel(?). You guys are amazing!

My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon and absolutely loved it! It’s conveniently located near the center of Waikiki and walking distance to the beach, convenience stores, and restaurants. The rooms are clean and neat, parking was convenient, concierge was extremely friendly, and the free breakfast was nice. We also loved that they offer free beach chair, towel, and boogie board rental. I definitely recommend if staying in Waikiki!

This was my second stay at the Vive Hotel Waikiki. I decided to come back since my first experience was amazing. The second time was just as great. The staff at the hotel is always so friendly and helpful. The hotel is very clean and well maintained. The continental breakfast was always full and delicious. The location is perfect. I can't say enough how much I loved staying here!

We were only at the Vive Hotel Waikiki for one night, at the end of a cruise. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful, providing good advice on the hotel amenities, local transport and transfer options. Our room had everything we needed and the easy breakfast was more than sufficient for our needs. We really appreciated the all day tea and coffee availability. The location of the hotel is excellent. We would happily stay here again.

We had a good experience here. All of the staff we met was friendly. Room was clean and updated, just a little small but it worked. Not sure if they have larger room options. We were here for our belated honeymoon and anniversary. They left us a box of candy and card. This was a thoughtful gesture by the staff. One suggestion I would have is to have more/better signage in front of the building for main entrance and parking garage entrance. We had a hard time finding it at first. Also we heard people in room behind us through the walls easily. They were talking very loud which woke us early. Maybe some sort of sounds proofing in walls would be helpful but probably hard to do since the building is completed. We booked our stay here directly on their website and got a good deal over other sites. All the pricing, etc was correct when we checked out.
user_name:
Ken G
Forest Hill, Maryland, Usa

review_body: good place stay, close to beach, nice breakfast. if I was to complain it would be the price of parking $30 is a lot for working, local should get a better price even though they go through another company!

The hotel was in a great location, the staff were fantastic and the hotel in general was very clean and tidy at all times. We paid extra for a 44sqm room which was great value for our money. This room had a walk in wardrobe and the shower alone was literally the size of a normal bathroom.The bed was a little soft though, as were the pillows, so sleeping comfort was a little down, having said that we didn't bother asking if they had different pillows.The fridge in the room was smaller than a normal bar bridge and not too cold. There is a message that said something basically confirming the fridge wasn't too cold and to not expect your food to be kept cold. We weren't happy with that. On check in we were offered a kettle which we gladly accepted, surprised that tea and coffee making facilities were not standard. We used the ceramic mugs and tea/coffee from the dining room.As for the dining room, we felt the small coffee tables were not good to eat at. Not enough dining tables. Not sure why they used mostly plastic cutlery, with only a very small amount of metal cutlery available. Its horrible using plastic cutlery and also terribly bad for the environment. They did however provide a great filtered water unit which we used every day and saved buying bottled water. Top points for that.Breakfast was very ordinary. Every second day there was rubbery omelette and hot mini sausages. Otherwise it was cold over boiled hard eggs. There was fresh fruit, bread, muffins and buns. No cereal or yoghurt. The menu repeated every 2 days with only some changes to the type of muffins/buns. Again from an environmental point of view, the little milk containers (about 10grams/0.38oz) should be replaced by fresh milk in jugs.The use of beach mats, boogie boards, umbrellas and towels, again top points for that.Overall a great hotel with top customer service, would definitely consider staying there again, but if there was a comparable hotel that provided a better room fridge, and breakfast experience I would probably switch.

Had higher hopes for this hotel but learned the hard way that it doesn't matter how good the service is if the building is inherently inferior. Super small rooms, AC units in windows, poorly draining bathtub, and the vibes of what was likely a former apartment building or maybe a single room occupancy hotel.

We took our boys (9 and 14) for their first trip to Hawaii. And thought Waikiki was the best way to go for the first time. Everything was within walking distance (the farthest we went was a 10 minute walk), the beach is really close by to the hotel, a 5 minute stroll or Uber if we went out further. The boys really enjoyed the divided rooms (their own bathroom, bed, closet, fridge, etc.) Just wished there was door to divide the two rooms. They definitely noticed the difference between being in Anaheim (Disneyland) and Hawaii (Oahu) the week seemed to go by faster in Anaheim than in Oahu. The hotel itself probably only had 8 rooms to a floor, we couldn't hear our neighbors, more the outside noise, but it wasn't too bad. I liked how each "room" had it's own electronic device (for surfing the net or playing games), but my kids preferred their own devices. The concierge was SUPER helpful! We made friends with Kasie (pink hair girl, according to my 9 year old). Definitely talk to her and or her counterpart, they will let you know what's up with the activities on the island and can help you get registered for activities (even though you can do it yourself online, but when you're on vacation, it's nice to have someone do it for you and guide you).

This was my third stay at the Vive in four years. The first two were excellent, but I was very disappointed this time. From horrible king size beds, to poor housekeeping services, management's lack of any offer of discount, I did not enjoy my stay. I usually stay in a room with a Queen size bed, and have had no problems whatsoever. This time I choose a Junior Suite for a little more. Big mistake. The King beds are old and have dips in them. I had to prop a pillow against my back to keep me on the higher part of the bed. I told management and they told me that they were on the list to be replaced. I happened to visit a room with a queen bed, and the mattress was fine. As if that wasn't enough, my housekeeping was overlooked one day, and when I reported it, it was missed again the next day. I reported it to the front desk and they sent someone at 5pm to take care of it. However, they forgot bath mats. The room was not as clean as my previous visits. The breakfast was improved from my last stay, and several of the employees were great. But management offered nothing more than an apology. At the very least management should have discounted my room to a non-suite and refunded me the difference. I did not ask, they did not offer.

From the moment we checked in with Daisy we were made to feel special and very welcome. Every time we left or returned we were greeted as friends. The complimentary breakfast set us up for the day. It is very generous - but no cereals . Minor maintenance needed in our room was attended to promptly and efficiently. Only small grumble is that we found the air con in the room a little noisy.

We stayed at the Vive Hotel for 10 nights. It is a couple of blocks off of Waikiki, not far from the Honolulu Zoo. They offer discounted valet parking with some stays, which we used. The staff were all very friendly, helpful and responsive. We appreciated the breakfast buffet every morning. An abundance of fruit (pineapple, strawberries, oranges, Honeydew, and papaya. Some days were hard boiled eggs and sliced turkey or ham. I enjoyed the Portuguese-style biscuits with a surprise filling. The 24-hour coffee service was handy. You need to request ice from the front desk, but it was always quickly delivered to our room. Each room has a tablet to order services and check out local services. Would definitely stay again.

Breakfast was poor. Hot and cold meal were changed day by day. But there were not big differences. The hallway were not clean everyday. I stayed 1 week, but I wonder if it was cleaned during that time.

Vive hotel was exactly as advertised online and more! We needed a short two night hotel stay to travel in and board the cruise ship and this place was perfect! Great location, we could easily walk to the beach, shops and restaurants. Very clean and the complimentary breakfast was fresh and delicious and after a long day in the sun when we returned to freshen up before dinner we came back to our room to find a sweet honeymoon card and gift on our bed.

I had such a terrific stay here and it’s nice to go to hotel it’s located near everything to the beaches nearby and good shopping to everything was it as expected and I would have no problem coming here again河野側ってすごい感銘神に関しよろしくね水酸化水

Very nice hotel, great staff, great price , and very clean. Nice breakfast buffet included. The location was great, within walking distance to the beach, shops and restaurants. They stored our luggage in a secured room after checkout and we took advantage of their complementary room to freshen a few hours later. If we return to Waikiki we would definitely stay there again.

The people were super from the front desk to the valet attendant to the Mohawk wearing concierge. We stayed for 6 nights. The free breakfast became very boring except for the fruit which was delicious. Two downsides—our room had no bureau, dresser or even shelves though it was a very generous size with a large walk in closet. There could be bumpers on the pocket doors to the bathroom and more hooks would have been good. So, we literally lived out of our suitcases and another luggage rack would have been appreciated. I am sure we would have gotten one if we had asked. The location is great.

This was our 2nd stay at the Vive Hotel. The hotel is centrally located in Waikiki and close to the beachfront, zoo, aquarium, Diamond Head Monument and several other locations. We were able to walk to most and ideally is a 5 minute walk to Waikiki Beach. All is great – breakfast, service, concierge, and they offer beach towels, chairs and other beach articles. The rooms were clean and sized Ok for a couple. They even offer a tablet in the room. Our concierge helped us with booking a few tours and a shuttle to the cruise port for our departure. So this is not the Hilton – nor are we paying such a price. We were pleased with all and would find it hard to complain of any inconveniences. For their service and, we would surely return on a future trip. Great job by all the staff and management… Thanks again to all...

A small hotel that treats you like a friend. Rooms small but very clean and well appointed. Greeted back att hotel like a friend after being away , complimentary breakfast beach towels and advice. Breakfast in lounge room simple but very nice, but we found the information desk was to be the best for advice booking events or just a transfer to the airport.

The Vive tries very, very hard. Really. It's sad because they start out with two major disadvantages, being the only hotel in sight that has NO balconies, and again for having no in-hotel restaurant. The room was HUGE, roughly the size of a modest studio apartment in floor space and very comfortable. The mattress was new and utterly lovely to sleep on. However, here again, the Vive suffers. I've stayed at better looking Motel 6s. It was utterly lacking in any attempt at decor--and what modern hotel still uses window a/c units? Our 20th storey room had two and yes, they do put out some really cold air, but they aren't equipped for the size of the room they serve, thereby having the guest freeze when in the direct flow of air, but grow sweaty and sticky in the isolated hot spots.We weren't uncomfortable at all, and if you don't care what the room looks like then I can recommend the Vive quite highly due to the superb staff they employ. Any inconvenience you encounter will be swiftly attended to and they are quick with whatever compensation they can think of to make amends for even the slightest impingement on your stay. Expect to be greeted like a long-lost and much-loved family member.

I booked this place because it was highly ranked on trip advisor. I’m not convinced these review are all genuine. The room is TINY - about 1/3 to 1/4 of the room size compared to where we stayed at the Hilton (for the EXACT same price) earlier in the week. The bathroom and sinks are European sized. The only difference is Hilton resort fees are $23 more expensive. The Hilton had balconies, its own beach, an ocean view, a beautiful gym, easy parking, huge rooms, King beds, etc. Vive has...breakfast?We are on the side facing the road and hear every siren because the seal between the window unit air conditioner and the window is not good- plus the air conditioner itself is VERY noisy. The parking garage is less than 6 feet tall. Spent over an hour to find parking nearby. The staff were no help when I called to ask where I might park our small SUV. I parked in 3 other garages in Waikiki and my car fit just fine in the other garages. This is the only hotel complaint I’ve ever written, it really is THAT bad. Beware.

Overall, I enjoyed my experience at the Vive hotel. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and the facility met my expectations. The only thing that was a major downer was the mattress. It had lost ALL its support as there was a huge dip in the bed from what I can assume is years of usage. My feet were literally higher than the rest of my body and I woke up each morning with an aching back from sleeping so awkwardly. I told this to the lady at the front desk and she was kind enough to take off one of the amenity fees, while also notifying me that they had just received a shipment of new mattresses for this very reason. Other than that, my stay was great! Breakfast included lots of fresh fruit (love), and a variety of breads (no bagels though), hard boiled or scrambled(?) eggs, and sometimes sausage or lunch meat. That said, it would have been nice to have some yogurt, breakfast cereals and oatmeal w/ milk and various toppings as well. Oh, we loved having access to beach towels, chairs, umbrellas and boogie boards too. That really came in handy for time spent at the beach, which was just a short little walk away.

The mini-fridge had a note on it warning that leftovers would not be kept at proper storage temperature. In reality, it didn't even chill a bottle of water. It should have been replaced. There were no ice machines. You had to call guest services to have a qt bag delivered. Free breakfast alternated each day between hot or cold food. Not much variety. The AC units in the room did not cool properly. Had them on 69 and room temperature never went below 72.

my vacation stay, the experience we have during our one week stay at VIVE Hotel, Waikiki. The amenities provided great. I recommend to my friends about VIVE hotel. Staff are very helpful in providing the things that clients needs.

Everything was great except for thin walls. We could get very easily hear the conversations in all of the adjoining rooms which either kept us up all night, or woke us up really early (3:30am) in the morning. Because of this, we will not be recommending this hotel, nor staying at this hotel again.

Had a wonderful experience staying here. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. Daisy and Roger made my whole vacation very relaxing and helped me out with an issue I had, unrelated to the hotel.

Had the pleasure of staying at the Vive Hotel for 9 nights , great location 2 blocks from the beach , eateries and bars. Super friendly staff beening my first time in Hawaii a huge thanks to KC your concierge for all your help and advice.I did the grand island tour and got to swim with the dolphins in the ocean wow wow ! Lost for words how great it was.Thanks vive hotel for having such a great concierge will definitely be back soon Aloha from Sydney.

Stayed at the hotel for 3 nights and had excellent service - better than any other hotel I've stayed in ever! Front desk staff were very attentive and the hotel provided great amenities and events. Hotel is a quick walk to the beach, shops, and public transit. I'll definitely be staying here again in the future!

My friend and I booked a last minute trip to Hawaii last month and didn't want to pay a fortune on accommodation. Being two single girls that live on their own we wanted our own space so we booked the Cosmopolitan Family Suite which was fantastic. It was two rooms in one with their own bathrooms so you felt like you had privacy even though you were in the same room. The only suggestion I would make is that there was a sliding door between the rooms so that you could have complete privacy at night while sleeping or when coming out of the bathroom. Otherwise it was perfect.The hotel is a few blocks back from the beach but it was an easy walk and the hotel and they provide towels and umbrellas to take with you which was great.The location was really good and very easy to get around. We walked everywhere from the hotel along the main street and the Pink Line trolley (to get to Ala Moana shopping centre) was really close by if you wanted to get some shopping in. The staff were so lovely and greeted you every time you walked in and out of the hotel and were very helpful if you needed anything. The concierge is only available between 8.00am - 2.00pm which made it hard if you wanted to book something later in the afternoon but when they were there, they were very helpful.A basic/light breakfast is provided in the morning every day until 9.30am which was nice. Lots of delicious fresh fruit and bread. They also have water in the lobby every day filled with flavour (I had a lot of this). There is no pool at this hotel so if this is your thing, I wouldn't stay here. It didn't bother my friend and I though as we wanted to be at the beach. I would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again if I was going to Waikiki. It was clean, in a great location, with friendly staff and very reasonably priced. The wifi worked great and was very fast which was great for communicating back home or to look up your next activity or place to eat.

Good place to stay. Central to lots of activities in Waikiki. Diamond head is a 10 mins drive. Beach is less than a 10 min walk. Great local food around! It’s VIP parking only at this hotel but defiantly worth it.

The hotel has been remodeled and reinvented several times just like most of them in Waikiki. The latest is modern and nice. The staff are great. The location is almost ideal. This place is a really good value for your money.

Our room was all we needed for our vacation. Comfortable stay in a wonderful place.The continental breakfast was great, tasty and quick. It was nice not to have to out for breakfast in the morning.thanks

We stayed 3 nights here and was very pleased with everything. Vive is just one block from the beach which make it super convenient for beach lovers. You don't have to worry about lunch or dinner as there are some cheap eateries around the corner. Room is reasonably good and clean. There is no swimming pool in the hotel but that is not a big deal for us. We loved the breakfast spread. Their choices are much better than some of the 5-star hotels. Local fruits such as hawaiian papayas and pineapples are served daily. Will stay there again for the value!

We liked this hotel, and I might have given it a higher rating, but the air conditioning in the room was completely inadequate. Despite running it all the time at max output (and a lot of noise), the room never cooled off to the point where it was comfortable for sleep. They really, really need to do something about that. Other than the AC, it's a fine hotel - well located, attractively furnished and decorated, good continental breakfast. But since the point of a hotel is providing a place to sleep, the AC is a big, big problem.

A small, quirky, beautiful, quiet hotel in comparison to the others in Waikiki. No children (that I saw). No noisy families. Not a million people. Ahhhh just what I was after. Location was perfect for us. One street back from the hustle and bustle but close enough to be in the hustle and bustle when we wanted to be. Literally a 2 minute walk to the Duke statue and Waikiki Beach. 5 minute walk to the centre of the main street. Victoria (Concierge) provided AMAZING service and nothing was a problem for her to organise. Two lifts. Breakfast is a little different but good enough for us. Fruit/pastries every day and basic hot food every second day. Go elsewhere if you are expecting bacon, pancakes, every type of egg etc. Tea/Coffee/Water available 24 hours. We had the Cosmopolitan Suite (4 people). Two rooms but only divided by a wall. TV and air con in each room. No door to close to separate the rooms but that worked fine for us. Bed was comfy. I had read that air con was noisy and I was really concerned as I am a light sleeper but I didn't think it was noisy at all. Individual bathroom for each room. I had read on here about how friendly the front desk staff were. I found this a bit hit and miss. Either super friendly or little acknowledgement. I would have liked to have heard a "welcome back" or "how was your day?" upon return. Perhaps it is just different in Hawaii. I'm not saying they were never nice but I felt like I wanted more from them. We loved all the different furniture in the dining area and made it our mission to make sure we sat in a different spot during our stay and we did. Tour vans pick you up at the hotel or outside another hotel close by. Board games and books available. Little beach chairs, boogie boards, umbrellas and towels included but it is part of an 'Amenity fee' that we don't see in Australia. Umbrellas are pretty flimsy and don't hold up well in the breeze. Beach towels aren't like our big beach towels but good enough. I brought my own. As soon as you get organised do yourself a favour and go see Victoria or KC and organise your tours. It is truly the best way to see the island unless you have a car. My best piece of advice, get out of Waikiki. Use it as a base but the true beauty of Hawaii is outside of that concrete jungle.

Went for a week+ with my friend. The room was average sized and minimal amenities but the room was relaxing and comfortable, kept clean daily. Breakfast was served every morning with fresh local fruit. Beach equipment was available any time of the day and the beach was a block away. The staff at the front desk was helpful including giving advice about where to eat and visit in the area.

The staff is very accommodating, particularly Daisy and Viktoria. Location is accessible to the beach. Continental breakfast is fresh and filling. Rooms are decent-sized. Valet parking is convenient. One tiny bit of a problem that we encountered is that the hotel does not have a pickup/drop off location.

I stayed at the vine hotel for 9 nights great location few minutes walk to the beach and restaurants and bars . The best part of my stay was the super friendly extra helpful concierge KC my experience in Hawaii was fantastic thanks to your excursion advice. I did the grand island tour and also got to swim with the dolphins. Thanks again Vive hotel and a extra shout out to KC for being super cool thanks from Sydney AustraliaWill definitely be back..

We came here for a birthday trip (it was our first time in Hawaii too!) and we had an amazing time! We stayed in one of the junior suites. We loved the atmosphere of the hotel and the smiles at the front desk. They were very kind and super helpful. The free beach supplies is also a huge, huge plus!  You're literally in front of the infamous Musubi Cafe and 2 blocks from the beach. It's close enough where you can just wear a towel around your bathing suit and not feel weird. For my birthday, they gave me some snacks and a card. I thought it was as very cute touch! I think this is the perfect place for the price. Also - book on their website! You'll get the resort fees waived. My only complaint was that one of (out of the 2) air conditioners was extremely loud. Luckily, one worked well enough for us through the night.

Very clean, friendly and welcoming atmosphere . When you walk into the lobby you are welcomed by friendly staff that treat you to a tasteful welcoming juice and fresh wet towels to freshen up from you travels. You are treated to complimentary breakfast everyday, that has a huge assortment of local fresh fruits, meats, breads and beverages. Each floor is hand painted with different Hawaiian saying with vibrant colors that scream Hawaii. If you want a fresh,vibrant living space this is for you. My only down fall is that every room has a window unit, I was not aware of that till I got into our room. If you plan to rent a car be aware that they only have a valet service that is $30.00 a day no matter if you use your car or not.

I love Vive and have stayed here twice. Excellent service, beautiful décor, great breakfast, wifi and a wonderful location a few blocks from the beach. This is not a showy hotel (no pool, window a/c units, small rooms), but you'll like all the thoughtful details, clean design and the beautiful, spacious lobby for breakfast, working or hanging out. I love swimming at Waikiki early mornings - it's a three block walk you can do barefoot with just your cover up and towel. And there's a cluster of modest eateries selling great poke, veggie food and food truck dishes that are delicious and cheap just kitty corner. You can walk everywhere in Waikiki from Vive. Highly recommended.

I would definitely recommend this hotel.Their hospitality was the best ever I have experienced.They provided me a room to take a shower before heading to my flight at night although I have checked out in the morning.What a nice hotel!

Nice place to stay. Good value for money. Great location. 1min walk to the beach. Friendly and helpful staff. Nice breakfasts. Rooms were small but adequate. Aircon was very noisy was the only negative .

This hotel has a super location - closed to beach, restaurants and shops.The rooms are a little on the smaller side - but they are very clean.The breakfast was very good, and the 24 hour water, tea, coffee was welcome.Best part of this hotel was the incredibly accommodating staff - Daisy, in particular, was very helpful both before and during our visit!Waikiki is an expensive place to stay and Vive Hotel is a great find!!!

Great stay at Vive Hotel Waikiki for a reasonable price. Perfect location 3 blocks from the beach. All the staff were lovely and room was nice and clean. The continental breakfast was great and had a nice selection.

I have just returned from staying 4 hrs at this well located hotel in Waikiki. The rooms were great - not the biggest - and very comfortable. I had everything that I needed including a room safe (which none of the other bigger, more expensive hotels I stayed in this trip had). The breakfast was included and more than adequate, with alternative cold meats and hot food, along with plenty of fresh fruit, bread and pasteries. The staff were great and always welcomed me back. I know that had I needed anything they would have been happy to help. There was a useful in-house concierge that helped me arrange an excellent round island trip. All in all a very positive experience at Vive Hotel. If I go back, then I would certainly stay there again. Great location as well.

Lovely small place with personal service. Great location. The tablet in the room was a nice touch. They should start breakfast service earlier because a lot of the tours started early and we were unable to get breakfast.

In Honolulu at conclusion of a cruise. Chose Vive for cost, breakfast included, and location. Vive was a good choice. Met expectations plus very friendly & helpful staff. Small rooms but well arranged. No complaints.

We're really ha[[y with our stay at Vive. Excellent value, excellent location, excellent staff. The best thing about this hotel is their staff. Daisy, KC and Victoria were super helpful from answering all our tour inquiries over email, booking our tours and car rental, giving us directions around the city, and calling our shuttle to the airport since they were late. We loved our stay in Waikiki and would definitely stay with Vive again.

The room was good and well maintained. The location is perfect just a quick stroll to the beach. Coffee and tea are available all day at the lobby; as well as the water filter. It is a good idea to bring your own reusable bottle.

I stayed here for a week and had a great experience. From the continental breakfast each morning to the free beach equipment (chairs, towels, boogie boards, beach mats, umbrellas, etc), a lot was included in the cost. The staff were all friendly and helpful, going above and beyond to ensure guests' comfort. The hotel is conveniently located close to the beach, restaurants, and shopping.

I loved our stay at Vive! It was really welcoming and the staff was very accommodating. The breakfast was good though we only at a couple times. It is good if you're looking to save some money on food! The flavored water was so good and the coffee all day? The best!

i just spent the last two week in Hawaii on Oahu and Maui staying at 3 different hotels during my stay. the Vive ranks the lowest among all three by far, I found it to be overpriced for the value you actually received.Positives: The hotel location is Great! it is two blocks and a straight shot to Waikiki beach. The staff were very nice and professional. Quick check in and the process was smooth. the entrance lobby was tastefully decorated and welcoming.The negatives:The room was extremely small and cramped with a tiny bathroom in which only literally 1 person could enter the actual bathroom at a time. it resembled more of a small walk-in closet that was converted to fit a sink, tub, and small vanity with a sliding door. There was a loud window a/c unit in the room that was struggling to maintain the room at 70degrees, the bed was ok. However because of the window A/c unit and poor insulation around the windows, i could hear EVERY single sound outside including the countless sirens, and traffic clearly and distinctly. I am not a new to "city noises" as i live in Atlanta but this was very loud, sounded as though the window was wide open. Had to call maintenance to fix slow draining tub and sinkIf you plan on driving around Oahu, it will cost you $35/day to park (plus tax) - avg around waikiki i noticed was $30.my biggest issue with this hotel was the $25 "resort fee" or "amenity fee". its just a cash grab that does not offer value at ALL!!The hotel doe NOT have a :POOLGYMSPARestauarantBarNOTHING most hotels that charge an amenity fee contain.instead of these amenities that people actually will gladly pay for, they offer you:a basic breakfast - fruit, bread and coffee each morning ( after the first day we left the hotel for a real breakfast each morning). and a cheap beach mat and umbrella if you need it. (wifi is included...but is also free at most hotels at this price point)all in all i was extremely disappointed at the size of the room, bathroom, and the lack of "amenities" they actually provide.It seems they only added the amenity fee spring of last year. Im guessing because most hotels in Waikiki charge amenity or resort fees..... but those hotels also have ACTUAL AMENITIES.I will be returning back to waikiki next summer for business and i will Definitely NOT be staying at the VIVE. i would much rather find a hotel with actual amenities and central a/c. spent almost $300 in fees/parking.put that into a better hotel

great stay, spacious rooms, lovely staff. would be nice to see less single use plastic though, especially at breakfast. free beach rentals are a nice touch too, especially given the location. nice decor

I've experience 5stars and 6stars hotels in the world. VIVE hotel service is way better than them!! I'm so appreciated to kind staff over there! and all my experiences in VIVE are so so satisfied! I will stay again when I visit Hawaii next time too!!!

Your Hotel was wonderful! A few blocks from Waikiki Beach and everything else! Rooms are small but very nice, updated, clean. The breakfast is great! Everyone was very friendly and helpful! They have beach chairs, towels, etc. to take to the beach. Being able to reserve a room for an hour or so to come back from the beach or wherever to clean up before heading to the Airport was fantastic! We will definitely stay here if we come back and highly recommend it!

Comfortable and great service great location beautiful room and view very welcoming, everthing close by, would definitely return, great breakfast and entertainment, we would definitely recommend staying here

we visited Vive 3 yrs ago and were so impressed with the friendly staff,great breakfast and lovely room.This time,we were greeted by friends,KC,and some of the kitchen staff...lovely.The breakfasts were wonderful. However, this time our room was small, the air con machine was noisy and Dennis kindly changed it. I will take it up with Thomas Cook ,our Travel agent as to why our room was downgraded from last time. our thanks to KC,Dennis,Kevin, Marsenina,Daisy,Amy,Alex and Rodger for their services.

middle of the road hotel but very nice staff, very clean, and certain perks that make up for it. free continental breakfast is awesome, but would like to see more vegetarian options. all of the beach gear is very helpful. good overall stay and would stay again.

Great room in our junior sweet, the super king bed was amazing, and huge modern shower excellent. Most of hawaii have those bath showers but not in this room. Just a block from the beach. Staff always there when needed but leave you at peace as well. Excellent.

We loved our vacation and overall experience with this hotel. This was our first time in Hawaii and we enjoyed it! Our only concern/issue was with the “deluxe continental breakfast” which switched between 2 menus. On one day there would be all cold options (which included sliced deli meat & cold hard boiled eggs, fruit & a selection of breads for toasts) the alternate days would include fruits, selection of breads, sausage & the egg only to an omlete but no veggies or cheese to fill it with. Because of this we ended up having to find breakfast most mornings as our 1 year old didn’t have much to choose from. But when we brought this disappointment up with the staff they were so kind and gave us free parking for the length of our stay! Thanks Vive Hotel!

the room we had was so small. tried to get a room change but you couldn't accommodate us.The rooms on the website look a lot larger than they are and is false advertisement. The eggs at the cooked breakfast were disgusting

This is the place you should stay on low budget with high expectations. Staffs were very friendly and cooperative. We had our friend’s wedding within an hour so we informed at the front desk, then they let us check in an hour early and that was a lifesaver! Location is perfect just straight down from Duke Kahanamoku statue, Junior Suite Ocean View room was dropped our jaw with the view and how spacious it was. Free coffee and beverages saved our budget so much and their free breakfast was superb. Resort fee was waived when booked through the hotel’s website so that’s what you should do too. My picky bf kept saying it was the best hotel ever!!

We had a wonderful experience. We got more than our monies worth. The staff was very friendly and the fact that we could borrow towels and chairs and umbrellas was a life saver. I would recommend Vive to anyone going to Waikiki

we stayed here for a week for our honeymoon. It has good amenities and the breakfast buffet is a nice feature. the rooms are compact but clean and comfortable the shower in the room was kind of crappy. Also for house keeping they say to hang your towel up if you want to reuse it but they still changed our towels daily. This hotel doesn't have a pool but the beach is like a block and a half away and they do provide beach mats and unbrella's as well as beach towels. it is obviously right down town waikiki so you do hear the traffic outside

This was my 5th stay at Vive Hotel Waikiki. I typically stay in Waikiki for 1-2 weeks, and each time I do, I always choose Vive Hotel Waikiki. The rooms are great, rates are reasonable, and the staff is exceptional. This stay was the best ever. I stayed in room 1608 with a fantastic view, the staff was very helpful in helping me to plan an awesome local activity. I look forward to returning to Hawaii and again staying at Vive Hotel Waikiki.

I stayed with a couple. A clean, compact & convenient hotel. My favorite is breakfast. It was good to eat fruit & drink coffee in a buffet style. I want to use it next time. Next time I want to learn more English and enjoy conversations with guests.

The hotel is very good. It is not excellent because of the size of the room and the bathroom is extremely small and feels confined. The decoration is dated and the airconditioning is very noise. However, the staff is friendly, the breakfast is fantastic (except that the coffee is to light...you could make it a little stronger). The location was wonderful!
user_name:
Karen S
Los Angeles, United States

review_body: We stayed here in a two bedroom room. The rooms aren’t separated by a door, which is slightly odd, but the two bathrooms keeps it private. I would recommend a door inbetween but still a good option for friends and families- and location is central.

The quality of sleep was the only real concern; it felt humid in the room and the beds aren't all that comfortable, unfortunately. The bathrooms are really nice and have all the amenities needed. It just seemed a little expensive for what it offers, but it wasn't too shabby overall.

I traveled to Waikiki to rendezvous with my mother, as she returned from an overseas trip. Vive was one of the few hotels that had a 2-bedroom suite. It was perfect for our stay! She had her own space, I had mine, and I was only a few steps away in case she needed my assistance. The front desk staff, concierge, and valets were all very helpful. My only recommendation is that handicap access at the front entrance be somehow added. When we were dropped off at the front entrance, it was awkward for my aging mother to navigate the steps into the hotel. Other than that, it was wonderful!

Checked in later on a Wednesday, around 11:00 pm. Valet was no where around, so I self-parked. Got a verbal lecture from front desk along the lines of "you should've just waited for the valet". Next morning upon checkout, valet stole $40 that I keep in my loose change container. This took place on THursday, 09/05 at 8:30 am. Please look in to this. Thank you,

The rooms are very small (but very do-able!). The ocean view was a partial ocean view....from a distance. However, the staff was very attentive and kind. As well as helpful. We ran into a small incident with a neighboring room and the hotel handled it discreetly and very professionally. The valets were superb!! Well worth the price for sure. The breakfast was more than we expected from the website which was a pleasant surprise. Would definitely stay here again

We were very impressed with this boutique hotel. We booked a junior suite with ocean views (nice and spacious room with a big bathroom and GIANT walk-in shower), and although we were only on the 8th floor, we could still see the ocean down Uluniu Ave. We can only imagine the views from the upper floors (and trust me, we tried to change to a higher floor).Proximity to everything was great....everything was within walking distance. We did have a rental the entire stay, and the valet guys were quick to grab our car and/or offer a suggestion. Mitch had lots of great suggestions for restaurants all over the island.When we first arrived at about 11 pm at night, we were a bit disappointed there wasn't an onsite restaurant (apparently didn't pay attention to that when we booked), however again as everything was within walking distance, it really wasn't that big of a deal. The continental breakfast they bring in each morning was a very pleasant surprise for us. The baked goods were fantastic, and as expected when travelling to a tropical destination, the fresh fruit was impeccable.Every time you walked in past the front desk, regardless of what the attendants were doing, they were quick to say Aloha with a smile, adding to the authenticity of the boutique hotel experience.If you're looking for a resort style hotel, this isn't the hotel for you (no restaurant, pool, or balcony), however if you're looking for a relaxing place to rest your head at night (very comfortable beds) with great customer service and breakfast, this is the hotel for you....on top of it all, the valet and resort fees were some of the lowest we could find as well.All-in-all, we would definitely recommend Vive Hotel to new travelers and would be quick to stay there again ourselves (on a higher floor of course!).

Staff was great. Only 2 blocks from beach. Room was simple but clean. Concierge service was outstanding. Bus outside hotel doors. Convenient location however the outside noise could be heard in the rooms. I was on the 21st floor and there's only 22 floors. This is not the hotel's fault but a few homeless people hung out in the neighborhood and every night from 3 to 4 a.m. you could hear one of the homeless men yelling and screaming from a distance. This is no fault of the hotel as I'm sure anywhere you stay in Waikiki Beach area will experience this.

It's a great place to stay in Honolulu. Everything was perfect. KC, the concierge, was super helpful. As well as the other staff members. Breakfast was very nice. The only drawback is the slightly smelly and noisy air conditioning. Beside that it worked fine, what is most important.

I stayed here for a week back in mid August as my usual chain hotel did not have the rates within the limits of my organization. It was good that we picked this place as it was a pretty enjoyable stay. My coworker even switched from the chain hotel to this one and praised it after I asked him about it when our week was over.One of the major highlights of this hotel is their breakfast. It starts at 7AM everyday and has a good variety of options. Waikiki beach is located about 2 blocks away so I would take a relaxing stroll there each evening. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. They worked with my coworker to find a room with a reasonable rate since he switched to here at the last minute.The only negative things about this place is that the window AC could be a bit loud since it is next to the bed. While the bed was comfortable, I somehow did not sleep very well. Still, this would definitely be a hotel I would consider the next time I'm in the area.

Our stay at Vive Hotel was great. The hotel is extremely reasonably priced compared to other hotels on Waikiki beach. A lot of users mention the size of the room but we found that to be a non-issue. The room was big enough to fit two carry on suitcases, two book bags and two people (along with the closet and desk provided in the room). The hotel is minutes away from Waikiki beach and they provide beach equipment (chairs, towels, boogie boards, mats). The staff is very welcoming and accommodating. They are very attentive to guests which I appreciated. (The only thing we didn’t utilize was their breakfast as we went out for food for all our meals.) I would 100% recommend this hotel to folks looking to stay on Waikiki beach.

This hotel is great for anyone that has a busy schedule and just needs a place to come back to to relax and unwind. The hotel offers a variety of games that the kiddos can use and a mini library that guests are free to use. The best thing for me, however, were the exceptional beds that the hotel has. It truly was the best nights sleep I have had in a long time. Overall, my stay at the Vive hotel was amazing. I will be staying here again.

Modern look and great location, within walking distance to great food and beach. Staff is friendly and helpful. Nice to have light breakfast daily, but would have liked more variety. Cosmopolitan room and bath were small without enough space to “unpack” for two for the week. But the decor and lobby is modern and beautiful. Valet park was nice too.

Vive hotel is located right in the heart of Waikiki. Super easy to get around within Waikiki. We walked to the beach everyday when we resided there. Hotel staffs were really friendly and helpful. One minus is hotel is a little outdated

My first time to Hawaii so not much to compare to but overall an excellent experience. The hotel was clean and modern. The super friendly staff made this place an even better stay. The room was nice and clean and had a modern feel to it. When we checked-in, the hallway solid walls felt a little bland and old due to the the textured walls but they were undergoing some art renos on the walls with some simple tropical art and canvas paintings. The art isn't too busy and definitely gave the place an even more modern feel and for sure made a difference. While the view from our room wasn't an ocean view or a mountain view, it was still breathtaking. There's no ice machine on each level but it was a matter of requesting it on the tablet or going down to front desk and asking for it. Not a biggie. There is always fruit infused ice water by the kitchen area in the lobby and having that water there made us enjoy the stay that much more. Valet was great. Every valet staff was super friendly and helpful. The location is super close to the beach. It's basically a 2 min walk to the beach and right beside a bus stop. The buffet breakfast is great. Yes, while it's mostly just fruit, bread, and some cold cuts, I realized I definitely needed some servings of that for breakfast when my other meals mostly consisted of pretty much just spam, loco moco, shrimps, or malasadas. The croissants they have are also delish.Definitely would come back again and would recommend to friends/family.

A very welcoming and friendly front desk. Excellent location from Waikiki Beach and the International Market. Right across the street from a delicious poke bowl spot and musubi! Coffee and filtered water available 24/7. Only bummer was breakfast selection, do wish it had more options. I would stay here again! Affordable and clean.

I loved Vive!!!! I will stay here again when we come to visit our daughter. Every staff member we came in contact with was so friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. Loved the breakfast each morning and the system to pick up our car. And your price point was very competitive.

Wonderful staff, all so friendly. Great breakfast! Don't change, we will be back with you guys next time! The room was a little small, but we really weren't there but to just sleep because there was so much to experience!

The location is great...walking distance to everything in Waikiki...room was very small and no lanai (balcony) so that wasn’t ideal. The bed was very uncomfortable and neither of us slept well. When we checked in, went up and keys didn’t work and loud party next door...back downstairs to get new keys..one worked, the other didn’t. We enjoyed the breakfast...although it would be helpful to open earlier than 7a as everyone we talked to was from the mainland and had been up for hours...the breakfast area was full waiting for breakfast service...

Pros:- great location;- very good value for money compared to other facilities in the area;- beach amenities whenever needed (umbrella, towels, chairs, etc.);- breakfast buffet is light and full of fresh fruit. For us this was a plus, as we don't eat big breakfasts and could save a few pennies on the usually expensive American breakfasts;- helpful concierge service;- fresh, flavoured and hot water always available in the common room, as well as board games for when you just feel like staying in.Cons:- we paid an additional fee for wifi, tablet, breakfast, beach amenities and concierge service but it seemed to us like everyone else had free access to the same services;- rooms are really very small with dated (and loud) aircon systems;

Employees are kind and provide delicious breakfast and a clean room. It's less than five minutes' walk from the beach. I go to Hawaii every summer and I stay at this hotel three years ago. I plan to stay at this hotel next year. This hotel is perfect.

The room, service, and location were great! The AC worked really well and the shower pressure was fantastic. Less than a 10 minute walk to the strip in Waikiki and the beach. My only critique is that the continental breakfast was rather disappointing.

This was my second time at Vive - not only because of the hotel but KC the concierge is so kind, so knowledgeable and helped us map out our whole stay. It’s such a relief to have someone that is happy to help you while you’re in a place you’re unfamiliar with. KC set us up with sight seeing, incredible places to eat and all around outstanding experience which is why we will DEFINITELY be back at VIVE again and again. Thank you to the staff and the killer accommodations!

One of my best stay in Waikiki. Everything was just perfect. The Staff was very friendly and helpful. I definitely will stay an other time there.The hotel is pergect located. You don't even have 5 min to get to the beach, restaurants or shops.

This hotel was awesome! It was pretty close to everything, less than 5 minutes walk to waikiki beach, internation market, and shopping center. The hotel room was very clean, service was top notch! I'll be staying at this place again when I visit Hawaii!

We staid here for a week and I just can tell everything was perfect, breakfast good and people at the reception very helpful. I will think about it in tears when I will be back in Italy. Mahalo for everythingAndrea

Stayed with wife for second time. Was very happy with the value and service the first time, so decided to stay again. Not beach front but great location. Very close to food and other amenities. Beach was just a 3 min walk away. Hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. Breakfast includes lots of fresh fruits. Only downside is rooms are a little small, but not a big issue for us as we were out and about most of the time.

Great location. Near the beach (like 5 minute walk), good food selection, and shopping nearby. Enjoyed our stay here for our 1 year anniversary. They even did cute swan towels and provided a box of yummy chocolates to celebrate. We checked out before breakfast started and they prepared a box for us to take to go. Also, having free breakfast is awesome. Hawaii in general is really expensive so it's pretty amazing they even offer this! Very convenient for a quick bite especially if you're waking up early to catch a tour. I would recommend this place.

Convenient to downtown and beach. Great breakfast. First night didn't realize there was no snack machine and I didn't feel like going back out. Maybe you could possibly have some cookies in the evening or fruit.Overall a good value for your money.

The staff was very welcoming & helpful upon arrival, during our stay and even after check-out.
