They made me feel extra special with a yummy personalized surprise & card waiting for me in my room after a day out exploring. The ice water, hot coffee, tea, & cups were always stocked. Towels, umbrellas & beach chairs were accessible at all times. The lounge was always clean, cool & quiet, perfect for resting after a day out in the hot sun. A continental style breakfast is offered in the lounge/living room where you can easily mingle and meet amazing people from around the world. Lastly, I thought it was cool how they host local artists to play in the living room so that you could enjoy and support locals. Only con that I have about the facility is that they don't have a gym on site but they do offer a discount to a gym off-site.

The hotel was very nice. Breakfast was fine. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. KC at the concierge desk was amazing. We had 2 couples traveling together but we wanted to do different things, and KC did a great job of meeting all our needs. KC sent us on fantastic tours that were of high quality. KC gave us good directions for things we wanted to do that didn't require a tour. KC was extremely helpful.KC was especially amazing when we wanted to take a helicopter tour. KC explained that it can be chilly at altitude and recommended a long sleeved shirt. KC offered to lend me a shirt for the trip. That seemed above and beyond the call due. We were very impressed. (It turned out I had a long sleeved shirt but the offer was amazing.)

Location is great, walking distance to beach (3-4 blocks). Lots of shopping nearby. Located in a less congested part of Waikiki a little further east, so that is great. Valet parking $30. Staff knew it was our ten year anniversary, and provided chocolates with flower towel design on bed at our arrival. Very thoughtful.

I made reservations in November/December. I had a confirmation number. We get to Vive and there is no record of our reservation. The site where I booked the trip said they had to cancel for "non-payment." I keep EVERYTHING and there was no request for payment. Needless to say, I was a wreck. Vive was fully booked. Roger pulled a room out of his magic hat and we were able to stay the two nights. He even arranged for us to use the hospitality room before we were to meet our shuttle to the airport. I have learned a valuable lesson here: Book through the hotel instead of a third-party. AND people can be so kind when you need their kindness.

Overall, I loved the hotel...especially for the price!Positives: Very hip decor ( especially the lounge area) Extremely friendly and helpful staff Free breakfast Close to beach  Negatives:No poolNo bar or restaurant on site

Breakfast is great! Rooms are nice. Walking distance to quite a few food trucks on the block. Housekeeping crew are so nice and a big thank you to them for making our beds and rooms feel refreshed after each day. Only con I have is paying valet everyday and they have no pool.

The room was rather small, but my son and I didn't plan on staying all day in that room, so it was more than comfortable for our needs. My compliments to your maintenance department, Our air-conditioning unit wasn't putting out much cool air, and just moments after I called it in, he was at my door. He did a quick evaluation, and when asked how long would it take he said 30 minutes, but in fact he had it done in under 20 minutes. Excellent job, and your staff gave us a nice note and so treats. I would have liked to have had a couple more drawers because I didn't care to live out of my bags, plus a couple more hangers would have been nice. I could have called and I am sure your people, as wonderful as they were, would have provide them for us. I loved your breakfast, and I was impressed by the beach items that you provide. My brother stayed in the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani and they didn't offer them any of the things you offered, including the free valet parking for military. So, I feel blessed and will gladly use you again and will recommend you to my family and friends. Thank you and your wonderful staff for a great and comfortable stay.

We had a sea-view queen room. Thankfully powered by 2 AC units, we were extremely comfortable and satisfied with our stay. Extra touches like the free, high speed wifi, breakfast in the morning and musical performance on Friday night made it an extra special stay. With the beach lagoon so close, we didn't need a hotel-based pool, and it was accessible to all of the shops and restaurants.

The facility was very modern and renovated. Location was a 5min walk from beach. Staff was super friendly and the hospitality was second to none. The room was modern, large, and very clean, we were allowed to check in early, and also given a hospitality room after checkout to shower and change before our flight.

This is a great hotel just 2 blocks from the beach with public transportation to many areas in Honolulu right outside the lobby doors.. They not only provide you with beach towels, but also beach umbrellas and mats are available. Front desk staff and Concierge were very helpful. No pool though and our room was a bit small. I would definitely stay there again!

My Husband and I Stayed at Vive Hotel This Past Week and We Had an Amazing Stay.Very clean and comfortable hotel. Nice place,good price great location. Highly Recommended.And ofcourse i would like to thank the front desk name Daisy...She’s so very kind helpful and accomodating...For Sure we will stay again soon at this hotel..(Vive Hotel Waikiki)

We loved this hotel. We stayed for honeymoon and we are so happy we choice the Vive. The hotel staff were professional and hospitable. The best part was the fact that they had everything you needed to go to the beach: chairs, umbrella, boogie boards, mat, and towels. Also on your last day they have a courtesy room if you need to shower after the 11am check out time. If you're wanting a place that's clean, hospitable, reasonably priced, and close the beach, then The Vive is the perfect hotel for you.

Vive is a perfect location for all your tourist needs. The beach is 2 blocks away and Vive provides beach towels, boards, mats and surf lessons recommendations.We were in walking distance to shopping, beach, and restaurants.We jogged one morning to Diamond Head. The staff was friendly and helpful.The staff helped with air-condition explanations when called, the breakfast help talked to you and always had coffee and infused cold water available.The desk staff were knowledgeable about eating and drinking suggestions.Yes, we were made to feel welcome and comfortable at Vive and we would go back there if given the opportunity.

Shout out to KC who booked all of our tours and answered all of ours questions.KC was awesome to deal with always happy to assist us.Thank you again for making our experience fantastic.Happy Aussie Travellers

The hotel is reasonable in relation to room, amenities, location and service. Service was very good, professional and provided recommendations. Room was cleaned well, however not every day which is suitable for me. The location is very good as only one block from beach and shops, restaurants and local Waikiki attractions. The bed wasn't the best and wish for my first stay in Waikiki I could have had a better view and higher floor room due to the length of my stay was very decent as the lower floor room I had could hear traffic. Overall hotel was good

A great small boutique hotel in the middle of mega-resorts. A nice personal, intimate hotel experience. It is one block to Waikiki beach. We have stayed 2x there - and have stayed at the big resorts. There are no pools and no restaurants but a complimentary breakfast in a living room environment. There is no need to pay to be in a crowded resort in a crowded pool when the beautiful beaches and restaurants are all around you! For the price, you cannot beat this - nice rooms - small European style. The hotel provides beach chairs, umbrellas, towels etc. The staff is absolutely top-notch - they get to know you and really help make your vacation the best possible. Front desk staff is interested in how your day was and always at your service. Alex, Daisy, Amy, Victoria and the others were amazing. The concierge, KC, is outstanding- KC will help you plan your day no matter your interest. KC knows Oahu. Valet service efficient and courteous. Also loved the book library and board games! Thanks for a great stay. Mahalo!

If you are looking for a comfortable and convenient hotel in Waikiki rather than a resort experience, this is a good choice. The hotel is in a great location for beach access and wandering around Waikiki. Clean and modern with a friendly staff and free breakfast. It does not have a pool or balconies in the room so this is really just a great base for operating from and not a resort.

I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Clean rooms, Free breakfast, 5 min to the beach, outstanding staff. There are plenty of options for food around the area. There is also a bus stop right by the hotel and we enjoyed discovering the area walking around and using the bus.I highly recommend this hotel.

This hotel is very good however the airconditioners are small and noisy. The airconditioner that was in our room is right opposite the bed and we had to keep getting up and turning it off. It was also noisy. The breakfast is not huge but adequate and fruit is very good. The hotel is quite good for a budget hotel.

The Hotel is a good option close to Waikiki Beach (only 2 blocks from the Duke statue). The things provided by the hotel for your stay in the beach are very useful because you need to only walk the 2 blocks to arrive.

We've stayed at the Vive several times over the years, including for our wedding, and have loved the value and the warm hospitality we've received until this trip. It's still a great value and we appreciated the welcome back note and goodies in our room. But from the moment we arrived we could tell something was different. From the valet to the front desk the aloha sprit that made this hotel special was missing. No one was particularly rude, but we felt the lack of hospitality throughout our stay.Additionally, we could not configure the A/C unit to prevent it from blowing air on our faces and did not sleep well either. Some improvements include the addition of eggs and sausage to the complimentary breakfast and the papaya was impressively ripe every day.Overall the Vive is still a good value but we realized how important genuine customer service is to us and will likely stay somewhere else for our next trip.

We were in town just for the weekend for a wedding and to visit friends. The convenient location and free breakfast help us make to most of the short time we had in Honolulu. The room was a bit small, but we spent very little time in the room so it wasn't a big deal. We would stay again when we come back to Honolulu.

Firstly, this hotel is a lot lower priced than the majority of hotels in Waikiki. We opted for the Vive because it was more within our budget and the reviews are generally good. We knew before we arrived that this hotel would be quite basic compared to the higher end ones.The positives:The hotel is in an excellent location, just a couple of minutes walk to the beach and 10 min walk from the shopping mall/lots of restaurants.The staff at the hotel are welcoming, friendly and very helpful. The hotel lobby is very nice. Air conditioning is great in there, and the 24hr tea, coffee and water is much appreciated. The breakfast seemed good, although we can't really comment as we aren't big breakfast people so just grabbed a few pastries each morning with our coffees.The negatives:Although we have no issue with the room size (we are used to staying in small rooms having stayed in places like NYC where rooms are also tiny there!) I personally found the rooms not very well thought out. For example, we had a chair and an office chair for the desk/table - I don't think 2 chairs in such a small room are necessary when there's such little space to begin with. Just remove the office style chair and there would be more space. The mattresses slide on the bed base so if you move then the mattress moves away from the headboard creating a huge gap.The cleanliness in this hotel isn't to the standard I expected. I just felt like the items in the room and bathroom needed a good clean - e.g dust on lamps, marks on bathroom floor. Additionally there was also an old blood stain on the duvet we had - now this could easily be missed as it was so small but its the attention to detail that is lacking.We personally would not return to Waikiki as we didn't love it, however if you are on a budget then this hotel is okay and has potential to be a lot better if the rooms had a refurb or some redecoration.

Location of hotel is fantastic, only 5min walk to the beach!Staff have been very helpful in offering and arranging tours.However my suggestion for improvement is with the breakfast bar, because there is no formal dining area, and it's more of a cafe style where you can chill and relax, it can be a little bit hard to have a proper breakfast. Also would suggest to change the menu to provide more vegetarian and vegan options.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Vive hotel, and felt it was a tremendous value for the price we paid. Be aware of what this awesome hotel is, and is not so you aren’t surprised. What it is:- One of the least expensive hotels in Waikiki Beach area- The service here is absolutely amazing. Daisy at the front desk is a gem who did everything in her power to make our stay great. Very knowledgeable and super friendly. Every person we encountered - front desk, concierge, bellboy, cleaning staff, breakfast helpers - were all so friendly. We appreciate that and it added to our trip in a very positive way. I am 100% certain that customer satisfaction is extremely high on their priority list. Alex has a great front end staff!- Very chic decor- The free breakfast is definitely as tasty and bountiful as it looks in the pictures! Hot eggs and sausage served every second day, with boiled eggs + cold cut meats served every other day. Great fruit, pastries, bread (including the delish blueberry bread) served every day. Good coffee every day all day and 2 types of fruit-infused water in the afternoon and evening. - We loved the stylish seating/eating area in the lobby!- Great location to the beach - a short 5-7 min saunter!- Lovely beach chairs. I didn’t think I’d like them because they aren’t Tommy Bahama but I actually liked them better because they were lighter to carry and still comfy. Beach towels also included and beach umbrellas are flimsy but better than nothing.- Not only was the room rate extremely inexpensive compared to most, if you book directly with the hotel you save the $25-$40USD ‘resort fee’ per day! Wow!- Our flight home is late tonight, and rather than pay an extra half-day rate for keeping a room which some other resorts do, they have a ‘Courtesy Suite’ which you can book for one hour on the day of your departure at no extra cost! Wow!So this is what Vive Hotel is. Be aware of what this hotel is not. I won’t call these negatives, just the reality of what it doesn’t offer so you aren’t surprised and can make your best decision on where to stay:- No pool or balcony- The rooms (aside from suites) are very small compared to other hotels I’ve stayed in. For example, Hyatt Centric room I’ve stayed in was 330 sq ft compared to the 220 sq ft Cosmopolitan Queen here. Very little room to move around in the room and the bathroom is also small. Although modernized a lot, this building must have been built a long time ago when room sizes were smaller.- No restaurant or bar on site- No ironing board in the cosmo queen rooms- No ice machines on the floors - just call front desk and they bring you a bag of ice (some might see this as a positive)For us, we knew there was no pool or balcony, and traveling on a budget the main thing for us was a clean, comfortable, modern-looking hotel with the free breakfast and close to the amazing Waikiki beach! Because of all the money we saved on the inexpensive room, no resort fee (booking direct), and courtesy suite the final day, we decided to upgrade for our final 4 nights out of 9 to the double-size Lifestyle Junior Suite at a whopping 440 sq ft for only $50USD plus tax more per night. Totally worth it! For a pool, we went to resortpass.com and booked a small cabana for one day at the Hyatt Regency a block away and had a great pool day!Zero regrets for us in booking Vive and we really appreciate the personalized service and all the positives that this hotel offered. Look on their website for discount codes for the best possible rates! Thanks again Vive!

Very friendly staff, great location, only a short walk from the beach. Loved the fruit choice at breakfast and love that you can fill your water bottle in the lobby! Room was a bit of a squeeze, but I was only there for a night so really just needed a hot shower and a place to put my head down for the night.

Friendly staffs. Nice room and great lobby atmosphere. The weak points were that the bed was sacking (or too soft?), and the AC was a window AC. Be prepared to pay additional resort fee of $28.xx and $30 valet parking fee (plus tip) daily.

everything was great, the location is awesome, the service includes everything needed in the trip, the staff is very polite and helpful, shops and restaurants are all around just a short walk, a car is not needed

Firstly, you can’t fault the staff here. Always say hi when you arrive, hold a smile and help out when asked. Now, let’s start with the cons and get them out of the way. 1-Rooms are tiny. Yes, I know the hotel notes the sizes on the website, but they really are small. You’ll be walking over suitcases as there is literally no where to put them. 2-The bed is just ok. The mattress is comfy enough but it just continually slides across the timber bed frame. If you try and sit up, the mattress will move about 4-5inches meaning there is a huge gap between the mattress and bed head. A simple non slip mat under the mattress I assume would help here. 3-Bathroom. Tiny as tiny can be. 4-Cleanliness. The entrance to the hotel is lovely, with a nice clean library/seating area. The rest of the place, not so good. Plenty of dust on our bedside table lamps, and shelves. It’s not bad, it’s just not great. In short, the front of the hotel is great, the rooms are desperate for a refurbishment. Pros. 1-Location. Close to everything you need, the probably best thing about the hotel. 2-Staff. Have been great whenever asked of anything. Always greeted with a smile and a hello. And that’s about it. I feel like the hotel could be so so much better, but I also appreciate this hotel is priced lower than others. Still, it’s not cheap (nothing in Waikiki is) and I probably expected a little more.

Vive hotel has a great location, great amenities including continental breakfast, beach supplies, and more. The customer service was always amazing. We will definitely recommend Vive hotel to our friends and family!

Good location with convenient environment. The hotel front desk are friendly and nice. Room is clean and service is good. Near Wakiki beach only 6mins way far and easy to grasp foods near by the place we live.

The hotel is in a good location in Waikiki, less than 5 min walking to the beach and they provide you beach towels, chairs and umbrellas. The hotel is also close to two shopping centers and different places to eat and drink. The concierge service makes booking activities and tickets very easy and the bus stops are very close to the hotel. The rooms are quite small but well organised and clean, as the bathroom. The breakfast offers coffee or tea, croissants, bread and fruits, simple but enough to start the day. Vive hotel Waikiki was a pleasant stay for us.

My daughter and I had a wonderful time at the Vive Hotel. The location was perfect and the service was great! I have already recommended the hotel to my family and friends planning their Hawaii vacation this summer.

This was our first time in Hawaii the island is beautiful and had a great time but the hotel had parking fee of $30 a day and i had a coupon for 50% but could not use it as told by management the room was extremely small and if you would order something you need in the room there was quite a few times had to re order it a number of times before it came guys at the valet were great although staff not so pleasant will be coming back to hawaii definitely but will consider another hotel....

Convenient location ( walking distance to Waikiki), very clean, and reasonably priced for area. They also provide basic beach amenities ( sun umbrellas, grass beach mats, snorkling gear). Room was small but space was well designed. Close to variety of restaurants and retail stores. Would recommend to a friend.

like it as it was clean, new and very convinience location for the last day in waikiki !2 blocks from the beach, 3 minutes to bus stop, 24 hours coffee /tea , filter water machine with microwawe oven !

What a lovely hotel that has the staff that goes out of their way to ensure all your needs are met! Thank you Amy and Daisey for your outstanding assistance and your Beautiful smiles each day. You both totally put professionalism in your work and make each person feel you are there just for them. Thank you and see you soon. Lary Hurlbut

Although they didn’t have every amenity I wanted; nonetheless, they excelled at what they did. I was comfortable, relaxed, and well taken care of. I would recommend to anyone, and would even stay there on my next visit.

I had a great experience i checked in with a lovely man at the desk. After the airline i was slightly flustered so it was nice to have such great staff. I had a great breakfast every morning, a nice view and even got a birthday card and snacks for my birthday.

I highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again. The staff were amazing and I especially appreciated the hospitality room since our flight was not scheduled until after 9pm. The continental breakfast every morning was also wonderful.

Clean, tidy room with sea views. 2 blocks from the beach in the heart of Waikiki. Beach towels provided. Good breakfast and all day coffee. Shuttle services available to malls, Pearl Harbour, airport, Diamond Head. On bus routes so easy for transport. Bit of traffic noise in the evening and noisy aircon.

Hotel was great , the best part was the breakfast in the morning that is included , this way you don’t have to worry about where to go every morning for breakfast . The down side are the rooms - they were so small you can barely put your luggage , it blocks the whole room , but we managed it somehow . If you have a car you have to pay $30 per day which is a little bit pricey. Other than that it was a great stay . We didn’t have any issues !! Hope this helps to some people .

Very good:Free borrow of boards, towels, sun umbrellas, beach chairs, beach mats Very goof breakfast buffet.Not so good:Small roomsLoud, the street can be heard as we are beside of it. Floor outside of the room is dirty.

Having booked with not a lot of expectations and realizing Hawaii’s hotels generally don’t seem recently remodeled, I was extremely pleasantly surprised by this gem. The little details like the aloha sign, the morning continental buffet, the 24hr tea and coffee downstairs, the tablet in the room and the extremely friendly staff all made it a very delightful stay. I like comfort and usually go for big hotels like Marriott or Sheraton, Hilton, etc, but didn’t want to pay thousands of dollars for a worn down hotel so I found this one that looked decent but it was so much more than that. The decor and details gives it a very cool, yet cozy feeling and the staff makes you feel at home.We unfortunately stayed only one night but I will recommend it to my friends and would definitely stay here if we go back to Honolulu. Thank you very much for our wonderful stay. Ps: We got kicked us out of our cruise ship very early in the morning and showed up at vive expecting they’d let us leave our luggage while we went to the beach or something but the room was actually ready and they let us check in at 10am. I suppose we were just lucky the room was ready and not everyone can do this, but we really appreciated this. Thank you again :)

4 stars for the location of the hotel, the 24/7 water coffee/tea provided, and for providing beach towels, mats and chairs. The bed in room 806 is not as comfortable and the air conditioner in that room is TOO NOISY

I gave it a 4, only because it's not beach front...but..I am very happy with my stay here.~Very friendly, helpful staff. I was greeted every time I walked through, and they showed care when I had a room issue (bed).~Good location. It's just two blocks from the beach. There is a crosswalk right in front of the hotel, so that made it easy. Easily walkable to beach, shops, restaurants, canal!~Room are updated and clean, a bit small (but I didn't care about that!) *Room 1402 does need a new mattress though, it slants and is boxy/bouncy. I had trouble sleeping but I added a ton of pillows, so that helped. I also recommend a different bed placement. Currently, it's difficult to get in and out of the bathroom, and I had to put a pillow at the base of the bed so that I wouldn't keep hitting my shin~Decent breakfast every morning 7-930, I think, Every day was sliced bread, pastries, muffins, peanut butter/jelly/honey packets, fresh pineapple, watermelon, honeydew, cantelope, strawberries, coffee, tea and pineapple juice. Every other day was hard boiled eggs, ham/turkey (deli) slices and egg omelettes/sausage links.~Great value. You pay way less here than the other hotels (please don't change that!!)~beach towels, chairs and umbrella are offered at the front desk~Mountain side, high floor was decently quiet!Thank you. I will book your hotel again

The vive hotel was a great hotel. Room and bathroom was kind of small. Toilet was too close to the shower. Front desk receptionist was very helpful. Valet garage was right before the Hy’s steak house sign, a slight hill going up to garage.

We recently stayed here and the staff is amazing, our room was great. The continental breakfast is delicious. It is about blocks from the beach, and close to everything. We will stay here again, whenever we get back to Waikiki. I recommend this hotel!

I really enjoyed my stay at Vive. The staff were friendly and the hospitality was awesome. It's at a central location and close to restaurants shopping and the beach.The breakfast was great. I'd definitely return. Thanks for making my trip awesome. Amanda

Great place to stay in Waikiki and great value. We took a nice walk to dinner every night since there were so many options around the hotel and did not have to take our rental out as much. The beach was walking distance, around 5 minutes away, Vive provides towels and chairs. Awesome place to stay overall and not too expensive, we would stay here again.

I had the pleasure of staying there one night. The location is excellent in the heart of Waikiki and a very short walk to the beach. The hotel is updated and has a fresh look. The lobby is designed for hanging out. They also have a supply of games to play. They have coffee and flavored water available all the time. My room was spacious and modern. It included a tablet to access Netflix etc. and it had a large screen TV. The bathroom was spacious and my shower was huge. I had a great view of the ocean and diamond Head.

This was truly a place that felt like home and was worth the price. The staff were all really nice and helpful and friendly, the breakfast great with a lot of fruit and the lounge so nice, I sat there several times to do work and chat. Internet was fast. And it was steps from the best beach. The hotel also had all kinds of beach gear we borrowed: towels and mats and boards and umbrellas. Room was a bit small for two, but this was no problem.

We would stay at the Vive Hotel again next time we are in Waikiki. The rooms are ok for size but wish that the bathroom were a little bigger. Housekeeping staff was very good as well. Breakfast was good but needs a little variety.The best part of your hotel is your Customer Service and special mention to KC at the Concierge Desk. She was awesome. So helpful and knowledgeable. We did not have any problems with all the tours and city bus schedules. All her recommendations were very good. A big asset to your company.Thank you! We enjoyed our stay.Manny & Dulce OngVancouver CanadaJuly 13 to 17/2019

The rooms are small. Shower was broken. Paid for a ocean view and could only see a sliver of water through two buildings. Checked out early left Hawaii after learning my grandfather passed and hotel would not compensate for remaining days.

Aloha! The Vive hotel has an excellent concierge by the name of KC (KC Nunes) who is very patient, knowledgeable and personable. He set up a submarine tour, a helicopter tour and a Polynesian Cultural center all day experience for me in a most pleasant wayI also enjoyed my stay at the Vive .since it is convenient to everything including Waikiki beach. It is about a 25 minute walk from the convention center where I had an international meeting but the exercise was good for me. Much love to the people in Hawaii. You have a beautiful spirit and way of relating to people and a great culture. Aloha.

My husband and I came to Celebrate our 21 Wedding Anniversary and the staff at the Vive Hotel are excellent. They all go about and beyond to make the guest feel extremely welcomed. Victoria was type notch. She worked extremely hard to get us all of the tours we wanted for a very reasonable price. She was very knowledgeable. She didn’t rush us through the process she took her time and got to know us as individuals. Which really made us feel special. When one of the tours short changed us by not making all the stops they were supposed to she took the time to listen and tried to do everything in her power to make it right for us. We could tell that Customer service was her number one priority. Once Kara’s knew we weren’t happy about one of our tours she stepped right in and did what she needed to do in order to make sure we were happy. It was great to encounter a manager that was hands on with everything. Once KC in Concierge knew we were Veterans she went above and beyond to get us discounts on our tours for being Veterans. Which really meant a lot to us. We also got the privilege of meeting Beverly who switched us out of our 1st room into a bigger more beautiful room and then had the room put together so beautifully for or anniversary. All of the employees just wanted us extremely happy. I was very impressed that all the staff knew us by our name, and went out of there way to greet us and speak to us every single time they saw us. I would take the Vive hotel over the Hilton, Hyatt, Sheraton or any of those other big hotel companies because to them you are just a guest in their large reservation book. But to all the VIVE staff they wanted you to feel comfortable and right at home I felt like I was dealing with my family which was really nice. Victoria and KC should be considered for management as far as I am concerned. Their knowledge and care for the guest are unremarkable. Keep it up Ladies. Most Sincerely, Mr. & Mrs. Alexander

Great location. Really easy to walk to everything you visit Waikiki for. The breakfast was really nice. Great selection and great way to get your day going. The staff was super friendly and always were eager to help you with anything.

First of all the Hotel is up to date and every chair in the lobby lounge is super comfortable, and attractive.The staff are knowledgable and helpful and willing to go the extra step for the guest.I loved my stay and will be back.

Great staff, courteous, very helpful. Good location, clean rooms, god breakfast. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that 's want to stay there. I had a problem with Hotel.com and the women at the front desk was a great help getting it straighten out.

good location, tasty free breakfast and beverages, clean and comfortable lobby. If there are more useful shower and electric kettle in a room, it gonna be excellent! Also I wonder if their shop's opening hour was more useful like 7am-11pm! it was pity that we couldn't see the shop because it opens after we go out and closes before we come back.

My husband and I stayed at the Vive for 5 nights. We had originally booked it for 7 nights but decided to cancel 2 of the nights and stay at a different hotel. With that being said, you can probably figure out that we didn’t love our overall stay here. We can’t say it was horrible but it certainly didn’t meet our expectations. We booked here having read some good reviews and they certainly had some high points. So let me tell you some of the positives of this hotel. Pros:- Great breakfast served every morning. A very good selection of items such as fruits, eggs and sausages, boiled eggs, bread, and pastries. - Very central to Waikiki - walking distance to the beach, restaurants and shopping.- You can borrow beach towels, mats, boogie boards, and chairs to bring to the beach - We booked through the hotel’s website directly and did not have to pay the resort fee.Now let’s talk about some of the negatives.- Bed/mattress was NOT comfortable. You can tell the minute you lay on the bed that it was a pretty worn out bed ... you pretty much sink in when you lay on it. Pillows were also not comfortable. - Room was a bit run down and was pretty small. It felt like the size of a hotel room in New York City. - The area outside our room was super stuffy. - Rooms weren’t that clean. We noticed that certain areas were very dusty. - Air condition inside the room was very loud and didn’t cool the room down sufficiently.Overall, we think this hotel needs some work. The rooms need some further renovation. We decided to only give this hotel a 2 star because they lacked cleanliness and the comfort factor was missing. We valued a good night’s sleep and this hotel couldn’t deliver that. I guess it all depends on what you’re looking for. If you’re on a budget, we think this hotel may work for you but don’t expect to sleep well.

We chose this hotel due to its location and value. It met our expectations on both fronts. If we visit Waikiki again I may spend a bit more to stay on the beach but if I am tight on funds I would absolutely stay here again. Breakfast was 4 star, the larger suite we had was 4 star, and the front desk staff were 5 star. We didn't see a pool (but didn't inquire about one either). We didn't rent a car so we can't speak to the parking.
user_name:
Robert S
New Hope, United States

review_body: There was hair all over the bed in our room and they moved us to a different room upon complain. The second room’s bed was ok, but bathrooms are horribly designed. They are tight and there is a towel rack above the toilet. There is barely any counter space so I used the rack to put my cardigan there, which sadly fell in the toilet beneath it. The hotel is way too overpriced for what it offers. Breakfast was included but they provide tiny dessert plates (some days, not all) for food. You’ll end up with 5 plates if you don’t bring your own disposable plates. The location is just OK. I would not stay here again.

Very good location for the price. Rooms are on the smaller side, but adequate. Friendly staff. Breakfast is fine, but prefers more than just eggs and sausages and fruits every day. It would be nice to have more breakfast varieties.

I came across this hotel when I was staying at a "roach infested" place across the street, and needed a new place to stay. The front desk staff told me to book online to save more money.I stayed at the Vive Waikiki for 6 days. The place was very nice. While the room was smaller than what I was used to, it had everything I needed. The breakfasts each morning were more than enough.The parking valet guys always seemed to have my car ready to go. Once I learned to schedule maid service, there were no more issues. It is one the tablet that is next to the bed.The only negative thing was there was no coffee maker in the room. However, the hotel has 24 coffee service in the lobby. Sometimes in is nice to have a cup of coffee in the room without getting dressed to go downstairs.I plan to stay there the next time I am in Honolulu.

The staff was very friendly and helpful. Hotel in very good location approximately 5 minute walk from beach. Nice breakfast with a wild selection of items to choose from and changes every day. Microwaves in breakfast area available if needed to warm food. No complaints!

The location is great. The breakfast is good and the staffs are friendly. Also, they provide a tablet in each room. Overall, I am a happy customer. You can also borrow beach towels, beach mat and umbrella from them with no cost.

We had a great experience at Vive Waikiki! The staff was friendly and helpful and we loved the free breakfast every morning and coffee and fruit-flavored water during the day. The availability of beach towels, umbrellas, etc. were also great! AND - only 1 block from the beach and close to the bus stop and shopping areas. Definitely the place to stay!

Stayed here for 4 nights on a tour around Hawaii in December 2018. I spent ages reading reviews and chose this one for the combination of good reviews and decent price. The room was tiny, air-con was noisy, but otherwise the room was okay. The hotel has an excellent location, a couple of blocks from the beach, with a bus-stop right outside (takes you directly to Pearl Harbour). Staff were super-friendly, and check-in was easy. There's coffee on tap all the time and the breakfast was decent enough. Rented a car one day and the valet parking overnight wasn't too pricey. Would definitely recommend if you're staying in Waikiki and not hanging out in your room the whole time! Would give it 4.5 if possible.

Staff was very nice and helpful. Check in process was welcoming, and we received juice and cool towels at the front desk. Lobby was large and stocked with coffee and infused water. Room was clean and mostly quiet on the 15th floor. Sheets were soft. Great amenities, supplied phone charger, ice delivered to the room, beach towels available. Overall, Vive was comfortable and staff was great. We would come back.

If you don't plan to spend a lot of time in your room, this hotel is good. The lobby is a good hangout and meeting spot. The only negative thing I would say is the room cleaning service. They wouldn't clean at all or it would happen really late in the day. Other than that it was comfortable.

Fantastic hotel and central location. Staff are wonderful and greet you when entering/exiting the hotel and always on hand to assist with enquires, very customer orientated. Room was good, clean and comfy. There is a tablet in the room with info on the hotel, area and other features. There is no pool, however hotel is only a couple of blocks away from the beach. towels and beach accessories available from reception. Breakfast is served in the living room. It’s a great space where can chill during the day, you will find board games and books available. There is also a water station were you can refill your bottles and tea/coffee available all day. If taking any tours the hotel is close to a couple of pick up locations both within 5-10min walk. Would definitely stay again and highly recommend Vive for all travellers to Waikiki.

Friendly stuff, clean, good breakfast, bathroom, location. Air conditioner could be better. While it's cooling the room well, it makes a noise that doesn't make night sleep comfortable. The breakfast options are limited but the fruits compensate for it 100%.

I came upon this hotel as the place I was staying was infested with roaches. The staff told me they had availability, and told me to book the place on line because it was cheaper to do it that way.I arrived Saturday morning after being on thew cruise, The room wasn't ready until later in the day, but they took my luggage. I received a message informing me the room was ready. The place is a boutique hotel, so the rooms are smaller. The drawers for the room are under the bed.The staff is more than friendly.Their breakfast was very good.The only negative was there is no coffee maker in the room, but they have 24 coffee service in the lobby. It is just a little inconvenient to put on street clothes to have a cup of coffee.I would definitely stay here again.

Vive is the place to stay in Waikiki. The complimentary breakfast every morning that includes fresh fruit, coffee, eggs and much more is such a nice service that will save you lots of money. Location is right in the heart and close to beach. Great hotel definitely would recommend and I will be going back.

first time at this hotel in march 2019.8 night staystaff were wonderful and helpful and always friendly.on checking in greated with a icecold pinapple juice which was nice.location is great,i really like that area for a hotel,on the sand in a five minute walk.bus stop right next to hotel.ok yes rooms are very small,but as I spend little time in room while away doesn't worry me.the breakfast included was just fine,food always fresh,area kept so clean,hats off to those early morning staff there they do a fine job.I really did enjoy my stay there after many stays at other hotels in Honolulu ,and would book there again..My bed was great and slept well,11th floor didn't hear much road noise either which was a suprsie.

Was in Honolulu for a few days and booked a room at this hotel. I was surprised by the hotel. Very clean..quiet and it is within 5-10 mins walk down the street to Waikiki Beach. The view I had was the parking lot but I didn’t care. Wish it had blackout curtains tho. It offered free continental breakfast and a free hour use of its complimentary room after checking out. This came in very handy since my flight was in the evening.Room I booked was the standard room. Amenities, air conditioning and bathroom were good.

Wish I could stay in Vive at all of my travel destinations. They were so helpful and made our stay feel like home! Don't hesitate to book here! They even let you borrow beach carpets, chairs or boards!

Location, Location, Location is what it's all about and even though this property is NOT on the Beach - it is only a short walk from the front door to the sands of Waikiki. Great Buffet Breakfast every morning. Great Staff especially Alex who was Awesome. They even provide you towels, mats and other accessories. No Gym or Pool yet when you have the Pacific - who needs a Pool - They do give you a 50% Discount at a local Spa / Gym which again is only a short walk to. ABC Store right on the corner from the Hotel - about a 1 minute walk - everything is there you might need. The Bus Stop[ is right outside the Front Door and for those who are 65+ - You can get a 1-Day Pass for only US$2.00. WOW what a bargain ! If you take the #13 Bus takes about 15-20 minutes from the Hotel and you are at TARGET / WALMART ? SAM's Club for all of those great deals. No need to Rent a Car - I walked everywhere - to The International Market / The Beach / The Hard Rock Cafe and The Harley Davidson Shop - Tours can take you everywhere or you can rent a Motorcycle ( Harley ) for freewheelin. For Me the Only CONS were that they had Bathtubs in the Bath Room to take a shower in. I hate bath tubs - why would anyone want to sit in their own dirty water. Prefer Walk-In Showers which would also eliminate falling down from wet floors stepping up and over to get out of bath tubs. No Complimentary Water - had 2 Bottles in the room at US$1.50 each. Also, No Smoke Hoods in the room to eliminate any risk of smoke inhalation due to fire - remember the Grenfell Tower in London. Otherwise really enjoyed my stay as I said everything was so convenient - did not need to rent a car.

A few blocks away from a perfect Waikiki beach. Towels, boogie boards and mats free to use. Pleasant colorful lobby. Valet parking on site. Small rooms but great location and value. Friendly staff, lovely light breakfast. Will return! Very sad to leave.

The hotel was very clean and orderly. The staff were welcoming and the breakfast was good! I was surprised to learn that beach towels, mats, parasols, umbrellas and boogie boards are available for tenants to borrow - my partner and I went swimming everyday so this was really great for us. (The beach is a 7 minute walk away from Waikiki Beach)I highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again! It was a little bit pricey, but definitely worth it.

I’ve stayed a total of three times at this beautiful hotel now and I don’t think that I’ll be ever going to a different hotel whenever I stay in Oahu. My visits have been nothing but positive and I’ve been treated so well and so kindly by all of the staff. I always look forward to seeing my favorite concierge, KC, sitting in the lobby always ready to help us find our way or recommend a great tasty place for lunch. Look for the bright red hair, you can’t miss it. Although we haven’t used their concierge booking services to the fullest extent, I couldn’t help but notice the couple before us were all smiles after KC booked them for their tour of Pearl Harbor. KC being born and raised on the island certainly gives them the insiders-advantage on all the best spots, deals, and events happening!This time around I was able to take advantage of their amazing customer service. On the last day I decided to reserve the “courtesy room” that is an in-between room one can use after checking out. Our flight wasn’t until the evening but we didn’t want to leave Waikiki yet - amazingly, they have umbrellas, chairs, beach towels and mats for you to borrow. They will hold your luggage for you in a secure room while you go romp around in the surf; upon returning our loaned gear, we were able to retrieve our luggage and check into the courtesy room to shower, change, and rest for an hour. AMAZING. I dont really know of any other hotels that do this and it is STELLAR!! ✨✨

Everything and everyone,from the email reservation Dept. Front desk ,house keeping(Julia R) to the people keeping food service clean in the morning was top notch. We stayed in a Junior suite room 2107 and it was very comfortable and quiet. The buffet in the morning was a deal maker for us. Waikiki is expensive to eat out every meal and this saved us some $ and was always great.

A nice little hotel, at an extremely reasonable price which is close to everything you would need in Waikiki. Staff were extremely friendly and no request was too much trouble... rooms are small but nice, clean and great features

Good amenities, breakfast had a local touch, rooms were clean, staff was nice. Laundry service was the same price for regular laundry and dry cleaning, which was too expensive for us.Only thing is the ecological turn they use to justify the cleaning of towels only on demand (cleaning the ones on the floor, leaving the ones hanging on poles) is inconsistent with the paper trail they leave. Only coffee cups are offered for coffee, whereas there could have cups of glasses offered for juice and water, instead of paper or plastic cups. Coffee cups are also only given during breakfast time. In any case, this was a well located hotel with good amenities and nice staff.

I was born in Hawaii but hadn’t been back in 50 years, so I was glad to stay in such a great place with welcoming employees. From the cool towels and pineapple juice at check in to the lei making in the lobby, Vive Hotel embodies the Aloha spirit!

When given a less than desirable room, was immediately offered a better room. Great breakfast, friendly employees. I liked that they had umbrellas, chairs, and beach towels for use. The air conditioners are pretty noisy, but useful.

I really enjoyed to stay at Vive Hotel. The staffs were the most friendly hoteliers I have ever met. Room is small but well designed, very cleane. The hotel provides water ,coffee ,tea for 24hrs in the lobby along with free breakfast. Specifically Taro bread was delicious.

The staff and valets were the best and I can't praise them enough for their aloha spirit, their professionalism, and the service they provided during my two week vacation in Hawaii to see family. I will definitely be staying here every time I visit Hawaii. Vive Hotel Waikiki, your staff and valet are the best and thank you for an excellent stay!

I'm a local who travels often domestic and int'l, and I've stayed in a lot of hotels - including a staycation here on island from time to time. Waikiki almost always has numerous construction projects underway, along with pipeline repairs, overhead cable repairs, etc. (not to mention the almost-monthly parades and festivals when entire streets are shut down). That mens lots of traffic that induces major stress. Arriving at Vive Hotel Waikiki starts with a friendly valet, a front-desk visit to a friendly human who kindly slides a cool beverage toward me (pineapple juice), and in a minute or two, hands me room card, and in a minute later, I'm in my clean, nice-smelling, extremely comfortable room. If calm, chill, efficiency ($$) and comfort is important in your pick of Waikiki space, Vive Hotel Waikiki is an excellent choice.

Always my favorite place to stay for a weekend get-a-way. Yummy and convenient breakfast included and served fresh in the lobby every morning. Comfy beds. Excellent services. Elevators and valet can be a little slow but it doesn’t detract from the overall cool vibe.

This was our second stay at Vive and had an amazing time. This hotel thought of everything to accommodate their guests needs with the added perks of the beach accessories.. We will definitely be coming back soon!

Stayed at Vive hotel four years ago and decided to come back this year to stay again to celebrate our wedding anniversary! Booked a 10 nights stay and it was wonderful! Upon arrival, we were greeted with warm smile and 2 glasses of fresh pineapple juices! We booked our hotel stay directly with the hotel because the resort fees are waived that way, and you get 50% off valet parking since we rented a car during our stay. One other good thing when booking directly is that you get complimentary room upgrade (if available) automatically. Since this was for our wedding anniversary celebration, the hotel upgraded us to 18 floor corner room with partial ocean view! It was a much bigger room than when we stayed 4 years ago. And when we reached our room, we saw these beautiful towel swans, a box of chocolate, and a card sitting on our bed! That sure was a nice surprise and did make our stay here extra special!!Continental breakfast are served every morning. They alternate each day with limited hot breakfast (sausage and eggs), and than cold deli meat the other day. Fresh fruits such as pineapples, watermelon, cantaloupe, melon are served everyday. Some days you get strawberries and papaya (i love!) too. There are many baked goods such as muffin, breads, etc. Juice, coffee and tea are also available!The location of Vive hotel is excellent. It is literally just steps away from shops, restaurants, and the famous Waikiki Beach. One best thing the hotel offers to guests is the beach gear items you can take with you when you go to the beach such as beach towels, beach mats, beach chairs.Customer service is excellent, all staff are always friendly and ready to help.All in all, a wonderful stay and will come back again for sure the next time we visit Oahu!

片言の英語でも笑顔で対応してくれました。バス停にも近く、ボディボードやタオル、シートの貸し出しも気軽に対応していただけます。行動的にアクティブティを満喫するなら、とてもコスパの良いホテルです。Even though my English was poor, they always responded with a smile. The hotel's location is near the bus stop, and you can also borrow body boards, towels and sheets. It is a very good hotel if you want to be active and enjoy the activities.

The staff was awesome from the time I checked in to check out. The location was walking distance to everything you may need: great food, laundromat, ABC Stores (snacks, drinks, sunblock, etc), zoo, and beaches!!

Comfortable rooms, friendly and accommodating staff. The free daily breakfast was good, however the breakfast area can be improved by more dining tables and chairs as opposed to couches. The location is also fantastic, being within walking distance to the beach, shops and restaurants.

I looked for a hotel that could accommodate a late check out and had a place to keep our belongings as we had a late flight and this place was it. The professionalism and friendliness of the front desk staff and everyone there is the best service that I’ve encountered in a while.

Only problem we encountered was with the Valet. Our friends dropped us off and didn’t want to park since it was going to be fast however the valet was having none of that. He took his time doing everything else instead of moving the car in front of them. Our friends ended up backing out through a steep driveway onto very busy foot traffic since the valet area is tight and there was no place to turn around since they were blocked in by the parked car. There was no one else waiting for valet service so he didn’t need to be so stink about it. Unfortunately one disgruntled employee blew what would’ve been a great rating.

The Hotel staff could not have been more friendly, helpful and great to be around! The room was a sort of semi 2 room arrangement with 2 bathrooms. Which, with 2 daughters, was a good economical compromise between 2 rooms or a 2 room suite was better than usual 2 queen beds side by side. The hotel location is great as it is just one block back from Waikiki Beach.

Great hotel, good breakfast, easy valet parking. Only downside was that the A/C units in our room were kind of loud. Other than that, very clean place with comfortable beds. We would stay again and highly recommend!

Quick overnight stay, but the staff was great and the room was lovely. Conveniently located in Waikiki, but not noisy or in a shady area. would love to stay here for a longer trip! Check in and check out was simple and straight forward.
user_name:
Natalie B
Kwajalein Island, Marshall Islands

review_body: Great location very close to Waikiki Beach. affordable rates and nice amenities provided. would definitely come back. Room size was great, lots of fun stuff to do in the area and the concierge was very helpful.

The hotel is one of the best i have stay in the US. Except for the initial issue on my debit card, my stay in the hotel was pleasant. Breakfast was health with plenty of fruits to choose from. The staff were very helpful.

The place seems be renovated and it was good enough to stay for couple of nights as business trip.Staff are so friendly and nice! GOOD!Breakfast was okay (lots of fruits) but somewhat it was smelly due to foodwaste....I wish I could enjoyed salad section,,, no veggie at all.

The Vive is a quiet great location. We found it perfect, only being a short walk to the beach and great food and shopping.The daily buffet fruit breakfast is amazing. A great light and healthy option to start the day. The staff are friendly and courteous, with the only slight negative being the noisy window rattling AC units. A very minor point though.

Booked hotel for three nights for a short vacation trip to Waikiki. Great service and friendly athmosphere. Love their breakfasts. Close to the beach, shopping, restaurants etc.Truly satisfied with service. AC is a bit noisy. Furniture and carpet are in good shape, but not brand new. Bathrom renovated and looks great. There was no view from my room (4th floor), but I didn't care much since I spent most of the time outside.Overall, very satisfied. Will book again

Vive Hotel is located very conveniently to get around; it doesn’t have the famous Waikiki views from our room despite being an ocean view, however it’s an easy walk away. Within walking distance of nearly everything. Staff is accommodating and friendly; will assist in all matters. The use of towels, beach mats, umbrellas and chairs is very convenient and nice.

I have been Vive hotel from june 1st to 4th. I arrived in the morning and I was able to get an early check-in. I also received juice and a cool water towel from the information desk upon arrival. It was a small part, but I could feel their sincerity.I was assigned a high-floor room as requested. It was a very efficient room, though not so spacious. I was happy to have a congratulatory card and pretty towel decorations in my room to celebrate my wedding anniversary.If you value efficiency and price over luxury, the Vive Hotel is the best choice in price and location. In particular, they not only provide light breakfast , 24-hour fresh water & coffee but also offer a boogie-board, beach parasol and mat for free. This can save you money and make you comfortable.Whenever I had any questions, the front desk staff greeted me with a big smile and showed me their sincere kindness.I hope to have an opportunity to stay with Vive! Thanks a lot!

This beautiful and clean hotel is perfectly located less than a 10 min walk away from the International Marketplace and the beach! The staff was very kind and accommodating for our needs. The complimentary breakfast offered a nice selection of fruits and different pastries each day and other yummy breakfast items. Tea, coffee, and fruit-infused water is offered 24 hours a day which is great. They also offer beach amenities such as mats, towels, and boogie boards! Something that I've never seen before is a small tablet in our room that you can use for ordering room service and surfing the web. Although the Cosmopolitan room was small, it was exactly what my boyfriend and I needed since we were on the go for most of our trip. Despite the valet parking being $30/day, this hotel is a great value. We were able to find street parking by the canal.

Vive is literally two blocks away from Waikiki beach, just grab your towels at the front desk and go! Ample breakfast, clean rooms, and wonderful, friendly staff. Close to shopping and restaurants, too. We would stay there again!

Everything is great, perfect location and services including breakfast and drinks. Except the room is a little small and the air conditioner's noise is too loud (we reviewed some guests' comment, so we have prepared earplugs by ourselves).

Our stay was comfortable. We were given a room located at the corner of the 18th floor. Nice view from our hotel room. Thanks to Ms. Daisy, the front desk receptionist who welcomed us so warmly. Room was clean & smells good with white bedsheets & towels. Free continental breakfast w/ plentiful of assorted fruits & 24 hours free supply of water, coffee & tea. It’s just a short walk to the beach & the malls. The staff were polite & friendly. Will definitely recommend this hotel to our friends.

The location is great and the people on staff are very helpful and friendly. The rooms are smaller than most other hotels we have stayed in and we had to store our golf bags in the hotel storage room in order to have enough room to move around our room. The rooms all hear street noise even on the highest floors so sleep can be interrupted by sirens and early morning garbage trucks. Breakfast is very minimal and not varied. Vegetarians had little to eat since there were no cereals or yogurt available. Hard boiled eggs were served for 4 out of the 8 days we were there. Except for pineapple or papaya on 1 day, the fruit selection was not local.

We had a wonderful time at the Vive Hotel. The staff was friendly and the accommodations were stylish. The parking was interesting, but the valet made it work fine. We were thankful to be able to use beach items such as towels, mats and umbrellas.

The reception desk is very welcoming. It is a nice hotel that is only a block away from the beach. I highly recommend this place especially if you are trying to do Waikiki on a budget. They offer a nice morning breakfast of pastries fresh fruit and breakfast meats.

Love this place. In the heart of Waikiki.Complimentary beach accessories were big plus. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful.Breakfast with fruits, bread, some eggs and ham and drinks. Very clean and stylish hotel lobby as well as the room.

Great hotel, service and location. Will stay here again! Breakfast was good, wish it started earlier. Staff is very friendly and attentive. Valet is timely and helpful. Overall I had a wonderful stay.

Second time for us staying at the Vive. -Service was excellent, polite and friendly. We appreciate the daily ice for our beach cooler in addition to the chairs and towels. Having the valet was convenient as well.-Our room did not get cleaned every day. The floor lobby could use some updating.-Better comfort and value compared to comparable properties nearby.-Great location for us. Centrally located Waikiki, without the hub-bub of the big ocean front hotels.-Bed was comfortable. The A/C tends to be noisy with a constant dripping of condensate. However, it does block out the street noise.-We appreciate having the extra room of a suite. We found the standard rooms "small".

everything about the hotel was wonderful and the staff were all incredibly welcoming and friendly. The location is ideal and the breakfast is a huge plus, would definitely recommend for anybody going to Hawai'i

Good location, 2 blocks from beach. Excellent continental breakfast. Permitted early check-in. Room was a little cramped. Staff was courteous and helpful answering questions on local places to visit and transportation.

The clean room condition and the kindness of the staff were impressive. Access to Waikiki Beach was also good. The people were friendly and there was no difficulty because they responded quickly. It was a good trip.

Services are fabulous, friendly staff and very helpful. The room is always cleaned and the food are very good. The location is so central and excellent. The facilities are great, I will certainly advise my friends to stay in your hotel. Very affordable and wonderful staff, always smiling and always at hand to help.

It was our second time to stay at VIVE, and it was great again. The room was great along with the view. The staff was very responsive to our needs. The breakfast is great and every day we met interesting people from around the world. We recommend VIVE highly for anyone going to Waikiki.

Wonderful place to stay while in Oahu. Close to the beach and activities, very friendly staff and clean rooms. The fresh fruit at breakfast was amazing. Nice touch providing beach accessories, we used them every day while we were there.

Hotel is in a great location just steps from Waikiki Beach. The hotel does not have a pool or a place to sit outside to take it all in. Room service never resupplied our toiletries during our stay. They never vacuumed the carpet in the room or on the floor outside. The front desk staff was wonderful. They are so nice and helpful, they make the hotel. The homeless and druggies have overtaken Waikiki beach and the surrounding area outside the hotel so we will not go back.

Hotels in Waikiki are expensive - so value has to be seen in that context. The hotel is conveniently located, albeit on a busy road, a couple of streets back from the beachfront. My room had a good view of the sea and was very comfortable. The light breakfast and all day availability of coffee and iced water was great. But I was most impressed by the welcome and service provided by the front desk staff. Many thanks to them and to all the team at Vive.

Good: 1) if you book directly with them they waive the daily amenities fee.2) they offer free water, tea and coffee 24 hours.3) they offer you a cold towel and pineapple juice upon check-in.4) they promote not packing mats, towels and beach umbrellas as they offer it at the hotel. ** see bad #2Bad:1) rooms are tiny! Yes, it's advertised but man it's TINY!2) they note on their website don't bring beach towel, umbrellas, mats etc they have them available at the hotel. Now this is true... however, the umbrellas were CHEAP and we brought one to the beach that still had a tag on it so we thought it was new. As soon as we opened it to set it up the rods were all undone and all over the place! Once we fixed the rods and set it up on the sand with some light wind the umbrella falls and the rods came undone. This happened about 5 times until we gave up because it split in half and half the rods were out. ALSO, they have mats available but they don't have a designated return area so it's constantly being used and not cleaned! GROSS. Imagine baking in the sun and someones sweat is all over the mat and then it just gets used and used with out it being cleaned! How disgusting. We took a sunset yoga session and we both used a mat and placed a beach towel on top. The smell came through the towel. It smelled SO BAD that I didn't want to put my face on the towel.3) there was a mishap with the cleaning but they tried to rectified the situation after I addressed a solution should be made! 4) the daily cleaning is mediocre. We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. After what seemed to be 3 days into the stay they did not vacuum the carpet! It should be included considering your hotel is at the beach and sand gets everywhere. Also, they didn't have an extra toilet paper roll available after one of the cleanings. The A/C cover fell off and they didn't even try and fix it... after the cleaning it was still on the floor and the floor was dirty as can be. Also, after one of the cleanings they left the dirty towels on the floor so let's just say they are not the most thorough when it comes to the cleaning routine.Improve: 1) designate a return area for mats and ensure its sanitized and cleaned before another guest uses it! 2) if you will promote leave beach umbrellas etc at home because you offer the items at the hotel please make sure it's not broken and so cheap! Also, when being returned it should also be cleaned and ensure it's in working condition to prevent what happened to us. 3) cleaning should include vacuuming the floors daily!4) train your employees to rectify a mistake vs. being told by the guest to come up with a reasonable solution.5) The fruit available during breakfast was not sweet (which was about 1/3 of the spread). My friend had the cantaloupe and it tasted it had gone bad and she mentioned it to an employee. Scones or egg whites would also have been nice option.Overall, if you are on a budget and don't mind a small space and minimal amenities but would like to stay walking distance to the Waikiki beach area then this is a good option. Luckily, for us we were out most of the trip so it wasn't so bad. If you plan on staying in a lot then I'd suggest going elsewhere.I have stayed at the Ashton Waikiki right across the street from the beach. It is slightly more expensive but the rooms are bigger, they have nice restaurants in the same building and the hotel is literally across the street from the beach. I have also stayed at about 3 other hotels in Waikiki and I must say this was the smallest room by far. If Vive improved the areas mentioned above then maybe it would be a bit more worth it.

The staff is very kind. I want to visit again. Vive hotel is very good location. To beach only 3 minutes by walk. Many good restaurants around.You will definitely be satisfied with this hotel. The mall is very close

It is a nice boutique hotel two blocks from Waikiki beach. The service was great and the room is big. There is a free flowing tea and coffee service at the lobby. The free breakfast everyday was also quite decent. Not a biggie since there is tea and coffee services at the lobby, I would have preferred to have a hotpot (water heater) in my room so that I can have my tea inside my room. Nonetheless, this is an excellent hotel and a strategic location

Overall I'm satisfied with the hotel in term of location & value. The only thing I'm a bit disappointed which the room is very small. I had booked a sea view room but in actual fact 80% of the view was blocked by nearby building, you won't enjoy it much.

I enjoyed my stay at this hotel with one big exception, the really noisy air conditioner unit. To be fair, the hotel provided ear plugs which helped but I shouldn’t have to use ear plugs in the first place. Anyway, the pros include the fast check in, complimentary breakfast, location, great valet and housekeeping services. Overall, good value for my money.

The hotel was within walking distance to the beach and restaurants. The staff was wonderful and the room while small was decent for the price. I also read that the air conditioner was loud however we found it not loud at all. It makes a sound just like any central air conditioner or fan. The mattress was not so comfy but I also saw that they were upgrading their mattress with new ones after we had already checked in. I'm sure that if I asked they would've switched our room to one with a new mattress but we decided to deal with it. If you have any issues ( no matter how small) the staff will get right on it and will take care of it before you can even blink. I would like to especially thank Roger and Daisy at the front counter as well as all of the valet staff. They as well as all of the other staff here made sure that our time was fantastic. If we visit again we will stay here and would recommend this hotel to friends and family. Mahalo!

We absolutely loved staying here, it was in close proximity to the beach and shops, the room was clean and the included breakfast saved us time and money. Cazi the concierge could not have been more helpful, she knew exactly what we needed to do and worked out our plans within minutes. She suggested the best places to go and we were so happy with her choices. Will definitely stay here again.

We have stayed here five times, and the hotel keeps making delightful improvements while maintaining an overall consistency that can be relied on.Staff - Courteous, polite, friendly and helpful as always. Accessibility - Walking distance to the beach, great food, shops, car rental company and main arterial routes.Rooms - Comfortable. New lighting. Power cords. Amenities - Love the dining area with the Continental breakfast every morning and easy access to water. They have everything you need for laying out on the beach as well.Cons - 1) The air filter vent in the shower was covered in a thick layer of dust. It was unsightly. For comparison, the courtesy room shower vent was completely clean.Still a terrific place. I will continue to stay here every time we come back.Thank you Vive!

Friendly staff, pleasant rooms (everything worked), decent breakfast. Perfect for one night stay at good rates. We wanted 2 bedroom suite which are in very short supply in Waikiki and had a family suite which is 2 interconnecting bedrooms each with bath. In usual US style there's no door between the bedrooms - I think there must be a law about this as it's so common, if rather off-putting to Europeans. But fine if the alternative is much more expensive separate rooms. Check in was friendly and efficient and they brought a kettle up to our room at no charge, much appreciated.

On my first trip to Oahu, a friend suggested Vive Hotel as a nice boutique hotel, close to the beach, that wouldn’t break the bank. The room was wonderful, with a view of the ocean (from three blocks away), and conveniently located for easy in/out when we would take trips to the north shore or a local restaurant.

Great stay near the beach. Small rooms, but everything still felt clean and organized. Loved the complimentary breakfast, beach umbrellas, towels, and mats! Easy access to city bus transportation too. We would definitely stay here again.

Buffet was great... as Hotel supplied pictures showed. Staff as also very nice. For the price, overall this place needs a facelift... poorly painted, furniture worn in lobby, rooms had its own window a/c. I felt like I was staying in a Motel 6, except Motel 6 rooms are bigger. My head was 3 feet from the toilet, and though I have never been in jail, it had that kind of feeling in terms of tight quarters. I would NOT recommend this for anyone planning on staying more than one night.

The Vive Hotel was absolutely amazing. The staff was so incredibly nice in every way, rooms were clean and quiet. Being able to use the beach towels/umbrellas was so awesome too! Perfect place for Waikiki!

Vive Hotel is a smaller hotel in the Waikiki area. If you are okay without having a pool and outside area, this is a good affordable hotel. We didn't spend much time at the hotel, so this was okay for us. It provides a free breakfast, which always includes a fruit spread as well as bagels/bread/muffins and some type of meat/protein. They give you access to beach gear: towels, mats, umbrellas, boogie boards, which was very convenient. We had a late flight out on our last day, so they were able to provide us a room after check-out for an hour, which was great to be able to take a shower before leaving, and re-pack our bags and such. The rooms are a bit on the small side, so keep that in mind as well if you are used to bigger rooms. For us it wasn't an issue as we didn't spend a ton of time there.

KC was awesome with tips using the local bus for sightseeing. the room was clean and nice, however breakfast was basic and didn't cater for my gluten free needs. The girls at reception were always helpful and we loved the use of towels, chairs, boogie boards etc when we went to the beach.

I enjoyed staying here, but I'd warn that the a/c was not sufficient for our room on a warm day. On the plus side, the service folks cared about my thoughts and offered to move us to a second room. We opted to stay where we were, but it was still nice.

So glad I found this hotel! -Walking distance to the beach, restaurants, & shops-Nice & clean hotel-Friendly staff-Good breakfast every morning! -Coffee, tea, & fruit infused water available 24/7 in the lobby-Beach towels, mats, & umbrellas available upon request Our flight was at 11pm. So with a 12pm checkout time we didn’t want to haul our luggage around. They were able to hold onto our luggage during the day & even offered their courtesy room for us to use to shower in & freshen up before our flight!I’d definitely recommend this hotel to family & friends. & if I come back I’ll stay here again!

Love this place. Staff helpful. In the heart of Waikiki. Best value I’ve seen. There is a bit of typical Waikiki noise on Kūhiō. Stay in a mauka side room if you can. If you are a city person the noise will be typical. I happen to live outer island and in a rural area.

Excellent value for the cost of the rooms at the Vive - very quiet at night and great access to beaches, shopping and restaurants. Complimentary beach accessories were big plus. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Could include some cereal/muesli options with breakfast.

Clean and modern hotel, excellent location close to the beach and walking distance to lots of restaurants and shopping. Staff was great, very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good, lots of fresh fruit.

Only criticism was the sparse breakfast! Fruit, croissants, toast, coffee. That’s it! All staff very helpful all the time. Great location near beach, shops and restaurants in Waikiki. Note that there is a tax and resort fee to pay.

Rather than pay hundreds per night for a beach front hotel we opted for the Vive which is only three blocks from the beachfront. The staff were so friendly, they have towels, beach umbrellas and chairs to use each day. It was the best service. The room is small and the air con is a little noisy and there’s no balcony; but all you need is a place to sleep when you’re in Hawaii. The bed was comfy and we never heard noise from other guests which you often get in larger hotels. We’d definitely stay here again as we saved thousands on our accomodation. Save your money to enjoy Hawaii by staying at the Vive.

Loved the service and amenities available. The continental breakfast was fresh and more expansive than anticipated and the staff were very friendly and accommodating. Most of all I loved our suite layout, two rooms in one, best design ever, more hotels should have this design!!

Vive is in a great location, very close to the beach and restaurants. The room was very clean and comfortable with a nice view of the beach. Amenities were good, just what we needed for a day at the beach. Noisy air-con was the only thing we could fault.

Great service, Wonderful!! I wish I could be there every year!! I have told my friends just how wonderful it is to stay at VIVE!! The employees are the best, they took very good care of us and they were happy to do so!! I would advise anyone to stay. The service is GREAT!!!!!

I wish we got to stay longer, but we only had one night here as it was a 2 min walk to my friend's wedding at another hotel. We stayed under the kama'aina special, which included free valet parking. I had booked a cosmopolitan queen, but upon entering our room, I realized we were upgraded to a lifestyle junior suite w/ ocean view, which was a splendid surprise as I've never been upgraded before. The staff with which we interacted was friendly and had excellent guest service. The quality of everything was great. We slept in so we didn't get a chance to partake in the free breakfast in the morning. Although no pool, this hotel is very close to the beach. The experience at this little hotel was impressionable and I would definitely stay here again if i'm ever staycation-ing in the Waikiki area.

Comfortable in every aspect. Parking is especially easy at this hotel and very reasonably priced incomparison with places where you have to find you own space and walk. Be prepared for a well organized continental breakfast in a lovely room where you can meet new friends. Dress is very casual.

Hotel is central to everything, 5 mins' walk to beach, which we thought was great. Fresh and healthy breakfast is included, available 7.30am to 9.30am, definitely a plus, and rooms were serviced every day. There is a little safe in your room where you can store your valuables, though we felt we didn't need to use it. Staff are welcoming, cheerful and very helpful. We will definitely use Vive Hotel again. Only gripe we have is that the air conditioning unit was noisy, and disrupted our sleep, but since we do not have one at home, we are just not used to them.

This was only a 24-hour stopover, so my stay was very brief. The hotel is located about 2 blocks back from Waikiki beach, along the main tourist/shopping precinct - close to restaurants and convenience stores. A "deluxe" continental buffet breakfast was included, but unfortunately no cereals or yoghurts, or cold cuts as I would have expected.

Close to the beach. Great location for awesome restaurants etc.. Morning breakfast better than expected. Very courteous staff. Room was a tad tight but clean and everything worked the way it's supposed to. Just a great experience all around.

Small rooms and noisy window mount air conditioning makes the sleep not too comfortable although the beds are good.The buffet breakfast was just about right. surprisingly, there was no cereal and No Bacon/ sausages. Adding cereals only could make a big difference.Handy Location.

Great place to stay, close to amenities but off the tourist trail. Nice to have a breakfast buffet. Close to the beach and appreciated the hotel providing chairs and towels.
