Also close to the Zoo and convenient to other parts of the city and area including Diamond Head using the city bus line. Staff was helpful and and courteous. Would stay here again.

I think that the resort fee woud not be imposed on lumply. Itis better to impose to user.리조트 이용 요금은 개별적으로, 사용다에게만 부과 하면 좋겠습니다. 다른 호텔도 다 그렇게 하리라고 생각되지만 뭔가 불합리 해 보입니다. 그리고 아침 식사 테이블이 너무 작아요. 좀 더 큰 것으로 교체하면 좋겠습니다.

Great value for money venue that provides good amenities, central location to Waikiki, friendly and helpful staff and great continental breakfast at no additional cost. Would come back again and recommend to friends.

Excellent value and service given its location. Even include simple breakfast. Rooms are small and basic but to be expected, and are clean and neat. Very friendly staff. Beds are definitely on the soft side though.

Vive was great, the location was really good and the staff were always happy to help you with anything you may have had a problem with. word of caution the beds are soft for those who like a firmer bed.

We had a great stay at the Vive hotel. The staff was excellent, helpful and always smiling. The location was perfect, walking distance to the beach and many other sights and dining. Right on the bus lines, so you could travel the city by bus. The room was cozy (small) but who spends much time in the room?The Continental breakfast was good, but limited selections. KC, the concierge is a treasure.

The location is perfect, directly located at famous Waikiki Beach. Beach towels and parasols provided. Rooms are small, but clean and nice. The breakfast is with fresh fruits and tasty kona coffee. Water and even flavored water is provided the whole day.

It was a good location. Rooms very small and did not live up to expectations when booked. Poor air conditioning and ones above us leaked onto ours. Noisy Air con made sleeping difficult. Showers need adjustment to save water. Need more coat hangers and there was limited hanging space . Limited drawers. Good breakfast.

The hotel is nice, the people who work there are great and very nice. I loved the location as well. Also, I really appreciated the fact you can borrow beach towels, chairs and umbrella. Breakfast are pretty yummy!

Boutique type hotel located close to the beach, shops and restaurants. Rooms are modern and clean but on the small side especially the washroom. Front desk staff were excellent and helpful and even mentioned the option of a 1 hour stay in another room to freshen up since we had to check out at noon but our flight was later that night. Nice breakfast options and coffee available 24 / 7. This hotel has no balconies and for some reason we could hear a lot of noise / traffic even though we were 20 floors up.

A 2 minute walk from Waikiki Beach and surrounded by shops and restaurants. The hotel is very clean and the staff really helpful and available. However our room was very noisy (even on the 16th floor) as if the window was always open. The view on the ocean was wonderful though. There were also some black stains on the walls of our room - which by the way was a bit small. Overall we spent a very nice couple of days. Had it be possible I would have rated this place 4,5/5.

This hotel has all it needs for a nice and relaxing vacation. Among other things, they provide a continental breakfast, coffee, water, concierge services, beach apparel, valet services, a complimentary guest room on check-out day. We absolutely loved our stay there. I would highly recommend for a couple or a solo traveler. Thank you Vive!

The hotel is nice, and the room we had was small, but very clean and was fine for a short stay. Much smaller than economy rooms elsewhere. Location was great. I've stayed in a lot of hotels, and this was by far the worst for breakfast - food was fine, but very limited. Also not impressed with room service. When the maid came, we asked if she could come back in 5 minutes. She never came back. My wife went downstairs to ask if someone could make up our room, and we were told the maid had marked us down as requesting no service. No one came our entire stay.All in all, would I come back - no.

Great location. Many bonuses. Great staff. Helpful Concierge. Short walk to everything. Right on the bus routes. Complimentary beach gear. One of the few places that includes breakfast. We plan on staying there again on our return visit.

Excellent buffet breakfast and I love the fact that you can sit in the lounge downstairs and relax with a cup of tea or coffee or cold water any time of the day. Stayed in the family room this time as there were three of us and it was spacious and comfortable.

Customer service was outstanding and they gave me a room to shower in before my flight. Clean room and the breakfast was very good. Plenty of fruit and juice. I will be back later this year. Liked the location.

I was, once again, very pleased to stay at the Hotel. Overall, I find it an excellent place.I might have welcomed a slightly larger room, and one which did not overlook the noisystreet. But perhaps this can be rectified on my next stay, in November.The staff were all cheerful and helpful. The breakfasts were more than sufficient, thecoffee always good, and I appreciated the brief use of a "waiting room" on my departuredate, because my shuttle bus did not come until 5 p.m.And, speaking of the shuttle bus, I must thank the receptionists in the hotel forlining up the Roberts bus on the day of my departure.Thanks to everyone at the Vive Wai-ki-ki, especially Alex, who is doing a wonderfuljob there. See you in November !====================================Dr David de Giustino

We found this option cheaper than surrounding hotels, probably because there is no pool and it's a couple of streets back from the beach, but saving the money is worth it!The lobby looks fresh and inviting. While the rooms are smaller, they are clean and modern (unlike many comparable hotels in Waikiki). Continental breakfast included in the room rate is very rare in Waikiki. Walkable distance to everything locally. Although we did not use it, the hotel offers a complimentary 1 hour in a room after you check out, which is a wonderful idea for late flights!!

We stayed two nights prior to taking a cruise with celebrity cruise lines. Location was great and breakfast descent. The air conditioner in our room was awful, it was loud and most of the time didn’t work. Room was very tiny. We did use the courtesy room to shower and change before heading to cruise port, that room was nicer than our actual room. That’s when we realized how crappy our room was.

We really liked this hotel, friendly, helpful stuff, right in the hub of Waikiki with quick stroll to beach/shops/restaurants. The complimentary light breakfast and all day coffee and water was great. Room a little small, but not really a problem for us. I am happy to recommend this hotel.

The room was so small that we could hardly move in it and could not place the suitcases in it. we had to pay a quite big amount to get a bigger room. when we moved in the safe was not working and so did the aircondition. on moving to the other room we left a pair of shoes behind which we realized only before leaving. we asked the front desk whether they had found the shoes. first they said there is no such a pair of shoes at the Lost and Found, but later when we insisted on double checking they said it was there. it was packed in a plastic bag labelled with our first room No. How come they did not send it immediately to our new room instead of lying.before leaving (last evening) we wanted to open the safe but it did not work again. even the specialist could not open it. With a drill they could open it after an hour. the air conditioner was very loud.

This is a great hotel in a great location. Excellent service, friendly staff, valet parking (extra cost), beach equipment available. The only negative things are the rather poor breakfasts. They get boring after the first day. Also the rooms are very small, so if you have two large suitcases you will have trouble moving around in the room.

The staff at this hotel are first rate, location of the hotel is excellent, although the rooms lack space ( for clothes) it was not a major issue. I stress again how good the staff were on the front counter etc

Great location close to beach in heart of Waikiki. Very nice continental breakfast and fruit bar with a slightly different daily menu. Staff were super helpful and resourceful. Room was smallish but very clean and comfortable. The window Ac unit was a little annoying. All things considered, excellent value!

Great location and friendly staff.Air conditioning in room 1007 needs an upgrade. Very old and noisy. Lowest fan speed too fast and loud.Otherwise it was great. Bookings of shuttle buses etc were reliable.

Enjoyed our stay at Vive. Good location! We enjoyed the hot breakfast when it was offered. Air conditioning units were very loud at night. Very nice and accommodating staff. Wish there was balcony room options.

This is a great boutique hotel about 20 storeys tall, lobby and rooms are recently renovated, hallway is little dated but doesn’t bother us. We find most other hotels in Waikiki are kind of old, and this is actually newer than many others. This is more like a business style hotel than a resort, so don’t expect a pool, gym, restaurants, etc. This is not a luxurious hotel but has great value given its location and style. Our room was #1106- a corner suite with Queen Size bed and two windows; given all the reviews online, we expect it would be a little smaller than usual. But we have travelled to Asia often and feel it is not as bad in comparison. Pros: - centrally located in Waikiki, 1 block from Waikiki beach, less than 2-3 minutes walk to the Main Street - Ala Moana/ Beach.- offers complimentary 1 hour room after you check out in case you have a late flight, this is a great feature as a lot people may still go to the beach on their last day, and this allows guests to freshen up before the flight. - In room IPad that allows you to call for room service, get your car, request for services, etc. - 24 hour complimentary coffee, tea, water station and hot water in the lobby. We love the fruit infused water, they often load up with fruits and the water is really refreshing! - there is also an activity/car concierge which we did not use. - if you want to try to Hawaii specialty food - spam w/rice, there is a great one across the street “Musubi Cafe Iyasume” Others: - $30 valet parking per day - $12 resort amenities includes morning continental breakfast (7-9am), beach mat, umbrella, business Center access, wifi and other amenities. Staffs are helpful and friendly!

We knew before we booked this hotel that it was not a 5 star .Arriving at the hotel we were so excited about the lobby.Clean, modern, with a with a welcoming staff.We then went to our room and wow we were back in the fifties.The room was tiny, old ,and not up to date.You could reach the bathroom from the bed you were that close.Now our biggest issue was a wall air conditioner.This was so old and noisy it was impossible to sleep.You were either freezing or hot.If a good night sleep is important to you this is not the place.Buffet breakfast was included but very sparse.No hot items at all.I could live with that but not having a adequate cooling system in 2019 is not acceptable.

I enjoyed the great location close to the beach.The room was perfect, and the bed was comfortable. I would recommend it to my friends and family. The staff was friendly and went out of their way to help. To my friend at the front desk, from Illinois. Thank you!!Tim from Chicago, who lives on Maui.Warmest Aloha!

Always some apprehension booking on line, but was satisfied with this booking. One block off the main street so quiet yet convenient. Friendly staff, good property, good location, great value for money

I loved everything staff,cleanliness, location is the best of course if I come back to Hawaii (I definitely should) this hotel would be my choice again you will be minute walking distance to Waikiki beach all the great restaurants, cafes and shopping places

Location was great. Bed could have been better. Complimentary room after check out was a wonderful bonus. Breakfast was very good. Service was excellent. Very helpful and friendly staff. Will recommend to others!

Having stayed previously some time ago in a Junior Suite we really enjoyed it, that's why we came back. This time we were put in a disabled Junior Suite that does not give any room in the bathroom to put your things. We immediately asked for a change and got one, the desk clerk treated me as though I was an idiot. The place was quite shabby and cleaning left a lot to be desired. The shower area needed a good clean, there was a bit of filthy plastic on the shower wall, it was still there after 4 nights. The ground floor eating area was left with cups, food residue etc for hours at a time. In general the place looks quite shabby.

My stay at this hotel was great. Really like the room and and the location was great as well. The beach is walkable distance, as well the local vendors. The fact that the amenities were made able for the beach was awesome. Hope to visit hawaii soon.

In general, we enjoyed our stay, although the breakfast was not very good. The addition of cereals would make it much better.The concierge KC was outstanding. KC put together an itinerary that was excellent.
user_name:
John B
Saint Augustine Beach, Florida

review_body: I stayed 4 days/nights by myself, and it was my first trip to Hawaii.Pros: I chose this hotel mostly for location and since breakfast was included. I was not disappointed by either so overall a good choice. I really enjoyed the tablets, and don't know why all hotels don't have them, makes it very easy and simple to request any services or just look up information. Cons: The a/c was very noisy and really hard to sleep with if you're a light sleeper. While a lot places had these window units, I definitely would pay a little more if a place had central a/c. Secondly cleanliness was just okay in some areas, in particular my window was so dirty I couldn't see out of it until I opened it up. If I paid for ocean view room, I would expect them to be cleaner. Now they did have cleaning scheduled the next day as I was leaving, but would have appreciated it while I was there.

Rooms are small the AC units are noisy. Location is terrific. I will nice to a ramp to roll baggage vs carry it to entrance even a few step can make difference even a wood ramp will help. That will help even handicap access. Improved brkfst items.

Lobby is refreshed and friendly with water/tea/coffee and microwave available for hotel guests. Elevators, hallways and rooms could use some more upgrading and refreshing. Staff was friendly and housekeeping made our bed everyday. Only complaint is our glass was not replaced despite being visibly dirty after use. Rooms were decent with some upgrades but shower head could use some more pressure and CLR perhaps, as it was leaky in some areas. Lighting was decent but missing outlets to where there should be, for example, in front of wall mirror, missing outlet and no lighting above.

Great service! All the things u need to the beach are provided! Breakfast with fruits, bread, some eggs and ham and drinks. Very clean and stylish hotel lobby as well as the room. The bed is very comfortable.

Overall this hotel was very good. The location was excellent and the deluxe continental breakfast was a big plus. But the air conditioner in the room was very loud and the mattress was very soft and sunken. Otherwise, I will definitely stay again and recommend to my friends.

It was a lovely hotel that is centrally located in Waikiki. The rooms are clean with modern furniture and the continental breakfast each day was great. The staff were very helpful, including the Concierge, Casey, who helped us a few times.

The hotel was great. Front desk staff attended to any need we had. Room had everything needed. Valet parking was exceptional, staff was quick to retrieve or place our vehicle (little expensive for a daily fee).

Nice boutique style hotel. Well located and good service. The breakfast can include hot foods. Nice that they have coffee and tea available in lobby all day and night. Rooms were small and the A/C very noisy. Had to switch off A/C at nights as we could not sleep with the sound

Great Hotel, Great location. Staff were friendly and hotel was clean. Rooms are on the smaller side however if you are just interested in somewhere to sleep and not in spending alot of time in the room, this is a good price for the location. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

The staff was friendly and helpful. The location was a short walk to the beach which was perfect to me since hotels right on the beach tend to be extremely busy and congested. I would definitely stay again if I visit Waikiki.

Great boutique style hotel very friendly staff, location ideal near beech and shops booked in for 5 days decided to stay for an extra 4. Hotel has a very friendly vibe, breakfast fresh fruit great coffee eggs pastries sets you up for the day. Fantastic value.

We stayed here for 5 days and had a great stay. Loved the pineapple juice and cool washcloths upon arrival. Especially loved 24 hour coffee/tea/water access, daily breakfast, and the complimentary use of beach gear. Convenient location. Super easy 5 minute walk to the beach. Close to restaurants and shopping. Would stay again.

you definitely need to lower your expectations when looking for hotels in Waikiki, there are many aging hotels that fall in the 3 star category, they are not as nice as what you would expect on the mainland but they are next to the beautiful hawaiian beach. The Vive has updated rooms and lobby, however the rooms are very small, Bed, Tv, table and small bathroom all fit together in a very tight space. The bathroom vanity is small enough i would hit my elbows on the wall while getting ready in the morning. Breakfast is nice lots of fresh fruit and pineapple juice, some average pastries. The facility does not have self service Ice Machine, or laundry facilities which was a bit of a disappointment.

We stayed for three nights and just loved the amenities! Delicious, complimentary breakfast each morning, friendly and efficient staff, easy valet parking! We do wish the mattresses were more firm. Ours were a bit worn and sagged in the middle. Window AC was loud, so we let the fresh air in via the windows. There were tiny air holes at the bottom. Excellent location so we were able to walk to the St. Augustine church during Lenten Season.

This is a very good choice of staying at Waikiki. My family and I are all satisfied with the short stay. Hope to go back to Hawaii again in the future. Thanks for all the efforts the staff of the Hotel have made.

Great location with excellent service and a desire to help with any request.The air conditioner in the room was noisy but our faces were taken care of and the room was upgraded to a higher level.Breakfast was needed after 2 nights and we had enough of it and stayed there for 5 nights.The hotel's wonderful service covers all the problems and deserves appreciation.

While the rooms are small, they were clean and neat. The staff was very friendly and went out of their way to help. We had a tour arriving before the breakfast bar was open so the desk managed to put some muffins and pastries in a sack for us to take along.

Close to Waikiki Beach and shops. Continental breakfast included and coffee or tea all day. Large flat tv screen. The Concierge desk was attended 24 hours which was helpful. Although the air conditioning worked well it was extremely noisy .

As a senior woman travelling alone, this hotel worked perfectly for me. I stayed in a Cosmopolitan Queen on the 19th floor. I felt very safe and secure. The front desk staff, particularly Alex and Roger, were warm & welcoming, with lots of good advice. The large "living room" in the back of the lobby, was perfect for breakfast, and the provided cold drinks were refreshing when I returned from walks. There are at least five budget Asian restaurants & a liquor store a stone's throw from the front door. Just down the street is a Food Pantry & the Japanese noodle house, Marukame Udon. The beach is close & the hotel provides everything you need to go there. There is a bus stop right outside the hotel where you can catch the #2 into Honolulu and Chinatown. Going the other way towards Diamond Head, #2 stops at Campbell & Monserrat Avenue, a good place to find healthy cafe food. Get an all day pass for the price of a return trip. The concierge was very helpful. The included breakfast offers enough choice for most and the coffee is good! Housekeeping was also good. Book direct with the hotel for a great rate. Be realistic about no pool, outdoor space or balconies. There were happy people from all over the world staying here.

My wife and I spent 5 nights at Vive hotel Waikiki and it was perfect at all levels : 1) the hotel location is great : 1 block only from Waikiki beach 2) the room was clean and the bed confortable , the AC was a bit noisy but you get used to it at some point, 3) potentially one of the main strengths of this hotel : the quality of the service : all the desk agents was very professional and friendly. Bottom line : a good value hotel with great location and service. We will come back.

We enjoyed our stay at Vive. Location is perfect. Lobby is invitable with friendly staff. There is small thing that can be improve is breakfast items need to be different daily.. other then that all good.

Appreciated being immediately checked in to sparkling clean room when arriving unannounced three hours before 3pm check in time. Make sure you get value from the additional compulsory daily "resort fee" by borrowing beach towels etc. Needed earplugs against noisy air-conditioner but they worked. Breakfast eggs over-boiled and not edible. My expectations of famous American hospitality were not met here or anywhere in Honolulu actually. Staff could be more warm. Overall though an attractive efficient hotel and the room was even better and more spacious than photo

We just stayed 4 nights in the 2 bedroom family suite with 2 adults and two teen age girls. Honestly our first impression was is this it and it wasn’t what we had expected. Having settled in and got used to small size you soon realise it has everything you need and will do the job just fine. Having the second bathroom was perfect also with the girls. We had and issue with finding the room only being partially cleaned one day and mentioned it to the front desk in the morning only two have two cleaners there in no time with an apology note and a little gift which was lovely. We couldn’t ask for better service. The thing that really stood out was the staff and how friendly and obliging they were. Nothing was to much trouble and they were always smiling. We have two more nights booked at the Vive on our way back through from Maui and I’m sure the experience will be as good as the first. Oh also the beds were super comfortable.

The staff was courteous and professional. Location was awesome, in the middle of everything. Loved the suites, they have a unique layout with dual restrooms. Front desk staff was so kind to us when we had some issues.

I said 4 nights in the Cosmopolitan Family suite, which has two queen beds and 2 bathrooms. Its was a bit tight in space in the bathrooms, but overall I would stay in this room again. All the staff I encountered were so friendly and accomodating. Especially, Alec?( young caucasian man, wears glass) he heard my toddler throwing a tantrum in the lobby and he came over with a ballon for him to play with. That immediately ended the tantrum and made my little boy so happy amd it was very much appreciated by us. So thank you!As far as location, it a very short walk to the beach and to so many restaurants. Overall, the price I paid for the value I recieved was outstanding. I will not hesitate to stay here again.

This reasonably priced hotel is a couple of blocks from the beach in Waikiki. We stayed for about 8 days and was comfortable. The beds were comfortable, and the room nice and clean. This hotel provides a complimentary breakfast that included melon, strawberries, hard boiled eggs, pineapple, and a small assortment of bread rolls. Juice and water also available. Must say the coffee is one of the best I have had anywhere. The water, juice and coffee were available 24/7 which was nice. Another nice perk was the availability of beach towels, umbrellas and mats for the beach. No need to bring your own towels.  The common living room area on the first floor was a nice way to chill, and read a book provided or a board game.  We stayed on the 14th floor on the mountain side of the building. I included a couple of views we had as we were on a corner room.  Details on the room included a nice queen size bed, a nice TV and other amenities such as bath robes, bottled water (which you had to pay for - not sure what that was all about as there was free water access on the first floor) a small fridge, and a personal use computer pad.  Couple of items that were annoying though was the air conditioner and the lack of an ironing board. For a fairly nice hotel, they have used cheap window air conditioners which were very noisy and the wind blowing around this made the room extremely noisy. I had to shut off the air conditioner at night due to the noise, but nothing I could do about the wind. Just had to live with it. Maybe lower profile air conditioners could be used.  Due to the direction of the trade winds, maybe staying in rooms on the other side would help. The staff was great to deal with, and the housekeeping staff made up the room quite nice daily. We rented a car for several days and used the valet service. For $25.00 a day was a bit high but convenient.  All in all, was a great stay. We totally enjoyed the fact it was a close walk to the beach. Took no more than about 3 minutes.Great choice for the money.

We are having an amazing time staying at the Vive! By far, the best asset is the wonderful staff. Every person we have had contact with have been genuinely friendly and helpful. We are welcomed home every time we step in the door. The location is great! We are close to either where we want to be, or transportation to get us farther out. We are enjoying the breakfast, and love the infused water available all day! The whole hotel is very clean and maintained well. Staying here on our honeymoon was a wonderful choice for us, and we will hopefully return for anniversaries in the future!

I just stayed at The Vive Hotel and was very happy with my stay. The staff are great, from the moment I arrived and through out my stay, they were so friendly and accommodating. Amy, Alex and Rodger at the front desk checked me in, offered me a refreshing glass of pineapple juice, cold wet towel and information on the hotel and the area and gave me good recommendations of the local restaurants.The Car Valets were right there in the morning when I showed up and never had to wait more then four minutes to get my car in the morning to go out and explore Oahu and the same when I came back in the afternoon to return the car. The room was clean bight and cozy, the mattress was comfortable and the bathroom was clean and updated. You had everything you needed from bathroom amenities to Flat screen TV, Mini Fridge, In room safe and nice bath linens.The location is fantastic, close to restaurants shops and the beach. When travel takes me back to Oahu I will be going back to The Vive Hotel.  Thank you for making my stay really great!BDN777

Good hotel. Great location. Great staff. Aircon was loud though. That's the main reason it doesn't get 5 stars. Really old outdated aircon too. But the shower was huge and the bed was comfy and I had the ocean view room. Price was what it was cause of the location. Staff were excellent, cannot stress that enough.

Staff at Vive hotel very friendly and helpful which made our stay very pleasant. Continental breakfast was a good start to the day, good variety of fresh fruits and baked goods. We upgraded from a queen size room to a junior suite which was very spacious. Overall we were happy with the service provided.

Biggest draw of the hotel for me was how modern it looked. The lobby was very clean and sleek and most of the interactions for service can be done with a tablet that every room gets. The tablet also had a nice personalized message to whoever is in the room. The staff was very helpful and gives you a cold towel and pineapple juice when you enter. They also provide beach towels, mats, chairs. and umbrellas to all guests. Other nice things about the hotel, they had water, fruit infused water, and coffee available around the clock, which was nice. The deluxe continental breakfast was pretty good, lots of fruits, some cinnamon rolls, and eggs. It could use a little more protein, especially if you have a big day of adventure ahead. Special shout out to Roger/Peter (I thought I heard Peter at first but his name tag said Roger) for being very helpful during check in and check out. One neutral point: The elevator is used for all guests as well as employees. The employees will wait for the next empty elevator to not bother you, but it does cause a little congestion with the elevators and these elevators were a bit slow already as there are only 2 of them for 20ish floors. Nothing horrible or anything, and it does give you a chance to get some water.The only negative point: In the morning, I was usually woken up by honking of cars or the backing up of trucks. Unfortunately the street across from the hotel was being worked on during my stay, and it was rather annoying. Luckily the pillows were thick enough to block the sound, and its not the hotel's fault that road needed to be worked on. I do think this was more of a problem for rooms that face the ocean. I was 19 floors up however, so I imagine the problem is exacerbated on the lower floors.Despite that, this stay was still a 5/5 for me.

Alex was great from check-in to check-out. Very friendly and personable. The rest of the staff were also very nice and friendly each day. We even got a personalized concierge recommendation for some LGBT locations.

Great value for money. Friendly staff always able to answer questions. Concierge only there until 2pm but can book your tours ans activities. Free breakfast consists of pineapple, cantaloupe, mini croissants and toast. Bus stop out front takes you to Ala Moana s/c. Beach is only 2 blocks away.

I was delighted to introduce my sister and brother in law to The Vive hotel As before the service , help at reception, concierge service was excellent. My room was comfortable the breakfast was delicious and plentiful and if I come back to Hawaii you will see me again for sure!!

Wonderful hotel! KC the consierge is the best! The location was very good! The breakfast was good ...and it was included! I loved the fact that we received pine apple juice when we checked in! Love the Vive!

We booked their cheapest, smallest room so I feel bad judging them on this. The staff was amazing! It was our first visit to Hawaii and we had lots of questions which were answered quickly, politely, and thoroughly.Our only complaint was the time the housekeeping service chose for our room, usually around 4:30pm when we would tend to come back from the beach and shower before dinner, or retire early after a long day of hiking.

Very pleasant stay overall. Staff were all friendly and the place is always kept clean. There were abundant supply of beach gear everyday and everyone is always responsive. Must give a special note about ERWIN from parking and KASI at the booking desk. Kasi was super helpful and Erwin made special effort in getting to know the names of guests and greeted us every time we got our car. He would open doors and trunk for us accordingly base on what he observes. You can definitely feel his passion for creating a welcoming experience for the guests. Some staff can smile more but they were never rude and always had good manners. We enjoyed our stay and would have no problem in coming back and recommending to our friends.

We stayed at this hotel April 2019. Clean rooms, pleasant staff, very responsive and great location: walks to heart of Waikiki but not too close that it's crowded and loud. Got lots of great eats close by as well all walking distance. Must mention ERWIN from valet parking, always a pleasant smile and makes an effort to learn your name and greet us every time we dropped off/picked up our car. Made our stay that much more enjoyable! KASI from the booking desk was also super helpful in sorting out our activities for us. Services were top notch, a few staff can benefit from smiling more but they were always polite. We also enjoyed the continental Breakfast which provides daily from 7-11am. Some people complained about the quality, but we have no complain.

We have appreciated that the hôtel provides beach chairs, transat, sunbrella, boards to go to the beach. It was a plus ! The hôtel is great, not far from the beach and restaurants. The rooms are small and clean. The AC is noisy.

This was the second time I’ve stayed in this hotel. I love the decor, it’s location is excellent, and the young staff members are so friendly and helpful. I love being greeted at check in, with a cool drink and cold towels.

This hotel is centrally located in Waikiki and close to the beachfront, zoo, aquarium, Diamond Head Monument and several other locations. We were able to walk to most and ideally is a 5 minute walk to Waikiki Beach. All is great – breakfast, service, concierge, and they offer beach towels, chairs and other beach articles. The rooms were clean and sized Ok for a couple. They even offer a tablet in the room. Our concierge helped us with booking a few tours and a shuttle to the cruise port for our departure. So this is not the Hilton – nor are we paying such a price. We were pleased with all and would find it hard to complain of any inconveniences. For their service and, we would surely return on a future trip. Great job by all the staff and management… Thanks again.

Stayed here for 9 nights. Location was perfect, under 5 minutes to the beach. Beach mats and towels available to borrow was great. Room was a bit small but didn't matter. Breakfast was basic but sufficient. Daisy in particular at reception was extremely helpful. Would stay again

Amazing staff. Excellent location in the middle of everything. Room was spacious and clean. Atmosphere was nice. Has this unbelievable blueberry bread for breakfast and pineapple juice. This hotel by far is PHENOMENAL

Great Location-3 blocks to beach, excellent hotel guest services-staff are pleasant, professional, engaging, and remember your name! The breakfast is fresh and delicious. The rooms are tight so when I had a friend join me last minute, I upgraded as 220 sq. Feet would have left me feeling cramped. Solo or a couple it would suffice. Every staff I encountered was pleasant and seemed happy to be there which keeps you in vacation mode a lot longer! Roger, Amy, Casey, and the breakfast ladies were stellar. Hotel location was safe, lobby large and inviting. Great value!

I was searching around and hesitant on where to stay in Waikiki, read the reviews and finally decided to go for Vive. I was very pleased I selected the hotel, very good location, welcoming staff and had what I needed. It is a 5min walk to the beach, 4min to the departure point of most tours, had a good vibe, perfect for my budget. Ok, no views (at least from my room but it was ok since the beach was easy to reach. There are chairs, moreys, towels and others to take with you for a day at the beach. Breakfast is ok, nothing extraordinary but you won't starve. I wish the bft started a bit earlier so one will have time to eat something prior to go for the morning tours.I enjoyed the hotel, it was clean, very well located, handy, modern decorated and friendly staff. I wouldn't hesitate to go for the same hotel if I ever back at Hawaii

The staff is friendly and very informed. The rooms are clean and 2 blocks from beach. Food is close. Great place to stay. They have towels and devices for the ocean. McDonald burger king and local foods close as well.

Location is a perfect balance between the beach and the strip while still staying relatively quiet. Service is extremely friendly and helpful (cleaning, valet, front desk), the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was nice enough. Only thing I wasn’t extremely happy with was the breakfast selection (mostly bread and fruit)

This hotel is a real gem because it's fairly priced, conveniently located and comfortably designed. I have stayed here twice and I will definitely return with my family. I recommend this place to all of my friends when they visit Honolulu.

Really nice hotel: great value compared to other options. Modern, nice size rooms, some good views; friendly staff. The only issue is despite calls I couldn't get housecleaning to clean my room when I was gone.

My husband and I were a little concerned as we found the room at a very good rate. Generally, the hotels in Waikiki are rather old and we understand there is only so much that can be done to old buildings working on rates like the one we got, but we were amazed! The lobby and room was very clean, service was attentive and friendly, the breakfast was a nice touch as well as the all day coffee. The only reason I couldn't give 5 stars is because the room was a little small, air conditioner was noisy and there was a window at the end of the hall next to our room with a layer of dust so think, someone wrote their name in it and it was there when we checked in and again when we checked out (#1403). I would think that if there was maid service before we checked in, someone would have noticed it as it's at eye level when you walk down the hall.We were there to celebrate my husbands birthday and we had dinner at Hy's next door. I loved that it was a convenient spot and if needed, there is a crosswalk right outside the front door so you don't have to go too far out of your way to get to the beach. Loved that you offer beach amenities too!

We booked our stay for 10 days and really enjoyed it. Our room was small, but fit the purpose of 2 people comfortably. The staff are friendly and helpful. They offer beach mats, umbrellas and towels to borrow while you are down at the beach and we thought this was an amazing service that not many hotels offered. The only let down was the included buffet breakfast, there isn't much to choose from and they don't cater for dairy free tummys. On our last day, our window started to leak (unforseen issue) so our last nights stay was upgraded to an ocean view suite. They were extremely accommodating and apologised profusely for the interruption to our stay. We would recommend staying in this hotel!Faboulous stay.Sincerely, Happy Aussie

The location was very convenient just a few minutes to the beach, restaurants, etc. Value was great as well compared to some of the very expensive Waikiki hotels. Rooms were a bit small but space is a premium in Waikiki so I can understand. Solid breakfast, towels, beach mats, etc. provided.

This was our 3rd stay. Vive feels very upscale and hip but is so reasonable. The staff is friendly and helpful. The neighborhood offers everything you need. Even if I had money to throw around, I’d probably still stay at Vive.

Room 1207, I think water leaks out of the tap handles, my fiancé’s toiletries bag kept getting soaked when we left it in the back right corner of the counter,The bathroom counter was dirty when we arrived and wasn’t cleaned once by cleaning staff during our stay.In the bathroom the edges of the tiles along the walls have drywall dust on them from when the suite was last renovated , which means those spots have never been cleaned since the room’s renovation, But everything else that the cleaning crew was doing was greatValet was great because we had a Jeep and the only place to put jeeps is close to the entrance of valetEvery time we brought a concern or question to hotel staff they answered well and knowledgeably, or they did whatever they could to repair the problem or meet our needs right away which was great. The first night the air conditioner didn’t work at all and maintenance came and pulled and serviced the equipment for us 10 min after we called the next day.The deluxe continental was a little misleading as well, the food was good, but the pineapple was always sour like it came from the philipenes and not Hawai’i, and the watermelon in the picture online in comparison with the continental is not very accurate. But the fruit infused water was wonderfulTo sum it up, we loved the hotel staff, and the little things that vive does for their guests to make they stay just a little more special, but the website leaves you with some high expectations that aren’t totally met, and the cleaning was not on par for a hotel.

We will start off with the Good.#1 We really liked the layout of the Family Suite. 2 seperate areas with Queen size bed,desk, TV, mini-refrigerator, air-coniditioner, closet, and bathroom in each area (seperated by a wall).#2 No resort fee, when Reservations were made directly through the Hotel#3 $25/night Parking Fee (Actually just okay because other places charge a lot more but there could be places that don't charge anything and we just didn't see them).#4 Free (or at least not a seperate charge) for Breakfast which was a Continental Style Breakfast.Now the Not so good:#1 Air-conditioners (actually this borders on horrible). They are WAY TOO LOUD!! We had a rough time sleeping the first night and just turned them off the second night. Thankfully it wasn't hot to make sleeping uncomfortable but it did get warm.#2 The beds. Hard to say what exactly was wrong with them but they weren't comfortable. They seemed to have hills and valleys or slanting to them.Upon arrival we were greeted warmly/friendly. The Check-in process was quick. The Valet Service person was very friendly and helpful. The only thing was it took a long time to show up so we finally called the Front Desk then he arrived with our luggage. He was very helpful recommending a place for late night ice cream and places to visit. We had a problem with one of the phones in the room and the Maintenance person responded quickly and fixed the issue. The person at the Continental Breakfast was not particularly friendly but we were there for a short time and didn't interact much with her although the question we asked about nuts was answered quickly. All but one of the persons at the Valet Service were super friendly and helpful. The other one.....not so much. When we went to check-out we were asked how our stay was and we informed them of the beds and the air-conditioner and they said they were sorry and would have a Maintenance person look at it and I told them I had seen another review of the air-conditioner being loud and they were told they were going to be fixed but it appears they weren't. What would have been a better solution was to discount our room since our sleep was not good due to the beds and mostly the air-conditioners. There are many places to stay on Oahu and unless these items are corrected, why should we stay here again. There were the things we liked but the things we didn't like overcome those things and make staying here again, hard to do.

We were so pleased that our initial reservation could be exchanged for a more appropriate room when our family plans changed 2 hours before our flight to Oahu. Not only was our request accommodated, but we were upgraded to an ocean view for the week. We especially loved the birthday surprise that was waiting for us the next day when we returned from the beach, and we are already missing the blueberry bread and the fresh pineapple and mangos each morning.

Staying at the hotel was alright. This was my second extended business trip and the first time experiencing bad service from the valet guy. Aside from the first valet person being rude, another valet guy scrapped the bottom part of my rental car. While waiting on the second floor for the car, I heard the scrape. When the car was brought up, I asked the guy if everything was okay and he simply responded with "oh that's just the bottom of the car." Because of the 2 valet incidents, my stay this time gets a 3/5.

This was our seventh stay at The Vive Hotel and it never disappoints. We travel from Australia every year to stay there. Join their mailing list and you will receive any deals that are being offered. The last deal we took advantage of was 30% off the Junior Suite and if you book directly from their web site you won't need to pay the amenities fee. There is a bus stop at the front door and the hotel provides information on bus routes and fees. Waikiki beach is a short three minute stroll away and the hotel is close to shopping, cafes and restaurants without being situated on the busier streets.Daisy, on reception always remembers us, as does the lovely Filipino lady who prepares breakfast. The Vive is truly a hidden gem.

I stayed at Vive Hotel for the fourth time and had as great a time as usual. Upon check-in I was greeted with a cold glass of pineapple juice, and upon getting into my room with a nice set of complimentary snacks. The hotel is centrally located, just a few steps from the beach as well as local shops, restaurants, and attractions. The rooms are fairly small, however, they are clean and equipped with everything you need. Complimentary breakfast with plenty of choices is served each morning, and beach towels, boogie boards, umbrellas, etc. are offered free of charge. Daisy, Roger, and the rest of the staff are very friendly and helpful no matter the customer request. I will definitely return the next time I am in Waikiki.

I stayed at Vive for a week in mid March and KC at the concierge desk helped me out with booking a tour. When I got back from the tour I needed some additional assistance and KC was more than happy to help me out and resolved the matter quickly. Thanks KC! I would definitely stay here again.

We loved our stay at Vive!! Whilst not a 5star resort, we received 5star friendly approachable staff. Breakfast daily was excellent and a great reasoning atmosphere. A big shout out to KC on concierge, helping us with all our extra plans!! We got early check too, fresh cold towell and juice on arrival with a guenine caring approach to us for the whole week we spent there....we highly recommend Vive Hotel.

I enjoyed my stay there with my girlfriend. The staff were nice and very helpful when asking questions about the best way to get to places. We were lucky enough to be able to check in early around 11am which was awesome. We liked the location and our room. Breakfast selection could use some work but it was good enough.

Stayed 4 nights with a wonderful experience. Definitely will come back again! Room is quite small. The location is very good, with everything nearby. The breakfast buffet is just OK. The coffee at any time is very nice and greatly appreciated!

As a solo traveller, was really happy with my motel choice! Location is great, 2 short blocks to Waikiki Beach, and surrounded by great bars, restaurants and shopping centres. Exceptional Service! My flight came in early, I arrived exhausted knowing they’d hold my luggage till check in time, but was checked in straight away as they had a room available. All staff were super friendly and more than happy to help with everything from beach towels and chairs to booking shuttle buses and giving directions. Room was very clean and had a super comfortable bed. Really affordable and had everything I needed. Continental breakfast was also great! And they have an awesome gift shop.

My husband and I spent the weekend here before meeting friends on an extended stay. Although the building appears older and dated, they did an exceptional job with updates and amenities. Close to beach, restaurants and shopping. They offer beachchairs,towels, beach mats and umbrellas. They have great mini tablet devices offering lots of information. Daisy was fabulous to help facilitate an early check in. We had been travelling for quite some time. We feel it was a great buy for this modernized boutique hotel. Would recommend!

I was frustrated with the name brand hotels charging as much as they do, when I stumbled across Vive. We only needed one night before heading on to Kauai. Our room had a beautiful ocean and Diamond Head view, on 20th floor. Spacious with nice toiletries and linens. Hotel is fairly quiet although A/C is a bit noisy. The price difference was minimal for the view. The hotel is off the main drag but a super quick walk to the beach, shops and restaurants. They have valet parking which is $25 per day but very convenient if you have a car. Buffet breakfast was adequate with lots of fruit and bread items. I liked the addition of hard boiled eggs. Coffee is available 24/7 which is great if you wake up on “ mainland time” and need your coffee at 4 am!My only complaint was check in person questioned our reservation being for two but our two adult children were with us. I was a bit taken aback, as they live on Oahu and were just coming to be with us for a few hours. If you get the room on a AAAdiscount make sure you bring the card, as I did last minute. I felt like the front desk person was skeptical of us even though we were perfectly normal guests.Perhaps they’ve had bad experiences with other guests . For longer stays it’s nice they include beach equipment and towels. The only reason for the 4 stars is due to “ not the warmest” reception and only an adequate breakfast buffet. Perhaps adding another protein, such as yogurt, would round out the buffet nicely.

The location is close enough to Waikiki Beach and the main tourist attractions, but not too close to all the noise and heavy traffic making it ideal for us. All the major public buses stop in front of the hotel making traveling easy without a taxi. The breakfast was excellent complete with coffee, tea, juice, fresh fruits, pastries and boiled eggs. This ensured we started our day with energy and didn't have to search out for good food. The bedding was very comfortable with modern and clean rooms. My only point for improvement was that our washroom didn't have an exhaust fan so it got humid quickly after showers.

The Hotel is conveniently located to the Beach, Shops and Restaurants. The Staff were very friendly, professional and attentive. The Continental Breakfast was excellent and our Room was very clean and comfortable, an excellent Hotel.

The walls might a little thin, the rooms small, and the mattress and pillows a bit lumpy, BUT as far as value goes in this Waikiki location only 2 blocks away from the Duke statue on the beach and in the absolute heart of the action, this hotel is unbeatable!

Great location, close to beach, bus stop less than 1 minute walk , good breakfast. Friendly staff, Preston at the front desk is so nice, pleasant, approachable, friendly and helpful. The guest room and bath room are small.Overall we enjoyed the stay at Vive Hotel Waikiki.

The hotel was very nice, clean, and has good character to it. Everyone was nice and friendly, made our stay very comfortable.Liked the breakfast they serve every morning. We would like to stay there again in near futures.

We had a great time celebrating our honeymoon in Hawaii. My husband and I think that the hotel was everything we could’ve asked for. We loved the staff, the breakfast, and the rooms were great for what they were. Initially we thought our room was small, however, we spent so little time there - so it was ideal. We loved being able to rent equipment, and take our car as we pleased.

I had previously stayed at the Vive so thought I would return. This year I had a Jr. suite and I was disappointed with the room it was large enough but scantily furnished didn't have a dresser had a institutional feel to it and the mattress on the king bed was very soft and not comfortable. The smaller rooms are a better value.

Nice room, it is small but very clean and neat. It is near to the beach. Good service, friendly staffs, near by restaurants, mini market, stores and walking distance to bus stop . Great welcome drink.

The lobby is spacious and well-appointed. We loved the fresh-fruit-infused water decanters always available in the lobby - delicious! It was very nice to have the continental breakfast available each morning. There are beach towels, beach mats, umbrellas available in the lobby for the short walk to the beach. There are tons of restaurants of every kind within walking distance.  We really appreciated the “hospitality room”, which we reserved from 5-6pm on the day that we checked out. This allowed us to shower and re-pack our bags for our flight that evening, even though we had already officially checked out at noon.  As others have stated, the rooms were rather tight, but still comfortable. It would have been nice to have a couple of drawers and hooks, though. All in all, a great place to stay!

Vive Hotel is home away from home. Great Place, location and especially great employee's. This wasthe 9 years in a row that we stayed at The Vive. We Love It! It's a wonderful location only 2 blocks from the beach right in the middle of Waikiki and all of it's activities. Will return again for another extended vacation here.

If you are taller than 5ft, you might want to rethink staying in this hotel! The room closet had no room for two suitcases. No coffee maker in room. Free breakfast was only fruit and hard boiled eggs. No milk for coffee! Oh, and $25 dollars per night to park your car! Beware!

Rooms VERY small, very noisy, lots of traffic noise, old dirty windows, horrible AC unit. I was up several times throughout the night trying to get it to workBreakfast OK, coffee not as fresh as it could be, also would like to supply an option for fat free milk

My stay at the Vive Hotel Waikiki was, overall, quite a pleasant experience. Upon arrival, the front desk staff was incredibly warm and welcoming. He explained the check-in process thoroughly and also provided me with a map of the area and a list of events taking place around town. The cold glass of pineapple juice was also a nice touch. I've seen some reviews on here complaining about the amenity fees but let me tell you, the $12 daily charge at Vive is incredibly affordable compared to most hotels in Honolulu and they were certainly up front with me about them. Also, if you really hate the amenity fees that much, book your room on their site directly and they'll waive the fees. Problem solved. Pro tip: I recommend doing your research on the place you plan to stay so that various fees won't catch you off guard.My room was satisfactory in size. I had the Cosmopolitan Queen and I found the bed to be quite comfortable. While it is true that the A/C unit could be a lot quieter, I didn't have an issue falling asleep. However, more sensitive/light sleepers might have a problem with this. There is also a lot of street noise when staying at the Vive but I have a newsflash for you all; you're staying in Waikiki! It is essentially the party town of Hawaii and yeah, it's an up-all-night area so you can expect to hear people having a good time outside, buses coming and going, and the occasional homeless person screaming for no reason. It comes with the territory. Again, however, I didn't have a problem sleeping with the window shut but the more sensitive sleepers may have an issue. If you're sensitive to noise, then get a hotel on the outskirts of Waikiki. The only problem I had with my room was in the bathroom. They really need a vent/fan system in the bathroom and the shower head in my room would spray everywhere, including over the curtain, when in use. I had to use a towel to mop up the water on the floor. The rooms have an info card in them that state the room will only be cleaned if you request it as an economical measure. Again, I like this style. The room comes with a tablet that you can use for various things such as ordering room-service (the Vive apparently has a system where restaurants in the area can delivery to the hotel for you), as well as request more towels, toiletries, etc. The tablet is where you also schedule your room to be cleaned. I love this because I hate coming back from exploring and finding my room in use by the the cleaning staff. The tablet let me set the time I knew I'd be away and by the time I got back, the room was in order. The location is more than ideal. You can walk to the beach in less than five minutes! Part of that $12 amenity fee goes towards the breakfast provided every morning, as well as free use of beach towels, body boards, beach chairs, etc. I found that service to be incredibly useful and it really made it so that my girlfriend and I didn't have to worry about packing those items thus taking up more space. Now about that breakfast, it's not a five-star hotel people so stop expecting as much. The Vive does provide a fine selection of fruits and breads, as well as ham, turkey and hard boiled eggs. You can get water, coffee and pineapple juice to drink. For me, it worked out just fine because I prefer lighter breakfasts. I would definitely recommend the Vive, except for some of your more high-maintenance types, and I would most certainly stay at the Vive again in the future if I'm looking to stay in Waikiki.

We booked the Oceanview Queen, 21st floor (I think ..it was one below the very top), partial oceanview. As many have mentioned, this room is small - but it was the perfect home-base to come back to after full days of gallivanting in and in between islands. The location is PRIME! It was close to everything -- in walking distance to the beach and a welcome perk after nights (or days) of mai-tais and the like! The staff was awesome - friendly, accomodating - They have a bin full of mats, umbrellas and chairs for guests to use. The continental breakfast offered much more than just rolls and coffee. The lobby was cozy and inviting - lots of seating, boardgames, books.

The hotel is close to waikiki beach and everything is only a short walk away. The hotel is inviting the rooms are decent but it looked like they were under going renovations at the time we stayed. They have board games downstairs and tea/coffee as well 24/7.

Great hotel. Excellent location close to beach restaurants and shopping. Complimentary breakfast was amazing with fresh fruits. Hotel provides chairs towel umbrellas and body boards for the beach. Staff was extremely helpful. Great price for this hotel.

This is a great hotel central to everything you need. A short walk from Waikiki Beach, tons of stores and restaurants. Bus stop right by the entrance to the hotel. Very well kept with very nice staff. Was nice to have the continental breakfast daily. Saves you some money even if you eat out a few mornings to change it up some. They provide a nice water station to fill your water bottles a long with everything you could need to take to the beach with you. We rented a car. Parking daily was very smooth. My only suggestion to anyone staying here would be to take ear plugs to sleep. It is on the Main Street which is very noisy ALL hours of the day. We were on the 15th floor and could still hear it as if we were right on the street. Over all a great stay.

Vive is two blocks from Waikiki Beach. The staff are all friendly and helpful. The price is a great value for all the amenities. They include a good breakfast with fresh fruit, bakery, etc. This was our second stay.

Smaller than your average hotel room, but very cozy and charming. Had an ocean view room (beware of the street noise if you like to sleep with the window cracked). Perfect place for those having to stay in Waikiki (was in town for a work conference) and want to be away from the crowds and humongous chain hotels. Extremely walkable location. Breakfast, 24/7 water/tea/coffee station, beach gear were great and all the amenities we really needed. Appreciated the friendly and wonderful hotel staff. Would definitely staff here again!

Great location! The room was everything we expected; well kept and clean. The desk and concierge staff were beyond helpful. Anything we requested, they had. Anything we wanted to do or plan, they helped us with or booked it for us. They knew all of the best restaurants, from expensive to on the cheap; even the places to avoid! They kept our bags for us and let us use the amenities even after we checked out and had five hours to kill until our flight. A five star rating is not high enough! Fantastic customer service!

Enjoyed my stay at this boutique hotel. All the staff are super helpful and pleasant. Free breakfast is attended to expertly with abundant fruits, local breads/rolls and hard boiled eggs. They provide a robe in the room which was very nice. The room was small, maybe too small for two people but this is to be expected here I think. I was also a little surprised by the window AC unit but it actually worked well and was not too noisy like some hotel AC units can be. Also had a pretty decent view. My room did not have a lanai but on each floor at the end of the hall they do have an open area you can enjoy. I would stay here again for sure. Also there are some yummy local hole in the wall places to eat right outside the front door.

I was very pleased with my stay at Vive. Our room was small but completely adequate with a nice bathroom. Everything was very clean and well-maintained. The spacious and comfortable lobby provided extra "space" to eat, relax, visit, or whatever. Staff was pleasant and helpful at all times. Our concierge, KC, provided excellent advice regarding activities and efficiently made all arrangements. I would stay at Vive again without hesitation. I am a very satisfied customer!

Loved this hotel. Great value for money, great location, great breakfast, great staff and a great room!Would totally recommend this hotel and would happily stay here again. KC, the concierge, was awesome a job well done.

Had a great stay. I highly recommend to anyone.oved the amenities that they aooceeed. Staff was very helpful and I would stay again for sure. The location was perfect being in walking distance to downtown.

Rooms were small as others noted, but we weren't in Hawaii to stay in the hotel all day. Things were modern and they had a tablet to request services and amenities. Location was very convenient for access to the beach and they had towels and other beach supplies available at the front desk. We weren't expecting much for the price, but overall the trip was very pleasant.

Great Boutique hotel and very close walking distance to Waikiki beach. 100% tick to the staff there, very especially Daisy and Preston. Both went out of their way to help us out and nothing was too hard. But all staff including the house staff were excellent. Couldn't fault them at all :)Great having the facility for tea, coffee, fruit infused water, herbal teas available 24/7.One recommendation would be a slightly more variety for Breakfast maybe some cereals and fresh milk

Centrally located to things we wanted to do. We paid for an upgrade to our room with a view. This is what got them 2 stars for value. I literally had to stick my head out the window to see Diamondhead and you could only see just a very small part of it between buildings. The room is small with only a window air conditioner. Not a deal breaker for us since we were really only there to sleep and shower, so we didn’t need a huge room.

It was a perfect stay, from the beginning to the end. Front Desk was great, Valets were great, Housekeeping/Room Service (even though I drove them crazy going to the 6th Floor sometimes) were great. The Breakfasts were wonderful -- great selection of fruit especially and the coffee was First Class. We will stay with Vive again next time. (our stay - 27 Feb to 12 March)(

Excellent customer service, great fresh breakfast, very clean and well run. Loved the free beach towels, mats and chairs to use during our stay and valet parking available. Modern, chic and fun vibe! Fresh fruit infused water and coffee available all day. Very impressed for the cost and location. We were able to walk down to the beach and good restaurants and shopping all super close by. Only minor thing was our standard room was quite small but all you need a room for is to sleep comfortably and get cleaned up each day so it still served its purpose well.

First time staying at this hotel. The front desk staff are great, offering a welcome drink and cool towel on arrival. They were able to arrange an early check in to our room we appreciated! Knowing it was our wedding trip, they had a cute arrangement of towels folded into heart shaped swans, with a box of chocolates on our bed. There was a really nice view to the ocean and diamond head from the lanai outside our door. We were given a high level 17 room, which had nice views to the mountains and diamond head. The only negative as other guests have mentioned is that the room is tiny. Not a huge amount of space around your bed, but we still managed to find space to lay out our big suitcases. We only stayed a couple nights and mostly out all day to return to sleep, so it was sufficient for us. And it was clean and neat. They have 24 hour tea/coffee in the lobby with included breakfasts each day. There is fresh fruit available for the gluten-free eaters. The hotel is a few minutes easy walk straight down to the Dukes statue on the beach. If you are catching buses, there is a bus stop not far from the hotel door which is handy. Trolley stop just the next block down. All in all, the only negative was the size of the room, with no in-room facilities such as tea/coffee maker. But with all the cafes/restaurants at your door step, it’s not a huge deal if you are happy to eat out. If you would prefer to be able to cook some of your own meals in, (with Food Panty a minutes walk away to buy groceries) then I would recommend you stay elsewhere.

My family and I stayed at Vive Hotel and it was a perfect experience central located to the beach front, local shops, and attractions! The rooms at fairly small however that didn’t mind ya much because being in Hawaii you will be outside primarily throughout the day. They also give you boogie boards, beach umbrellas, and towels free of charge!! Which I thought was unbelievable. They breakfast was very tasteful as well and you have many choices to chose from. I would highly recommend staying here!!!

I had a great experience at this property. I was there for 8 nights and, since the rooms are small and there wasn't enough space to put al my clothing away, I upgraded to one of their PH suites and it was gorgeous. Daniel, the manager, was amazing at accommodating my needs, as was Preston who helped me the second day, in coordinating my change. The have free breakfast but, my favorite part was that they had fresh coffee 24/7. I was jet lagged for much of my time there so, the coffee (which was delicious) was incredible. I loved the PH Musician suite - it was clean, nicely decorated, big bathroom, nice balcony with a partial ocean view, and even had a heated toilet! Bed was comfortable...all was great. And, another great thing is that they have a very low resort fee. If you don't need to stay on the beach and looking for an affordable, nicely decorated boutique hotel in Waikiki, which is almost impossible, I recommend Vive!

Nice hotel. Well located. Very pleasant and helpful staff. Rooms are small but large enough for a stay. Bed was way too soft for our backs. Parking fee was rather steep at $25/ night. Hotel provided beach towels, chairs, mats and umbrellas - very nice! Generous cold breakfast buffet. All together, a happy place to stay in Waikiki!

Rooms clean comfortable.Nice breakfast. Walking distance to everything.KC was excellent in booking all of our outings,helping with all our needs!Wonderful Staff! Price very affordable! 5stars Will recommend!

We had a late flight but still wanted to go to the beach after check out. We were able to use the Hospitality room for an hour in the evening to get showered and cleaned up before heading to the airport.

My husband and I stayed here for a week for our honeymoon. The staff were awesome and we got a great price for our stay. The breakfast was good each day with fresh fruit and different pastries and bread. The hotel is walking distance to the beach and they provide all kinds of items for free with your stay. (Beach towels, chairs, beach mats etc). I highly recommend this hotel for Waikiki. Also make sure to go to Ice Cream Rolls which is just next door. Amazing ice cream! I would defiantly stay here again. They were very accommodating and the hotel is very clean.

Staff was friendly. breakfast was fresh. accessible room well thought out.. View of the ocean slightly but walking distance to the beach.I appreciated the window blinds with tall buildings on all sides.

We would definitely stay again! Celebrating our Anniversary we upgraded to the Junior Suite, it is a must (we were on the 20th floor gorgeous views), very comfortable, lots of room to move around and store shopping. Rooms include Continental Buffet Breakfast - fruit was definitely fresh but not very sweet otherwise great selection of breads, croissants and pastries. All day coffee/tea and tropical fruits in iced water (microwave/toasters etc) in a lovely lounge area. Lounge area was perfect for reading a book, coffee, Wifi catch up and chat with other travellers. There is no pool but only 1min to the beach for a daily swim. Service: Percius service at check-in and duration was outstanding (remembered our names) and Porter was extremely helpful with taxi's and Uber. Room was lovely and clean 'daily' thank you, ladies. Overall all the staff were fantastic! Loved our stay thank you Vive Hotel Waikiki!

We had an amazing time in Hawaii, and Vive was amazing!The room was good, clean, had a pretty good view over the ocean, and was only about a 3 minute walk from the beach. There were always beach mats, towels, beach chairs, and umbrellas.The breakfast was awesome. Good pastries, tons of fruit. The coffee is the best hotel coffee I've ever had - and I travel for work often enough for that to mean something :P

After lots of research I settled on the Vive Hotel for our week's stay on Oahu.Tip: Book directly with the hotel and sign up for their rewards program. You will not be charged the daily amenity fee and parking will be half price. That's about $25 a day saved there! They only offer valet parking and the height of the garage is only 6 feet so if you have a high SUV or van, be warned. We found this out with our rental van, thankfully the rental company had a lower van we could use.The hotel is in a great location, just 3 blocks from Waikiki Beach. Everything you need is close by.The hotel offers free wi-fi, a free continental breakfast with pineapple juice, filtered water, tea, coffee, assorted fruits, cold cuts, boiled eggs, and assorted breads & buns. The lobby/eating area is large but with few tables and chairs that are suited to eating - most are couches with side tables so you have to eat hunched over.The lobby had a cute library and lots of board games you could borrow, there was a small gift shop too.The hotel is wheelchair accessible but has steps to the lobby - to enter you need to walk around the side of the building where there is a ramp into the back of the lobby. Not far to go.We had a wheelchair accessible room which is a corner room with a seating area, king sized bed, desk, safe, robes (slippers on request), 2 air conditioning units and a wheelchair accessible bathroom with wheel in shower. There are few wall shelves in the bathroom but there was a standing basket type shelf so there was plenty of space to store your toiletries.The closet in the room was big and the bed had 2 huge drawers under it, lots of room for your stuff.The bed was very comfortable with feather pillows which I like.We were on the 9th floor and there was a lot of noise from the street. I don't believe the windows have any sound proofing at all, since we could hear all the traffic noise and even a child crying at one point! Being from a cold climate I am used to double paned windows that keep out the noise, but there were just single paned windows. At night the noise of the air conditioning acted as white noise and kept most of the street noise from bothering us (except at 5:20 am when I could hear trucks beeping as they backed up, and there was some construction on our street which started very early).There's no pool, no spa, no courtyard, no gym, so I guess that's why this hotel is priced cheaper than other hotels in the area. But we weren't looking for any of these amenities so the hotel suited us just fine.The hotel will lend you beach chairs, umbrellas, beach mats and towels free of charge. Wonderful! We took advantage of that for an afternoon at the beach.I wasn't quite sure of the function of the tablets, most anything we wanted to know we looked up on our phones or computer, maybe not everyone travels with that but I would think this day and age they do. Sometimes it would be off and since that is the only clock in the room, it was a hassle to try and get it to come back on.Employees were very friendly and helpful and I would definitely stay here again.

We only stayed there for 2 nights but we had a great time. the staff is super nice and helpful and they have a spare room that they will provide for guests that have a late flight. this way you can still enjoy the beach or go hiking and freshen up before you head to the airport. the breakfast was also pretty nice and free.

We stayed at Vive for our honeymoon this past week. We loved it! When we walked into our room, we were surprised with towels folded into swans and the best Hawaiian chocolate for our honeymoon. The people are so sweet and accommodating. I saw a lot of mediocre reviews about the breakfast, I actually thought it was a good amount of food. Just fruit and bread but I really loved the variety of those items. They always had coffee and fruit water available, they gave us an hour stay in the hospitality room, and held our bags from checkout until we left. The only negative we had was the construction (not terribly noisy but kind of in the way of our walk down to the beach). Thank you Vive for a great stay!

Staying at Vive was an amazing experience for us. The room was immaculate everyday, housekeeping did a sensational job, the bed was super comfortable, the air conditioning was a little loud but it was great to have it, the street noise was minimal, KC the concierge was super helpful and supportive, we wouldn’t have been able to work out the bus or trolley without the help of KC, Breakfast was great, the bread was delicious, the fruit was fresh and yum, the fruit infused water available all day was delightful, tea and coffee available all day was super convenient, the location was perfect for us and so close to the beach, all the staff were extremely kind, helpful and welcoming. Everything was awesome! We will be back for sure

I really don’t take time to review often, but after the service that Daisy provided, I had to. Just an awesome, wholesome person who really worked hard to accommodate us as best as possible. Thanks Daisy!

Arrived Friday March 1st for the weekend leaving Monday March 4th. Vive is situated 2 blocks from Wakiki beach. Vive is located right in the middle of a very active tourist scene. Upon entry the lobby is clean and inviting with comfortable chairs and couches throughout. I was presented with a cold towel to wipe my face and a cold glass of pineapple juice - refreshing and delish. Staff was pleasant and accommodating. I was surprised at the size of the room - small but for a traveler of 1 just enuff. Continental breakfast daily but needs more variety. Lots of things to do is in walking distance. Come right out the lobby door and turn right on the sidewalk and enjoy. Enjoyed my stay at Vive and would stay again.

This was our first visit to Honolulu so we were not sure what to expect. The Vive Hotel was great. The employees went out of their way to be of help to us and address any questions we had. The room was not big, but comfortable. We were on the 14th floor with a view if the beach, which was nice. The breakfast every morning was good, but no hot food nor any dairy, such as milk or yogurt. Lots of fresh fruit, baked goods, hard boiled eggs and great coffee. The parking of your car is valet only and $25 per day, which can become a little pricey. All in all, it was a good place to stay.

This hotel did NOT disappoint! Location is super close to everything, it was clean, breakfast was great, and they allowed us to use the convenient room for two hours before our super late flight. The staff was more than accommodating, amenities were legit, and the hotel had towels, mats, and umbrellas for the beach. Coffee and fruit infused water available in the lobby all day didn't hurt either. We met a lot of guests who have been going there for years, so that says a lot about Vive. They're able to book tours for you and they were reasonably priced. Will definitely come back to this hotel!!

Overall we had a fantastic stay at the Vive Hotel Waikiki. We were very lucky that the team (Liz and night supervisor) they were so kind. The fresh cold water and coffee and area to relax is nice especially on warmer days. Its like a little retreat. We made it our home away from home.

I am so glad my husband and I chose Vive Hotel to spend our honeymoon. Our junior suite was so comfy and had pretty decent ocean views. We really enjoyed the breakfast and the dining area is perfect for relaxing, too. All the staff are super friendly and provided awesome service. Shout out to the concierge, KC, for going above and beyond with putting up with our fussy needs (answering a million questions, booking tours, cancelling, rebooking...). Would 100% recommend.

I'm a quadriplegic and rely on good service to make a trip work. The concierge KC has been incredible! Helped us heaps and wouldn't accept our tip! Also, the bed wasn't very accessible, but the staff were super helpful to move furniture to make it work. Also the breakfast, WiFi and in room tablet are much appreciated! I recommend this hotel.

We got a room high up on the street side. There was some some street noise, but it is not bad for central Waikiki, and the view was fine. The room had no balcony, but it was roomy enough and it had everything we needed from a hotel room.There was a problem with our sink when we arrived so we got moved up a few floors with an apology. The breakfast room was the lobby with a variety of seating arrangements, and though it sometime got full, you can usually find a comfortable seat to suit your preferences (being a retired spy, I usually took the seat in the corner with my back to the wall). The coffee was very good and there was a variety of breads, buns, cold meats and fruits that changed a little bit every day -- nothing too exciting, but then we never got tired of it either. We had to pay the resort fee, of course, but at least we used the beach mats, chairs, towels and umbrellas. All the staff were friendly, helpful and smiling. We spent 10 days there, and would go back again without hesitation.
