This was our second time and the hotel, and even though our stay was very short -- one night -- we'd recommend it to anyone. The location is great and the staff are friendly and helpful. We'll definitely stay there again.

I like the location perfect hotel to short walk to main Street & beach. If you have tours the main pick up spot for buspickups are across the road. I will definitely stay again close to several ABC stores very convenient.

The Vive Hotel is located on Kuhio and is a short walk from the beach.I had a Junior suite which was very clean, spacious and had a wonderful ocean view.A delicious continental breakfast is included daily and coffee and tea are also available all day.Boogie boards, beach towels ,umbrellas ,etc. are available to take to the beach.Special events such as making valentines or being entertained with ukulele music are great.All the staff are excellent . Daniel Sakakibara is super helpful and always helps make the visit to the Vive more enjoyable. Preston Vidad was also great with extra wake up calls.Thanks for another great stay!

This was a great place to stay just a few blocks from Waikiki Beach. The staff was extremely helpful, courteous, and friendly. The breakfast was very fruit and pasty based, but delicious. The staff was very helpful in storing our luggage before our room was available and after we had checked out.

The hotel is centrally located in Waikiki and close to the beachfront and other locations. We were able to walk to most located we wanted in Waikiki. The rooms were clean and sized perfectly for a couple. The tablet in the room was a great amenity, giving access to all aspects of the hotel. Included breakfast was a plus and convenience each morning.

Friendly staff, the maids, reception, concierge, valet, and a special mention to the hard working Filipino lady in the kitchen during breakfast service. Easy access to shops, dining, zoo, the beach...No complaints...

really enjoyed our stay at Vive. the only thing that we struggled with was only 2 elevators, and what at times seemed to by a long wait time to get on one. but i also understand there really isn't anything to be done about that. But all other details of our stay were wonderful, we really enjoyed our little honeymoon gift of the chocolates.

Clean, friendly staff, great amenities, great breakfast spread. This was our second stay at Vive. The living room area is awesome. The selection of food for breakfast was decent. The coffee was on early, so even if you were leaving before breakfast was served, you could take a coffee with you on the early morning excursion. The only thing missing was some gluten free bread or crackers, as all the bread and pastries contained wheat flour.

Daisy is a real professional and she was a big help. Promote that girl... The service we experienced was friendly and professional. The room was a little small but very clean and quite.The location & amenities were very good. We liked the breakfasts and live entertainment. We didn't like the small size of the room.

Comfortable and spacious room in the junior ocean view suite. Complimentary breakfast is average. The staff are lovely and eager to please. Located walking distance to Waikiki main area and we could see the ocean. Treats in the room upon arrival as a birthday gift was a lovely touch. The rooms are a little dated but clean and comfortable. I would stay here again. Pick up and drop off is awkward as no standing or parking out the front and a tight squeeze in the valet area.

Preston at the front desk was excellent, as well as house-keeping and valet services. Great centralized location. First time staying on a hotel on Kuhio, rather than Kalakaua, and enjoyed it much more...less chaotic and quieter. The room was small, and would have been very cramped for 2 travelers. Parking and resort fees were very reasonable. Overall, great hotel for the money. Will definitely stay here again.

We enjoyed our stay at Vive. It was more affordable than many other hotels in Waikiki. The rooms are on the smaller side but updated and sufficient. The breakfast was basic but always well stocked and really enjoyed the flavoured water. The staff was exceptional, amazing service. The air conditioning system could use upgrading, its a little noisy. Great location.

I was very impressed with our stay here at Vive Hotel Waikiki. Everything about this hotel was way better than I expected. With service, employees were always welcoming and willing to take the extra effort to help us with whatever we needed or requested. With cleanliness, every time we went out and came back later that night our room was always stocked with fresh towels, bed made, room tidied up as if we were checking in the room for the first time. The value of Vive hotel was surely one of the hotels where we got the most for what we were paying for. The location of Vive hotel was right in the sweet spot being minutes away from the strip and Waikiki beach. Last but not least one of the top sleeps I’ve ever had sleeping here at Vive. It could be probably waking up in Hawaii or could be the awesome vibe Vive hotel had to offer. Check out this hotel and see for yourself. PS: Wanna give a special shout out to their valet parking employees: Jauffrey, Ryan, Jordan, and Erwin (I apologize if I spell any of your names wrong). These guys were great and just wanted to let y’all know that we appreciated your guys’ service. Thank you.

I had a wonderful stay at VIVE Hotel Waikiki. The location was very central to shops, restaurants, and beaches and the staff was extremely friendly. I loved how they offer complimentary breakfast, which allowed me to start off the day on the right foot, as well as they offered fruit water, coffee, and tea throughout the day. Would highly recommend this hotel, great accommodation for a good price.

Excellent service, clean and very accommodating. The location is the greatest and breakfast is really good! This hotel made a huge difference in how much more we were able to enjoy our stay in Honolulu. We'll be back!

We are typically regulars at VIVE. We love the location, style, and value for your money. However our most recent stay had very unfortunate incidents. I won't go into details but we will no longer stay here in the future. It's a bummer that we will need to find a new regular fav hotel when we visit Waikiki, which is typically once a year.

Don't hesitate a second, book this awesome hotel, it s worth it !Everything is perfect there : people, rooms, breakfast, the ocean view, the place at the center of Waikiki 2 min of the beach. They even provide beach stuff.

Nice hotel and nice staff. Good location near the beach, restaurants and markets. Nice amenities. Thanks for everything.This was our honeymoon and our first trip to Hawaii. Oahu is a beautiful island and Waikiki the perfect place to stay.

This is an older hotel which has been renovated.Rooms are on the small size and very very basic for Waikiki and bathroom is tiny!However bed is very comfortable and overall place is clean.The staff are amazingly helpful and in fact make the place what it is.Breakfast on site is part of the “resort” fee these places are now charging and it is basic. But enough to see you through!Property is very well located and there is life coming back into Kūhiō Sve which makes this an attractive place to stay.

Over all the hotel is good, front desk had serious attitude issues and replied idk to most questions asked. Upon asking for hotel email, finally the front desk offered to speak with a manager... too late... wouldn’t recommend this hotel if looking for the Aloha spirit... more like NYC attitude

I thoroughly enjoyed my time at Vive Hotel. I had never travelled to Hawaii before and had great things from friends. A special mention and huge thank you to Kasi who helped me book all my tours who was incredibly helpful and professional. I will definitely come back and stay at Vive Hotel the next time I visit Honolulu - a very convenient location.

My partner and I stayed here for one night on our way back to Sydney from the big island. Great value and great service. The free continental breakfast is very good value too. Would recommend for any couple making a quick pit stop in Waikiki.

Our stay was enjoyable and fairly priced. The location was outstanding. The breakfast buffet was very good quality and an expense save. The staff always greeted us with a welcoming Aloha and accommodated our requests.

We found this hotel to be perfectly located in Waikiki, bus stop outside door, simple complimentary breakfast and spacious room (junior suite). Five minutes walk to Waikiki beach, would definitely stay again.

Preston Vidad was on the desk and provided amazing service for my wife and myself. He could see we needed a room early and made it happen quickly. Will we waited he allowed us to enjoyed the buffet breakfast.

Location is unbelievable as your're a short walk from everything in the center of Waikiki. Lots of food options within walking distance. Hotel amenities were fantastic, continental breakfast had a lot of fruits and various bakeries. Filtered hot and cold water machine available 24/7 along with coffee and tea. Beach towels, sand mats, beach chairs and umbrellas readily available - although umbrellas were a bit worn out.Room was quite good, some of the items are aged a bit like the carpet and toilets but were not dirty or poor by any means. AC was strong which is fantastic. The only knock I had was that the beds were a bit saggy and soft so those that can't sleep with that might be concerned. Otherwise I would highly recommend.

Though it iooks small , this hotel provides you almost everything you need when traveling, convenient locations to Waikili, 24 hour prepared beverages , fresh breakfast. reasonable price valet parking

Friendly helpful Staff, clean rooms, comfortable bed, continental breakfast, close to the beach, provides chairs, beach towels, mats, floaties, umbrellas, as needed while staying there. Close to all Waikiki has to offer. Excellent concierge service. The air conditioner is a bit noisy and would have liked some storage drawers but other than that would highly recommend this hotel.

This was an great place to stay with exceptional service, nice breakfast, clean, great location. Would have been nice if it had a pool but the beach is only a couple of blocks away as well as all downtown shopping

overall great stay. Great location, 3 minute walk to the beach. They provide you with everything you need! This includes beach chairs, towels, umbrellas, kids toys, even umbrella if needed. Highly recommended.

We really enjoyed our hotel!! We slept so well and were very comfortable.We are giving you 5 out of 5 cause we loved it at Vive....but there were some things. Especially the cable! And we could not see the tv from out bed and had to move the mattress to view.NOTE: You need to recycle. No recycle bins in the breakfast area which leads me to believe all the recycling I left in my room was thrown out. Still using plastic cups and straws. This upgrade is important.Loved your valet guys!Was given kid boogie boards, valet guys noticed and swapped them for adult boogie boards.Didn't notice that water that was available that was purified. I wish I would have been told in the beginning about the good water. Just some constructive criticism, a great hotel and so cute and stylish!H & J
user_name:
Hannah P
Myrtle Beach, South Carolina

review_body: The room was small but decent and clean. The breakfast and service offered were good. My only main complaint is the housekeeping service. It was not consistent. Some days were good and some days my room looked like it was half done. Robe and towels were not folded and shampoo and body wash were not refilled. I even found a pillow case left on my suitcase. This happened mainly on the last few days of my stay

My wife and I had a wonderful 4 night stay at Vive Waikiki for our first trip to Honolulu. On arrival, the valet was courteous and helped us with the luggage. Roger at the reception desk was very friendly and kind. The room was slightly smaller, but good enough for the two of us - having any children in the room would be difficult. The room and bathroom were updated and clean. The hotel has a very cool tablet in every room, which allows you to order room service, request cleaning, have the valet bring up your car, etc. It also has some apps that are very helpful, including one for white noise. The breakfast was good, although of limited variety - there were delicious fresh fruit every day which we loved. The days when papaya was served were the best! The valet was $25/day. Overall, would recommend this hotel highly!

Overall, very good value for the proximity of the hotel to Waikiki. It is about a 5 minute walk to the beach. It's on Kuhio Rd which is lined with tons of restaurants and shops. So close to the International Market Place and many other stores. Also complimentary Kona Coffee 24/7 was such a treat. Continental breakfast every morning until 9:30am. Only complaint I have is the cosmopolitan room with queen size bed is a bit cramped and small. The air conditioner is loud and the bed wasn't that comfortable but again for the money and location it was worth it. This is very clean hotel with nice amenities as free towels and beach chairs and umbrellas to be used. Also there is valet parking for $25 per day. Also in the room, there are tablets you use to order anything you need such as ice, or to have them get your car ready, pillows and toiletries.

This was our fourth time at the Vive. The staff at the front desk, the kitchen staff in the morning and the cleaning staff are just great. This hotel is great value for the money. We are looking forward to coming again next February.

I absolutely loved my stay at Vive, from the minute we arrived we were greeted with that Aloha feel, with fresh pineapple juice at reception. They accommodated our check-in requirements, which made our arrival day even better. Awesome breakfast buffet - and tea, coffee and cold water available all day. Clean room, comfy bed, friendly staff. Hotel is an easy 3 minute walk to Waikiki Beach front - Dukes Statue end.. ABC stores and food are everywhere, basically every corner. Vive Hotel is close to tour bus and shuttle pick up locations. If i am ever lucky enough to return to Hawaii i would definitely stay here again.

This hotel was a good value. It was a perfect for my needs being nice but affordable. The room was small but clean and up to date. The staff were friendly and helpful. I will definitely stay at the Vive again.

This hotel is a very good place for the price. It’s centrally located in Waikiki and it’s easy to walk everywhere. Although the hotel is a little bit dated, and doesn’t have balconies, the view is great and the rooms are nicely appointed.

This hotel is close to waikikW beach, just too small blocks, nice location. The hotel is clean, quite and provide tasty breakfast for customer. All emploees are kind and nice. Only inconvenience is park, no self parking. It is vallet park.

Great location minutes to Waikiki beach, shopping and restaurants. Location cannot really be much better. The rooms and bathroom are extremely small and could use a bit of updating. There is no central air, it is a window unit, though it was surprisingly effective (at least in February) and it worked perfectly for our needs, though it was very loud. The room is not particularly quiet but it is certainly a nice enough place to stay.What really makes the hotel stand out are the amenities. It was very nice and convenient to have the included continental breakfast- meats, fruits and breads. Nice to always have coffee and water available throughout the day. We are grateful that the hotel provided beach mats, towels, umbrellas and chairs! Great touch. On Friday there was even snacks and live music and that was really unique and nice. Valet parking was very good and convenient, especially if you can get the reduced fee with your booking like we did. Would stay again if looking for best value. Thank you!

This is a nice boutique hotel with its location being it's best selling point.Rooms are on the small side but equipped with all the basic amenities. Bed is quite comfortable and the room was clean. One thing to look out for is that the bottled water in the room are not complimentary. We got so used to those being on the house that we just opened them without paying attention. Not that it costed a lot but just got a surprised when we were slipped an invoice under the door the morning we were due to check out. Staff members were friendly and helpful. Breakfast buffet served fruits and variety of bread and spreads. No hot food available.

It was our second time staying in Vive Hotel and we really enjoyed as the first time. The hotel is located in Waikiki, close to all shops, the International Market Place and the beach. Breakfast was included and was delicious including coffee, tea and variety of pastries and fruits. Guests can have coffee and tea all day long. Staff is very friendly and helpful, immediately ready to accommodate any request we had. This is a great boutique hotel, with excellent staff, a great location and we highly recommend it.

We really enjoyed our time at Vive! Location was good - it's only a few blocks from the beach, and has a really convenient bus stop on the same block. We appreciated having the breakfast included (during our stay it was mostly just a ton of carbs and fruit) as well as free access to beach towels, mats, etc. Room was small, but still a good value for the amount we paid. I would say the biggest surprise perk was the courtesy room you can reserve for one hour at no cost on your check-out day. We had a late night flight and it was great to be able to use a room to shower and clean up before heading to the airport.

Our week long stay could not have been better! Everyone was helpful, cheerful and concerned if we needed anything. Room clean, location excellent, breakfast tasty- & coffee available 24/7(it seemed). All amenities as promised were there. We met many other international guests which became friends. I will stay at Vive when I return to Honolulu. You should too. You won’t regret it.

Vive is an excellent hotel for accommodations and their professional staff of employees. Mely who works to set up and maintain the morning breakfast does an outstanding job. Management should be proud to have such a hard worker in staff. I also had the opportunity to work with Morgan as a concierge. She was professional and knowledgeable. Thanks to her! The front desk was always very helpful. The cost of the hotel is money well spent, located two blocks from the beach and offers to loan beach umbrellas, towels, chairs etc. to guests at no additional cost! Overall this establishment is highly customer focused and recommended! We are retired and travel often

This boutique contemporary hotel simply has everything you need and nothing you don’t! Really helpful and friendly staff, a (very) clean and bright room, close to Waikiki beach, restaurants and shopping. Free breakfast is great too! I really couldn’t find fault with anything. For what I paid, I would definitely stay at the Vive again next time i’m In Honolulu.

Vive is conveniently located close to the beach yet a bit out of the main thoroughfare. Hence it provides convenience without hassle. I was upgraded to a penthouse room which was not luxurious but provided a nice comfortable accommodation with balcony views of both the ocean and mountains. The only complaint is about the check-out process. Instead of late check-out there is a refresh room that can be provided. I was never given any clear indication whether this was private or shared by others likewise needing extra time beyond the 12 noon checkout. In my case I only needed about 30 extra minutes in my room but that would not be granted. In fact, I was called in the room at 12:04 as a "reminder." That really soured what was otherwise a very nice stay.

On review, was offered free pineapple juice, and very friendly service. The room itself is small, with air conditioning in the window, which was powerful, but noisy, and blew straight onto the bed. But it was responsive and cool. The room didn't have a window that opened, or any balcony. The bed was fine, the shower/bath was old, and the bath clogged up. There was no service elevator, so sometimes a wait.The staff were amazing, very friendly, and always ready to help. The breakfasts were fine, fruit, eggs, and now some pastries, including delicious sausage rolls. Free beach towels, beach mats, and beach umbrellas were nice. Never any problems getting change from large bills, or asking about shuttles.Location not so bad, two blocks away from the beach, bus stop right next door, but no actual place for Ubers or Shuttles to stop outside, which was a bit annoying.

We loved our stay at Vive! A few mins walking from Waikiki beach, lots of restaurants and shops around. Everything was just as the advertised pictures. When we first arrived we had missed the time zone difference after flying and ended up having to book an extra night at another hotel since Vive was fully booked, but despite that the male receptionist (working the morning shift on both 7th&8th Feb, didn't catch his name unfortunately) was amazing and very helpful and accommodating to our situation. Shout out to him!So the second time we came back, when we actually had the right reservation dates, we were welcomed equally friendly and attentively, checked-in by Beverly I believe. She was fantastic, informative and kind. The room was as we requested on a higher floor i.e. 20th, looved the view! The hotel even attended to our honeymoon trip by treating us some complementary chocolates upon arrival in the room. Functional space, bathroom was slightly small but worked very well, clean. Bed was very comfy. In the evening there was an ukulele up-and-coming artist who played for the guests in the lobby - beautiful touch! He was amazing! Breakfast in the morning was good (as American continental breakfast goes ;) ). During the day we could borrow beach towels and umbrella which was lovely. We also took advantage of the pool&spa offer Vive Hotel had for using the pool area of a nearby 5-star resort (upon a small extra fee). Splendid! Definitely recommending Vive! Keep it up! :)

Easy walk to Waikiki beach. The room was very clean and the hotel was the perfect size. The breakfast was fresh and delicious. All the staff was helpful and friendly. My honey and I loved the daily beach towels, chairs and mats too. We can't wait to come back. Oahu is our favorite island now. Endless beaches and sunsets too! Thank you

If you want something with god location . No fuss and can put up with loud help you up all night air con. It had no pool. But friendly staff. Evidently they charge you after you leave for your stay instead of up front

Lobby staff treated us as though we were their most important customers. Nice room, comfy bed, cool views. Cleaning staff did an awesome job. Nice location relative to beach and shopping and restaurants and parks. Fantastic breakfast buffet. Gathering area near lobby was very inviting and relaxing. Will stay here again!

Lovely staff and great location. Room was small and and had an in wall AC (this didn’t bother me because I have worked in remote camps and it’s almost like a white noise). But it kept my cousin who I was travelling with me but in another room awake. Ear plugs would solve I think. Breakfast was simple but nice. My room was clean and simple with a partial ocean view

We stayed at this location for one week. The location is excellent, plenty of restaurants and activities within walking distance. The room is very small, bathroom is very tiny - just enough room to stand. Service is average, breakfast is nothing to brag about. If you like just fresh fruits and coffee, you would be happy. We stayed on the 15th floor, but the road noise was terrible!If you don't mind the size of the room, road noise, and enjoy fresh fruits breakfast every day, then this is a decent choice!

This is a really nice hotel in Waikiki, just 2 blocks from the beach. The rooms are small but my husband and I thought it was enough room for us. There’s a closet, a desk with open shelves, and the bed had pull out drawers. We used the room to sleep and change clothes, so it was fine for us. Free breakfast is included which contains fruit, coffee, juice, and some danishes. It changes a little each morning. Fresh water is always available. There’s a concierge on-site who got us a better deal for a one day car rental. Free parking, free library, and free use of beach towels. In walking distance of everything, there is no need for a car. Bus stops across street from hotel. We had a great view from our room. Resort free $12

Nice location 2 blocks from the beach and at the end of the strip. Good restaurants within walking distance such as musubi cafe and marugame udon. Very clean. I stayed on 15th floor and can still hear some traffic noise in the morning but it never caused me not being able to sleep at night. Bed is on the sof side. Pillows are also on the soft side but supportive. Water pressure is good and never ran out of hot water. Free continental breakfast is included. Staffs are nice and helpful. You will be charged $12 for service fee which gives you beach towels, umbrella, etc. Valet parking is $25 per night which sounds expensive but it's actually one of the cheaper ones in waikiki. There is also no limit on how many times you can use the valet. Overall it's a really good value especially because I got a good deal by booking my flight and this hotel from Hawaiian airlines.

Very good location and good quality. Some front desk staff were stiff but the overall team were very pleasant to deal with. Service team always greeted us and did a very good job. I'd recommend and will stay again next time.

We got the Newly Wed package and stayed at Vive for a few days. The service is excellent, extra point for location, offering beach towels, breakfast and having coffee and tea ready at all times. The only down sides are that there is no pool and the size of the rooms are small. But, we knew these before booking and hotel is so close to the beach that not having a pool wasn't an issue. We will definitely come back for our next trips.

My husband and I would highly recommend staying at the Vive. It is clean, with courteous staff, and a helpful concierge. Just three blocks from Waikiki Beach, the Vive proved to be remarkably convenient to both shopping and eating establishments such as the International Market Place and the Royal Hawaiian Marketplace.

I have stayed Vive Waikiki 7 nights. I missed a night due to cancelled flight, but hotel staff was able to modify my reservation. Breakfast was great with variety fruits and pastries. 24 hours access to coffee, tea, and water dispenser were awesome. Hotel provided beach towels and umbrella to use at beach. All hotel staffs were awesome, top customer service.Hotel location is within heart of Waikiki, 2 min walk to beach and international market. All popular shops and restaurants are within walking distance.Vive hotel has resort fee of $12 which is a lot cheaper than other Waikiki hotels which they charge $30-$45 per night. Vive also had valet parking service with in and out privileges for $25 per day while other hotels charge at least $35 per day.My flight was at 9pm on the day of check out, I was able to come back later that day and use comprehensive room for one hour (so that i can clean myself before long flight).I have visited Waikiki multiple times. By far margin, this was best hotel. I am glad that I stayed at Vive and I will definitely comeback here again.

Great service, friendly and helpful, great customer service they receive me with orange juice who those that, and the front desk and valet parking super friendly I felt great VIve.This review was from Erik Budenos room 1407

The location is amazing and very convenient. Paid a little extra for ocean facing room but there was not much of a view. No big deal but not worth upgrading. The AC was loud and old. I live on Maui and because of our "endless summer," I expect an efficient, new and quiet AC unit at a hotel. That is not the place to skimp. Pros are small bar in hotel and free breakfast. Rooms are clean and nice enough. Staff is very nice and accomodating. Cons loud AC, few pillows on the bed, definitely has the look of a quick cheap remodel. Overall above average but not great.

We took mom for a short trip to Waikiki in January and stayed in Vive. Room is large and comfortable for three of us with two baths. Complimentary breakfast was a plus with nice selection of pastries and fruit. The 24-hour coffee and water is great for us. We want to thank all the staff for making us welcome in Hawaii, especially KC who recommended a customized tour around the Island for three of us to accommodate my 82 year old mom. Hotel is cozy and beautiful and close to shops and restaurants and the beach is just one block away. We will be back to stay in Vive.

Great hotel, minus all the extravagant fees of the chain hotel in Hawaii. Nice and quiet in the suites. Awesome breakfast included. Worth the price for everything you get. We recommend it and would gladly stay again.

Vive Hotel is centrally located in bustling Waikiki. Restaurants and stores for essentials are all within walking distance. Hotel is quiet and offers great amenities. Their specials/offers for Kama'aina was an awesome deal as well.

This was for a birthday celebration, the big zero on the end type. We were met with cheerful, helpful staff and some small welcome treats along with a birthday card. The birthday girl chose the Vive for the comfy looking beds, bathtub, proximity to the Queens surf break, surfboard storage, breakfast buffet with fruit and library. All those were great, we had a great time surfing and walking around "Disneyland" as we call Waikiki. The bed was really comfortable once we rotated the mattress so that the head that everyone sits on was at our feet, leaving a cushiony firm mattress under our bodies. On first try it seems very squishy but still supports in all the right places. There were a few hairs in the drawers under the beds and bathtub and a couple of small stains on two towels and a robe, hence the lower cleanliness score. Otherwise, very clean and nice. The worst bit was the allergic reaction to the towels. We inquired specifically before booking and were told that scent free detergent was used for all the linens. I used a washcloth to put some ice on my forehead for a headache and used a towel when getting out of the bath the first night. My chest and neck (where I used the towel before I realized it smelled) turned red and irritated. And my eye swelled up till I could hardly see out of it. Other than that we had a lovely stay and thoroughly enjoyed it. Just be cautious if you have severe allergies.If you're there on a Tues or Thurs evening visit Karissa of Henna Happens at the Hyatt farmers market - fabulous!Thanks to all the wonderful staff!

This hotel had a very friendly and accommodating staff. There were towels, mats, umbrellas, etc that could be taken down the beach, which was only a few short blocks away. In the lobby one of the evenings, there was great live music! Would stay again.

All staff were accommodating and friendly, found a few deals by outside restaurants not honoured but management corrected paperwork handed to guests and followed up promptly. Fresh milk at the breakfast offering would be a welcome consideration instead of hundreds of ‘half & half” containers and surely cheaper. All in all, a great relaxing stay. Thanks Team VIVE !!

KC was extremely knowledgeable and friendly. This was our first trip to Hawaii and KC gave us so many tips on what to do (that would suit all ages) and gave us many alternatives that would fit within our budget. We cannot thank her enough,we would strongly recommend KC!! KC also booked our tours extremely quickly so we could get on with our day :)

It would have been nice to have something warm for breakfast. Since i was on a business trip i booked solely on the free breakfast. This could have been a "warm" positive review however your continental breakfast ruined the stay. We were given the same meals every single morning. Cold fruit, Cold hard boil eggs, Cold bread...

Two blocks from the beach and very nice rooms. In my opinion, the best part was the service that we received from "all" the staff that we received assistance from. Why did we stay here:1. Great reviews2. Wonderful location3. Pricing was excellent; don't forget to ask for discounts for extended stays if you don't see it on their web site (reduced parking rates and discounted room rates)4. Two blocks from the beach5. Many restaurants close by ($ to $$$$)6. Great shopping7. Last but not least exceptional service from staff. All were very attentive, but a shout out to Aldrin who really went out of his way to help us out.A few things to consider:1. If you are staying for longer than 7 days, ask for a room that has a dresser.2. Higher floors are quieter (15 on up)3. Taste out the fusion water4. Book direct with ViveHighly Recommended!!!

The hotel is a short walk from the beach. I was in a junior suite it had a small fridge but no coffee maker or microwave. Breakfast was included they had fruit, pastries and cold hard boiled eggs, coffee avavilable all day. The area to eat breakfast was awkward lots of couches and armchairs with small side tables. They could have used the space much better with tables you can eat at. The day before we left our room was not made up. I told the front desk and they did offer fresh towels but houskeeping was closed at that time. Overall a good experience it would be great if they upgrade the breakfast tables.

Central location in Waikiki and close to the beach. Every aspect of our stay from the location to the comfortable room and courteous staff was excellent. The only minor inconvenience was that you can't watch TV in bed, but we weren't in Hawaii to watch TV anyway.

Excellent location. 3 mins walk to Waikiki beach. 5 mins walk to International Market Place & food places. 30 mins drive from HNL airport.Great Service. Breakfast provided. Beach gear available on first come first serve.Small Room. Perfect for business/couples/friends if you spend most of your day outdoor. Slightly small for family or a group of 4+.
user_name:
netherian
New York City, New York

review_body: Loved our stay in this Hotel. Very nice staff. Breakfasts were fine. Steps to the beach. Rooms were not too big, but clean and nice. Will definitely recommend you to visit this hotel! P.S. Also visit the Flour and Berly restaurant, the Hotel propots it they give a 15% discount for the Vive visiters. That was the best pizza we ever tried!

Vive hotel is a nice hotel conveniently located in the Waikiki Beach area of Honolulu. Easy walk to the beach, zoo, shopping, and restaurants. The Vive appears to have been recently renovated, and the room was clean and comfortable, with all of the expected amenities.My choice of the Vive over other hotels was based on location, Wi-Fi, and lower resort fee ($12/day which includes breakfast).

Rooms were very small, but well appointed and clean. The air conditioner was a window unit and very noisy and drafty. It did keep the room cool. Location is great and service is very friendly and helpful. Delicious fruit and pastries for breakfast.

If you are looking for a hotel in Waikiki, look no further. Vive Hotel Waikiki was an absolute pleasure! The amenities are outstanding, including all the beach equipment you need, a delicious local style continental breakfast and superior complimentary toiletries. The staff was fantastic. They made us feel like we were the only guests in the entire hotel. Preston at the front desk was our favorite! He provided top notch, friendly service and helped make our stay the best it could be. We will definitely be returning in the future.

We stayed here for 10 nights during our honeymoon and liked the hotel. Hotel was very clean and close to the beach and where all the action was. It was my first hotel visit that offered a tablet for use! The room was admittedly quite small but was otherwise clean and suited our needs.

The Hotel is very central to everything. It may not be on the main strip but it is only a 2 minute walk to the beach. The hotel is very clean and the staff accommodating and friendly. You can spend three times as much on a hotel but there is no point if you are only sleeping there. I would recommend this to anyone.

Excellent service, friendly people, comfy beds, a tasty free breakfast open for 3 hours every day, and easy valet parking are just a few of the wonderful things about this hotel. We also really appreciated and used every day the free use of beach chairs, umbrellas, towels, and beach mats. Also, we got some good advice for nearby hikes. We will be back!

This was a great place to stay. Everyone was friendly and helpful. The room was small but everything we needed. Very modern and nice decorations. We enjoyed the beach more with the use of towels, beach mats and chairs from the hotel. An easy 3 block walk to the beach. Breakfast was great everyday, better with the main lady there as she peeled the pineapple. Great coffee and tea available all day. Would recommend this place to anyone and everyone.Too bad we have to go back to Alaska. It’s probably cold there

I recently stayed at Vive Hotel as part of a couples getaway with some of my friends. The stay was very pleasant. The rooms are kind of small and not that new, but it's decent for island sizes. The description says ocean view but it's basically a side view of the ocean between hotels. The hotel staff were very helpful and welcoming. the last day especially they held our luggage and gave us access since we had a late flight. We had use of towels and umbrella the entire time since we were there. There is a $12 fee which is supposed to cover these things. The location is pretty good, very close to Waikiki beach which i would not recommend spending your time since its very touristici and with a lot of homeless people. Kuhio street is pretty busy with lots of shops and restaurants to choose from. Honestly for the prices you pay in Hawaii this is a decent hotel that does not break the bank. I would recommend if you are not high maintenance and are truly just looking for a place to sleep, shower, sleep comfortably and close to all things in Waikiki.

Could not recommend this hotel enough! Excellent location, only 2-3 minute walk to the main part of Waikiki beach where the Duke statue is. Its in the middle of "the strip" so basically anywhere you'd like to go in Waikiki is a max 15-20 minute walk (usually less) in either direction. Yet because its just off Kalakaua the hotel was very quiet. The staff were AMAZING! The room was incredibly comfortable and clean. Its a newer hotel. The free wifi was super fast. The free continental breakfast was great. The coffee was really good, there was juice, and so many different kinds of fruit and pastries, a different selection each morning. That saved us having to go out and spend $20 USD at a cafe daily. They even had free beach mats, umbrellas and towels we could borrow for the beach (where we spent a lot of our time!). We had a great experience here. The staff even send us up some Hawaiian chocolates to our room to congratulate us on our engagement.

My positive impression of Vive Hotel was sealed even before I'd arrived. I'd emailed the hotel several times with some general inquiries and every time, within minutes, I'd get helpful responses from Roger at the front desk. When I checked in, there was Christine to greet me. Throughout my stay, Roger and Christine went out of their way to provide travel information and inquire about my day, making me feel welcomed every time I walked through the front door. Other staff were no different. This customer service gave off a positive vibe.The hotel location can't be faulted. It's within meters of Waikiki beach, restaurants, shopping, bus stop. There's 24/7 access to delicious Kona coffee near the lobby and free beach amenities.Overall, excellent value for the service received.

I was very pleased with staying at the Vive Hotel for my first time in Oahu. My partner and I were celebrating an anniversary, and we both agreed that we would stay here on our next visit! The location is great, just a quick walk (less than five minutes) from Waikiki beach. The staff was very welcoming and friendly and catered to our requests as best as possible. Our room was clean, and the bed was very comfortable. The room we had appeared as pictured on their website.Although the only available parking is valet, the fees were quite reasonable and arguably better than most hotels we researched in the area. The attendants assisted us as promptly as possible, which we appreciated a lot! Overall, we had a wonderful experience at this hotel. With the level of service as well as convenience in location, this hotel is such a great value!!

I never write reviews, but I was compelled to write one. The staff was friendly and the room was a decent size (family suite). There really wasn't a view, but it's okay, because I LOVE the blackout shades, although the air conditioner was a little noisy (I sleep with ear plugs, so it didn't bother me much at night). The breakfast was decent. I loved that they had a ton of fresh fruit and bread choices, and there was always full plates of food. Only thing was that even though there were 4 pots of coffee, the regular seemed to run out quickly, so I was often left with decaf. That's not a huge downside though. I loved that they had individual creamers, although I wish they had more variety instead of just Half and Half, and French Vanilla. Maybe Hazelnut and/or Irish Cream? I loved that the staff was down to earth and were very inclusive to employees and guests alike. I wish my staycation could have been just a little longer, so I can play tourist and go to the beach and go shopping (which was so conveniently located from the hotel). Even though I'm from Oahu, I don't get to venture out towards Waikiki often, but if I decide to stay in this area for another staycation, the chances of me staying here again is very good. I would probably recommend this to family and friends.

Great location.Room was clean, great view. Staff were incredibly kind.Breakfast buffet daily.Located 2 blocks off Wakiki beach and within easy walking distance of shopping/ dining.Traffic and parking is somewhat limited in the area so plan ahead.

Great location, smaller rooms, but great service, good breakfast with lots of fruits. Reasonable resort fee includes all beach gear and towels. Overall would recommend and come back here with family and friends!

I enjoyed my week-long stay at the Vive and would recommend to other budget travelers. Very clean and comfortable with a fantastic location less than a 5 min walk to the beach. Good value for money for Waikiki. I was hardly in the room except to shower and sleep, so I didn’t mind the small room and compact layout. The window AC unit was a bit nosy but kept the room cool. No amenities like a pool or gym but they do offer free boogie board rentals.

This is a great place to stay. The staff are all friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and modern and the breakfast is the best. A lot of fresh fruit and breads. The lobby area they call the living room is a nice relaxing place to just around a enjoy other peoples company. I enjoyed talking with people from several other counties.

I booked the lifestyle room with ocean view. Very nice and clean room, easy to see ocean with beautiful sunset. Staff in Vive is very friendly. Breakfast has many fruits and pineapple juice. I enjoyed the stay there!

We stayed for 3 nights in the junior suite. The room is spacious and the location of the hotel is superb. Breakfast is simple but the coffee & tea is 24hrs so u can hv a drink whatever u want. We definitely will stay in this hotel if we visit Honolulu again
user_name:
Mei Li H
George Town, Malaysia

review_body: I had very good days! I liked this hotel very much. Next time I visit Hawaii, I want to stay at this hotel. Because the location was very good, breakfast was delicious, and the room was clean and fashionable.

The location of the Vive Hotel Waikiki was great for exploring, and the staff were really friendly and helpful, and provided us with great recommendations. I would have liked to see a heartier breakfast, and our room was a bit small, but overall we had a nice experience.

Friendly staff, welcoming, and incredibly clean!The air conditioner was a little bit loud. But we got used it after the first night.The hotel has a great breakfast and the staff were really quick on refilling the fruit and pastries.We would definitely stay there again when we go back to Waikiki.

Cosmopolitan Queen room small, but adequate for a couple. Quite clean and quiet. The "Deluxe" continental breakfast was good but there needs to be an investment made for some tables and chairs, rather than having people balance food and coffee while seated at sofas, etc. Great to have the extra hour to check out (upon request). Staff were very helpful and pleasant. Valet parking was quick and they assisted with luggage. Good to have free use of beach "toys". Short walk to beach. Fastest hotel Internet ever!!

This is a wonderful place to stay. The central location is within walking distance of tons of restaurants, as well as shops and the beach. The service was first rate! Daisy (front desk) is really accommodating and professional.

We found the Hotel nice and charming, including the good brakfast, the permanent offer of great coffee and tne friendly help at the deskThis is a great place for a vacational trip to Honolulu, You have everything central, from swimming to busses and shopping. Connection by regular busses to the Airport.

I stayed in this hotel in December with my wife and I would say this hotel is good but not extraordinaryGood things- Location is great. Just a short walk from the beach and main street- Breakfast is not excellent but It´s enough. It has cut fruits- Staff is very kind and they always try to help you- they gave us a box of chocolates as present four our 20th anniversary Bad things- In our case the room was pretty small- Room was very noisy. We could heard noise from the street- Hotel has resort fee and parking fee. Most the hotels in Waikiki have- It has not got swimming-pool- they charged for 2 water bottles in our room, when we didn´t drink them. But after send them an email complaining about it, they gave us a refund,Hotel is fine and recommended but don´t expect luxury

The hotel was very clean which was a plus. Everything is walking distance which is nice but all the chain shops are overpriced. Shop in the neighboring towns if you want save on your trip. The amenities charge and parking charges are a bit much. WiFi can be used at Star Bucks down the street for free versus being charged $12 a day at the hotel. Then you get hit with $25 a day parking charge. Felt like there were fees for everything. The "complementary" breakfast isn't really complementary. And its mostly fruit, bread and boild eggs... Overall, the stay was fun. Could have been better without all the extra fees that don't seem to make sense when you already paid a resort fee when you book your stay.

We just spent a week at the Vive Hotel over New Year and loved every minute. Prior to staying at the Hotel, I read many reviews with interest. Firstly, this is not a five-star resort, but rather a nice, clean hotel centrally located in Waikiki. In other words, you get what you are prepared to pay for! We loved our stay at the Vive. Front desk was always helpful (Mahalo Preston and team), we had no problems waiting for lifts, rooms were cleaned and made up daily. Our room was very quiet, spacious, a good-sized TV with plenty of channels, WiFi running at about 9 Mbps for downloads and the complimentary breakfast buffet is a nice touch. It is a very short stroll from the hotel to either the beach or the main Strip in Waikiki. There are no verandas (Lanai or Porch) with the rooms but that just means you need to find a bar overlooking the beach to enjoy the sunset instead. My only suggestion to management is to consider putting a small electric kettle/jug in the room as having to attend the lounge on the ground floor for hot water is a little bit of an inconvenience. Finally, plenty of people complain about the air-conditioners being noisy however for us they were just white noise that helped mask any external noise from the outside. We would certainly stay at the Vive Hotel again.

We stayed at the hotel from Dec. 17-Dec 21, 2018 and fully enjoyed the super clean room and friendly staff. The hotel is only two blocks away from the Waikiki Beach. The bus stop is right outside the hotel lobby. Restaurants, bars and markets are all within walking distances. Will stay there again for next visit.

I stayed at the Vive Waikiki for 11nights with my wife. We both enjoyed our stay and would certainly recommend this property to anyone staying in Waikiki. The lounge area was great. The furniture, the pictures, the plants and other decorative items created an atmosphere of pure relaxation. This was one of our favorite places in the entire building.The hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly and polite. The location was just minutes away from Waikiki beach; you'll enjoy free towels, mats and also a boogie boards.I really had a great time staying at the Vive.

Friendly and efficient staff including excellent housekeeping.The buffet breakfast available each morning and hot/cold beverages available during the day saved a lot of money. Great location a couple of blocks from the beach and from a range of restaurants and stores.

Stayed a week in this wonderful hotel. Great location. Very central. Staff were also very friendly. Air con noise is not that bad. Plus I think they are being replaced soon. Book directly to save resort fees.

I can't say enough about how friendly the staff is here and they are very helpful. I was in town for a class and certification exam and mentioned that I passed. They congratulated me with a note and box of chocolates on my bed. Also, when I left some shoes behind they sent them back to the mainland for me for the cost of shipping. I'd stay there again.

Really great location, staff are welcoming and friendly. Lovely clean rooms and great air conditioning! Close to Ross superstore, Royal Hawaiian Centre, Crackin Kitchen snd everything is in walking distance.

We stayed there for 1 week and got quite good service. Hotel is situated in good location, close to the beach. Very decent breakfast. There was always free coffe and water provided during the day, we just also felt that they are caring about the customers. The room was ok, shame that there was no balcony. I would definately recommend!

Spent our 7 nights here, it's worthy! Great location to the Waikiki beach, restaurants, shops, bus stop, and tour pickup points. Staffs were very helpful and friendly, the breakfast was simple but quality(lots of fruits!). It might not like a luxury hotel you are looking for but you will feel like home.

Stayed here for 6 nights over Christmas week and had no complaints! Being literally two blocks away from the beach was awesome, and the hotel provides its guests with beach towels, beach mats and beach umbrellas as part of its daily amenities fee, which is only $12 per day! With that fee is also the free and daily continental breakfast, which featured various pastries, hard-boiled eggs and fresh cut fruit. The staff was super friendly and helpful and for having so many people go in and out from the hotel to the beach and back, the hotel was always very clean.Also included with the amenity fee is a complimentary "guest room" on the day of your check-out. This let my girlfriend and I still visit the beach after we checked out, swim in the ocean, and come back to a room that allowed us to shower and get our wits together before heading to the airport. The hotel can also connect you with a local airport shuttle for $12 per person. Great 6 night stay, hopefully I'll find myself back in Honolulu in the future and I will definitely book here again.

I read reviews and found no surprises. For one person the room size was more than sufficient. I was very pleased with my stay on the 17th floor that has some ocean views. I like sleeping to the hum of the AC. Quick walk to the beach. I was more than happy with the breakfast options each morning that DID include some proteins including boiled eggs. I would rebook at this destination. Note: clearance for cars is 6 feet in the valet parking so I was glad I booked a compact vehicle.

We stayed here after a cruise and so glad we did. The hotel is older but has had some updates. It was a great size room with a very roomy restroom. They gave us a room with a view. We arrived at the hotel around 9 am. We were told that our room wasn't ready but would be ready by 3 pm. I ask them to call us when it was ready. Within an hour and a half they called just as they said. The guy at the front desk remembered us by name every time we came through the lobby.

1. Very nice on customer service 2. Free breakfast and 24hrs offered coffee n tea 3. Free beach equipments4. Awesome time on x-mas card making 5. Near to some Popular restaurantsThanks to Vive, we had wonderful time in Hawaii!

We booked directly through the hotel, which waived the $12/day resort fee and also included free valet parking (usually a $25/day charge). The hotel has free WiFi and complimentary water, tea and coffee 24/7, as well 24/7 access to to microwave, toasters, and small pizza oven, in the lobby. The hotel also offers free use of beach towels and mats, available at the front desk.Rooms are very clean and the window-mounted air conditioner worked great. We kept our room at 69 degrees while sleeping every night. The beach is <5 min walk from the hotel. Walk out the main entrance, go straight, and you'll be at the heart of Waikiki Beach. There is plenty of shopping and eating/drinking establishments w/in a 10-20 min walk. Two notable front desk standouts were Preston and Roger for days and nights, respectively. They accommodated every request we had during our entire stay.Next time we go to Oahu, the Vive will be the first place we look to accommodate our stay.

My dad and I really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The hotel staff is incredibly friendly! They provided us with pineapple juice as soon as we walked in. The hotel is within walking distance of the beach (about 3 minutes by foot) and the aquarium. There is also a bus stop a minute away where you can catch a bus to Pearl Harbour. They lend beach towels and beach chairs and body boards at the front desk. Breakfast was included and quite enjoyable. The room was as expected, not giant but met all of our needs.

They are very friendly and kind, and has provided very good service. All necessary equipment has been prepared. One thing I am not 100% satisfied is the sounds from other room via exhaust outlet. During the mid-night, sometimes I heard some sounds and conversation. Thank

While the outdoor area and the lobby give the impression of a good quality hotel, staying here is probably one of the worst mistakes one can make.The 21 floor hotel only has two elevators with no separate one for the service staff. You either have to squeeze in next to service personnel carrying cleaning products or you are forced to endure multiple stops until you make it to the lobby. Also, on the upper floors there is no indicator stating the level the elevator is currently located at, therefore making the (up to 10 minute) wait for an elevator seem endless.The cleaning staff refrains from doing an sufficient job (or any job at all) unless you leave a few dollars lying around in your room for them - and even then their work is hardly worth a single penny.The extremly small bathroom (which cannot be locked) has not been noticeable cleaned once during our 7 day stay.The biggest issue we had with the hotel was the breakfast. It mostly consisted of a bunch of cheap and tasteless items supposed to resemble toast and different kinds of buns. To add some taste, one could only choose between strawberry jam and peanut butter. The coffe tasted awful and had such a high temperature that it could not properly be filled into the provided paper cups. The only thing off the breakfast buffet which could be considered edible was a variety of fruits.Also, if you enjoy a good night's sleep in a temperature regulated room this hotel is not for you. The air conditioning is loud and if you happen to stand directly in front of it you can kind of smell that the last time it has been cleaned was probably back when it was set up.All in all we would not recommend this hotel. There are probably way worse alternatives somewhere in Honolulu but there sure as hell are also way better ones within a similar price range.

Not much to complain or write home about. The location is excellent and the customer service was consistent and good. Nothing spectacular about the property and amenities though. Fresh fruit and continental breakfast daily.

I stayed at the VIVE from December 23rd -26th. From the moment I checked in I was met by smiling faces and treated fantastic and with a glass of cold Pineapple Juice. Daisy who was working at the front desk was very nice and friendly. All of the employees were great! i loved the room. It was a little small, but for just me it was just fine! It was clean and comfy and had a great view from the 21st floor! I enjoyed the Continental breakfast every morning featuring tasty fruits and croissants and Pineapple Juice! I really enjoyed my stay and would recommend The VIVE to all my friends! Daisy was especially nice and helpful at the front desk throughout my stay! Thanks for a wonderful Christmas visit to Waikiki!

I didn't book and I was looking for a room for one night: the personelle was very nice and cozy. Room was very good; and also good quality breakfast but the dedicated area with sofas is very nice to see but not very suitable for the purpouse.

I stayed 4 nights with my girlfriend in December.Likes:Terrific location, convenient to Waikiki, Diamond Head, and close to the highway.Valet parking (FREE with government or military ID)Free breakfastFree beach rentals (towels, mats, umbrellas)Helpful front deskDislikes:Soundproofing could be betterParking can be expensive (I think ~$25/night) if you don't have government rateNo fitness roomOverall impression:Come here if it's your first time in Oahu or if you want a walk-able, "city" feel. The location and service are really top-notch and you can do a lot on foot. You're also close to many great eats and it's not hard to jump on the highway if you want to get out of Waikiki. If your idea of vacation is lying on an empty, quiet beach then perhaps this neighborhood isn't for you. Also, if you're sensitive to noise or need a gym, then a different hotel would be best.

we stayed a week and it was the first time at vive hotel .We don't regret this choice,staff was professîonal,the hotel is close to beach restaurants and shopping center . Housekeeping everyday room clean .We'l go back to this hotel surely.

We have a nice stay in Waikiki hotel. The room, the service and the hotel was nice. However, the room was quite small, the breakfast almost has any tables to sit, and the outdoors were very noisy. In general I would say that the hotel was okey.

We have stayed at Vive a number of times always having a very nice stay. Staff treats us wonderfully.Parking is easy, location is where we want to be. Breakfast always delightful with assorted fresh fruits pastry and lately hard boiled eggs; couldn't ask for more.

The Vive Hotel had the best continental breakfast on the island! The staff were professional and personable. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be close to the beach and treated like royalty:)

Good location, very close to beach, shopping, bus stop right outside. Continental breakfast, beach towels and mats provided. Friendly, knowledgeable staff. Hotel needs an update, towels and bathroom were dirty when we checked in. Bath water was clogged but fixed immediately. Noisy a/c, plumbing and street noise. Good for short trip, but not for relaxing beach holiday

If you insist on waterfront property or a true resort with on-site activities, you'll want to look elsewhere, and pay MUCH more money. My room was small, but very efficiently laid out, clean, comfortable and updated. The staff couldn't be better. All were very friendly, hard-working and professional. Some even knew me by name after a few days. Every inch of the hotel that I saw was very clean, and the staff were constantly working to maintain it. The hotel was conveniently located within walking distance to many areas of Waikiki, including only a few short blocks to the beach. An excellent continental breakfast was included. This really is a great hotel, and very reasonably priced. If I return to the area, I'll defintiely stay at the Vive again. Thank you!!

Great stay at the Vive. The staff was personable, friendly, helpful and very courteous, especially the desk associate Rodger. The room was outstanding with an ocean view and it was clean and spacious. A breakfast was offered in the morning and although I wouldn't say it was a traditional type breakfast, it was outstanding, plentiful and had lots of items to chose from. Although the hotel was not right on the beach, it was only a short block away. The hotel is also conveniently located near great shopping and dining. The price for a topnotch, beautiful Waikiki Beach hotel was terrific and I look forward to staying there again.

We stayed for 8 nights in Dec 2018. Preston was the staff that helped us out for the majority of our stay. He was very friendly and helpful. He accommodated our need of medical supplies when one of us got injured, helped us book a hospitality room, and even helped hold a package for me that was shipped to the hotel. All in all, he exceeded my expectations for a hotel stay!The hotel itself is within walking distance to everything you need in Waikiki. Valet staff were very quick and helpful. The unlimited in and out privileges were a huge bonus as well. Breakfast was good with lots of coffee, juice, and fresh fruit available. I did wish they offered breakfast a little earlier. maybe 6:00 or 6:30 so that we could eat and get to sunrise for 7:00am.Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel! Great value with great services. Keep up the good job Vive!

This was my second trip to Hawaii and I returned to this hotel - because it was a great stay the first time and remained a great stay 4 years later. I'm a casual and frequent traveller so I like hotels that have value for the money. Vive does. Staff is an important part of that equation. The staff here is competent and friendly. KC, the concierge, helped me pick and book my activities. I was very pleased.

We recently stayed at the vive Waikiki, it’s a trendy little hotel right in the middle of the action, which makes roadside rooms very noisy, we swapped ours to the back , only one complaint was the air conditioner was so loud, apart from that the rooms were small but neat and tidy , foyer inviting and trendy . A good value hotel in my opinion.

Me and my husband really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The hotel is very clean and all the staff was pleasant. This is location is close to the beach, restaurants, and plenty of shopping.I highly recommend a stay here.

It is a comfy quiet place. Service excellent! Overall Very good! Every one was very friendly and helpful. Only one problem: is in the bathtub and sink - draining system was not working well, water was draining down very slow.

Chose this motel for its breakfast inclusion as well as no resort fee if booked through their website. We booked a Cosmopolitan Queen room which was not a big room but big enough for 2 of us. Fresh juice and wash cloth on arrival and extremely pleasant staff all trip. We arrived early so they stored our luggage so we could walk around. I highly recommend this motel as it is so central for the beach, food and shopping in the main part of Waikiki. Ala Moana shuttle stop is only around 100m up the road. The buffet breakfast every morning of coffee, juice, fruit and pastries was delicious and unlimited coffee and tea 24/7 was awesome. Will definitely stay here again. Thankyou Vive

The concierge, KC, was super helpful with tips & recommendations suited for our preferences/travel style. The hotel has very friendly staff with comfy, modern vibes. FREE breakfast and FREE beach equipment rentals. If your flight is much later than the checkout time, they store your luggage at the hotel and you can book a 1 hr courtesy room to freshen up, no extra charges. The location is near the end of the "main strip" but was perfect for us, as it was walking distance to the beach, the zoo, the international market place, marukame udon, and T Galleria the duty free department store. We did not rent a car, but the bus stops and pick up points for activities farther out is very convenient near the hotel too. The resort fee here is much lower than the other big hotels. Rooms aren't that big, but it's good enough for a bed to sleep in at night. The AC can get a bit loud, so ear plugs might be a good idea. We loved our stay here and would definitely recommend to our friends and family!

Stayed here with my partner for 2 weeks until the end of November at room 1604. Staff here are friendly and helpful. Thanks to Kasi for managing to book me SUP lesson with only a few hours notice. Also the guy at the valet in the morning is awesome as he is always smiling even when he had to work a double shift on thanksgiving. (I hope he finally got to cook his turkey for his family) I really like the convenience of the in-room tablet to arrange room cleaning or valet. Breakfast each morning wasn’t too special and it does get quite busy but it was very convenient to start the day with. On my previous trip to Hawaii I had stayed at the Hilton village and to be honest I would prefer to come back to Vive Hotel as the staff are far more personable and friendly. Also the location for Vive is fantastic as it’s near the main shopping strips and beach. I’ll definitely come back to stay at Vive Hotel!

The Vive is in an amazing spot, close to all the main Waikiki hotspots - we walked almost everywhere, and even other spots in Honolulu (like Ala Moana) can be reached by catching a bus a few stops. The staff were always friendly and helpful, arranging everything we needed, and nothing was too much trouble. The room is slightly small, but it's comfortable for two people, and very well maintained.The only downside was the bed being super soft (but that's a personal preference - I like firmer beds) and the wind rushing past the window makes a reasonable amount of noise. (But the wind is just the weather in Honolulu at that time of the year, and being so high up that's to be expected!)Overall, a great value place to stay, with super friendly staff and convenient to everything you need to do in Waikiki.

Our room was on the 17th floor and was very quiet except for the dripping noise from the external AC from the floor above hitting the cover of our AC. AC could do with an upgrade! The room itself was on the small side with a tiny bathroom. The room got cleaned daily.The hotel is about 5mins by foot away from the beach. There is also a supermarket about 2mins away to buy water etc.Breakfast was basic by European standards (1 type of jam, no cheese/meats etc.) although the fresh fruit was nice. The breakfast area is small and more of a lounge area with small and low tables which makes eating difficult. We usually went out for breakfast. Free beach equipment (towels, mats, etc.) is definitely a bonus!Staff were friendly and able to answer all of our questions.I would recommend this hotel to anybody watching the pennies and not expecting any luxuries.

Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel was walking distance to a lot of the places and right next to a bus stop that runs until 3 AM. Free breakfast was a plus because we were able to pack some light snacks for morning hikes. Overall, it was a great stay!

Just returned from 8 nights at the Vive Hotel. If you're looking for a no-frills place to stay then you'll be happy here. Bottom line: no pool, workout room, or restaurant; small basic rooms, good service. Staff was friendly and helpful. They asked at check-in if we were celebrating anything so I told them it was my birthday during our stay. The next day they sent up some snacks with a happy birthday greeting. The room is small, almost Manhattan small. There was no dresser for clothes, just a couple small shelves of the nightstands. Eventually we discovered two drawers in the bed frame. A little awkward but we just kept our clothes in our suitcases. The bathroom is also small with a sliding door. The water pressure is great and hot water was quick to arrive, even on the 18th floor. The bed was pretty comfortable which is good since we both caught colds and ended up spending a lot more time in the room than we anticipated. The AC is a window unit which is typically loud but did the job. There are only two elevators which meant we often had to wait a few minutes. The continental breakfast is nice with several pastry and bread selections, fresh fruit, and hard boiled eggs. Seating in the lobby was sometimes scarce but we managed to find seats all but one day. The location is good, only three blocks to Waikiki/Kuhio Beach. There are many dining options nearby including Hula Dog and Marukame Udon. We didn't plan on renting a car but ended up getting one for almost a full week. Valet parking is cheaper than other hotels in the area and we never waited more than a few minutes for the car. It was very convenient and helpful.

The location is unbeatable--a couple of blocks from the busiest part of Waikiki but still easily accessible to shops, restaurants and the ocean--and feels safe at night with people about. I was there for a good while and interacted with many staff and each and every one of them was gracious, friendly and helpful. Breakfast buffet is more than decent (though no eggs cooked to oder, etc.) and is continually restocked, worth $15 per person, I'd say. Breakfast area is the lobby and it's perfect for that with miscellaneous tables and chairs such that you can be left alone or you can chat will other guests, which I did on several occasions. And it's available for 2 1/2 hours. A nice mix of American, European and Asian tourists. At $25 for guests parking is a bargain for this part of Waikiki. No pool (I saw hardly anyone in a pool at any hotel and lots of people in the ocean), no restaurant but there are lots within blocks including the fine Japanese Jin Roku across the street), and the only central air is in the lobby; that's the main drawback as the rooms are cooled by window units which sound like window units. I'm not accustomed to that but it didn't disturb my sleep. I am accustomed to a good bed and thats what Vive has.

I booked for the marathon at good price. Was met by name at checkin , very profesional and friendly front desk. Room was small but very nice clean and modern. Had no resort fees and free parking with the Kamaina rate. Breakfast was excelent . All around I got more than I paid for. Will stay again!

The hotel is located the centre of Waikiki, steps to all attractions, beach, stores, restaurants... Great location, clean room and friendly people. Pleasure to stay there. Noisy air condition was the only thing was not good

Hotel was well located for the Honolulu Marathon. The people in the hotel were accommodating on having a room available on checkout day to allow for cleaning up after the long run of the marathon and my eminent departure to the airport.

Extremely noisy, breakfast in an inappropriate area, couldn't tell us that a great chiropractor was right next door when we needed it but mainly INCOMPETENT PEOPLE WHEN THE CUSTOMER IS IN REAL NEED. I had a sun stroke and the three receptionists were just looking at me trying to explain what I needed, doing nothing. They had me lay in the icy cold lobby in my wet clothes and gave me only a couple towels when I said I was freezing. We had booked the courtesy room which was not ready, we had to ask multiple times for the room and to get our luggage to be able to make it to the shuttle on time...

Overall, the hotel has cosy atmosphere.Although the room is not so big, it is bright, quiet, and very clean.They offer healthy breakfast.People of the hotel are nice and helpful.Close to the Waikiki beach.Super convenient for supermarkets, ABC stores, and restaurants.

My stay at VIVE was truly a wonderful experience.The hotel is located in a prime Waikiki spot (less than two mins to the beach) with lots of amenities close by (ABC convenience store, bus stop and food market). My friend and I were lucky enough to get a room on the 21st floor. Our room had everything we needed and I loved the addition of the tablet (with a personalised welcome message). Our rooms were cleaned every day to an exceptionally high standard!The complimentary breakfast and tea/coffee throughout the day was great value for money and I loved the fruit infused tea that was on offer throughout the day - so refreshing!The stand-out of the trip, however, was the hotel's concierge....KC. KC could not have been more helpful in advising us on places to go and things to see. She was great at recommending some of the less popular spots too. If it wasn't for her, I would not have been able to live my dream and ride an ATV through Kualoa Ranch (Jurassic Park) - this excursion gets booked up well in advance and KC patiently (past her working hours) waited whilst my friend and I re-arranged our car rental to secure the last two tickets available that week! Thank you, KC!All in all, it's safe to say that staying at VIVE made my trip. Mahalo!

We stayed here for 8 nights, and had a great time. The hotel is not beachfront, but only a very short two blocks away from the beach, and also close to the shops and restaurants, as well as being on the bus route (in fact there is a bus stop next door).The rooms were comfortable, and it was great that breakfast was included and there were tea, coffee and infused water stations set up for guests during the day.I noticed comments regarding noisy air conditioning units, and our unit was definitely a bit noisy. But it was constant white noise so did not interfere with our sleep. I find the units that come on suddenly during the night way more disruptive to sleep.We would definitely stay here again, it was lovely, with wonderful, friendly and helpful staff.

Location was great, it was close to the beach and the main street where all the shops and restaurants are. The staff were so helpful, lovely and always acknowledged us, such great service from all the staff members. The price was such a catch for the length of stayed, it also included free breakfast everyday, free wifi, no cleaning fees when our rooms were cleaned everyday, complementary unlimited beach towels, beach umbrellas, boogie boards and beach mats.

Hotel provided an excellent value in terms of location and service.A very welcome service is a hospitality room available post-checkout if you need to utilize the facilities for a quick shower after a day at the beach.The only negative is street noise on the Kuhio side of the building due to the window A/C units. But it's a small price to pay for the location.

Me n wife are here for honeymoon. We were warmth n welcome by THE VIVE HOTEL staff,everything was great from the top to the ground floor lobby. Everyday provided nice breakfast v local fresh fruit. One of the excellent is the help desk run by KC,helped me alot to plan n book everything for my trip.Thanks for all the staff,n bye untilll we meet again.Mahalo... ALOHA!

Travel first time by myself and the staff at Vive Hotel were very helpful and pleasant during my stay. Rooms were very clean and hotel was about less than a minute walk to the beach. Enjoyed the continental breakfast.

Such an amazing stay. Free breakfast was just what you needed to start your day and all staff were amazing! KC was exceptional and went above and beyond to make sure our time in Hawaii was perfect. They provided free towels, free beach chairs and mats and cleaned our room on the daily

Great Stay in a nice hotel. It was a great price for what I needed for my trip. It was a really quick walk to the beach. You walk down one street and wind up right in front of the Duke statue on Waikiki Beach. The staff was nice and very helpful and the continental breakfast was a perfect start to the day.

Excellent boutique hotel in the Waikiki area, walking distance to everything. Hotel staff were professional and courteous. Rooms were very nice and clean......bathrooms very small but functional. Would certainly stay here again.

The hotel was newly renovated, clean and cozy. Location was also great, being very close to the Waikiki beach, and within the lively city of Waikiki. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful with all of our needs. Highly recommended!

Mattress are way to soft, when laying on the mattress u just get sucked in.Would have wished that complimentary breakfast was more then toast and fruit every day. Coffee was great, pineapple juice was good too, wished it had been fresh instead of canned juice .Ac units make to much noise, my wife and my self had to turn off the ac to sleep in are room at night time.Other then these issues we had a great stay in the hotel, staff was great and willing to help with everything.

This hotel is pretty awesome. The staff is super friendly and it's hard to beat the location for what you're paying. It's just a few blocks back from Waikiki Beach and unless you want to spend way more to be on the beach, this is all you need. Easy walk to shopping and food. No amenity fee is also great to see. Also had a deal running which included a rental car and free parking, which made going with Vive a no-brainer. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Also took advantage of being able to borrow their beach mats, towels, chairs, etc which was very nice. I knocked the sleep quality because the mattress was pretty bad in our room. I'm young, but I had some trouble falling asleep and had a back-ache each time I woke up. Definitely recommend to management to upgrade them as soon as possible. The rooms are otherwise very nice. Plenty of space for two. A couple other notes to be aware of:- the hairdryers aren't great, so bring your own- the iron is very bad; would be nice to see Vive upgrade those too- the air conditioning is provided by two window box units; they do an ok job, but cannot be set below 76 degrees F; it's hard for us to sleep in a room that warm, so be aware of that if you're the same; they also don't do much for humidity, which meant bathing suits and towels take a couple days to dryI'd overall recommend Vive very much on general quality and price, as long as you're willing to bend in a few smaller items.
