Hotel was clean, breakfast was okay, especially fruits. You can use complimentary beach towels and umbrellas. Only 5 minute walk to waikiki beach. I had view to mountains, maybe I next time ask view to sea if avainable. I would come back if coming again to Honolulu.

Very relaxed environment with a kind and helpful staff. Good Coffee and infused water available all day. The room was small but comfortable and well designed. Two blocks from the beach. A good price. Will stay there again.

It was exactly what we wanted and needed. The breakfasts were nice to have encase we needed a pick me up for the day. The hotel was very close to the beach and all the shopping centers to have tons of fun around.

Incredible location, surprisingly spacious accommodations, free continental breakfast, and most importantly, AMAZING service! Vive hotel is the perfect choice for you if you're looking for something that is the perfect blend of luxury and budget~ If you're coming to Waikiki to relax and unwind, leave it to the staff at Vive to make sure you're taken care of! They also use technology in your rooms to be able communicate with their staff members. For example, we were getting ready to leave the hotel for an excursion and we used the tablet in the room to call for our car and by the time we were ready to go, the car was waiting for us! This was especially convenient because we have two kids. Overall, we had an amazing experience and hope to come back often!

it is only two blocks from the beach and the price is right. breakfast is fine. good value. only thing missing is an outdoor patio. I would stay there again. I could walk to everything and the location towards the Diamond head is good.

The Vive was a great place for 1 night stay while being in the center of town. The room decor is wonderful too! Valet was a little tricky. I circled the block before realizing where it was located (in a separate low-roof garage). BUT the valet service was accommodating. Thanks Vive!

Was there 3 weeks. Basic breakfast. Nice having water available 24-7. Had to keep chasing staff up for daily room service and we were always left till last. Location close to restaurants shopping beach and bus to Ala Moana Centre...

We stayed here as we had been booked elsewhere but due to striking workers at Sheraton. We chose to stay here. Rooms are small but comfortable and clean. Breakfast is included and has chopped fresh fruit juice danish and toast. There is also all day long access to tea and coffee. We stayed here twice before and after our cruise. Our first check in was a little confused and we didn't get the info newsletter which has wifi info etc. Second time checked in by Preston who was so welcoming and efficient. Mahalo Preston. We had room with ocean view. Hotel easy walk to beach. Only negative the air conditioning in the windows was super noisy almost impossible to sleep. These really need to be upgraded.

We greatly enjoyed our stay at Vive even though we didn't use all the amenities they provide. Our junior suite was roomy and comfortable and the continental breakfast was pretty expansive and satisfying. Our only warning/concern was that with the oceanview rooms (we were on the 10th floor) you trade a pretty good view of the beach with a significant amount of street noise. Garbage collection at 5:15 on Thanksgiving morning was not greatly appreciated.

A great location just a few minutes walk from the sea front. Really nice restaurants and bars close by, and the main bus routes to take you into Honolulu downtown (and the Ala Moana centre) are yards from the front door. Having beach towels/chairs available is also a nice touch.Breakfast is nice, although the lounge area is not big enough for the number of guests at the hotel. Every morning we were searching for a space in the crowd and lots of guests ate in their room. The rooms generally are also very small: we were on a 2-week vacation and had big suitcases which we had to stumble around. It wasn't too bad as we only stayed 3 nights, but any longer would have been painful. Also the room tablet isn't really much of a benefit; it didn't work for us and the "tech" person they sent up couldn't fix it and didn't return with a solution!Overall it's fine for a few days but I wouldn't stay longer (although 3-4 days is plenty to explore Honolulu). The room cost is quite high but I think that's true of lots of places in Waikiki.

Stayed one month. Breakfast is good, coffee machine can only get luke warm. Both machines with the same problem. Otherwise very good. Front desk with minimal knowledge of options of bus or subway use when having a demonstration on Saturdays.

This is my second visit to the Vive Waikiki and both times, we were very pleased. The Vive is a pleasant alternative to the mega resorts in Waikiki, easy in and easy out. Every staff member we encountered was friendly and professional, especially the front desk representative, Preston, who I made multiple requests to. He was always very helpful and most accomodating. Looking forward to my next visit to the Vive.

Excellent and friendly service, good & efficient room service, great valet service and 24hr guest service was helpful! Only thing missing was hotel facilities (pool, games room etc). We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would like to thank the staff at Vive for the awesome hospitality! Mahalo!

I haven't been in a room this small since I was in Paris nine years ago. For American standards, this was pretty surprising. We had two big suitcases and there was no where to put them other than on the floor. There was not enough cupboard space / hanging space to unpack so we had to keep stepping over and around the suitcases. The room was clean and nicely furnished. The queen bed was comfortable. We had an air conditioning unit which was great, although it made noises at intermittent times. No big deal though.The hotel provides a continental breakfast. They describe it as deluxe but it was pretty standard, nice to have fresh fruit. The hotel is NOT set up for this though. There are a few seats around the breakfast bar but not enough to accommodate the morning rush. A lot of guests apparently take their food up to their rooms because of this. It is a nice gesture to offer breakfast, but if you can't actually seat your residents then I personally would rather not get breakfast, pay less on the daily rate and go elsewhere.The hotel does provide towels and mats for the beach which is a nice add-on.On our welcome sheet, it was noted that we could stream music through the in-room tablet. We like to listen to music instead of watch TV, so I thought it would be nice to listen to spotify (which is one of the music services they outline on the sheet). I searched everywhere on the tablet for the app but it was not there, neither were any of the other music apps that were mentioned. I rang down to housekeeping, and they sent up tech support. He was stumped! He didn't know how to get the apps onto the tablet and wasn't sure why they weren't pre-installed. He said in the time he's been working there that he's never been asked to do this for anyone. I found this very odd as it seemed to be one of the main perks to having the tablet, certainly from the info sheet that they provided, this was a big deal for them. It felt like this hotel was over-promising and under-delivering a lot. Again, I would rather pay less daily rate with less gimmicks (that clearly they are struggling to deliver on). He said he would ring the service provider to find out, and I stupidly assumed that he might get back to me with a workaround. I never heard from him again.Everything was adequate and clean (which earns it extra points) but I don't think it was good value for money for what you were getting. I would most likely not stay here again.
user_name:
therealmckay
New York City, New York

review_body: It was a short time, but was able to spend a very nice time.The location was convenient, so we could easily go anywhere.There was no traffic jam around the hotel.The parking lot was small, but the valet parking was also comfortable.

Let me start by saying that my review isn’t about the room because it was to be expected. I mean you’re in Hawaii a room wasn’t very important to us as our goal was to be venturing the island and much as possible. This review is about Preston at the front desk he was AMAZING! From the small things like asking about our day to offering recommendations on LGBT friendly things to do he never disappointed. Everyone referred to us using the last name and always greeted us with a smile. Loved the fresh pineapple juice and towels upon arrival! Bonus breakfast each morning consists of boiled eggs, pastries and fruit. Ultimately we saved over $500 going with Vive vs a major brand hotel chain. Loved this gem and highly recommend it for anyone looking for a great location (2 min walk down one street to beach) savings value and excellent service.

Customer service is high class, all staff are always smiling and ready to help you! Room was clean and brand new, the only reason I will not give 5 stars is cos of the street noise, you can hear everything from the street (I was in a upper floor) and if you are light sleeper it might be a bit hard. Apart from the noise I will say that’s a great place to stay if you are in a low-med budget.

I spent only one night here, but from the time I walked into the beautiful, tropically decorated lobby to checking out help from the valet manager, it was an excellent stay. Cold towel and a glass of pineapple juice upon arrival was a nice touch. Room was small but very well organized and appointed, with a tablet for hotel and local information as well as ordering room service. Storage under the bed as well as a small closet. The breakfast was mounds of fresh fruit and baked goods. 24-hour tea and coffee service in the lobby. Many dining choices nearby and a close walk (2 blocks) to the beach. I will stay here again!

They provide free coffee at lobby everyday that is great, and the bus station is near by the hotel, very convenience! And it's just 5 min walk to the Waikiki beach! They gave us free chocolate, so nice!

The location for this hotel could not be more convenient, located on Kuhio, which is the 2nd large street of the main strip where all the restaurants and hotels are on. Kalakaua is the 1st main strip which goes along the edge of the beach and has all the shops is only 1-2 blocks away. You can get to the beach within minutes. The other great things about this hotel including WATER at all times. We never had to buy any water, as we brought our own water bottles. They also provide coffee and tea all day. There is a pretty decent breakfast with some pastries, toast, an assortment of fruit, and boiled eggs. You can also borrow body boards, beach chairs, mats, umbrellas and towels. There is free strong wifi in the rooms and a tablet is included in each room. These are all great services that are included in your $12 per night resort fee per room. Yes, you do have to pay it per night, but you get quite a bit of tangible things. We never rented a car, so didn't have to deal with the expensive parking which I believe is $35 self-park. Parking is very limited in Waikiki and having to pay for it is very expensive, so avoid it at all costs. Rent a car for the day and then drop-it with keydrop when you're done after-hours. We did this at Enterprise and it was awesome. Back to the hotel. They don't have a pool, but why would you want to hang out at the pool, if you can just go over to the beach?! We loved this hotel and how convenient and close it was to everything. All of the staff were wonderful to us. It made our stay in Hawaii so pleasant. The only thing I suppose is that I wish the rooms were slightly larger, but I guess there isn't much room in Waikiki. Being used to staying in larger rooms in California, I was a bit taken back by how small our room was, especially with a toddler. It reminded me more of our hotel room on a cruise ship or in Japan, where everything is crazy small. No matter though, we spent the majority of our time out on the streets and beaches of Waikiki. Oh, the concierge was also super helpful with answering questions and booking cars for us at a discounted rate and with a smile. Thank you to our friends at Vive!

We have stayed here before and it is still fabulous!! They really think of everything! The in-room ipad makes it very easy to ask for your car, ice, extra towels, etc. They have chairs, umbrellas, beach mats and towels for the beach. I like the bright colors at Vive: it both looks and feels like a happy place.

Enjoyed our stay at Vive. Rooms are kept clean and beds are comfortable. The lovely breakfast and the all day coffee and flavored waters was very good as well as convenient. The staff provides every thing you could need in the way of beach supplies: chairs, mats, umbrellas. Would definitely stay here again

I think we got the best room in the hotel, 2106. The people were great. Helpful, informed, and enthusiastic. The amenities were good (towels a bit scratchy), better than could be expected. I strongly believe that if we return to Waikiki this hotel will be our first choice.

It is a nice decorated and well located hotel. The rooms are clean and well equipped. There is parking for 35$ per day. The The only strange thing about the hotel is that you have to have breakfast in the lounge and to make yourself in between the other guests to find a place to seat. Breakfast is good, although some ham or cheese is missing. For any other things, great experience.

1st time staying at this hotel, and definitely coming back again in the future. Good location. Short walk to the beach. The only complaint i have is that there's no fan installed in the bathroom, but other than that, I like this hotel.

This hotel was perfect for the big city feel of Waikiki and in perfect walking distance to everything. This was our first stop on our trip to Hawaii and it got the vacation started right. The continental breakfast every morning was delicious and the complementary fruit-infused water and coffee all day came in handy.

This hotel is only 2 blocks from the famous Waikiki beach. Clean rooms and fantastic staff, very friendly and helpful. Excellent maid service. Reception staff were also very helpful. We had a wonderful time here and it's a great base for exploring the island.

Wanting good, safe, clean accommodation I chose the Vive Hotel Waikiki. During my stay I was impressed with the quality of the hotel, its location a few minutes walk from the beach, and the price. Excellent value for money.

We travel often and the staff was very friendly and professional but Beverly from the front desk was one of the best we've ever had the pleasure to meet,. She was so friendly and professional. Housekeeping Manager (Asian female) was also wonderful. She took the time to go through the dirty laundry for medicine that we lost. The only negative was the noisy air conditioners. Overall, a very nice experience.

Nice modern hotel, very clean, but somewhat plain and simple with not a lot of frills. If you do not book your room directly through the hotel, they make you pay a surprise "amenity fee" of $12/day that they say pays for things I would otherwise expect a hotel to provide. It feels scammy and left a bad taste in my mouth. I would have otherwise rated Vive higher as I enjoyed my stay.

I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. I called to cancel reservation but somehow I have been charged twice. The first I understand, but second time it was absolutely unfair, I explained it to stuff but got the same answer.

From the moment we arrived we loved this hotel. Christina at reception checked us in early and gave us a room with a partial view of the ocean and great view of the city. The room had robes, water, and a tablet you could use during your stay. You could order room service from various local eateries using the tablet. You could also order your car from the valet service with the tablet. The room though a little on the small side was more than enough for the two of us during our 2 night stay. Christina went the extra mile and arranged a birthday treat for my girlfriend cos she knew we were there to celebrate her birthday. It was a wonderful gesture which brought a tear to my girlfriend’s eye when we got back to the room after a long day sightseeing. That was real customer service. Thanks to Christina and all at the Vive for making our stay so enjoyable.

The roomxwas a bit smaller than what I was expecting but the customer service was amazing and perfect for the hotel. The AC had to be cleaned during our stay but it was handled easily by the hotel staff and proffesionally.

Whenever we visit Waikiki we stay at the Vive. The hotel is very central for our needs not too expensive and serves a great continental breakfast. The staff are very friendly and helpful with all things.

When we arrived at the hotel it was early morning, they kept our luggage. We were lucky to checked in by noon. Unfortunately the room was very small for my daughter and myself. After one day, hotel manager offered us a bigger room with two bathroom. It was so nice.What I did not enjoy was to share the lift with hotel staff with big cleaning trolly. It would be better if they have their own lift to carry things.Overall it was really nice to stay. Most of the staff are so kind and helpful.

These people are awesome, they worked with me for last minute changes and treated me like a king. The valet even knew me by name. This was the best hotel and was the most impressive staff I have seen in the industry.

My husband and I have just returned from 2 weeks staying at The Vive Hotel. Excellent value and if you book direct thru the hotel the rates are cheap and they waive the amenities fee. The rooms weren’t big but more than sufficient and very comfortable. The hotel is very clean and smells great! Breakfast downstairs in the lounge area is included daily. Free tea, coffee and iced water available all day. The staff are lovely and very helpful. They supply beach towels, boogie boards, umbrellas etc free of charge. The ground floor lounge area was great. We stayed with 2 other couples and would come back to the lounge late at night for a cuppa and to plan the following days activities. The location of the hotel is amazing. Only 1 block back from Waikiki beach, close to many small shops and eateries and the bus stops right outside the front door. I seriously cannot fault this hotel and highly recommend it.

Aloha,Whether this is your first trip to Hawaii, traveling for business, or a kamaaina returning home, give the Vive Hotel Waikiki a try.Although my stay at Vive Hotel was brief, I couldn’t have asked or expected any better customer service or accommodations. The valet Ryan is courteous and professional with much Aloha spirit. Mahalo Ryan!The Guest Services personnel always greeted me with a smile. If I asked for anything it was done promptly with a professional attitude. Roger is professional and posses outstanding customer service skills. Mahalo Roger! The accommodations were supberb and I couldn’t have nor expected any better. The continental breakfast was more than adequate with a selection to please many a traveler. The customer service at the Vive Hotel is outstanding! It’s the personnel at the Vive Hotel with their Aloha spirit and outstanding customer service that will make your trip a memorable one!Mahalo nui loa to All,Sheryl Wainwright

We were refugees from an unfortunate Airbnb experience and threw ourselves on the mercy of the manager, Preston Vidad, who took mercy on our plight and immediately found us an extremely comfortable room on an upper level floor, one window giving an excellent view of Diamond head and the other of Waikiki Beach, with breakfast, and all at the best Trivago rate. i would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone looking for a clean and comfortable budget hotel literally 2 minutes from the Duke's statue at Waikiki Beach.

We had originally booked at the Hilton but cancelled last minute to book here at Vive and I’m so glad we did. I booked through a third party site and someone from the hotel phoned to offer us a cheaper rate if we booked direct with them. So that was the first good sign. They accommodated us with an early check in after arriving on an early flight. They even invited us to have breakfast that first morning which was so appreciated. Breakfast was tasty and slightly different everyday for our week long stay. Although I don’t like filter coffee but that’s personal preference and there were other options. Our room was immaculate and very well sized. We were expecting a small room so to find such a spacious room was a welcome surprise. Housekeeping was to a very high standard and all the staff we dealt with went out of their way to be helpful. Even just little things like the lift always being open and ready in reception which makes a difference when you’re on the 20th floor and the little notes from housekeeping added to the our experience. The location is perfect, literally just steps from the beach and places to shop and eat. Honestly can’t fault anything about our stay and I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend Vive to anyone visiting Waikiki. It really made our trip to find ourselves in such fab but well priced accomodation.

My grandson and I spent three perfect nights at this sweet hotel. It was clean and cozy and a great place to rest up for our swimming, touring and active days! This is not one of your touristy hotel chains. Rather, you meet and see the hotel staff daily and they even joined in during some fun Halloween pumpkin decorating they sponsored. We had fun as well.Although there is no pool, the beach is a short walk away and so are all the restaurants and shopping you could ask for. Somehow, this quiet and fresh spot made Waikiki a little less touristy and more restful than expected! Loved it!

Recently stayed at Vive for a day stay when the flight for mybdeparting flight was changed to a late night time. Absolutely loved the room with all its features. Preston noted that it was my bday the day before and surprised me with a delightful surprise of treats. It was such thoughtful touch!

The service at this hotel was terrific very helpful friendly staff. We arrived late at night from airport. The room we were allocated the air conditioner was very noisy so they moved us to another room, little better but same problem. Room clean and bed comfy. They even provided beach chairs and umbrellas for the beach which bigger resorts don’t provide. Beach towels were provided also. Position of hotel very good only 1 block easy walk from the beach and restaurants. If you don’t mind noisy ac this hotel is for you, good value for money. They told me they are trying to replace air conditioners. Otherwise we were very happy with our one night stay.

Perfect for a short stay in the heart of Waikiki.5 minutes walk from Waikiki beach and the international market place. Very welcoming and professional staff. The hospitality room (A room you can book for an hour if you have a late flight) is a life saver. Definitely recommended hotel.

I stayed at Vive for close to 2 weeks after moving to Hawaii for work. While the rooms are a little on the smaller side I couldn’t complain with the complimentary breakfast, the free valet service, and all the additional beach ammenities like towels, chairs, umbrellas, etc; and for the price you’re paying it’s a good deal! Halfway through my trip there was an issue with my AC unit, I talked with Preston at the front desk and he moved me into a suite until that room was reserved again. Preston and the rest of staff were always so kind and making sure I was being taken care of and enjoying my stay. Every morning I was greeted by Romeo to pick up my car, he always had a big smile on his face and suggestions and tips about life on the island. I was so thankful for him and all his help and advice! Overall the location is pretty great too, you’re about two blocks from the main strip of beaches in Waikiki and a few blocks east of some of the bigger shopping areas. If you’re looking to stay at a more affordable hotel with great quality service in Waikiki this is a great choice.

We stayed here three nights over the Pride festival in a family room.Room wise it was clean, small but well equipped and as we would have expected. I did think the AC on the windows were a bit loud rather than your traditional hotel AC, and also the blinds were a bit mediocre.I would stay again if I got it at a really decent rate. I think price is a real point with this hotel as the location is decent.

I really wanted to like this place. Every year my husband and I get away to Honolulu just to have a few days to ourselves. Well this year we were also preparing for me to retire in the next four months. Instead of canceling or trip we decided to cut back on expenses. I knew when I booked the hotel I wasn't reserving a 5 star posh hotel. I just wanted clean and comfortable. I started off okay everything was as promised from the fresh juice at check in to friendly customer service with front desk staff. We were assigned to room 1208 with a decent view of the ocean. Cleanliness isn't one of this hotel's strengths. The shower was large but the drain looks as though it hasn't been cleaned in years. There was hair everywhere, television (yes the t.v.) was filthy and I am not sure what we were breathing in because the vents were disgusting. Breakfast was as promised and neatly arranged but no meats. The second day we went out on our island adventure and returned at 4:30 and found that our room had not been cleaned. Strange, I've never experienced this before and after consulting with the front desk this was standard. It was not a lie our room was poorly cleaned around 5 p.m. the entire week. It was inconvenient. There are window unit air conditioners which are loud but we could still sleep. On the fourth night we were woken up to a fire alarm around 4 am. After running down the 12 flight of stairs many guests appeared angry because they were told to return to their rooms while hotel staff were investigating. We were told they believed someone was smoking on the 9th floor after waiting for 35 minutes. No fire truck showed up but we were told to return to our rooms. Of course the elevators were locked so up the stairs we climbed. The following day we were greeted with another alarm early in the afternoon. No explanation. I was frustrated. The hotel promised juice, coffee and water were available daily free of charge but water was not available after the 3rd day throughout the day. It's hot in Hawaii, hydration is important. One night I drank one of the $1.50 bottles in our room until we could purchase water. At check out I was charged for 3 bottles instead of 1. By this time I just wanted to check out of there. The valet staff were extremely nice (Romero was very cool and always greeted me by my name). I don't recommend this hotel if you are looking to relax but if you just need a place to sleep it is an affordable option.

I enjoyed my stay very much. It was close to the beach and other places of interest. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was filling and the quickness to accommodate was impressive.

I really appreciated the ice cold pineapple juice and cold towels on arrival. The room was very spacious, and we had a great time. The valet broke our roof rack while rounding the corner, with a loud cracking sound on retrieving our car, otherwise five stars.

Vive is nicely located, utilitarian, a good deal for the $. Preston was super-helpful at the front desk! The rooms are small, but who cares. They are nicely appointed. The e-reader in my room did not have Pandora (as stated on the ads), which would have been nice. It was quiet. The breakfast had wonderful fresh fruit, good breads, but little else. While it has a chic decorative style, there is a lot of maintenance that needs to be done (holes in the walls in the halls, etc.). I liked it.

Very nice hotel central in Waikiki. Daily breakfast was good with tea, coffee and cold water available all day. Rooms were clean and very comfortable. Staff were very helpful, providing towels and equipment for the beach.

A nice place to stay, close to the beach. Very friendly people at the desk. They also have beach towels, beach mats and umbrellas for your use at the beach, a 3 block or so walk, < 5 mins. Nice view of the ocean, or a nice view of the mountains. Very pleased with our stay here. Recommend highly.

Management was understanding upon issuance of change in dates of stay. We were also pleasantly surprised to find they provided chairs, unbrellas, towels, and boogie boards for the beach. So accommodating. The breakfast was also delightful with fresh fruit, hard boiled eggs, juice, coffee, tea, and bread or crossants. Valley parking is a must here, as space is limited

Good location, lovely people, clean room, nice view on the beach and the ocean, perfect location, free beach towels, free coffee and water all day, breakfast perfect with pastries and fruits. Highly recommended !

This is a confortable, new hotel with good service. It's the only one I saw with included continental breakfast, what was very useful. They provide beach towels all day. They charged exactly what was previoulsy arranged, without complication. And it is located right in the heart of Waikiki. Loved it!

Stayed here for a few nights on my way to New York. The hotel is cuter and much nicer than it looks on the web photos. I was a bit worried after reading about the small rooms and the a/c noise, but the rooms weren't that small as I thought and didn't even notice the a/c noise. The room didn't have a veranda and maybe not as big as the bigger name hotel rooms, but this size is enough when you're on a vacation and everything else about the hotel made it up for it. The hotel itself is modern, neat, and super clean, with less than 5 minutes walk to waikiki beach, international market place, tons of restaurants, shops, dozens of abc stores.They have a breakfast setup every morning in the lobby with fresh fruits, juice, coffee, tea, pastries to fill you up before heading out, and two kinds of delicious fruit infused water in the lobby 24/7.I was very happy staying here at Vive hotel and would like to come back if I get a chance to stay in Honolulu again.Oh, and the hotel staffs were amazing, the best you could get.Everyone was very friendly and helpful.They helped me on suggestions to restaurants to getting a shuttle bus to and from the airport, etc. I cannot thank them enough.I was sad leaving the hotel as well as Hawaii.Now, writing this review makes me miss it more.I will try to go back soon!Thank you everyone at Vive hotel!!! :)
user_name:
nyc_and_10003
New York City, New York

review_body: AMAZING HOTEL. Great staffing, simple hotel room, GREAT location. 4 minutes walk to the beach and great price man. The best price compared to those over priced rooms. It was perfect for our honeymoon. If you’re not sure or never been to Hawaii this is a great hotel.

The worst hotel I have ever stayed in. We checked out as soon as we could organise the refund. Wow I can not believe this was the same price as the Hyatt Place down the road. The rooms were tiny. Smelly. And the air conditioning unit hanging from the window was dirty and smelly too.

Great hotel and terrific service, my room was upgraded and had a lovely gift in room once I entered. Great location stones throw away from all amenities couldn't ask for a better hotel to stay at on my first trip to Hawaii.

Granted i was to be assigned to a Queen Oceanview room however the room had a full size bed but after i got to the assigned room by the desk i didnt want to go back too the desk and ask for another room

Booked a five-night stay at Vive Hotel and it was an awesome experience. Our flight were in the evening so we needed to store our luggage and freshen up so we were able to use their hospitality room which was amazing!! This is an amazing hotel and will give a 10 star if we could! I will gladly recommend this to anyone!!

Hotel is clean and very hospitable. Rooms might be a little small, but they are comfortable and nice. Great value for the area. Everything was as described in everything we researched. Bed was a little soft. We will come back if we are back in HI!
user_name:
Jon R
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We were a family of four that wanted to have two rooms - with my husband and I not wanting to share a hotel room with our two teenage kids. The Vive offered a good value Family Suite option (noting we were there during Australian school holidays so hotels were expensive) with daily breakfast included. The room was simply for sleeping with two rooms with double beds and two bathrooms. For the good value we did trade not having a balcony nor amenities such as a pool (with a pool at home not such a big deal for us) and gym. The daily breakfast was simple - bread, pastries and lovely fresh fruit plus juice and tea/coffee. I noted that some people supplemented it a little with stuff they bought but for us it hit the spot every morning. All day tea/coffee was available as well as refreshing water. A real bonus was the availability of hot and cold filtered water which meant you could fill up your bottles everyday.We were there to spend as much time at the beach as possible - it was a short walk from the front door and the availability of towels, chairs, mats, umbrellas and boogie boards was great! We also purchased blow up pool floats which they are happy to keep in the storage room for the duration of your stay.Finally, the location was terrific - not only an easy walk to all the shops and restaurants that Waikiki has to offer but also bus stops close by with bus services to locations such as Ala Moana shopping centre, Diamond Head etc.

This hotel has everything going for it; location, style, friendliness, and comfort. Stylishly and recently renovated it was beautiful. From the well though out provision of a beach towel, beach mat and umbrella, to the beautiful lounge area for breakfast or any time of day for a quiet read, and the thoughful water coolers with fresh fruit inside, and coffee always available.

Vive Hotel was a great find on Trip Advisor. I usually search for a balance of price and great reviews. Again I wasn't let down. Vive is a small hotel in a great location. It's close to everything and surrounded by ABC stores (as only Honolulu can provide). The room was modern and clean, the staff was excellent and the breakfast was fresh. We spent 6 days and would most definitely stay here again.

Had an amazing time in Waikiki thanks to our stay at the Vive. Staff were very friendly and helpful and the facilities are top notch. The location of the hotel puts you within walking distance of most attractions in Waikiki. Will come back again. Mahalo!

Vive Hotel was very clean and the employees were very friendly. I appreciate that the hotel gives military families a cost break as far as no resort fee and free valet parking. The next time we go to Hawaii, we will stay at Vive Hotel again.

Once we arrived, we were greeted by friendly staff late at night. We were provided cold pineapple juice and a cool fresh smelling towel. The room was cozy and clean. The sheets and bed was very comfortable. Free breakfast of pastries, fresh fruits, kona coffee and pineapple juice. They have free beach towels, umbrellas and beach supplies so we did not have to worry about purchasing one. Amazing stay.

The hotel is a perfect distance to the beach and the Main Street for shopping. The decor is very modern which my family loves. The offered breakfast with fruit and pastries was the perfect start to every morning.

Vive Hotel was exactly what we were looking for. Transport at the door, walk to beach and close to shops. The staff were excellent at helping us sort out our tours and car hire. Very clean and tidy hotel. The breakfast and all day tea and coffee were very welcome. Would definitely stay there again.

Air conditioner fan noisy in room 1104. Otherwise very enjoyable, although next time would request a room with a good view of the ocean.Staff very friendly and breakfast excellent.Enjoyed the comfortable area to have breakfast and relaz.

This hotel was perfect for me to look around Honolulu. It's really a few min walk to everything, beach, shopping, dining, sight seeing. The bus stop is next to this hotel so it's really convenient to go somewhere a little far as well. This hotel also has breakfast included! I'll stay again for sure!!!

This isn't a luxury hotel so you're not going to have a 1,000 sq ft (100 m2) room with an ocean view. But you'll get everything else you want: delicious breakfast, clean room, well-designed room so even though it's small it has everything you need, wifi, very pleasant lounge/lobby, 24-hour tea/coffee, and it's inexpensive. Can't wait to stay here again. Best hotel I've had in Waikiki.

I liked that the hotel is located within walking distance to the beach, shopping and restaurants but that's the best thing about the hotel. Noise: Loud. We stayed in level 18 and we could hear all the street noise from the room. My husband would have to turn the air conditioner off at night time to fall asleep because it was so loud (even though we had it on the lowest fan speed setting). We were awoken with an emergency alert at 4am in the morning. When getting to the lobby area, we needed to question the staff what was happening. They could not tell us and made us wait around the lobby area for 30+ minutes before giving us an answer. We were told by staff that it was a false alarm that had been set off on level 9, that this has happened previously, that they would have management come out to check that everything was ok, that it wouldn't happen again. On the same night, at 8.30pm, the same thing had happened. The emergency alert had gone off. Again, when we got down to the bottom to the lobby, we were told by concierge that it was the same level 9, that management was going to come out to check everything.My husband and I expressed our frustrations to the staff about the events that had unfolded and all they could say was 'sorry, this normally happens'

Vive fit the bill for a relaxing couple of days in Waikiki! All of the amenities were great: the lobby was a really nice place to hang out, especially when we got takeout dinner. The staff were all truly excellent and provided great service. All of the beach gear came in handy. Breakfast was pretty good. And the airport shuttle proved both more reliable and less expensive than Lyft when we needed to be assured that we'd get to the airport in time for an early flight. All in all, everything about Vive erased our stresses and made our stay easy.Our room was immaculately clean (which is a big plus for me) and had all of the comforts we needed in a compact space. The welcome snacks were a nice touch. The only thing I disliked was the sliding bathroom door; noise and light just slip through those more. The room had a nice partial ocean view but there are no lanais here. Our room was very quiet; if we had neighbors we never heard them. Because there are only a handful of rooms on each floor the hallways and elevator lobbies stay quiet.The location is also great, within walking distance of everything in Waikiki. Several buses stop right outside as well.One hint: join their free loyalty club for a discounted room rate and a free room upgrade when available.

Been to Hawaii many times, but this stay (for our daughter's wedding) was by far the most enjoyable. Roger (at the front desk) began our check-in process by obtaining a significant discount over the rate we expected to pay, so we were pleasantly surprised. Trini (Trinidad) tended to the breakfast buffet and housekeeping, and was always pleasant and ready with a smile, and Romeo (the valet) never kept us waiting for our vehicle and was a great source of info regarding local sights and things to do. The accommodations were nice, but it was the staff who made this stay great and will have us coming back again. Great location, great people!

I liked that the hotel is located within walking distance to the beach, shopping, restaurants. The rates were good and breakfast was good as well. Front desk and concierge were helpful in giving directions and getting reservations.

Great hotel with friendly staff. Very clean. Room a little on the small side but adequate. Close to the beach, restaurants, buses but slightly away from the bustle of Waikiki. Would recommend to anyone.

Wedding Anniversary HolidayWe came to Hawaii for our 5th year wedding anniversary. The wife did a lot of research to find a hotel that was great value for money in an awesome location, we found it here! Thanks to all the staff that made our special trip memorable.From the front desk to house keeping to KC Nunes (concierge) who booked all our day trips and gave us guidance. AlsoFor keeping a little surprise from the better half , a romantic sunset horseback ride. Which we were able to booked before we arrived.Thanks again for all the help KC we really appreciate it.

Awesome hotel and staff! The junior suite is large and comfortable and the package deal was a great deal (included $12.50 for valet parking). Love that they have complimentary beach towels, umbrellas, water boards, chairs, etc... . Cool decor in the lobby and perfect location.

Stayed here in mid to late August for a week. Vive Hotel Waikiki is an excellent hotel only 5 minutes walk to the beach. All the staff were very friendly and always happy to help with anything. We were here when Hurricane Lane hit the Hawaiian islands and the advice throughout by the hotel in how to prepare was constant. The room was smallish (not an issue, fully expected that) and had everything needed for a great week on Oahu. The breakfast was very good and a great way to start the day, as snob coffee drinkers we went out for proper coffee, but again that's our problem. Wifi was always A1

If you are traveling on a budget then this is the place for you. The room was small but we made it work for us. Staff are helpful, can walk a few blocks to the beach, close to shopping, expensive and cheap food.

Great location, clean basic hotel. Nothing fancy but exactly what we needed. Friendly staff upon arrival with smooth check in and all. Highly recommended if you want to be super close to the beach and shopping/food areas..

The location was fantastic! 2 blocks from Waikiki Beach, 2 blocks from food carts, close to shopping and restaurants! Easy city bus access! The staff was knowledgeable, courteous and professional! The continental breakfast had a variety of fruits, rolls and bread. The rooms are small, the window air conditioner was noisy, but overall, if fit the bill for us.

Hotel is conveniently located just 2 blocks off of Waikiki beach. Hotel was clean and modern. The staff was extremely polite and helpful. Slightly challenging getting in and out of the Valet/garage. Pretty tight with two cars going in each direction.

Vive met my vacation needs perfectly. It was by far the best value on Waikiki, and I would happily return in the future. The location and amenities here are outstanding! Vive is not a resort or a chain hotel. As long as you read the information on their website carefully, you will not be disappointed. The rooms are clean and neutral with no frills. After reading reviews on Trip Advisor, I decided to book the Jr. Suite. It was marginally more expensive than the regular room and felt like a normal sized room. I wasn’t expecting a view at all, but wow— we could see everything from the 20th floor including Diamondhead and the ocean. We were able to book the Jr. Suite + convertible rental for $228/night with no amenity fee by booking direct. Parking is valet only and $25/day. Vive is so conveniently located in Honolulu that we didn’t NEED the car at all, but I’m so glad we had it to explore the entire island. My favorite part about Vive is that everything we needed was included with no additional fees. We had a light breakfast at the hotel every morning (fruit, carbs, juice, coffee) that was perfect before hitting the beach. Speaking of which, it’s an easy 5 minute walk to the ocean. Vive has beach mats, chairs, umbrellas, boogie boards, and towels that you can borrow for free! This hotel is definitely worth your consideration. Mahalo, Vive, for a great stay in Waikiki!

Modern upgraded hotel with some nice efficient features located outside of the crazy mainstrip...but close enough to all the things you want to be close to. Valet parking was a great feature, you could even order your car to be brought around from the in room tablet. The tablet was loaded with hotel app that allows guests to order services, and even order food to be delivered. Front desk, valet and cleaning staff were top notch. Shout out to Trinidad on the cleaning staff for her superior attention to detail on the room.Good price too, get all that you want without overpaying. Walking distance two blocks to the ocean/beach. Will definitely stay here again.

The hotel is in a great location but that’s about it. We booked a queen bed room but the bed was only a double which made it a very squishy sleep and the “premium” breakfast could do with a few more options to make it premium but it is a convenient option with what they have at the moment. Staff are friendly and nice but their activities booking desk is only operational at weird times when most people are out so you may as well just book things yourself. We have stayed here twice now but I think for the cost you can get a lot more for your dollar so will look around next time we come.

This hotel was very nicely appointed, very clean and the rooms and bed were great. I would definitely stay here again and I would highly recommend this place for anyone wanting great value in a good location.

This was a great location. 3 minute walk to Waikiki beach. Plenty of restaurants and shops to choose from. Valet service was great. Front desk staff was great. Continental breakfast was very good. Fruit and breads and hard boiled eggs.The concierge KC was great. Sit down and chat with this high energy person. She set us up for Pearl Harbor and a great visit with dolphins. Also, check out her band, Kings of Spade on Youtube.

From the second we walked in the door, the staff at Vive made us feel at home. They were always quick to offer an "aloha" or a "have a good day" as we entered/exited the hotel.The hotel is located just 2 blocks from Waikiki Beach and within walking distance of many great restaurants and shopping. A breakfast buffet (lots of great fresh fruit) is included in your resort fee, as well as beach mats, umbrellas, and beach chairs for you to use on your beach days. For those of you with a flight leaving well after the noon checkout, hotel staff will hold your bags for you while you catch a few more sights around town. Also, ask about renting their courtesy room to freshen up before heading to the airport. You can book it for an hour and the best part is it's free of charge!

Loved staying at this hotel. The location is fantastic with so much within walking distance. The complimentary use of beach equipment is very nice. The hotel is small enough and the staff is personable enough that you get the feeling that they are more like friends than staff. The price is simply amazing for everything you get. Definitely staying here again on our next trip. Foe expectation management, the continental breakfast consists mostly of breads and fresh fruit and the room ACs are window units that can be a little noisy. The breakfast is delicious, though, and the slight noise from the AC is totally manageable.

Spur of the moment get away. We wanted a reasonably priced, clean place to stay. One block from Waikiki Beach, beach items provided, free breakfast, this place hit all the marks. Very hospitable staff. Would stay there again

Everything about this hotel is great! The location, the staff, the services, the amenities... Courtesy room to freshen up when you have a late flight is a life saver! I booked the basic room but upon arrival, which was well before check in, my husband and I were given a corner room with the ocean view AND the city view! Honestly, I never felt more sad about having to go home. Keep up the good work!

Having stayed at the Vive Hotel on six occasions I can honestly say that this is one of the most cost affective places to stay in very expensive Waikiki.The rooms are only small however they are well equipped and clean.The staff is helpful, courteous and friendly.The included breakfast is a great treat and the 24/7 coffee and tea service in the lounge is fabulous.The Vive is a short walk to the beach, shops, trolley and 'The Bus' stops right out the front of the hotel.If you book direct with the hotel there is no resort fee and if you subscribe to their email service you will receive regular updates offering specials on their accommodation packages.If you enjoy a small, boutique hotel this is the place for you.

We had a fantastic experience at Vive Hotel. It was great to be able to get towels, chairs, umbrellas, mats and body boards from the hotel to use during the stay. The hotel is about 2 block walk from Waikiki Beach, and so many great restaurants. The hotel was quiet at night, clean and the staff was great. It had all we could have asked for during our trip to Oahu.

We were spending 1 week of our vacation in this hotel. Overall it is a good choice when you want to stay close to Waikiki Beach on budget. The rooms were quite small, but contained all the basic stuff. The complimentary breakfast was okay, but quite heavy in carbs, so we often preferred a breakfast cafe. As usual on Waikiki Beach there was only valet parking for an extra fee available which was fine. The guys did a very good job in managing the car in the small parking garage even when one of the elevators stopped working. The first couple of nights we were struggling with a broken AC which was pretty loud at night. At least we could change the room after some discussion (!) and received an apology expressed in free macadamia nut sweets. Do not expect any luxury - except for an Android tablet in your room. The staff was always really nice and helpful (as long as you do not ask for a room change in the middle of the night). Looking back our first impression when we arrived was very good, but unfortunately was not confirmed during the week.Will we stay there again? Hard to tell, but probably not as we made much better experiences with other hotels at Waikiki Beach.

There is a $12 amenity fee per day that is not mentioned when booking thru 3rd party websites or at check in, and you can not opt out of this. This supposedly includes beach towel, chair, mat rentals and "free" breakfast. It's really too bad because we liked this hotel until we got the bill. It's clean and service is good but the business practices are to be questioned.

Vive was excellent made possible by the great staff and venue. We enjoyed the excellent services offered by the staff members, the breakfast, location and rooms. Highly recommend Vive. Location was within walking distance of most restaurants and shops be sure to check out the noodle bar just down the street excellent value and one order will feed two adults with sides. Coffee shops all around and 2 blocks from ocean. We loved it.

I had a wonderful four night stay at Vive hotel Waikiki. The staff was courteous and helpful, and greeted me every time I entered the hotel. The hotel is very small compared to other properties in Waikiki. While the room I stayed in was compact, it was bright and comfortable, exactly what I was looking for. The AC is a bit noisy, but it works to cool the room perfectly. Complimentary breakfast every morning was an excellent plus-- that little extra is what made me try the hotel. I also enjoyed the round the clock free coffee or tea. Thank you for a great stay!

It was a short walk to the beach but the room was dark... lighting needs improvement in the bathroom. Shower was pretty powerful though! The bed has drawers to put clothes in, which is unexpected. It was hard to get the room cool with the 2 ac units so the temp was uncontrollable.

We recently stayed for 3 nights in a lifestyle suite at the start of our honeymoon (as newlyweds we got a reduced rate and chocolates in our room which was a nice touch) Room was very clean, spacious & large bed very comfortable, excellent shower, only issue was AC was quite loud. The hotel provided an excellent continental breakfast (fresh fruit, pastries, eggs, bread, juice) and provided complimentary tea/coffee and water 24 hours a day. Also beach equipment & towels were provided free for guests use. The hotel was very well located, only a few blocks from Waikiki beach. Staff very polite and helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel.

The hotel had good service. The breakfast was nice for a quick bite in the morning. The window air conditioner was very loud. They need to vacuum the elevators more on a daily basis. I know they are near the beach and sand will make its way to the elevator floor but more attention needs to be paid to the elevators. The in room tablet was handy.

Last minute decision to change hotel accomodation and was completely satisfied with everything. The staff had great customer service skills. The breakfast was simply yet filling. Close to the beach. Will definitely choose Vive again.

Based on the excellent reviews, my wife and I stayed here for one week while on vacation. The rooms are tiny but clean. The breakfasts are filling but not great, consisting of simple pastries and typically not ripe fruit. Coffee too, but you’re better off going to Starbucks.When we checked in, we were informed that there would be a $12 per day amenity fee. When I asked why, I was told that it was to pay for the beach umbrella, chair and towel. Sadly, on our first visit to the beach, the umbrella was so flimsy that it folded on the first puff of wind. So we rented good umbrellas and beach chairs at the beach instead ($25 for two of each for 2 hours).When I checked out, I was informed that despite the fact that their beach amenities were useless, I still had to pay. They explained that the fee was also for things like the breakfast and WiFi. In other words, standard things included in the nightly rate at other hotels.So be careful here. If you book the room anywhere but the vive website, you’ll pay the amenity tax.

Perfect location close to almost everything! Within walking distance to the beach (Waikiki beach: 250m), shopping centre (International Market Place: 280m), and restaurants within walking distance. The staffs were very helpful and kind to assist in attending our requests. And they were very friendly. Would like to put on record my appreciation to Preston, Romeo, Daisy and Roger for attending to our requests, arranging our tour bookings and transportation. Not forgetting Agatha for keeping the room clean and tidy. Most of the tour shuttles stops are within walking distance or you can enquire at the reception to arrange for direct pickup to selective tourist attractions/tours. We enjoyed the breakfast provided and the collection of books available at the mini library.

Our vacation began with their hospitality. Although we arrived at this hotel very early in the morning, Mr.Preston and the other staffs welcomed us with their lovely warm smile and let us in the second top floor with beautiful view. They even gave our child a baloon! So we could enjoy the first day of stay.[About the breakfast] We read almost the all review before visiting,some review said they had no meat. But I was so happy to find sausage bread and boiled egg at the first breakfast! sausage bread was little spicy.The next day was cheese and tuna bread.They have both salty and sweet bread.If they had local banana and papaya,we would be very very happy! [About the room]From our room, sometimes we happened to see the rainbow.It was so fantastic! The room was well clearned everyday and I love the tablet which we could book time of clearning and changing towels.It's a smart idea.[This accomodation]This hotel is perfect for those who don't want useless pond or decorated waterfall but just a confortable bed and clearn room and delicious breakfast.We didn't buy any coffee at outside at all because they always had it! [delicious restaurant in vicinity]OMG=mexican food, Eggs'n things waikikinot reccomend IYASUME=Japanese rice ball shop it was expensive and the portion was very small.Well, Thank you VIVE hotel!

Thank you sooo much to the Vive hotel and staff. This place is clean, close to the beach and had the kindest staff. They made our stay memorable. Thank you for the chocolates, treats and cards ♥️ thank you. I’ll be visiting again!
Front desk, Preston, service very good.Room too small. Bathroom no counter space. No pool. Really poor ocean view. Room phone inoperable and did not receive a message from shuttle pick up to airport.

When we arrived Roger presented us with cold refreshment towels and a nice glass of fresh pineapple juice. This was a great surprise. I think it was to sweeten us up for our next surprise. Our room was the smallest room I have ever seen. I have cruised often and my smallest cruise stateroom was larger than this hotel room. The room had a window with window unit; 2 twin beds, large tv, a nightstand with safe, desk, dorm cooler, very small closet and bathroom. I was quite alarmed when I walked into the room. The bathroom was "clean" but NOT CLEAN. I didn't realize until the bathroom was steamed up that the wall had splatter on it that had not been cleaned. The toiletries were really nice. The breakfast buffet was nice. Fresh fruit with some pastry and Hawaiian specialties. Of course fresh pineapple juice, coffee and flavored water. They keep flavored water available 24x7. The hotel is a few blocks back (short walk) from the ocean. It is an easy walk to restaurants and shopping. Parking is via valet and does cost extra.

Vive Hotel Waikiki is a cute little boutique hotel located 2 mins away from Waikiki beach (5 min walk). The location of this hotel is not just perfect to get to the beach but is also perfect for public transit use and just walking down the Waikiki strip. The staff at the Vive are amazing. They were so helpful and kind. They would go out of their way to make sure you had everything you needed. The hotel room was always nice and clean. The continental breakfast was also good. I felt like it was enough food for me to start my day. They don’t have very much for protein but I saw people bring their own sausages and bacon and cook them in the microwave or toaster oven in the dining area which I thought was a great touch. They also had beach gear such as chairs, beach towels, and boogie boards that you can borrow. Vive concierge services were great as well. They have affordable shuttles that go to a lot of the major places and if there isn’t a shuttle they will tell you how to get there by bus or suggest taking Uber or Lyft. The resort fees were also reasonable as well and probably the one of the lowest in Waikiki. We had an excellent time at the Vive hotel and would definitely stay there when we are back in Honolulu.

o Good Points: The resort fee is lower than other nearby hotels The hotel had a fantastic rental coordinator, KC who was WONDERFUL to work with. The lounge for playing family games and reading was great and continental breakfast was very niceo Reason we will NEVER BE BACK : Cleanliness of the room was the worst I have ever experienced. The cleaning staff was not cleaning the bathrooms. When a friendly note was left including the on-going tips we were leaving, to ask them to clean the bathroom please, we came back to find instead they had soiled the toilet including the toilet lid which they left up, so to put the lid down you were forced to touch the soiled area. The shower had not been scrubbed, and there was new evidence that the counter had not only not been cleaned, it was in worse shape. Pictures were taken which document all of this. I personally spent 2 hours cleaning the entire bathroom with soft scrub on my vacation, and then we left the “guest at rest” sign up, so we could clean the room ourselves the rest of the week. They also would turn the air conditioners down so low and leave them there, that when we'd enter the room after they "cleaned" it was like entering a freezer unit. The organization and communication of desk staff could be challenging. Examples:• We asked about a shuttle service to the Aloha Stadium Flea Market, they advised us one was on the way. The shuttle they actually meant was the airporter shuttle that was making numerous stops around Waikiki prior to going to the airport, and we were to be dropped of on the way back at the stadium. This wasn’t the 20 minute shuttle we had thought it was going to be• We upgraded our room the first night, because the original room we booked was too small to be comfortable in (barely larger than the bed itself) We paid the upgrade fees, but they shorted us a day when they updated the reservation, so we returned from an outing to a locked door, and our key cards wouldn’t work. This took more time at the front desk to get clarified and corrected

My wife and I stayed for a week here and we loved everything about the hotel. The staff was super friendly and helpful, the breakfast each morning was wonderful and the rooms were quiet, clean and cozy.

I travel to Honolulu for business about 2 times per year. This is my absolute favorite hotel on Oahu. The price is affordable (ZERO RESORT FEE), parking easy, the hotel is perfectly located in Waikiki and there are plenty of restaurants nearby. The rooms look small at first, but are very comfortable with well functioning air conditioning. Based on my experience, having good air conditioning in an affordable hotel in Waikiki is an absolute luxury. The staff is friendly and helpful. The hotel even has a dedicated concierge, Kacy. She is a mohawk sporting, absolute expert of the island. The valets like Ryan and Romeo are friendly and fast. The free breakfast is better than anything you will get in any other affordable hotel. Sick of the powdered eggs, sausage discs, waffle makers and crumby coffee? This place serves fresh local fruit, terrific sweet and savory pastries (some with spam which I happen to love), and great kona coffee. Finally the place is clean clean clean. That alone gives it five stars in my book.

Such a great place for a reasonable price. Even before we travel to Oahu I would make phone calls with many questions and every single time the staff were patient and polite in explaining and answering al my inquires.

We stayed at VIVE Hotel Waikiki to attend our nephew's wedding. We're impressed with the cleanliness of the property and the great location at a very reasonable rates. We went to watch the most beautiful sunrise at Makapuu Beach Park the first morning we're there and unfortunately, someone broke our rental car window to steal my purse. The police called the hotel to inform them of my loss, including the key to the hotel room. A few minutes later, the hotel manager, Preston, called me to make sure we're okay and when we arrived back at the hotel, all the staff members were so kind and sympathetic. They even wrote a sweet card and placed a nice assortment of goodies in our room to make us feel better. This was totally unexpected and very much appreciated. We also enjoyed great assortment of local fruits and pastries and Kona coffee for breakfast. We would definitely stay there again and highly recommend it to anyone visiting Waikiki.

I have just spent 8 nights at Vive and it was great.From check in through to check out everything went exceptionally well.The staff - front office, domestic, cleaning and others were incredible.The hotel is close to the beach, close to shopping and to transport services.The breakfast was plentiful - fruit, pastries, breads, coffee, a variety of tea flavours, fruit juice etc.The rooms are quite small but I only slept in the room so that was not a problem.Great place to stay.

Very nice staffs and affordable rates with reasonable resort fees. Variety of food for breakfast and 24/7 kona coffee and fruit infused water available. Hotel is situated in a great location to the beach and the shopping district. Overall Highly recommended though wish the room would be a little larger and have black out curtains.

- Rooms: small, the mattress of the bed was really good (not to hart, not to soften), there is a small safe, bathroom was clean and equipped with a hairdryer; the only thing missing was a electric kettle or a coffee machine.- Breakfast: for American standards it is a good breakfast: a big variety of fresh fruits, sweet pastry, normal and blueberry toast, peanut creme, butter, eags, marmelade, canned orange juice, coffee (normal and decoff.) and tee (organic); no normal bread, no cheese, no ham. -> the hotel offers coffee, tee and water the hole day long in the lobby.- Service: really good - every question was answered politely and quickly.- Location: 2 minutes by foot away from the beach - some rooms even have beach view.I can recommend this hotel very much!

Only 2 blocks away from waikiki beach, you can borrow beach towels, beach chairs, mats, etc from hotel, very convenient. I would definitely stay here again. breakfast was ok, basic breakfast with toast, fruits, and coffee & tea. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Use the tablet in room for any requests.

The front of house staff were very welcoming, warm and professional, the freshly squeezed pineapple juice and smiling face on our arrival after a long flight was just what we needed. The concierge KC was fantastic, cannot rate her highly enough for her knowledge and willingness to help - thanks for getting us onto the trips we wanted so quickly, and I hope you visit NZ soon KC! Rooms are clean, tidy and the beds are super comfy, we also have a small ocean view which is nice. Good location, easy walk to everywhere. Daily breakfast is homely and a lovely touch. The only downside is the noisy air-con units, especially if the room above yours has theirs going as it drips continuously onto the window, so be prepared to bring earplugs to sleep with. Other than that cannot fault Vive Hotel or their exceptional staff and would stay again for sure.

The staff at the Vive Hotel were amazing...friendly and helpful. Every time you came through the lobby they had a smile and an aloha for you. Rooms were nice and clean. We were also pleasantly surprised to come in to a lovely note and chocolates wishing us a Happy Anniversary. We mentioned we were traveling for an anniversary and graduation at check-in, but this was such a sweet unexpected surprise.The location was close to everything in Waikiki making walking easy. Having chairs and towels for the beach was also a plus and meant less things to try and rent. The coffee bar in the lobby and fruit water was also a hit for everyone in our group. The juice from the breakfast was superb and if you were looking for a basic continental breakfast you wouldn't be disappointed. Overall a nice hotel with good amenities and a great location.

We chose this hotel based on ratings and proximity to the beach. It is a very nice and welcoming establishment. As you check in, you are given fresh pineapple juice and cool cloths to help you stay cool against the humidity. They also had amenities including free WiFi, beach towels, full breakfast, and other beach things. The customer service was excellent and the rooms were very clean. I recommend staying here, I already have plans to come back.

I felt at home. Everything was just, staff was friendly and attentive. I was given information that saved me money on cheap ways to get around. Would stay here again. I was able to go to the places I wanted to visit.

We stayed at Vive Hotel for two weeks and enjoyed our stay. Stayed in Cosmopolitan room which is small but is all you need if you are out all day. You can spend time in the foyer where there are comfy lounge chairs. There is also a microwave and small oven to heat food. Rooms are clean, staff very friendly and breakfast every morning included. Beautiful fresh fruit, croissants, bread, muffins, eggs , tea and coffee, all you need to start the day. The beach is about 200 metres and hotel supplies towels, beach chairs, Umbrellas and mats. I would definitely stay here again.

This is a very nice hotel. It is in a super convenient location right across the famous Waikiki beach. There is great places to eat and shop in every direction. All within walking distance. The staff is excellent and helpful as well as friendly.

We were delayed by Hurricane Lane, our booking was changed to accommodate us being a day late and we were allowed to check in early. We had a view of the sea and diamond head from our room. It was a 3 min walk to the beach and met our requirements perfectly.

The hotel location is great, convenient to get around, lots of shops and restaurants around, 3 min walk to beach.Love the free breakfast provided, the room is clean and cute.I would definitely return if ever back to Hawaii.

The hotel is close to the beach. The breakfast is quite poor, beside the fresh pineapple. The reaction of the staff on our complaints (e.g. problems with aircondition) was very good and they wee always . very kind.

I wish we had spent more money and stayed somewhere nicer. The location of the hotel is pretty good - it's walking distance to the international market place, the beach, and the main street with all the shops. The room however was extremely subpar. We had the noisiest air conditioner known to man - we had to wear earplugs to sleep at night. The bathroom tub had a weird stain in it that would not come out. The hallways were stuffy. This place charges you a $12/night amenity fee for things that should be included in the room price (wifi, breakfast), and you cannot opt-out of it. I didn't even have their breakfast during my stay. Overall, it was not worth the amount of money I paid.

Reservations and check-in didn’t go so smoothly but once checked into my room, all went well. I stayed on the 21st floor which was good because Kuhio Avenue can be noisy at night. The small air conditioning units in the windows were not really enough to cool the room in August but I made it through. Here is what I loved about the hotel: comfortable bed, great housekeeping service (!), complimentary breakfast, tea/coffee/ice water on the 1st floor 24-7, Turner Movie Classics on TV, nice shampoo amenities, location, beautiful lobby, shuttle service ($12) to the airport, view of ocean/ Diamond Head, and staff who really seemed to care if you enjoyed your stay. When I checked out, the staff offered to lend me a room for an hour before my shuttle picked me up. I had a red-eye flight and was SO appreciative. They said I could shower or just rest in the room. Does hospitality get better than this?! ALSO, on the first night, the electricity was off and despite the fact it was NOT the hotel’s fault, the next day I had a beautiful note and box of chocolates on my bed apologizing for the trouble. SO THOUGHTFUL!!! I would definitely recommend the Vive Waikiki.

Great check in with pineapple juice and cold towels. Clean room. Nice, light daily breakfast. Loved the free beach towels and chairs. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We stayed 6 nights. Great location. Thank you VIVE Hotel!!

Stayed for a few days in August and absolutely loved it. From the polite service at check in until the smooth & easy check out, Vive Hotel gets a top rating. It's a short walk to beautiful Waikiki beach but off the main strip which is loud & busy. The room is not huge, but plenty enough space for 2 people. Everything is clean & tidy and the A/C works well to keep you cool. Wifi is strong, there's beach chairs, towels, etc and a hospitality suite to use if you need to shower & clean up after checking out. Continental style breakfast is a plus so you can fill up before heading out. I'll definitely be coming back to stay at the Vive Hotel!

We have stayed Waikiki Marriott Resort and Vive hotel for our stay this time. I really liked the Vive, it’s easier to access to front desk and to the room, also room is well designed and functional. a lot of outlet to charge our devices. Enjoyed waffle fabric bath robes as well.We definitely come back and stay with you again .

Very quaint swanky chic remodeled hotel. Conveniently located to all of the shops and beach. Rooms are small, but nice. AC was cold. Breakfast was simple finger foods, but all you need - fruits, hard boiled eggs, and breads/muffins. I brought my family - wife and 10 and 8 year old. Didn't see any other families in the hotel. Small staff to service, but they were always around and helpful. Clean, good value, good bed. Limited view...but you're not paying for it either. Convenient parking on-site for cars under 6 feet tall. Overall comfortable and convenient stay.

One of the elevators was out for the first four days leading to long wait times from the 20th floor. The staff was very attentive and I enjoyed the breakfast buffet too. The location and parking was excellent.

Valet, housekeeping, and front desk staff are incredibly polite and pleasant. The hotel is very modern and chic, wonderful fruit & pastry breakfast every morning along with fruit infused water round the clock.

This isn’t a fancy hotel on the beach, but it’s only three blocks away. The rooms are very tiny, and one of two elevators was out of service. But the price and location made it a good choice for us. The continental breakfast was convenient and beach supplies were provided v

My friends and I visited the hotel July 25,2018 -August 1, 2018. I highly recommend this hotel for couples, families with children who are preteen or older, and young adults looking for a cheap but nice stay. Location: The hotel is located about 5 minutes from Waikiki Beach. There is an ABC store 1 block away. There are several places to eat within a 10 minute walking distance from the hotel. My group and I ate at a taco truck next to the hotel, I highly recommend it! In addition to the variety of restaurants there are several shopping locations within a 15 - 20 minute walk. Also if you are using public transportation (the bus) there is a stop that goes to all the tourist attractions within 1-2 minute walking distance of the hotel. Hotel Room/lobby:The hotel itself is very up to date. Our room had a tablet and Television and was very clean. The housekeeping did a very good job at changing the towels, taking the trash and even went as far as making a towel animal on our bed!! The lobby has several seating areas a few tables to lounge around in. They also have an amazing book collection where you can borrow a book read it and return it back to the book shelf when you finish. They have several family friend board games in the lobby that were lots of fun and a good way to relax in the evening. Not only do they provide these free activities you can also use their beach towels, mats, beach umbrellas, and boogie boards!!! ( which saves money buying any and space in your luggage) Staff: The entire environment of this hotel is friendly relaxing and happy. When you check in they provide you with cool towels and a glass of fresh pineapple juice. (YUM!) They constantly are asking how your day is, if you need any beach towels, simply saying “Hello” ir asking how your day was. On numerous occasions I saw staff members at the computer helping couples/ families/ individuas plan attractions for the day. They seem to genuinely want to help and make this a relaxing fun vacation. **on our final day we checked out of the hotel and hiked “the stairway to heaven” (HIGHLY RECOMENDED) when we returned to our hotel we were full of mud and we’re planning on changing and flying home the way we were. (I know gross right?) well the manager kindly offer us to use a vacant room free of charge for 2 hours to shower and clean up before heading home. We were so grateful at the generosity and kindness of the offer.**Breakfast:The breakfast bar I believe started at 7:00 am and ended at 9:30am (I could be wrong). They had a verity if fresh cut fruit (watermelon, pineapple, strawberry, oranges, cantaloupe, melon). They also had hard boiled eggs. Their were several pastries (sweet breads, muffins, bread with berries) they also had regular bread you could toast and put butter, Jelly, and peanut butter. They have fresh pineapple juice, hot tea, coffee (decaf as well) and fresh water that is infused with fresh fruit. Also if you do not make early because you want to relax and sleep in no worries on missing out because there was constantly staff members taking dishes and bringing out more platters of food so the breakfast bar was full. Cons: There was no pool so if you like to lay by the pool or have young children that don’t do well at the beach because of currents and prefer to swim at a pool i would consider this. Also their parking garage is Valet only and I believe is $25 a day. Other than they there was no problems! And I highly recommend staying here! This picture is our hotel view:)

The service was exceptional! A very special thank you to the staff that worked tirelessly to make sure breakfast ran smoothly! Every interaction I had with Front Desk, Concierge and House keeping was great. They are very good at anticipating your needs. There was one cover I kept removing from the bed because I didn't like it and by day two it was neatly folded on my bedside shelf for the rest of my stay.

Pros: Good pricing, great location, great service staff, modern interior, excellent location for exploring Waikiki Beach, excellent breakfast buffet, feels safe and secure.Cons: AC is a window unit and struggles to keep up on the warmer days, very small mini-fridge that does not keep drinks satisfactorily cool.

Vive Hotel Waikiki is only a few blocks from the beach, and if you're lucky you'll see a bit of the ocean from your window. The rooms are small, but cozy, and the hotel has good amenities. Breakfast is included, which is nice, and includes a lot of fresh fruit which is important when you're in Hawaii! The staff is amazing, extremely helpful and friendly.

Close to beach, shops, car hire, restaurants and other amenities.24hr reception.Air-con is old and noisy, could do with an upgrade.Room was too small to spend any down time in.Would stay at the Vive again.

This was our first time staying at Vive Hotel Waikiki. We were attached to this hotel because of the free breakfast, which not a lot of hotels in the area have. Saves money especially since you have to pay for almost everything. They also offer beach towels, beach toys, umbrellas, mats and boogie boards to borrow for the duration of your stay. Saves more money so you don't have to buy or pack any of that stuff in your luggage. Awesome customer service and friendly staff. Location is perfect. Walking distance to the beach, ABC stores, International Marketplace and other stores/restaurants. You are also guaranteed a parking space which is good since you're paying for it per day.

This boutique hotel is so welcoming and situated in a great location a few minutes from the beach. Staff are wonderful, lobby area is comfortable, relaxing and ecclectic.
