The breakfast area consists of various sized tables, chairs, arm chairs, lounges etc. which adds atmosphere. A continental style breakfast is included as part of the package and includes fresh fruit, eggs, breads and pastries, so something for everyone. Towels and beach equipment is also complimentary. Front desk staff are very hospitable and in particular Preston who went out of his way to make our stay special. The hotel concierge is very informative and can assist with booking tours, outlet buses etc and the ladies in housekeeping are kind and generous.Thoroughly recommend this hotel to Waikiki visitors.

Two blocks from Waikiki beach, it is handy to all facilities including public transport to get around Oahu. Rooms are located above the 6th floor. Clean and serviced daily. For Aussies, their continental breakfast does not include cereals, nor do the fridges in the rooms keep drinks cold. Just ask reception for some ice which you can put in the cooler to keep your drinks cold. Be aware that your room price does not include state taxes or the tourist levy which can add an additional USD30 per night. Also they have a USD12 per night resort fee for breakfast, beach towels and internet access. Staff were very friendly and helpful for first time visitors to Oahu. We would not hesitate to stay here again!

Huge Room, Comfy Bed, Great Breakfast, Boogie Board and Umbrella usage, tablet in room, 2 ac's in room, towel and juice upon arrival. Who can ask for any more - You are treated like family not as some hotel guest. A++++++++++++++++++

I’ve never heard of this hotel before until I checked out yelp for boutique hotels in Waikiki. This was one of a few I had my eyes on due to price, quality, and reviews. The boyfriend and I really enjoyed our since it was in Waikiki and we were able to walk around safely back and forth to our hotel.

Conveniently situated close to the beach and public transport. Room and bathroom very tiny with a noisy airconditioner and only a double bed. Breakfast area only had small tables to eat your food. Staff were very nice. Great for the price.

This place is situated 4 minute walk from beach , 5 minutes from international market place , 2 minute walk to a supermarket and a few foodtrucks.Service was great , room was small ( but all that we needed was there ) , clean and organised .

No resort fee! Great location in walking distance of stores, beach, and restaurants! Small rooms but very comfortable. Games in the lobby with coffee, tea, and water available 24 hours. The longer you stay, the more discounts offered by the hotel.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Vive. Location was amazing and just a small hop, skip, and jump to everything Waikiki. The rooms and lobby were extremely clean and I didn’t feel the need to break out my usual Clorox wipes (I’m extremely picky)!!! The towel swan and chocolates on the bed upon arrival were a nice welcome. We had a minor issue with the shower which was resolved very quickly. Coffee and cold water were always available which was awesome especially since waking up super early when coming from an eastern time zone is inevitable. Breakfast was good. It’s a nice continental breakfast spread (don’t expect any hot options!). Definitely try the blueberry bread! It was delicious. The only downfall was the concierge left fairly early and we were never able to ask for advice because we were gone before he/she arrived and when we got back it was after 5 and they were already gone. The beds were very comfortable and provided a good nights sleep. We got a larger room which had a nice big closet. Also be aware that the parking garage ceiling is pretty low so be careful what kind of car you rent if you plan to park it! Overall we had a great stay and would return there if visiting he Waikiki area again.

The staff were very helpful attending to our enquires. The room, although small, was adequate for our needs. After all when you go to Wakiki you do'nt intend to spend your day in the hotel. Preston & Daisey, at reception were particularly helpful, accommodating & courteous. We would have no hesitation in recommending the VIVE hotel to friends intending visiting Hawaii. The location is very good, central to every thing. All the busses stop at the door. Breakfast was an excellent selection of tropical fruits & pastreries. The 24 hour refreshments were very welcome.

We stayed at Vive Hotel Waikiki for 3 wonderful nights in one of their family suites. The location of this hotel is great and the suite is just a perfect size for us. Light breakfast in the morning was good! What sets this hotel apart though from the other hotels is definitely the staff! I would like to acknowledge Preston (front desk) for his friendly and welcoming attitude and Melly (breakfast buffet) for keeping us fed in the morning :))) and very nice food presentation when she was in charged. Most of all, I would like to give a big shout out to our “go-to person”, ROMEO from Valet! His professionalism, friendliness and hard work did not go unnoticed. Keep up your exceptional service at Valet! I highly recommend this hotel! We’ll definitely be back!!!

Great hotel with super friendly staff! From the moment we checked in until the moment we left we felt like we were valued customers. We booked this hotel because the resort fees and parking was reasonable. The breakfast buffet each morning was wonderful! Having access to beach towels and umbrellas was super helpful as well! The room was comfortable and had a nice view of the mountains and Diamond Head. While this hotel is not on the beach, Waikiki Beach is just down the street. There are also some local coffee shops nearby.

Very nice staff always willing to help for anything. Very comfortable and clean room at an affordable price. Great breakfast. Beach towels, mats and umbrellas lent for free. A concierge can help you to book great excursions still at an affordable price. Hospitality room free of charge offered after check-out. We'll definitely be back

Arrived evening 7/26 after nightmare of flight issues. The young woman at the desk was a GIFT! Hotel is 2 straight blocks from popular beach area. Tons of restaurants. Relied on other Recommendations and was so pleased! Family suite is Fabulous! 2 bedrooms and 2 full baths. This is the hotel to choose.

We love staying at Vive — have been there on 3 separate family visits! The staff, from front desk to concierge to valet parking, are all very helpful and friendly. Rooms are clean, breakfast buffet is terrific, location is ideal for walking to the beach in Waikiki or driving to any of the other gorgeous beaches. You can also catch the local bus or trolley easily from Vive to head out and explore. Mahalo to all wonderful Vive staff!

My wife & I stayed at the Vive Waikiki Hotel for 8 days. The staff were courteous and warm, and it was so handy to be able to pick up beach towels & mats from the front desk before walking only five minutes to one of the world's most famous beaches. Rooms are small but the space was well-used, and we enjoyed the design. Very private, hardly any noise heard while in our room. The air conditioning worked well and mostly was quiet, although one night ours rattled enough to interrupt our sleep. There is a fridge but it's basically to keep drinks cool -- it isn't strong enough to preserve food, and the hotel gives fair warning. Simple, delicious breakfast (pastries & juicy fresh fruit) & good coffee available free all day was lovely. Bed was comfy, shower water pressure was especially refreshing after long swims in salt water. And on our checkout day, we had a night flight, so the Vive staff let us check our bags so we could have one more activity-packed day. They even let us use a hospitality room for an hour before departing for the airport, so we could change, shower & rest briefly before our long trip home. All in all, we loved Vive, and would love to return.

Absolutely wonderful service! Love that there was a Kamaaina discount and a package with free valet parking! Rooms are smaller than other hotels but the space is used well and price is great! No complaints!

My wife and I stayed her for 5 nights for our honeymoon and it was nothing short of amazing!!! The location was great for activities in Honolulu along with the other activities throughout Oahu! The staff was great especially the guys working valet, they were extremely friendly! The free breakfast was a wonderful bonus as many hotels I searched did not have one! If you plan on staying in Honolulu I highly recommend staying at Vive! Our only regret was we wish we could have stayed longer!!!Mahalo Vive!!

Good location on Kuhio. Spend the extra $$$ and take a room on the 22nd floor. There are four, and the the only ones with balconies. They are great and worth the extra cost. Each has a view down Kuhio and a good view of the beach. Across the road is an excellent poke takeaway, and in the pink hotel next door, there's some excellent traditional Hawaiuan music every Monday. It's a jam session and some great singers and players strut their stuff.

Original room with one double (surprised with small bed) was very small and clostraphobic.I complained it wasn't acceptable for $175, so they upgraded us to very large room with Queen bed, and I was definitely satisfied. Great location to walk 2 blocks to main beach, and breakfast was great!

I stayed one week in the Vive hotel for business trip. This is a nice hotel because of its excellent service (including counter staffs and room cleaning), reasonable price, and the convenient location.Some small improvement may make it even better including extending breakfast service time (I hope it could open earlier) and maintaining the air conditioner to a quieter one.Overall, I had a comfortable trip at Vive hotel and will be willing to stay there again in the future.

We stayed at Vive Hotel Waikiki for 10 days and found it the perfect location. Very close to the beach and main shops of Waikiki with a bus stop just out the door. The breakfast buffet was a great start to the day and the staff were all very helpful and made us feel welcome. If we are lucky enough to return to Hawaii we will definitely return to Vive.

First and foremost - we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Vive Hotel Waikiki.It's located literally 5 minutes from the beach, and while you don't have "front row seats" with regards to beach view, i'd still consider it "beach-adjacent".Front desk staff was friendly and helpful - at multiple times we borrowed Boogie boards at no extra charge.Continental breakfast was rather basic, but still very tasty. There's coffee and to-go cups pretty much 24/7. There was a large assortment of fresh fruit (Pineapples, melons, ...)Our room was cozy (read: small) and while it was called "sea view", the view (from our room) was inconveniently blocked by a big hotel in front (the "Aqua pacific monarch", i believe). But i would believe that's only the case for the western-most rooms. The other sea-facing rooms should have a perfect line of sight down Uluniu Ave.Light sleepers should be aware that the window mounted AC unit is pretty loud (and you're gonna need that one turned on...).Each room has a nifty little Android tablet that fulfills multiple purposes, be it the ordering of hotel services, an alarm clock, Google maps, browsing the web, etc. The charging dock has 2 USB ports.There's barely any hooks / racks where you could hang your wet clothes.The bathroom, as well as the room itself, is clean, though the shower head needs to have the grime removed.Overall it's a great value, though.Oh, also right across the street, there's a sweet little Poke Bowl place, with the friendliest staff!

My husband and I loved staying at the Vive! Its a great location just down the road from the beach but far enough away from the hustle and bustle of waikiki shops. Everythings in walking distance. The staff were super friendly and accommodated our needs. There's free coffee and water in the lobby. The breakfast is pretty basic but enough to fill you up. Would stay again!

Located right on the outskirts of Waikiki. Quiet and everything within short walking distance <5minutes. Nicely decorated and modernized. They have tablets in every room through which you can schedule cleaning time, ask them to bring a car, etc. I hate it when you come back after long day and somebody is cleaning your room. Not a problem here. I would schedule cleaning every morning at the time that we would definitely be out.The only downside is that our room was pretty small, but I knew in advance.

The room was a little bit tight but since we didn't spend a lot of time in the room it didn't bother us much. It would have been nice to get the room dusted when housekeeping when to the room to clean.All the staff were very helpful and friendly!

Everything you need is available and the staff are always ready to help and make sure your holidays are special. Rooms are small but perfectly suited and the facilities just what you need. Location makes it easy to walk everywhere

We.had a great time in OahuThe week flew by. The Vive staff was cheerful, helpful andMade our stay great. Breakfast was awesome. The fruit was amazing. Great place to stay! It's close enough to the beach, shopping and any thing else you want to do without being in the heart of the noise.

The reception was good. The location is accessible to public transport. The room quality is high but services like changing of materials on daily basis was not thorough. Is a bit expensive and not tailored to various income classes.

We were so pleased with our selection of this small hotel, every staff member was helpful and friendly, and It was clean and comfortable. The hotel is in the middle of the Honolulu action, and only 2 blocks from the ocean. I highly recommend this hotel!

If you are adverse to large and sterile chain hotels and are looking for a fantastic boutique hotel in Waikiki, then Vive Hotel is your answer! Fantastic staff and everything you could need for your stay,

Excellent value for money. Convenient to bus, town and beach.Had 2 bedroom family room, was lovely. Had 2 bathrooms as well.Left my adapter in wall plug so phoned hotel. They immediately sent some one to the room to look for it. Phoned me back and kept until we could collect it. Thank you. Great service.

Tiny room. In-window air con noisy and ineffective. Bed OK but pillows too soft. Tiniest bathroom i have ever seen. Sadly booked there another night on return from Hilo. Wish I had seen before booking

We love to rent resort equipments such as bodyboards, beach towels, etc.Friendly service. Good amenities. Clean room.Room is not so spacious, but enough.Wind from air-conditioner directly hit us on bed. The wind was little strong for Japanese and my wife didn't like it, so she wore a mask.

Great location for beach, restaurants and shopping. The room was a little small and the air conditioning really noisy (we complained for that and they sent a technician the day after to replace the device, very good!), but we could still hear the air conditioning noise of the next room. Breakfast was just fine, can be improved. Staff very kind and always available, great assistance from the concierge girls.

Great location, friendly staffs, reasonable price, room is clean, service is good. Love to crab a cup of ice water in the lobby when we come back, it is so refreshing! Especially thanks Roger, Liz and KC for providing information before we arrived. You guys did great job!

I stayed at the VIVE Hotel since 2013~ This is the only place I stay in Waikiki. The front desk service is excellent. David is the epitome of customer care and management. The cleaning crew is quick efficient and pleasant. If feels like family that's why we come year after year. The first year, we caught the grand opening and received 6 $40 Visa gift cards~ Talk about a huge perk. Besides that the rooms are chic, the decor is spot on, and you are able to borrow beach equipment at no charge (e.g. mats, chairs, yoga mats, boogie boards etc.

We only stayed one night as we used it as our last stop of our trip before heading to the airport the next day. I chose the hotel because of the small resort and parking fee compared to surrounding hotels. The room served its purpose for 1 night but I definitely wouldn’t stay longer than 2 nights. There is construction outside next door and even though we were on the 12th floor, it was very loud. We didn’t try the continental breakfast but it is complimentary each morning. We loved the proximity to everything. Very easy walk to the beach and multiple places to eat including shopping.

The service and staff were wonderful help full the location was walking distant to just about every thing The room was comfortable I would stay there again The room was OK but had to call to get the room made up .

This hotel was beyond disappointing. The rooms are so small and lack luster. It was really disappointing. I was hoping to have a romantic get away but we couldn't even relax in the room. Depressing. Really bad rooms. There are plenty of great hotels in Waikiki but this definitely is not one of them. Completely missed the mark with the boutique hotel vibe.

We stayed there for 5 nights in May. The room was nice and clean, the staff was kind and we also took advantage of the hotel parking (which is 25$ per night if I remember well). Moreover, you get a good breakfast with a lot of local fresh fruit, which is good for the price.

Just amazing. First stay june 2017 for 44th anniversary. Came back this june for our 45th. Staff caring and remembered us. Preston Christine beverly and kc wonderful. Loved our room and breakfast. Thanks kc for recommending top of waikiki for our anniversary dinner. Hopefully will be back for 44th next year only at the vive.

Okay - so yes, the rooms are a bit on the small side -- BUT, did you really fly across an ocean to sit in the Hotel?? We didn't!! Here's what you will get with Vive -- We arrived about 11p night (our 4a, exhausted). The staff was pleasant and welcoming. Got to our room and found the sweetest note about my daughter's graduation, congratulating her! The staff daily exceeded my expectations! The concierge, KC, was amazing. The breakfast was delicious. This is the only place we will stay when we return to Waikiki. :)

My husband and I stayed here for our second visit to Oahu. We were greeted by really friendly staff, a glass of orange juice and face cloths to freshen us up. Roger answered all our questions. Location is great as it us walking distance to the Waikiki strip. Right across it is the Iyasume Musubi cafe which offers a variety of musubis! The hotel also offers free breakfast which is a big bonus! I suggest the pineapple with the seasoning they recommend with it! Preston was really helpful when we had a problem with our booking going to Hanauma Bay (In hindsight, we should’ve just booked it with the hotel and not an independent company). Having a dedicated concierge for car rentals is really helpful too. The room space is adequate enough but we were just a bit iffy about have the bathroom almost right beside the bed. Other than that, everything was excellent! We recommended this hotel to friends who are planning to visit in a few months. We would definitely book in this hotel again in our future visits. Keep up the good work!

Room was good but too many fees. Paid an extra $100 fee when we checked in then at the end of the stay we were charged another $84 for resort fees that were not explained when we checked in. The air conditioner is so loud it would wake me up in the middle of the night. Breakfast was good lots of fruits and breads.

I worked about 9 miles away but wanted to stay near restaurants and beach. I liked that there was no resort fee since I wouldn’t have used pool ect. They have beach stuff free to use. The breakfast was nice. Front desk staff could have been more friendly but they always answered questions and did their job. Maybe working in hospitality in Hawaii wears on you. Also my safe wouldn’t work multiple times. Room is really small with no balcony but it was fine for 1 person.

Excellent location and staff very friendly and helpful. Also breakfast very good . The only downside was the air con in the room was so noisy it was hard to sleep some nights , that said we didn’t complain so the hotel didn’t know. Overall a great value for money hotel!
user_name:
robh10777
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: Hotel is located in central Waikiki on the Main Street with a bus stop right in front. A short 150m stroll to the beach. Clean rooms and the breakfast buffet of fruit, pastries and breads was high quality. There is a lounge area with board games, 24hr tea and coffee station, library and tour desk downstairs. Free use of towels and beach gear and the staff were really helpful.

We stayed one week. Best was the near distance to the brach and the brach towel etc. service. Breakfast was not as good as expected, but better than nothing. Coming from Europe, it is essential for many hotel tourists to experience a really good and rich breakfast for which you do not have to leave the hotel. The service at the reception and the concierge was excellent. The rooms are very nice and we'll equipped, but our rooms could have been a little bigger.

My husband and I love Vive Hotel!! The staff were great and friendly, especially Daisy at the reception and Romeo at the valet parking side. Best of all, we love the location! It's a less than 5-minute walk to Waikiki Beach and along the way, you can get delicious musubi from the cafe just outside the hotel. We didnt regret choosing Vive at all. The rooms were very clean too. Great stay!

The cons - small room (big enough), AC didn't cool as well as I would have liked. The pros - everything else! Great service, nice valet for car, nice breakfast area and fruit, location was perfect literally maybe 5 minute walk to beaches and restaurants. Having beach chair included helped a lot with visiting local beaches. So considering the price and location I can not be happier with the hotel.

Having just returned from vive after to lovely weeks in the hotel which was wonderfully clean lovely towels and a lovely room.Thanks to Preston Daisy and Erwin making our stay unforgettable Preston thanks for all you done getting our boarding passes .Oh i forgot about Roger your really nice when you smile.Would come back again and hope you all would be still there thanks again Doris and Jessie two scottish ladies

Excellent location, modern vibe to the Vive. The rooms were small but clean and very functional, the staff was friendly. Breakfast very basic continental but all you really need. Step outside and you're a short walk from Waikiki, which is nice feature. Overall, we were generally pleased with our stay.

Good location which is near the Waikiki downtown & beach. The room is clean and comfortable whih will be better if the window can be opened. It includes a nice breakfast. The receptors are all gentle and kind.

The room was small. The sound of air conditioner and cars running on Kuhio Avenue was noisy. The Bus and the Waikiki Trolley stop were very close. The free breakfast of breads, fresh fruits and drinks was delicious. The stuff was very friendly. I enjoyed traveling comfortably to Waikiki.

Ideally located so just a short walk for our daily trip to the beach.Towels and Mats supplied at no charge.Hotel is very clean and tidy with daily room service with clean bath towels daily. Helpful staff and a free buffet breakfast included. Complementary Coffee and Tea available 24 hours

The rooms are cool and modern and the breakfast is what we liked to start the day. Also we are a short stroll from the beach and the buzz of Waikiki. Staff were helpful and friendly - we got our beach towels etc each day. The concierge gave us great support on our Pearl Harbor outing which worked really well

Not as big and flash as some of the other hotels but great value in terms of price, location, service and amenities. Complimentary breakfast, free Wi-Fi and low resort fee. No pool but only a 5 minute walk to Kuhio beach. Handy to shops and restaurants and has a bus stop virtually at the front door. Rooms were comfortable and clean and the staff were helpful and courteous. We wouldn’t hesitate staying there again.

We like to eat cereal with milk for breakfast to start the day and have found most places where we have stayed within the US and Canada provide this. Also, we found sitting in lounge style chairs with a small side table as opposed to a dining table and upright chair awkward and uncomfortable for eating a meal.

We really loved our stay at Vive Waikiki. The hotel was quiet and comfortable, but still in the middle of the action - only a few blocks from the beach. This is the perfect place to stay if you want a small, cozy room to unwind after a day of exploring. It's not a resort, it doesn't have a pool and the rooms are on the small side, but it is a great place to lay your head before your next night of adventure.The staff at the Vive were helpful from the beginning. When we first arrived before check in they let us stash our luggage so we could wander around Waikiki until the room was ready. At check in they give you a cold, damp towel and a fresh glass of pineapple juice - what a great aloha! The breakfasts were relatively simple: hard boiled eggs, fresh fruit, toast and pastries - but they were all delicious and always well stocked. The lobby is trendy and comfortable and was a great place to relax and eat breakfast. The stay was delightful and the room was just what we needed between days of snorkeling and catamaran rides. The concierge was a big help as we planned our days. We did the escape to paradise package and it was great. The package fully covered our catamaran trip - what a deal! The trip was through Holokai Catamaran - which I have also reviewed. We snorkeled with green sea turtles and had a beautiful sail to diamond head. It was by far our favorite part of our trip and we only did it because Vive offered the package. Finally, when we went to check out the staff at the front desk noticed that we had a evening flight and offered us a courtesy room. We were able to leave our luggage again, have a full day on the beach and then come back and use the courtesy room to take a quick shower and nap (you get the room for an hour) before we called a Lyft to the airport. All this for no extra charge!Vive is perfect for a couple looking to leave the traditional resort behind for a more international experience - our fellow guests were from all over the world! Plus there are great Poke and Musubi places right across the street. We'll definitely be back!

Very good value in terms of location, service and amenities. Complimentary breakfast, Wi-Fi, beach accessories. Proximity to beach, shopping and restaurants was excellent. Rooms were comfortable and well equipped.

We arrived at your hotel and were impressed until we got into our room. It was very small and not what we were expecting. We checked the room as we normally do and found the mattress/bed/sheets to be dirty. We called concierge and they made it right by moving us rooms and upgrading our room. We were very happy after that! We really appreciated the breakfast, the free books to borrow, the beach supplies to use, and the curtosey room. I will definitely be coming back and telling everyone to stay here!

Being one of the smaller hotels we’ve stayed at, the staff made us feel like wanted guests, not just people giving them money to sleep there. For our family of 5, this was a major plus! Few walking minutes to the beach✅ Bus line next to the hotel ✅Ala Moana Mall 7 minutes away ✅Coffee/ fruit infused water all day ✅Oven/microwave 24 hours ✅Board games to play ✅Beach towels/ umbrella/mat ✅24 hour valet for car/bike ✅Comfortable living room chairs ✅Tablet in room ✅Wi-fi ✅Robes ✅Environmentally friendly hotel ✅

The staff were great. Friendly and supporting our requests. Location perfect short walk to the beach. The bed was very comfortable and we had a great night's sleep. The only negative was the air conditioning unit in our room was so noisy that we had to turn it off during the night to sleep. I would stay at this hotel again and also recommend it to friends.

My sister and I had a great time at Vive. The breakfast was very enojoyable everyday. They have beach towels, beach chairs, umbrellas, beach mats, etc. that are available to use free of charge. On our last day in Honolulu (we were flying out overnight) they held our luggage for us so we could spend the day at the beach and we were able to book a hospitality room for one hour (free of charge) so that we could shower, rest, etc. before leaving. The staff were very friendly and helped us with any questions we had. Highly recommend.

Great place close to the beach and different attractions in the Waikiki area. Staff was welcoming, helpful, polite, and accommodating! Rooms were clean and the bed was very comfortable. I had a great time at Vive.

We had an amazing experience with VIVE hotel. The staff is so nice. The breakfast they had out everyday was full of fresh fruit. They came in & made our bed and cleaned everyday. The location couldn’t be better! We will be back next time we visit!

Very friendly and helpful staff !!!Nice and clean rooms, very comfortable mattress!Very good location, near beach and bus station for the trips in the city!Breakfast always fresh with lot of fruits ( great!!).

Very conveniently located, minutes to the beach and shopping by foot. Service was great, simple but clean room. Breakfast had a limited selection and seating but thoroughly enjoyed 24 access to tea and coffee.

Great location, friendly atmosphere, reasonably priced. Very clean & orderly. Close bus lines, beach, shopping malls etc. Complimentary wi-Fi, beach accessories, continental breakfast. Parking available.

Close to beach, shopping and transport. Service was helpful. Rooms small but acceptable. Bathroom was cozy. Main issue was older style and noisy air conditioning. Other guests running overnight rather than just having window open slightly for a nice breeze over bed.

We loved our stay at Vive hotel. The location was just two blocks away from Waikiki Beach and the rooms are clean and nicely updated. The staff was always super friendly and you just cant beat the price for the location.

Great location, friendly staff, clean rooms, great inclusions and discounted meals at nearby eateries, fabulous Hawaiian breakfast, generally a great overall upbeat feeling. I’ll be returning soon - thank you for making a short break wonderful

I chose to stay at Vive for my holiday - it’s in a great location, so central to the beaches and Waikiki shopping malls. The bus and trolley stops are just next door, so going to Ala Moana and further afield was easy. They provided towels and mats for going to the beach, no need to bring your own. The rooms were clean, with comfy bed and pillows. The concierges were always ready to help, Roger was my usual go to, such a gentleman and always so polite. Daisy was my next go to, such a cheerful presence behind the desk.I recommend this place to anyone, I look forward to staying here on my next trip to Honolulu.

Great location with lots of privacy. The room was clean and well cared for. Just a short three blocks to the beach. A friendly staff always ready to help you. The breakfast had great coffee and fruit, we would stay here again.

Service was great. Location was great and breakfast was wonderful. I enjoyed my stay. The room was average for the price. Had a problem with shower had to request service twice. Second request shower was unstopped. Room could have been cleaned better during my stay.

The boyfriend and I chose Vive Hotel because his sister had stayed here a couple of times and said that price and location were reasonable. Check in was at 3p and we arrived around 130p but they were able to accommodate us quickly. Front desk staff was very nice and professional. The room and restroom was a tad small but it's not like we were going to be there all day so it was ok. The hotel offers beach towels, beach chairs, umbrella, boogie boards, and beach mats so be sure to grab some before leaving for the day. Main reason I was pleasantly surprised was that they have a hospitality room which is basically a regular room for guests who have a late flight but would still like to go to the beach or hike before leaving. You have to book a time slot for it and have one hour to shower and freshen up before heading to the airport. It allowed us to utilize the last day of our vacation! I've travelled quite a bit and this is the only hotel I've come across that has this amenity. We will definitely stay here again when we're in Waikiki!

Great hotel, centrally located in busy Waikiki, very short walk (3 mins?)to the beach. 10/10 would recommend this hotel to a friend. Looks like it was an older hotel, that was tastefully redone- attention paid nicely to incorporating modern trends- bright colors, library with books to borrow, board games. -Satisfying breakfast in the AM.-Great value for price-Rooms are tidy but small: but really who needs a big room in Hawaii?-All staff was friendly and attentive, especially Jordan and Roger.

I have stayed here twice on visits now. It’s a great location only 2 blocks back from the duke statue on the main strip of Waikiki. The rooms are always clean. Check in is great, after a long flight they give you fresh juice and a warm hand towel when you arrive. There is a basic buffet breakfast with toast and fruit. But there is tea and coffee and cold water available in the lobby all day and bight which I loved. Both times I got a room upgrade which was amazing. Rooms with water views can see the beach even though you are not on the main strip. It’s walking distance to the beach and all the great shops and restaurants. Many airport shuttles go to this hotel. There is valet parking available at the hotel. You can also borrow towels, umbrellas and beach toys from the lobby. There is also a local information desk that can help you with local info and tours.

Lovely staff Will help you with anything Rooms are very small Close to beach and buses Wouldn’t stay there again Cheapest parking in Waikiki $25 a day What I could find Breakfast in the morning was good

Came for work on short notice and couldn’t get my typical hotel choice. The experience at Vive was fantastic from the moment I walked in, close to everything w/o being too touristy. Great food at good prices nearby, or go elegant and yummy at Hy’s right next door. Breakfast was great, love the fresh guava juice each morning.

Two swans made from towels with a note and chocolate were waiting for us on the bed. Room was spacious, clean and had a wonderful view. The bed was very comfortable. The shower room was huge. Free cold water, coffee and tea offered in the lobby. Beach items like boogie boards, slippers, umbrellas available for free too. Staff very friendly. Free internet. Breakfast with lots of fruits and different breads was nice. I found the blueberry bread delicious.This is a nice boutique hotel with a personal touch different from the huge crowded Hiltons and Sheratons. Highly recommended!

We stayed here for a week in May. It was the best hotel I could find at that price range during the time we were there. It is by no means a luxury hotel but it is very good. Very close to the beach 2-3 minutes walk, close to surf board rental, very close to a lot of resraurants, shopping... and also a bus stop right in front if you are going farther on the island. Check in was fast, we were greeted with pineapple juice and wet towels. The room was not very big but if you go to Hawaii to spend time in your room you're wasting your time and money. The shower drain was very slow to drain on the first night, but they fixed it right away when we called the next day. Breakfast could improve a lot, the items are what you would expect from a small cheap motel, so we chose to go elsewhere for a couple of mornings.They have towels, umbrellas and chairs for the beach which is nice. Wifi is free (not free really, there is a resort fee which includes wifi and other services)No other amenities that we were aware of.

The staff is super helpful and friendly. Very nice hotel off the beach. Short walk to the beach and very convenient valet in garage right next door. Room was nice and breakfast and coffee tasty. The infused ice water in lobby a nice treat after returning from the beach. Beach supplies free to borrow. We were grateful to the military discount and free military valet service. Thank you!

Super close to the beach and beach towel/chairs/boogey boards included to borrow. Room was small. Overall Waikiki is pricey but this hotel had good value for the price. Free breakfast from 7-9 which had a lot of fresh fruit. Would recommend if visiting to Waikiki and not wanting to spend over 300/night

I stayed in vive hotel for a week and I really appreciated the services. I also enjoyed the location very close to the beach and the commercial area. I would definitely recomend that place and come again for my next trip to Honolulu.

This is an awesome boutique hotel in a central location. The staff are friendly, rooms clean and the self serve breakfast was great. A big plus is the beach towels, umbrellas and boogie boards you can borrow. The rooms are comfy and clean. Just a couple of blocks away from the beach there are numerous shops and restaurants within a stones throw. I would definitely stay here again.

We, 3 rooms to the seaside, had a good time in your hotel. But, when we check out, we found amenity fee for all 3 rooms even though 1 room can not see any of the sea view. So we ask to the front lady to adjust that. But it was not accepted by so many kinds of her own reason talk. You know, if we ask something wrong to customer, there is a certain reason for that. Anyhow, we, except for that, others are satisfactory. But, we can not recommend your hotel is good to my Korean colleagues. With some tiny thing, Vive can lose customers.

Paid for our room several weeks prior to travel,which was fine. But the morning we were leaving we found a note under our door claiming service charges of $36.00 usd. Not impressed but had to pay. The extra charges are vague something about getting superior service or whatever. It's a bit like the cruise ship we came off,hit with a gratuity charge to pay staff. All this because US companies pay low wages but still charge top prices for food and service etc. I believe the average hourly rate for workers in Hawaii is around $8 an hour. We travel to Honolulu about every two years ,Vive is off our list of places to stay. Cannot stand hidden charges.

The Vive isn't fancy, but it does all the basics well. Our room was small, but clean and comfy. The staff are helpful, the free breakfast was good and we liked the being provided with complimentary beach gear (towels, mats, chair, umbrellas etc..). It's just couple of blocks back from the beach. Grab a longboard and go and join in the madness at Canoes which is a great surf break for beginners.

Great location and very friendly helpful staff.I enjoyed the complimentary breakfast and the coffee and tea available continuously as well as the fresh fruit infused water...lovely.Join their Vive site to avoid resort charges...

My husband and I travelled to Hawaii for the first time in celebration of our 5th wedding anniversary and our soon-to-be-born baby girl. Overall, we had a great experience in this hotel and were glad we chose to stay at VIVE. Pros: 1) Parking: At the time of our booking, there was a special going that offered 50% off the daily parking/valet rate. It was especially helpful that you could schedule to have your car brought down at a certain time by way of an in-room tablet app. This made travel around the island easy (which we did nearly every day)2) Breakfast is included. This was one of the deciding factors that led us to chose this hotel over others because of the money we could save not eating out for breakfast. Each morning, they serve an assortment of pastries and fresh cut fruits, along with pineapple juice, water, and coffee. 3) The beach. This hotel is walking distance to Waikiki Beach. It was very easy to get from our room to the ocean in less than 5 minutes. The hotel also offers beach chairs, towels, mats, and other essentials. 4) The service. The staff were always helpful and kind. We never had an issue with any request. This is a reason why we would return to this hotel again if we were to visit Hawaii again. 5) Lobby Interior. It is always nice to arrive back to an elegant, fun-looking place. Cons: 1) Room details. We selected the smaller queen ocean view room. While we could see the ocean from our window every morning, the window was small, and we also got a direct view into other windows of an adjacent high-rise building. I found myself wishing I had booked a room at another hotel with an ocean view and balcony, or at least one that had a window large enough for me to see the ocean while sitting in a chair. I had to stand to see the view. Not a huge deal, as we did not spend a whole lot of time in the room, but this would keep us from returning. 2) Room details part 2. We originally booked a studio apartment for our trip, but upon learning that it did not have AC and knowing that I would be 6 months pregnant, we decided to look for a place with AC The small unit in the room did not cool the room well, and the air was muggy and uncirculated. One window did open, but that did not offer circulation needed to freshen the air. Overall, we were glad to stay here on our first trip to Hawaii. Next time, we will opt to rent a home or studio in a more remote location with at least a kitchenette

Great location, affordable, great amenities and amazing customer experience from the employees - you can't go wrong at Vive Hotel. Although the room may seem smaller, who stays at their hotel rooms in Hawaii anyways??? Don't think twice, just book straight from their website to avoid the resort fee! You won't regret it! Oh and btw, they have free beach towels, umbrellas, chairs and mats that you can take with you to other beaches all over the island. They have continental breakfast every morning and coffee, tea and water at night. Also, look for KC at the Concierge -- coolest person ever! Makes you feel like family, the real Hawaiian way! And the Filipino guy at the valet (sorry we forgot your name), he's super helpful and also very friendly. Customer service was above and beyond! We'll definitely be back!

The Vive Hotel was a great choice. It was reasonably priced, great location near the beach, and the staff was friendly and very attentive. The rooms were small and relatively basic, but they were clean -- and you're probably spending most of your time on the beach or hiking/outdoors anyway. The breakfast was not fancy, but fresh fruits and some pastries were a nice refreshing start to the morning. The hotel also had beach towels/mats etc for use. There was a fee for parking (valet), but there were in/out privileges, and it's waikiki -- so parking is going to be expensive everywhere/and the rate was comparable to other hotels in the area. Would stay at Vive again.

Just nice a stay for a fews days and affordable. The location in the heart of Waikiki makes it easy to go out in the evening. We only can recommend it and if we come once back it will be out our first choice

Located 2 blocks from Waikiki beach and the International shShopping Centre the location of this hotel could not be better.It even has a bus stop right outside for easy transport round the island. The staff were extremely helpful and provide beach chairs umbrellas etc all free of charge. The rooms were a little small but some even have sea views and were extremely clean. It was a perfect spot for our short stay in Waikiki

Two blocks back from the beach in an excellent location. Room and bathroom were small but functionable. We were welcomed early and given a courtesy room later prior to going to the airport. We would stay again

Expected slightly bigger room but it was ok, we wanted to spend time outside as much as we could. Stuff was great, friendly and always helpful. Breakfast could be much better, but we felt that management is not caring about quality of it too much under cover of

Room & Hotel facilities were all very good. Staff were helpful & the cleaners presented the room well . Tea , coffee & water available in the foyer was greatly appreciated . The hotel was in a good location. A pool was the only holiday luxury missing.

Loved the room, views, location and especially the service!Everyone who worked here was awesome. Ryan the Valet was especially awesome. Everyone at front desk was as well but I do remember Daisy going above and beyond.Yes, the room was small, but who cares. It was super nice and really only a place to sleep. If you are at Waikiki, and in your hotel room, then there is a problem.It was just Aces all the way around.I remember thinking that I need someone to give me their lottery winnings so that I can live at Vive!

My flight was delayed so I wasn't able to arrive the evening I was expecting to. I called Vive as soon as I was made aware and asked if I could not be charged for the night since I wasn't staying due to flight delay. I was told I needed to cancel 5 days in advance to not be charged. I couldn't know 5 days in advance my flight would be delayed!!! I was told no, and I would still be charged, and i was. While i was at the desk after i did finally arrive another guest got a room comp'ed that they did stay in while I get charged for not staying. Not happy!

My wife and I had a great time. The room was a good size for the price, it was clean, modern, the staff was nice, it was a short walk to the beach away from the noise and they let you borrow beach gear.

Rooms were clean and renovated. Staff was friendly and always available to provide assistance. Walking distance to the Kuhio Waikiki beach and it was great to have beach towels, mats and umbrellas available for use. The continental breakfast and coffee options had something for everyone to enjoy. The feature we appreciated the most was booking the complimentary room for 1hr so we could freshen up prior to our flight home which was a late departure. We would stay here again in the future.

* Quick check in (pineapple juice & a cold towel provided) * Hotel provides beach mats, towels, chairs, umbrellas, boogie boards which were very useful * There's a tablet in your room which you can use to have valet bring your car up so it's ready when you get to the parking lot, or for a number of other services which was very handy * The room is adequate, but small. There are pull out drawers under the bed. Extra hangers & extra shelving in the bathroom, which also has limited space, would be helpful.* The hotel is a short walk to waikiki beach and easy access to the highway for day trips * Breakfast was simple, but great* All the hotel staff we encountered were really nice

Room was ok, nothing special. Window ac kept room at decent temp. Charging for bottled water in room is absurd. Staff was always courteous and helpful when needed or asked about specific activities. Would stay again.

We booked the Vive from reviews that were posted and the cost associated with the hotel. We were very happy with the room and the welcome we received at your hotel.The room was clean and the staff were very pleasant to deal with. The proximity to the beach was excellent.

Stayed here for 10 nights.We arrived at the hotel at 6am. Preston on the front desk tried to pull some strings to get us checked in asap. He wasn't able to get us a room straight away, but told us to return around 11am. Upon our return, Preston advised that the room was ready. Great news!The rooms are ok size. More than enough for 2 people.I definitely agree with previous reviewers about the level of noise coming from the A/C unit, however, it did not impact on our sleep. The beds were nice and comfy, very soft. I'm normally sleep on a firm mattress, but had no problem sleeping 8 plus hours uninterrupted. They also provide a free basic breakfast in the morning, various types of savoury and sweet pastries, and fresh fruit. Tea and Coffee is also available. You can fill up your water bottles before leaving for your adventure as well.Free use of beach towels and mats were available to guests as well.Overall, great hotel for the price.

When I decided to finally go to Honolulu, Hawaii and I was reseaching hotels this property stood out among all the rest. The Staff, Housekeeping, and Concierge were excellent. Two blocks out the front door and you are at the world famous Waikiki Beach. Fantastic restuarants and bars are very close. While all I heard was how expensive it was to be here I found that not to be true. There are wonderful deals to be had everywhere. My room although small was wonderfully appointed and comfortable. The views were beyond my wildest imagination. The front desk staff were amazing. I want to personally give a shout out to Daisy, Preston, and Christine for their professionalism and dedication to customer service. Thank you very much for making my stay in Hawaii not only memorable but special because of the service you provided me on a daily basis. Stay here and say hi to them. KC, the Concierge, was most knowledgeable and very helpful. This hotel was so wonderful I am already planning a return trip. Mahalo Vive Hotel and I look forward to my return visit.

Apart from the very small room with no balcony and a noisy window air conditioner, there are many good things to say about the Vive Hotel. Excellent location handy to transport, Waikiki Beach and shops, very pleasant staff, and the alfresco breakfast are all pluses. Upgrade to a junior suite and enjoy this pleasant budget hotel!

It was my first time ever visiting Oahu and had booked my stay with Vive Hotel Waikiki. It was a great location to walk to the beach and to shops close by. Daisy at the concierge was friendly and helpful. Romeo was a very nice valet representative for the guest parking. The rooms were modern, clean and comfortable.

The hotel is in a great location. Very short stroll to the beach, shops and restaurants. There is a bus stop close by to take you anywhere in Honolulu although we never needed to use it. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Especially Daisy and Kasi. The concierge desk was great and we planned a lot of our holiday activities through them. Overall a great experience.

We enjoyed our stay Vive. We needed to come in a day early and the young lady a the desk was very helpful. Although the room was small we didn't spend much in it. The breakfast was minimal. Morgan was very helpful with answering our questions. Would stay here again.

Very friendly and helpful staff nice breakfast lovely stay thank you. Would recommend your property to anyone travelling to your beautiful island.We found your property close to the beach and shopping and pick up points for trips. Highly delightful stay .Thank you to all your staff.

We stayed at Vive hotel for 10 days and had a lovely stay. Service was excellent and hotel clean and fresh. Breakfast with fresh fruits everyday was great. Towels and other beach equipments available for guests.

We had a great time, staff was overall very friendly and efficient. Room was small but we knew that when we rented but it was just right for us, quiet and cozy. We always took advantage of the downstairs lobby.

Step inside Vive Hotel and you see a bright, cheerful lobby and common area immune to the bustle of Kuhio Avenue outside. Most will find this hotel has the perfect mix of amenities. Who needs a swimming pool when Waikiki Beach is just a couple of blocks away? The location right on major city bus lines to Ala Moana or Manoa is a big plus. The standard rooms are quiet and spotless. In an area with high hotel prices, Vive Hotel is probably one of the best value for money propositions.

We arrived late at night, checkin was quick, efficient, friendly-just what we hoped for after a long set of flights. Our room was lovely, clean, spacious and very comfortable. Def recommend paying for the upgrade in room! Def recommend this hotel.

Service: The staff were friendly and accommodating for our needs. We traveled in a group of three adults, and were given an extra room key so we wouldn't have to share. During our stay, one key did malfunction, but the staff were very helpful in giving us a new one. Also, when we initially checked in, we were given complimentary moist towels and glasses of fresh pineapple juice to rejuvenate after our flight. Overall, service was excellent during our stay.Cleanliness: The hotel was clean in general. Our room, which was the Cosmopolitan Family Suite, was also clean. Value/Location: This is where the Vive Hotel Waikiki's greatest strength lies. The location isn't directly by the beach, but is a very short walking distance away. This means you get the benefit of being able to go to the beach whenever you like, but without all the noise and hustle that the hotels directly by the beach have. There are also plenty of food options in the area that are good eats when you get hungry. Breakfast is served daily and is satisfactory. The hotel provides free rentals of beach towels, chairs, and mats so you don't have to worry about purchasing those. Room/Sleep Quality: As much as I enjoyed my stay, I do have to be critical. The room was fine and accommodated my party of three adults. What I did not particularly enjoy was that the shower heads in the bathrooms were quite outdated. Also, the air conditioner was loud and noisy. As a light sleeper, this made it hard to fall asleep. I believe these are easy fixes and if hotel management reads this review, please consider addressing these areas.Overall: The Vive Hotel Waikiki is an excellent value hotel in a fantastic location. If you are the type who demands 4/5-star amenities (fitness room, swimming pools, balconies with clear beach/mountain views), then you may be better off looking elsewhere. However, if you don't care about those things, you'll have a great stay at this hotel and save some of that cash in your wallet for something else on the beautiful island of Oahu.

The rating is a weak 4. Helpful staff, clean and fresh hotel. Everything is close in Waikiki so exact location is not very important. The breakfast was simple but the fresh fruit made it a nice start of the day. The breakfast area is too small for the number of guests, we repeatedly saw guests that had to wait for quite some time for a table. The aircon was loud and we had to use earplugs to sleep properly. Wifi worked fine. Water cooker can be requested at the lobby.

We stayed here late April for 6 nights.Staff was very helpful and we had a junior suite which was so worth paying the extra dollars and we were on the 20th floor,the room was a good size and it had a very big shower and the King size bed was so comfortable.Location was a bonus and we walked everywhere.The ABC shops were everywhere and the quality after traveling to the big Island and driving everywhere was very good as you can buy gifts,beer,wine,food,wraps,sandwiches .Breakfast was continental so no hot food but it filled you up and it was included in the hotel.

My brother and I and our better half's stayed at this hotel in separate rooms. Unfortunately my brother had a issue with his and his wife's room. He like my wife and a l booked a suite a year ago. To his dismay he found that his room was 2 levels lower than he booked a year ago. While we understand these things happen, too our great disappointment the staff at the front desk made absolutely no efforts (and I mean nothing) to rectify the situation in any fashion. This is no way to treat a senior firefighter and his wife. Very dissatisfied.

Very nice hotel. Everyone was kind and friendly. The room was large and clean. The bed was better then my bed at home. The complementary breakfast every morning was great! If I ever go back, I will choose this hotel first.

Staying at Vive was a highlight to our trip. The front desk staff was extremely pleasant and helpful! The daily breakfast was just icing on the cake. It was good to roll out of bed and have food available. It’s not a 5 star breakfast but definitely something quick to start your day. Another amenity that made the hotel worth it was the beach equipment readily available. All of the hotel amenities, staff and proximity to the beach compensated for the small room size.

Roger was a great receptionist, made my day, room was small but intimate. Could use alil updating but it was good......nice location can see the beach from hotel room add waking distance as well, walk to food to.

The rooms are very small and musty. Our flight was delayed and we missed our first night at motel but they refused to do anything for us. The wifi wasn’t working and after calling several times they had a IT guy phone me to set up my tablet to get wifi... the hotel is close to the beach but has no view. Wouldn’t recommend this hotel.

Good value for Waikiki Beach. Excellent location, short walk to beach, on the bus line. Staff friendly and always helpful - thank you Preston. Only drawback is smaller size but think cruise ship cabin and you'll think it's fine. Also, bathroom sink is modern but leaves no counter space, and hand towels are not near the sink. For 2 nights pre-cruise it was perfect. Nice continental breakfast too!!!

The hotel is very well located 2 blocks away from Waikiki beach, all the main shops and restaurants. The room was very comfortable, spacious, modern, well designed and decorated. No outstanding view of the ocean but it is not a beach front hotel.Breakfast provided every morning as well as coffee and cold infused water all day.Beach towels are also provided for free along with a courtesy room for lat flight departures which was extremely convenient and allowed us to shower and change before heading to the airport.Thank you to all the staff at Vive hotel which made every effort to answer and accommodate our requests.
user_name:
Charlotte B
New York City, New York

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at the Vive Hotel!!! We were warmly greeted at reception with welcome pineapple drinks and cold towels. Preston told us about the area and gave us a map and hotel information. We were early to check in, but fortunately our room was ready (lovely after a long flight!)We had a Cosmopolitan Family Suite - 2 rooms, separated by a partial wall with 2 bathrooms (fantastic to have 2 bathrooms!). Our room was well presented and clean (and had 2 tablets). While the rooms are not large, they are very good for the price. Our room was at the back of the hotel and we had no issues with noise. It was great to have a continental breakfast provided - pastries, loads of fresh fruit, coffee, tea, toast, hard boiled eggs, and juice. The breakfast is provided in the lobby area, which has comfortable chairs and looks out to a tiny garden area. (My only criticism would be that there are disposable cups for the drinks and some of the cutlery is also disposable. Great that the plates and some of the cutlery were not disposable.)The Vive Hotel is in an excellent location - a very short walk to the beach. Beach towels, beach mats etc are available to use, which we really appreciated. All of the staff that we dealt with were very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. I would highly recommend staying at the Vive Hotel.

The rooms were very small and with air conditioning units on the windows, high winds would keep us up all night! Service was friendly and breakfast was ok but I would stay elsewhere next time I’m in Waikiki.

My wife and I spent three nights at the VIVE Hotel Waikiki before boarding a cruise. We enjoyed our stay. Hotel is just a five-minutes walk to Waikiki beach and all the great hotels and shopping areas.The hotel staff is very pleasant and responsive to our needs. The room we were in on the 19th floor was very clean and always had plenty of towels. The bed was comfortable and the air conditioning unit worked very well and was not noisy. The room is small and so is the bathroom ; nevertheless we managed well within the space available.The hotel offers complimentary daily continental breakfast. Although on the limited side as to choices, it served us well and we did not feel the need to go and eat elsewhere. Cost of room is decent compare with major ocean front hotels. I would recommend for budget concious travellers.

We were greeted at reception by Preston, who was very helpful in explaining things to make our stay in Honolulu very enjoyable. He even assisted when we had a problem with a tablet. The rooms are relatively small but OK with 2 large suit cases and hand luggage. We had a room overlooking the ocean but the hotel being on a heavy traffic road was a noisy in the mornings. If you had a room on not facing the road it would have been quieter but no view. The continental breakfast was adequate to start the day. The lounge area was available 24/7 to sit and relax and enjoy free tea and coffee at any time. A microwave was also available to use at any time. The Concierge Lady was also very helpful in advising which were the best tours. Overall very happy with our stay at the Vive.

On arrival first impressions count and this place was one that stood out. The staff were helpfull, knowledgeable and eager to assist. The hotel was just a short stroll from Waikiki beech, hidden far enough away from the hustle and bustle but close enough

Great place to stay! only 2 blocks to the beach, restaurants and shops! the bus stop is right infront of the hotel, to go to flea market, pearl harbor etc. My room is quite small, but that doesn't matter since I usually stay in the lobby or outside. It's clean, but when it gets busy, the hotel staff doesn't vacuum/clean floors as often. I also enjoyed the free breakfast, it has different breads and fruits. Thank you

Vive Hotel , Waikiki , was our choice after much searching on hotels in the area. We wanted affordable ocean view room , close enough to activities, we could walk or get transportation easily! This was our 36 anniversary trip, our son bought the flight tickets for! So excited and we were not disappointed in any way! Greater st the front desk with a cold glass of fresh pineapple and smiles! It wasn’t time to check in yet, so they took our luggage and held onto it, until our room was ready. We took a walk to the beach while waiting. When we came back they brought our luggage right out and gave us our keys! 16th floor, Queen room facing the ocean, awesome view! Very clean room with desk, chair, frig, and large flat screen TV. Closet with robes for our use and bathroom with sink, tub, shower, abundance of fluffy white towels and complimentary toiletries! Small iPad for our use as clock, travel info, places to see, and any questions we might have! Each morning they had what they called Continental and we called full breakfast! Large variety of local fresh fruits, breads, rolls and boiled eggs! The coffee was available 24/7 and was exceptional! Service was very helpful with everything Including making reservations to and from places we wanted to visit. They also helped us to find bus routes, rent a car and check in for our flight home! Very happy with all they had to offer!Thank you again, Vive Hotel!

I truly enjoy my stay at the Vive for the past week abs wish I could stay longer. The location, the service, the friendliness of the staff and the amenities were excellent. IF/when I go back I would stay at Vive again ❤️ It was a total rest and relaxation trip for me.

i loved the comfort of the hotel and the closeness of everything . it was an outstanding trip , i had one little prob , i saw one roach a couple of times , i know its by the beach and they are abundant around this kinda area , i was offered another room , but did not see the point of it , the staff were friendly and helpful , and when i had an issue they did their best to solve it

Room reflected price. They're nice, not super. The bed was comfy and the AC cold. No Room service. There are iPads in each room where you can supposedly get food delivered to your room via Bitesquad but it wasn't a very intuitive program and the receptionist couldn't show me how it worked . I went and got takeout.

5 Stars all around! Great hotel, service, experience, and super great location. The room was the perfect size and was super accommodating. The staff was always there and willing to help out even when our TV wasn’t working. They were super quick and ready to help.

With so many hotels to choose from on Expedia, I am so thrilled we landed on this one! The parking rates are great, staff is very personable and helpful, the accommodations with chairs and beach gear was a big plus! We enjoy the more rural parts of Oahu more than Waikiki and felt the personal touches in our stay at Vive were wonderful!

Since 2008 I have had the chance to stay every year in Honolulu.I tried several hotels, but here I found the best quality price compromise.Everything was excellent, from the first contact with the reception to the rest of the stay. Very friendly staff, room (1208) very spacious. Breakfast abundant and quite diversified. I would stay here again 100%. The only flaw? The Kuhio is known by all to be very noisy and, although I was on the 12 'floor, but facing the sea and then close to the Kuhio, you could hear enough noise. Perhaps it is better to give up sight but to be a little more quiet.

The Vive Hotel was great; we couldn’t have asked for anything more for our stay. Location was fab, their customer service was great, breakfast was perfect and the little extras (free tea, coffee and water throughout the day plus free beach equipment to borrow as you need) were a great addition. My one criticism which the hotel really needs to address: they use disposable plates, cutlery and cups for everything at breakfast. It's great to have a to-go cup option but plastic cups and cutlery is so unnecessary for people eating in the hotel - far too much waste was getting produced! Otherwise, as a whole would totally recommend this hotel to anyone!

Ryan in valet was great, Christina at check in was wonderful! We had a junior oceanfront suite on 20th floor! Loved the fact they had a courtesy room for guests flying out later in the day! They were extremely accommodating!

Very friendly and helpful staff, clean rooms, all amenities available either prior to arrival or when requested. Breakfast is also good. It has a 45 degree view to the ocean (from in between the other buildings). You can also partially see the beach fireworks.

Overall the stay worked really well for our needs in Waikiki. Our room was a little small and the bathroom was right next to the bed and had no ventilation fan. The breakfast was very good with lots of fresh fruit and pastries. Overall very good for the price

My husband and I visited the Vive Hotel in Waikiki in March 2018...Pros...Great location...literally a less than 2 minutes walk to Waikiki beach. Great selection of restaurants and shopping nearby. Great jumping off point to self drive around Oahu. Very clean hotel and a good continental breakfast with fresh fruits and Hawaiian coffee.Cons...rooms are very small...especially when you have two suitcases open. Old air conditioner units than fit into the windows that can be very noisy...25$ a day of valet parking.Everything considered...you’re mostly in your room to sleep and I can live with less space if I have a very clean room. I would recommend to friends and family.

We stayed at the Vive for one night as a stopover between Australia and the US. We arrived at about 8 in the morning, but Preston was able to get us a room early. The hotel is about two blocks from the beach and very walkable. We also had a late flight out the next day. The hotel provided a courtesy room for an hour to freshen up right before our flight and stored our suitcases--great. The staff could not have been more helpful. The rooms are on the small side, but we were only there to sleep. Thanks for an excellent stay. David D.

We have been very satisfied. Good breakfast, good service from the concierge. Possibility to have towel and beach stuff. Just perfect.very central in Waikiki and perfect location.We loved our stay.Highly recommended

Really great value room. Would suggest higher levels for views of the mountain's diamond head or the beach. Breakfast is more adequate and all you can eat. Staff friendly and helpful. Room is clean and well supplied. Great value for money.Yoi wont be disappointed.

We liked the location, staff, fixtures/decor, and cleanliness of the hotel. We disliked our room size and noisy air conditioner and the limited breakfast options provided (no big deal, we got our own, but were just looking forward to it as a nice bonus!)

Excellent B&B Hotel with the perfect location to enjoy Waikiki and explore its surroundings.Very friendly staff, standard room including all needs.A.C. is rather noisy and might affect sleep .Plenty of eateries in the direct neighbourhood.

I first noticed Vive Hotel Waikiki when I stayed previously at a nearby AirBnB condo. I am definitely happy I tried Vive. Beyond it being located 2 short blocks from the beach (where a hula show occurs 3x/week) and at the end of Waikiki (rather than smack dab in the middle of it,) the service offered by folks like Preston, Romeo, Ryan, Erwin, KC and the continental breakfast lady who's name I did not get exceeded my expectations. I am a business traveler (though I was here for vacation) so I really appreciated the friendliness and the degree of care w/which my requests were tended to. I was interested in a junior oceanview suite but was told upon arrival that one wasn't available for the duration of my stay. I mentioned this again the next day to Preston who went forth and not only found one but on a high floor. He phoned several times as he worked to see what he could find for me. He really went above and beyond, and he didn't have to. Thank you, Preston.I enjoyed the continental breakfast, especially the pineapple. The woman who managed it did a fantastic job and was always so positive and pleasant. The area was consistently clean and food quickly replenished, even with the high volume. I also enjoyed the water, coffee and tea service available throughout the day and evening as well as the daily newspaper. The common areas were mostly clean (except when people left crumbs behind on the table,) brightly lit, well appointed and comfortable. No soiled pillows and such that I've seen in other hotels. The valet service was fab! I never had to wait more than a few minutes for my car and the gentlemen (Romeo, Ryan and Erwin) were especially friendly. I enjoyed speaking with them.Even though my room was small (I had a queen oceanview,) it was comfortable, clean and mostly updated. Little things like wearing on the chairs, chips in the wood on the bureau where the fridge is, glass table top not glued to based (which I noticed in a Jr. Suite) could be improved but I was pleased with my room. The aforementioned are actually reasons why I didn't ultimately go with the Jr. Suite. When I had requests for maintenance, they came quickly and resolved the issues. I appreciated that beach towels and mats were available for use each day. I didn't use housekeeping much but from my limited interactions with them, they were always friendly and on their job as evidenced by the cleanliness of the common areas. I was really pleased with my stay, and mostly due to the quality of service I experienced from several staff members. Thank you for making my stay so enjoyable.

Just a couple blocks away from Kalakaua Ave, which is where the action is in Waikiki. This trendy hotel has a friendly staff and a very positive atmosphere. Though the room was not spacious, we found it to be cozy and neat and the bed were comfortable. Breakfast was good and overall service is excellent. We found Romeo at the valet to be exceptional, who was our go to guy during our 5 day stay. We felt very at home in this hotel and highly recommend it.

The Vive Hotel is a great spot to relax. We did find the standard rooms to be quite small, so we upgraded to a Jr Suite (an easy process). The breakfasts were great - not an overwhelming selection, but healthy assortment of fruits with coffee, bakery goods, and eggs. Staff were all friendly and helpful. The location of the Vive is ideal - a few blocks from the beach and easily accessible to other amenities around Waikiki.

The hotel was a block away from Waikiki beach. It was clean and very modern. The reception staff were very helpful especially Preston Vidad who followed up on my lost property until it was located. A continental breakfast was included in the price. We loved the big variety of fresh fruits each day, the breakfast was a real plus. We sat in a relaxed atmosphere where we met other travellers while enjoying breakfast.The bus stop was 10 metres away where you could get the bus to Alamoana Shopping Centre or other tourist attractions.We did have a room on the outside of the building which was a little noisy some nights from revellers. All in all, a wonderful experience at a reasonable price.

Daisy handled our Reservations over the phone and saved us money over the on-line hotel booking sites. It was a pleasure to see her smile each day, Thank You Daisy for making our stay a little brighter.

Central to everything. Staff were very courteous and friendly. Our room was compact but very clean. Continental breakfast had good variety. No tea or coffee making facilities in rooms, however, coffee was available downstairs all hours. Tour desk staff are very helpful. Overall a pleasant place to stay.

My wife is very particular about everything specially accommodation. She googles, YouTube, call, read reviews and ask around if available. This hotel have the best location for the money. A few steps to the heart of Waikiki beach, the International Market, high end shopping, night life and the best Udon within yards! A trendy hotel that is very cozy and efficient. The staffs are the gem here. From the counter to the concierge to the valet to the breakfast staff are all commendable. Not to mention the cleaning crew who are all excellent in service. Will definitely be back here again. Highly recommended. Romeo at the valet and Daisy from the reception were our constant info feed. But everyone there provide the best service. Kudos to the management!!

We stayed at the Vive for 10 nights and were very happy with our hotel choice as first time visitors to Waikiki.We arrived in the morning after an early flight, and were appreciative that a room was found for us straight away.The staff were welcoming and courteous at all times. This includes the concierge who was more than helpful with our inquiries. Thanks also to the lovely hotel taxi driver who delivered us very early to the airport for our return flight home.A light continental breakfast every morning included in the room rate consisted of fresh fruit,pastries and a variety of breads.Coffee, tea and water was available 24/7 in the breakfast/lounge area.The hotel location couldn't have been better. Only a short walk to the beach and a bus stop almost right outside the front entrance.Our room was located on the 17th floor, and although the air conditioner is loud, we found that it didn't interupt our sleep quality. The bed was comfortable and plenty of room for our suitcases.Highly recommend this hotel as great value for money.

Extremely happy with my stay. Would recommend to friends and family. Location perfect. Staff friendly and accommodating. Nothing was a trouble. Early check in which was wonderful. Definitely would stay here again.

A great hotel with generous hospitality and great staff all round. We were greeted by the lovely Christine at reception who welcomed us warmly. The rooms have everything you need and the location is fantastic, short walking distance from the main strip and beach. Extremely good value, with an excellent inclusive breakfast, we loved the blueberry toast and awesome spread of fresh fruits to start the day!

Super cool place clean perfectly located and great service , will stay again , loved the staff very professional , breakfast is very fresh and worth going to great way to start a fun day at the beach !
user_name:
Tom A
North Hollywood, United States

review_body: Overall Vive is a descent hotel. The room is ideal for a single person. Sleep quality is not very good due to poor AC system. Great location with easy beach access and a multitude of resturant options.

Great centrally located hotel, very clean & tidy. No resort fee as no pool or amenities, but easy block to beach Lovely staff and breakfast included which is great, plenty of it but basic.Rooms clean & tidy, very small (maybe just our room), but when on holiday & a couple of suitcases & no where to put but on the floor not much space around to walk. But only sleeping there!! Air conditioning very noisy & had to turn off which made room very warm! Did talk to reception & was looked at but nothing changed!Good value for money hotel

We arrived early, staff were very pleasant and greeted us with fresh pineapple juice and a cold cloth, and stored our stuff until our room became available. A good start. And when we were able to move in, we found the room very clean and comfortable - good bed, nice desk, drawers under the bed, a large closet with two robes, good bathroom with tub/shower combination and nice toiletries, including body lotion. Breakfast was spare - breads, pastries and fresh fruit, excellent coffee and juice, hard-boiled eggs - but fresh and well presented. The lobby is an inviting space with comfortable seating, lots of small tables (and one large one), and well-suited to eating breakfast or just hanging out. The location is great - just a block away from Waikiki beach, close to the Honolulu Zoo, some prime shopping and dining, and a good starting point for the hike up Diamond Head. Would definitely return and/or recommend.

Small but very clean rooms. Really close to the beach for an good price. Breakfast could be improved but good (continental breakfast). Otherwise, staff and services great! No services fees! Would probably go back. Mattress and pillows a little soft for our taste.

Hotel staff were professional and friendly, and we were provided pineapple juice and cold towels on arrival which was a nice touch. Room was nice, and the breakfast was adequate (breads, fruits and such). Would stay again.

It’s good for he cost .The rooms are on the smaller side but not rediculously small.Staff and friendly , room is clean. Breakfast provided . Overall a great stay .1-2 min walk to Waikiki beach and bus stops right outside to go to ala Moana centre, diamond head and pearl harbour .

The only two negatives I could say is the “contenital breakfast” was not that. Mostly bread and fruit. We were counting on that to save some money on our trip. The room was very small but fine since we only went there to sleep. Customer service was great at the front desk! I think we were on a different schedule then the cleaning ladies and kept having to call for new towels.

This is the first time I stayed here. It was an excellent value and stay. Yes, the room was on the small side but comfortable.
