Breakfast was continental so fruits, breads, coffee, juice, and hard boiled eggs. The staff was very attentive.The place is a couple of minutes from the "Duke" statue at the beach, so it's very centralized to everything. If you need a beach mat, towel, or umbrella, just ask the front desk staff. Cheap eats are across the street on the way to the beach.A thanks to Beverly for being accommodating when I had to stay an extra night due to work schedule.

I stayed at Vive for a week and on the whole was an enjoyable stay. As per other reviews, the rooms are small and air con very noisy but that blocks out any street noise. No resort fee as no amenities like a pool so a good place to stay if looking to keep costs down. Location is good, a 5 minute walk to the beach and a bus stop right outside making it easy to get to Ala Moana or the centre of Honolulu. Friendly staff on the front desk, didn’t see any other staff around the hotel. Would consider staying again in future.

Perfect located near Waikiki beach the Vive Hotel was a good base for various activities on Oahu. Free breakfast, 24h Coffee&Water were also good reasons to chose this hotel. Unfort. our Room was v. small.

Nice and polite staff members. Good healthy continental breakfast. We love the pineapple juice and the all-day coffee. However, the room is quite small and there is no balcony. Also, the bed is not that comfy.

Overall the place is great - very friendly staff, reasonable breakfast selection (although no proper seating area), free use of towels and beach gear. $25 valet parking (or you can try find limited street parking on surrounding streets)Location was ok - felt like the edge of central, getting closer to residential. But still only a couple of blocks from the beach and close to food & laundromat. Only letdown was the old aircon machines which was super loud. The positioning also had the aircon blowing on the right side of your head a couple of metres away so had to cover with a pillow. Opening only the window was too warm to sleep.

Very comfortable accommodations for a good price. Within walking distance to the beach, many restaurants and shops. Valet service was prompt. We were looking for clean, reasonable accommodations and this fit the ticket.

Very reasonable rates, yet very nice accommodations. Decent breakfast, but the lady who clears the breakfast that is to end at 9:30, starts clearing at 9:10, so get there early. Good fruit. Hospitality room is the bomb.

Great boutique style hotel close to all with fresh fruit and pastry breakfast with hot coffee/tea and juice. We lucked out and had a 21st Floor ocean view room. Rooms are small but adequate. Front desk, concierge, room attendant, valet and breakfast service were all cordial and professional.

Good value, near the beach, but NO DRAWERS in the room. I also underwent an embarrassing and sexist check in experience where I, a woman, had booked a room for myself and my male companion. When I arrived, the hotel had changed the name of the reservation to my companion's name and would not allow me to check in since I was the woman on the reservation instead of the man. The front desk did not offer any solutions and further continued to address us only by my companion's name for the rest of the trip. I would rather pay a little more next time and be treated as a whole person than be this embarrassed again.

The rooms were outdated and the bed was low to the floor and not very soft. It was hard. The lobby was nice and the breakfast was good. It needed some eggs and a little meat to go with the fruit. and breads.

Booking online, we thought this location was going to be modern and sleek; however, showing up the photos totally fooled us. Every piece of furniture was run down, the room was extremely tight and small. The queen bed didn’t seem like a queen. I have a queen bed and this bed was much smaller than what I have. Unfortunately we wouldn’t stay again because of the size and the way the rooms look. Staff was friendly; however, there’s always that ONE person that ruins it all with their attitude

Our stay at Vive was extraordinary! From check in, location, cleanliness, the complimentary breakfast, beachgear... We got help with all of our questions with a smile from the staff. Would definately recommend this hotel both for the value and location.

Let’s just say.. coming up to a small parking garage- I wasn’t expecting much. BUT first off, Jordan (Valet Guy) was welcoming and very nice. When we got to the first floor to check-in, there were cups of pineapple juice and cold towelettes ready for us! We booked the “Cosmo Queen” for our 2-night stay but quickly realized it was too small for us. We decided to upgrade. Ended up staying in the Junior Suite on the 21st floor and Preston did everything in his power to make sure we were comfortable, and didn’t make it seem like we were being an inconvenience. We ended up having to cut our stay due to a family emergency, but we are so thankful Daniel was able to accommodate us and our situation! This hotel is not your average hotel- no pool, no fitness center, no balconies- BUT, the staff is by far the BEST I’ve experienced at any hotel in Waikiki, + the bed and bathroom is nice! They offer beach towels, and mats for the beach, and complimentary breakfast! The VIVE sits in a perfect location to the beach, restaurants, and shops! If you’re looking for a budget friendly place to stay, this would be it! Save your money to spend on everything else in waikiki because it’s expensive!THANK YOU to the VIVE staff- especially Jordan (Valet Guy), Preston, and Daniel!! You guys made this local couple thankful for the staycation we had!! We hope to see you guys again!

The location of this hotel was perfect for us. Close enough to walk to the beach but not actually on the main strip. When we arrived, Preston Vidad went out of his way to accommodate us. Thank you, Preston! All the staff were polite. They offer beach towels for hotel guests and tea//coffee available all day in the lovely lounge area. We thought this place was very pleasant. Will probably stay there again if we ever go back.

The Vive Hotel Waikiki is conveniently located a short walking distance to the beach and the staff was so friendly and accommodating with us during our stay. I would highly recommend staying here during your visit to Oahu!

My partner and I visited Honolulu earlier this month and stayed at the Vive Hotel . The Hotel is situated in a great location close to the beach and shopping public transport and restaurants and bars and cafes. The room was quite small for us very clean . We were also provided with breakfast each day which was good could have maybe had a few more things to pick from. They can organize tours . All in all a great location for people on a budget .

The hotel room was very clean. But the size of the room is very small. The breakfast is not a real breakfast it is Continental high carbs that's it. The hotel itself was just a place to sleep no amenities. But the hotel is in a great location and you can walk to some nice eateries. I would not stay here again.

This place is amazing! ! Huge room! Very clean!! Friendly staff!! The breakfast had great fresh fruit every morning!! Yes coffee and water all the time!! Great location! Very short walk to beach!! Definatly will be back!

It's not a resort with tons of amenities but for where the property is located, it is a terrific thrifty option. Safe, clean, quiet. They really try to go the extra mile with customer service. Sleep here and use the savings to have a blast in pricey Waikiki!

Smaller rooms, but clean, nice & very friendly staff. Easy to find, there is only valet parking available, with no fitness room or pool, but overall worth the price we got! Will stay again in in the future.

Excellent location, great value for price and loved the hotel vibes. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Free access to beach supplies was a great touch, the continental breakfast in the morning was lovely.

We just got back from a six night stay at Vive Hotel Waikiki. The room, service, value, and experience was phenomenal. We booked the vacation about six months ago directly on their website. You can register with them and they discount the parking and will give you a complimentary room upgrade if available. We received both the upgrade and the parking discount.We truly have no complaints about our stay there. There is daily free continental breakfast...juice, coffee, pastries, and fruit. It was fresh daily and there was plenty to go around. Our room was quite spacious, we had the junior suite and we had a corner room with views of Diamond Head on one side and of Waikiki Beach on the other. The room was well appointed with a desk, sitting area with two chairs and a table. There was also a large walk-in closet to store our belongings which kept our room neat. The bathroom was also very large with an extra large shower. Housekeeping was very good and the toiletries were a nice quality as well. The valet service was prompt and courteous also. The hotel was extremely neat and clean and the location could not be beat. We parked our car after being out for the day and then walked everywhere we wanted to go in Waikiki. The proximity to bars and restaurants was so close and convenient. We felt safe walking everywhere. No concerns about the area whatsoever. I must say, we travel frequently and often pay more than twice what we paid at the Vive. In Waikiki, the hotels can be very expensive and the parking and resort fees really drive the prices up. Vive only charges a reasonable parking fee and no resort fees. We are used to high quality hotels and the Vive really knocked it out of the park for us. If you are looking for quality and value and solid service and comfort then the Vive will check all of those boxes for you.Thanks Vive for making my birthday trip extra special!

Stayed for 10 days at the end of February. Staff welcome you with a pineapple juice and chilled facecloth. If you flight gets in early, book the night before and you can get the free breakfast or go to straight to your room. Free breakfast consists of fruit, pastries and tea or coffee. Watch out for the spam though. Boiled eggs only made an appearance a couple of times.Hotel is in a great location. 2 blocks to beach and main strip for restaurants. Food Pantry only a couple blocks away too. Bus stop out the front (number 8 bus) takes you to Ala Moana shopping center. $2.75 each way or day pass for $5.50. Rooms are clean and nicely presented but are small. I stayed in Room 1204. Not much room for 2 people and their suitcases. Needs more than 5 coat hangers too. Very small fridge. Really only holds drinks. Air conditioner sits in the window and is VERY noisy. Doesn't cool the room much either. Free local phone calls and strong free wifi. Bed OK but pillows were small and too soft. Better to bring your own.Cleaning staff are friendly and do a great job. Everything cleaned each day and beds made.Concierge staff were helpful too. Having been to Hawaii several times I didn't want to do tourist stuff. Staff will suggest other activities and included pick up and drop off too.If I return to Hawaii again, I would stay here but will ask for a higher floor.

Real nice hotel well kept except very low clearance parking so no suv allowed. No tall SUV which they didnt say in the hotel information. Bfast food was great choice. Housekeeping was awesome job! I’ll come back!

We just stayed a couple of nights but loved this place. We were greeted with chilled facecloths and icy cold juice at check in. While the rooms are small, they are well laid out. There was a tablet in the room that provided information about the area and when you turned out the light changed to a clock. They provided a continental breakfast with lots of fresh fruit and a great selection of other items. Great location for the price just a couple of blocks from Waikiki beach. We'll definitely stay again next time we're in Waikiki hopefully for a longer stay

Very very old hotel. Small twin room, very old manual air conditioning on the window that makes a lot of noise, making us unable to sleep without switching it off. However the window is so small I’m unable to open it much to circulate the air. There’s also no proper door closing mechanism. There was a room beside me who kept opening and letting the door slam late at night, shaking my entire room and waking everyone up.I literally had no sleep that night. I have stayed in hundreds of hotels, hostels and more in my life, and this was one of the worst I’ve stayed in. The room does not look like the photos reflected at all. Please be warned.With the same price I managed to stay at another much better hotel with better location nearer to Waikiki beach. On the bright side, Staff is very courteous and kind. Breakfast minimal selection, a lot of pastries. Tea and coffee provided. However I still won’t recommend this to anyone when there are way more competitive and better quality hotels around.

Rooms are hostellike. That downgrades all. Location top. Breakfast good. Valet Parking: I should drive my car by myself in 2. floor. I refused. Big discussion. 24 hours front desk in duty. Water to take all the time.

Gave them a credit card to use when we arrived. They put a holding cost for the 9 days on this card. When we checked out they put the charge on the card I had used to make the booking. 2 cards - 2 holding costs which meant I had no credit on either card and couldn't collect my pet because of this. Hotel sent me a form to rectify but this didn't help with the problem they had caused by not being able to collect pet when returned home

The hotel is pretty close to the beach. there is plenty of activities and places to eat near by. the hotel provides amentias for going to the beach such as towels and beach chairs that is very convenient. The rooms are small however but clean.

Location is pretty good as it gets you away from all the five star shopping centres and more like what the locals do.waikiki beach was around the corner and a very handy minimart close by. Becareful of room sizes as our was very small but the lovely Daisy at the front desk moved us to a more suitable suite. And even though it cost a little more it was well worth it. If however you don't mind the size of your room there were plenty of comfortable place to sit in the downstairs lounge area which also doubled as the breakfast area.

From the moment we checked in, and were greeted with fresh pineapple juice, a chilled wet towel and a genuine smile, we knew we'd made the right decision. We received a complimentary upgrade to our room, which had some views of Waikiki Beach and was clean and comfortable- the fact that it was quite compact didn't trouble us at all. Complimentary breakfast, wi-fi and bottomless coffee was a bonus, as were the complimentary beach accessories we were able to use - portable low-slung chairs, woven mats, towels and a boogie board! Vive is a short walk to the beach, restaurants and shopping precincts - my daughter and I always felt safe. Friendly staff, chilled vibe and excellent value for money - we were sad to leave but will go back again, for sure!

Quiet, pretty, terrific breakfast...much more than a “continental” breakfast. Location perfect. Staff very helpful. Would not hesitate to go back. Just wish there was a pool but five minute walk to lovely beach.

Visited with my wife who was pregnant. Nice clean hotel. Staff was super friendly and accomodating. They organized a 1 hr. temporary room for us after checkout as our flight was later in the evening. Free wifi and very decent breakfast.Highly recommend!

“Boutique Hotel” to me means high quality, perhaps limited amenities, and stylish. You know, wine at 5:00... waffle bar with breakfast...that kind of stuff. Vive has the limited amenities part down, but not the rest. Still it’s a decent value with a good away from the beach location. The service from the concierge (in particular) and the front desk was wonderful, but the concierge only works 8 AM to 2 PM. Huh? That was annoying on our arrival date at 3:00. Actually I’d call this is a nice quality budget hotel. Our room was comfortable enough. The relatively recent renovation is lacking and won’t wear well. Rubber baseboards are great in a Motel 6 but surprising here. The windows are old, single paned, unimaginatively placed and sized, and had failing mechanics. The carpet was still serviceable but will soon be more tired and worn. The furniture was beaten and and randomly selected. The provided (yay!) beach chairs were really cheap, old, and uncomfortable (boo!)There are no coffee machines in the room, but coffee is available in the lobby. The water bottle in your room costs $1.50.Still, as I said, there’s easy access to Waikiki and all it’s attraction. We walked easily to the Marriott to rent a car for a day, found good restaurants nearby, and enjoyed our vacation in spite of the hotel.

We were very pleased with Vive. When we checked in, we were given pineapple juice. It was a little thing. But that is what we found throughout our stay. They had beach mats and other beach stuff to pick up at the door. You do not have to rent it. A three minute walk to Waikiki Beach. We had to leave early for a tour at Pearl Harbor. One of the breakfast people brought us muffins, croissants, and coffee was available an hour before they opened. The desk made dinner reservations at Duke's. We were first told that they were booked for that evening. When they found that we were leaving the next morning, there was an opening. I don't know if the hotel influenced it or Duke's. But it was a wonderful dinner.

If you want a hotel with amazing service, a lovely room with a nice bed (and everything else in perfect order) great breakfast buffet, free coffee all day and is located near everything, Its Vive hotel

I stayed in the hotel for 9 nights. My room was comfortable. I had a very good experience. Any requests that I had were tended to quickly and efficiently. I enjoyed my trip and my stay at VIVE. The hotel staff were gracious and helpful. I would definitely stay there again.

Small staycation at Vive this past Friday would have been perfect with the exception of ants in the bathroom sink. Other than that everything was perfect. Roger was an EXCELLENT check in clerk and our room was gorgeous!

Nice and cheap hotel with good breakfast next to Waikiki Beach. Free rental of beach chairs, boogie boards, sun shades and much more. Next to the hotel is an Alamo car rental (<2min to go). We rented cars there day by day, thus no expensive parking lot needed.

A quick getaway for the two of us. The value was great for our quick stay. Enjoyed the beach accessories you got to enjoy specially the mats and boogie board. Will be recommendin to family and friends.

The Vive Hotel was in a great location, an easy, flat 5 minute walk to Waikiki Beach & surrounding shops & restaurants.We only stayed one night here so we were very happy we could walk everywhere! Arriving in the afternoon we were greeted with a smile & a cool face towel. Check in was simple and quick. Our room was clean, had great views to the beach & sea and was large! The photos on the websites are very exact, maybe just some slight wear & tear. It is modern, the beds are super comfy, pillows that you sink into & large shower/bathroom. There is no pool but the beach is close by so not missed.We left early the next morning so didn't get to sample the fantastic breakfast buffet. Very quiet rooms, location is hard to beat, & small hotel gives it a personal character.Would definitely return.

Vive Hotel was simply fantastic. The location is walking distance from the beach and all the main things in Waikiki. There's also a bus stop right out the front making getting around the island a breeze. The staff were so welcoming and eager to help wherever they could (e.g. printing off a bus timetable). I stayed in a twin share room and honestly couldn't fault it. One minor thing was the air conditioning being a little loud but you get used to it. Plus you even get a complimentary iPad! Next time I'm in Hawaii I will definitely be staying here again.

This hotel has a great staff. Everyone from Christina at the front desk, the valet, houseman and kitchen staff were very pleasant. My personal favorite was KC at the concierge desk. She helped me to book horseback riding and gave me her personal favorites around the island. That was really sweet. There are a few drawbacks to staying here but they are minor. The first is there is no pool or outside sitting area and no balconies. They have a nice lobby and breakfast area that can be used all day with free coffee, tea and water. I used it for reading and hanging out. The breakfast is mostly continental, the only hot item is hard boiled eggs but nice breads and fruit. Overall my stay was very good. Thank you Vive Staff

Great and simple. Very welcoming staff. Nice view nice bed and great location. Will definitely recommend it and stay at the facilities again. Smaller room but the use of space is incredible. Great experience overall.

It’s located three blocks from the beach, a couple blocks from the Ala Wai Canal Walk to the northeast, near varied shopping with the additional feature of no resort fee that many lodgings in Waikiki charge. Our room, a Cosmopolitan Queen, while not large, was adequate for two people with room for a desk and mini refrigerator and was comfortable for a 10 day stay. The in room tablet was a nice detail. The coffee, tea and fresh fruit each morning were wonderful. The staff was unfailingly cheerful and polite. KC, the concierge, was a great help, both knowledgeable and friendly. He gave us suggestions for and directions to hikes and botanical gardens in the area. We would stay there again if we come back to Waikiki.

we arrived at 7.30 am and Preston checked us in and very very helpful. great room great service pleasant staff . if any thing it was a noisy air con.but when you are asleep can not hear it running. well done vive. and so very handy to main shops

Very friendly hotel with helpful staff, a convenient location, and nice extras like beach gear. No hidden fees at check-out and room was clean and well cleaned each day. Would stay here again and recommend to all.

The room here is literally 8‘ x 8‘ not including the extremely small bathroom,, you have window air-conditioning,, that works sometimes at best we are on our third window unit now and we have only been here three days,, The only thing this place has going for is the location is close to just about everything

We had two grown teenagers who we travelled around Hawaiian Islands with. We really needed to look at the price factor as we were staying in Waikiki for 5 nights after visiting two other islands. The hotel is in a fantastic position, not on the beach although very short stroll from the centre of Waikiki. The rooms and bathroom was a little small although we were quite happy, we had a family suite which consisted of two rooms joined together - but the best thing was that we each had a tv and a bathroom so we didn't have to fight for one bathroom. The location was perfect with a bus right outside the door. The only negative we could find was breakfast was very basic which was ok - but - only choices was toast, fruit and some pastries. Cereal would be a fairly cheap addition but it was not offered. We had to buy cornflakes and my daughter ate it in a paper cup. Not a fancy hotel, no pool or gym but worth the money. We would stay again.

My husband and I very much enjoyed our 9 night stay at Vive Hotel. Though the rooms are on the smaller side (cosmopolitan queen), we were still comfortable and the cleanliness of the room was great and much appreciated. The air conditioner could get quite loud as well as the street noise; however, this wasn't a big issue for us. The lobby was very inviting and a great place to unwind after a day exploring. There are also board games in the lobby. The furnishing and decor were very impressive. The light daily continental breakfast was good, another reason we enjoyed our stay. We were surprised at the fact that though lots of people enjoyed the breakfast, we could still always find a seat and table. I already miss the fresh cold pineapple juice provided at breakfast! We very much appreciated the water, coffee, and tea that was available all day. It was so nice to grab a cup of coffee on your way out/in. The provided beach gear (towels, late, chairs, boogie boards, umbrellas) was fantastic to borrow for days on the beach that is just 2 short blocks away. In terms of location, Vive is located in a fantastic location, walking distance to everything including bus stops if we decided to venture further. The staff at Vive are outstanding. They were all extremely friendly and helpful. I cant say enough wonderful things about the staff. My husband and I had a late flight (10:45 pm) and appreciated the noon checkout time as well as the ability to store our luggages until we had to leave Waikiki for the airport. In addition, we were offered use of the courtesy suite to freshen up and change before leaving for the airport. All in all, my husband and I feel very fortunate to have had the opportunity to stay at Vive and for such a reasonable price. We look forward to our next stay at Vive!

very helpful, courteous and friendly staff. The location is convenient to the beach and other attractions without being right on the beach. The hotel is close enough to the bus line that will take you to other attractions like snorkeling or the malls.

Can't ask for more! This place is clean, chic, and well appointed with fantastic access to everything Waikiki has to offer. Price is fantastic and the staff are top notch! What a great extra touch of class to be greeted with a glass of chilled pineapple juice and a cool face cloth.

this hotel is close to Waikiki beach (maybe 2 blocks). so nice staff, so delicious breakfast. the room was good and clean. they have tablet pc, so you can get any room service they have. and also they borrow beach gear such as towel, boogie board, chairs.

This hotel is in a great location. We were able to walk anywhere in the Waikiki area.Not a lot of amenities. They do have a continental breakfast which was OK.The room was smaller than I expected, but we didn't really spend much time there.All in all I would stay there again.

Great Hotel. Super helpful und friendly Staff. Our Room was always clean. The Location is great, you need only 1-2 minutes to the beach. The Breakfast was so delicious. We'll come back for sure. Mahalo for everything

We visited Waikiki to attend our daughter's wedding. Vive Hotel is only one block from the AMAZING beach! Our view on the 20th floor looked right out on the ocean and was a dream each morning. The hotel provides an included COLD breakfast (no waffles or such), but was very good! Guest receive a cold, refreshing glass of pineapple juice and a warm towel upon checking in. Parking costs extra, but we NEVER needed a vehicle. Restaurants and shops are all in walking distance! Highly recommend if you plan on an amazing Hawaiian vacation. Rooms are a bit small, but we only were in there to shower and sleep, so it didn't matter. They were clean and very comfortable! The staff is friendly and very helpful.

My wife and I loved our stay at the Vive! The staff were very helpful and inviting. They helped book tours, shuttles, gave maps and tips to get the absolute best out of our short stay! We loved breakfast with the other guests! So many interesting, wonderful people in one place! The most AMAZING part about Vive is LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION!!! We were a short walk from EVERYTHING in Waikiki! Safe, affordable and FUN!

Check in went smoothly. Appreciated the cool drink and the map of the area. The room was well appointed. Got 2 windows looking out Kuhio Avenue and Diamond Head. The room was relatively clean. There was some short dark hair from prior guest on desk. Bed was comfortable. There was a bathtub in the bathroom. Bath towels were clean. There was a large TV with the major US networks. There was a small fridge to keep drinks cool. The staff I encountered was friendly. Breakfast was nice with tasty pastries and fruits. Saw boiled eggs 3 days out of the 6 days. There was papaya or strawberries some days. There were many restaurants and shops within walking distance. The hotel is relatively new. The meeting area is spacious with comfortable chairs, tables and coffee is available all day. They have beach towels, mats and umbrellas for guests to borrow. Would return.

I had the pleasure of staying here a couple of years ago and made it a point to come back. I had such a great experience last time and knew that the hotel would deliver once again. From the moment you get in from the hot bustle of the streets you are greeted with a serene air conditioned oasis and as you check in are given chilled damp towels and ice cold pineapple juice. So refreshing!! Check in is seamless.The hotel offers great amenities. From free wifi and a personalized smart device at your fingertips to order room service or to plan your stay, to the top-notch concierge services in the lobby, you’ll have everything you might need. KC worked the concierge desk the last time I stayed at the hotel and it was a pleasure to see them again. If you have any questions about what to do, where to eat, or if you have to do a little problem solving, KC has got your back. One of the biggest perks for me is the continental breakfast that’s included. After a late night, nothing is more welcoming that hot fresh coffee, muffins, toast, eggs, and a selection of fruit. Their lobby is smartly decorated with beautiful art and tropical flowers, with an outdoor garden visible beyond a picture window to enjoy while you sit in a plush couch or chair.

Vive Hotel is the Hotel to book for your future Holidays in Honolulu, Hawai’i. Right from the moment we walked in we were made feel welcome and Staff went above and beyond to ensure our stay was unforgettable.Mission accomplished!

This was our favourite hotel on our holiday. All staff are down to earth, friendly and willing to help with anything. Make sure you see Morgan at the Concierge Desk and get a copy of her island map that she has hand drawn locations for good hiking trails/waterfalls and other attractions, its invaluable.

The hotel charge me almost 200 dollars a night, but it's not worth 200 dollars, I would say 100 dollars worth is a fair value. Some may argue that it's the price of Honolulu, but I disagree cuz I could easily book a hotel at the outrigger with 100/night.its relatively new, I can see that its newly renovated, however, the AC is super loud, like I had to called the staff to come fix it, but he said its super old cannot be fixxed, I dig through some other comments up here before I booked it, some ppl also mentioned it, but I didn't believe their comments, but now I really do man, its super loud, I asked to change the room, and of course front desk denied my request.Also, there is no self parking, valet parking is a enforced at 25 dollars per day, which is extract cost if you were to book this hotel, had I known I would pick a hotel with cheaper parking but better quality.Free towels and boogie board is for borrow for the beach is nice,,,but they do run out, which is so dumb...you need to get up early in the morning to get them.No pool, no sauna, no gym, its stupid tripadvisor gave this a 4 star, trip advisor really let me down this timeThe room is super small, there's no room to open up your luggage if you're carring a big suitcase, you would trip over everytime going to the bathroomBottomline, if the hotel was 100/night, I would think much about it, but because this is more expensive then neighboring hotels, there are so many options on waikiki, this hotel really suck by comparisondefinately not money's worth

The Vive Hotel is centrally located in Kuhio Avenue, Waikiki. It is a short walk to Waikiki Beach, the International Marketplace, and to many other attractions. The bus stop is located outside the door. Not only is it convenient, the hotel is nicely appointed, the rooms are clean, and there is a very nice continental breakfast included in the price. We love this hotel and will return.

Exceptional hotel with close walking to beach. Staff was so friendly and helpful and the ammendities are incredible. Everything you need from a hotel in Waikiki without paying the insane resort fees that you would pay for another 5 star hotel.

Really enjoyed our stay. The staff are friendly, accommodating, and go out of their way, great customer service. I want to especially point out the wonderful housekeeping staff, they were wonderful. One day I left my backpack next to the bench, our wonderful housekeeper found it and safely returned it to us. Since it contained our valuables, it was a real vacation saver. Thank you for the excellent customer service.

way too expensive for the stuff their offering1. tiny tiny room tiny bathroom2. super noisy air con , old disgusting ones.TERRIBLE , hate them3. 25 dollars valet parking fee mandatory 4. considering it's price, no tea, no free water in room5. no gym, no pool 6. poor soundproof we live on the 19th floor could still hear the bus door openingwtf 7. small bed, small pillow, no choice of king size one in this competitive area, u can find a better place than this

The rooms are small but clean. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The free breakfast was tasty and, well, free! Very close to the beach and all the Waikiki shopping. The hotel was the best price I found (and I looked at a whole lot of hotels) We had a great stay!

vive hotel is a boutique hotel located 5 minutes walk to Waikiki beach and from there you can walk west along the main tourist shopping street of Waikiki to do your shopping at night since shops close at 9-10pm so it is very convenient. vive hotel will lend you beach umbrella,beach chair,beach towel and mat free of charge. Hotel has paid valet parking but we parked at Waikiki Banyan hotel which is east of vive hotel about 15 minute walk and it cost slightly cheaper at $20 per 24 hours with in and out privilege. vive hotel is also clean,modern looking, has friendly staff, free breakfast buffet (no hot food items though) , good location and no resort fee! so it is very good value for the money. If you like good Japanese udon noodle, go to Marukami Udon restaurant which is 10 min. walk west of vive hotel. They make fresh udon noodles which taste great and very reasonable priced. It always has a line up. If you like sushi,you can walk 20 min. east of vive hotel to Sansei seafood restaurant and sushi bar located on the 3rd floor in Marriott hotel. On Sundays and Mondays,5:30pm to 6pm, most dishes there are 50%off. We enjoyed our stay at vive hotel and would recommend it.

This hotel is very nice and clean, the staff were very friendly and helpful. The location was very convenient, maybe 2 minute walk to the beach and 5 minutes from the mall. The Bus stop was not far at all from the hotel. They provided us with beach towels every day and would hold our room card for us when we went down to the beach. The rooms were small, but this wasn’t an issue since we only went there to sleep. They didn’t have a pool but again this wasn’t an issue since we swam at the beach daily and didn’t come to Hawaii to swim in a hotel pool. There was water, tea and coffee in the lobby all day long. They provided a little continental breakfast from 7-9 which was a nice quick option, we eat there a few times, but once we discovered açai bowls down the street that was our go to place. Overall we had a great experience at this hotel, I highly recommend it.

All in all the hotel stay was great. Location Was outstanding less than. 2 min walk to beach. Rooms A little small but the free breakfast and no resort fee far out way the room size great for couples families will need to book the larger rooms but still great value you won't be disappointed. Staff extremely friendly and upon arrival great you with ice cold pineapple juice and chilled face towels what more can you ask for.

Nice view from the room！The staff were very friendly.The room was very comfortable.The hotel is very close to the beach and the supermarket.I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to visit Hawaii again.

Hotel represents good value, close to beach and shopping precinct. Rooms were clean, staff attentive and the continental breakfast each morning was a bonus. Enjoyed our stay. Would recommend the Vive Hotel Waikiki.

Great location , very helpful and friendly staff . Please consider this place as it is not too close or too far away from the beach with a quiet homely atmosphere and a friendly helpful staff. This was the place for us , as we don't like the unwanted artificial glamour for the sake of staying in a hotel with a reputed name . Room we stayed was small but adequate as we spent most of our time outdoors.

Overall, my friend and I had an over all wonderful experience. The staff were nice, always said hello, room was small, but a good size for only 2 people. The breakfast mosty consists of fruit, pastries, coffee; nothing too fancy. If your looking for more options, there’s alot of great place to go to around the hotel aswell.Location was good, close to alot of restaurants, the beach and a bus stop that we used. Recommend the bus system if your not driving, takes twice as long as opposed to a cab or an uber, but all day pass is pretty cheap.

Would recommend staying here to anyone who likes access to public transport. Easy walking distance to Royal Hawaiian Complex.International Market Place.five minutes to zoo,easy walk to Waikiki beach and Army museum.

We booked Vive Hotel Waikiki for the last two nights of our stay in Hawaii. The hotel is an easy three blocks from the beach. It's a short walk to the beach and all the great spots in Waikiki. The room was small but clean and with an ocean view. We had a much warmer welcome at Vive Hotel Waikiki than at a larger name resort.

Location is great but very loud at night. You can request to stay at a higher level but may not be available. Right by the beach and the main street. Hotel is clean and very modern. Only downfall is there was no balcony but thats okay.

We returned to Vive Hotel! Its location is excellent, the price is very reasonable, its service is unbeatable. I love the atmosphere of the reception: the lounge music, and the kindness of the employees. Recommended!

If you are looking for a lodging that has comfortable bed, clean room, great continental breakfast, great staff...I highly recommend Vive Hotel. The place is simple, clean, friendly staff. Very short walk to the beach. Walking distance to a lot of restaurant and shopping. This hotel has reasonable rate. Check also their own special deals/package deal. Thank you the front desk for accomodating our request..we were on the quiet room location 19th floor. Thank you all the staff especially Mely who prepares the breakfast and also Trinidad. Preston at front desk..for recommending restaurants. We enjoyed of one week vacation. We were comfortable in our room...

Do you know how it feels when you walk into a hotel to check in and you are greeted like family that they are happy to see again ?Well that’s how it felt when we walked into VIVE hotel.From the check-in with hot towels and chilled juice, the huge breakfast buffet with tons of fresh fruit, the nice comfortable room (we had a junior suite with ocean view),the friendly staff on daily basis to the final check out, everything is nearly perfect. Every single one of our 30 days and nights there were so tremendous that we already made reservations for our next monthlong stay.

Thee hotel is in the centre of Waikiki, close to all amenities. Our requests were met promptly by friendly and helpful hotel staff. The room was small but clean and comfortable for our 10-day stay. We would definitely recommend this hotel and come again.

We've stayed at this hotel 3 times in the last 3 years or so. It's in a great location, just a block from Waikiki Beach; has clean, comfortable rooms; a decent continental breakfast; and parking. We'd go back again.

We really loved our stay here, since the moment we arrived we were greeted by the very friendly staff. Rooms are just what you need and are very clean and tidy.Ot was a surprise for me that the continental brekkie was included (I thought it wasn't) so it was perfect to have a quick bite and start touristing!

The location and value for us was very good, Plenty of assorted restaurants of quality meals. A bus stop right outside Hotel was very convenient . Beach was a 5 minute walk.Hotel staff were excellent lovely smiles and most helpful. Rooms on the small side but housekeeping was terrific, a very clean place to stay.

Our first time staying in this hotel. My wife and I love the location - walking distance to the beach, restaurant and shops... very convenient! Great amenities and service, also with free continental breakfast every morning (fruits , breads , tea. ) Hotel also provide us beach equipments and it’s free. They have everything we needed which made us very happy so very glad we chose this hotel. Although the room is tiny, its very clean and the view was great! The front desk agents are very kind and professional. Christine always greeted us with warm smile and helped us with directions. Mahalo Christine! The location is great, we loved it! Living room area is very cozy, wife and I enjoyed the books and coffee!!! Mahalo Vive form making our stay wonderful and memorable! We can’t wait to come back soon!

Just spent 7 days at Vive Hotel Waikiki, and would like to thank all the staff who served us! Every request we had was taken care of. Special thanks to Ryan for the good care he took of us. From free HDMI cords, good Wifi, mini chairs for the beach, free towels, good breakfast. And especially the courtesy room for us late flight departures. Very convenient and always serve with a smile no matter how many requests we had:) This may be a 5 star hotel but they sure make you feel like a 5 star customer.Thanks everyone, we’ll be seeing you next year!

This hotel is well located, clean, well decorated.Breakfast a little simple, not much variety.The rate was not that convenient, but under average of rates in Waikiki Beach.The staff very friendly and helpful.

Vive Hotel offers an excellent location close to the Waikiki beach, restaurants, shops and bus stations. The staff are helpful and friendly. Our room and the dinning area were a bit smaller than what we expected but this didn't bother us much. My wife and I had a great experience during our 11 day stay at this hotel.

This hotel is very close to the beach and the surfing shop my son was going to everyday.( 5 minutes) Very easy to catch taxi’s and the local bus. So glad we picked this hotel. The free breakfast always had lots of fresh fruit and delicious breads! Best coffee ever!! Great place and value.

No resort fee, and free breakfast. Location is perfect to walk to Waikiki beach, main road and many shops but a little noisy at night. Staffs are very kind and helpful. They also borrow you beach mat, chair, umbrella for free

I found the Vive to be a very nice smaller hotel for a fair price. It is located in a very convenient spot on Waikiki; a short easy to walk just about everywhere, but not in a clogged-up high-traffic confusing part of Waikiki. The rooms are small, but I didn't spend much time there other than to sleep, shower, and change. Otherwise, my room was nicely appointed. Everything worked. The staff was friendly and helpful. This is not a "resort" hotel, in which you could stay on the property and not leave; this is for someone who wants to get out and around Waikiki and Hawaii. That also means there probably aren't families with kids here.

Excellent location with an amazing view of Waikiki. Room was very clean and service was excellent. The air con was a little noisy but that was the only issue we had with Vive. They supplied beach towels, body boards and other beach gear which was very helpful. A great stay.

Very inflexible hotel- would not adjust our reservation at all once it was booked. Because of that, I would recommend a recognizable hotel chain instead. We never were able to have our room cleaned during the stay which was another let down. They did have 24 hour coffee and tea which was nice but that was sadly the best part of the hotel.

Great place to stay- two blocks from beach. Staff was wonderful. Breakfast was stocked with fruits, eggs and grains. Beds and showers were great. 14 floors up view of the area. We did use their parking. Lobby is big enough to hang comfortable. Book it, Buddy.

Great hotel. Minutes from the beach. Not a better place to stay in Waikiki. The staff is friendly and incredibly helpful. The breakfast is delicious and always fully stocked. The Vive really made our trip better than we could have imagined!

We returned to the VIVE for a quick trip after staying there when we got married in Hawaii last year. As expected, the room was clean and comfortable (especially the pillows and bed), and the service was impeccable. It's nice to know we can count on the same warm and welcoming hospitality every time we visit. They've even updated the tablets in the rooms to make tasks such as calling for your car even more convenient, leaving more time for you to explore and have fun. Thank you to the staff at the VIVE, we will be back.

A great place to stay! Walking distance to the beach, stores and restaurants. Delicious breakfast included each morning. Beach equipment provided upon request. WiFi provided with a handy tablet in the room. And fantastic customer service and hospitality. I will be returning to Vive in the future.

Excellent location, 2 blocks from the walking crowds. Easy to get to everything. I highly recommend. It is a boutique hotel, rooms are a good size, bathroom is a little tight. Sink is unique. Would recommend staying at this hotel. They also give beach towels, body boards, and chairs for the beach. One thing, I loved was the nexus tablet that is free for use in each room. It was very welcoming to see my name on the display when I entered the room. Can order valet, room service, etc. from tablet too.

5 min walk to the beach, coffee, and convenient stores. 10 min walk to shopping malls and restaurants. Free beach towel rental. We booked an 8 day trip and got a free valet service and a free upgrade to beach view. However there is a towel right in front of us. Room is very small and the A/C is average.

Great location, reasonable price, outstanding staff. From the moment we arrived (pineapple juice and cold towels) to the moment we left (post-checkout courtesy room to clean up after a long day on the beach), Vive delivered a quality experience. What could be a merely so-so property was elevated by great staff. Every single person we interacted with during our stay was friendly, courteous, and incredibly helpful--from the front desk, to the valet, to the cleaning staff who kindly overlooked that we had forgotten to close and lock the safe. The rooms are quiet and sensibly updated with a contemporary feel that gets the job done without quite feeling hip or luxurious--although the huge luxury shower in our junior suite was a notable exception. Our friends' non-suite room was quite small. There is no service elevator, so the guest elevators frequently stop at floors where staff are waiting (and waiting...) to bring carts up or down. The continental breakfast was limited and tended to run out of most items well before the 9:30 stop time. Despite those drawbacks, we had a great time and would definitely stay here again for the price.

We stayed their for 8 nights, best place to stay in Waikiki, better than resorts around the beach area Great location & value 2 min walk to beach can see from my room window, staff is very friendly and everyone is more than happy to help you anytime of the day including the night staff. Breakfast has a fruit bar which we loved as we are healthy eaters. They also offer secure baggage storage if you are checking out and have a late flight during the day. Ask for airport shuttle before checkout it works out good for 2 people cost wise. Rooms are clean and staff does a good job keeping it clean. You are surrounded by beach, great restaurants, best malls (international market place, royal hawaiian center), grocery shops (food pantry). Staff also helped me book car rentals for 2 days during my stay on a good price (comparing to other on last min car rentals).We are very pleased with this hotel, I will be more than happy to recommend this to anyone. Keep up the great work guys!

I come to Hawaii a couple of times a year and have stayed at a few different properties in Waikiki. The Vive will be one I won't be coming back to. The hotel is one of the few in Waikiki which doesn't have a lanai (balcony), the windows don't open, there is no pool, no bar, there is mold/dirt on the air conditioning unit. These are all important things in a competitive city like Waikiki. The elevator doesn't have key control access which is something worth noting. This all said the staff were all incredibly welcoming and went the extra mile in every way. The hotel also provides chairs, towels, mats and boogie boards for beach days and is in a nice location.

This's what I have lived in and seen the smallest hotel room.The super small space has two very small beds, very uncomfortable to sleep, and almost no walk and put the luggage space. Let's uncomfortable, it's not worth its price, very disappointed!

This hotel is in a great location.Staff were so friendly and helpful.Check in and check out were a fast.We were lucky enough to check in early as our flight arrived at 6am. The room was ready to go when we got there.The free continental breakfast was super convenient as all American meals are large it's nice to know you can start your day out with a light brekky at the hotel and even better it's free.Beds are super comfy and we defiantly got a great night rest each night.If your after a hotel which is in a great location with super friendly helpful staff and a great bed than I highly recommend this hotel.

Vive Hotel is at a great and convenient location that is close to the beach, restaurants (literally all around), ABC stores and only a 5-10 minute walk away from the shopping area. We stayed here for 7 days, so I really liked that Vive offered free breakfast as it definitely helped us save on that! They also offer coffee and tea all day long, and have a mini-oven and microwave for your use all day. The hotel also offers FREE RENTALS for beach towels, mats, floaties, chairs, beach umbrellas and more for your day at the beach!! We didn't have to buy or bring any of these from home which is awesome! I will say that the room was smaller than I expected, so if you are looking for something luxurious and fancy, this might not be it. However, if you are looking for a clean and well-kept room, a free breakfast, great beach rentals, and an awesome location, this is definitely the spot to go!! Staff are also super friendly and accommodating which made our stay very enjoyable!

We stayed at the Vive over the Christmas period and had an enjoyable stay! The room and bathroom were comfortable and clean, just enough space for a couple. The air con unit was fine for winter but do wonder how it’d hold up in warmer weather.The hotel is in a fantastic location for walking around Waikiki. It’s only a few minutes from Waikiki Beach and the main strip. There is also a bus stop right next door where you can catch a bus straight to Pearl Harbor. Well worth the stay if visiting Honolulu!

Better than anticipated with minimal noise. Very accommodating with early check in. Would return on next visit to Waikiki. Close to beach, food. Had to put a towel over the glass shelf to keep from banging head.

Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights, didn’t meet the expectations! Lots need to be done for the improvement of service, quality and amenities. My experience as a guest is just an average and lots need to be worked on to signify this hotel as nice cosy boutique hotel. Conveniently located but not a good value for money!

My second stay at Vive. Perfect location - Kuhio Beach at the end of the street, great price, very clean. Rooms are compact but well laid out, pretty quiet too. Will stay here again. Good basic breakfast selection.

Waikiki is not a cheap place to be. The Vive hotel has a good price. . Its a good place if you plan to speend time exploring the island and needs a safe and confortable place to rest and to get ready to the other day. If you want enjoy the waikiki night, the ViVe is just few meters away the main street. If you ate expecting surf lessons, there are several schools within 200 meters. Breakfast is fair, nothing special but enought.. the negative point is a commun between other hotels in the vicinity. Its the parking. 30 USD day.

This is the perfect spot if you want good value, near the beach, friendly staff and parking. Everything is walking distance in Waikiki. We used the hotel's beach mats and towels and spent the afternoons on the beach, which is just a few blocks away. Would definitely recommend to friends and family.

Am so happy with my stay at Vive hotel; from the very helpful staff, particularly K.C and Morgan who gave me wonderful ideas on how to maximize my vacation, to the amenities like the daily breakfasts, complete with tuna and hotdog buns and boiled eggs, wonderful fruit platters etc etc, coffee and tea all day..Loved the superfast elevators that whispered your floor!! The room is cleaned so well, no complaints at all. Service with a smile is their motto! The location is great! just outside is the bus stop, ( and I explored everything from Pearl Harbour to Diamondhead , just $5/ lets you travel all day , anywhere.)And you can walk across a little way, to the beach where there's so much to see, go across to the main road and explore all the big hotels! many with great free entertainment , I located the Catholic church too , right off the beach, with Sunday Mass with Hawaiian music! mostly free things to do, just get the brochures available in newsstands around,But Vive hotel gives you great suggestions! I stayed dec 8th to !8th 2017. Can't wait to return! Oh, they do not charge you a fee per night like other hotels do!! Mahalo and Aloha! Such a wonderful vacation with Vive hotel.

I'd noticed in June while visiting, but never went in and had seen previously on expedia when looking for a place to stay. Stayed in the double cosmo room with my sister while in Waikiki in December. Friendly staff upon arrival along with pineapple juice on check-in. Great location on Kuhio avenue which is just a street behind the main Kalakau Avenue. Bus stop was a 2 minute walk away. Walk to the Prince Kuhio hotel to catch the trolley to Ala Moana was also within a five minute walk. Close to restaurants and int'l market place and food pantry for snacks and fresh produce. Location and no resort fee were selling point. Breakfast included fruit, toast, croissants, and some other pastries. We had breakfast twice in our 6 day stay. Cute, cozy breakfast area with lots of seating. You can order up cleaning service from the tablet in your room along with other provisions. Complimentary beach mats and chairs along with boogie boards too. Our room was 228 square feet with a desk, small closet, bathroom with sliding door, 2 single beds (actually comfy), air conditioner and mini fridge. It served our purpose since we were there to enjoy the outdoors. Flat screen tv and decent wifi. Very helpful staff and friendly too. About a 5 -7 minute walk to Kuhio beach. Short distance to Int'l marketplace with its shops and dining.

Property staff were very pleasant and accommodating. Free breakfast and coffee and tea service was a nice touch. Room, although small, was clean and efficient. Location is perfect. Overall a great value.

Location. Location. Location. It's only a couple of blocks to get anywhere you want to in Waikiki--from the new International Marketplace, Duke's Lane, the strip down Waikiki Beach and Kalakaua, the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center, Yokocho Gourmet Alley, and so much more! StaffThe check in & out staff are friendly, helpful, and efficient. You're greeted with a cold towel and refreshing pineapple juice upon check-in and a speedy check-out. ServiceThe valet guys are fast and professional. Don't forget to tip them. If you need anything like ice in your hotel room, you just call guest services and it's delivered to you quickly.CleanlinessEverything was very clean except the ice we received. It didn't look dirty, but when it had melted, we found a few black floating mold pieces. Ew. The rooms, however, were awesome.Room ValueYou're pretty much paying for the great location. The rooms are nothing fancy but absolutely comfortable enough. You really can walk anywhere you want to in Waikiki, all hours of the day and night. The king bed was fantastic, soft, and fluffy. The ceilings are low (old building) but who's there to spend your time in the room anyway, right? Get your butt out there! You're in Hawaii!LobbyBeautiful. Computers complimentary for guests to use and print stuff if needed. Comfortable seating areas and breakfast provided! Most of the breakfast items are fruits and pastries. Coffee/tea provided 24/7.

Great value for location. Short walk to beach, near Duke statue . Very helpful staff. Rooms a touch small but not tiny. Free (basic) breakfast (toast, pastries, fruit) Free towels and umbrellas. Will stay again.

The service breakfast was good. Many fruits were fresh and delicious. The bread was delicious, and it was good that the type changed. With boiled eggs, the taste was accented. And I was delighted with the smile of the serving.

The location was ⭐️⭐️⭐️, very close to the beach and shops. Room was tidy, nothing special, for the price very good. Breakfast consist of fruits, white bread and boiled eggs, for a Finn more like a desert than breakfast, but nothing to complain!! I would stay again for couple of days.
Aloha~~We stayed at the vive hotel waikiki for 7 nights. We’re satisfied with reasonable price, friendly staff, good location etc...We had very nice stays. Thank you again for your kindness. Mahalo~~

My friend and I stayed 8 nights at this lovely hotel. The staff were incredibly helpful and friendly. Rooms clean. Wi-fi good, Location excellant with buses at the door step and quite a few restaurants within a 10-15 minute walk away. No resort fees was also a bonus.

All staff were very friendly and welcoming during our entire stay, without being fake or overbearing. The welcome drink and cold towel at check in was wonderful after traveling a long time to get there, as was having the complimentary breakfast and coffee available 24/7 in the living room. The front desk provided good service with a smile but KC at the concierge desk was great. He provided us with the right information we needed for local things and also helped us book a snorkeling tour, swap market shuttle and airport shuttle. His advice was personal and professional and helped make our trip wonderful. On top of that, he refused a tip for the service which showed us he was not helping us for the money as has happened at a lot of other places. A good location a short walk from the beach and other local attractions. I had a good feeling about stay before we got there and an even better one afterwards.

The room was clean and spacious. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location close to everything. The sunrise at the beach was breath taking. Plenty of places for dining. Lots of shops in the area.

Breakfast was included but the choice was limited (pastries, fruits). No pool so no resort fee, but it's fine as the beach is just 2 short blocks away. Room was small but it works for 2 people. The air con unit was a bit noisy.

We spent about 10 days in Waikiki and are very happy with out choice to stay at Vive. Staff was fantastic, location is great, the price was very reasonable and there were exceptional perks with the concierge staff and complementary breakfast -continental.The rooms were very clean, a little on the small side but big enough. The parking was also the best deal in the area. Would definitely stay there again.

The best thing about Vive is its location - really easy walking distance to Waikiki's main strip and shops. They also have a relaxing common area with free tea and coffee, which we really enjoyed. The Cosmopolitan Queen room was fine, but did feel a bit small with our luggage and shopping every where, so the common area lounge was great. We hired a car and even though parking was $25/day, the valet service is great and so convenient. Hotel has a modern feel to it. The continental breakfast varied slightly each day which was good - but you have to get there early-ish as we came close to 9am one day and most of the food was gone.
user_name:
Fiona L
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: We loved the staff here. Everyone was awesome. Room was a little small, but who spends much time in the room whilst in HAWAII !! Would stay here again. Great location and even greater staff. You won't regret your stay here.

We love the Vive. It is intimate, close to most Waikiki attractions, valet parking is very convenient. The free breakfast is very good. The staff is great, and the price is right. The rooms are a little small, but they are fine for us.

Very welcoming staff with the aloha spirit, good location and neat , tidy rooms, some noises from air conditioning units and street but didn't stop us sleeping. Simple breakfast but enough to get you started, nice lobby area and was good for relaxing

This good and not overpriced hotel is excellent positioned close to the Waikiki beach and the major shopping streets and centres. You will find them in walking distance. The hotel is Ideal for people with a normal income!

Great hotel for a sleep over only. Breakfast was included in our stay which was pretty average. Seemed more like a backpackersThey offer free floating boards and mats for the beach. They are a block away from the beach

Good value, walking distance to the beach..lots of places to eat..next to bus station..sometime housekeeping was late but its fine..overall was good..we need a family suite or a connecting room and vive provides the best value

I stayed at the Vive Hotel Waikiki last month from 18-25 November for a one week solo getaway and had an awesome stay. What attracted to this hotel at first was the YouTube videos showing it's beautiful lobby. I usually stay away from boutique hotels because they cost more but not this hotel. I found that this hotel was actually $300 cheaper than where I usually stay which was great. The location is great, it's on Kuhio Avenue which is behind Kalakaua Avenue, the main road down Waikiki Beach, but the walk up from the hotel to Waikiki Beach on Uluniu Avenue (which is directly across the road from the hotel with a crossing right out the front) takes you about five minutes if that. As soon as you walk into the lobby you'll be impressed, it's very bright, clean and beautiful with a lot of seating for guests, interesting things on the walls and shelves, board games and a bookcase with "Aloha" on it. The reception staff are very friendly and helpful. I was greeted with a nice cold glass of pineapple juice and an icy cold hand towel. Unfortunately I arrived in Honolulu at 6am, arrived at the hotel at 8am and couldn't check into my room until 3pm (ended up checking in at 1pm) but the hotel were more than happy to mind my bag and gave me access to their guest bathroom in the lobby to freshen up. I was also told to help myself to the free continental breakfast which was much appreciated. The continental breakfast was good, some fresh fruit, pastries, coffee, tea, and a large selection of bread to toast. I'll admit that after a few days I was bored with their breakfast but it was nice to just grab a coffee and a pastry to start your day. Also the coffee and tea is available all day. My room was a Cosmopolitan Queen room, their standard room, on the 19th floor with a city view. You could see Diamond Head and the ocean hiding behind all the other buildings. If you're after an ocean view get a hotel on Kalakaua Avenue not back here on Kuhio Avenue, just saying. My room was small but very clean and comfortable, perfect for just a couple or someone solo. The bed was great, I liked the storage space drawers underneath the front of the bed, good for shoes. There was the usual room safe, small closet, great tv, even robes, cold air con and free wifi. The air con and the wifi are my only cons. The air con unit was old and very noisy to the point where I preferred to turn it off and open the two windows for some fresh air. The wifi started off great, easy and strong connection but after a few days I had to keep logging back in and it was really slow. There is free wifi down in the lobby which is a lot better than what's in your room. The bathroom is very small but has a full bath and an awesome shower, great water pressure and hot water when needed. I loved the long desk with the tv on it and the little Nexus tablet next to your bed with your name on it greeting you as you walk in each day is a nice touch, you can surf the net and watch Netflix on the tablet is you don't have your own device. Housekeeping were very friendly and did a great job cleaning my room each day, usually late in the afternoon. I left them a $2 tip each day, I know it isn't much but every little bit helps huh and it's a small thank you for their service. There is a pc that guests can use in the lobby right next to the guest services person which I thought was handy but it's running an old Internet Explorer browser that kept freezing up due to security issues. Kuhio Avenue is very noisy at night with people yelling, cars beeping, etc most nights but you are in Waikiki which does get very noisy at night and very early morning. All in all the Vive Hotel Waikiki s a very nice hotel, it's clean and comfortable, good location, great price with friendly and helpful staff, free breakfast and wifi. I would recommend this hotel to couples and singles, even families if they get the Cosmopolitan Family Suite though I didn't see many kids there oh and there is no pool. Mahalo to Preston and staff for a wonderful stay.

The hotel is beautiful, lovely decor, very clean rooms and helpful staff. The amazing breakfast spread every morning helps us get our day started on the right foot with healthy fresh fruit, pastries, and coffee etc. Helps keep our cost of trip down to not have to pay for breakfast every morning. Great location if you want to be right in the middle of things, sort of offers the best of both as close to Waikiki beaches but can walk on some more private paths located nearby. Would recommend to anyone who wants both value and comfort!

Excellent location. Relatively modern, definitely clean room. Helpful and friendly staff. I was there for an overnight trip/layover and this hotel is ideal for those purposes. Comfortable bed, continental breakfast (plenty of fruit and good coffee).

We stayed just one night on the way through Honolulu.The welcome was friendly and the rooms were clean - although very small.The location is a 2 minute walk from the beach and very close to the main shopping district.The breakfast was simple but perfectly fine.Hotels in Honolulu are not cheap - but this was reasonable value

Good value, really nice rooms and perfect location. Lots of fresh fruit for breakfast and coffee/tea at all hours. They provide you with beach towels and everything you could need at the beach, and the staff is very friendly.

Quiet & Cozy with Friendly staff...we enjoyed the Continental breakfast & pineapple juice, Location was close enough to walk anywhere but out of the Waikiki madness. Great place for local Staycation that included free valet parking.

We stayed in a Queen Room with an ocean view that we really enjoyed. The room is small, but clean and comfortable. The tablet provided in our room was really helpful. We also appreciated the safe and the small fridge. The only thing we didn't like was the air conditioning. It was really noisy so we had to turn it off during nights. We really enjoyed the breakfast with lots of fruit and pastries. Coffee and water was available all day which is a plus.The location of Vive Hotel Waikiki is amazing - it's only a few minute walk to the beach, there's a bus stop right in front of the hotel and there are plenty of dining and shopping opportunities just few steps away.

It would be unfair to start this review bragging about the amenities at this hotel because quite frankly this isn't an amenities rich place. No pool, no restaurant (though continental breakfast is included and quite fresh) and no lanai's in the rooms. Why then a 5 star review? The price is low, the beds are great, the rooms are clean, the staff are excellent, the valet parking was half the price of public parking, the lobby is welcoming, the beach goodies are free to use, the tea and coffee are unlimited, and the location! Excellent location. This hotel is a GEM.

What a great place to spend six days in Oahu. It is conveniently located close to the beach, International Market and many, many shops and eateries. Our group even strolled down to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre one morning. If walking is not for you, the bus stops about 10 metres from the front door! Our room was very comfortable and quiet and well appointed. The staff were amazing - helpful, courteous and very friendly. Nothing was ever too much! Very reasonably priced.

The biggest advantage of this hotel is its location and employee friendliness. My room condition was good, and I also had a good breakfast. If I go to Hawaii Waikiki beach again, I want to stay at this hotel again.

We paid such a good price for our stay in Vive. It’s a small hotel and rooms are small yet the location is amazing and we are very happy with our stay. If you are looking for a place to sleep for your trip in Hawaii, look no further.

Great value and location.Accesible to everything ( buses,restaurants,shops, lots of abc stores).Helpful and friendly staff. Breakfast was adequate.Housekeeping did a wonderful job of cleaning the rooms.Courtesy room was a great idea.Would definitely come back.

The hotel is very well situated. The rooms as stated in their website are on the smaller size, but more than enough room and comes with all the necessities.Daisy on the front counter was terrific and very customer focused.My only negative would be the lack of sound proofing, you constantly hear doors opening and banging closing.Would definitely recommend and stay again.

The location of the hotel is convenient - Less than 5 min to the beach, close to public transportation, about 20 min from the airport and close to restaurants and shopping places. The rooms and bathrooms are small - we did not mind this because we spent most of our time outside. They offer breakfast - bread, cupcakes, croissants, coffee, tea, pineapple juice & fresh fruits. The staff are polite and very helpful.If anyone is looking for a budget friendly hotel, i would recommend staying here.

Vive hotel was perfect for our week long trip. From the check-in experience to checkout, the staff were always friendly and helpful. Vive is only 2 blocks away from the beach and main shopping areas, which allowed us to stay in a slightly quieter area. Highly recommend and will be back!

My daughter and I spent 6 nights at this hotel. The location was ideal, 2 blocks from the ocean, quiet at night, and within walking distance of many activities, restaurants and sites. The room was exceptionally clean and the service was perfect. The front desk service was always positive and supportive of what we needed! Preston and Daisy were always warm, full of smiles and helpful ideas, they are the main reasons we would choose this hotel again, that exceptional service!!!! It was so wonderful we are hoping to go back next year in 2018......

Knowledgeable and friendly staff. Free WiFi and delicious breakfast buffet makes this a great value. No sneaky hidden resort fees! Only a couple blocks to the beach and walking distance to so many good restaurants. Will return for sure.

This hotel is amazing , clean friendly and close to the beach ! On arrival we were given towels to freshen up and fresh pineapple juice , the continental breakfast each day was delicious , with a variety of choices !! They also offer a courtesy room on the day of check out , so you can freshen up before leaving the island . Highly recommend this hotel !!!

We arrived at the hotel around 8am not expecting to be able to check-in, but Preston on the front desk was absolutely brilliant. They had a room available and we were checked straight in and were able to rest for a couple of hours before going out again.A really lovely little boutique hotel literally a few minutes walk from the famous Waikiki beaches.

Had an awesome, easy, relaxing stay here. Staff were lovely and very helpful. Breakfast in the morning was delicious., plus coffee & tea all day in the main lounge.Amenities in room were top notch, WiFi included. And most importantly, no ridiculous “amenity/resort” fee!!We will definitely be back!!

We came to Hawaii expecting friendly, happy people & great customer service. The hotel was clean & comfortable but has no soul. Staff don't address you by name, they barely say hello let alone go out of their way to be helpful. Breakfast was ordinary & limited with the same thing repeated daily - we sort food elsewhere as it was so boring.

We should have benn told that the possible breakfast selections diminished remarkably aftern 9:00 am. We went down to get coffee about 7:30 am and saw a remarkable selection of breakfast items but did not return until 9:00 am for food. We were shocked to see that there was hardly anything but bread and fruit. All the egg and meat selections were gone!!Perhaps you must warn customers about this.

Staff were exceptionally friendly and went above and beyond to make our stay great. Hotel is close to the beach and shopping. Breakfast was light but delicious and included pineapple, pastries and coffee. Overall we were very pleased with the hotel.

Upgrade airconditioner units-aircon they are too noisy.The iPad was brilliant concept. It was great idea to be able to schedule room clean and request any additional amenities.no other comments.Great location

We loved our stay at Vive. Prices are very reasonable. The location is much quieter than the next place we stayed while still being a short walk to all Waikiki has to offer. The shower is absolutely HUGE! Bed was comfortable and there was no shortage of linen/pillows.The staff were super friendly. We were looked after by Preston. He's a legend and hooked us up with 15% off at Flour & Barley which turned out to be an awesome feed.

We enjoyed the Vive last year and returned for a second stay this year. Again we experienced a superb, friendly staff. The location, amenities and service are great.Vive claims their direct reservation prices are the guaranteed lowest, however when we booked our stay, calling the hotel was more expensive than the online price I found. The hotel said they couldn't match the booking site price.

Bed was extremely uncomfortable. Room was noisy - air conditioner was loud all through the night and when it finally stopped, you hear busses going by in the morning starting from 6/7am. Window has smudges all over them so it makes the place feel dirty. We stayed here for one night because we arrived late so we were looking for a value hotel. This wasn't good value at all!

This is a fantastic property that has may benefits including very friendly and helpful staff, continental breakfast, all day coffee and free internet. It’s a pleasant short walk to the beach and to all shopping including restaurants and caravan food kiosks. I would recommend to families, couples and seniors. Transportation is available for tours and public buses from virtually the front door with staff including a concierge service at your finger tips and ready to be of help. Very clean and comfortable. Fantastic value for money

excellent hotel good value for money and good location. Breakfast could be little better set. A/C quite noisy and not very effective. Overall no problems. Will definitely recommend.. We were on the 19th floor so good view from room.

Stayed in Waikiki early Nov 2017. Rooms are small but well maintained and organized. Bed and pillows were super comfortable. Breakfast had many choices for fruit, pastry and breads. Lounge well laid out.

This is a reasonably priced room.Breakfast is delicious, and water and coffee are always available.The distance to the beach is 5 minutes on foot, and the shopping center is within 10-15 minutes on foot.

Vive Hotel was a great place to stay. The breakfast was a good start to the day (i.e., boiled eggs, lots of fruit, bread, peanut butter, jam). We appreciated the all day tea, coffee and filtered water. I would recommend bringing a water bottle that you can fill up and bring up to the room and to use when you are out and about.The staff are very friendly and helpful. We appreciated their recommendations for restaurants and packing us breakfast for our early morning excursion.KC, the concierge, was so so helpful in recommending and booking tours. When there was a mixup on the tour operator side (no fault of KC), KC fixed it promptly and we were still able to do everything we wanted to do. The room was not spectacular, but clean and the bed is really nice. The dark carpet and dark furniture makes it look dingy, but then again how much time are you spending in your room? Overall, great place to stay and I wouldn't hesitate in staying here again or recommending it to another person. Bonus: no hidden resort fees!

Two blocks from the beach, one block from Mokus Surfboard rentals, one to two blocks from everything, restaurants, grocery store, and retail. Staff is on top of it and attentive. The breakfast is mostly bread, juice and coffee, rooms are really dinky. Serious height restriction for vehicles - don't rent a Suburban. Overall the Vive is a great value!

Loved my stay here, so close to the beach and main strip in Waikiki. Staff were lovely, free loan of beach gear was very handy too. More than adequate continental breakfast was lovely, I recommend a sea view room for a few extra dollars, as you will be able to see the beach rather than just other buildings outside your window....

A plus on all accounts. Survey needs to be shorter. Trip advisor was a good resource. Yes tons of notes in my headLook at that last pic - the D'Ali Lama will be speaking there - town is called and that old theater is from the 9th century Remaining Norman fortress walls date even further back

Great location - 2 blocks back from the centre of Waikiki Beach. We were on the 16th floor and the room was fairly quite at night!! The A/C was a little loud but I think that is normal for Hawaii, I didn’t mind at all. Room is small, but very clean, modern and in good up keep. There is no resort fees which is rare in Hawaii. Basic continental breakfast included I really enjoyed - pineapple juice, Hawaiian coffee, fresh fruit, toast and pastries.
