Upon check in they give you icy cold pineapple juice and cold wet towel to feel refreshed after your flight which was a really nice touch. Front desk has a map of Waikiki with which bus to catch where which was really helpful. You can also borrow beach towels, umbrellas, boogie board, beach chairs and beach mats (first come first serve - umbrellas always first to go). I would stay here again for sure.

The hotel was perfect for us. Loved having the complimentary breakfast in the morning. The staff were also very friendly and helpful. The concierge helped us decide the best places to visit. Thanks so much Vive.

- located very close to waikiki beach and many shops/ restaurants- robes provided ( nice touch)- room is very small but this is typical for a downtown hotel in waikiki. Just enough space.- a/c unit is very loud and is definitely a problem while trying to fall asleep. Archaic window a/cs are used.- breakfast is slim pickings including includes fruits, croissants, muffins, toast. No bacon or eggs or sausage etc.- chic decor both in lobby and room - check in and check out was fast and painless- staff was friendly

The location was perfect, so central and easy to walk everywhere we needed to go. The hotel is small but great, the room was comfortable and quiet, and we had a great view of the ocean. This hotel has a young-ish vibe, but not in a backpacker/hostel kind of way. We're in our early 30's and we felt very much at home here. Free breakfast was delicious, and the staff were all very friendly and accommodating. Definitely recommend Vive Hotel.

Stayed here for 6 nights and so glad i picked this hotel from the excellent reviews. Why pay more in other hotels when here was excellent value for money with no resort fee and a breakfast thrown in too.  Arrived here at 1 in the morning from a 20 hr flight from England and was greeted with a warm welcome and pineapple juice on check-in which was excellent. Was given room 1207 and as it was my partners 50th birthday there was a note and a small box of chocolates on the bed which was a nice touch. The room itself was just perfect for the 2 of us. Sea view, clean, safe deposit box, wifi, tablet for room service, en-suit bathroom, hairdryer, t.v, fridge and a very comfy bed and pillows. Just perfect. The room was serviced everyday by the maid. The air-con was noisy but only put it on in the evening before i went out and on my return to the room it was cool enough and just turned it off. As i was on the main street it was a bit noisy outside but it didnt really bother me.  The breakfast itself was excellent. Im usually a full English breakfast man, but would enjoy relaxing in the lounge for an hour having the selection of fruit, pastries, muffins, toast, juice, tea and coffee. There was a microwave, or combi oven available if needed.  During the day and for 24 hrs, complimentary tea and coffee was available and it was great to come back to after a days sight seeing or being on the beach. The staff were amazing. A big Aloha to Preston and to all the staff who made our stay very enjoyable. I had all my activities booked already, and my shuttle back to the airport. The staff on the front desk made my telephone calls to confirm on pick-up times from the hotel for these activities. Nothing was to much trouble.  This is a gem of a hotel and would love to return here again in the future. MAHALO.

My wife and I had a pleasant stay at Vive hotel, the staff were very friendly and we loved the interior of this place, very funky & Art Deco! I would like to say a big thanks to KC Nunes, he was tremendously helpful in giving directions and recommendations, loved his company, very pleasant to talk to, and what a great hair cut too. Overall good hotel. Funky as hell!!!!

Very helpful staff. We arrived early and our room was made available as soon as possible. We were invited to have breakfast while we waited. Our checkout was late in the afternoon and we were delighted to be offered a courtesy room to shower and change before we left.

It was a pleasant surprise to have found this place. Stayed in a jr. suite on the 21st floor with a king. Huge room in a minimalist decor. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom quite large and modern and the shower was simply huge. The WiFi was superior and the tv cable system ok. There’s a tablet in the room for your use that has just about all that’s needed. Just a great touch. The room was terrific for sleep. The A/C rattles for sure. I can see where that would bother guests. No coffee or tea in the room. All our interactions with the staff were good. A couple of them were downright fabulous as they helped us out with suggestions. The hotel is very close to the beach and incredible shopping, restaurants and grocery options. The lobby is large and open. The concierge was useless but the desk staff more than made up for that with their friendly advice and suggestions. It’s pretty obvious that the management cares.

Loved this hotel, stayed there for a whole week. The staff were very nice, they always gave us advice on what to do. There was an employee named Ryan there, super cool guy and always helped us. Definitely recommend this hotel, it's pretty much at the center of everything.

was frankly worried by all the reviews that complained about : carb-only breakfast, cramp breakfast areas, small rooms, noisy air conditioner, noisy main road, slow lifts, no beverage making set in room, unfriendly recep services -- so we came with trepidation & were mentally prepared.lets start with the pleasant :-5mins walk to the main beach-plenty of all kinds of eateries from budget to high end (opposite is a nice & affordable korean food, and a japanese too.)-important bus routes on this road : bus stop 30secs walk away (towards downtown and A la Moana shopping mall & major bus transits)-buses 19 and 20 from airport alight 2 mins walk diagonally opposite -from the same bus stop, bus 2 and 23 go to Diamond Head national park-renovated lobby & chic bright cheery dining/seating area-bedroom (we took standard) was spacious enough, clean, bright cheery, is even fitted with blank-out curtain (Hawaiian sun is blazing already by 7am)-rooms are very well and quietly ventilated-24hrs free flow beverages (coffee,teas) and hot & cold water from the Dining with paper cups to take away-the dining/seating sofas are inviting enough for many guests to drink & laze there-bed & pillow good; linens & towels clean, refreshed everyday if we needed; toiletries good quality-the road normal rumbling was not a problem (or we were too sun tired)-LED TV was good reception-they provide free of use, everyday if you want : beach towels & beach chair-the Tab on my bedside is handy, has my name on it—I should have asked whether it’s a souvenir for me...now with the less than perfect :-is indeed an all carb breakfast binge with not one shred of meat or cheese or eggs—but weren't we already forewarned that it was Continental Breakfast to be? and we could load ourselves with as many bread, pastries, muffins, croissants (they were good) as the server could pull out fast enough from the kitchen. On the table tops are ovens & mega toasters to warm them our loaves. Peanut butter, jam and butter as much as we can spread. Vanilla milk for coffee—nice touch. They won’t stop you if you do buy in ham & sausages etc—which we were tempted some time but we might create a riot as other guests would think we got preferential treatment. And there’s so much cut fresh fruits provided that you wouldn’t complain of lacking fibre and vitamins. But breakfast stuff all poof taken away the moment the sun dial chimes 9.30am, so you have been warned-cramp dining room? Yes it did fill up during peak breakfast time but we didn’t see anyone deprived of seats. Assortment of sofa, chairs, long bench, glass top—all pleasantly mixed up.-small bedrooms & insufficient racks to hang? We didn’t suffer that despite that we tend to hang all our clothings to air and dry. Our corner room has 2 windows—all cheery and bright-slow lifts? Nope, always less than 1 min even at peak.-no beverage making set and complimentary water in the room—yes; and they extort USD1.50 per bottle taken. But there’s plenty of water & beverage in the Dining. In facts it was very pleasant to sit there and enjoy our coffee and people watching. We brought up water and coffee for the night.-and the mother of all complains—noisy air conditioner. Yes, it was noisy & rattling. We were surprised to see many high rises in Hawaii still using these ancient through-wall air con unit. We came armed with ear plugs but the hawaiian sun, sea and sand cured all our insomnia and we were cong’ed out by midnight—deaf to careening carriages turned screeching pumpkins on the road outside or air con rattling itself hoarse inside.-unfriendly recept services? I’d say they seemed like that.. but truth be told, they were efficient & quite helpful. But they were shy to be flashing colgate smiles on all occasion for one and sundry. Overall we think they are a nice comfortable chic boutique hotel.

Room was very small. “Ocean view” description forgot to include the other high rise hotel directly in front of Vive, blocking the ocean. Windows were small enough to funnel only the hottest UV rays onto our faces. Found a cockroach scurrying around the bathroom after we had both showered in it. Front desk was unable to find another room or upgrade us, I highly doubt there was another room they could’ve given us though. They sent Anthony to kill the bug with Raid, but only after stepping all over our room with his work boots. In the end, we only got a meager refund for half a night’s sleep. Will not recommend that roach hotel to anyone else.

The location was very convenient. That's one of the most positive thing I can say about the hotel.I will list the Cons below:Bugs in the roomIce only available at the first floorHouse Cleaning left the door to our room open so anyone could have gone in and stolen our belongings. When we called the Lobby, the Receptionist only said "Sorry".

Very good location, a few steps from the beach and from the principal area of restaurants, bars and stores (since Louis Vuitton, Dior, and so on, to ABC and souvenirs stores). Free breakfast with good options such as fruits, breads, pineapple juice, coffee and tea. No extra fee usually charge for others ($25 a day), free amenities to the beach (towels, chairs, umbrellas, bodyboards and mats) and very friendly staff.

Great price, friendly staff, and fantastic location! We were allowed early check in after coming off a morning cruise and check out slightly late which they were very accomodating about.Only have postive things to say about this wonderful place! Would definitely stay there again.

This hotel was new/redone but not just with a coat of paint. The rooms were small but clean and fresh. No resort fees! I'll definitely stay again. The location is just a couple of short blocks to Waikiki Beach.

The Vive is situated 3 blocks from the beach (2 min walk).Our room on the 19.th floor had a spectacular view of the beach and Diamond head.Two things to notice here is:1. Breakfast - For europeans continental breakfast is more than just pastries and fruit: I would at least liked to have some yoghurt and cereal.2. AC-noise - If you must have the room dead quiet to sleep you will find that the AC is situated in the windows and are quite noisy. But if you book a hotel in the Waikiki hotel complex area there will always be some nice from the street, even on the 19.th floor.But staff was very friendly and helpful.Our room was big with the biggest shower I've ever seen in a hotel room. You could have showered your entire family at the same time in there :-) Note that we had booked a jr suite.Amenities was nice with beach towels and straw mattresses to borrow.

First, let me just state, the ONLY reason I am giving 4 instead of 5 is because there is no restaurant on premises. If I could give 4.5, that would be more accurate. This hotel was very accommodating. We were right across from the water (about two city blocks, not far at all) and also just at the edge of shopping, just turn right outside the doors and that's all great shopping. They let us park our car in the lot way before check-in (as in 6 am and check-in is at 3). We were only there one night, just to experience Waikiki, and when we checked out, the let us keep our car there until we had to go to the airport later in the evening. The bed was very comfortable. My husband and I booked the mountain/city view and ended up with a corner room on the 21st floor that had a great view of the mountain plus a side window where we could see the ocean. Also, the shower was probably the best, most roomy shower I've had in a hotel and I've been to quite a few. The continental breakfast was just that, nothing special, but that is as advertised. A forewarning, we used valet for the car which was great, but, the garage is narrow and has a few blind spots, so that's a little scary - but there's no real need to drive if you're hanging local so that's about 30 seconds of your stay. I recommend this hotel, and I would stay here again.

We stayed for 6 nights in a queen room. They even checked us in early at no charge! Great location, bus stop right out the front, comfy rooms, Staff are friendly. Will definitely be coming back when in Hawaii again!

This was my first time visiting Honolulu. We stayed there for 6 days and very delighted all the time. The breakfast was very good and location is perfect for beaches and buses. The staff are all friendly and ready for help. Strongly recommend! Special appreciation to you, Ian.

This hotel was so nice. Rooms are clean and staff is great.. A 2 block walk to the beach and all the restaurants. Free beach towels and matts. Breakfast is fruit and pasty. There is all day coffee. So why pay more for the brand names and stay here. The valet parking guys are really good.

Room is normal, clean, but even in 16th floor there was very noisy. We lots of little ants.(don`t forgot food on the table) The bed was very soft for us. Breakfast was little low, no eggs or meat products. Location was very good . Hotel personal was kindless and helpful. I liked the opportunity to get free coffee and tea throughout the day.

It was an excellent experience. The rooms were clean. The attendants were great. Hotel was clean and felt safe. The breakfast was good. The hotel was close to everything. The young lady was very helpful on getting excursions.

This was our second time staying at Vive. 2 years ago, we stayed at vive for our honeymoon for 10 days. So when my wife and I planned to go back to Hawai‘i, we definitely wanted to comeback to Vive.On our recent trip, we stayed 2 weeks. We had asked if they could book us in the same room we had during our honeymoon and they accommodated us. It was great staying in the same room, which was the ocean view jr. suite. Great size room with great views of Waikiki and Diamond Head. The room was also was very clean.The location is great, only less than a few minutes walk to Waikiki and the statue of duke. Just across the street was one of our favorite places to eat, musubi cafe. And definitely close to all the shops and places to eat in Waikiki. The first time we went to Vive, we remembered the staff was so friendly and welcoming, which is one reason we decided to stay again. All of the employees during our stay for this vacation were friendly and welcoming but three people that we definitely remember and are great at their job are Paul and Jordan (valet) and Agatha (housekeeping). These three individuals went above and beyond every day to help make our stay feel like home. Location with the price of the room and the friendliness of the staff are some of the main reasons why we chose to stay and would stay again when we plan our trip back to Hawai‘i.

We stayed at the Vive as part of our honeymoon in July and could not have been happier. As soon as we arrived we were greeted by lovely friendly staff who made us feel welcome straight away, and the fresh pineapple juice was just what we needed after a very long flight. Upon checking in, we were advised that as it was our honeymoon we had been upgraded to a Penthouse suite – the room was absolutely amazing with lots of interesting touches like the John Lennon picture on the wall, all of which suited our tastes perfectly! We also received a lovely box of chocolates and a note wishing us a happy honeymoon which made it feel extra special. The hotel is in a great location and the fact that we were able to borrow beach towels and mats was really useful. The concierge was very helpful, and recommended two great restaurants which we visited on our short trip. Overall we were so pleased with the hotel – we were originally booked at another hotel but changed shortly before our trip and we’re so pleased that we did! It was an excellent first stop on our first trip to Hawaii and we can’t wait to come and visit again!

This hotel was incredible we loved it. Great location with a two minute walk to the beach and great value . Spacious room, big bathroom and super comfy bed. We will definitely stay here next time we go to Waikiki.

My travel friend and I chose the Vive Hotel Waikiki for our 4 night visit after reviewing Trip Advisor. It was a superb choice! The hotel is conveniently only 3 short blocks off the center of Waikiki Beach and the ocean. It is close to nearly everything and the bus stops that go out to Diamond Head , Hanauma Bay , or in the opposite direction towards Pearl Harbor. The rooms were quite small, but modern. With a mini fridge, good TV, good free wi-fi, and a very nice continental breakfast with great fresh fruit, and very reasonable prices, this is a really great choice for staying in Waikiki! The price was very reasonable and the staff fantastic. I have traveled the world and Morgan at the concierge desk and Preston and Shane at the front desk were as friendly and helpful as anywhere I have traveled . From recommending restaurants with a map included, to completely setting up our Day at the Polynesian Cultural Center, they were all above and beyond the call. I will stay here again when in Honolulu and highly recommend the Vive Waikiki !

Great place to stay with easy walking distance to the beach, restaurants and transport. A very nice clean and relaxing place to stay. I loved the comfy bed and pillows. We stayed in the family room and it was just perfect for us. Concierge was awesome with KC and another girl (can’t remember her name sorry) just so helpful and informative. Loved being able to borrow towels, beach chairs, mats etc. .& no resort fees. The continental breakfast was a great start to the day too, with breads, pastries and lots of fresh fruit and juice. We loved our stay here and will be back and highly recommend VIVE. Thanks VIVE Hotel for a memorable stay.

I stayed at this hotel with my wife for a week in Oct-17.The staff are excellent and really helpful and remember your name.Location is excellent, although it is away from the busier part of Waikiki but this is a positive as it is quieter and only 500m away!Complimentary breakfast is a great inclusion however could be improved by adding some cereal options and some more 'normal' dining seating.Internet is great, beach towell/chair/umbrella hire is included.The updated rooms were clean, light and felt much larger then they actually are.

Did I mention that this place is really clean? This is an older building in the old part of Waikiki that has been remodeled into a very nice hotel. Space is very limited on the island, so these rooms may seem a little small, but they were perfect for two people. All of the other reviews will talk about being two blocks from the beach, all of the free gear that they provide with friendly service, and how great Kasi, and Morgan are at being concierges. That's all true. We really appreciate all of the last minute bookings, and tour advice from both Kasi, and Morgan. They are what made our vacation enjoyable. The one thing you won't hear about is the great bedding. The extremely soft cotton sheets are only available from hotel suppliers, so I couldn't order any. The pillows are another story. These were the most comfortable pillows that I have ever slept on. They were so good, I took one apart to find the label. We have only been home for a few hours, and I have already ordered two for $27 each. Want to know what they are? You will have to stay at the Vive to find out for yourself.

A well run, well appointed Hotel in a very central location with a short walk directly to Waikiki beach. The Hotel is extremely clean and all staff are happy and will always help with any request. A must to visit again.

Vive hotel is really nice and quaint. It has a warm feeling when you walk in and the staff are really nice and inviting. For the price we paid it was worth it. The tablets in the rooms are a nice touch. It's within walking distance to everything you need, rooms were smaller but I didn't feel cramped. I would stay here again.

This is a very convenient hotel. The room that we were in was nice somewhat small. As with every hotel room there are quirks and ours was the toilet running. Otherwise the staff was great, the continental breakfast was perfect to get you started.

My family had a good time on vacation, and we enjoyed our stay at the VIVE Hotel. The room is well cleaned. The staff are friendly, and this hotel has a relaxed and comfortable atmosphere. My family will definitely be staying here again when we return..... Mark T.

At a last minute we decided to take a long weekend and go to Honolulu. The place we usually stayed at was full so we searched and found Vive. It is just a block or so from the ocean. They have complimentary boogie boards, chairs, umbrellas, beach towels, etc. so we did not have to pack or buy those items. You also receive a complimentary continental, lots of fruit. We joined their Vive club (it's free) and found a box of Godiva chocolates on our bed. The room is small but clean and seems new, does not have the funky damp smell that some hotels in Hawaii have. Preston at the front desk was helpful. When we checked in we received a cold drink and a cool cloth.Our return flight was around midnight, we checked out and played all day. Vive had a complimentary room that you could use to shower etc before leaving for the airport, which was great. I am hoping to return to Vive again shortly.

Excellent service, beds great, always clean and continental breakfast provided. Beach towels and gear also free. Location fantastic, back couple blocks form main beach and shops. Concierge was very knowledgeable and very helpful negotiating a refund when we couldn't complete Volcano flight. The overall experience was appreciated.

The location is great as its only 250m to the beach. It's close to a great choice of eateries and shopping options, public transport, tour companies.The continental breakfast (pastries, toast and fresh fruit) is what we would eat at home, so perfect for us.The front desk staff greeted us with a genuine smile and ensured that check in was as smooth as possible - the wet face towel and juice was a lovely touch. We arrived early and weren't expecting any of our rooms to be available. One was, so this made it that much easier and a great start to the holiday.The down side - the rooms are not well insulated from street noise or the air conditioning unit (old school rattler in the window). Due to the warm and humid weather, the air conditioning need to be run 24/7... This made sleep difficult and uncomfortable. The other down side - house keeping. I do feel that its reasonable to have the bathroom cleaned daily and the common areas vacuumed daily ( four days went by before they vacuumed the hallway and lift which was covered in sand).If the hotel could address the down sides, I would stay here again.

Staying at this hotel was perfect! Staffs were friendly and helpful. My room was always cleaned with replenished amenities. The walk to the beach was minutes. I enjoyed how restaurants and stores were walking distant. Thank you for the stay!!

Rooms were tiny. So small almost hit the bed when opening the door. Some staff members great and others not good at all. Single beds in twin rooms are not acceptable. Most disappointed as we were looking forward to this holiday.

I was nervous when looking at hotels in Waikiki because I had read many reviews talking about the rooms being unclean in many of the midrange hotels. I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived at Vive Hotel to see it was clean and organized. The room is a little small but my wife and I stayed for 6 days and it was large enough for us. The location is great and the hotel will supply you beach towels, chairs and kid size boogie boards. The breakfast consisted of mostly pastries and fruit and had some hot drinks and pineapple juice. It is right next to a bus stop that could take us pretty much anywhere we wanted to go. It’s about 20 min bus ride to Ala Moana shopping center and 30 min bus to downtown. The only compliant I would have is that even on the 16th floor we were able to hear the traffic down below sometimes, but even as a light sleeper it didn’t affect my sleep at all. The black out shades and comfortable bed and exhaustion that comes with traveling allowed us to both sleep very well. Below is the picture of our room and the ocean view that we had. Although there is a building in front of you, you still can see the ocean. Also, there is not resort fee which does help with the affordability of this hotel. On a side note, TheBus in Waikiki just changed so now you can ride all day for just $5. So something to consider in your travels.

The interior of the hotel was pretty hip and cool. But there were several problems while I stayed in the hotel.1. They never replace new cups in the room. We had to get paper cups from the lobby everyday. What a waste! 2. Free continental breakfast doesn't include protein:eggs or yogurt. Mostly bread, pastry, bread. It was gross and fatty. 3. They require Vallet no matter what, which costs 25$ mandatory fee per night. And also additional charges at they end of the night. I thought it doesn't charge "resort fee" so it would be cheaper but I ended up paying way more!!!

Everything was easy. We just had to check in, sleep, eat breakfast, grab beach accessories from the front desk and go have fun. Convenient location for shopping and transit. Rooms were cleaned up everyday and the breakfast was a good way to start the day cheaply and quickly.

Excellent staff. Very helpful and prompt in service. Great location near the beach without the expensive resort fee that others charge. Delicious breakfast with many fresh fruits and great coffee. Would stay here again.

The rooms was small but I didn't come to Hawaii to stay in my room. It was very clean, the breakfast was great and the staff was wonderful. I would stay here again and again. They booked transportation for me and helped with anything I needed. I was impressed and I loved the room they let me use to shower just before my flight as it was very late night and I needed to clean up before my flight.

This hotel had a great and convenient location, and the staff were always very helpful. We definitely recommend this hotel for anyone looking for convenience and comfort. Thanks for a great stay Vive!

This was probably the best hotel experience I have ever had. Wonderful staff, clean rooms, excellent continental breakfast - an extreme value in Hawaii, 3 small blocks from the beach. I just wish they had hotels elsewhere because it would be my first choice.

Great service, rooms small but clean, great location, continuous coffee and tea service, air conditioner a bit noisy, fruit and pastries available daily, bus service nearby, great restaurants nearby. Overall experience very good, Will revisit in the future

Great location, value and parking was great! Walkable to shopping, beach, restaurants, etc. Many of the shops close past 9pm so it was very convenient after a day of fun activities, you can still go out for a drink and enjoy the tourist strip.

The trip didn’t begin great as our room had an insect problem. We requested a new room and received a new one almost immediately. The rooms themselves were far smaller than I had expected and much like many of the properties in Honolulu have a newish façade laid on top of a, at times noticeably dated and deteriorating interior. The location was fantastic. Right in the thick of everything Waikiki. Super easy to get to our favourite spots. The most fortunate / unfortunate part of our stay was the service. The front desk gentlemen that helped us changed rooms showed no empathy, never apologized and didn’t follow up with us the next day to see how our new room was. In fact he barely could make eye contact with us. We were both disappointed in the lack of interest. However, the valet Captain Paul was unbelievably kind and genuine. His interpersonal savvy, customer focus and approachability was off the charts. He was the only member of the staff that we felt really cared. And we showed our appreciation by letting management know in addition to Paul himself. He was also the only member of the staff that we tipped. I recommended to the manager that Paul actually be at the front desk - at which point I learned he was at one point but made the decision to return to running the valet team. In our opinion as customers every member of this team could learn something from Paul.

The hotel has a great location only one block off the ocean. I had a quiet room in the back. The view was another hotel but I was not there for the view. But the room needed some updates. The air conditioner was a wall unit and it did not work. The bathroom shower has problems with the stopper. I would recommend this hotel but advise that it needs some updates. They provide towels and sitting chairs when you go down to the beach which is a big plus and the breakfast that is included is very good.

We came here for three days - 2 nights and we were truly disappointed. It all began with late check in and early check out. When you arrive early on the island and depart late, you're truly lost if you have to check in late and check out at dot 12. The arrival and departure date is lost by this policy. I would have appreciated it if they offered us a room to change our clothes or get a shower. With that policy we basically spent two days with our baggage in the car which was quit unconvienent. Also, the rooms were super tiny. The bathroom doesn't even fit one person, it was a joke. The AC was incredible loud, you can't sleep while it runs and you won't be able to open a full window as it's quite high so you will end up sleeping very warm. there's also no coffee maker or a complimentary beverage in the room. They give you a welcome drink (juice) when checking in though which is quite nice. Wouldn't come here again!

Travelling first time to Hawaii I was looking for a place to stay that was safe, clean, secure and within walking distance to Waikiki Beach. This hotel was perfect on all counts and also I had a great view of the city streets. The room came with a safe and was perfectly set up and outfitted. The bed was very comfortable so I had no trouble at all getting a good nights sleep I actually had to set an alarm so I wouldn't over sleep. I stayed for 6 nights and house keeping was very quick and efficient. I used the concierge service which was very helpful and knowledgeable. The reception desk was staffed at all times (made me feel safe) and they were very accommodating with any questions that you had. It just made my trip so much more enjoyable and I would certainly visit again either by myself or with my family.
user_name:
Carmen C
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: We had one of the larger rooms on the 21st floor. Everything but the lobby area in the hotel looks a bit shabby. The rooms have paper thin windows what leads to street noise (even on the higher floors) and disturbing noise of the window-mounted AC units.Only good things about this hotel are the location and the complimentary contintental breakfast.The Hyatt Centric Waikiki we stayed at on our trip is by far the better choice in the same price range.

Stayed here before and after our cruise. It is very close to the beach and main street in Waikiki for shopping, 5 minute walk. Transport just outside hotels door. Small and comfortable rooms, very friendly staff and can have complimentary beach towels, chairs at reception. If you aren't looking for beach views and paying a fortune I highly recommend this hotel. Was very surprised at how close it was to everything. Just up the road from Dukes statue.

Just returned from Oahu and I cant say enough about this hotel. Ifyou are looking for a 5star resort that is not it, but for its category it is the best hotel I have ever been to. It is the little things that make it standout, like the complimentary breakfast, the fresh pinnaple juice every morning, the tea, coffee and water available at all times which was convenient and saved money. The fact that you can take beach towels, mats, boogie boards with you for a day at the beach and you dont feel akward for asking as everybody is so polite and welcoming. The room was cleaned everyday to high standards and while I was worried about its size from other comments, it was perfect for us. Also the fact that you can schedule car pick up or cleaning time though the ipad in your room is great. Best of all however was the one hour courtesy room they provided for us after we checked out and before hading to the airport! Do you know of any other hotel that would this? It helped us make the full of our last day in oahu and plan a snorkelling excursion which otherwise would have been impossible if we could not come back and take a quick shower to remove the sand and wet swimsuits before catching a red eye flight! Thank you!If I have a small downside is the noisy aircon. We were so exhausted every day that didnt really affect us, but it is indeed noisy. Hope they can replace these somehow.I wish there was such a nice hotel in every city I travel to!

Generally are good but glasses window won't stop the traffic noise at night and the king bed is clumsy.24 hrs coffee are very good, as well as breakfast, polite and helpful staffs. Will come back again.

The hotel is located very very close in walking distance to the beach/main strip. The room I had was very small but fortunately I did not stay in it all say. The services like the free breakfast and beach towels with a mat were nice. The car vallet was quick and easy. Other then the room size and lack of a pool the room was perfect.

We read that parking fees are waived for kama'aina. When we inquired about this upon check-in, the clerk said we had to have booked the room at the kama'aina rate. A better hotel would have waived the $25 per night fee if they wanted to encourage rather than discourage return visits. The room was extra tiny but worse, the bathroom sink area was too small to brush your teeth without having to stand back to clear the walls. The sink itself was designed by someone who clearly never imagined what torture it is to actually use it. One inch deep and nearly flat, instead of water flowing down the drain, it splashes everywhere. Worse, the drain was blocked so we had to wait for the cookie sheet sink to drain every minute.At least the valet parking and housekeeping staff were very nice. We definitely will not choose to stay at this hotel again nor recommend it to others.

Nice quiet and friendly place to stay two blocks from Wailiki Beach. We parked at the hotel and their parking attendants would bring the car to you when you required it. The breakfast buffet was good with lots of fresh fruit and morning buns.

Let me start by saying what Vive is not:-It is not a chain hotel-It is not a brand new build-It is not an all-inclusive resortWhat Vive is:-It is a renovated high-rise, probably originally built in the 1960's-It is conveniently located-It is reasonably priced-It is safe and cleanWe have been to Oahu many times as my husband's family lives there. This particular trip was specifically for my daughter because she's interested in attending college on island. Therefore we decided to pick a new place to stay for this particular adventure.We arrived a little after 3pm and were greeted by a tall, sweet young man at the front desk. Jordan really set the tone for our whole trip! He was so kind and cheerful. Every time he saw me he'd greet me by name and wish us well. My only advice to him is to relax and take a breath! The valet attendants were kind, courteous, and always quick. I believe their names were Ryan and Roger. They took care of us too.Breakfast wasn't fancy - an assortment of fresh fruit, breads, muffins, and condiments like jam, peanut butter, and butter. Coffee and juice were also available. I didn't notice milk, but that's because we don't drink it. There were toasters and other warming devices. The lobby and dining area are not separate, but there's plenty of seating. I'm giving "Sleep Quality" 3 out of 5 stars for sound, not the bed/bedding. About 22hrs out of the day Waikiki is busy and loud with people, trucks, sirens, traffic, and all that transpires in a metro area. Although you can hear all the sounds from outside, I never once heard anyone else inside the hotel. My daughter had to do homework and said she didn't have a problem focusing. I highly recommend Vive for those who want a place to shower, sleep, and be close to the action. I'd totally stay there again!

This is probably the smallest room we have ever had in 30 years of traveling and yet that was well publicized before we arrived. And it was still quite comfortable. The staff and location make this an excellent choice to stay since it is in walking distance to the beach. Many restaurant options from food trucks to high end dining are all easily accessed. The staff from the front desk folks to the valets - are genuinely interested in your stay and go out of their way to provide awesome service. Our room was on the 20th floor and was very quiet.

Arrived at 7am thinking we'll have to wait for check-in time, but fortunately a room was made available for us that early. We are so grateful as we have been sleep deprived. They have comfy beds, clean rooms w/ toiletries, friendly staff, very nice continental breakfast with fresh fruits and yummy pastries every morning, and 24hrs available hot & cold water & coffee. It's only 2 blocks away from the beach & they provide beach towels, mat & chairs, also few steps from a bus stop. Great value for your money! Highly recommended.

Nice centrally located hotel just a short walk to the beach, even though the hotel doesn't have a pool and the room size is quite small and the rooms with some beach view can get quite noisy from the main street below, we enjoyed our stay and would recommend this budget great value hotel

Close to the beach and trolley pick up point. Continental Breakfast included which made mornings easier. Friendly and knowledgeable staff especially KC at the concierge. Nothing was too much trouble. Room was a little on the small side, but had everything we needed - comfy bed!

Hotel is 2 blocks from the beach. You can use their mats, chairs, and beach towels from the lobby. If you walk out of the front doors the beach is straight ahead. Location is perfect because you're on the main street for restaurants, shopping, lounges, public transportation and of course the beach. The continental breakfast is nice and great to get you started on your day. Plenty of fruit, pastries, pastry with meat and coffee and fresh squeezed pineapple juice.Anything you need just contact the front desk via in-room notepad (electronic). If you want to rent a car to venture out to other beaches, etc., please use the concierge. They have a special relationship with area rental car companies and will get you a better deal.

I stayed here for a week. And it's probably the best place to stay if you're on a budget. Arrived early and checking was a breeze. They provided free breakfast. Rooms are small but very comfortable. It gets cleaned everyday. Staff were very nice and the location of the hotel is just a short walk from the beach. Will definitely stay there again!

This is a clean, conveniently located hotel near the beach. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Our room was "cozy" but up to date and very clean. The price was far lower than surrounding properties.

We spend 7 nights at Vive and this is a great hotel. Rooms - Comfortable beds and good space in room for cases and clothes to be hung. Room has small safe and a fridge. I see that people are saying the air conditioning unit is noisy ... yeah a bit but it does work and some of the templates we experienced were over 30 degrees so very happy to get back in the room. Rooms are cleaned every day and to a high standard by a great team of cleaners.Breakfast - Buffet style with fresh fruit, cakes, small snacks and bread, Plenty of coffee on tap and this is available all day. There are two microwaves available as well. Location - A very short walk to the beach and to very happy not to have been on the beach front given the level of noise late at night, there is a bus stop next to the entrance which gives you good access to downtown. Staff - Very professional and helpful though out our stay. Reception staff when we arrived late from the airport were very welcoming with cool towels, fruit juice etc and gave us some good pointers on what was open to get food etc. Beach towels available and mats which staff sorted every day for us. They handled post for us as well. We also has great help from the concierge Sara Beth who helped with a tour booking and spent a great deal of time on best restaurants and also gave me direction to the only store selling Hawaii Five O materials. (Thank you) Another member of staff KC arranged for items to be forwarded to us which I am very grateful for and thanks to all who assisted with this. I planning another trip next year and plan to stay here again.

Great hotel, great value and great location! I would definitely come back to stay at Vive! We stayed for our honeymoon and a sweet card and chocolate were on our bed at check in! I also loved the complimentary coffee :)

Amenities and location are great. The hotel is located at walking distance to the beach. Easy access to downtown malls and many shopping stores and restaurants. Although cleanliness is a minus, I will recommend to others with advisory precautions.

Hotel is small, but nice. We stayed here for 8 days on a business trip with family of 4. Killed 2 cockroaches, one on first night and the next on the third night. Didn't see any more after that. Informed staff about the critters on the day of checkout, they didn't offer any type of inconvenience incentive. Staff said they would spray the room after our departure.

The Good- check in, free drinks, pleasant staff, free breakfast with juices, hot drinks, breads, muffins, lots of fresh fruit. It's not substantial nor does it range in choice but it's free...The beach mats, seats and towels that you can rent are really helpful and will save you dollars.The room in general was fine, bed was comfortable, shower was ok. The use of the iPad in the room was innovative tooThe bad- the lifts are only 2 in number, expect to wait. The rooms are tiny, the bathroom is small, toiletries are not replenished unless you continually ask, same with the bedding. The pillows are small, but more than anything the air con is ridiculously loud. We turned it off in order to sleep but then the room becomes too warm. In the 8 nights we spent there I did not have one uninterrupted nights sleep and generally woke up 2-3 times per night. It's a box per room and each room is the same.As close as this hotel is to Waikiki I wouldn't return. I would rather pay a little more and be able to sleep.

Clean and comfy hotel that not over the top. The great location of the place has a bus stop almost outside the main door. The walk to Waikiki beach was just straight down the road about five minutes away. In my option just a great good value pleasant hotel that is worth the stay.

The service at this hotel was excellent! The rooms are on the smaller side but service and amenaties make up for it. Just a few minute walk from the beach. They also offer a courtesy room to freshen up in after u check out before u head to the airport.

Excellent stay only complaint was air conditioning very noisy and not cold enough, location was excellent, breakfast very good, valet parking used everyday and were very friendly offering advice, I booked Hys Steakhouse next door for husbands 40th which was excellent

We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. It was really central and close to one of Waikikis bests Beach Park. Also, the rooms were clean with a comfortable bed and the staff are very friendly. The breakfast is simple with fruits, sweets and good coffee. Only con about this hotel I would say is their air-condition which is kind of noisy. Would however definitely recommend this hotel.

Great stay at the boutique hotel, breakfast was great with fresh fruit! Staff was so friendly and inviting except for the Asian lady with blonde and black hair, she has attitude and didn't seem happy we were paying cash for the water we purchased from our room. Other than that loved that it was so close to the beach! Would stay again.

Super helpful staff and great location. breakfast every morning and complimentary beach towels and boogie boards available. We would definitely stay here again.If I had to name some negatives, our room was a little dark, and the window mounted a/c units were loud.

It's all good love ❤️ i will go back again no problem next time I'm in Hawaii will definitely be back not far from the beach not far from the Hawaii canter and Ross and the pancake special for $5 bucks can not beat that

Hotel is 2 short blocks from Waikiki Beach. Rooms are a little smaller but modern and clean. At check-in we were greeted with 2 glasses of pineapple juice. I only spend my sleeping hours in the room so it's perfect.

We only stayed here for the one night so couldn't fully experience the hotel. It is located at a short walk from Waikiki beach which is very convenient. The room we had was on the small side but had everything you may need.

The Vive is the best place we have stayed, staff went above and beyond the call of duty, listened and helped out every way the could everything was awesome, the only thing i would recommend is to have a protein with breakfast, eggs for example. That would be my only thing to say negative.

We just spent 5 nights at the vive and it was a terrific experience. It is located 2 short blocks from the ocean. Even the Hyatt is not on the beach. The king junior suite was a deal and had an ocean view. It was very spacious with a shower to die for. The staff was helpful, if you needed ice, beach mats or towels for the beach, just ask at the desk.The rooms were clean. The breakfast was delicious fresh pineapple, honeydew, cantaloupe, mango as well as bread and pastries.

Great location for Waikiki, shopping and bus stop right next to the hotel. Modern, clean, nice staff, good room service, great buffet breakfast included. My only suggestion is the a/c units in the rooms need to be upgraded as they are very noisy. Would definitely stay there again as good value for money.

I would highly recommend this hotel. The staff was amazing rooms were clean the location was great (close enough to everything the far enough away to be quiet). The continental breakfast was included was great, I can't say enough great things about this hotel.

I don't usually review things but I decided I definitely had to take the time to for Vive Waikiki. My wife and I honeymooned here this week and we loved it. It was always clean, there is complimentary tea and coffee available 24hrs, a nice continental breakfast and high speed wifi access. It's only about a minute and a half walk from Waikiki beach and located on a main street that has excellent access to many of the bus routes around Honolulu. The most impressive thing about The Vive though was the staff. Very friendly, helpful and incredibly easy to deal with. We cannot thank KC, the concierge who helped us book all our tours and car rental, enough. She went above and beyond to ensure we got the tours we wanted or in some cases, she recommended even better ones. Definitely made our stay more memorable!

I had a really great time! The whole staff is very helpful. The rooms can be alittle small but I do not come to hawaii to hang in my room. Love the location, the hotel is spotless and love the decor. Open a sister property in Maui.

Amazing check in, juice and wet cloth on arrival. Early check in too. Free breakfast ran out very fast, 3 mornings i went down at 8.30 and there was barely any fruit left which was a shame, free tea and coffee thought out the day was nice.

Location great; breakfast very good. Rooms very small. Cleaniness OK. Beach chairs, boards, towels are all available and very good. Valet parking was good and prompt service. Travel desk not really promising.

Today is our final full day at Vive & I must say we have enjoyed it. Our room on the 12th floor gave us a great partial ocean view & lots of natural light in the room. The room felt clean which is important to us. The welcome staff was friendly and quick to get us checked in! It takes only 3-5 minutes to stroll right onto the beach! You are convenient to all the shops as well but off the "main strip". The only suggestion I can make is to improve the lighting in the bathrooms. Ours is a bit dim/yellow, not the best for ladies who are applying makeup for an evening out. Otherwise great stay!

Location close enough to beach and major shopping malls. Good value for the area. If have a car sign up with my vive and use their website to pay less for parking. Parking supposedly expensive in Waikiki so would walk everywhere while in that area. Beds and pillows were comfortable.

My wife and I stayed three night at the Vive Hotel in Waikiki. Perfect location. Close to the beach and off the busy streets of town. The staff was amazing. Ryan and a Emily were so very helpful with check in and dinner reservations at some local restaurants. I will return to the Vive each time I'm in Wakiki. Great price!

Vive hotel is in a good location and for the price.....it is ok. The rooms are a bit small, however the staff are so helpful and even got us checked in early as we arrived around 11:00. Breakfast was basic....but enough to get us going. The rooms are clean, they provide a tablet so that you have free internet access, and also provide towels and other beach accessories to take to the beach, which is a short walk away. It is a solid option if cost is a consideration.

A hotel that meets the budget and includes a continental breakfast. Just stayed one night but was treated well, check in was quick and easy and the staff is very accommodating. The rooms are very small but for the price I think it is a good value. everything is clean and efficient use of space wise.

Highly recommend, awesome room, and very friendly staff that make the extra effort, enjoyed our stay there. Very central location to Waikiki Beach. Breakfast could have a bigger variety, however it was decent enough.

Vive Hotel Waikiki is a great place to stay while in Honolulu. Super close to Waikiki beach and all of the shops and restaurants are within walking distance. Continental breakfast was great and the valet service was quick and courteous. Would absolutely recommend.

Loved the hotel, spectacular view of the city, great for photos. Clean, tidy (with AC), daily room service. Handy for Waikiki beach, about 10mins walk at most. Easy access for airport pickup and drop-off.

It was a great vacation! The location is perfect, hotel staff is really helpful and professional! Breakfast was super and the 24 hour service for coffe, tea and water also! The hotel is definitely recomendable!!!

We always have the best experience staying at vive hotel. We were able to check in early and also get a free room upgrade to a ocean view room which made our stay even better! Can't wait to visit again. Mahalo

We were satisfied, close to the beach, not big but clean room, breakfast is OK, lot of dining option in vicinity. It is good they provide beach towels and beach mats (limited amount of umbrellas). Good stay.

If you are looking for a comfortable, modern, and laid back hotel at the expense of amenities you likely wouldn't use anyway, this is your spot. My wife and I have stayed here twice now and each time has been very relaxing. The rooms are comfortable and modern, the breakfast is nice, and all of the staff from the front desk to the garage attendants are genuinely friendly and helpful. Thanks Vive!

Me and my partner stayed here for 10 nights in July the location is perfect. 2 mins walk to the lovely beach and 5 min walk to the main shops. Breakfast in morning saves just that little bit extra as well nice fresh fruits and pastrys the staff were always friendly and helpful rooms were cleaned everyday and were always to a high standard. we also used the rep (lady with Mohawk)that works in there she was all so very helpful booking a perl harbour trip dolphin/turtle tours and car rentals. Would defiantly love to return one day in the future thanks for a great experience

Great location very central to everything buses beach shops restaurants clean tidy friendly hotel complimentary good breakfast room are a little small but plenty of seating in the downstairs foyer easy accessible from the airport as The Bus stops outside hotel so overall a very good stay and would recommend this hotel

Enjoyed my stay and will recommend to others as well as return in the future. The location was great and was easy access to get to other locations on the island. I loved the fresh fruit every morning at the continental breakfast.

After a very stressful trip I was very pleased to find this hotel last minute at 1:30 and be able to check in immediately. No hassle friendly and fast service. My room was super cute and the view was pretty nice for a city view.

My sister and I had a great experience at Vive hotel on our trip to Hawaii. All staff is extremely kind and very useful when we needed anything, whether it be a shuttle to an excursion or a couple of band-aids. Our bed was made as well as towels were changed each afternoon. We really enjoyed our stay and will be coming back to Vive on our next trip to Hawaii.

Stayed here many times very affordable close to everything shops, food and most of all the beach. Small breakfast selection could be upgraded but overall worth the stay. Every ting we needed. We got..

The hotel is a great location! If you want to stay in Waikiki area, plenty to do and this hotel is walking distance to everything! A block or 2 from the hotel entrance is the beach. Shopping and eateries are just a steps away. Public transportation also easily accesible. Continental breakfast is complimentary which is helpful since it can get expensive in HI. You can borrow beach chairs and matts plus towels from the front desk which helps so you don't have to worry about where to get it. Become a member of this hotel and they will give you 50% off of your daily parking of $25. Great experience. Cannot wait to go back
user_name:
genie1278
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed at the Vive for a week and enjoyed this boutique hotel. It is ideally situated close to the beach, shops and eateries but just far enough away from the crazy crowds. Great rates that include a conti breakfast for the area and the staff were extremely helpful and courteous. We had a great time.

This is a good budget spot for Waikiki. Located within a quick walk to the beach and the International Market (central Waikiki). The front-desk staff was attentive and provided great suggestions for restaurants and off-the-beaten-path things to see and do. The rooms are much smaller than the pictures convey (tough to get 2 standard checked bags in and laid out). While I appreciate the hotel’s commitment to sustainability, I would have also appreciated if housekeeping would have changed the linens (on occasion) and ensured shampoo and soap are filled without guests having to request them. Breakfast didn’t cut it, we ended up eating out after the first day. $25/day resort fee covers valet parking.Overall: It would be a toss-up if we would stay here again; if we found a different hotel for a similar price and location we’d book it.
The hot water in the lobby, microwave, coffee was very convenient.Staff friendliness and room condition were neat.But, Exterior noise and air conditioner are very noisy.I can not sleep well at night.

Pros: The price is very reasonable for the area.The valet guys were very nice and friendly. The water pressure in the shower was excellent.There is a refrigerator in the room.The bed and pillows were comfortable. They will give you beach towels and beach mats.The iPad is an effective tool for scheduling services.The location is near the beach, shops, tours, and restaurants (about 2-3 blocks).The area seemed safe.Cons: Yes, the air conditioner is loud, and the walls are thin.There is no coffeemaker in the room.Breakfast was a major disappointment and not worth traveling down the very slow elevator to the small lobby/seating area.The room was small-ish and not like the pictures on the website. Not a big deal, but a slight disappointment.The hallways seemed dark and dingy.Housekeeping needs a lot more training. The sheets were not changed once during the 6 night stay. I know because the stains that were on the sheets when we arrived, remained for the entire stay. I did type into the iPad a request for a change of sheets. I even removed most of the bedding from the bed. The stains were still there. The rug was not vacuumed once, even though they seem to be concerned about ants/bugs. Housekeeping was also not very attentive to toiletries and replacements. Overall, the room did not seem to be clean or cleaned each day. If you're paying more than $130-150, you're paying too much. This could be a great boutique hotel, but changes need to be made. As it stands, I would probably not return to this hotel when visiting Oahu. Trip Advisor rarely lets me down, but it did this time.

Amazing hotel with nice view on ocean.Staff are very polite and helpful like a 5***** hotel. Breakfast is continental but very good too many choice of fresh fruits. I recommended to other travellers. Aloha

The staff are really great! They help us a lot during our stay. We went to Maui for 2 nights and they stored our luggage until we came back. I have a child with autism and had a meltdown. They were very understanding and helpful throughout our stay. The valet parking guys are very courteous too. The rooms are small but very clean esp the bathrooms. Clean and good smelling towels. Location was close to the beach, Catholic Church, restaurants and the shops. The street can be noisy from Friday to Saturday, screeching cars usually. I suggest to request rooms on higher floors. Breakfast has fresh fruits always. The bread and pastries are all good. I enjoyed the 24/7 brewed coffee, tea and water at dining. Microwave and toasters are available to use at the dining too.Big thanks to Chris Weeks for always being so nice and helpful.

We enjoyed our stay at the Vive Hotel Waikiki. The staff was first-rate--helpful, courteous, efficient. The continental breakfast each morning featured much fresh fruit, and the pastries were good, too. Perhaps there could be a bit more variety from day to day. We enjoyed having access to coffee and tea all day. On the whole, we found the Vive Hotel Waikiki to be an excellent value for the price.

The rooms were a little small, but we chose this hotel because we didn't plan to stay inside except to sleep anyway. Located a short walk to Waikiki beach, it was perfect for us. We would definitely stay there again!

Check the room before you book, Ours was somewhat small, I would have book a bigger room.KC and Morgan were outstanding in helping us set up tours for Pearl Harbor and Polynesian Cultural Center. KC rocks! Morgan was so helpful!Front desk staff were attentive to our needs.The breakfast was always on time, coffee is great! You may get tired of fruit every morning.It made our overall experience memorable!

The staff was friendly, the room was clean, and the hotel lobby was really nice (like a living room away from home). The location of the hotel is perfect as it is 2-3 blocks away from Waikiki beach and the Duke statue (where all the Waikiki tour trolleys stop). The hotel staff was even nice enough to hold my luggage after check-out at noon as I would not be picked up for the airport until 7 pm. When the airport shuttle passed by me, the staff was really helpful in getting in contact with the shuttle and making sure I was picked up. I felt the Aloha spirit in Vive and couldn't be happier of my choice to stay there.

The vive hotel has very good location & cheap price. It was convenient because it was close to Waikiki. And It was nice to have a lot of restaurants and shopping malls around hotel .but my room is not clean.

For the price, this hotel was a really good choice. The location is really good, and we were upgraded to a room on the 21st floor and could see the sea which was lovely. Waikiki is not the kind of place you want to spend a lot of time in hotel rooms, so it didn't matter too much that the decor of the rooms didn't quite match the standard of the lobby area, but it has everything you need. It's small, friendly, good value and in a lovely spot. Not luxury, but a great little hotel.

The front desk and valet team went above and beyond to make or stay enjoyable. We were only a couple blocks away from beach. Vive supplied us with towels, chairs and umbrellas everyday! Continental breakfast was so so but they had great coffee! Our room was exceptionally clean. The team members really made our stay the most enjoyable!

The hotel was clean and comfortable in a Perfect location. Staff were very friendly and helpful with all questions. Breakfast inclusion was a nice add on. Easy access to beach and plenty of restaurants within a 5 to 10 minute walk.

Vive is the perfect location, walk out the front doors and straight down the road and you are at the beach in 2 minutes. Super close to the heart of Waikiki shopping and eating as well and also, the bus stop is right next door.

A great find! We were specifically looking for a larger room with two queen sized beds to travel with our daughters, both young adults. We found the perfect room with two bathrooms at Vive with a gereat location. It is only three minutes from Waikiki and was also close by to some great small restaurants. The beach amenities made it very convenient to go to the beach. The continental breakfast had a generous variety of fruits and breads and it was available until 9:30. Honestly, it was a perfect option for us and well priced given the area. We cancelled a second reservation at another hotel so we could stay there again on our way back to the mainland.

Short stroll to Waikiki beach, great value especially with breakfast, close to public transport, staff exceptional, no need to take anything as beach towels, chairs, mats etc supplied. Have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

The location is very easy to access the beach from. The windows are old so you have a lot of sound resonating through, making it a little rough to fall asleep. The decorated living room was a great place to hang out and relax for a minute. Just dont leave food out in your room, you will find it covered in ants.

The value for your money at Vive simply CANNOT be beat in Waikiki!! The rooms are clean, comfortable, and cozy. The hotel is the same! Every staff member we met provided OUTSTANDING service. Housekeeping, breakfast, front desk, valet...all smiling, helpful, and full of the Aloha spirit! Although the room we had could be considered small, we only used it for sleeping and showering, therefore, who cares about the size! We had a BEAUTIFUL view of the ocean from the 20th floor, waking up to that view every morning was Heaven on Earth! If we HAD to find a fault, it would be that there are no hot options for breakfast. Big deal! For the price, this hotel is 5 Stars!! We will DEFINITELY stay there again should we return to Waikiki! I highly recommend this hotel!

Booked our reservation here based on location, price and Trip Advisor reviews. Hotel is conveniently located to the beach, restaurants, shopping and the bus line. We arrived way in advance of check-in and they had rooms available so they allowed us to check in that morning. We were greeted with a glass of juice and a refreshing towel. They also provide towels, mats and body boards for the beach. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Rooms were smallish but comfortable and what you'd expect for its prime location in Waikiki for the rate. We had a corner room with views in all directions. Room had thick, lush towels and bathrobes for use. Had a nice variety of breakfast items in the morning and coffee/tea available 24/7. The modern lobby lounge area was nice to hang out in. They don't offer a pool or restaurant but with the beach minutes away and the huge variety of places to eat in the neighborhood it really wasn't necessary. The only downside was that the air conditioner was a little loud but overall a great stay and would recommend and stay here again.

Room somewhat small, so look for what you are signing up for. Otherwise it is a great location for the beach and shops.The consiglieres KC and Morgan were extremely helpful in setting up tours. KC rocks!

Check-in time was at 3p but we arrived at 11:30a. We didn't expect to be able to check our room out until then but it was actually ready when we arrived. They were courteous enough to offer to look after our luggage if we wanted to look around. The room was cool and clean - very refreshing since it was pretty warm outside (what do you expect, it's summertime in Hawaii). There were complementary robes you could use, but they were pretty big (I don't usually wear robes so, maybe they're supposed to be like that?) I enjoyed using the complementary conditioner as well - I don't know what it was but my hair felt so soft the next day! They had fresh fruit for breakfast in the morning as well as an assortment of pastries. Coffee, tea, and pineapple juice were also available. My favorite thing was probably the beach towels and mats they let guests use - it would've been a hassle if you used your own towels. Overall, my stay was wonderful. Me and the boyfriend will definitely come back here to stay when we visit Hawaii!

Apart from air conditioning noise, a very good stay. The breakfast was great.Staff were friendly and helpful, with good advice to us as tourists. They booked shuttles promptly, and were very helpful explaininglocal conditions- for example how the Honolulu bus system works.

I stayed here for 10 days while looking for a place to live. The location was convenient and the price was reasonable. I was disappointed in the room, not at all what the pictures present. The lobby however was fabulous. Breakfast was nice and the coffee was excellent! The housekeeping service wasn't the best and they weren't very observant. They left the room with no toilet paper one day. I know Hawaii is a tropical location and there are bugs, but finding large cockroaches in your bathroom, only a few steps away from the bed was rather gross.

Vive is just a short walk to the beach and shops which is great. The rooms and hotel in all are very very small. Staff is polite. Complimentary breakfast is just pastry and coffee. Overall stay was pleasant.

Overall the hotel is clean and we did not encounter any bedbugs (one of the first things I check for upon checking into a room), and had excellent service, and a very comfortable bed. The hotel is located two short blocks from Waikiki beach and strip. We had a partial view of the ocean from our room. The rooms are small...just enough to move around. We didn't mind because we rarely spent time in our room (except to sleep). The valet service is friendly and is available 24 hours daily which is helpful when coming back late from an excursion. The hotel offered beach gear on first come basis and offers concierge service which we didn't use. My only constructive feedback which I provided in our feedback survey is to supply each room with a coffee maker and expand their continental breakfast offerings. I like my coffee in bed while on vacation...not go down 18 floors to get it. We will consider staying here again on our next visit.

Convenient to the beach, shops and restaurants-- yet just steps away from the bustle of it all. Superb staff, charming rooms --highly recommend Vive Hotel in Waikiki and we would definitely stay there again.

Close to everything, large bright rooms, very friendly and helpful staff and great bang for your buck - While this isn't right on the beach, it is only 2 blocks away. You get a lot more for your $$'s by being willing to move in 2 blocks

perfect location! everything including the beach was at walking distance! the rooms were very clean & very simple. the provided tea & coffee in the lobby 24/7 was much needed & appreciated. hope to visit again!

We had an amazing trip. Will recommend Vive Hotel for couples without kids. Room was too small and air conditioner was a little bit loud.Good housekeeping team and lady who served breakfast was really nice. Mahalo

The value of the hotel is amazing, it's slightly cheaper but at the same time is in perfect location with nice amenities. Breakfast is provided and also beach gear. We rented a car and the valet service is amazing. Room servicing is also equally good. I have no major complaints except for smaller rooms, lighting was not good and warmer rooms. I guess these conditions apply to all Waikiki hotels.

Stayed here for 3 nights. Location not the best, but within 5 minutes walk of the beach. Rooms are small which is to be expected for this price, but very clean. Breakfast was free and had a healthy yet diverse spread. Service great as always. Definitely can recommend!

We stayed here for 6 nights and were impressed with the location (about 3 minute walk to Waikiki Beach) and the cheaper price point. The room was very clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. The Korean BBQ restaurant across the road does excellent takeout, we ate there several times. There is also a bus stop directly outside that takes you to places such as Ala Moana, Pearl Harbor, etc which was very convenient. This hotel doesn't have any frills (no pool, our room didn't have a balcony, etc) but this is reflected in the cheaper price point and with Waikiki Beach so close, we didn't feel we needed these things anyway. Overall I would recommend and be happy to stay here again.

We just got back after staying at Vive Waikiki for five nights. We chose this hotel for two reasons, the price and the reviews. Our stay resembled all of the stellar reviews. Being greeted with a refreshing cool towel and pineapple juice while checking-in was awesome. All of the staff were friendly and extremely helpful. Shout out to Emily as she greeted us with a smile every time she saw us. The room are a little small, but you are in Waikiki to enjoy the beach. The room was clean and appeared to be recently updated. The complimentary Continental Breakfast was great with all the fresh fruit and pastries. They have filtered water and coffee available in the lounge all day. The towels, beach mats, and chairs were great. If you are taking a late flight, they have a complimentary room you can use for 1 hour to freshen up!If you want to stay in a hotel that is a couple of blocks from the beach, walking distance to the International Market Place and Royal Hawaiian Center, and want a staff that epitomizes the Aloha Spirit. Do yourself a favor and stay at the Vive Waikiki.We will be back, best hotel choice we have ever made.

Super friendly staff. Great value. It's a very short walk to the beach, and to all the other stuff that happens in the area. Great location, away from all of the business of the area, but close enough to walk.

The staff genuinely make this hotel a standout experience. Combined with its great location (within 3 mins of beach, restaurants, bus stop, supermarket, car rental and coin operated laundry) value for money and modern fitout, including in room tablet to access hotel services, this hotel was the complete package. We were really made to feel at home during our week long stay in a 2 room family suite, each room with its own ensuite. Additional inclusions such as continental breakfast and complimentary use of beach towels, beach mats and beach umbrellas were a nice touch. Valet parking is expensive in Waikiki (US$30-40/day), but at US$25/day, Vive is more reasonable. In window air-conditioners were a little old and noisy but effective.If you want a pool / bar / full service restaurant look elsewhere.

Welcome - excellent. Continental Breakfast - good. Lounge/dining area - excellent for groups gathering and/or meeting fellow visitors.Coffee and tea urns available 24 /7, very appreciatedRooms - a little small but very clean - and you only need them to sleep in anywayLiterally 1 block from beachHotel provides beach towels, mats umbrellasSome good eating houses on doorstepThe Concierges, Morgan and Casey - the best.

If you are looking for a cheaper place to stay this is the one even though room was rather small. Very close to everything . Staff are very friendly and rooms are cleaned daily . Breakfast is very ordinary

I found the Vive Hotel via TripAdvisor and booked my stay here as I didn't want to spend a fortune on hotel accommodations in Waikiki. As I was only going to be in town for a couple of days and out most of the days, I didn't need an expensive resort. This is a boutique hotel located only a couple of blocks up from the "Duke" statue. It only took a couple of minutes to get to the water. Staff were super friendly and relaxed. I was upgraded on checkin to an ocean view room, but due to the building across the street, couldn't actually see much of the ocean. The room itself was very clean, and I had a great sleep in the comfortable bed. There is a cool tablet in each room where you can order food, browse the internet, play music etc. Wifi at the hotel worked well and I had no issues. Breakfast is mostly just fruit and pastries, although I thought the fruit was quite good. Overall I had a great experience with this smaller hotel, and would definitely stay here again on my next trip. If you are looking for a property that is a true resort, be prepared to pay way more and also pay resort fees. I thought it was refreshing that this hotel did not charge for resort fees as many other Waikiki hotels do, whether they are actually a resort or not. If you'd rather spend your money on food, activities etc, Vive Hotel is perfect option.

When I first arrived I was pleased that I was offered a cup of juice before heading up stairs to my room. The staff was friendly and welcoming. The room size as really small. I would not recommend it to someone who will be staying in their room for long periods of time or who will be staying for more than a day or two. The major problem I had was that a bug that looked like a bed bug was crawling across the bed. I killed it and took it downstairs to the lobby to show the front counter staff. I asked him if the hotel has a reputation for bugs and he said that he was new and did not know. Needless to say, he changed my rooms after the ordeal. The bedding in the room he changed me to looked stained. I had a horrible time resting at this hotel. I would not stay here again.

I would recommend this hotel as a value hotel. The location is awesome as it's like a 3-5 minute walk to Waikiki and the main strip where the tourist area and all the shops are (literally two lights away from everything).Service was amazing from the front desk, valet, and cleaning staff. Always friendly and willing to help. Will not try to up-sell you too much for anything and just straight up helpful.Even though there are lots of food options in the area, the Continental breakfast provided every day, which included fresh fruits (pineapple, watermelon, strawberries, cantaloupe, honey dew, and papaya), and toast/croissants, unlimited 24/7 coffee and distilled water -- was a great option and amenity. We never had to go to the ABC convenience store to get water since we just refilled our bottles most times.Don't expect to be blown away by the rooms, the two-twin rooms are quite efficiently small, just enough space for two and no more. Sliding door for the bathroom. A/C is not central and is one of those that hang out the window. Either way we got a floor that was pretty low (8th floor) which was pretty much City view so we didn't care that much. I'm not too sure whether there are Ocean view suites, but the Hotel is kind of far away from the Ocean to really get any kind of Ocean view I would think. There are much larger hotels like the Marriott and Surfrider (that's right on the beach) that I would think would block most of the Ocean view from this building.That said, since I was just going with a friend, I didn't care much for the Ocean view. But if I was going for some thing more "romantic" this hotel would not be my first choice. Try Surfrider or Marriott but be expected to pay a hefty premium $$$$. But don't get me wrong, the rooms were clean and nice. Just don't expect anything super fancy or "Instagramable" -- I'll leave it at that.Oh, another great amenity is that they provide for free body boards, beach chairs, beach mats, and beach towels for the day. That was a nice touch. Saves you some money and hassle on your beach day.The concierge was amazing and helped us plan most of the excursions that you may want to do -- seemed very knowledgeable.My advice is if you want to book this hotel, call the directly and don't book through Expedia or other sites as they might be able to offer you a better deal.All in all - would recommend this hotel for its location, decent rooms, free continental breakfast, very friendly and helpful staff.

We stayed at The Vive Hotel last year and liked the hotel very much so thought we’d try it again this year. I’m happy to say it was every bit as good this time around. Some hotels can begin to look a little shabby around the edges quite quickly but The Vive Hotel has fortunately avoided this.We stayed in a “Junior Suite, 1 King Bed, Ocean View (Lifestyle)” which was much larger than the ordinary rooms at the hotel. The extra space was worth the extra cost.The complimentary breakfast includes juice, fresh fruit, pastries, toast and coffee/tea. Having this available allowed for a quick easy start to each day without the need to go looking for breakfast.The location of the hotel is toward the Kuhio Beach end of Waikiki so it is away from the more expensive resort hotels. None-the-less, these are in walking distance.Beach towels, mats and chairs are available without any resort fee, which is very good.The only negative was that the air conditioner was noisy at times.A special thanks to Christopher, Preston and Emily at the front desk for genuine friendliness and professionalism.
