Also thanks to Morgan (Concierge) for great local knowledge and obtaining bookings for us with very little notice.

The hotel is affordable but mostly greatly located! The room was smaller than the pictures had let us imagine but it was an overall great stay. I think some rooms have been renovated, but it wasn't the case for ours. I would still recommend it without a doubt!

walking distance from Waikiki Beach. Amazing staff. great recommendations. Open, fresh, boutique, clean. offers beach amenities ie beach chairs, boards, umbrellas and of course beach towels. highly recommended. just wish views were better and option for balcony.

I struggled between 3 and 4 stars with this hotel... It was a decent value for the Waikiki area, but anywhere else it would've been a major disappointment.They seemed to offer many amenities that seem like they would save you money, but they were all so cheaply done that they weren't really worthwhile. Examples:Refrigerator - This one really got me. I got a junior suite so i could have a fridge and keep food in there to make lunches for the beach. When I arrived, the fridge was the same temp as the room and there was a sign inside the unit that said "this refrigerator is not guaranteed to maintain temperatures to keep perishable items safe." I got another fridge brought to the room, but they were very clear that it was only meant to slightly chill drinks. This to me is not a refrigerator, folks. Shouldn't be advertised as such.Continental Breakfast - Frozen pastries and fruit slices. Nothing was hot and it was the same ever day. Ended up going out every day for breakfast.Free Beach Gear! - the towels were a definite convenience, but the chairs they had were too painful and cheap to sit in. Thought this would save me some money, but ended up spending several hundred dollars renting good gear all week.

The location is very nice, near to the beach, bus stop, and many stores. The room is slightly tiny, but is acceptable for me. And the room is clean and comfortable. The staffs are helpful and friendly. Since I stay at higher floor, the view is not bad (you can see part of ocean) and I like it.

I enjoyed my short stay at this boutique hotel and will stay again. The location was convenient and the price was right. Also enjoyed free continental breakfast with fresh fruit and tasty rolls & breads. I stayed in the junior suite and felt like a queen :)

After a problem with our planned accommodations in Oahu, we quickly searched to find a hotel that could accommodate our family of 4 (parents with two adult daughters), We were very fortunate that they had the availability for a family suite (basically two rooms, two bathrooms with and opening between the rooms). While this wasn't the condo we anticipated, the rooms were new, clean and well furnished. The quality of the VIVE Hotel Waikiki is above average but what was the best part of our stay was the service! When we called (in somewhat of a panic) we spoke with Shane and he was very knowlegable about the hotel and listened to what we needed. He found the best deal for us for a 6 night stay and assured us that we would be well taken care of upon our arrival the next day. Our first clue that we were going to have a great stay was when we drove into the valet parking and Paul helped us (and he recognized he has spoken with us earlier on the phone to answer a question). The great service continued upon our check-in when we were greeted and assisted by Preston. He knew exactly what Shane had planned for us and our check in was smooth and swift. Preston worked to make sure we had a great room and when we asked him about nearby eating options, he recommended the Flour & Barley restaurant! Great suggestion!. The VIVE Hotel Waikiki provided plenty of beach towels, beach chairs, beach mats and boogie boards! When we were finding it difficult to find the best tour package for Pearl Harbor, KC at the concierge desk was great! She found us the tour on the date and time we needed. She also helped with maps and driving directions to some great beach spots. Each morning we enjoyed the comlimentary selection of fresh fruits, pastries and breads! Coffee and juice were delicious. Lastly, the walk to Waikiki beach was just a short distance, about a 5 minute walk!Booking at VIVE Hotel Waikiki will be our home base when we visit Oahu again! Thanks for the great personal and attentive service.

Staff were outstandingly friendly and helpful. To have a drink and cool towel upon arrival was very refreshing and a nice sight after flying in overnight. Our room had an old school bath and shower in one which was unlike what I'd seen in pictures online and the bath didn't drain quickly but besides this the room was great with a large comfy bed and loads of tv channels too. Hotel is central and a short walk from Waikiki beach. Excellent value for money and would stay again.

I needed a hotel in HNL for a business trip, and Vive was the highest-rated on Expedia. It didn't disappoint. Customer service was excellent, and the hotel was clean and inviting. Breakfast was very good (fresh fruit and pastries, but could use some eggs, sausage, etc). Room was nice but small. The fridge has no freezer and isn't meant to keep things very cold (label inside says so). A few other drawbacks are the lack of pool, fitness, and laundry facilities (though they offer a laundry service). Location is relative, but it's a short walk to the beach or canal and near several main streets. Overall, I would say this is a very good hotel. Service, price, and quality definitely outweigh the few minor detractors.

Our stay at vive was excellent t from the early check in to the inclusions like breakfast wifi beach towels. Having this made the hotel grea value for money in a close location to the beach. The room was clean and the staff always friendly. Will definitely stay here again and will recommend to friends

Arrived early and was promptly attended to and checked in by Preston. The hotel was great and the inclusions were fantastic making the hotel great value for money. Enjoyed the breakfast and the staff were always polite and friendly will Definately stay here next time I'm in Hawaii. Thanks for a grea stay Mahalo

A couple blocks off Waikiki Beach, you can enjoy the experience affordably enough and be yourselves. Vive gives you a home where your will be comfortable and close, without suffering from the offers of extra cost services. We enjoyed a week here, including having to leave at 6 AM for work on three days and found it perfectly workable.

I loved everything about this hotel. Location was ideal, and price was unbeatable. The room was clean and well maintained.The staff here truly went out of their way to make our stay fantastic. It was really the little things that made all the difference. For example the front desk is 24/7 and the person behind the desk always had a smile on their face. The night before I checked out I wanted to pay my parking and they allowed me to split the payment with my friend. I guarantee that most other hotels would have just made me pay it on one card. I really appreciate that they did that. The valet service is fantastic and quick. And if you sign up to their members program you get half price parking and free room upgrade.We ran into some trouble on the morning that we had to leave for the airport (at 4.30am!!) where our rental car would not start. The valet attended went out of his way to help troubleshoot the problem. Unfortunately we were unable to start the car, but he kindly offered to watch the car til the car rental company could come pick it up so we could catch an Uber and not miss our flight.I cannot wait to come back and stay here again.

The most important thing to choose this hotel was good price.So I satisfied overall.Location and beach mat, towel rental service are good.But window is little bit small. air conditional sound is too loud to sleep.

Room was small but adequate for the purpose of our stay. Friendly staff without being overbearing and great knowledge of the local area. The Aircon was noisy but if switch off at night having been on during the day, it did it's job!!

Great hotel. Beach location. Provides free towel and chair for beach. Great breakfast included in hotel charge. Concierge services from Morgan and KC excellent. Helped in tour preparation. Hotel close to tour pick up sites. Room cleaning services very good. We were there July 13 to July 19 from NYC. We're greeted at Hotel by pineapple juice and towel. Lobby and breakfast area posh and elegant. 24x7 coffee in lobby. Shall greatly recommend Vive in Wakiki to every one. Close to food places. Hotel arranged shuttle bus to airport at a cheap price.We had a great stay. Recommended by my daughter.
user_name:
sprasad19
New York City, New York

review_body: Good location 8 minute walk to beach. Great continental breakfast included with fresh fruit etc. Great staff at reception and a big thanks to KC at the concierge desk who could not be more helpful and informative on local attractions and bookings. Rooms are on the smaller side but we knew this before booking. Very clean and really has a great vibe about the place.

I found the Vive Hotel in Waikiki to be an excellent choice for my stay in Honolulu. In addition to its location only a short walk away from the beach, the room was extremely comfortable and had an excellent view inland. The hotel staff proved quite helpful in recommending local sights and events, as well as shuttle service to the airport.

I visited Vive Hotel Waikiki recently and what a pleasure! The location is just perfect. The room was clean and comfortable. The staff are so friendly and courteous, and they really pay attention to the small details that make your hotel stay special. The concierge, KC was so helpful and knowledgable! I felt like I was visiting a friend - she recommended some spectacular places. I'll definitely stay here again next time I am visiting!

WE loved this hotel, fantastic location, amazing service - the one thing that really made a differecen was that our flight was at 7 pm - the hotel offered a complimentary room for one hour so we could rest and shower and enjoy the afternoon at the beach.

Recommended by friends. What a great experience.! A cup of juice and warm hand towel on arrival, staff are very friendly and helpful, they even let us check in a bit early so we can have a rest and refresh before shopping in that hot and humid weather :) lots fruits at breakfast, loving it...

We stayed at the VIVE Waikiki and can honestly say that it was one of our best stays at a hotel to date! Our room was clean, comfortable and cozy. The staff was super friendly and the spirit of Aloha was truly felt! We enjoyed the concierge service by KC who was very knowlegeable of the island and recomended some pretty awesome eateries and Hot night life spots! The Vive Waikiki is reasonable, comfortable and friendly! We would def recommend this hotel to others who is looking to visit Oahu!
user_name:
NYCwinegirl2
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is extremely well positioned for all the highlights of Wakiki it is close to bus stops food and the beach . Great place to stay and we would come back to Vive for our next visit. Breakfast was plentiful and a good selection. All the necessities close by for food requirements

We loved the location which was handy to transport, facilities, attractions and shopping at a reasonable price. Friendly helpful staff made the stay very enjoyable. Simple but adequate breakfast is provided. Full range of beach gear available for use.

I had a great stay in the Vive Hotel, very clean Hotel, the staff was very friendly and helpful. Excellent location and value with the breakfast being served, and a super deal closer was the cold glass ofpineapple juice upon your arrival for check-in.

Probably the most comfortable hotel I have ever been in. From the layout to the color schemes...the hospitality and even the lobby music. Yes, the music played over the speakers was phenomenal. The hotel has an aura of comfort & relaxation unlike no other.

This was our 3 visit to Hawaii but our first time staying at the Vive hotel. It was definitely value for money. It is in a great position to Waikiki beach. It was very clean and the staff were all very friendly. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Lovely place, friendly staff! Centrally located in the middle of all the action and shops around Waikiki beach. Recommend to folks without kids because there's no pool, if that's important, but the beach is two blocks away.

The vive was an excellent place to stay with a perfect location close to everything but quiet and calm inside. Rooms for very cozy and clean we are on the 10th floor and had a nice view. Would definitely visit here again!

Travel to Waikiki was a wonderful vacation. It was my first time and I hope we can go again. The hotel was small but comfortable. Something I forgot to mention was that the elevators were a little slow. But overall I recommend the Hotel, the location is more than great!

Perfect location, affordable price, great supportive stasffs.I didn't realize location is that perfect but just few hours later, I'm sure I'm staying the best one with reasonable price. And breakfast is a good benefit in Hawaii

This was my second time staying at Vive and once again, it couldn't have been better! My friend and I arrived early in the morning and Preston was very kindly able to check us in to a room by 8am and even upgrade us to have an ocean view. Perfect after a long flight! We stayed in a Cosmopolitan Queen room and found it to have plenty of room for us and all our shopping! We unpacked our suitcases upon arrival and used the wardrobe and drawers under the bed which saved space too. The air conditioner didn't bother us at all, we kept it on at night and it was barely audible. The room was clean, modern and very comfortable.I also loved the breakfast in the morning, great way to start the day! Fresh fruit, toast, and pastries available each day.The hotel staff are beyond friendly, and really make your stay enjoyable!Location is fab! Bus stop right outside the hotel, very short walk to the beach and restaurants, but off the main strip so not as pricey as other hotels in the area.I would 100% stay here again and would continue to recommend it to anyone going on a Hawaiian holiday!Thank you for another perfect stay Vive!

Friendly staff, clean room, yummy breakfast, great location! Paul who helped us to park the car gave us good suggestions to travel around. It is located very close to the Waikiki beach and easy to do shopping nearby. We will definitely come back!

Central location from the beach and buses. Breakfast, towels, chairs, mats, boogie boards included NO RESORT FEES! Storage for your luggage after noon checkout and a complementary refresher room before you leave for the airport, that was the icing on the cake for us!!! We loved this place, luxury at a reasonable price.

A nice hotel in very a sentral area. We had two different room, where the first one was very small and a little bit dark. But the bathroom felt new and fresh. The second room was big and airy with beautiful views to the beach and to Diamond Head. Overall i nice experience. Hotel staff was very friendly. We really liked the courtesy of lending out beach towels and boogie boards.

almost everything was good. location, breakfast, rent service, price was so good,except noise. the outside noise ran into the room without any disruption due to air conditioner connected with outside.we woke up many times because of noise even we were so tired to get up.we checked window closed, and it's clearly closed.so i think it's due to air conditioner.

Nice hotel, clean and tidy, good location. No pool available and staff are very helpful and friendly. The hotel is situated close to everything which is a bonus. Breakfast area is basic as is the food.

Vive is only one block back from Waikiki beach and a 2 minute walk from the Duke statue, so very central to everything in Waikiki and transport options around Oahu. Rooms were adequate- clean and comfortable, however they felt very dark and cramped. The beds were small doubles, and the bathrooms were absolutely tiny- certainly no room with the door shut to get dressed without bumping into the walls basin or toilet!The included breakfast was excellent and coffee / tea was available all the time self-service in the downstairs lounge which was great. We stayed 4 nights which was too long in such a small space. It would have been fine maybe for a night or two if just using as a base for a quick stay. Any longer and we wanted somewhere to be able to sit outside and not feel confined. We were out all day but it's still nice to be able to sit out on a balcony or by a pool in the evenings rather than in a tiny room. Staff were helpful and friendly, and parking was easy although extremely expensive at $25 per day!All in all, it was clean and comfortable but I wouldn't stay again as we didn't feel it represented good value for money.

I knew this was a boutique hotel going in, but I wasn't expecting the rooms to be so small. The bed was small, it felt more like a double bed than a queen and the air conditioning was so NOISY! I didn't get a decent nights sleep the entire time we were here because it was so loud. And far out the windows need to be double glazed or something because even on a high level the street noise came straight through.Location is fantastic and the towels and beach mats were a great plus. I enjoyed the water filter downstairs, saved us buying bottles upon bottles of water. The breakfast isn't anything to write home about but it was nice when I couldn't be bothered leaving the hotel one day. Staff were friendly enough. I wish there was an ice machine somewhere in the building that could be accessed by guests, I had to ask the front desk for ice and it felt a little weird. The tablet in the room was cool but a few times when we "scheduled" our room cleaning we came back to a notification that it had been done, but it actually hadn't. The TV allows HDMI input, that was excellent. And I did like the drawers under the bed that allowed us to unpack our things. So overall I didn't mind this hotel but I wouldn't be encouraging my friends to stay here.

The room was spotless and large. Comfy bed and great city views from the 21st floor. Free tea, coffee, juice and water available all day in the lobby area was far better than having a humming fridge in our room. Everyone friendly and helpful. Great location too. Only slight issue for us was that the A/C was noisy.

My Wife and I have just returned from a week staying at this great Hotel. Selected this Waikiki Hotel based on reviews and ratings and it certainly did not disappoint. Months before arriving Expedia had made a mistake with the room booking but this was quickly solved by Beverly at the Hotel. Checking in and we were met by the smiling Preston whose warm welcome was a great start to our Hawaiin holiday. We had a corner room on the 18th floor which had two windows and was bright and sunny. Room was well presented and every day was cleaned professionally and couldn't be faulted. All staff went above and beyond in offering advice on places to see, restaurants, buses etc. Complimentary breakfast was a bonus as well as towels, beach chairs and mats. Nice to not pay resort fees and being only minutes from the heart of Waikiki, the Vive Hotel hits the mark with position, price and personality!

My wife and I stayed at Vive for a day before flying to Maui for business. The first thing we noticed was the professionalism of all the staff and their incredibly service. It started with the valet guy (wish I remembered his name). He helped us with our luggage and told us where we needed to go and had a great attitude. We went down to the service desk and a few moments later, he ran out of the elevator with our phone saying we had forgotten it in the car. We were VERY impressed by the gentleman and really grateful for him. The front desk was just as friendly and helpful and got our room key quickly and were in our rooms in no time. The room was clean and comfortable and everything was in working order. It was perfect for what we needed. As for the location of the hotel, it was walking distance from everything we had on our list to eat, from udon to spam musubi to 88 tees, and tons of other places. The location was PERFECT. Breakfast was included with our stay which was continental, and honestly, I usually skip it because the pastries are typically not very good and stale. We were pleasantly surprised. It was the BEST continental breakfast we have ever had. They had delicious and fresh pastries, modern and working toasters and toaster ovens, tons of fresh fruit, and fresh pineapple juice, and more. We ended up getting thirds - it was THAT good, and I'm not a huge breakfast guy to begin with. Check out was just as easy and we both agreed as we left that we would come back to stay at Vive in a heartbeat and would recommend it to all of our friends and family. Can't wait to go back!!!

My wife and I stayed at the Vive for a quick 4-day trip to Waikiki, and were impressed with the Vive. It's just what you need, and not much more - a good value if you've been to Oahu before and know what you're getting into. Rooms were basic, but clean and up-to-date. Lobby is nice, and the few amenities they have are just what you need - beach equipment, basic breakfast, good internet, cool-looking lounge and not much more. If you need a pool and a lot of expensive shops in your hotel, this isn't your place. With the money you save over the big hotels, you can rent your umbrella and beach chairs on the beach every day, which is what we did. Staff is friendly and competent, and they do have a concierge to help if you need that sort of thing. Only a couple blocks from the beach, this is a great value, and perfect if you're comfortable finding your own food and arranging your own beach days. Also, they do a great job with options at check-out - we had a red-eye back home and were able to take advantage of their departure room, which let us shower and re-pack before getting on the plane home after we checked out.

I enjoyed very much our stay in this hotel. Everybody was so friendly and helpful. We got pineapple juice and a wet towel for refreshment during check-in. Although the rooms are tiny we found it comfortable and clean and to be honest it was enough for us. I liked the style of the hotel, the lobby is very nice and a little library is also available. The location is great, a bus station is next to the entrance so it is very easy to go to the airport / city center. Many restaurants and shops are also available in walking distance.The hotel is just 3-4 minutes from the beach. We liked very much that the hotel provides chairs, towels, boogie boards and mattress. As far as I remember umbrellas were also available.A bit wider choice of the breakfast (for example yogurt, vegetables, eggs) would be beneficial and would make perfect the mornings. :) At the same time, we knew that we can expect fruits and pastries when we booked a room. We appreciated very much the courtesy room. We had a late long flight and it was great to have a room for changing clothes/taking shower before leaving.I highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Positives: Clean Room. Negatives: Elevator and halls are dirty, smelly, and outdated. Staff was rude when we asked if they could honor the parking deal offered on the website. Not worth the money, would not stay again.

Just enjoyed a wonderful 10 day stay at the vive waikiki. We had a junior suite that was spacious and had a nice view of the beach. Room was quiet and spotless. Hotel stay comes with a lot of helpful perks. Breakfast is included. They are well located close to shops and beach. Beach gear and towels are cheerfully provided. Staff is very helpful, and organized. Can't wait to return to the vive!
user_name:
cabozo
New York City, New York

review_body: Staff was excellent, but the noise from Kuhio St and the A/C kept us from sleeping well. If you are a light sleeper this may not work out well for you. If you can sleep through a hurricane, maybe it's OK. Beach equipment loans was a great idea.

I got to Honolulu a lot and this was my first stay at the Vive. When you book online you are told that you possibly get free upgrades when available and 3 free gifts when you book direct on their website. I was sent a link to the free items and was told the would be emailed to me. One was one day of free airline internet, another was free cup of Starbucks and I forgot the last but the emails never arrived. When I arrived at the hotel I asked if by chance one of the upgrades were available and I was told yes but it's $125 additional per night. I was shocked and asked about the free upgrade. I was told that's only to an ocean view room and none were available. Hmmmmm they were never specific that the upgrade was limited. The hotel is small but cute with a. Nice lobby but the elevator and floors are not air conditioned and it gets hot. The have a continental breakfast but it's mainly bread, fruit, coffee and oJ. No cereal or anything else. Also I was shocked to find out upon arrival that had no pool or area to sun yourself. It wasn't a bad price for Waikiki but I'm not sure I would stay there again.

Value for money, ideal for holidays. Rooms are a little small, but it's what you paid for. Breakfast is great with fresh fruits and breads. Coffee, tea and water are available all day. The breakfast area is very nice and comfortable. Staff are friendly and helpful.

Overall very good experience. The room was clean and comfortable and the staff were friendly and helpful. The only fault was there was a lack of hooks and shelves. Hotel situated in a central location and only 5 minutes walk to the beach.

Thanks for great experience, we had memorable vacation! Friendly and very accommodating staff and highly skilled, professional supervisors made our stay pleasurable. We are planning to stay in the same hotel next year :)

I selected this hotel because of the reviews I read on Trip Advisor before I selected a hotel. Well, it was a pleasant experience. This was the first time I traveled to Honolulu, Hawaii; but it will not be my last. The decor was CHIC. The room was nice and clean. They offered "Complimentary Continential BREAKFAST" daily. It was a three block walk to Waikiki Beach. It was a convenient location to a lot of attractions.

Loved the location..the staff.. the style ...all superbgreeted with a smile and there was nothing that the staff would not do to make the stay a relaxing and memorable onea special mention to Preston,he went out of his way upon our early arrival to make sure we were comfortable and he arranged for us to check into the room earlier Chris and his staff were always there to greet you with a smile and there was a genuine feeling that they were happy to see youOverall a fantastic time and we would like to thank them all for the time spent at this little gem ... we will be back !!

Overall, a positive experience. Good location, walking distance to the beach and the main road. The hotel has been recently refurbished and has a small boutique feel to it. Downstairs there are funky leather chairs in bold colours, music playing in the background and a cool laid back feel to the whole place. We had an ocean view room which was adequate, except for the noise from the road below. The noise travels through the air conditioning system so early morning you'd get woken by sirens, trucks reversing etc. That aside, I would recommend this hotel to my friends.

We stayed in a Family Suite (2 Queen beds and 2 bathrooms). I had read how small the rooms are, but we wouldn't have needed anything bigger. The location of the hotel is a huge advantage - literally a few minutes walk from the beach, and so easy to borrow towels, mats, boogie boards etc from reception. The valet parking was convenient and efficient. As a family of 4 with 2 teenagers and 2 adults the room setup was fabulous (having the 2 bathrooms) especially considering the reasonable cost. I loved the vibe at the hotel and the free breakfast was an added bonus (plenty of fruit and pastries) I would not hesitate to stay at Vive again.

This hotel was conveniently located in downtown Waikiki close to shopping and restaurants. It was clean and the rooms were good sized. All of this for a reasonable price. That would have been impressive enough, but the customer service took the hotel one step beyond. We were greeted warmly with cooling towels and a refreshing glass of pineapple juice. All the staff were courteous and answered our many questions readily Great job by the staff!!!!

Our stay at Vive was fantastic. After a sleepless long haul flight my room was ready to check in early and check in with a refreshing juice was smooth. I couldn't fault my stay here. The staff were very helpful and the location was perfect.

Great location, although I sometimes didn't feel safe at night. A lot of homeless in the area. Aircon was super loud and we ended up turning it off and opening our window. Room clean, but small. Bed comfortable and room attendants were great! Front desk weren't very warm in our opinion. Breakfast was mediocre, only fresh fruit and stale pastries. We didn't utilize this as much as we would have liked. Loved to eat out to be honest. Overall, location was the main positive.

Great location to Waikiki, friendly and helpful staff, comfy beds and quiet rooms, concierage very helpful and knowledgable for local things to do, markets and food, etc. Free wifi, breakfast, beach gear and no resort fee.

From the minute I arrived, jet lagged, when they placed a cold glass of fresh pineapple juice in front of me, it was great.They have the most responsive staff. They are always jumping to anticipate what you might need, whether it's someone to carry items to your room or any other request small or large. The staff at the front desk wear headsets and when you make a request, they speak into the headset and the person you need replies and they make it happen!!At VIVE, you drive up to the 2nd Floor and it's VALET PARKING. They will get someone to help you bring any items to your room, you step out give them the keys and they do the rest!! When you want to use your vehicle, you call the Front Desk, and by the time the elevator takes you to the 2nd Floor, your vehicle is waiting for you. It's a brilliant solution to make your stay as sweet as possible.Their continental breakfast was great. Coffee, rolls, lots of wonderful fresh fruit that is constantly replenished in the trays are a great way to start your day.They are located a block away from the Hyatt Regency Waikiki Budget rental location so you can easily pick up a vehicle and explore the Island. Thanks to the previous Trip Advisor Reviews, I stayed here and loved it!

Great location (just a couple blocks from the beach, wonderful breakfast spread, extremely clean facility, very comfortable rooms and the best customer service I have ever experienced! Highly recommend the Vive!

Very close to beach and shops! Nice continental breakfast with fresh fruites, could do with yoghurt though. Nice staff and clean room but the AC was a little to loud. Beach towels and other beach gears available every day.

Great staff, decent rooms, great location and they provided beach gear, which is a plus. If consider staying here again but the lack of a pool it's kind of a bummer, though the beach is right down the street.

The location of the hotel is convenient to all the activities of Waikiki. Our room was clean and comfortable. All staff were friendly and helpful throughout our stay. The included breakfast is a great addition and having access to beach towels/chairs is handy.

We were very happy with our stay at the Vive hotel. The staff was always very nice and helpful, e.g. while storing our long surfboards. We liked the nice and clean room as well as the tidiness of the housekeeping staff who did a great job. Only the breakfast is a little simple as there are no eggs, etc. available.Thank you for the overall good value.

VIve Hotel offers everything that you need at Hawaii--nice and clean rooms, complimentary breakfast, rental beack mats/boogi boards/beach towels, and above all else, super-friendly staffs!The rooms may be small, yet very efficient and has all the little details that you need for your stay. The A/C seems to be a bit loud at night, but it didn't bother our sleep, as we were all knocked out at night after our fun daytime experiences. Vive hotel would definitely be our #1 choice we we were to revisit Hawaii.
user_name:
Yun Kyung C
Seoul, South Korea

review_body: I was really impressed with the welcoming staff and refreshing pineapple juice served upon check in. We were weary travellers and arrived early for our room. They rushed the clean up so we could occupy before check in time and kept our luggage secure.I was very tired but they had a comfortable lounging area where I was able to rest prior to room check in. The lobby decor had been updated & was very pleasing from the huge fresh tropical floral arrangement to the other appointments. Wow.The room was adequate, a bit small but fine. It had everything you needed. The room air conditioner was loud so we were grateful we brought earplugs. We had trouble regulating the temperature.The continental breakfast was mediocre but glad to have it to cut down on expenses. The location was very central to the Waikiki area the beach, restaurants, grocery stores, laundry mat, tours etc. The concierge was very helpful. If you wish to see Pearl Harbour, book in advance. They loaned beach mats and chairs Yeah.The most amazing part was they offered us a room to refresh in before our midnight flight after check out earlier in the day of departure. I have never been given that service ever. This went the second mile since we were dirty from trekking up to a waterfall.We will gladly return one day! Thank you for a happy sendoff to Vancouver Canada.

Lovely boutique hotel. Super helpful staff. Two blocks from Waikiki beachHotel provides towels, mats and beach umbrellas. Delicious continental brkfst. Fresh fruit juice, danish and toas. Coffe and variety of tea. Clean rooms. Loved our stay. Will stay there again. Special thanks to our super helpful concierge Morgan. Every one was veo nice and helpful. Thanks!

The Vive hotel was exactly what we were after. My husband and I visited a few weeks ago and loved everything about our stay here. The staff were lovely and we were always greeted with a smile and received help in booking a car and tips on where to go. We arrived from Sydney Australia and much to our surprise our room was ready at 7.00am which meant we could have some much needed rest after a long flight. The complimentary tea and coffee and continental breakfast was perfect and there was always lots of food available.The location is great and so close to the heart of Waikiki. It made going out very easy. Our room had all the amenities we required and was cleaned daily.We have nothing but positive things to say and will definitely be staying here when we visit Hawaii again.

My room was terrific. My bed....that bed was so comfortable, the walk in shower was sooo soothing. Walking distance to Beach, shops, sightseeing even restaurants. My overall experience was so good that I plan on going back in August (2 months from this review) and stay at VIVE.

This hotel is well worth staying at while in Honolulu. The staff go out of their way to make you feel welcome. The included breakfast was delicious and always fresh.The rooms might be small, but this is not important in the scope of the entire place, highly recommended if you want to feel welcome, rested and spoiled.

Great location. Close to everything we wanted to get to. 100 meters to the beach and the centre of activity. Spotlessly clean. Friendly staff. Continental breakfast was very convenient and at no charge. Tea and Coffee 24/7. WE will have no trouble returning next visit.

Our room, had two twin beds. We did not expect this. We didn't complain because we were only there for 1 night. It was so small the two of us could barely stand up at the same time. There was no place to put the suitcases when open except on the bed. The bathroom was so tiny that there was little place to put the toiletries. The shelf provided barely held a toothbrush and toothpaste. It was clean. Service was good. They provided beach chairs and towels. The complimentary breakfast was mediocre. Most things were gone by the time we got down there. But if we had time to wait, maybe the food would have been good. There is NO protein provided. Toast, muffins, fruit, pastries. Coffee, tea and juice. No milk for the tea. Just creamers.

We stayed at this hotel for the first three nights of our stay in Hawaii. We picked this hotel because it was ideally located and was good value for money bearing in mind that hotels are expensive in Waikiki. Arriving late after flying in from London we found the staff very friendly and helpful. The room was spacious, well appointed, clean and the bed was very comfortable. The continental breakfast had a very good choice and was always fresh and well stocked no matter what time you arrived for breakfast.The hotel is situated one block back from Kuhio beach and is in walking distance of all the main shops and hotels on Kalakaua Ave, we even walked to Diamond Head from here, about 2 miles to the state park entrance.After 18 days exploring other islands we came back to Waikiki for 5 nights and stayed at the Outrigger On The Beach and wished we had stayed back at the Vive instead, far more modern and by far better value for the money, we would highly recommend this hotel for a short break in Waikiki.

This small boutique hotel was in a perfect location, 2 minutes walk to the Beach, great staff, friendly hospitality, very genuine! Clean rooms, breakfast daily, fresh fruit and crossiants, toast and pastries. Would of loved to have a cereal option, it would of made it perfect! Lovely ambience!

Great location with everything so close. Steps away from beach, shopping restaurants. Staff very friendly and always willing to help. Continental breakfast lots of choices and good foods. Would definately return to this hotel.

I can only echo what the majority of the previous reviews on here say - The Vive is an excellent value for money choice for your stay in Waikiki. Lovely clean hotel in an excellent location with friendly staff and a more than adequate free breakfast. My only small gripe would be that, as previously stated, the rooms have very little storage space so why, when 99% of visitors are holiday makers, put a desk in them with a large swivel chair - who sits at a desk on holiday. Why not swap these for a chest of drawers?If we are ever lucky enough to visit Waikiki again The Vive would be our hotel of choice.

Would recommend to others and would return on a future trip. Reception staff were always welcoming and helpful, couldn't fault the them at all, they were very knowledgeable of the area. We found the reception staff more helpful than the concierge. On two occasions the housekeepers came to our room and advised they wouldn't be cleaning it as they finished in 5 minutes. Location was perfect for us especially with a bus stop out the front and a 3 minute walk to the beach with towels, boogie boards, chairs and parasols available to take with you.

Great place, staff was wonderful. Helpful quick and always going the extra mile including comp room for cleaned up if you stay beyond your check out time. Continental breakfast was a pleasant surprise especially considering this was Waikiki.

Great location, terrific staff made our stay really enjoyable. Boutique style, clean room, nice but simple breakfast of toast, pastries and beautiful fresh fruit enjoyed in the wonderfully styled common area. Mahola!!!!

All Services was Great , the staff was excellent in all areas,will return to this hotel when we come back, it was easy to anywhere we wanted to go. a quick walk to places to eat and the beach,The hotel planner had great knowledge of all excursions.

We had a wonderful stayed at the vive hotel, excellent location, walking distance to the beach, shops, restaurants and inter national market . The staff were helpful and friendly , the lobby is newly decorated and it's quite nice to enjoy the breakfast....the room service was really great and the bed is very comfortable, definitely recommended to friends...

Hotel is very good value in a good location (5' walk to the beach). Hotel room is nice. Airco is bit noisy. I liked the free breakfast (fresh fruit, toast, coffee and tea). My flight back was late in the evening. I really like the free room that the hotel offered me to refresh myself before going to the airport.

The staff were awesome it was the size of the room and the old smelly noisy air conditioner that let them down and as a result we found another hotel to stay at after our first night there. The staff were friendly helpful and understanding

Have visited this hotel previously when we were lucky enough to be upgraded to a Penthouse suite, so this time we requested and paid for the upgrade. Totally worth it. The views, the extra roominess and the balcony helped make our trip one to remember. The staff are very helpful. The only negative would be the noisiness of the air conditioner, fixed by wearing ear plugs every night.

The VIVE is conveniently located a few walkable blocks from the beach, International Market Place, Food Pantry (grocery), popular Waikiki eateries, and the zoo and aquarium. The family suite is ideal for parents with multiple kids or in our case, 2 grandparents, 2 parents, and 1 baby.

To start, its a beautiful hotel with the lovliest staff I've ever come across. The rooms are fresh and clean with a nice deep tub in the ensuite for those who want to soak after the riggers of snorkling, diving, surfing, etc. You are literally a 3 min walk from Waikiki Beach, 1 min from Mac 24.7 if you need a 24h eatery and a short walk or bus from everywhere else.The perfect location!

This hotel is a really nice place to stay in Waikiki... its modern and funky, with great decor... staff are friendly and helpful.... room was nice, with very comfortable beds... clean bathroom, nice view of streets from window... with glimpses of the beach ....buffet breakfast was delicious... good location, close to shops, transport, and beaches... the welcome glass of juice and cold face cloth was a nice touch...Thanks to KC, Emily, Adam and Ryan...

Positive: Good location, clean, friendly and very helpful staff. Excellent support on car rental. Negative: Very small room. It needs enhancement on air conditioning system and breakfast. Overall good quality vs price

Location: on Kuhio Avenue, 200 meters from Waikiki BeachFront desk: friendly and always helpful staff; especially the breakfast ladyRooms: rather small, but nicely furnished rooms, small bathroomBreakfast room: large and pleasant, there are enough placesBreakfast buffet: continental (muffins, pastries, fruits, etc.)Valet parking: 25 Dollars per day (no additional tip required)Negative: Unfortunately the bed cover at one end smelly(We have to turn it around.)

We stayed at Vive Hotel when my husband and I went to Oahu for our vacation at the end of May. I initially picked this hotel for the price since we were on a budget--the room is small but very clean and had the basic amenities: mini fridge, clean bathroom, cable TV, and free WiFi! Other reviewers have complained about the AC unit being too loud but I didn't mind it (plus I didn't hear my husband snoring Lol). We enjoyed the complimentary coffee and tea as well as the continental breakfast in the morning. Unfortunately we didn't make use of the beach gear so I don't have any opinion about it. Also the parking garage ceiling is low so be careful when driving in/out of it if you are renting an SUV. The location of the hotel is also convenient, 2 blocks away from the international marketplace mall and within walking distance of the shops and beachfront in Waikiki beach. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone looking for an affordable option in Waikiki.

We were very happy with this hotel. Its location is fantastic....a 2 minute walk from the front door, straight ahead to the beach, shops and eateries. We had a corner room, 1808, with a wonderful view of the beach. Quite a large room with a big bathroom. There are 2 window type A/C's so these can be a bit noisy, but didn't stop us sleeping. Breakfast was included in the price and we found it to be more than enough... pastries, breads, fruit, muffins, juice, tea and coffee. Always topped up. The staff were very helpful and pleasant. No pool area, but the beach is very close and they provide beach towels. We would stay here again.

Vive honeymoon - great location, amazing staff, small but cozy ocean view room, just perfect breakfast, great amenities ( beach towels, beach chairs, boogie boards, etc ). Valet service a but expensive but worth every penny. Highly recommend !!!!

We just returned home from 9 nights in Waikiki, where we stayed at Vibe Hotel Waikiki. Based on the Tripadvisor reviews, I chose Vive, and we couldn't be happier with the decision. Vive has smart, hip decor: comfy sofas and chairs with colorful throw pillows, beautiful appointments and art, with large picture window facing a serene tropical garden/fountain. This “Living Room” not only is a place to chill out and read (a small library of books to borrow) or catch up on emails, it is where all gather in the AM for continental breakfast. Assorted fruit, breads and pastries, juice, tea, and coffee (also available 24 hours) is served from 7-9:30 AM. We booked the Lifestyle Jr Suite, a slight upgrade from the standard room, and we were very pleased with the comfort, spaciousness, and yes—the view! We had an ocean view straight down the street to the Duke Kahanamoku Statue! There is a large walk in closet, with safe, iron/ironing board, a large desk and chair, 2 accent chairs, coffee table, huge bathroom (the shower was amazing!), 2 air conditioners, TV, small fridge (it’s not the coldest fridge, so keep that in mind when putting perishables in it), and a King sized bed that is incredibly comfortable. Yes, there is no pool or fitness room, and there is also NO resort fee. But beach supplies (towels, mats, boogie boards, small beach chairs) are free and in ample supply. Morgan at the concierge desk was really helpful when we were looking for a tour to take around the island (Circle Island Tour). Kuhio Beach Park and Queen’s Beach are 3 blocks down the street, and there are several places to grab a bite (Ruffage makes great natural food meals/sandwiches, Shorefyre has delicious breakfasts with no wait, Me BBQ is awesome Korean food). If you want to explore the Waikiki area, and not be “locked" into your hotel/resort with exorbitant prices, but appreciate a clean, smart, and comfortable and affordable accommodations, then Vive is the hotel for you.

Would prob stay there again . Very close to main strip. 5 min walk to beach . Staff helpful . Although one room had a noisy air con and wasn't cleaned one day . Breakfast could have included a better variety .

Had a great time the staff and food was excellent for the trip my wife loved it I would definitely come again and recommend it to family and friends the food was perfect for the location meaning fruit pineapple authentic Thanks
user_name:
Merritt J
New York City, New York

review_body: Pros:1 Good value, good location. in Waikiki area. There is a bus stop that's very close2. Relatively clean room3. wifi worked. AC workedCons:1. Breakfast was alright, not too many options. Fruit was good.  I would like some milk, oats and waffle. It'll be great if they can add these options.2. I found lots of small/tiny ants in the room3. Bathroom was pretty small but alright. There was no fan in the bathroom.

VIVE Hotel is an excellent place to stay and so close to the beach, restaurants, transportation and shopping. It doesn't have the extra expenses associated with some of the properties which was nice. The coffee & breakfast are wonderful. The staff was very polite and knowledgeable. We booked all of our excursions through the hotel and we were very pleased.

The positive reviews of this hotel are spot on. The staff were friendly and welcoming. The rooms were small, but comfortable and updated. The location is just a couple blocks from the beach, and well within walking distance of lots of restaurants and shops. We had a fantastic stay. Loved that the hotel provided towels, mats, and umbrellas for the beach!While valet parking is a little pricey, I think the overall value of the hotel makes it worth it. I would gladly stay here again.

Very happy with this hotel! Large rooms (we had a family room as our college age boys were with us) and lovely breakfast with pastries and large fresh fruit selection. Coffee set-up 24 hours. 2 short blocks to walk to Waikiki beach. Super friendly staff, and valet parking, although $25/day, was very efficient with never a long wait. There is NOT a pool or fitness room, but we didn't miss that as we spent time doing other things. Beautiful hotel!

I loved the hotel. It was nice and the staff was friendly and accommodating. The location was great with lots to see and do and the price was a tremendous value! We would definitely recommend the Vive Hotel to all our friends and family!

The location was good , central enough to walk wherever and close to beach. Built in recent years and still seemed in good condition. The room was small and not what we expected after viewing on line. Clean room

Great location however a lot of street noise enters the room. Great location clean, friendly staff. Basic breakfast toast pastries fruit tea coffee. No room facilities for making tea coffee had to go to reception for these. Very small bar fridge in room. Nowhere to hang wet bathers to dry. Cold filtered water on tap in reception. Hotel supplied towels beach mats umberallas etc for guest use at the beach

The vive hotel is great if you really want somewhere just to sleep. The room is small but if you're spending all day at the beach then it's really no trouble. The breakfast could be improved but it is better than nothing. Close walking distance to the beach and shops - a good location.

This was our first stop on the honeymoon! The staff was fabulous. Everyone was so accommodating and friendly. The rooms are small and basic (but comfy!), but we didn't plan to spend much time at the hotel! The breakfast was great too! Overall an EXCELLENT value! We paid what we would pay in pittsburgh for a basic hotel! The hotel is located just a few blocks from the beach and they offer free beach gear rentals. Valet parking service was great too. No resort fee. We were very happy with our stay.The valet staff member went as far as printing a security footage tape showing up arriving our first night from the airport rental car location. We were able to prove to the rental car company that we left the center with a missing part. This saved us hassle and money.Overall great stay. Very impressed.

Not a five star hotel but reasonable price. Good location being about 3 blocks from Wikiki beach. Rooms are modern but small. But if you are out and about while in Oahu you just need a place to sleep then the room size is not an issue. They have a concierge so they can help with travel or sightseeing questions. They do serve breakfast they food, nothing fancy but at least something to start your day out. Rooms are clean also.

vive hotel experience globally good. Unfortunately breakfast is very poor in quality and there is no choice. implementing this issue could get a big improvement the the overall hotel performances. hope this child be useful.

The Vive hotel is in a great location and has excellent staff. The complimentary continental breakfast is a great savings. My only negative about this hotel is that our room was very small. There were only 2 of us, but there was no room to walk around the bed and the bathroom had no room for my toiletries and hair appliances.

I stayed for six nights in a cosmo queen with an ocean view. You get a nice, clean room at a reasonable price. Some of the perks are a mini fridge in the room, complimentary breakfast, wi-fi, use of beach towels. chairs, etc. Hotel staff is very friendly. The only drawback is the A/C. You get a window unit which is kind of loud (bring ear plugs) and the window unit above yours drips water onto your a/c which is annoying. If it weren't for that I'd give this hotel five stars. Aloha!

The hotel was clean, staff was friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was very good. The location was convenient to the beach, many restaurants, bus stops and shopping. I would stay there again.

Located on Kuhio Ave at the top of Uluniu Ave, this hotel is located just one block back from the centre of world famous Waikiki beach. If the beach is not your thing there are many many shops and restaurants within an easy stroll.On arrival you are greeted with a smile, a cold towel and a refreshing juice.The rooms are on the small side, but very comfortable and have everything you need. The bed was comfortable and the shower hot!A continental breakfast is included which was fresh fruit, toast, pastries and coffee/tea/juice. All very fresh.There is a very nice lounge area just off the foyer where you can sit and plan your next outing, chat or read a book.If you are going to be out of your room for most of the time then this hotel should be on your short list for consideration.

Location was spot on (2 blocks from beach), continental breakfast did the job, rooms clean and had everything you needed, staff were pleasant and reception provided beach accessories.... was a good visitWhat let it down on our visit, was the parking as what the hotel doesn't state is the height restrictions and when, like most, your car rental company for 5 persons or more give you an SUV, it doesn't fit in the hotels car park. Lesson learnt, would happily stay again with smaller vehicle

I would definitely stay at the Vive hotel again. The staff were VERY helpful and courteous, nothing was too much trouble. Very close to the beach and the main street with restaurants, cafes and shopping. Great experience overall.

Nice small hotel close to Waikiki. Value priced with no hidden fees. Parking car price was best I could find at Vive Hotel. It is a older building that has had the rooms updated. Continental breakfast was good. A lot of guest opted not to have a car. City noise was in the back ground.

it's a very nice 3 stars hotel. Amazing customer service. i would have given 100% if that cockroach wasnt in the room and provide complimentary parking. it's walking distance within the places we wanted to go, not too far by car if touring around the island.

I was on a mom-cation and stayed at the Vive it's nice because it is located one block off Sunset beach. The hotel lobby is very nice and upscale however they didn't spend a lot of time on upgrading the rooms. I stayed in the hotel for 6 nights and I had to request to have the sheets changed and my room vacuumed which was never done. I was very disappointed in the cleanliness of the room.

We just got back from our week long stay at this hotel and I cannot express enough how much we enjoyed our stay! There are a number of reasons why:- I have to start off by saying the ENTIRE staff in this hotel are amazing! They answered all questions in such a kind manner, were willing to help with anything, went out of their ways to make sure your stay at this hotel is going well. We have stayed at some huge name hotels but the service at this one tops all other names. INCREDIBLE service! A shoutout to Paul, Beverly, Marilyn, Emily, Chris, Kevin, Ryan, Shane, Roger, Adam, and anyone else we missed for your SUPERB service! I really hope the owner/s of this boutique hotel know how awesome you all are and hopefully give you good raises! ;) lol-The hotel itself is very modern looking and clean.-Every morning there was breakfast consisting of fruits, toast, juice, tea, croissants, and muffins. It's not a full breakfast but it was perfect for us as there are so many places around for breakfast/lunch. As well, tea and water was always available!- The hotel was super close to the beach and strip (maybe a  2 min or less walk).- the hotel allows you to rent out beach chairs, beach umbrellas, rain umbrellas, beach mats, boggie boards, and towels absolutely free of charge. It's pretty expensive to rent outside the hotel. - The bus line runs on this street so it was super convenient when going places. The bus itself stopped practically next to the hotel. - we rented a car and the valet parking was only $25/night which is a great price when comparing to other places - Our flight was later in the evening. The hotel staff were kind enough to keep our things and what we loved the most was, you are allowed to sign out a curtosy room to get freshen up before leaving to the airport (take a shower, nap, chill out, change, get ready). That was awesome!- Before coming, some of the reviews we read mentioned the rooms were small. They are small but not to the point where you can't move. We didn't have a problem with it the rooms. My husband and I are heavy global travellers and would say this is the typical size of a room. We didn't spend our days in our room - we would sleep, get up, shower, leave, come back to freshen up, and were out again. Thank you for an incredible stay! We recommend this hotel to everyone! We would definitely come back again!

The stuff was very friendly and me and my family had a wonderfull stay there. I can highly recomend the hotel. The only negative thing is that rooms are a bit small. The hotel is super close to the beach!

We had an amazing time at the Vive hotel, the entire staff was great, very accommodating and helpful, especially Shane at the front desk and Patrick at valet. PROS:-reasonable priced valet parking $25USD/per day-included boggie boards, beach towels, and beach mats available at the front desk -included courtesy room (1hr) after check out to shower and get ready for a late flight - plus no extra charge for valet parking -the rooms were very clean and the hotel lobby had a modern vibe -light breakfast included consisting of toast, muffins, fruits, and tea/coffee..it was just right-a very short walk to Waikiki beach CONS:-no central air, there is a stand alone AC unit mounted in the non-operable window, the AC unit is very loud-the room we stayed in was quite small but did serve its purposeWe will definitely stay at the Vive again and will recommend to our friends and family!

As a 3 star hotel, this hotel certainly offers more than expected. The staff were efficient and friendly. The room condition were great with huge space and comfortable beds. It is also conveniently located near Waikiki beach.

Great location , polite and helpful reception staff but the noise of the air conditioners was unbearable . Tried turning off and opening window but road noise and noise of everyone else aircon still made for little sleep . Also too hot with air off .

The location was good, only 3 blocks from the beach and handy for public transport The staff were excellent and it had a concierge to book any tours. There was 24 hour tea and coffee and a large spacious sitting room The room and bathroom were well appointed, small, but adequate.The air conditioner was noisy. At night we switched it off and opened the window but the noise of the traffic was heard. This all contributed to a poor nights sleep. The breakfast was basic with only bread, pastries, fruit and cakes. There was no cereal

This hotel was fantastic! The staff were so welcoming and friendly. The amenities were great and rooms were so clean. There is a simple breakfast available and tea/coffee/water station 24/7 in the lobby. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Hotel is a lovely little hotel, good value, close walk to the beach, clean with great customer service. The front desk was so helpful and provided a scented wet towel and pineapple juice upon arrival which was a nice touch. Near a bus stop as well.

Even before we arrived, our experience was fantastic. KC at the concierge desk did an excellent job recommending vendors for tours and other activities, especially considering that I was using a local travel agency at the same time. KC beat the travel agency in response time. quality of communication, and ability to meet our needs. Besides that, KC sings for an outstanding band, the Kings of Spade. You should check them out.Shane at the front desk was also very helpful. He recommended lunch and dinner spots for us. We had wonderful experiences at House Without a Key, Yard House, and others.The room was simple and very comfortable--especially the king-sized bed. The continental breakfast was good, and exactly what we expected. Thanks everyone for great memories on our anniversary.Jeff and Shana

First time in Waikiki, Honolulu! We enjoyed our stay at VIVE!! It was referred to us by my sister-in-law. (GREAT referral!)Great staff members and great location. We did not know about the complimentary breakfast, so that was a bonus and it saved us a TON of time in the mornings.Hotel offered complimentary use of beach towels, chairs, and mats!! These little things are such a great idea and makes the vacation more pleasant. The beach was only 2 blocks away so carrying the stuff was easy!Hotel rooms were small but nonetheless comfortable.Staff made the stay at VIVE very pleasant and we would definitely go back!Thanks VIVE staff!!

This hotel has very good value, If you don't mind about room size and closing beach location. quiet good: location, friendly, room cleanliness, and tea complimentary in lobby. Lobby was also comport. bad: room size(in case of std. room), bundle of morning meal.

Very friendly and helpful staff. Hotel was in a fantastic location. The room was clean and very suitable for our needs. The air conditioning was noisy. All day tea and coffee was a blessing. Definitley would stay there again and would recommend without hesitation.

Great location, friendly helpful staff and more. Rooms a bit on the small side but perfectly adequate. Very good transport options, shopping and restaurants all nearby, and Waikiki Beach but 2 blocks away. We would certainly come back!

I stayed in this hotel at the end of April 2017 for one night before my trip to Cancun. The hotel itself was fabulous. The room is clean with good air conditioning minutes walk from the beach.If this hotel had a pool it would be 6** from me.

This may be a smaller hotel,but we had a great stay here. The staff couldn't have been mire friendly and helpful. Waikiki beach is just a few minutes walk as is the main shopping area. The room wasn't huge,but was big enough and had all amenities. Towels and bedding were changed daily and the room was immaculate.. I loved the breakfast,but my husband would have preferred more than the fruit and pastries offered. Would I return? Yes definately!

My daughter alerted me to this hotel based on reviews from Trip Advisor. And, I'm happy I listened to her. We enjoyed our stay here because of the calming and practical decor of the room and lobby areas. I have already recommended Vive to friends and we intend to return very soon!

Absolutely Great Hotel! Everything was just perfect! Starting with the stuff, they were amazing from the front desk to the room cleaning.We have been to many other places, but we hane never seen such a cleaning service, just amazing,speechless. The hotel is in a perfect location, breakfast was delicious! One more time we want to tank you for our great stay and for making us feel like home!

The room we had was clean and had everything we needed for a two night visit. The staff is very friendly which made checking in and out a breeze. Only 2 blocks to the beach...hooray. The a/c is noisy and I wouldn't mention it except it might be a problem for someone else. We would choose the Vive for our stay again.
user_name:
Robert M
Northern CA, United States

review_body: Dorm room size rooms. Clean modern decor. Staff extremely helpful. Three blocks from the Waikiki beach. Perfect for a place to sleep. We don't come to Honolulu to stay in our room. Valet parking fee @ $25/day is reasonable. Continental breakfast gets a bit boring after a few days. This is our second time here. Not fancy, but fits our needs.

We stayed in a mini-suite (just a little more than a regular room) on the 17th floor with a view overlooking Waikiki beach in one direction and Diamond Head in the other direction. This was a corner room with views in both directions. The lobby is fantastic with more than enough sitting areas which accommodate the continental breakfast served every day. The hotel provides towels and beach accessories for guests to visit the beach only 2 blocks away. This is a small well appointed hotel with only 9 rooms per floor and the staff are great. If I ever have the opportunity to return to Honolulu this hotel will be my first choice.

Cute little hotel 2 minutes away from wikiki beach and the wikiki strip. Rooms were clean and tidy. They even offered valet parking ($25) a day. Not bad. We had free coffee every morning. The employees were all friendly to me and my wife. Will recommend on others to stay here for the price and location !

This is our second stay at Vive hotel Waikiki and it exceeded expectations, the staff are so friendly and helpful, the sitting room was a great place to relax and regroup, the free breakfast of fruit and pastries fueled us until lunch, the rooms are compact but comforable. My partner and I would definitely come back again for a third time! Thanks for making our trip extra special.

I like the location near by Waikiki beach and bus station.Breakfast will be more perfect if there is milk or vegetables.Staff of front is patience，helpful.It's pity there is no swimming pool in hotel.

This hotel is perfect for a couples stay! The walk is short to the beach and they offer complimentary beach gear . The continental breakfast is perfect and really saves you an extra $20 in the morning! My fiancé and I stayed in a regular room. It was small, but perfect as we weren't in Waikiki to sit in our room. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating! There is no bar and no pool but who needs a pool with the ocean that close?! And there were plenty of places to grab a cocktail within minutes!

Stayed at Vive Hotel 22 April to 29 April, close proximity to the beach with views of the beach from our room on floor 12 facing the beach, for a very competitive price. Overall great experience, breakfast menu was limited but other than that, all was well. Would stay again next time!!

We came here for a conference but also had some fun in the beach. The first day we couldn't check in because our flight had emergency landing in another city. I emailed them once I landed and they responded in a very short time. When we arrived, they were very friendly and helpful. The location is very good, just two blocks away from the beach. I will recommend this hotel to other people.

Hotel Vive had everything we needed for a two-night stay in Waikiki. Staff was extremely helpful & friendly, decor was bold & fun, loved the twin/twin room for a mother/son trip, appreciated having use of beach towels & mats.

This hotel is one block back from the beach close to Duke's statue. It was very good value with some other hotels close by being $1K USD more. On arrival we were given a wet towel and cold pineapple juice. We arrived at around 7am and unfortunately no rooms were available but staff did say we could come back closer to noon rather than the 3pm check in time. They also offered us breakfast from the continental breakfast buffet. 24hrs a day you could get tea, coffee and filtered water. There was also a microwave for heating food up. The continental breakfast was a variety of fruit and pastries including croissants, bread and spreads. The room was comfortable and had a fridge if we brought food back. At reception there is a consierge and the staff at reception were so friendly and helpful, I could not fault the service provided. You can also get beach towels and water gear from reception too. Outside you are on a bus route and are easily able to get around Waikiki. For convenience, a little extra with breakfast, value for money and great customer service I could not fault this hotel.

We had a 1 night stopover in Honolulu and the Vive was perfect! Well located, newly renovated, friendly staff. Free light breakfast of pastries, breads and fruit. Hotel provided useful info at check in as well as a cool towel and juice. We had a family room which was 2 rooms converted to 1. Bathrooms and rooms small but functional. Beds comfortable. Only fault was noisy air conditioners but didn't stop us sleeping. The tablets bedside was a nice modern touch but perhaps a child lock would be useful as our jet lagged 4yr old managed to request an airport shuttle at 5am! No pool or ocean views or balconies but we knew we wouldn't be in the room much so it suited us to pay less and not have these things.

Nicely presented hotel. No problem with the room presentation . We stayed on the 10th floor and the noise from the road traffic below was bad, difficult to sleep at night. The person who checked us was not very friendly.
user_name:
Brian Edward C
New Norfolk Tasmania 7140

review_body: A nice tidy hotel with a great location that is an easy walk straight onto the beach. Staff are helpful and friendly.Really enjoyed our stay. They even let you use a room to freshen up in after checking out, you are treated as a customer until you have left.

A very pleasant and unpretentious hotel located just 250m from Waikiki beach. Comfortable and well appointed guest rooms with free WiFi and all the basic amenities you need when holidaying in Hawaii.Pros:1. Location, location, location. Close to everything you could possibly want to do at Waikiki. The Bus stops right outside and most tour pick-ups are meters away.2. Breakfast buffet. Much needed before going out doing touristy stuff. Pastries and fruit only but if you want a heavy breakfast there are many options nearby.3. Beach stuff available for free. Don't get fleeced by the beach umbrella/chair/mat rentals on the beach. The hotel provides everything you need, no charge. Just get to the beach early to get a prime spot.4. Courtesy room: In case you have a late flight and want to get in some beach time before you leave, the hotel very kindly provides a guest room for an hour so that you can rest and take a shower before you go even after checking out. Very highly appreciated! 5. Economical. No "resort fee" as charged by many of the other hotels.6. Free (and fast) WiFiCons:1. No bar/restaurant in the hotel. Not much of a con, really. There are several amazing options literally steps away for food and drink. Do you really want to stay in your hotel all day? Get out and explore!2. No gym/health club/spa: Again, see above. Many larger hotels nearby have spas that can be booked even if you aren't a guest. The Hyatt is right next door and has a great spa.3. No/limited view: This is not a beachfront hotel. You can see the ocean from the higher floors if your room faces south but there are buildings in the way. If you have the gumption to actually leave the hotel and walk a few steps, you get all the views you like right from the beach. TL;DR: Excellent location, economical rates, friendly staff, free WiFi, breakfast buffet and courtesy room!

The staff here is awesome! I had no trouble using their tablet request system. The room was cozy and was perfect since I was just exploring Hawaii during the day and just needed a place to sleep. It had everything I needed! They offered beach towels, mats, umbrellas. Unfortunately, they didn't have snorkel gear. The room and lobby were updated and looked really great. It felt very clean! The staff were super helpful! I got sun burnt and they had aloe for me! They were always making sure we were all set up for our day.

Very nice stay Rooms were clean and roomy enough. We had a family suite, the set up was a bit strange. No actual 2 rooms just a half divider between rooms but nice anyway. Staff very accommodating and friendly Hotel very pleasant Continental breakfast was wonderful with plenty fresh fruit pastries muffins etc. Close to everything all within walking distance.Would recommend in future

Staff were very friendly and helpful. I had horrible blisters and I was just trying to get pharmacy info, he gave me bandaids with cream. Very helpful. We had heavy showers, they offered us to use umbrellas

All services such as equipment rental and breakfast, was good.however, room amenity were somewhat uncomfortable. becasue there was not much... i would like to have a variety of amenities including toothbrush and toothpaste.

This was the perfect hotel for our 30th Wedding Anniversary trip to Hawaii. The location is perfect for the beach, shops, bars, restaurants and everything to see in Honolulu. The decor throughout the hotel was stylish and even had a great smell! The breakfast was included in our stay and was great, with complimentary tea and coffee 24 hours a day. On our final day, we were offered a complimentary room to change and freshen up for our flight later that evening, which was a great touch and showed the class and helpfulness of the staff throughout the hotel.We will definitely be staying at the Vive hotel when we return to Hawaii in the Future!

The hotel is clean, the staff friendly, and the location is convenient. Wouldn't have minded a deeper sink in the bathroom. Not being computer savvy, we didn't know there was a tablet in the room to order maid service or ice, etc. If the check-in counter folks just let people know, that would be a big help.

Considering the way the Vive Management handles this place, its clean and the staff are really helpful and friendly. My wife was stung by jelly fish and Chris from front desk helped us understand and suggested us the clinic and remedies.My only complaint was the rooms are very small, and paying $160/night, at times I feel its not worth it, but front desk staff makes you feel better. All together if you are looking for a decent place to stay, Vive is better option.

Family holiday of 2 adults, 2 kids. Within walking distance of beach, shops, and trolleys. We had a 2 bed suite which suited us although not a lot of storage and bathrooms are very small. Air con units were very loud when running but when turned off and windows opened there was a lot of street noise.

This hotel was clean and staff were friendly. The location is perfect for the beach, just 2 streets away. It's close to a fantastic little coffee shop located in the Hyatt down the street. They offer free loans of beach gear which is handy. The room was small but clean. The downfall was the noisy air con that couldn't really be adjusted and the shower head which is not short person friendly. The breakfast is very basic with toast and fruit mainly.

The location of Vive Hotel is excellent (2 blocks to Waikiki's beach), the friendliness staff, the delicious breakfast, the beautiful clean rooms, the extra services like beach gear, the scale for our luggage, the respect for the client, all and everything was just amazing! We would like to thank Paul and Sato for their really good service and willingness to help. With regards Elena and Marco from Costa Rica

I stayed at the Vive Waikiki for one week, arriving after an all day / late flight at 11:00 PM, we were greeted with pineapple juice at the reception desk, which was extremely refreshing. Check-in was quick and convenient. The room was quite small without much storage for clothing or luggage (2 small drawers are located under the bed and a small closet with no door). However with intelligent use of space the room felt comfortable and functional. The continental breakfast is fantastic with a large assortment of baked goods, bread and fresh fruit. Coffee is available at any time and the lobby area is comfortable and inviting. Staff at the hotel is extremely helpful, the day we were leaving we made use of the courtesy suite as we checked out at 12:00 and our flight did not leave until 23:00, they allowed us to stay in the room for an extra period of time. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Waikiki.

I was looking for a nice place in the heart of Waikiki to stay. This place is better priced than other big name hotels in the area. However, it is situated in the far end of Waikiki beach which put you closer to the unsavory side of town. It is only a two block walk but going down one more block is not good. The staff was pleasant and nice. The included breakfast was just fruit and bread. I end up going to MAC 24/7 for food. The good thing is everything is within walking distance

Our overall experience staying at the Vive Hotel was a positive one. Here are a few things we enjoyed and some areas of opportunity for improvement:Pros:Location- sure it is not on the main road in waikiki, but you are literally 2 blocks away from the beach, shops, within walking distance of the zoo and it is not on an extremely busy street which makes it easy to get in and out.Breakfast included- sure it could use more items with protein, but it is a great way to start the day, saves money and time.Staff- the staff was always extremely helpful and courteous. As soon as we arrived, we were given a lot of very useful information on the area.Amenities- the fact that they will loan you beach gear, towel, chairs etc. is also a great benefit.Cons:Amenities- take into account that this hotel does not include a gym or pool. Room- the room is a bit small in comparison to other hotels and since the hotel is an open building you can experience problems with ants if you leave any food lying around.Overall we had a very positive experience staying at Vive and considering the price paid to stay here, I would say it was well worth it! Definitely would recommend this hotel.

I loved this hotel. It's right in the center of everything. I got a great deal online. My family stayed here and they not once complained. We ate breakfast here almost everyday. Pretty good. My daughter loved the baked goods. Its a very modern boutique hotel and very clean. Nice decor. Staff was really nice and always offering to help. Will be back soon.

Overall stay was very good and the staff are excellent and helpful. It would be perfect if renew & relocate the AC so the air wont blow right to the bed. And also please check the bathtub drain, almost clogged and when take shower, out feet soaked with dirty water.

We arrived here early on Easter Sunday morning after a long night from Melbourne expecting to have to wait a long time to check in.We were greeted with a lovely Aloha and a welcome drink by Beverly at the front desk. She went out of her way way to get us a room within 5 minutes. She was extremely helpful and gave us all the assistance we required since it was our first trip to Hawaii.The hotel is located very close to the awesome Waikiki beach and has bus stops outside connecting to all the major attractions.The staff are always helpful with advise and in the last 3 days we have enjoyed our stay here.
