Looking forward to the next three days here. Mahalo to all the lovely peeps at Vive

Nice hotel with great deal. They offer pretty good daily breakfast. Hotel staffs are pretty friendly and they can help you with your request such as restaurant reservation, shopping advise and such.I will definetely recommend my friends to use this hotel for future travel to Hawaii!!

Our staycation was awesome! The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was beyond nice and the bathroom was so huge, biggest walk in shower I've ever seen. It is very modern and the room is pretty large in size, we had withdrawals when we checked out lol.

We loved our stay there. It is close to the beach. They will give you beach towels, chairs, and boogie boards. HUGE PLUS for us. Breakfast was good, not great, but it worked for us. I would totally stay there again.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Vive Hotel! It is well located, comfortable, and stylish without being over the top. It is an easy walk to any part of Waikiki and still manages to be fairly quiet. Breakfast features fresh fruit daily along with coffee, juice, muffins, etc. Staff is very friendly and they go out of their way to be helpful. Room was small, but clean and a view of the beach. And the best part of all is the Vive is reasonably priced! Truly an excellent, all-around value.

Hotel location great. Staff very helpful and friendly. They go out of there way to please you. Free breakfast. Nice quit room with great tv. Location is very close to beach and many restaurants. Would stay here again and again. Priced reasonably

Me, my gf & our friends love this hotel. The location is Superb, Very friendly & helpful staffs, Lovely fruits selection for breakfast, All-day coffee, Nice living room that you can come down and catch up on your work, Clean, Good internet, Unlimited towels/ Beach chairs/ Mat, Nice app to call for additional services such as schedule a pickup time for our car etc. I have given 5 stars review for this hotel which obviously means I really love it, however, there are two things that I wish this hotel had offered which are 1.) Balcony for our room, and 2.) more selections on breakfast menu (they only offer breads, buns, fruits, coffee, but not the usual Cereals&Milk nor usual cooked breakfast choices). Having said that, will I return to this hotel on my next visit to Waikiki?? The answer would be 100% YES!

You will be charged for water, parkingx2, and an ordinary worker claimed to be management when I asked about additional charges. I would highly recommend reconsidering the lower cost of this hotel vs another one. I was charged way over what was on my bill and it still has not been rectified.

Great location, an easy walk to the beach. Very quiet, Friendly, helpful staff. Hotel and room were in excellent condition. Would prefer more options for breakfast (cereal) Wonderful value for money! We would highly recommend it to others.

We stayed two nights at the Vive and really enjoyed it. They were very close to the beach and it wasn't too loud. They offered beach mats, towels, boogie boards, etc. for us to enjoy Waikiki. We did not encounter any bugs in our room or even in the lobby (other than flies, nothing out of the ordinary). The bathroom is VERY small, but seeing we were out most of the days, it wasn't too much of an issue. Breakfast consisted of fruit (oranges, pineapple, cantaloupe, melon, among others, depending on the day) and pastries (such as muffins, bread). If you're like me, you need protein to get you going for the day. This being said, we were hungry a few hours later. The quality of the breakfast was good though. Keep in mind, most places don't offer breakfast for free. This will allow you to spend your money on a good lunch!I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again! Thank you for easy check-in and providing good service!

This hotel has great location for a very reasonable price. The room was small but clean with all the amenities you need. The staff was helpful and friendly. Highly recommended for anyone not looking for a grand hotel but a hotel that serves all the needs of a great vacation.

Check in was okay. Room was very clean and modern but so so small. Cold breakfast only danishes and bread. No pool which was a bummer.& Very slow elevator. Close to beach. And friendly staff who were helpful

The hotel location is good in terms of distance from the beach, however it is in a sketchy part of the street, with loud police sirens going off all night. I imagine if you're on a lower floor that noise would be annoying. Someone hanging around near the hotel offered to sell us drugs and we did see one man passed out at the bus stop right beside it. We weren't really bothered but I wouldn't stay here again if I had kids. In saying that the actual hotel is lovely and the staff are overall very friendly and accommodating. We arrived at 7am and because I e-mailed them saying we'd be arriving so early, they managed to have the room ready for us to check in. This was a huge life-saver as it took about 15hrs to get there! We had a junior suite so our room was a very good size, clean and comfortable. The bed and shower were huge. The only problem we had with the room was the same thing everyone has a problem with here, the air conditioner. On top of the standard loud noise those box air cons make, ours started making weird loud banging noises all night, about 3 nights before we checked out (this was when it was not turned on). We were moved to the room next door for one night whilst they fixed it. We were told it was fixed but when we came back it was still making the same noise. Not a big deal, but annoying.The free breakfast was good, though basic. Fruit, pastries and toast. The little sitting are was really nice and a good place to meet other guests. The free tea and coffee 24/7 was a life saver, as my husband and I drink about 10 cups of tea a day each haha. They have free beach gear too, which was great! Boogie boards, mats, chairs and umbrellas. Free Wi-Fi was fast and didn't drop out.Unfortunately, we had something small taken from our room. It was an old military glasses case that was filled with proper art pens/pencils. It magically disappeared from the night stand two nights before we checked out. I'd recommend you leave everything you can't carry with you in the safe or locked in your suitcase. Even things that don't seem to be worth stealing. Overall, we would stay here again because it is excellent value for money. It is less than half the price of the hotels on the beach, but only a 5 minute walk away. There is no resort or wi-fi fee, breakfast is included and you can borrow beach gear for free (renting an umbrella is $29 a day at the HHV to put it in perspective). The bus stop right outside was convenient and the trolley stop is 5mins the road at the Hilton.

My wife and I stayed only one night after our Hawaii cruise. Hotel staff was excellent. Room was a little on the small size but very clean and efficient. We were ungraded to an ocean view room which was nice. Breakfast was great. Valet parking very convenient. Loved not paying a resort fee. Excellent hotel for the price. Would stay there again without a doubt.

My husband and I stayed for one week in a room with Queen bed that was on the smaller side. A few weeks later, I stayed with another relative in Jr. Suite with ocean view and it was amazing -- terrific views and very comfortable. Excellent staff and great location!

Location was great, rooms and lobby were clean and loved the modern urban decor, friendly and capable staff, prices were very reasonable, breakfast was great, valet parking attendants were friendly and happy to share advice on places to go.

The staff were all very helpful and friendly, The free breakfast was perfect for us. After we upgraded we loved our room.The location was great we could walk anywhere we wanted to go , even to Diamond Head and back.The beautiful beach is two minutes away .

We chose this hotel as it had good reviews and it seemed like a good value. We were only staying 1 night before we fly out in the early morning next day. We still believe it is a good value. The staff members were friendly and helpful. However, there were ants on the walls and bed side tables. My husband also got bitten by some insects from the floor. The air conditioning unit is quite old - it made loud noise and smelt.

The VIVE Hotel was better than anticipated. Great Hotel, location and staff. 2 blocks to the beach, close to restaurants and in a very safe area. Rooms were excellent, beds are nice and soft. View from the 17th floor was amazing over the city. This hotel really made our stay in Honolulu much more enjoyable than paying a lot more in the resort hotels. Hotel is quiet and relaxing! Highly Recommend to anyone.

There is a lot to like about Vive, but also a lot of smaller issues that may ruin some people's experiences. Because of the amount of small issues I can't confidently give a rating of more than 3 stars, but I will say that Vive has by far the nicest and friendly hotel staff I have ever encountered. The staff really made for a great experience and stay here. It's sad that the hotel itself couldn't live up to what a great job the staff does.Pros:the stafflocationroom size (for 1 person)beach towels and body board availabilitycons:broken shower head rodants or termites on desklizards in room (fine for me, but others may hate this find)useless room temperature, super small mini-fridgeno microwaveno access to ice machine (have to request it - why?)mediocre breakfast - have seen nicer breakfast offerings in the middle of nowhere South Dakotabeach chairs - what a joke, a piece of metal that lays directly on the sand, covered in stains

I can't recommend this hotel enough! We stayed here for a long weekend in March and really enjoyed everything about it. The location is great, just two blocks from Waikiki Beach, and close to tons of great food options - grab something from Musubi Cafe and eat it at the beach! The Vive Hotel has paid great attention to detail in all areas of the property. From the pineapple juice at check in to the waiting area in the parking garage, you really feel like you are welcome and appreciated. The rooms are small, but set up in a way that maximizes the space so well that you don't even notice. The drawers are under the bed to save space! You also have a cool tablet with the hotel info that you can use on the wifi. The hotel offers free continental breakfast, which is delicious, beach towels and beach toys for your use, and a business center. The parking is valet only, but at a rate that's the same as self parking at a lot of other hotels in the area (and anyway, if you aren't planning to leave Waikiki, no car needed - the bus stops right out front). They also don't charge any hidden resort fees. We loved our time at the Vive Hotel and will definitely stay there again.

I very much enjoyed my stay here during spring break! The hotel's proximity to the beach was ideal, and the service was truly professional and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel to visitors as the value, location, cleanliness, and customer service could not be better! Thank you, Vive Hotel, for our wonderful stay in Hawaii!

We came here for a 6 night stay and it went beyond our expectations! Clean and comfortable facilities. Complimentary breakfast was refreshing. The staff was friendly and helpful. They even provide the basic necessities for a beach day! Last but not least, the location was great; all the festivities were within walking distance.

Staff very helpful and efficient and the lobby area all time of the day very relaxed with books to read as well, all guests very friendly too, re eption staff very charming and always providing useful info

Staff extremely helpful and friendly! Gave us great recommendations for local and popular places to visit, including in Waikiki and other parts of the Island. Provided great amenities, breakfast daily at no additional cost, WiFi strong enough to stream Netflix and free access to beach towels, body boards and beach chairs. Would definitely stay here again when we return to Hawaii. :)

We had a great stay in the Vive. We arrived earlier than they expected - 9.00am - and we were told that our room wouldn't be ready until 3.00pm. However, the staff member behind the counter noticed that I'd signed up for the 'My Personal Vive' option on the Vive website and this entitled me to a free upgrade if one was available. He did so and we were upgraded to a room twice the size of our original booking (thanks Sato!!). It had a walk in shower, a fridge and a huge bed. Tip 1: sign up for the My Personal Vive option on their website.We soon discovered the hotel was very handily located next to a bus stop (out the front door and turn right) from which you can catch buses to Ala Moana Centre, Pearl Harbor and a variety of other places. Tip 2. download the app 'DaBus'. This will give you real time access to the bus schedules for all bus stops including the one by the Vive. Tip 3. Use the Vive shuttle service to the Waikele Outlet Centre - it's cheaper than Roberts.We were literally 4-5 mins away from the beach (and decent coffee which was best bought in the Hyatt Regency) and the main strip - Kalakaua Ave. Also, we were 10 minutes walk from the 'Food Pantry' - the only decent supermarket in Waikiki (its cheaper than the ABC stores and a better selection).The staff were really helpful and professional and knew the answers to everything and weren't afraid to help you out with any issues. Emily let me use all my pennies towards my bill at the end which was very much appreciated (what else was I going to use them for).The only gripe I had was the breakfast. It wasn't bad - but it needed some more options - particularly around protein. The breads and the muffins and the fruit are good - but some ham, cheese, sausages etc would really help. But it's the only thing I could really recommend they improve.So, overall, a great hotel - well situated, excellent staff, free wifi, comfortable rooms, could do better on the breakfasts, reasonably priced and very clean. I would recommend this hotel to you.

we loved staying in this hotel. The interior design is lovely. We were expecting smaller room based on the previous reviews, but the size was decent and comfortable. The breakfast is delicious with variety of fresh fruits, pastries, jam and butter. Fresh coffee and tea is available anytime during day. You have acces to toasters and the microwave anytime of the day. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We highly recommend this hotel and we would definitely stay here next time we're in Hawaii

For a first class stay with staff members who go a step beyond what is expected, I heartily recommend the Vive Hotel Waikiki! I want to thank all the nice people manning the front desk and concierge desk, as well as the morning buffet attendants. All the housekeepers were efficient and pleasant. Thanks everyone for a great stay!

My wife and I stayed at the Vive Hotel twice in March as a stopover when going to Australia and back from New Zealand to Canada. It's a neat, fashionable hotel that's a couple of blocks from the beach. They have a great continental breakfast and excellent guest services. There are lots of places to eat within walking distance, Hy's if you'd like a quality dining experience is next door, for example.

I hope to come back to Hawaii and i will definitely go to your hotel during our stay!Small room but the rest makes up for that! Great amenities offered at the hotel it's so well situated that everything is close by. Best value in all the choices seen!

Great Hotel on a great beach!!! We loved it!!! And the Long Journey from Germany was worth a visit on this beautiful Island Hawaii!!! We really enjoyed the trip. The Hotel was also great in a perfect Location!!!

Stayed four nights at Vive and loved it on my first trip to Honolulu. Great boutique hotel for the money. Just two (short) blocks from beach. Could see it from my room. Huge crowds at beach but Vive's street was quiet. Keep in mind rooms are small but you won't want to spend much time in them. Beach towels and mats are available in lobby. Breakfast (fruit, breads, coffee and juices) was good. No restaurant or bar but plenty options nearby. Musube (rice balls, rice bowls) and Me BBQ (Korean) are across the street and cheap. (Didn't use it but lots of places deliver.) Parking (valet) is $25 -- but only $12.50 if you sign up to become a Vive member. Free wi-fi. No "resort fee." Only negative: window air-conditioners are noisy.

The hotel is in a great location, so close to the beach and the main drag of Waikiki. The staff were helpful and extremely friendly, making checkin after a long flight super easy. Would stay here again in a heart beat.

Location, food, staff friendliness - everything is good. If I go to Hawaii again, I would definitely choose this hotel. Highly recommended to anyone, especially first-time travelers to Hawaii just like my family and myself.
- Clean room - Near the beach and many shops- delicious Breakfast (some breads and fruits)- Simple Air conditioner- lower price is the best thing - It's good place to stay for the trip or honeymoon

This is a lovely place to stay.It is close to the beach ....one block back....so it is much quieter than on the main street.The offer all the things you could need ..towels boogie boards umbrellas etc ....We will def stay there again

This is a great little hotel in a prime location near to the beach and the high end shops. The staff are really friendly and helpful. It feels snaller and more personal than the big 'corporate' hotels which surround it. If the rooms were a bit bigger and more modern I would have given 5 stars but I booked on price and it was definitely good value.

Front desk was really helpful and kind when we checked in, and after that every staff member was amazingly helpful, not to mention how immaculate the room was! Breakfast was an awesome plus too.! Love this hotel!

Hotel is 2 blocks from Waikiki Beach, just off the main drag. Complimentary breakfast, and beach towels and chairs to use each day make this place a bargain compared to the big resorts. Stayed in a Jr Suite that was large and spacious with a super comfortable bed. Would stay again.

I loved this boutique hotel, just small rooms. The library with coffee and tea 24 hours was the best. customer service was great and the location is two blocks away from beach with shuttle services available in the area

Rooms were dark, small, and felt cramped. There was no fresh air as windows don't open. The continental breakfast was the best part. Rooms in the back of hotel are more quiet as they don't face noisy Kuhio Avenue.

Room was small but location was great for the price. 2 blocks from the beach. Walking distance to a few good restaurants. Parking was easy but $25 a day. Friendly staff, bed was comfortable and room was very clean. Breakfast was minimal but had good fresh fruit. Only complaint is the maid service comes early. Put out the do not disturb if you don't want an early wake up call.

Staff was excellent, breakfast was a plus, room was small but clean and adequate for our short stay. Location was perfect just a quick walk to the beach and hotel provided towels, beach chairs & mats, boogie boards. If I was staying longer I would have preferred more amenities such as outdoor space either a pool or lanai and a hotel bar.

VIVE hotel is like none other in Honalulu. With fresh local island fruits to greet you in the morning and incredible staff to assist with every imaginable vacation need, this is a #1 5-star hotel!During check-in, Eva greeted us with smiles. She was friendly and thoughtful. We absolutely enjoyed our beautiful view of the Waikiki beach and lovely Diamond Head. The ladies who oversaw our room made sure they provided us with our individual comfort needs such as extra blankets and additional towels. Chris guided us to fantastic finds that tickled our tastebuds and wowed our eyes. His expertise on island knowledge and joy to share the richness of the island with us added to our confidence to explore more. Adam in the valet team proved time and time again his authentic love of making vacationers feel like home during their time in Oahu. Beverly has bent over backwards on one specific occasion where we felt like family. At the concierge desk, KC gave us her stamp of approval after cross checking our list of things to do. Twice, she even called two companies to confirm their hours due to pur prior experience. Last but not least, thanks to the kitchen staff that has so graciously provided ice for us each and every night. We had the ideal stay and dream vacation. Our thanks to the team who made it all possible.

Stayed in April 2015 for 2 nights.Decent service, good location with indoor parking. Within walking distance from everything Waikiki.I booked a package including bicycle rental, but we had no time to use them.

This was a great hotel for our 5 night trip in paradise. We were greeted with the friendly valet gentleman, Adam. Beverly checked us in with a smile and with cold scented towels and pineapple juice. We requested an early checkin and we were lucky we got it! Jackie, the housekeeping manager and Daniel, the hotel manager, greeted us as well and made our stay feel like were right at home.Little did we know Adam already met us up to our room and delivered our bags immediately. We received a hand made card with chocolates on our lovely king bed. We booked the junior ocean suite which was a great size for our long stay. The hotel is only 2 blocks away from the beach and close from the main strip. They offered us complimentary beach accessories such as towels, mats and boogie boards in addition to complimentary continental breakfast downstairs. Whenever we wanted to request maid service, they were on it. Dasleen tidied up our room perfectly! The other valet gentlemen were also very helpful which were Ryan and Paul.At first our tablet didn't work but they managed to fix it before we left which was great. We used it to order room service one night and it was delicious! I'm glad we chose this hotel for our spring break getaway. Wish we could have stayed longer and even thought about extending our stay but it was too expensive to change our flight dates :/ Hopefully we can come back next time but not get sunburnt! :)Mahalo for your hospitality!

This our fourth stay at the Vive and it never disappoints! Amazing staff, facilities and location. The included breakfast is generous and although the variety is limited it is always fresh and tasty. Free Wi Fi is always a bonus. I love that the hotel supplies beach towels, mats and boogie boards. Another thing I love about this hotel is the staff. Lots of friendly, smiling faces.

I picked this hotel because it was such a good price and had such great reviews. Normally the lower the price the lower the reviews, it ended up being the best decision for my first trip to Hawaii. Right off the bat I will say that this is what you might call a budget hotel, unless you shell out some more money the rooms are small and you won't get a beach view, but for me I don't need all that because I was barely in the room other than to sleep and shower. We had a double bed room and it was perfect. It had a fridge, a safe, comfortable, clean beds and a tv. The thing that puts this hotel over the top for me was considering it is a lower priced hotel it had awesome accommodations. When you check in you get wonderful smelling cool towels for your face along with a cold glass of pineapple juice. The employees are friendly and very helpful. We had so many questions during our stay and they always were able to help with transportation or pointing us the right way to something. They have beach towels, beach mats, boogie boards, umbrellas and chairs available for you to use at the beach which is a straight walk out of the hotel and two blocks away. Awesome breakfast, with all kinds of breads, fruit, sausage rolls, muffins etc That saves so much money on food costs, which is greatly needed with the restaurant prices for food. They hold your luggage till check in and if your flight is late they will hold your luggage after check out and offer you a courtesy room to clean up in if you want to spend time at the beach the day before you go. Also the decor is just very lovely, the breakfast area is not traditional tables, but really trendy chairs/couches and tables. They have a library for you to borrow books for the beach as well as two computers for you to print anything you need. I really just can't say enough about this hotel, I felt like I got so much more than I paid for. They made our stay great, and I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants great accommodations for a great price.

We had a 3 day stay at this lovely hotel. We arrived early at 830 am and had 2 rooms booked. The very helpful staff already had 1 room.ready as i had emailed them of an early arrival. The room was on the 21st floor one down from penthouse and had beautiful ocean views.The room was spotless with a small bathroom, but did have a bath. Lovely soft white towels and assorted toiletries. Wifi worked well and plenty of Tv channels. The location was excellent just a 2 min walk to beach. The provision of beach chairs,mats and towels was very welcome. Breakfast was continental so was not a hot breakfast but had large platters of fresh fruit, pastrys, toast, juice and tea and coffee. The best part of this stay was the staff, all just so helpful with whatever request was made.A wonderful stay.

We so enjoyed our stay here!! The location, inclusive breakfast, beach equipment rentals, amenities, and lovely staff were the best parts! The room itself was a little plain/older in design- but it seemed that most hotels looked about the same in Waikiki. We are looking forward to coming back :)!!

KC was fantastic! She was well informed and I booked some excellent activities!!!! The hotel was three blocks from the beach and all the shops and eateries. I had a great view of the beach, 24 hour coffee!

Perfect location and accommodations for our 11 days stay. Staff were friendly and courteous. Our room was comfortable, clean and the breakfast was delicious with plenty of choices of fruit, coffee, tea

Vive is a very old hotel that has had a renovation. Staff are nice enough. We were lucky to be upgraded to a suit and had a nice view of the beach. Unfortunately the windows are head height so you can only see when standing up!! There's no pool which surprised me. I can't complain tho as I just assumed they had a pool. The beach is only a 5 min walk away though so very close. They offer complimentary beach towels, mats, chairs and boogie boards which is good. The air cons are old units that sit in the windows. Bit noisy but work ok. Quite noisy outside at night. We were on the 18th floor but still could hear people yelling on street due to windows being so thin. They offer complimentary continental breakfast in the foyer. Unfortunately they had run out of everything when we got down for breakfast at 845. We didn't bother going the second morning. Overall Vive is a nice hotel. We prefer hotels with pools and balconies so we won't stay here again for that reason. Otherwise we possibly would.

This hotel is very beautifully decorated with paintings, sculptures, and eclectic furniture. They are affordable, do not charge a resort fee and WiFi is free.The only complaint I have is that the air conditioner in my room was too loud.

Stayed late Feb 2017 for five nights. Whilst not being budget it was cheaper than your big name hotels. We loved the hotel. Great convenient location, very close to the beach and bus stop. Incredibly helpful and cheerful staff. We had an issue with out rental car and the staff were more than willing to help; calling the rental company and sorting out the issue. Breakfast is included in the price however don't expect a full buffet breakfast as it is a delightful selection of pastries, breads and fruit. 24/7 access to complimentary tea and coffee facilities were major bonus as well as free strong Wifi. Negatives we experienced were a slightly loud air conditioning unit and the ridiculously expensive valet parking (which was the only option) at $25USD per day. However this is comparative to all the surrounding parking locations that we found.

Overall, excellent stay. Hotel Staff (Desk, Valet, Housekeeping, and Concierge) were excellent, professional, and very courteous. Room was small but functional, very clean/well maintained with working A/C and mini fridge. Hotel appears to have been renovated within last few years. Breakfast was mainly fruits and pastries with coffee, tea, and pineapple juice. Beach gear (chairs, towels, bamboo matts, umbrella) available from front desk for day use. Given the price and services provided with high courtesy I would stay there again as the Staff and location made for a pleasant experience!

Had go to try and get my son jeep. We did not accomplish to many laws. We also went to our 35 anniversary very beautiful. Sunset was to die for. We went for a ride around the island visited other beaches.

I'm not going to lie, the rooms are not the biggest but it was just fine for my wife and I, see if you can request a corner room they seem to have a little more space, the location is very hard to beat walking distance to many shops, restaurants, and just a minute walk to the beach. The staff was awesome and their location being where it is made it very easy to drive in and out of. If you every stayed on the Main Street in Waikiki you will know what I'm talking about.

We enjoyed the location. Room had an interesting setup...with beds back-to-back partitioned by a half wall. But the air conditioners on the windows were loud blowing smelly air. The breakfast could have used some yogurt or cereal or granola instead of so many varieties of breads/buns. I would have left thinking it was a half decent hotel except for the valet guy at the very end who brought our car and left us with 2 huge luggages, a stroller and at least half a dozen smaller backpacks and bags to put into the car...let alone 2 small children we needed to strap into car seats. Didn't even offer. We already had a tip ready thinking that he would naturally start helping us load. Nope- disappeared without a word. I was so mad I almost went back up to reception just to tell him off. As you can see these last 5 minutes of our stay is what left the biggest impression. Left at 11am on Saturday Mar19 if you want to pinpoint who he is.

I give their Staff a 99% their facility a 97% overall my rating is a 98%. Why? because there is always room for improvement and growth. The location of the hotel is great ! Their Continental Breakfast is awesome!Carlos

a boutique hotel three short blocks from Waikiki Beach; lots of restaurants in the area; free beach towels, mats & boogie boards for guests; continental breakfast is sumptuous; cereal & milk not available though; small standard room too small for 2 adults with large suitcases; upgraded to a corner room wt a sitting area and view of the water; overnight parking is an additional $25/night.

The hotel offers a resort-style service from welcome beverages to casual and shining lobby sitting areas to stunning breakfast. They also provide beach equipment including beach towels, mats, boogi boards and chairs. The room could be quite basic on the other hand, tight space for the amount per room. And no other facilities such as pools or gyms. They offer valet parking for $25 and if you book use their membership on their website they give you half-price parking. The location is convenient, and the staff are very nice. Recommended for wakiki economic stay seekers.

Excellent location, price, and service. The room was a bit small, but the morning buffet and the friendly staff more than made up for it. The car valet service was especially helpful as we were visiting family each day.

Good location. 5 minutes walking distance form the beach. Great breakfast. Big room. Clean. Friendly staff. Valet parking. Beach towels. Free Wifi. Reasonable rates being in the heart of Waikiki. I will return for sure

We got an upgrade at checkin which was appreciated. Free beach hire eq and the staff are really nice. Great location for the cost however even though we had ocean view the windows aren't to the floor so you can't see the ocean unless standing up. Older style hotel with air conditioners in the windows. Continental breakfast quite minimal so if it's not free I'd go somewhere else to eat.

I decided to travel to Oahu for a weekend with my boyfriend. We picked Vive hotel because it was the first one that was in our price range. It was more than we expected. The hotel was a short walk away from the beach and the Waikiki strip. The hotel also had chairs, umbrellas, beach mats and towels which was perfect for the beach! Having that available allowed us to pack light and didn't need to worry about buying or renting them. This hotel was a great place to stay!

Location solid Window AC units are loud and a bit annoying at night and during the day when working in the room. Breakfast was very limited with just a variety of breads and fruits. No meat or eggs. No pool

I stayed in this hotel for two days in October,2016.Because of good location, it was convenient to tour in Waikiki.It is practical and good for the price.Free breakfast was good.But there was an ant in the room.

Hotel is in a handy location, great for public transport and a short walk to beach, local shops and markets. It is a great little property their best asset is the staff, all team members were friendly and went out of their way to be helpful and make our stay great.

Awesome location and friendly staff, rooms were clean and the tech interface made it easy to request items, schedule cleanings, etc. Annoyances were always small but many: incorrect flyers of events, insufficient replacement of shower items, blah continental breakfast with no variations, charge in room for bottled water. Again, if you don't care about those this was a great place to stay.

We found our stay at Vive very nice and relaxing. Room was spacious and clean but with little wow-effect. Best feature of the hotel is definitely the friendly and helpful staff that set us right into vacation mood.

After an extensive search of other hotels in Waikiki (very expensive), and based on the recommendation of a family member, we stayed at Vive for 4 nights. We were very kindly upgraded to a partial oceanview on the 21st floor. The staff was professional and friendly. The room, although small, was adequate for the 2 of us for 4 nights and was clean and the bed comfortable. We appreciated the mini-fridge in the room. There was some noise from the street, but the white noise provided by the (rather loud) air conditioner lulled us to sleep each night. Breakfast was perfectly adequate for our needs and free!! -- fruit and pastries were much better than we had anticipated based on some of the reviews. Granted, no big proteins, but qood bread, peanut butter, delicious croissants and a few other pastries to start the day. There could be a few more tables/chairs as the breakfast area tended to get crowded at peak times. The all day tea and coffee in the lobby is a nice touch. We were delighted with the central location. Really, only a 5 minute walk to the Duke statue on the beach, easy access to a bus stop to take you almost anywhere on the island, close to restaurants, shopping. Just couldn't believe how accessible everything was. Would stay at Vive again if we ever return to Waikiki.

Vive was a really good experience. Staff was fantastic, hotel was clean, fun and funky (in a good way). Decent breakfast selection in the morning (fruit and pastries, etc.). Location was perfect for walking to beach and other spots in the city. Room was a tiny bit small for the price, but if you have traveled outside of the US it was similar to room sizes in japan.

A modern and well presented property within walking distance of Waikiki Beach and all the shops and eateries. The staff are friendly and helpful. The hotel lobby is airy and clean, and able to be utilised when waiting for airport transportation. The room was clean and medium sized. The bed was comfortable and the room serviced to a high degree. Good tarrifs are available if procured head of stay dates

Got a warm welcome with a pineapple juice and fresh hand towel. The room was not very fancy and was small, as to be expected for a city hotel, but it was clean and convenient. All staff were friendly and helpful. Gave good local advice. The included breakfast was fresh fruit, breads, pastries and coffee, which was good enough for us. Loved the eclectic furnishings in the lobby- made it unique and fun.

I am not sure how this hotel was so highly rated. Maybe it is based on reviews that were done after the initial renovation. I stayed in room 905 which had some issues. The bathroom sink did not drain well. The bathroom floor tile was worn. The bathtub was stained. The windows needed washing from the outside. Also, room 905 was very close to the bus station which was extremely noisy without the air-conditioner running.The positives were the hotel staff was great and the location was pretty good. I would probably not recommend this hotel.

Staff were very welcoming and helpful. Rooms comfortable, but on the small side, location was excellent for walking and bus. Only disappointment was no outside patio or deck. Excellent breakfast. Would stay again!

Great location, friendly customer service, updated and hip lobby, good value, so-so rooms. Over all I'm very happy with this hotel. Friendly greeting at the door, just two blocks from the beach, and lots of food/drink options around the hotel. Good breakfast included and 'extras' like umbrellas, beach mats, etc. The room was clean. the bathroom was updated (large shower) and the bed was soft enough. It just wan't as 'hip' or modern as the lobby lets on. Kinda dark and an odd layout. Also the windows here (and all over the island) are thin glass so the road noise can be heard with the windows closed at all times (even when you're trying to sleep at night). I suggest a floor higher than 8 when you check in. Other than that it was terrific, I'd stay here again!

Excellent staff polite helpful particularly Eva R (front desk)Christopher (front desk) Hotel location is great, breakfast was good.we will return have recommended to friends and family.We had a wonderful stay at Vive Hotel Waikiki

Rooms seem to be redone and are nice, but fairly small. Location is great in Waikiki, only a couple block from the beach and main strip. Staff are very nice and helpful. Continental breakfast isn't much though, better than nothing but more like snacks.

Very posh hotel conveniently located 2 blocks from Waikiki beach. Hotel staff was wonderful. The amenities are fantastic, and overall the value for our stay was great. Only thing to note is the rooms are small.

The hotel is in a great location, just two blocks from Waikiki beach area (Duke Paoa statue). The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are a bit small however clean and comfortable, very good value and would stay again.

VIVE HOTEL is very very nice location in wakiki and kind staff, and fresh food and clean roomi will be back vive hotel again next year thnk you vive ~~~~~thank you hwai~~~~~~i love it~~~~~~~~~~~~ see u next time ♡ps. 2107 room, turn on the water tap make noise, this motor fix please

The location was excellent, the facility was nice. A continental breakfast included lots of fresh fruit. The staff was nice. It's not a 5 star hotel but it was less than half the price of the nicest hotels.

Perfect location. Very helpful staff, clean and central! Very nice staff. You can borrow towels and enjoy the beach. The room was small but very clean and nice. Good value for money. We were on honeymoon.

Centrally located, a couple of blocks from Waikiki beach. Clean facilities, helpful staff and a very nice continental breakfast each morning (included with the room rate). Coffee is available before breakfast for those that may be starting an excursion before breakfast begins. The rooms are compact , like you would find in most European hotels. Nicely appointed and clean. You won't go wrong with this hotel.

The location, service, staff and price are the definite advantages of this hotel. We arrived too early for our checkin, however the staff who greeted us were really accommodating and really helpful. Our room was cosy and comfortable too. Very clean and the beds were always made. This was the first time we were in Hawaii and the staff were really knowledgeable and provided us with advice and tips on where to go. The hotel is also 2-3 mins walk to Waikiki beach, and is in walking distance to many restaurants and shops which was a definite bonus. We really enjoyed our stay and will definitely be coming back :)

The Vive hotel is only 2 blocks from the beaches in the heart of Waikiki. The location is near a bus stop, and only a 5 minute walk to most of the shopping and restaurants. The staff is friendly and the concierge is knowledgeable of the attractions and other points of interest in the local area, as well as, on all of Oahu and the other islands as well. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. Don't forget to take advantage of the "checkout courtesy room". A very good value!

Awesome boutique hotel just off the main strip and a quick walk to the beach. Pricing and service was excellent and the rooms are cozy and have a great vibe. Only downsides are obstructed ocean views and very few amenities (no hotel bar or restaurant) but again, it's so close to everything that it's not a big deal.

The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly. The rooms are very small though and very little room for clothes - two tiny drawers in the bottom of the bed. The bathroom has very limited space to place things and the sink is very shallow. Would not be comfortable for a week long stay.The location was nice - only 3 blocks from the beach. They provided beach mats, towels and umbrellas to use. The complimentary breakfast was nice - the coffee was great!

We wanted a hotel in a relatively central position and were attracted to Vive because of the great reviews and good value. We were not disappointed. We were upgraded to a suite on a high floor on check in and this was more than adequate for our needs. The hotel makes a refreshing change from the chains and the staff are wonderful.An added bonus is the complimentary breakfast in the morning which had a good choice of items. The hotel also provides beach towels, boogie boards etc for the beach free of charge which we took advantage of, this is a nice touch. The beach is less than 5 minutes walk from the hotel.Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again if in Honolulu.

The hotel's location and price are very good. So I had a good time. I stayed family room. It was very comfortable and usefull. Also hotel's location is closer to beach and closer to famous restaurant.

Everything went well: price was good, location amazing, nice rooms, equipment for a beach day could be borrowed from the lobby, after checking out, leaving late at night we got a nice room for us to have shower and change our clothes. The only thing that wasn't good was the breakfast, which only included pastry and fruits, no protein of any kind. But the breakfast was still very delicious.

I'm a solo traveler from Sydney and stayed here 9 nights during my first visit to Hawaii. I was looking for a hotel that was affordable yet conveniently located and not have a balcony like most of them do in Waikiki. This hotel ticked all the boxes for me and it had everything I was looking for. I booked a twin room and the rooms are small but not tiny. Even though I was by myself I didn't feel if I had another person in the room it will be too small because trust me I have stayed in smaller rooms in Japan, and compared to that this room is a luxury. The room is exactly as shown on their website, their photos are not photoshopped in any way, it was exactly how it looked. The only thing that kind of was hard to get use to was the air conditioning noise.As you enter the lobby you will see the dining area where breakfast is served every morning from 7-10:30am which consist of tea/coffee, bread, pastries and some fruit. It was good enough for me as I don't eat much in the morning anyways. I enjoyed the Kona coffee they served and miss that I can't have it anymore.The hotel is conveniently located, two blocks away from the beach and main strip of shops. There is a food pantry nearby if you need any toiletries or pick up any groceries. There is also a pink line Waikiki Trolley stop nearby if you want to get to Ala Moana shopping center.I will definitely stay here again.

This hotel is excellently located in Waikiki with the beach and many attractions within walking distance. We had he cosmopolitan queen room, which is quite small but well laid out and comfortable. The staff is friendly and helpful and the Art Deco decor is lovely. The only snag we had was that the valet parking clearance is only 6 feet-- common at the parking garages in that area. Our rental vehicle would not fit, so we were constantly looking for parking elsewhere. Highly recommend Vive Hotel Waikiki!

We didn't research much about Honolulu hotels, but we came across this deal and went for it. We were very happy with our decision because it wasn't a huge commercial building with endless hallways and elevators. Instead, it felt like we were checking into our own vacation home. Everything was modern and cozy. Valet was very convenient and the building was easy to access since the hotel is just a block or two away from the busy roads of Waikiki. We got the Jr Suite which had a view of the Waikiki beach and Diamond Head. It was the perfect amount of space to relax for the two of us. The small fridge was convenient to store any drinks, leftovers, or delicious fresh mangoes i bought from the outdoor market nearby. The shower was HUGE. Although we didn't hang out at the Waikiki Beach area, we did notice there were free beach gear available to rent (like body boards, chairs, towels, mats). I typically look for a fitness centre and swimming pool when i'm traveling, but I wasn't too disappointed that Vive didn't have these because you had a beach out front (5 min walk) and so many recreation activities nearby to keep us active (hiking, paddle boarding, swimming, etc). Many hotels don't have breakfast deals, but it was nice that there's a free breakfast time in the morning to get some fruit and pastries. Free coffee and tea is available all day which can be a lifesaver during a busy vacation. :)

My girlfriend and I had the most amazing stay with Vive Hotel. Rooms were beautiful, Staff was super helpful. We were particularly taken with the concierge KC who was incredibly helpful and sent us to a ton of places that only locals know about. We went to some much less touristy beaches, did a dolphin swim and got to explore all kinds of other parts of the island. Couldn't have asked for a better experience in Hawaii

We stayed at Vive Waikiki last month and it was super awesome. We were so grateful to also have such an great guide right at the hotel, KC. We got the scoop on the best local places to eat, the best spots to experience every day life on Oahu and the best venues for live music. The room was beautiful and super clean, right in the middle of the action in Waikiki, extremely friendly staff. We can't wait to come back and have another beautiful trip. Thanks Vive!

Being European we typically have no issues with small (er) hotel rooms, but even for us this one was a little too small. Ok for the 2 nights we stayed. The sink as other reviews state is a classic example of mis-design as too flat and water will not rinse, wonder why they aren't replacing them. Overall the hotel is a bit polished up to make it look & feel like a boutique hotel but I really wouldn't call it one. Just a bit more colour than your average American hotel. Enjoyed the free complimentary breakfast. It's very basic but we didn't expect more so it's a nice little extra. Reception staff was super friendly and definitely well above average. Great location. Overall I think it's ok but far from being great and should we return, we would probably pay the 50-90$/night more to upgrade to a different hotel. Came here as we booked late, lots was booked out or at an outrageous price. If you book well in advance you may get a better deal elsewhere. Liked the fact that it's not a family hotel.

I recommend it, as it is located close to the beach, the breakfast is included and the staff is helpful. The internet speed is good, the breakfast offered is very decent, and the system used with the tablet works very well. The only downside is the air conditioner noise.

Reasonably priced with NO resort fees and a free breakfast buffet. They provide mats and towels for the beach. I was extremely pleased with the room and service. You won't be disappointed! I will definitely stay here again.

We spent 3 nights here recently at the end of our honeymoon. We were very impressed by our stay. On arrival we had been upgraded to an ocean view which was a real treat! The room was large, simply but stylishly decked out and the bed was super comfortable. The staff and service during our stay was excellent and all the little extras such as complimentary beach towels and equipment as well as breakfast each day add up to make your stay very easy without all the fuss of bigger hotels. We would definitely recommend staying here if you are wanting a great hotel without the big price tag!

Great location, good price (no resort fees) and incredible staff. I highly recommend this hotel. Short walk to the beach, right next to a bus stop. Everything you need at a reasonable price. Book it now.

Had a horrible experience. Was given a room next to a construction site, with zero noise insulation and the size of a shoe box, when asked for a different room, due to inability to sleep let alone think, the Asian man at front desk was rude and chastised us. From then on, he targeted us. We borrowed an umbrella at lunchtime from this Asian manager, which we returned 45minutes later to someone else at front desk, stating our room number. At approximately 2100hours that night, assuming it was this Asian manager, as he was the only one on, he slipped a note under our door saying we must pay for the umbrella or a charge of 26USD would be charged. What?? Breakfast is terrible, rooms are terrible, staff don't talk to you and the sheets are filthy. Not to mention constant slamming of doors and banging from staff at all hours of the night, coming and going. Never again, not too mention we payed 1300 AUD for 5 nights, not the cheapest. Don't bother. Go elsewhere.

I have stayed at both the Courtyard Marriott and the Vive. My wife and I were more comfortable and relaxed at the Vive plus the price is way cheaper and the hotel is right down the street. The valet is half the price at the Vive plus there is complementary breakfast. This makes Vive an excellent value and should be a top-choice for any bargain hunters that don't require a beachfront hotel with shopping and high-end restaurants next door. Rooms: The regular rooms are small yet functional. They do not have a coffee maker or microwave but do have a mini-fridge. Bathrooms are clean and modern. Beds are very comfortable. TV's offer a standard collection of cable channels. Window mount AC get's the job done but is not as nice as the built-in units you typically see a Hilton/Marriott. Lobby: The "Livingroom" is well decorated, clean, and contemporary with an "art hotel" feel. There is lots of space to hang out, relax, and eat the complementary breakfast. There is a microwave and toaster-ovens if you need to warm up leftovers. There is no bar or restaurant. Valet: The cost is $25 a day. We paid $39 a day down the street at the Marriott. It's a great value and the staff is nice and there is usually no wait. Breakfast: Who else provides complementary breakfast on Waikiki? They offer a variety of fruits (strawberry, pineapple, melon) and numbers breads & baked goods. I typically filled up on fruit and cinnamon rolls. Free coffee and tea are included. This presents a huge value and savings if you don't require bacon/sausage/eggs in the morning. Location: The hotel is two blocks from the beach and provides full-size towels, umbrellas, boogies boards. All for free. Nice restaurants on the other side of Waikiki are a 10 minute walk thru the shopping district.

Other hotels were booked up so we chose this place. It is only a couple of blocks to Waikiki beach and they provide a lot of amenities such as beach towels, boards, and umbrellas. The breakfast was a little lacking with regards to quality of fresh fruit and coffee. Valet is $25 with unlimited in-out privileges. Nearby are plenty of places to eat (musubi, food trucks, International Market Place). We had a junior suite with a view of the beach along with some space to sit in some chairs and a huge shower. Overall, it was a decent place I would recommend but we personally will try out other places.

Great location to the beach and excellent internet! Awesome service and staff were great. The Vive was an ideal location to the beaches and within the proximity of major shopping. Excellent restaurants in range.

I visited it in February 2017 for vacation. I find this hotel in a very good location. The staff was very nice. Rooms are too small. There is only sweet breakfast choiche. The valet parking service is very good!

Our first time at the Vive Hotel. Great location, only small blocks from Waikiki Beach....straight out hotel door, straight ahead and you're at the Duke's statue. Right at the start of all the shopping and restaurants on the beach. You really can't get a better location for their price, which is about half of the main hotels on the beach. The parking is reasonably priced for the area......you get unlimited ins and outs with free valet service and your car is inside the building too. Free beach towels and mats.....unlimited too. People are very nice. Only problem was the breakfast....all breads and a couple fruits like cantaloupe and that's it. They need to keep their exterminator employed.....we found a few bugs that seemed to be coming from the carpet behind the furniture.....not a big problem but could become one fast.

There are so many old hotel in Hawaii.Vive hotel's room condition is very clean and new!!!They lent quick and easy to beach supplies.And provide incredible service, breakfast is free, daily hotel fee is free!!And the employees are very kind.

Fantastic hotel, very central to Waikiki. Public transport is very accessible, just a short walk to all the buses you would need to get to most tourist destinations. Check in was very friendly, they also gave us information on what weekly events were happening in Waikiki and a simple guide to taking TheBus to most of the tourist destinations you would want to visit. Room was slightly smaller than the usual, but that didn't bother us. Would not recommend to a family though as it would be just enough room for a couple. Room was very clean and housekeeping was fantastic, making sure our bed was made everyday and all bathroom amenities were refilled everyday. Downstairs in the lobby was where the breakfast was - breakfast included a variety of pastries / bread, coffee/tea and fresh fruit. Coffee/tea/water was available 24/7 and the lobby had some boardgames for you to play if you find yourself with a little spare time.Upon check out, it was very easy - the hotel also has a concierge service which helped you book things like activities, tours, shuttle services etc. The hotel helped me book a shuttle service to the airport which only costed $12 pp including baggage. They also had beach equipment for you to take with you when visiting the beach.All in all, very lovely hotel to stay at, one of the more value for money hotels on Waikiki, would stay here again next time I am in honolulu. Customer service is very consistent.

Great location in Waikiki. 2 blocks from the beach, shopping, and restaurants. Helpful and friendly staff. Rooms were clean and updated, but very small. Would have benefited to have a small dresser to put clothing.

Hotel is very close to the beach, and staff was extremely courtious and friendly. The rooms were smallish but comfortable and had all the convienances needed. But when in Waikiki who spends the whole time in the room, being 100 yards off the beach helps.

There are 6 of us on this family & friends vacation. I ended up booking this hotel via TripAdvisor website directly due to the price and its overall rating. Although there are few disappointments (keep reading), I am still giving it a 5-Star rating due to the overall performance.The PLUS:- Located in the midst of bustling Waikiki Beach. 2 blocks away from the beach. 1.5 block from the International Market. 2 blocks from a super popular Marukame Udon restaurant.- The lobby and its first floor area are very modern & chic. It is decorated with Thai arts and it has many calm and welcoming colors.- The room is clean and chic as well. It has some minimalist feel to it.- Every room has a tablet for you to select multiple services you need such as getting extra towels, have them bring up your car when you get to 2nd floor (garage floor).- They are very prompt when I asked for the car. Average 3-5 minutes wait max after arriving at the garage level (2nd floor), the valet will show up and retrieve the car quickly.- The staffs are friendly and respond quickly.- You can borrow beach mats, towels, & even boogie boards from the lobby for your use. - It includes FREE breakfast with pineapple juice, coffee, fruits, & several selection of pastries, The raspberry toast is the BEST!!!The "Disappointment"- The sink was a joke because it is not deep so you do want to be careful when washing hands or brush teeth because water can splash everywhere. I am hoping they can update the sink because it is not useful much.- Room are "minimalist" meaning it is fairly small and tight. Upon entering the room, most of my traveling companions asked me to check with front desk to see whether larger rooms are available but the larger ones are Penthouse Suites. We decided not to upgrade later since we will be outdoor more often. However, I did overheard front desk receptionist has the exact same conversation/request from other guests on the phone.- OVERALL - The room is great and acceptable. Most issue people might find is with the bathroom. The design of the bathroom is good but the vanity can use some serious upgrade.

This hotel is very central and much cheaper than hotels directly on the beach. The included breakfast and wifi are great too.The bathroom is small but the room is clean and comfortable. We have stayed here twice now, which says something.

The hotel is not suitable for family travel. The room is so small and the breakfast is so poor. The location of the hotel is very good in Waikiki. Maybe the hotel is designed for young people. Valet parking is 25 dollar for each day. And there is additional charge of security fee, which is 100 dollars during our stay,

Stayed here one night pre-cruise in September 2016. Nice location about two blocks away from the beach and close to everything. The hotel itself was very clean and modern with a decent continental breakfast, albeit with limited tables. A personalized tablet was provided in the room with my name on it and some local information; somewhat useless but cool. The room itself was very small and we walked sideways just about everywhere (it was good practice for the cruise cabin). A summary sheet of weekly activities in Waikiki was provided at the reception which was really nice. I actually passed by a week later just to pick up the new summary sheet for the following week. Would probably stay elsewhere next time unless the price was right.

Hotel is conveniently located near Waikiki Beach. Staff are extremely pleasant and helpful. Rooms are small but completely adequate especially for my wife and I who spent very little time in our room. Beds were very comfortable - our best sleep while we were in Hawaii. Minimal road noise as we were on the 14th floor. Wifi was sufficiently fast. The continental breakfast was as expected and appreciated as most hotels that we investigated were not offering any free breakfast. Appreciated the use of complimentary beach towels, umbrellas and mats for our time at the beach. Its expensive to stay in Waikiki - we felt the hotel was very good value and that previous ratings for the hotel are correctly reflected on TripAdvisor.

We had an amazing experience staying here. All staffs are very friendly and helpful. The room is very clean and locaion is really good. We walked to the beach and restaurants. I will stay here again if I come back.

We enjoyed our stay. Staff were very helpful and courteous. Public areas very nice, and it was very helpful to take advantage of the free continental breakfast. Location is a couple of blocks from the beach, so a lot is within walking distance. Bus stop nearby for longer trips within Honolulu. Our guest room was pretty small (more along the European model) but had what we needed.

For anyone looking for an inexpensive room in the middle of Waikiki, Vive is the place. Because it's inexpensive, don't expect many amenities or extras, but what amenities they do provide are awesome. The included breakfast had fresh fruit, bread, and coffee every morning and was delicious. Coffee and tea are available all day. This hotel also offers beach towels, mats and umbrellas free of charge. The lobby is well kept and clean and is a great place to hang out. Our room was well kept and cleaned every day. We had absolutely no complaints at all with our stay. The beach is only two blocks away.I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Waikiki and if I visit again, Vive will be at the top of my list of places to stay.

A hotel I certainly will recommend to friends. The location was good. The place was clean and the rates were reasonable. All the hotel staffs we came acrossed with were very helpful & polite. A definite hotel to book again next time.

The rooms are smaller than average, but they make up for it in comfort. The bed and pillows are comfy, the room always smelled fresh and clean, the toiletries were high quality and staff friendly. Would recommend to future travelers!

Really liked this small boutique hotel, free breakfast was great. Great location! The rooms were very small but who wants to spend time in the room when your in Hawaii!!! Staff were friendly. Thanks for a lovely time!

Like many previous reviewers I agree that the staff is the best thing about the hotel. Without them this would be an average place to stay. Every request I had, from ice to a bottle opener, to a bandaid for a cut finger was met cheerfully and quickly. I wish I could remember the name of the desk clerk who helped me contact and straighten out a foulup by the airport shuttle company when I checked out at 4 AM. Although the cosmopolitan queen room was small, I stayed solo and it was no bother. I could even get a glimpse of the ocean by standing in a corner even though it wasn't an ocean view room. My major complaint is that there was virtually no storage space apart from one shelf over the hanging area, forcing me to live out of my suitcase for 5 days. Free breakfast is a nice amenity but can get boring after a couple of days. No noise problem on 21st floor, mountain view room. There was a comfortable chair to relax in, which is not present in a lot of hotels. Room rate is very reasonable.

This was our third stay at Vive. From the cold pineapple juice and cool, damp cloth on arrival to the included breakfast to the excellent location, we think it is great! We've always gotten a junior suite, but this time we looked into one of the smaller rooms, when the cleaning lady was working inside, and although compact I think it would be perfectly adequate for the two of us next time and would help hold down the cost in expensive Waikiki.

We live on Oahu on the west side of the island and we like to do a stay-cation downtown every once in a while. Great little hotel with great value and close to so many things. Close to some really good food with the beach a stone's toss away. Definitely will be our go to place in Waikiki from now on.

Nice place. Room little tight but no issue. Had all amenities. Would return. Could perhaps upgrade beach chairs to more comfortable. Did not use those provided due to poor quality. Breakfast was simple but hit the spot!

As soon as I entered (through a valet service that is very affordable - cost of self parking) I was greeted warmly, I would describe it to arriving at "home away from home". The continental breakfast was more than enough to get the day started. While air conditioners dripped on our air conditioner, sleep quality was not affected given the comfort of bedding.

Hotel is 5 minute walk from Waikiki at a fraction of the cost of resorts on beach. Great alternative. Rooms / hotel clean and friendly; rooms, though, are small. Continental breakfast included as well as beach equipment. Valet parking available at an additional cost.

Love this place! The decor is lovely and modern, friendly/ kind staff, continental BF with ++ variety, close to beach. Very clean. Exceptional service! The staff treated me with such kindness. I miss them all already!

Enjoyed our brief stay at Hotel Vive. Location was perfect, room was very nice with view of Diamond Head. Of particular note was one employee Erick, and the care he gave us. Appreciated having a bag of fresh fruit and muffins ready for us in our early check-out before breakfast time!

Nice and clean. Some what worn, such as the elevator floors. The breakfast was some what limited in choice and could have been served earlier. The staff was outstanding. Always ready to help or answer a question. Good value for the location. Ocean view from our room was limited by the new high rise hotels built nearer the beach. Not likely I will visit Honolulu again, but if I do, I will stay at the Vive again.

I was very disappointed with the hotel room size. Barely enough room to turn around. No tables at which to eat the abysmally small breakfast selection. Zero protein offered. Staff was very friendly. No place for a cab to pull into. Found Marriott Waikiki much better.
user_name:
russellc539
New York City, New York

review_body: good location, good value, great interior design make this a great pick. Rooms are tiny but I bet that is everywhere in waikiki. morning continental breakfast has lots of fresh fruit and white-flour-carb choices... so if you like that, then you would enjoy this. Parking is pretty convenient. It pays to join their Vive club before reserving a room.

Very close walking distance to Waikiki Beach, shops and restaurants. However, the room was far too small and stuffy, the air conditioner very outdated, noisy and inefficient.We were very uncomfortable during our stay here and wished we had chosen more carefully for our five nights in Waikiki. There appear to have been some cosmetic improvements to the rooms, but these do not go far enough. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The buffet continental breakfast was pleasant and well appreciated.

Wonderful stay! Found this on my own as I have had good success with 'boutique' hotels before and this was no exception. Walking distance (2 blocks) to the beach, shopping, and numerous eating opportunities. Room was clean and the entire hotel well kept and very clean. Staff was very personable, helpful and knowledgeable. One exceptional point was the courtesy room available to those who were leaving the island well after check out. we checked out at noon, but were able to come back and use the courtesy room to take a quick shower at 5 PM before heading to the airport fro an all m\night flight back to he mainland. It was so nice to leave after a great vacation feeling refreshed for a lng flight and not all 'funky'. Highly recommend this hotel!

Great location. Very close to the beach, restaurants and Waikiki tourist areas plus easy access to highways. Cheerful and very friendly hotel staff. Also a good price on car parking with no resort fee.

Staff went above and beyond to make our stay exceptional . We would definitely come back! Room was spacious and very nice.Continental breakfast was good but could have included more choices. Stay over all was excellent!

Hotel in a great location. We enjoyed the daily complimentary breakfast and the helpful staff. Hotel decor was upbeat with plenty of spaces to chill. Two minute walk to Waikiki Beach and four to great shopping.

Really good value for money! Short 2 minute walk to the beach and about 4 minute walk to main shopping center. In the middle of everything. Staff are super friendly. Great that they provide things for the beach such as mats, chairs etc.

The Vive Hotel Waikiki is a modern hotel that is in a great location. However let downs are 1. Limited buffet breakfast menu 2. No gym 3. No pool. Apart from that I would highly recommend vive hotel. The staff are friendly and always helpful!

good location with famous restaurants nearbyeasy breakfastfriendly and kind staffesay check-in and outcomfortable parking but expensivenot good bath tub but good emenitiesvery commnicationable treatment

This boutique hotel has potential, with friendly staff and at a central location. Unfortunately, the room desk and bathroom sink seemed to be infested with ants/termites which kept crawling around. The hotel team said that they would address the issue, but these were still there when I was checking out. I received a box of Godiva chocolates and an apology note on my bed, which was a lovely gesture, however, I would have preferred a room change (I was too busy with work to suggest this and assume that the staff did not bother as no one asked me if it was all ok during my stay). There was noise every night as the hotel is on a main street; either from pedestrians shouting or police stopping people/vehicles; not really what was expected. Hotel check-in, like all other hotels in Waikiki have late check-in. Not catering for early flight arrivals. The reception team said that I should have bought an extra night if I wanted an early check-in...hmmm..great opportunity missed to cross sell when I made my booking?! The hotel charges for bottles of water which are from Hawaii...a real turn-off as water represents gesture of hospitality. Breakfast consisted of either fruit (which was lovely and fresh) or bread, muffins, croissants etc. basic and adequate.

We stayed here on our honeymoon on two separate occasions, at the start and end of our honeymoon. We wanted to explore the island and not base ourselves in Waikiki for the entire trip so needed a nice stop off for our tour and we chose well.We took a lot of time researching all the hotels in Waikiki (my husband would say an excessive amount of time!) but it was worth it! The hotel lobby and the hotel staff are the true highlight of this hotel. The lobby is well stocked with newspapers, books, local information and coffee. It's always clean and even smells sweet! The staff were extremely polite and helpful - and by adding the little touches of a fresh drink and cold towel on checking in, made us feel welcome and genuinely cared for.We knew the hotel lacked some of the obvious amenities of the bigger hotels - such as a bar and a pool. But when you fly half-way across the world to paradise, a hotel pool is not high on our list! And we ate at a different restaurant every night. To sum it up, the Vive offers great value for money in a very expensive city (for us post-Brexit Brits!). And if the pound ever recovers against the dollar and we find ourselves back on Hawaii's beautiful soil again, this hotel WILL be our first stop!

We stayed here for 4 days. I like to make reservations direct and from the beginning received good response. Hotel conveniently located a block from Waikiki beach, clean and bright. It includes a Continental breakfast which was very adequate, with good coffee, fresh fruit etc. Best of all, they provide stuff for the beach, like beach towels, mats, chairs, boogie boards. I do hope people are responsible enough to return these items in good order.

The hotel is located very close to the beach. Our family wanted this convenience, as we enjoy this during our times together. It is also close to diamond head which was another family hike time spent together. Continental breakfast was also a bonus for our group. Thanks!

My partner and I stayed for three nights at Vive Hotel and it was perfect for us.The hotel is a short walk to the beach, about two blocks. The hotel also provides beach towels and possibly beach mats or chairs as well. The complimentary breakfast was incredibly handy as well - the breakfast is a selection of pastries, breads and fruit however that's all we were after. Coffee and tea is also available.The front desk and valet staff were incredibly helpful and friendly.I found the room to be clean and spacious enough - I've read a few reviews on here about the size of the room, but I found it to be fine for my partner and I. However we did not spend a lot of time in the room so this could be why it did not bother me.

I stayed here for 5 nights and enjoyed it! Location is perfect, just a 2 minutes walk and you are at Waikiki Beach. Staff was always very friendly and correct. Rooms are perhaps rather small but very clean and comfortable. The price is great for the location and includes breakfast, which was OK but do not expect a high-end buffet....To summarize, I think this hotel is a very good choice to stay, considering location and price!!

Booked thru Orbitz and I picked one of the cheaper deals. I was a little worried, of course, but I can honestly say that I didn't have any significant complaints about the room or the hotel. Yes, factor in the $25/day + tip for valet parking, but this was always pretty convenient (one day we made it to the garage 10+ minutes after requesting the car and it wasn't there yet). Tablets in the room let you request the car and amenities (like an ironing board and iron). We were on the 17th floor and didn't experience any of the noise issues that I see some others did. The AC wall unit was very good at getting cold wherever the vent was pointed, but not so great at hitting me in bed (so I woke up a little warm at times). Hot water and tea were available 24/7 in the lobby. Staff was friendly and the hotel is just a few short blocks from the water. Highly recommended.

I stayed for two nights. I found a couple of roaches around the TV platform on the desk the second day, and lifted up the TV set, and found several dead bodies of roaches. i reported this issue to the reception, and staff members were responsive to my concerns and asked if they could send people to handle the problem. But I declined cuz I would leave early next morning. A lot of packing we had to do, and my wife and I are not the type of people who bristle at roaches. The reception sent Staff members to clean up the dead bodies of roaches around TV, and delivered their apology cards and a basket of candies to our room in person. As a guy doing research in PR, i have to say Vive Hotel handles the issue in a good manner from the perspective of public relations and customer relationship management. BUT before I went to bed and left the room next morning, I still saw/caught several roaches near desk, carpet, bed (one on the bed) and bathroom, which are the places where roaches commonly can be found. I did decide to book this hotel after seeing the positive reviews on booking site. Seems that almost no one came across such issues. I visited Hawaii many times, and had never saw a single roach in hotel previously. No idea how this happened. Maybe I had bad lucks this time. Hope those roaches do not go home with me.Except the roach issue, this hotel is not bad. Staff members are friendly. Check in and out are good. Location is good. Some people complain about the room size, which is okay in comparison with Tokyo hotels. But i dont like the breakfast very much. too sweet, not good for health.

well informed staff - friendly & happy to discuss local plans / transport options etcreasonable price hotel . Continental breakfast was welcomed and adequate. Clean smart hotel . Rooms a bit small but OK for single or couple - good eating near by and buses at front door.

Small hotel with great staff and decent location but the small rooms are really really small and the beds are cheap. I wouldn't stay here unless you can get a larger room . Save your calories and skip the included breakfast ( the pastry at Kona Coffee up the street is incredible as is their coffee)

Great experience, staff is what made the difference. Very friendly, very accommodating, no eggs at breakfast, but there was fresh fruit and pastries. As well as coffee and tea throughout the day! Staff went above and beyond to accommodate my wife and I with our luggage.

The location of this hotel is very good. It is a few minutes walk to Waikiki Beach. There are so many options for shopping and dining around this area. There is also a bus stop near the entrance of the hotel. The staff are very helpful and friendly. When we check-in, they even offered pineapple juice. Breakfast is included. We loved the breakfast a lot. The hotel also offer free water and coffee 24 hours in the lobby, which is really convenient. Highly recommended!

Really enjoyed the experience at Vive. Great check-in, super close to some great restaurants, beach towels and mats were always available, and an incredible front desk who were always willing to answer questions. Rooms are on the small side so would recommend to stay for couples/solo.

It was clean and a nice location. I didn't like having to pay 25 parking a night, this is usually for a big hotel. The breakfast is not continental as they only had fruits and pastry. We ended up going to get our own breakfast every morning. I like the free wifi that is offered and the boogie is free. Good walking distance to many things and super close to the beach and food locations. Room is very Small

We had a wonderful experience, especially found the location convenient -- the second floor cab service was nice and convenient. Staff were very helpful in assisting us to get to the Pearl Harbor early enough to get a free ticket, and then we could go at our own pace.

We loved our stay at the Vive hotel!! We chose the hotel for its great value for money, location and the fact the room included breakfast, which always helps the holiday budget. Our room was cozy, (we had the smallest queen room), which was fine for us this holiday, because we had planned a busy holiday doing activities. But a touch more space (for ahem all the shopping bags) is probably the only thing I'd change. Otherwise we couldn't fault the service, cleanliness or anything.
