I would not recommend The Vive to my friends who are looking for a more resort style holiday - with a pool, restaurants, beachside etc. But if people are looking for a nice place to stay while they go off exploring for the days, or plan to swim at the beautiful beach (a very short walk away) over a pool, then I'd totally recommend The Vive without hesitation.

This place is a true gem on Waikiki. Located just a block or two off of the strip, it's hard to beat this location. The price was a STEAL - very affordable. The hotel was very clean, the service was top notch, and the staff was very friendly. Highly recommend this place!

Great amenities. Beach towels, and beach equipment. 2 block from the beach. Super affordable compare to other hotels in the area. Clean and Great Breakfast. Blueberry bread to die for. It would be nice to have a toaster instead of toaster oven. Just a thought. Overall great place and super helpful for a single traveler. The staff goes above and beyond. Parking is super affordable one flat fee for the valet. Close to everything!!

Enjoyed our stay here. Vive is very convenient to the Kuhio Beach Park on Waikiki beach. Excellent staff - super friendly and helpful; Chris and Mike at the front desk were extremely friendly and helpful to us during our stay. Also Jordan and Ryan in the garage - very helpful and welcoming. It was refreshing when the staff remembered our names and greeted us warmly when we interacted with them. Also quick to get us anything we needed. We arrived after midnight, but were welcomed on arrival with a chilled glass of pineapple juice and chilled damp towels. After a long flight from the east coast, it was very refreshing and appreciated.The hotel is a great size - certainly qualifies as a "boutique" hotel - small enough to not feel like a number, but large enough to have all the important amenities. Great free breakfast with fresh pastries and a variety of fresh fruit. Free coffee at all hours (always tasted fresh). They don't have an in-house restaurant, but there are dozens close by and you can order food delivered to your room from many of them.The hotel provides free beach chairs, beach towels, boogie boards, bamboo beach mats, floats, etc. While the hotel is not directly on the beach, it is a very short walk to Kuhio Beach park on Waikiki Beach (less than 2 minutes) and shorter to the glitzy shoreline drive with all the high-end shopping, clubs and restaurants. You can save a lot of money by staying at the Vive and still walk over to the Moana Surfrider beach bar for appetizers, cocktails, live music and enjoying the sunset over the water from the beach.The rooms are smallish, but our junior sweet had a king bed and plenty of room, and the tiled, glass-door walk-in shower was enormous. Towels were large, fresh and fluffy, Bathrobes were as good as any I've seen at the Ritz Carlton. Bed was comfortable and linens were high quality. Be sure to ask for a high room with an ocean view.Only a couple of negatives, and they aren't huge - we opted for an ocean-view junior suite. The view was great. But the two window A/C units were loud. I sleep very soundly, but if you are a light sleeper, they might very well wake you up all night long. Secondly, if you are renting a car, keep in mind that the the hotel has no self-parking - valet only - and charges $25/night. That's not outrageous compared to other hotels in the area, but wasn't included in my budgeting. Here's a suggestion: there are several car rental places convenient to the hotel. Rent as-needed and only for the day. Don't pay by the week for your car and have to add $175 week for parking it at night at the hotel. We drove three times to Diamond Head and were turned away each time because there was no available parking. We ended up using Uber to get there instead. When driving to the North Shore, Chase Rentals (one block from Vive) offers convertible Camaros, Corvettes, and Miatas. Rent for the day and don't pay for parking!

Nice hotel, very well located on just a few minutes walking distance to the beach, near to shops, restaurants, bars etc. If you are a fruit fan, you will love the breakfast. The staf is very helpful and friendly. Nice surprise was the complementary 1 hour use of a room after being checked out to fresh up before going to the airport.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Vive Hotel and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the area. We had the family room and the two bathrooms came in very handy. The free WiFi (no limit on devices) and free breakfast was great. Also no resort fee was a bonus.The staff are great and are always happy to assist you.

Loved the location, amenities, price, continental breakfast and beach items for use was just an added perk. Staff was very friendly and attentive. I loved the 12 noon check out time and appreciated the fact that they held out luggage until out 4pm shuttle pick up time while we spent the day touring downtown Honolulu. They even offered us complimentary refreshments while we waited for out ride to the airport. I would absolutely stay here again and recommend the Vive!

The Vive Hotel was outstanding and the staff was exceptional; From the luggage storage during the check in and checkout time, to the offer of the complementary room to change before our travel home, to the morning breakfast - everything was amazing.

We stayed at Vive from Jan 27 to Jan 30 on my birthday vacation.This is a boutique hotel with some smart features.Pros:Each room has a Google nexus tablet which you can use to get room service,look up nearby restaurants or simply check the weather and news.We ran out of towels and soap all the time (since the beach was so close !)and just had to click the tablet and someone would be at the door with them.Internet is complimentary and speeds are real fast.They have complimentary beach mats,umbrellas and towels by the reception which we were delighted to use instead of renting at the beach.Reception staff is super friendly ;helped us with ziplock bags (to keep cash while at the beach) and couple of other things.They recommend great restaurants and help with directions too.Breakfast is a simple continental spread with breads,spreads,cakes,muffins,fresh cut fruits,tea n coffee.I would have preferred some oatmeal/cereal and milk but thats just me.Complimentary cologne towels and cool pineapple drink at check-in was refreshing after a tiring flight.Definitely recommend this place.Cons:They have small compact business user style rooms.Traffic is busy on the street below and we were on the 20th floor but could hear cop cars zipping faintly. AC is a window unit with remote.Need to be savvy with electronics to figure out how to change the thermostat.

By Betty . Jan. 29,2017This was our 3rd. visit to the Vive Hotel and we love it and will return again!.The Vive Hotel in Waikiki is excellent value. It has a great location and includes a continental breakfast.The staff are all outstanding! They are very friendly, helpful and welcoming. We were greeted with a refreshing drink and hot towel when we arrived and given a late check out upon departure.I highly recommend this hotel.

Hands down the best boutique hotel in Waikiki. Amazing staff, great art work in the lobby and lots of freebies - breakfast, 24 hours tea and coffee, wifi and complimentary room to freshen up, if you have a late flight. Truly a pleasant experience. Considering how expensive Waikiki can get, this hotel offers the best value for your money.

Nice to have a bathtub, as some motels don't have them. Very nice morning brunch. Very helpful and nice staff. Very attractive reservation area and morning brunch area. I'd stay there again. We stayed here during our visit to Pearl Harbor and other touring around town. We could walk right to Waikiki beach. Even though we were close to busy traffic, we didn't seem to hear the noise.

Probably best to book backside room as it might be quieter . Very good location .Staff was excellent .It is an older Hotel but renovated. The rooms are small and not a lot of room for an extended stay.

We spent a few nights at Vive Hotel. It's a boutique hotel just a short walk from Waikiki Beach. The front desk & concierge staff could not have done enough to help guests. Their restaurant recommendations were perfect. They made reservations for restaurants and transportation. The hotel provides beach chairs, towels, mats, tubes & floats. The main lobby & garden are beautiful. Our room was a bit small with really no storage other than a closet. A few small shelves for clothing. The bathroom was remodelled, the painted tub was peeling & the toilet roll holder loose so the paper kept falling down! Otherwise the room was nice with a comfortable bed and air conditioning. We were on the 12th floor. You could hear traffic & sirens, so you were aware you're in city! Would I stay here again? In a minute!

Hotel in a great location for Waikiki. Staff very friendly but room is so small as to be difficult to even enter and bathroom so small that it is difficult to function in. Room not being made up after being gone all.day was unacceptable and nothing was done about it - only excuse when I called was that it is a "boutique hotel". Don't even know what that means but guess I'm not a fan.

I stayed here while attending a conference at the Hawaii Convention Center. It was a 24 minute pleasant walk to the center, but the bus also stopped right next to the hotel. The beach was literally a 3 minute walk down the block, and all of the Waikiki shopping and dining options were close by. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and adequate, though the air conditioner was loud and opening the windows just resulted in traffic and city noise instead. Continental breakfast consisted of various small pastries and toast and nice fruit including delicious pineapple and papaya

great location, great staff always VERY helpful especially when making bookings for us, free beach towels and mats useful, were able to book in early after a long flight, breakfast being included was great value,
user_name:
Darren James C
Bvrleigh Waters, Queensland

review_body: I stayed at the VIVE. It's a boutique hotel. I had no idea what that meant when I reserved the room!. Apparently an old apartment building was completely gutted and renovated into this awesome hotel. It's eclectic and different. They cater to your needs and treat you like royalty. I had a few issues in my room they were taken care of. I had a few ants and a roach. They called maintenance and he came right up and sprayed. I wish they had real blankets. The duvet covers inside filling was not real effective and kind of sloppy. The refrigerators aren't designed to keep food at a real frig temperature. I've never heard of that before but I had bought milk and it was barely cold. Even with all I have said I would stay there again in a minute. The fruit breakfast was fabulous, the views were beyond fabulous, they had boogie boards, chairs and towels and mats at the front desk that you just bring bag when you are done. They had coffee and tea in the lobby at all times. The room I was in had a shower that was the size of my bathroom at home. I loved it!! Water was hot and the water pressure was great. They do have window units. They seemed new and clean but you might need to help them out by keeping your blinds closed when you are out. My room faced the sun and was high up on the 20th floor so that might have been part of it. By the way they had two sets of blinds in my room. The front one to was just for shade and the other for room darkening..

Excellent value and location. No beach surcharge, complimentary breakfast, and free WiFi. Three blocks from beach. Warm greeting on arrival after long flight. Offered us pineapple juice and a warm wash cloth. A nice touch for this boutique hotel.

Good location, small room, but service excellent. Breakfast a little light on, but adequate.Plenty of close by eating places.Staff extremely helpful and always willing to give tips and head you in the right direction.Would recommend.

Nice hotel three blocks from beach. Eat at jinroku. Fresh fruit for breakfast was great. Friendly employees. Room a bit in small side. Ants in sink in room- 3.8 stars rounded up to 4. Beds were very comfortable.

While we only booked one night, we were treated as tho we were frequent long term guests. From check in when we were given a free room upgrade, to restaurant advice, booking shuttles, complimentary luggage storage after checkout, the staff was great. Definitely recommended!

We stayed a week at the Vive....excellent value and staff especially Sato were excellent....Nothing was too difficult or a hassle for any staff....Breakfast was great. Thanks for making our stay a memorable one...

My friend recently spent 10 days at the Vive. We did a lot of research beforehand and found good ratings for the Vive. We also liked that the Vive did not charge a resort fee and had complimentary breakfast. The hotel is right in the pulse and beat of the city and within walking distance of the beach, zoo and shopping. Our room was on the 19th floor and we had views of the ocean. I booked the room using my AARP membership which books through Expedia. I thought I booked a room with 2 queens and we got a room with a bed that seemed to us like a full size. We could have been upgraded for a small nightly fee for 5 of the 10 days but we chose to stay where we were. Be careful if you book on AARP because I swore I booked 2 queens. That was the only glitch in our vacation. The breakfast is fruit and pastry which was always good. The breakfast lady was so attentive to everyone and worked very hard to keep up with all the coffee drinkers. She always had a smile on her face. Then there is KC. What a gem ....very knowledgeable and helpful in booking our excursions. I miss everyone at the Vive already. I would highly recommend the Vive and would stay here again in a heartbeat.

We stayed at the Vive from January 9th through January 19th, 2017. When we walked through the doors we were met with warm smiles, a glass of pineapple juice, and a refreshing, scented face cloth to freshen up after a long day of traveling. Check in was a breeze and in no time we were in our room. We stayed on the 19th floor. The rooms were a little small but had everything we needed. They were very clean and the mattresses were very comfortable. Every morning a nice breakfast was provided which included fresh fruits and pastries. A special thank you to the friendly lady that took care of making sure the breakfast area was stocked, coffee was always available, and everything was cleaned to perfection.A special thank you to KC as well who went above and beyond to help us plan our excursions, transportation and anything else we asked. We were given excellent advice and had a great time on each of them. Overall, we had an excellent stay at the Vive and I can't say enough about the friendly staff. I would definitely stay again.

Stayed with young kids for 6 days and then overnight 1 week later in the family room. Hotel was in a good location close to central Waikiki and beach. Rooms were small but adequateUse of common lounge with microwave etc.. was great for young kids. Staff were excellent. Only lacked access to a pool.

A very nice hotel with the best location. The complimentary breakfast is great and the "living room" area with free coffee was a favorite spot. The hotel is located two minutes from the greatest parts of Waikiki beach. Overall, we strongly recommend this lovely hotel.

We absolutely loved our stay at Vive and would highly recommend it to anyone! You will not regret choosing Vive. We were a little unsure since we booked blindly online but read reviews & they were all positive. Now we know why!

We knew the room would be small but we did not care one bit. After a one hour ride from the airport, the pineapple juice and cool towel were a great welcome-especailly having flown from the east coast. The staff at check in was absolutely fantastic and since we joined the loyalty club, we were upgraded to an ocean view room. The next morning, the valet was right on the spot to get us a 5am cab to Diamond Head. The breakfast was great and my wife went back for seconds on the pastries. For one night or two, you absolutely can't beat this hotel. With a great staff, great location, and no resort fees-this was an awesome find.

Very welcoming and friendly. The cool towel and pineapple juice at check in was a great touch. The whole Hotel seemed clean and tidy. Our room, although slightly smaller than expected, was comfortable and clean. Bathroom was adequate. Small fridge in room that was really only a cooler and no coffee making facility (had to go down to lobby to get free coffee supplied). Overall, we were happy with our hotel experience and would definitely consider staying at Vive again.

Was not allowed to check in when I arrived 30 minutes before check in time; at the same time not given late check out although I asked only for one hour given my flight departure time. Bad attitude of the desk staff generally. Was told that there is no vog in Oahu which is evidently false and was important to me to get some information given that I am asthmatic.

Hotel is nice as the location is good and very convenient at Waikiki，room is very neat and very clean and the people are always helpful and friendly to guests. I would recommend it to others for sure.

GOOD, price is reasonable.Although the room is quite small, it was good to stay.Waikiki beach is very close. The breakfast is simple but tastes nice.Staffs are warm and try to help guests. Thank you again.

Very handy location, close to beach and amenities but away from noise and crowds. The staff are very friendly and always willing to help. 24 hour tea, coffee and chilled water facilities were a nice extra and the cool pineapple juice on arrival was amazing! They loaned us beach chairs, towels and mats to enjoy the beach! Good value for money!!!

Get an ocean view and a high floor; it is well worth the money. Bed was comfortable. The room we had on 19th floor was small; you would not want an extra cot brought in, but very clean and modern. Complimentary breakfast was a real treat, although no hot food. . Complimentary use of beach towels and straw mats was unexpected. The distance from the beach was SO handy. Less than 5 minutes walk. No self parking; valet only.

The Vive Waikiki is a small boutique hotel a few blocks from the Ocean. it is within walking distance to the shops & restaurants in Waikiki. A huge plus is that they serve a continental breakfast. The decor is very modern. The room is a bit smaller than I anticipated but fit my needs.

Vive Hotel is a couple blocks off Waikiki. It is very conveniently located near the Duke statue. The hotel room we had was small. It included a tablet for our use while we were here. They offer breakfast from 7-9am. It consists of several kinds of fruit, a variety of breads and rolls and coffee or juice. They have a concierge until 2pm daily and the front desk is staffed around the clock. They have towels and mats for you to take to the beach. There are 119 rooms in total.

Very nice and modern hotel, very well located and with very friendly staff. We got a 19th floor room (ok with that) but it looked like it was design for Lilliputian people. Everything so small that even when we enter with our SUV at the parking lot, we had to enter a 2 mph because we thought we were gonna hit the roof of the entrance. The bathroom is minimal and the entire room is just...mini. For 200 US a day we expected more. It was crowded our entire stay (3 nights) and that bother a little. The breakfast was ok, but lacked protein (ham, cheese, eggs, etc)Apart from that the style is great and original, the staff is very nice and the location is perfect.

The location of this hotel is the obvious selling point - just a 2 minute stroll to the beach. The hotel itself is great - modern and well maintained. Although the rooms are small they are sufficient - you shouldn't be in your room much with all there is to do! Very clean, friendly and helpful staff and a great lobby area to hang out in.

Amazing location - just back from the Duke statue. Surf shop on the way so easy to pick up and drop off boards each day. Free use of beach equipment which is fantastic. Complimentary breakfast includes fresh fruit and some pastries (not overly substantial - don't expect bacon and eggs!) 24hr tea/coffee/water filter is tops!

Nice property, friendly staff, continental breakfast food fresh and well presented. Room and bed are very comfortable..not large but we are not near Waikiki for the room..loved the location..a block off the busy main drag. Easy stroll to the beach. We enjoyed our stay.

Nice room cozy not big but not too small. Location is amazing walking distance to the beach and shopping centers. Staff were nice and accommodating. Would definetly stay here again for next year trip.

This hotel is small, the AC is noisy, and from more than one window the view is less than spectacular. But the rooms are clean and nice, the decor is simple and elegant and beyond all else it is staffed by happy, helpful, young people.

Everything you could want. Location, price, free breakfast, nice rooms. Not an "island" feel but walk a block to get to the beach for all the Hawaiiana you could ask for. It's a smaller boutique hotel. I will definitely stay here again and recommend it.

Love Vive. Even though the room is small, my daughter and I enjoy the facility for the cleanliness, great staff, location, and pretty good breakfast. We didn't stay too much in the room anyways, so the size of the room is not really a big deal for us.

Parking garage was manned by friendly personnel but it was a tight space overall and very difficult to maneuver in. There is no pool. The free complimentary breakfast was great. Staff was courteous and always helpful. Outside city noise, especially the trash trucks and buses began early. Location was excellent. Very close to many restaurants, shopping and the beach. Driving in Honolulu is difficult to say the least.
user_name:
Wes C
The Woodlands, Texas, United States

review_body: Arrived at 9.30am very tired after an early flight. Was greeted casually with a 'hey' from some young guy at reception.....so first impression wasn't great. The consolation being we were able to check in early.We stayed for one night in a Cosmopolitan Queen, described as cosy....to us, small.The bed was too soft for our liking, the AC was not only noisy but had a horrible damp smell, and even from the 18th floor we were woken by traffic noise. All factors did not contribute to a good night sleep at all!Breakfast was a basic selection of sweet and savoury pastries and fresh fruit. Other lazy hotel guests left their dirty dishes around the foyer so it made it difficult to find a clean place to sit and eat. Tea, coffee, and water was available 24/7.Location was handy to public transport on Kuhio Ave and a short walk down Uluniu Ave gets you to Kalakaua Ave, opposite Duke Kahanamoku statue.Sato at reception was more professional than the other young guy we encountered.Unfortunately when you don't get good quality sleep it affects your mood when you're trying to enjoy your holiday.On that basis we're not likely to stay here again.

This hotel was a great value for the money. The staff were all super friendly and helpful. The rooms are on the small size, but it's just cozy, and too bad there's no balcony in the room (although after walking around on the floor, we found that there is a balcony looking to the east). The in-room tablet for hotel services was pretty cool. Would have been nice if there were an iron & ironing board in each room, but it wasn't a big deal. We were on the 19th floor and it was quiet enough at night, though the pillows were a little bit uncomfortable. The breakfast was simple but good - bread/toast, coffee/tea/pineapple juice, pastries, muffins, and fruit. Enough variety throughout the week to keep it interesting. Enjoyed listening to the chill music while eating breakfast. Very relaxing. The location was great, and it was super convenient having the beach gear available. Would recommend/stay here again!

The small room was in very poor condition- multiple stains on desk, discoloration of tub and toilet handle, a lot of chipped paint. Every time hot water was run in the sink there was a loud and never-ending shrieking sound. The window AC unit was extremely loud. We've never experienced a room that was so badly taken care of. Continental breakfast was good. Providing yogurt would have been helpful. The staff were very accommodating. Beach towels, mats and chairs are provided.

The hotel common area and guest suites are modern and must have been recently renovated (based on our January 2017 visit) however the finishes are not overly high end. The Vive hotel guest suites are smaller then I'm used to but functioned fine. The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpfull. The hotel was one of the only hotels in its price range to offer a contenental breakfast which was enjoyable and typically included an array of fruit, breads, pastries and tea/coffee however it didn't provide any proteins.

The place was excellent. Blocks to everything and the price was great!! I highly recommend this hotel. Loved the lobby and the way it looked very inviting! The staff was great and very helpful. Awesome

As Honolulu was the last stop of a month long trip in the States we chose not to stay in an expensive hotel on the beach which we're up to double the Vive in price. The Vive had modern up to date rooms with everything we needed. We had a family room with two adjoining rooms and two bathrooms which was brilliant. The down side is no balconies or pool but if you are planning on spending time on the beach it is only one street away. The staff were super helpful and friendly and I would definitely stay again.

My wife and I stayed more than a week and were not disappointed. The location is fabulous. The hotel foyer is quite pleasant and the free all-day coffee and tea bar was very well received by us. We had the included breakfast one morning but it is very basic and decided not to bother again - lots of pastry items. The fruit was fine. We stayed on the 18th floor I think in room 1808 on a corner looking out to Diamond Head at one window and the beach the other. We had a junior suite, ocean view room. The room is small, yes, but covers the basics, and is clean. The bed was comfortable. The view from our window was amazing. On New Year's Eve we had the most incredible view of the fireworks - directly out our window in the ocean was the pontoon with the fireworks and our view was like front row in a theatre! We couldn't believe it. The staff were very friendly at all times and helpful.

This is definitely not a resort. If you are look for a good price for a room close to the water this is the place.I found body hair on new towels. Not just one but two towels. The hair dryer did not work. Floor had sand all over. Sheets felt like sheets used at a motel.

Great hotel, very close to the beach. Cold towels and juice on arrival was welcome. Rooms are modern and suitable size for 2 people.The staff are so friendly and can not do enough for you. KC is a great concierge.Breakfast is fruit and toast and there is coffee and tea 24/7. Complimentary beack towels and mats are available.The only downside is the aircon is noisy.Would stay here again

Very well located (one block from Waikiki Beach and the Statue of the Duke), close to everything, with very comfortable rooms (not fancy, though, but very comfortable and clean). If you reserve it right, I'll have a nice ocean view. If not, you will still face the mountains. Could you ask for more? They also offer beach towels, mats and boards. Fully Wi-Fi covered property (free) and also features parking (valet only, and paid, though). Also, they have a very nice and tropical breakfast everyday, from 7-9h30. They also have cold and hot water filter and coffee available all day at the lobby. You will be greeted with cold wet towels and pinnaple juice, just to get you in the Aloha mood. And I can't finish without complimenting the crew. All of them, always, so nice, polite, helpful. You WILL NOT go wrong! Thank me in morning...!

This is a excellent centrally located boutique hotel in Waikiki. The desk staff and concierge are very friendly and helpful, and the lobby has an excellent library if you want some bedtime reading. The rooms are small but modern and comfortable, although the quality of the mattress and linens could have been slightly better.

The hotel is close to everything. The rooms are comfortable and very different than what I expected. It is definitely a boutique hotel. The free breakfasts offered many options to choose from and were quite delicious. Free coffee and tea 24/7 too. The staff was very friendly and the amenities offered were a very nice touch. I will stay at the Vive on future trips to Hawaii.

Close to beach (two blocks as I remember) and musubi restaurant (across the street)! Offering beach towels, chairs and boards, that was quite convenient! Will be my first choice for the next time visiting!

Just 1 block off the chaos of the strip, Vive was convenient walking distance. Rooms are represented accurately on their site. Great Value. Bonus amenities in offering beach towels and mats was super convenient. Representative at concierge counter helpful and friendly

Efficient and professional staff. Clean rooms. Warm, friendly and comfortable surrounds (lobby & dining). Access to beach accessories extremely helpful. Breakfast was very pleasant and plentiful. Lots of Towels in our room and bathrobes were provided. Parking was no trouble albeit a little expensive. We really enjoyed our experience at the Vive, Waikiki

The staff were all very welcoming and friendly. They offer free towel/beach Matt/chair service as the beach is a two min walk. Although not beach front is is VERY close by. We were offered fresh towels and drinks upon arrival just what I needed after feeling very sick. They do free breaky and although limited in variety it's complimentary after all and does be job esp if we're on the run in the morning. They have hot water for tea and coffee downstairs and books to read also. We got upgraded to a beach view room but if you had to pay extra for it I would stick with standard as the windows were tiny anyhow. Small room but does the job for a couple.

Great place to stay. Although room was a little small, it was all we needed. Rooms were modern and clean. Staff went out of their way to help you. Good location, just 2 blocks to the beach and within walking distance to several eating establishments and attractions. Staff was very helpful in suggesting things to do and see. Went out of their way to make sure our stay was enjoyable. Left us a nice card and chocolate for our anniversary. Concierge service was excellent. KC was very helpful and went out of her way to make sure issues with one of our trips was resolved. Great help. If we go back, we will definitely be staying here.

The hotel is well located just a few blocks from Waikiki beach and it's shopping and restaurants. Continental breakfast is just pastries breads and cut fruit. If you need more there are plenty of options nearbyTip. Was travelling with family and we were in 1801 1802 and 1803. 1801 and 1803 were larger than 1802 but 1803 was the best with windows on 2 sidesTwo quirks. First only 2 elevators for 21 floors so can be a wait. Second the winds were really high answer the windows were drafty so the blinds would blow in the winds and you could feel a breeze getting through

Pleasant hotel in good location. Rooms a bit small, but stylish. Rooms need a little maintenance, but not in too bad shape. Loved the complimentary pineapple juice and cold towel upon check in and the staff was incredibly pleasant and efficient.

From start to finish, this hotel MADE our vacation. We were within two blocks of the beach, directly north of the Duke Kahanamoku statue, so PRIME location. The complimentary breakfast is a life saver, as having to eat out three meals a day can drain the wallet in Waikiki. Though you can tell the building is a little bit older, the management/ownership has done a fantastic job of modernizing and renovating every single room, with detail and thought put into the decour and amenities. The staff were all very professional and more than willing to help. I want to personally thank Preston for going above and beyond, offering suggestions and helping us find things to do. He is definitely an asset to any team that he works on, and he helped make our vacation a great one! We will be seeing the good people of Vive Waikiki again next time!!

Stayed at the Vive Hotel during a brief trip to Honolulu in September. It is a great location just a couple of block from the beachfront and handy for many of the typical tourist amenities including restaurants and shops.The hotel was modern and clean. The front of house staff were helpful and the access to a complementary room before leaving for my evening flight after checking out at lunchtime was really useful. My particular room was a little small but this wasn't an issue as I was travelling alone. The breakfast was continental style but entirely adequate. I would consider staying here again.

This hotel is exceptional. Wonderful accommodating staff, beautiful decor and fantastic experience overall. We arrived early from a long flight and staff straight away organised a room for us to go into for a super comfortable sleep. The hotel was in close proximity to the beach, shopping and eateries. I loved the decor with touches of Balinese mixed with contemporary, comfortable furniture.

cons : room is much smaller than expected. too loud airconditioner sound. very hard to ventilate. drinking watet provided in the room is not free. breakfast is unsatisfactory(only fruits and bread) pros : location good, staffs are nice, lobby is good.

Small room but had all need to have. Great friendly staff. Great breakfast. N only two blcks from Waikiki beach. They have towels, mats, parasols, boards, n all. Will definitely b staying here nxt time. Great stay made our vacation!

Great stay. Excellent staff. We thought the location was ideal and the service was excellent. The family rooms are adjoining and great but note there is no door between them. Breakfast amenities need refresh but food nice.
user_name:
Michael H
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: We stayed here for two nights after a cruise. The location was excellent for being so close to Waikiki beach and shopping district, without having the associated high cost.We found it was best to book online directly, rather than a travel website. Even better, sign up for their emails and you'll get a link to an even lower price. Bonus!We had a room with a queen and, as reviews have shown, they are small. However, the king beds were only available in suites and were a lot more, and we didn't think it was worth that higher price. Would be nice to have the option of a king bed in a regular room at just a little more than the queen.The hotel is on one of the main streets, so you will get traffic noise. Also, it's a window air conditioner so that adds to the noise. However, we were able to sleep so that was fine. The bed was comfortable.The service we received from Preston was excellent. He was professional, funny, and friendly. He accommodated us for an early check in without any extra charges. We really appreciated that.The continental breakfast was set out beautifully and had a better variety than most. Keeping in mind it was only continental, which really is coffee and pastries, it certainly fit the bill. However, don't expect the range of some others - with eggs, oatmeal, yogurt, etc - as that's not the case here.Most of the people staying at the hotel were far younger than us, but we enjoyed that. The whole place had a young vibe ... except the music, which was mostly from the 70s. Fits the surfer crowd, I guess ;)I would definitely stay here again.

Amazing location! Steps from the beach and great places to shop and eat. All the staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. NO "resort fee" & Free WiFi that worked well enough to do what I needed to do. Free breakfast is OK, but not the biggest selection. Good for a snack to hold you over until lunch. The good thing is that the free coffee, tea and water is available all day in case you need some refreshments.I would definitely stay here again!

I arrived early after a very long flight from Australia and was worried I'd have to wait until late afternoon before I could crash. Preston Vidad, the guest services agent at the front desk not only checked me in, he upgraded me to a room with a gorgeous view of the beach at Waikiki. My husband and I stayed at VIVE in May and received similarly gracious service. A perfect place to stay for easy access to the beach, comfy rooms and great service.

room is tiny small, noisy outside and airconditioner, poor breakfast, however customer service is goodno pool, no entertaining facility. no coupon. wifi is free and no resort fee goodin short, it is not good for a couple trip

I would recommend vive hotel for an amazing experience in Hawaii. The hotel is extremely clean and the different services offered at the hotel are extremely convenient such a best towels and gear. The best part of the stay was the friendly and very helpful staff! We will definitely return. It was a great deal ! I felt like I was at a 4 star hotel! Location is great- only thing is limited parking nearby. Will have to stay at garage if no street parking is available.

The hotel's location and staff were awesome. Nice free breakfast and free rent service for beach items. They also prepared Godiva chocolates for our visit. If i go to Hawaii later, I will choose here again.Thanks for your kind service.

I have stayed here before and I enjoyed both my stays. Very cute hotel, the staff are lovely. They greeted me with fresh, yummy pineapple juice and everyone was so friendly. They allowed me to check in as soon as I arrived which I sincerely appreciated after flying from Sydney overnight so it was really nice to settle in and decompress after such a long, uncomfortable flight. Nice breakfast of fruits, croissants, muffins, toast, juice and coffee. The rooms now come with tablets with your name on it that you can use during your stay which is pretty cool and unique. Waikiki beach and supermarkets are a very short walking distance away.

We stayed here for ten days and it was an excellent experience. The staff were friendly, the hotel rooms were neat and catered to our every needs. The wifi was also excellent. Would definitely stay here again :)

We had a great time. Rooms were fantastic. Continental breakfast included, coffee and tea available 24hrs for free. Staff couldn't have been more helpful, and always so friendly and welcoming. Will certainly be back again.

Had an excellent time at Vive while in town for the Honolulu marathon. Staff were helpful at checkin and then throughout stay. Room was a good size (we upgraded to junior suite) and within easy walk to the beach and all amenities. Breakfast was included and provided decent coffee and plenty of local fruit.

First thing's first the hotel has a Zen'y type of vibe to it and tries to have a cool and chill type of atmosphere.The staff including housekeeping, reception and especially valet are absolutely awesome. The only exception is one gentleman from reception whom we complained to about an issue in our room and every subsequent encounter had been unpleasant he had a very clear air of "I don't care to him."The room: claustrophobic, I've stayed in a cruise cabin that used a smaller space better. Really that's where the issues start. We were kindly upgraded to an oceanview closet from our original city view closet upon checkin that was awesome. What wasn't awesome was to find tiny ants in our toothbrushes, in the closet and around our bed the next morning (no, we did not bring anything to the room). The unhelpful gentleman (see above) didn't really care and offered for our room to get sprayed with an insecticide, my wife can be exposed to any harsh chemicals. After much arguing he agreed to move us to another room. The other room was a downgrade from what we had and required us to walk through what I coined the walk of death, essentially an open air corridor with a railing on the 19th floor. It would have been cool to walk past but not when you have heavy suitcases and are carrying things. I spotted an ant in this room as well but not as many. Also the noise from the street was brutal even on the 11th floor. - The fridge is weak - a note is inside it saying that it's not suitable for perishables- the bathroom looked tired, evidence of leaks was present and the bath tub paint was peelingThe plus side is that they had nexus tablets in the rooms which you could use.Location - not bad, 5 minute walk to international marketplace, 8 to the Royal HawaiianValet - staff are amazing, $25 is lower than other places in the area, didn't want to bother looking for street parking Breakfast - A sugary nightmare, a medley of baked goods and fruit, all that will spike your glycemic index. This would have been perfect if I was a teen but in my early thirties I can't afford to eat that for breakfast. We ate breakfast elsewhere on multiple occasions. The coffee was fantastic though - Kona Coffee.Other cool aspects - beach towels, boogie boards and beach mats are available for free.Bottom Line: Would I stay here again? That's a firm no for me. Should you stay here? If you are on a really tight budget and want a descent hotel, and are not claustrophobic or scared of heights (for some rooms) and are not afraid of breakfast foods that are pure sugar or care to eat elsewhere I'd say yes. I've stayed at worse but better rated places with a higher star ranking.

I booked The Vive Hotel based on the recommendations of other trip advisors. Thank you because everything I took on board was true and helpful. A lot would make comment on the small rooms, well all I can say is what would you want a big room to do ? The small room was totally fine, we organised our room to store our suitcase outta the way we had no problem of the size at all. The location of this place is perfect, it is central to everything you need and we were here for 10 days and did not once feel we needed a car. The staff are very helpful & friendly. The breakfast is free, and after 10 days you could get sick of the same thing however I packed a microwave dish & brought some eggs to make scrambled on toast & brought an avocado and mixed it up myself. If your a light sleeper then the Air Con may annoy you, but you get use to it, and it was really good being able to have it on all night. this place is great value for money as coming from New Zealand the accommodation can be pricey because of the dollar but this place was all we needed and we had a very pleasant stay. Made a great choice.

My wife and I stayed here for 6-days in December. Just 2-blocks from Waikiki beach it seemed to offer good value at a busy time of year. We up-graded to the junior suite (which was well worth the few extra $$$). Room was a nice size with a separate walk-in closet and a view of the beach. Shower was as big as many hotel rooms I have stayed in!Staff were friendly and super-helpful. Breakfast was also good with plenty of local fruit and coffee. If you are using public transport to get around (Pearl Harbour, etc) then there is a bus stop just outside the hotel which made things easy.

I was upgraded to an ocean view upon checkin. Everything was very clean, staff were friendly and helpful. I stayed on the 20th floor so I didn't hear much street noise. Breakfast daily was only fruit, toast and pastries.

Awesome location with convenient transfer bus. There are lots of stores outside which is good to me. Bus transfer is easy since there is bus station just nearby. This is a good choice when visiting Hawaii again.

I arrived from flights from Canberra at 7.28am. Check in is at 3pm. I was dreading being up all day and just wanting sleep and a shower. The lovely man at reception got me a room, also offered my the complimentary breakfast. I was so relieved. They also gave me a cool towel and pineapple juice, which I needed.The building (as in hallways) is a bit dated, but clean. My room is spacious and clean and came with air con, hair dryer, safe, fridge, desk, King Bed, bathrobes and hanging space.The complimentary breakfast is aimed at Americans for sure. A lot of sweet items and only savoury is the toast. But still toast and coffee in the morning is a nice touch.There was free wi-fi.The location is great, it took me maybe 3 minutes to walk to famous Waikiki beach and close to all tourist areas.Also to mention that reception helped me with local transport and even changed some of my larger notes.The customer service is what makes this hotel. I am VERY impressed.

This is a pleasant and well priced hotel a few minutes walk from the beach.Breakfast is basic but tasty, the Wifi works and the staff are very helpful. The rooms are a little on the small side for the US but that's hardly a deal breaker considering how nice everything else is.

We really enjoyed our stay at Vive hotel. It suited our needs perfectly. The room was cleaned every time we requested and on time, the breakfast was perfect for our requirements and the hotel was in a great location allowing us to get to the beach within 3min (100meters) and close to shopping, restaurants etc. Staff were friendly and nothing was ever to much to ask for. You can borrow towels, body boards etc for the beach if you require them.I notice there are a few negatively worded reviews about the size of the room. The hotel offer a number of sized rooms, we stayed in a hotel sized room but we knew what we were getting. There are pictures online and basic research allows you to know this information before you book. In my opinion you get great value for money and we will definitely stay here again next time we come to Hawaii. Mahalo!

Just 3 minutes up the road from the "Duke" at Waikiki. This Chic Boutique Hotel is ideally placed for the 1st ,2nd or 17th timer to Honolulu.The rooms are "compact" but fine for two average sized occupants.Bed was good,air conditioner OK and to my wifes delight you could open the window and get fresh air (as she prefers).The desk staff were helpful every time we asked for advice or directions(which in our case was often)A special mention to the Concierge who assisted with booking several tours and in particular a last minute choice to go to Pearl Harbour . The 75th Anniversary was the following week so we enjoyed the added bonus of several very good Military Brass Bands over from the Mainland performing all the patriotic favourites..Would return to Vive if or when I should return to Honolulu.

My wife and I spent 2 nights at Vive Hotel Waikiki and loved our stay. The room was small, but had all we needed, and the price and location were great. Access to beach gear a plus, and the breakfast was better than expected.

Rated top 10 Waikiki hotels according to Tripadviser, but that is NOT accurate.. decent, clean budget hotel is about it..Nice lobby, good customer service, continental breakfast and free wi-fi.. rooms small, minimal, inadequate Air conditioner, below par housekeeping service..

Very friendly and obliging staff. Good location, quick breakfast with fruit, cereal, juice, coffee and pastry. Room is small but it is all we needed. Beach mats provided. Room cleaned thoroughly every day.

The good news is that this hotel is centrally located. The lobby is inviting and decorated very chic. The breakfast was adequate. The rooms are semi clean and bed are comfortable. The price is right. The staff is friendly and accommodating. We recommend that if you are going to rent a car do it through the hotel concierge. We called about 5 locations to rent a car and the hotel was the cheapest and easiest way to go. Now the bad. The rooms are very, very small. They only have queen size beds bcs they can't fit a king in the room. The room has sliding doors bcs there is no way you can open a door in the room. We were upgraded to an ocean view. But the view has all the roof tops from all the hotels that is in front. Not the ocean view you would expect. Get the picture? We stayed here bcs we were not going to be in the room much and did not want to spend money on a room we were not going to enjoy. Having said that I would not recommend this hotel if you are more than 2 person, have a lot of luggage, or staying more than 2 days. If you are a minimalist then this is the place for you.

Decent hotel but room was the sizeof a closet.ok for one person not not more than that. The staff was really nice and helpful, location is great 5 min. To the beach and it has a decent complimentary breakfast.

Excellent service (great breakfast, bread, coffee, fruits) location, but quiet small size room. But it didnt bother us much though, you won't stay at the hotel all day long. You will have so many things to do in HAWAII. :)
user_name:
Myung Julie K
Los Angeles, California

review_body: Good value, friendly staff, Ideal location for beach and transport. Only thing I missed was not having a kettle in my room. (love my cuppa). But having to go down stairs for a cuppa I was able to relax in sitting area . So there was an upside to that.. Thank you to all welcoming and cleaning staff.

Stayed here over Thanksgiving. Short walk to the beach and shopping center. Complimentary breakfast is a plus. More importantly, it actually tasted really good. I will definitely recommend and stay at Vive again!

Outstanding experience. The Staff, rooms and location were perfect for a little getaway. Some change-up on the morning breakfast fare would be nice but overall, A+. A little jazz band/wine hour in the evenings would pep up the Check In area...

My wife and I were planning our trip to Hawaii and searching for accommodations in Honolulu. We had never been there before and had no idea what to expect. We wanted something within walking distance of Waikiki and shopping. We were also looking for something with a continental breakfast. We chose Vive because it offered the things we were looking for at a reasonable price. We were very happy with our experience and would definitely stay there again.

Vibe hotel is a good hotel overall.The location, the price and the friendlyness of the staff were all good.Once you visit Hawaii again, you will stay at the Vibe Hotel.It was very good during the old period.

Stayed here for four nights. The hotel is two blocks from the beach. We were provided fresh pineapple juice as a welcome drink. Front desk staff courteous and warm. Valet parking (within the hotel building) was $25/ night, unlimited ins and outs. No extra resort fee.We booked a standard room. Great view of mountains behind and the view of ocean(not much) from side window. Rooms were kept neat and tidy. The hotel is well maintained so did not notice any wear and tear of furniture. There was a tablet and a mini refrigerator in the room. Breakfast is served from 7AM to 9:30AM and includes bread, pastries, muffins, fresh fruits, coffee, tea and juice. The lounge is beautifully furnished. A microwave and toaster oven are available for use 24hrs. Free coffee, tea and water are also available all day long. A computer is reserved for guests. We used it to take printout(free) of our air ticket. Beach mats, beach towels can be picked up from front desk. The rooms are quite small and so are the bathrooms but place comes at a price in Waikiki and this place is definitely value for money. Thoroughly enjoyed the stay. Definitely recommended.

No resort fee and with free breakfast. A great place to stay, very close to Waikiki beach. Very helpful staff. Good wifi connections. Elevator is fast. Very nice hotel to stay. I'll stay in this hotel again.The only con is the room is small, but it really doesn't matter coz we only use the room to sleep, we are always outside. And the AC is loud, the good thing is we used ear plugs.

The staff is very efficient,. My wife and I enjoyed the continental breakfast each morning, The fruits were fresh. The staff was very warm and welcoming. Sato at the front desk gave us some great info about the island and various restaurants. My wife and I enjoyed every minute spent at The Vive Hotel. We felt at home.Because of our experience we plan to re-visit

This hotel is on the same level as the hotels which are 3x or 4x more expensive. Everything is clean and modern, the location is phenomenal, and the staff is extremely helpful and will make your stay perfect.

The hotel room we had was small but was exactly what we needed. The continental breakfast with fresh pineapple juice in the morning was great after our early morning walks. Coffee and water is always available which was greatly appreciated.It's in a great location, just 2 blocks off of Waikiki so you can leave the hustle and bustle behind but be easily close to it.The service at the hotel was fantastic, they helped us many times and was very friendly which we treasured. Thank you Vive for making our time in Waikiki great!Would highly recommend staying here!

The hotel is very convinience, close to the beach only 2 minutes walk. The hotel and room are clean and cosy, the staff are very friendly. Love this hotel, will definitely book again when return to Hawaii.

We stayed for one night at the end of our Hawaii trip. The staff are extremely helpful, and were able to assist with many things as it was out last day there so needed to get a few things sorted e.g. luggage weight, transfers to airport, room to freshen up after we had checked out. The rooms themselves have everything you'll need. They are reasonably sized, and the beds are comfortable. They include a tablet in each room with which you can book room service, check out local stuff etc. Which I thought was a nice touch, and something I hadn't seen in so called 'fancier hotels'. If you're staying a few days in Waikiki and not too fussed about being directly on the beach (not a big deal, honestly) then we could definitely recommend.

The staff at Vive Hotel were so amazing. Every staff member we encountered during our 2 day/night stay were so friendly and helpful. It was so refreshing upon arrival to be greeted with fresh pineapple juice and cold face towels after a very exhausting journey to Oahu. Despite arriving at 7.30am, they still let us have breakfast and prioritized the cleaning of our room with housekeeping so we could get into it asap. Breakfast was ok, continental with delicious fresh fruit each day. The hotel also supplies complimentary tea/coffee all day long!Location: The location was fantastic. Although this hotel is not located directly on the beach, it is only approx 2-3 blocks back to the main centre. There was a bus stop right outside the hotel that takes you to Ala Moana shopping centre, Honolulu and Pearl harbour. Rooms: We stayed in the entry level room category, was snug for two people but we didn't come to Waikiki to stay in our room! Each room has a tablet (iPad) in it so you can use internet and even log into your netflix account from it. Was great to have access to this to check google maps, weather, etc.Tip: Join their loyalty program to get a discount on rooms - My personal vive, for discounted room rates and complimentary room upgrade.The staff and the location really make this hotel fantastic, and we definitely recommend. If you're looking for a slightly "cheaper" hotel, a block or two away from the beach, and looking to avoid daily resort fees then this is perfect!

This is a fabulous establishment, what makes it value for money is the location and staff who ensure your stay is perfect from the time you check in to check out. The hotel is clean and has everything you need for your stay in Waikiki...it is not overpriced like some of the other hotels in the area. Absolutely loved this place.

This hotel satisfied me over my expectations! Fantastic staff: young, kind, professional, helpful; always available in giving any infos I needed. Room: It was big, comfy, cozy, silent (except the sound of the ocean!!) with a very comfortable bed. I loved staying here. There's also a tablet you can use for connecting to the concierge. Location: one-minute walk from the beaches and whatever you need, but in a quiet area. And the mornings are colored by a breakfast (included in the room rate) full of fresh fruits (pineapple, watermelon, cantaloupe, strawberries..) Plus pure pineapple juice, muffins, pastries, honey, coffee, tea, water (these three last ones available 24hrs). Wifi ok everywhere. Beach gear complimentary. Shuttle to airport very convenient. Good price for value. I would definetely advising this hotel to everyone!
user_name:
AntoStar
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed for six nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. The rooms aren't enormous (but they're not tiny either) and the bathrooms are ever so slightly cramped, however the interiors are clean and modern. You barely get any street noise and it's a safe and pleasant area. The location is really excellent and you're only a couple of minutes walk from Waikiki beach, shops, food etc. Because the hotel is placed about mid-way on the main strip, it's super easy to walk to a lot of places including Diamond Head, plus there are bus and trolley stops nearby.However the best part about this hotel is the service. I like smaller hotels where you don't have to queue up behind 50 people to get a towel or ask a question; they just seem more personable and the Vive was no different. All the front desk staff were super friendly and helpful. I arrived in the city on an early flight and got to the hotel about 7.40am, well ahead of check in time and fully expected to leave my luggage and head out for a couple of hours. However the lovely Preston sorted me out for an early check in, which was very much appreciated.I travelled to Honolulu solo and found this a really great well priced hotel. Would absolutely recommend it to anyone visiting the city.

We would stay here again. Staff was very helpful, great location and room was nice. Easy walk to shopping, beach, food and bus if needed. If you're looking for a large room, this isn't for you. It was perfect for us. Thank you! We will be back!

Good little hotel and well located in Waikiki. Staff are extremely accommodating. Breakfast is somewhat limited. More important is the courtesy room offered, as complimentary, as we had an extremely late departure from Honolulu. First hotel I have been in worldwide that offers such.

This is quite a basic hotel but for the price it's really great value. Only a 5 min walk to the Duke statue it's really in the heart of it all for a fraction of the price.The room and bathroom were really small and quite noisy. We travel with earplugs so it wasn't too much of an issue for us but the room we had was on the main road. There was a complimentary breakfast in the morning but unless you like sweet muffins, cakes, pastries it's not that great. The fruit was good though and so was grabbing a takeaway tea to hit the road. I would prefer tea facilities in the room though. Staff were lovely. Really friendly and welcoming, even when we came in late at night or leaving early in the morning. Would definitely recommend if you're looking for something simple but walking distance from everywhere.

Great hotel. Friendly staff. Rooms small, bath room extremely small. Noisy AC. Otherwise clean room. Great location, short walk to the beach, and various shops and restaurants around. Poor breakfast, just some fruits, coffea/tea and sweeten bread, not my taste.

Good location an easy two block walk to the beach. Continental style breakfast included and friendly front desk service including a reasonably priced shuttle service to Waikele Outlet Stores. Room serviced daily. Bed comfortable.

Highlight of our trip. Great staff, great location, cool and modern interior, comfy bed, great shower, loved the tablet in the rooms. Staff also held our baggage while we visited a neighbour island AND followed up when we were back home in NZ about the NZ earthquake - what a lovely touch.

Stayed here for a week at the beginning of November. Our flight from NZ arrived at 06:30 so we were delighted to be greeted with cold towels and pineapple juice by the super courteous receptionist Preston. He booked us into our room, gave us a weekly info sheet, explained how, what, where and when and said our room was ready and we could join them for breakfast ! All the staff at Vive are wonderful, so helpful and efficient. Yes , the aircon unit is noisy (ceiling fans would be good) and maybe the rooms are 'snug' but there was always hot water, maid service.Lovely to be so close to the beach, great that you had beach towels, boogie boards and chairs on request.Pastries, toast and mountains of fresh fruit for breakfast, tea and coffee available all day.It is the location, price and the genuine quality of the service that would bring you back. The absolute icing on the cake would be more information about airport transfer .On our arrival we felt we had little choice except to take a taxi (expensive) but on our return journey we booked an airport shuttle bus ( half the cost ) available via reception or Nexus tablet.

Offered good value for money by being a block back from the beach. The staff at all levels were excellent and most helpful. It made the stay very pleasant. They even supply free towels and mats for the beach

We found this hotel based on the recommendations listed on trip advisor and can only agree with the majority~ This is a well priced hotel for the location and ease to Waikiki Beach. The rooms are clean and well proportioned! We stayed in a family suite with two double beds and two sep bathrooms and toilets. They are well appointed and met all of our needs. Breakfast was included and the hotel has a nice Vibe. The staff are very friendly, especially Preston and Emily. Both were helpful and i suspect they're not trained to be nice; they are simply nice people! I struggle to see how you could rate this hotel poorly!

The Vive Hotel provided the best customer service experience I've had in a long time at any hotel I've stay at and I've stayed at many. There was not one thing that they didn't try to help you out with. We used the Valet Parking service frequently. You didn't have to wait long for your vehicle at all. At the end of every day when we returned, they nicely greeted us and asked us how our day went. Took any dirty beach towels or chairs from us so when didn't have to turn them in ourselves. Breakfast was simple, but good. My husband particular liked the tablets in each room which you can use to request additional services at a fingers touch. The response of the staff was very prompt to any requests we made. Location is great. Short walking distance to beach and many restaurants. The rooms are a bit small, but the hotel makes up for it through their exceptional service. They truly epitomized the phrase "going above and beyond" and the price you cant beat. Thank you for an amazing stay during our vacation!

Just 2 blocks from Waikiki beach this hotel is well placed to go everywhere. Staff were brilliant - bright & cheerful, nothing was too much bother. Decor & furniture all very nice.As soon as you book in they are there with a refreshing drink & cold towel, lovely!The rooms are in dire need of a revamp/refurb. The aircon was so noisy we had to turn it off during the night, so it was very hot. Decor in the room wasn't good, so even though the room was clean it looked shabby. Room was very small & bathroom was minute, not much room at all. The shower over the bath was useless, but did the job - just!The hotel gives a free light buffet breakfast that is replenished frequently.There is free tea & coffee in reception 24/7 but no tea/coffee making facilities in the room.I would recommend the hotel to anyone on a budget who want to be near the main areas as well as the beach.

Location and cleanliness were great, everything else was pretty average. We were charged for the water bottles in our room after it had not been used. We did appreciate the option to use the beach towels and mats, that was also great.

Had a wonderful stay at Vive. A pleasant find in Waikki. Good location and close walk to the beach and many activities. The bus stops very close to the hotel which provides an excellent transportation option for the city. Rooms were well maintained, clean and comfortable.

We arrived early at Vive and they managed to get us into a room, had expected to store luggage and have to wait until 3pm for check in. Friendly cheerful obliging staff. Coffee available all day in the lounge is good. Nice fresh fruit for breakfast, along with toast and pastries perfectly adequate. The rooms are not particularly big but clean and air conditioned . It's well located for the beach and eating out. Would recommend
user_name:
Beth A
Palmerston North, New Zealand

review_body: Great location. A fantastic lounge area to hang out in and coffee / tea / cold water available 24 hrs. The room was small but comfortable, only 2 blocks from the beach and we were picked up across the road for the activities we wanted to do. Definitely recommend for the star rating.

The rooms are pretty small but the location is fantastic, staff are great, can't beat the pineapple juice and scented towels on check-in either. The breakfast options were also great, overall had a great stay and would definitely stay here again.

Great location price and staff would highly recommend if you are looking for a break from the busy hotels with lots of noise then this is the place for you staff are amazing and literally a two minute walk to the beach

It was a nice stay for the price. The room was small but the bed was confortable and the shower clean. The service is good and organized. You can use a tablet of the hotel at your room to request services.

Good location and close walk to the beach and many activities. The hotel offers two bedroom options was is uncommon for the area and was a must for our visit. The bus stops very close to the hotel which provides an excellent transportation option for the city.

The location, staff, ameneties of the hotel were all excellcent. However, I had a really hard time sleeping in the guest room, as my bed was around 40cms from the bathroom. The hotel had a really distinct smell, it had a old smell. I had to turn on the box aircon constantly. The room was abit crabby for me. The photos were misleading, I looked at the photos and thought this is nice and then next minute, it was not the same. Everything else in hotel is good besides the guest room.

Stylish hotel in a convenient location but the room was pretty cramped even for just two people. The hotel does offer beach supplies like mats, chairs, boogie boards and towels. Valet parking is just $25 for the whole stay with in/out privileges.

Vive Hotel has an excellent and knowledgable staff that are ready and able to help you with whatever needs arise. Only two blocks from Waikiki beach and a short walk from the Honolulu Coffee Co. (best coffee in Hawaii!). Rooms are very small and there's no pool, but when you're in Waikiki, why would you want to stay in your room and swim in a pool when you're so close to the warm Pacific waters? We would gladly return.

If you are looking for a place to stay where everything is made easy for you, than Vive is the right place to checking in. Confortable beds, clean rooms, plenty of amenities, breakfast included and free coffe, tea and water all day long. The hotel also provide you with all you need for the beach. The staff is the very best I met so far, and I travel a lot. Five minutes walking from the beach.

Excellent location, hotel was just a few steps from bus stop, two blocks from Waikiki beach and shopping area, close to everything. The staff was very nice and helpful. Overall perfect hotel to stay in Honolulu.Breakfast was nothing to remember, as it offers only fruits and bread. However, fruits were delicious and bread ok.

We stayed at the Vive Hotel because of the location (just a couple of blocks walk to the heart of the beach) and competitive price.The room wasn't big, but it was comfortable. The continental breakfast was quite good, but got a bit boring after a few days.The staff were very helpful, and did provide access to things like umbrellas, when asked for.One small inconvenience - ice was not directly accessible by us - we had to order it to be delivered to our room (no charge) or pick it up in the lobby.We used Speedi Shuttle to get back and forth to the airport (round trip about $28 USD / person).We did a lot of walking about the area, but also used the public bus to visit Pearl Harbour and Hanauma Bay Nature Preserve.We ate in a few restaurants in the area, but particularly enjoyed The Cheesecake Factory.The best activity we did was take a Polynesian Cultural Center tour (Ali'i Luau Package). It was rather expensive, but worth it.

I was a lone traveller but felt very comfortable and welcome at this quirky boutique hotel. Very handy to the main strip but a block away from the noise and crowds. The rooms were small but very clean and modern. I had a great view of Diamond Head with a good sized desk and comfy desk chair for me to spend my time (when not out running, shopping or at the beach) studying and checking mail etc. I felt very much at home. The staff get to know you by name and always say hello as you pass through the foyer. Breaky and bar area was a lovely sanctuary and again, very comfortable and intimate - even when full with people it was quite and very relaxing. Well done Vive, highly recommended from me!

Centrally located, very smart clean boutique style. Well priced for amenities. Free Wi-Fi , breakie and beach towels. Helpful friendly staff. Comfortable bed and pillows. Speedy lifts and a a huge shower.

The staff were very helpful and friendly. We had to extend our reservation last minute and they made it possible. Wonderful location, two blocks from the beach and the International Market Place. The rooms are small but it's perfect for resting after a long day exploring.

This hotel is amazing. The room we had was small, but that is perfect for travelers like ourselves; we don't carry much luggage. The room was lovely and we could see the ocean and Waikiki. The valets were always helpful and friendly, we didn't have to look for a parking spot and they got our car for us very early in the morning. The breakfast was perfect and the selection has vast.
user_name:
Susan K
Los Alamos, New Mexico

review_body: The staff was very friendly and helpful, always greeted as soon as we walked through the door. There was always refreshments available at every hour and the concierge was very helpful. The housekeepers did an outstanding job! The location of the hotel was great, centrally located allowing easy access to the vehicle/bike rental, beaches, restaurants, zoo and shopping areas. Beach towels, umbrellas and equipment were readily available for all guests at the front desk. All tours arrangements were picked up at the hotel or locally. Although the rooms and service were very good, the rooms were quite small and did not have drawer space for storing clothes.

The location is only 2 blocks from the beach park on Waikiki. It is within easy walking distance of great shopping and eating. The staff couldn't be nicer. The valet parking is less than at other near by hotels. The beds are great. The only thing to point out is the rooms are small. That was not an issue with me at all. This is definitely going to be my destination to stay when I return. The housekeeping staff is very efficient. The lobby is very relaxing. The breakfast is a continental breakfast, but very well done with at least one roll with meat or cheese.

The staff certainly go the extra mile to make your stay memorable. Helpful informative staff and those little touches like beach towels, beach chairs, umbrellas for those Hawaiian showers and anything else to help! Rooms slightly on the small side but space is a premium in Waikiki.The beach and shop are both literally on the doorstep and there is a good choice of eating places to suit any budget. Lots of walks and so much to see!

We have stayed here a few times and every time it seems to get better. The service is exceptional, staff very helpful the location is great. We generally stay in a suite because we like a bit more room and we find this place has some nice rooms with good views. With the reopening of the International Marketplace this motel is well located just around the corner, close enough to take advantage of the shopping and the new restaurants. The motel also provides beach equipment and the staff are in hand to provide suggestions for things to do. Good value.

Great service, great location but small rooms. The A/C can be a bit loud and disturbing. Rooms in direction of Kuhio Ave can also be a bit loud. Breakfast is simple but good. There is always fresh fruit. Coffee and tea is available all day

Awesome atmosphere and helpful staff. No resort fee was a plus and complimentary breakfast. The lobby was very comfortable being that we had to wait a bit for our evening flight. We were offered use of a room to rest and shower before our flight also. I was relieved that we didn't have to book an extra night when we were leaving at 8pm. My complaint would be that it is near a busy street and traffic and sirens awoke me. Also breakfast was not conventional it was more like finger foods.

Hotel is located at a great location with reasonable pricing. Staff was very helpful and plenty of amenities included with the stay: beach towels, mats, breakfast, lounge area. Valet parking was also at a reasonable price compared to other hotels

Our stay was 7 days. Staff at the Vive were very helpful with any assistance that you needed. Our room was ocean view, a little small but it was very clean with fresh linen every day. Location was 5 minute walk to the beach, bus stop, very easy to get around. I would recommend with no problem at all. Wi-Fi was great & breakfast also included. They do need extra dining tables as most of the tables where coffee tables & lounges but it was OK. Didn't like the coffee but I always take my own instant coffee anyway. Great for a budget hotel.

We stayed here for a few nights recently and were happy with our stay. The hotel is well kept and very modern with clean rooms, although they seem to be on the small side, particularly the bathroom, but we did book one of the cheaper rooms. The provided breakfast was great, fresh fruit, toast and varying pastries and muffins, was nice not to have to think about where to eat for a change. Staff were very friendly and the juice and warm towel at check in were a nice touch. Hotel was good value for money, 2 blocks (short walk) from the beach and had good wifi. I was expecting a balcony but it seems the hotel didn't have any. The reception staff got us on a tour at the last minute which was good value compared to others.

The hotel is just off the beach and quite at night. The breakfast service is continental type and is included with your stay, and delicious, but the same each day so don't expect variety. You can get coffee any time of the day or night. We booked our excursions right at the hotel which was nice. Nice Korean BBQ restaurant just across the street and resonable too. P.S. my wife is Korean!

This hotel is great - especially for the price! We stayed in a larger well known resort when we first arrived in Waikiki and then Vive for our final night and it completely beat it hands down in terms of service, cleanliness, and amenities. It's so close to the beach and offers lots of special little extras to make your stay as comfortable as possible. The staff are really friendly and helpful and go out of their way to make your stay as comfortable as possible.

This hotel had great reviews and was one of the most affordable in the area. It is only a few blocks (easy short walk) from the beach. They have towels and things you can check out on your way too! Parking is by valet only and is not cheap, but we didn't have a car for the two nights we were there. The Jr Suite with King Size Bed was excellent. Had great views of ocean and Diamond Head crater. The bathroom was large - the shower was gigantic - the room itself was very big with the bed area, a tv/entertainment area, and a desk/work area as well as a walk in closet. The staff were super friendly and nice. There were no surprise hidden resort fees. Bed was very comfy. The provided breakfast was the only thing that was just okay - not a "real" breakfast, but enough to hold you over to lunch if you're not looking for a full breakfast menu. I would definitely stay here again in Waikiki. It doesn't have a pool, but who needs one when you're right by the beautiful ocean. I love the location - right in the middle of everything in Waikiki - easy to walk wherever you want to go.

We needed a place to stay for one night in Waikiki and came across this hotel on expedia. Room was TINY. By TINY like you barely turn around in the bathroom. Staff was awesome, location was great. Breakfast was fruit and toast so that was kind of a bummer. Overall it was a nice hotel.

My wife, her brother and I stayed for 9 nights.The good: the room was clean, and housekeeping did a great job of keeping it that way. The hotel is very close to everything including the beach. The staff were friendly and helpful.The bad: the air conditioning unit was noisy and was blowing directly into bed. The parking was 25$ a night and it was extremely hard to find other parking near hotel.The ugly: the worst part was the breakfast. There was only one type of jam and it didnt change the entire time we were there. Only a few types of fruit and they also never changed. No egg at all. No variety. It almost feels like the hotel is trying its best for you not to eat there.Overall? Not worth it.

My Wife and I stayed at the Vive in both September & October during our trip for our wedding Anniversary and in one word our stays were Awesome!!!!!Fantastic location, fantastic staff, fantastic rooms!!!! This was our first time to Hawaii and could not have asked for a better stay, so close to Waikiki beach, the main strip, shops and restaurants including the super delicious Me's BBQ right across the street.If you e planning a trip to Honolulu don't second guess a stay at the Vive, you won't be disappointed the staff are so friendly and accomodating to their guests needs and the housekeeping staff are fantastic and super friendly. We stayed in one of the Jnr Suites for the extra room and bathroom space it's worth the extra dollars.

This is a great boutique hotel, two blocks from Waikiki beach front. My sister recommended this place because her firm does the hotel books that are in every room. We traveled with our 13 month old, and it was still spacious enough for the 3 of us. They set up a pack n play (I would bring a set of crib sheets, so the baby has a familiar scent), and you can put it in the open closet area, which is right around the corner from the main room, so the baby doesn't get distracted by the TV etc. The bathrooms are very nice, and shower is very spacious.
