Our stay at Vive Hotel Waikiki was simply amazing. At Check-in we got refreshments and even a free upgrade to a suite! The staff is very very friendly and helps you whenever needed. Waikiki beach is just down the block so its just a 2 minute walk. Overall I can really recommend this Hotel!

Rooms were adequate; comfortable and clean. The location was great, just two blocks to the beach and restaurants, and the staff was exceptional. They had towels, boards, etc available for use for free. We would definitely stay here again.

We stayed at metropolitan queen. Some highlights that make me want to stay again: very friendly and helpful staff, comfortable room size, clean(room service is great as well), continental breakfast, stable wifi, great location( walk to Waikiki beach and shopping center) , free beach supplies, walking distance to Honolulu zoo where I can park for 1 dollar per hour(overnight parking is allowed).

We had a very good stay at the hotel. Staff was friendly and helpful. Location was good and it was within our budget. It's very close to the beach, it was nice to know that hotel provided beach towels, chairs and other beach gares. We will defiantly stay again and Recomend to our family and friends.

We were happy in our stay with Vive Hotel and very comfortable. The room was nice and the service. We had no problems at all and we were a block away from the beach.The hotel was very close to everyhing we neeed. We will come bavk again.

We recently stayed at Vive hotel in Waikiki. This hotel is situated about 2 blocks from the famous beach. Staying at a boutique hotel is a very different experience from a larger chain. This hotel does not offer the usual pool/spa etc but does give you something unique. Entering the hotel your welcomed with a cold towel to refresh and a nice cold juice, they know you by name and I even got a belated happy birthday from the reception team (my birthday was the week before) so clearly they take the time to get to know their patrons. Reception enters a funky sitting area with a constant supply of tea/coffee and cold water available for guests. Staying at the hotel included continental breakfast which is great. Your room has a tablet to link you in with hotel amenities and local points of interest. You can access beach gear to borrow and there is a concierge to help you make the most of your stay. There is also a bus stop a few steps from the hotel. However ask the concierge about using the bus system, we took the bus to the outlet stores and it took forever (nearly 2 hours)..... A shuttle bus is the best option for this shopping experience. The only down side for me was the size of our room. I accept we booked the cheapest so I was not expecting a penthouse, but compared to other hotels we stayed at along the strip the room we had was small, there was no balcony which also made it a little claustrophobic, the bathroom was well appointed but also very tiny. For us it was not a huge downer as we were out exploring most of the time but for those of you who like a little rest or downtime opt for a larger room with some more space. Overall this is a modern exciting hotel which will give the bigger chains a run for their money.

Our visit to Oahu was a relaxed, enjoyable time, made so by expert advice from the Vive Hotel staff led by the Concierge K.C. and the front desk staff. We found the room cleaners and the lady at the breakfast bar to be similarly helpful and friendly. These are attributes you expect in a quality hotel, but don't always find. Congratulations, Vive Hotel Waikiki!

Just had a very nice week at Vive Hotel in Waikiki. Booked a Junior Suite which was a corner location and on the 15th floor. Very comfortable bed (pillows a bit big) and large bathroom that also doubled as a disabled shower. Large screen TV in the living area, a writing desk and a separate closet all added to the feeling of space. Very attentive front desk staff made us welcome each time we arrived back from our activities and Kasi on the Tour Desk was very knowledgeable. Continental breakfast was fine as was the all-day/night coffee station. Would have liked to have tea and coffee making facilities in the room so we didn't have to trek downstairs every time we wanted a coffee.Location was a plus as you walked out the front door, crossed the street and 2 short blocks later you were at The Dukes Statue on Waikiki Beach. Walking distance to the newly opened International Market (take plenty of money) and of course a visit to the Cheesecake Factory is a must. Best way to get around is The Bus and for $2.50 you can travel almost around the Island. A visit to the Outlet Stores at Waikele is also a must and you can go broke saving money on all the bargains you can pick up. Coach Store was an eye opener and my wife managed to spend a very long time in there. (as well as spend a lot of cash..lol)On the whole, a very nice boutique style hotel in the centre of all the action with few detractions (aircon in the window a bit noisy) but would definitely stay here again.

This hotel was lovely. Its staff very freindly & helpful and it was perfectly located to get to the beach & trolley stops. The breakfast was fine but it could have done changing every other day just so it wasn't boring. Highly recommended.

We live in Hawaii and enjoy "staycationing" every few months in Waikiki. Vive Hotel was one we've been meaning to check out for a while, and while we liked many things, we are not likely to return.Things we liked:- Great service at the front desk- Spacious lobby with complimentary coffee and tea, all day long- Located on Kuhio Ave, which is just a short walk to the beach, International Market Place and all the other buzzy parts of WaikikiThings we didn't like:- Kuhio Ave is a pretty busy street and if you have a room fronting it, you will hear a lot of street noise. We had a very poor night of sleep.- We booked an ocean-view junior suite. I would barely consider it a partial ocean-view as there were mostly buildings blocking the ocean.Unfortunately, the cons outweigh the pros and we will likely not return.

Small but clean and cozy room. Good air-conditioning, TV, wi-fi, amenities like continental breakfast, complimentary use of beach towels, chairs, boogie boards, and very friendly staff. Great location about two small blocks from the beach. Great steakhouse next door (Hy's). Affordable.

Perfect location, very close to the beach and shopping. Excellent lounge facilities, clean rooms. Staff is incredibly helpful and friendly, they had great recommendations on where to eat and how to get there. Highly recommend this place and would love to stay with them again!

Great value for money. Only two blocks to beach. Quiet. Friendly and helpful staff. No pool, but complimentary towels, chairs, boogie boards. Good, relaxed brekky included in price. On The Bus route. Recommended!
user_name:
Chris H
Sawtell, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: Location was excellent. Lounge facilities were very good. The use of microwave was most useful.Breakfast was good except one day no fruit.. Reply we are awaiting delivery.! Beach mats and towels provided. Rooms clean and bed comfortable.

Very curteous staff room was very nicely cleaned each day and location was fabulous close to shops bus just outside and Waikiki beach just a 3min walk away well done guys highly recommended Cheers Chung and veroinica from Australia

great hotel, great staff, perfect location. Room was very clean with TVand aircon, it was very close to the beach.Staff were very helpful and professional. I would definatley recommend this place or visit again
user_name:
Chris P
Colwyn Bay, United Kingdom

review_body: My wife and I spent 3 nights at the Vive Hotel. We found the hotel to be a great alternative to the much more expensive hotels just blocks away. We were on the 21 st floor and had a corner unit. The room was clean, stylish and quiet. We had a peek-a-boo view of Diamond Head and the beach at Waikiki. The newly renovated International Marketplace, shops on Kalakaua Boulevard and the beach were just minutes away. The hotel is also situated right next to a bus stop which used for day trips to Ala Moana centre and the Honolulu Museum of Art.The hotel provides beach towels, boogie boards and mats for use at the beach. We also enjoyed the daily continental breakfast provided free of of charge daily.Staff was very professional and helpful and the hotel provided us with a late checkout and use of a guest room to freshen up before our late trip to the airport to return home.Our room had a party sized shower, a large TV and all the comforts you would expect.I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a less expensive alternative to the big beach hotels.

While the rooms are relatively small, who wants to spend time in a room while in Hawaii? Rooms are certainly okay and very clean. Staff is fantastic. Free breakfast is okay but plenty of nearby restaurants if you want a full breakfast. Location is perfect for access to beach, stores, restaurants etc. Very good value for the price.

Delicious continental breakfast including lots of fruits to choose from. Nice clean rooms. Very friendly and helpful staff. Great location, close to beach, restaurants etc. Help yourself to coffee facilities and cold water facilities which were set up in the lovely lounge area.

This small boutique hotel is situated in the heart of Waikiki, offers a great value and has a very cool lobby vibe. The amenities are great - free wifi, free continental breakfast (pastries, fresh fruit), free coffee and tea station 24/7, and free use of beach equipment (boogie boards, towels, mats, etc). The only downside are the sleeping rooms. They aren't fancy or very large so if having a plush room is important to you, this may not be your place. But if you are like me and don't intend to spend alot of time in your room, then this is a great place. The staff are really helpful and have great recommendations for hitting the local spots nearby. This is a hidden little gem!

Great staff and the free breakfast was awesome! The hotel rooms were at a great price and modern appearance made the stay very comfortable. They offered a shuttle service to and from the airport which was handy!

Staff were wonderful - we were very impressed with our service from all front desk staff, the concierge KC, and the valet driver. We stayed at a few different places on our holiday but Vive Hotel staff provided the best service by far.Rooms were small but adequate. Free breakfast was better than we'd expected and we appreciated the free 24 hour coffee and tea facilities. Vive Hotel is a short walk (couple hundred metres) to Waikiki beach and we could borrow towels/chairs/boogie boards at no cost. We saved hundreds of $ staying here compared to one of the front resorts, but the location was essentially just as good. In the mornings we did notice a "plumbing-type" noise/rattle (possible a hot water system kicking in?) but this was brief and it worked well as an alarm clock for us anyway, so we weren't inconvenienced. We would stay here again if we were to return to Waikiki.
user_name:
Kendra K
Port Lincoln, South Australia, Australia

review_body: It was great! Staffs were helpful and location was very good. Also, check in and check out service was very fast so we could manage our flight time. Even breakfast was delicious haha :) I strongly recommend this hotel !

Everything was nice will come back. I give it all good for everything that I needed very nice staff. It was close to the Zoo,Beach, sports bar and food. Anyone who may stay at your hotel will enjoy there stay.

Nicely located for a visitor to Waikiki. Staff could not be faulted. Professional and amiable. They all have vast knowledge of Honolulu, in fact all of Hawaii and are only too happy to pass this on to their guests.

Stayed here for 8 nights with my boyfriend We really enjoyed our stay here The staff were helpful and friendly The rooms were abit small but still very Morden and lovely. The bed was really comfortable. It has a small noisy air con which worked perfect... Maybe bring ear plugs if your not used to the noises.They provided a complementary breaky but it's just bread and muffins tea and coffee which was good but it's not what you want everyday... Maybe you guys can add some cereal to that list. And maybe add some tags saying what the food is.. As I heard someone had a banana muffin which he ate and he is allergic too... Need to fix that up...The hotel give you beach towels, chairs matts boogie Boards to use at the beach. The room had a mini fridge in there Wished this place had a pool aswell But overall we really enjoyed our stay Don't bother about an ocean view the hotel is blocked by a big building in front so you can only see a tiny bit of the water. And maybe ask for a room not facing the road as it was very noisy felt like the window was open but wasn't, really thin.Thank you the vive hotel.

Staying at Vive was a very pleasant experience. The staff were very helpful & when we asked for a bigger room ( we were staying for 3 nights) they accommodated us without any problems. Absolutely recommend this.

Vive is great at being a limited service hotel. Very clean, modern, and friendly. A great value at these low price points. Rooms are on the smaller size, but is exactly all you need. Not quite unique enough to be compared to other boutique hotels, but would definitely return and recommend. Think more Ikea and less Kimpton. Wifi was very fast, breakfast was more than enough (standard continental), and rooms are very clean. One of my only complaints: no staff elevators. Almost every time I was taking the elevator, I had to wait for valet/housekeepers to board elevator and take it one floor above/below. Very annoying in my opinion but worth the low room rates.

We had a great time at the Vive. From check in to our reluctant check out it was an enjoyable stay. A good location, although not on the beach. It still just a short walk away and even better it avoids all the large crowds on the main drag of Kalakaua Ave. We've made the Vive our go to hotel for our staycations on Oahu.

Stayed here for a couple of nights and used it only as a place to get our head down. It is well placed a few blocks up from the beachfront and has a main road at the front door. The staff are friendly and will do anything for you and the breakfast is good although no cooked items. We had a room facing the street which was quite noisy (as was the air con) but it was clean, tidy with all requirements fulfilled. I particularly liked the tablet facility in the room for concierge, information and room service etc.

We arrived in the middle of the night after a long flight from germany an had a very warm welcome with excellent service and a delicoius fruit punch, fresh coffe an water were available free all the time, the bed was good, the air condition worked well, and the service was fast (needed a new hairdryer, had a problem with the sink). We woukld stay at the VIVE again at aour next visit at Honolulu

Like many others we chose this hotel based on the reviews and the price. We definitely weren't disappointed. The staff is fantastic and always willing to help, I rank them above most other hotels we have stayed at. It is a close walk to the beach and right by a bus stop. If we ever have the opportunity to come back we will definitely stay here. Also, they do not charge a resort fee and they serve a continental breakfast with really good coffee. Our room was nice and had great views.

This is a wonderful boutique hotel in the Heart of Waikiki. The staff was warm, kind and incredibly supportive. The room was amazing! They really put a lot of effort into making the place vibe in a contemporary, designer feel. The room we had was spacious and luxurious and an absolute pleasure to be in. It is only a few steps to the beach and the new International Market Place, which is the future of high end Waikiki is only a block away, which meant we had some of the best food and shopping you can imagine after spending the day in the surf or checking out the many other attractions!

We chose this hotel based on excellent reviews on TripAdvisor, the position to Waikiki Beach, the services provided, the standard of the room and the cost.We were not disappointed!We had requested a quite room on a higher level and that's what we got. Our room 2107 was positioned high on the south side with views towards the mountains and east to the ocean. We even had our very own little entry balcony on approach to the room.It seems the hotel staff enjoy their work. They always acknowledged us when we walked in or out of the lobby. They assisted us with every request with a smile.Complimentary breakfast in the relaxed lounge area was fresh and sufficient to start the day. Coffee, tea and chilled water available all day.I would definitely recommend this hotel to people who want to enjoy the surrounds of Waikiki and are not looking for resort style with larger rooms. We felt our room was just right for a couple.Thank you for our no problem relaxing stay.

Stayed here prior to doing a cruise to Australia. Staff are excellent in every area. We were checked in at 0700 after a long flight into Hawaii. Staff were fantastic in getting us into our room early noting the long flight. Breakfast provided and room ready immediately. Door staff "Ty" went out of his way to assist us during our stay. This is a boutique hotel that is central to all amenities and provides everything you could want for whilst in Hawaii. A short 2 min walk to the beach yet far enough away from the hustle and bustle. A great place to relax and enjoy everything that Waikiki has to offer. We are already planning our return visit.

Chose this boutique hotel based on reviews on this site plus trying to save a few dollars in an expensive area. I have used boutique hotels before and I am usually quite happy with them. In this case I had a significant issue with the size of the room and particularly the bathroom. For one person it is probably OK but for two people it was just not satisfactory. As the old joke goes I felt like I had to step outside to change my mind. Cleanliness was no problem and staff were excellent. The physical space was just too confining for us and our luggage. Small closet space, shallow sink that drained poorly and newspaper would have been a better choice for toilet paper then the gritty stuff that was provided. Once you are in the price range that we were paying it would have been better to pay an extra $40 or $50 a night and get better room and amenities. For a single individual on a limited one or two day stay this is probably a good option. For couples or longer stays, you may want to consider somewhere else.

We found the staff very polite and courteous on arrival, the room was very clean and size was adequate for our needs, would have liked more time to stay and enjoy, but maybe next time! and also the contintental breakfast was excellent

I enjoyed the stay. Used a room that was 2rooms connected, no inconvenience but jt was smaller than imagined.Continental Breakfast is served but just bread and some fruits, no serious breakfast (like bacon, eggs, cereal)

Quite a good experience except for the small rooms. Close to the beach and action. The air conditioning unit was a bit noisy, we turned it off during the night to get a good night's sleep. Ask for a room away from the lifts.
Very good location and hotel staff.Good morning meal and free coffee.but, a little bad air conditioner and elevator.I have a Very good experience~!!!Maybe, I want to reserve this Vive-hotel again.

The hotel is excellent proximity to the beach, short (1 Block) walk. The lobby is nicely appointed with several sittings areas- enough for 40+ people. The entire staff was friendly. However, Christopher, Ryan and Morgan were excellent! They offered service above and beyond what I expected. Extremely helpful with local cuisine and sites to see. The room was clean and the upper floors have an ocean view. No balconies, but there is a small window that opens. The renovation from the prior owner is starting to show. Tub finish peeling in 2105. Mattresses need improvement....extremely soft. Other than that...great experience and a very fair price for the value you receive!

This is a great "budget hotel " with above average service , great location , comfortable if compact room , I would definitely recommend it as good quality and value for money. Staff were great . Only downside was noisy air conditioner - we still managed to sleep well in comfy bed though .

Great location, price, service, hotel room, breakfast. I'd definitely recommend Vive and stay there again. The location is only three short blocks from Waikiki beach and great dining and shopping opportunities.

Great place, amazing located and well-prepared team.Just tree block from Waikiki beach and all the excitement Vive was a great choice.There was a breakfast great for a quick bite.The concierge was helpful with our tour reservation. Wifi was fast and the room was great. Provides beach mats, boogie boards and towels for when you want to go for a swim at Waikiki Beach.I would absolutely stay here again!

This was my first time to visit Hawaii. I felt that choosing this hotel was really good.Location, complimentary services, and friendly staff, everything is good.We can enjoy staying in Hawaii reasonably.

I went to Hawai'i on business for work nearby in Manoa and chose Vive based off the photos I saw online. The staff was fantastic, the rooms beautiful, and the breakfast incredible. I would absolutely stay here again!

hotel location is good. same variety of breakfast every day. okay the first day and got tired of the food as days passed. common area is good. front desk okay but not as good as some wrote in their review.

Excellent hotel, great location, includes breakfast! Provides beach mats, boogie boards and towels for when you want to go for a swim at Waikiki Beach. Staff are the best and the hotel is fully recommended

Where do I start?We arrived early Sunday morning with 6 in the group. 2 out of 3 rooms were ready which was a bonus after a 10 hour flight from Australia. My husband and I somehow got an upgrade to a beach view room, but we are to complaining. We were offered breakfast when we arrived, which a great. The guys at the front desk provided us with a free map of the area, pointed out important things that we may need and there was free Wifi during our 9 night stay.Breakfast is fruit, toast (blueberry toast was amazing) and pastries were available with juice, cold water and tea/coffee (available all day). There was enough variety to get through until lunchtime.There are ABC stores within a few minutes walk away and plenty of eating places nearby.KC at the concierge desk was awesome, we had issues with our shuttle cancelling on us for a Pearl Harbour visit. Within a couple of minutes, a new shuttle was booked for us.Vive doesn't have a pool, but with the beach less than 5 minutes away it doesn't matter. Free towels, beach mats, boogie boards where always available when needed.Rooms were clean and tidy. Air conditioner was a little noisy, but didn't bother us. Vive would have to be one of the quietest hotels we have stayed at during our travels.Nothing was an issue with staff during our stay. Have to mention how awesome Ty, Paul and Christopher were during our stay. Being in a party of 6 but doing different things on days the guys were amazing letting us know if the others were back from their activities.We had a very early pickup for our flight home. Christopher and Paul organised a breakfast bag for us to share while waiting for our flight. They were amazing and had an awesome attitude towards everyone who stayed there.Next time we visit Waikiki, we will be staying at Vive again!

Stayed for 4 nights in Oct. GREAT location. Junior suite was well sized with a large bathroom. Floor tiling looked a bit scruffy but bathroom and room was very clean. Plenty of towels and toiletries provided. 24 hour coffee and the included continental breakfast was appreciated. The hotel lounge area for guests was great -well decorated and would be acceptable in a much higher starred hotel. Beach equipment was readily available. Only negative would be no bar on site - but you didnt have to walk far to find one. Can highly recommend this hotel if you want a 5 star experience but not the surroundings.

Staff was welcome, had a tab in my room, which was convenient. Close to beach, eating places are in walking distance. Breakfast food variety was pretty okay - mostly toast and different pastries. Good that they had some fruits as well. Overall nice stay.

How lucky were we to stay at the Vive HotelGreat location,helpful staff, I would like to mention the Concierge Morgan, KC,and front desk Chris,always so friendly and helpful as were Preston,Paul,Marilyn,Sato Valet Ty , Ryan and Adam. Also, the staff who delivered the buffet breakfast. What a team!First class and well done all of you.

Rooms are well maintained and very clean. Complimentary breakfast buffet was delicious. No pool, but with an extremely short walk to the beach who needs one. Exceptional reception staff, all presented well and keen to.help make our stay a great one!!

This is a very good hotel with excellent friendly service and a lovely breakfast buffet, very convenient for Waikiki Beach. The restaurants recommended by the desk team were all as good as described. The only reason the rating isn't 5 stars is that the room we had was slightly smaller than expected and the air conditioning unit was quite noisy. Would I go back though - yes, I would with no qualms!

Clean, pleasant rooms though a bit small. Very friendly staff, answering all our questions with a smile. Nice breakfast, though only fruit and pastries (we try not to consume too much sugar). Beach gear is available for loan. Comfy lobby with coffee 24/7. Complementary convenience room after checkout was wonderful; It let us enjoy a few more hours at the beach before our flight.If you're looking for a clean, pleasant place out of which to base your Honolulu trip (and not spend a ton of time in your room), it is highly recommended!

Only two blocks from the beach and within easy walking distance to the many shops, bars and restaurants in Waikiki. Nice hotel with modern decor and free breakfast! Kiwi and Aussie travellers will like this style of hotel as it's similar to what we have back home and not as dated or tacky as a lot of other hotels can be in Waikiki. Rooms are modern and clean but quite small (so if you like large spacious hotel rooms then this is not the place for you to stay). Great to have free use of beach towels and boogie boards to take to the beach. Staff are really friendly and helpful. The only thing that I didn't like about this hotel was the noisy air con unit in our room, which made it hard to have a good night's sleep.

This place was awesome! My boyfriend and I actually live in Honolulu and decided to have an impromptu weekend getaway. Booking took no time at all and the room was very nice and clean. We will definitely be coming back again! Thanks for the awesome service!

Clean, economical, great continental breakfast, close to buses and beach and shops staff were really helpful with tourist information. Not a backpacker style but neither too ritzy as to not be interested in us.

Vive is the bomb! It's the most perfect boutique hotel, located smack dab in the middle of Waikiki, 2 blocks from the beach plus all the entertainment you need, at a great rate, with complimentary wi-fi, a tablet, island fresh daily breakfast and free beach gear. The staff is also helpful, courteous and amazing!

This is a great place to stay in Waikiki, it is at one end of the main strip and beach area of Waikiki and I found that great as I would set off for shopping or a walk and at the end of my trip if feeling hot and tired would just get a taxi back to the hotel for $10 Great funky hotel with great friendly staff always happy to say hi when I returned and never a problem to answer any of my questions. The only thing, if I needed to be honest so this doesn't look liked a staged review, is that the cooler the air conditioning was running at night while sleeping was causing a louder air conditioning sound as it cycled in and out through the night, I just turned the temperature up a degree or two and it quietened down to not disturb my sleep. In all a great place to stay, very clean and funky and I would not only just recommend it to anyone but I will stay there again when I next visit Hawaii, close to the beach. less then 5 minute walk without all of the noise and hustle of the main drag and beach. Well done VIVE :-) keep up the great work, thanks for a pleasant stay.

I stayed in the Vive Hotel Waikiki for one week at the end of September 2016. Overall, I thought that it was an excellent value and I was very satisfied. I will comment on some of the negative and some of the positive aspects. On the negative side, the rooms are not large (but are as advertised), and the window-mounted air conditioning units are noisy. Also, the hotel does not have a swimming pool, nor a bar, nor a restaurant, nor a nightclub, nor a gym, nor stores, etc. But all these amenities are readily available within walking distance. If you plan to spend all your time at in your room, or in the hotel, then this is not the best choice. The positive aspects far outweigh the negatives. The rooms are clean, well-equipped, and fairly quiet especially if your room is on the back side of the hotel (except for the aforementioned air conditioning units). There is almost no noise from other rooms. The high speed wifi works very well. The continental breakfast consists of fresh fruit, a wide assortment of pastries and bread, great-tasting juice, coffee, etc. Coffee is available all day in the lobby. The lobby is large and very-well decorated. The local daily newspaper is provided at no additional charge. The hotel provides towels and chairs for use at the beach (just a couple of short blocks away). All the staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. The concierge arranged a rental car for me, and provided excellent advice on how to visit the many attractions on the island to get the most out of the experience. My flight home was in the evening, long after check-out time (noon). The hotel stored my baggage, and provided me with the use of a room, at no charge, for an hour before I left for the airport to shower and change. I should also mention that I had the opportunity to visit friends in some of the other hotels in the vicinity with comparable prices. I will refrain from saying anything except that I was very happy that I chose to stay at the Vive.

When we complained about noise and asked to be moved, we were made to wait a whole day. Then was told bu staff we should move to hotel across the road as they did not want to deal with problem. Hotel from hell. Would not send wild dogs there.

We ended a cruise of the islands with 5 night at the Vive. It was our first visit to Hawaii. The property was nice, the staff very friendly, the room was clean and there were a lot of amenities. We were 3 short blocks from the beach and was amazed at all of the restaurants and convenience shopping nearby. A bus stop was right next to the hotel and you could catch buses to anywhere around the island to include the HoHo trolley. Only complaint would be the breakfast buffet as it was pastries and fruit. After eating fruit, we walked to McDonald's for protein. We were on the 20th floor and did not hear any street noise.

Nice property - friendly staff - clean rooms - lots of amenities - good location. The only real problem we had was that there was a lot of noise from the street below at all hours. We were on the 10th floor at the front of the building facing the beach - it could have been the location of our room though. It just made falling asleep difficult.

This is an excellent new boutique hotel – we loved our stay here! I had really researched what hotel would provide the best value for money and the best location. Thanks to all other Tripadvisor contributions I can definitely confirm that the Vive Hotel Waikiki wins hands down! Brilliant location – 10 out of 10:Extremely convenient location on Kuhio Avenue – just use the walkway directly outside the lobby to cross Kuhio Avenue, walk down Uluniu Avenue for 5 minutes and voila, you have arrived at the corner of Kalakaua Avenue (major, prestigious shopping strip). On the other side of the road is the famous Duke Kahanamoku Statue and the iridescent blue of Waikiki Beach. On that 5 minute walk you will come across two ABC stores a Mexican restaurant and our favourite – Jinroku Pacific (teppanyaki grill). If you walk a few minutes in the other direction, along Kuhio Avenue, within minutes you arrive at the Kuhio Avenue entrance to the newly opened International Marketplace. Exceptional reception staff – 10 out of 10:Without doubt the staff on reception were so exceptional we have to give them a 100% spot on mark! We are very well travelled and it was clear that the reception staff have been selected for their professionalism, warmth and friendliness – they were the best that we have ever encountered. Whether you arrive at 3.30 am or have many questions during the day, nothing is too much trouble. Want some beach gear – no problem. Want a recommendation for dinner – no problem. Repeatedly we overheard “you’re good to go, do you need a transfer to the airport”? They make the check-in and check-out so easy. The reception staff are the ‘face’ of the Vive Hotel Waikiki and what a friendly face that is! The rooms – 9 out of 10:We booked a Junior Suite Mountain View for USD$210 per night. Upon arrival, yes, the first impression is “it’s a bit bland”. The room itself was a good size (lots of room to spread out your luggage) but there is no ‘pizzazz’ as such. In saying this, it really doesn’t matter as you are out and about most of the time anyway. Features of the room are a fantastically comfortable bed, a great shower, a fridge (no minibar but 2 bottles of water are available), a safe and a bedside tablet. (Note no plug in the bathroom sink for shaving).The lobby – 10 out of 10:The lobby is comfortable with leather lounges and a nice area to enjoy the free of charge breakfast which is available from 7.00 am. Breakfast consists of fruit, pastries, muffins, toast and jam and of course the all important coffee to kickstart your day. In fact the coffee is available throughout the day and night.In summary, we would give the Vive Hotel Waikiki a 10 out of 10 mark for the location and the brilliance of the staff and we wouldn’t hesitate to stay there again.

We booking this hotel just by the reviews we had read! Glad we did it was ideal for our stay, comfortable air con. rooms.Staff very friendly concierge with lots of local information.Breakfast was also good with lots of fresh fruit as well as croissants. Tea and coffee available 24hrs in lounge.

A great way to end our time in Hawai'i as my sister and I treated our mom for her 80th birthday celebration. My mom called it "a trip of a life time". Mahalo to all the staff at Vibe.They went out of their way to make my mom feel special.

Stayed for 5 days as an end to a long road trip aroynd the USA.The room was smaller than expected but clean and comfortable. It is only a short walk to the beach and towels/ mats/ chairs are provided by the hotel. There is tea coffee and chilled water available in the foyer area all day and use of the computer amd printer if you need them. The staff were very friendly and helpful they answered all our questions and evven telephoned our LA hotel for us the morning we were leaving. Local buses leave from just outside and there is a great little sandwich/ice cream shop over the road. It was our wedding anniversary trip and on our arrival there was a lovely note and box of chocolates for us. These small touches are what makes this hotel.

This is a great property! Loved the size of our room and the shower was amazing. The staff was amazingly nice and helped with directions and all. Great location near the beach, shops and restaurants. Would definitely stay again.

I would have given this place an average rating if it weren't for the staff.Truly the best part of our stay at this location was the customer service. Some of the most accommodating and friendliest workers I've experienced on the island.From the valet to front desk, everyone was professional and very helpful. The concierge, KC, was awesome!! Just a really great staff all around....but no matter how great the people who work here are unfortunately it can't make up for the rooms themselves.Honesty for the rates we paid the rooms at this location were pretty disappointing. VERY small and the AC in our room made the worst noise.The location is right in the heart of Waikiki so that is a plus and the decor is very fun however the basic necessities could use a big upgrade. The rooms are so small that eating in them is uncomfortable and close to impossible. To make up for that they make the lobby area very welcoming and it can accommodate seating areas for small groups and couples however if you prefer eating in the peace of your room this hotel isn't really set up for you.They also lock the parking garage at night which I understand is a safety measure and cuts down on unwanted outside parking but it definitely made checking in late at night a little difficult. Again the staff was very apologetic and helpful but not the best first impression.If you want a hotel with great location a stellar staff and you don't plan on doing much but sleeping in your room then this place will probably do it for you.

Can't say enough! Room, staff, experience all were great! Walking distance to the beaches and shops. Every request answered with a polite positive attitude. Will definitely stay again, and look forward to the same caring experience while away from home.
user_name:
Jonathan T
Lake Wales, United States

review_body: I Stayed here for my honeymoon and from the day I booked too when we got to the hotel everyone was friendly and great. I would totally come back. And complementary breakfast was yummy, it was pastries and fruit with juice or coffee. Prices are great. And service was good. Very clean hotel. For my next trip to Waikiki this is the place I'll stay! I did research prior to my trip and this place was it!

Great hotel - Modern vibe, impeccable service, reasonably priced, and only 2 blocks from Waikiki Beach. All of the staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. The concierge even emailed me ahead of my trip and set up several reservations for me. Great experience.

We had a great stay! Highly recommended! Complementary beach gear. Very short walking distance to Waikiki beach. Super friendly staff. Continental breakfast was very good--fresh fruit, great baked goods. We couldn't have been more pleased.

great location; rooms were a tad small and simple, but it is a good value for your proximity to many things in Waikiki. Staff were very helpful and friendly; the in room iPad was a very nice feature. It's not a luxury hotel, but you save money to do fun stuff in Waikiki; great value for what you get

Staff couldn't do enough, free wi if, room was small but we were there to see HI not sit in the room. Great vibe from staff and very up beat. Coffee 24hrs and homemade muffins in the a.m. Staff couldn't do enough for you. If needed beach chairs, boogie boards, beach mats and towels provided at no additional charge. Room was cleaned every day. centrally located to all public transportation, restaurants, great local flavor where the locals go, a must go to Helena's 120 N school st. about 45 min ride on bus(well known from food network) and Me's across from hotel as well as the Blue seafood truck. Laundry across the street. The beach is 1 block from hotel. ( not a long block). We could see the ocean from hotel. Great shopping at numerous shops to bring gifts home for family and friends. Public was friendly and always smiling( how could you not when in HI). Weather for September was BEAUTIFUL sunny every day and hot. If you don't like the heat, carry a sweat towel and suck it up. Germaine's luau was awesome. Ask the hotel Staff for details.

To be recommended for a stay in Honolulu. The staff members are remarkably helpful and efficient, and always with a smile. Very well located, one block away from the heart of Waikiki beaches. If you want to stay in a room on the Waikiki side, insist on getting a room on the higher floors because the Ave where the hotel stands on is very noisy and insonorisation is weak. On the other hand the courtesy room available any time for one hour after check-out is definitely a bonus.

Amazing journey!all good!unfortunately we stayed there just for 2 days but the atmosphere was great. The perfect piace where can enjoy the beach and if you like surf....wonderful!! Also the food is good.

Great Hotel. Nice decor, excellent staff, great continental breakfast. Clean and happy. I look forward to spending the rest of my time here. Close to everything. Great that I can go to in-house library and get a book grab a beach chair and spend a relaxing morning on the beach, that is only 3mins walk. Lovely quiet room. Thankyou Vive

Ideal location with everything within easy walking distance. Beach equipment including towels, mats, chairs and body boards was free from the reception, Rooms were lovely and bright. Breakfast was included. Staff were very helpful. Highly recommend this hotel.

The hotel was fantastic. Great lobby vibe with people always around enjoying the facilities. We had a sea view from our room and the hotel is in a great location for the price. Rooms were on the small side and we really missed a balcony. But the hotel does the best with what they have. Breakfasts are amazing and included. We will definitely stay here again!

the hotel is located very closely to waikiki beach and CBD area, 3-minute walk to the beach and 5-7 minute walk to the shopping street. decoration is full of feeling of design. the family suite is very economical, including breakfast. the guest service is good. but I'm not satisefied with the room cleaning. It should be improved.

Not a fancy super hotel. Just a very comfy and practical well managed, small property. Comfortable rooms, excellent breakfast (included), 2 blocks from the beach, a tablet in your room to use, beach apparel free on demand including bodyboard.... practical to the extreme, modern and clean. I recommend it. Could not find a better price than $350 the night for 4. Sounds a little bit on the high side. And this was after a16% online rebate.

The hotel was amazing. Not only were the views of Diamond Head and Waikiki Beach visible from our hotel room, the location to everything could not have been beat. A great hotel/location for our honeymoon!

Just back from staying at the Vive In Oahu, amazing hotel, rooms small but perfectly formed, staff excellent and can not do enough to help you, facilities superb, location superb. Stayed in room 1505, small room but honestly not an issue once you in there, comfy and facilities superb. Location just minutes walk to beach and they provide you towels, chairs, boards etc. On checking out got offered an hour in complimentary room that day so we could check bags with them in morning, go to beach, stayed there all day(Flight was that night) came back got bags and freshened up and changed, brilliant and free! Breakfast again small choices perhaps but very nice choices and a nice place to sit and eat. Cannot say enough about the hotel or the staff, amazing gem of a hotel.

room needs improvements. replace AC. it's so loud, you can hardly sleep! and you can't sleep without the AC on because of the heat/humidity. the sink is terrible. it was aesthetically pleasing but absolutely non-functional. faucet too close to wall and sink, you can hardly rinse/wash anything. also, besides the wardrobe, there were no rods/hooks to hang anything like a simple towel.

Pros: location, staff, breakfast.Cons: Insect control, replace the flat surface sink, need a space for drop off and pick up, no balcony, one chair to sit, small room, umbrella loanerLocation: Waikiki beach, International Market Place mall close by.The location is very close to the Waikiki beach, good breakfast, great staff, room is too small, the sink is flat and not deep enough, ant clawing on the desk found one cockroach on the floor by the elevator, no space for drop off and pick up.

Very good value, with great comfortable beds, and clean rooms. Very close to the beach, and new shopping areas. Local buses at doorstep, and local pick up points for tours. Impressed with ipad devices in each room, giving information and free wifi for your use. Tea and coffee available 24/7!Throughly recommend.

Good location, clean rooms, friendly and helpful staff. Good value. Would stay here again. Bed was comfortable, breakfast was adequate, nice decor, large shower. I have nothing negative to say. Nice hotel for the price.

We stayed here for 3 nights in September 2016.Arrived in the evening after long flight.Staff was very friendly and attentive. Lobby clean and inviting.Only 2 small elevators which were quite slow.We were upgraded to an ocean view room which sounded nice.Got to our room which faced Kuhio street and the beach.When we opened the door we could almost not fit in the room with our 2 bags.The so called ocean view was a sliver of ocean which could be seen between the high rise hotels and condos across the street. The room was smaller than the cabin on our last cruise, I estimate it was about 120 sq ft. The bathroom was a small 6X6 bumpout with a sliding door. Very little storage anywhere. 2 small drawers under the bottom of the bed, and a small shelf in the bathroom. We had to use our suitcases on the floor to store our clothes and toiletries.There was no lanai or outdoor area anywhere also no poolSlept very poorly as the noise from the street below was continous all day and night. The small air conditioner mounted beside the window was also noisy and struggled to reduce the room temperature.The complimentary breakfast was okay, all carbs, toast, muffins, biscuits.Nothing hot and no protein, cheese, bacon,sausage, eggs etc.Minimal fruit, pineapple and watermelon. We booked another hotel in order not to ruin our holiday completely.

We chose this hotel initially by price but on arrival were pleasantly surprised by the comfort offered, the proximity to the beach and helpful staff. The bed was good, only a 3 minute walk to the beach, and the desk staff were very helpful with directions for activities and where to eat.There is a bus stop just outside the door. If we are ever lucky enough to come this way again we would be very happy to stay here again!

My wife and I stayed here for 4 days 3 nights during the first part of our honeymoon and it was the perfect spot. The hotel is very close to Waikiki beach, shopping areas, and great dining establishments. When we booked the hotel, we didn't realize how great this location really was until after checking in and walking around during the day and evening times.The room was the Lifestyle Jr Suite, and the view we had from the 20th floor was really great, especially at night. Bathroom was decent size and the shower was extremely large. A cool feature that this hotel has is that it has nightstand tablets to utilize to request room service, parking valet, etc - very convenient!Staff was very friendly and hospitable. Concierge Service provided cool hand towel and pineapple juice upon checking in. They also have beach mats and towels to use as well. Continental breakfast was provided each morning with fresh fruit. The all day coffee/tea accommodation was super nice too just to recharge ourselves if we got back early from activities we did.

Hotel is easy walking distance to beach and amenities. Room was not overly large but sufficent. If you want more, you pay more. Good value for money. No resort fees, good because we only used towels. Liontorr

K.C. the concierge at the hotel was great. She spent 1 hr with me planning my tours. She was very helpful, knowledgeable, and well informed on activities on the island. She made great suggestions and recommendations. The staff was very eager to help in any way they could and were very attentive and responsive. The room was the perfect size (I traveled alone) and very well kept. I did not find the a/c too loud at all as others may have experienced. The hotel is at a great location. Just 2-3 small blocks from the beach. There are several mini marts and pantries nearby as well for snacks and gifts. There's even a laundromat nearby. The bus stops right in front of the hotel too. Everything was just so conveniently located. The downside, in my opinion, is the breakfast buffet. It's just pastries and fruits. There's coffee, water and one choice of juice. I was hoping for pineapple juice but every day it was guava juice. Also, there're no real milk for coffee, just creamer packets. The plates are appetizer or dessert portion sizes so you can't fit no more than two items at a time on them. There is no formal dinning area so you have to eat by the lobby on fancy chairs with small accent tables for your small plates and coffee. There are real plates and silverware for the food but all the drinks are served in paper or plastic cups. The decor is also somewhat odd. It has a hindu tribal feel to it with loud music in the lobby to match. Not really the hawaiin feel I was expecting. Finally, although the lobby and rooms are clean and well kept, for some reason the elevator and hallways are quite dingy, no air circulation. Overall, I would recommend a stay at this hotel if your looking for value, convenience and service.

Staff at the front desk and at the Concierge desk were great. The location is very convenient and while the breakfast was generally the same every day, it was good. The room was clean but it's pretty small and there isn't much cupboard space. The bed itself is comfortable. We would have had a great stay except for one incident in which we suffered a loss. The incident itself was bad but it was the Manager's attitude that made it horrible - he needs customer service training. It's a pity because the service of the rest of the Staff was great.

The hotel is located just 5 mins walk from Waikiki beach and right next to a bus station for local transport and "Trolley" buses. Excellent for short trips, we had a Queen Cosmopolitan room, very clean and average size for a short stay, Service was outstanding and the Continental breakfast was also good. Coffee "to go" available, Beach gear as of Body boards, chairs and towels was provided! We would definitly recommend this hotel and come back at our next trip.

Modern livestile Hotel without very good staff,. They make feel you at home.Location is excellent. Only a few steps to the Beach. Roomservice was excellent.Only the matress was not as comfortable as expected.

Really enjoyable stay at the Vive-Hotel Wakiki. The hotel is ideally placed in the resort, not too far but not too close to the beach and is ideally placed for bus stops to travel around the island.Breakfasts is really good and are Is included in the price.Bedrooms are quiet and the beds are very comfortable, Only drawback is the lack of a pool but you have the Pacific Ocean about 5 minutes awalk away. I would recommend staying here if you are visiting Wakiki.

Being in the middle of Waikiki like the vive is is great, good food and shopping options nearby, close to the beach and the zoo too. The hotel lobby is an oasis to relax and read or play a game and staff are all very friendly. The room we had was nicely decorated but quite small, The small window mounted aircon unit was loud though, kept us awake at times.

We consistently go by Tripadvisor ratings and this hotel rates well. Not really for us. We arrived to the nice cold drink at reception. It was early, 12 noon, and we realized our room may not be ready, which it wasn't. We were told it wouldn't be long so went for a walk and returned at 2. That is 2 hours. The same person on reception didn't recognize us and had to ask our name and relook up our details. For a relatively small hotel this doesn't give a good first impression. We then had to wait a further hour in reception for the room to be ready. And the wait wasn't worth it. We had booked a 17th floor sea view room. Yes, there was a sea view but the room amenities were, in our view, poor. Tiny fridge, no tea / coffee making facilities, noisy air conditioning, huge but very basic shower. Second day after servicing the bed sheet had a hole in it. And after the first day we should have expected but room servicing was done as late as after 4pm. You might say you get what you pay for, but this hotel is not exactly cheap. We spent the first two nights of our holiday at the Ilukai - same price and way better. So, disappointing. Won't return to this hotel.

We were greeted with a lovely fresh flannel to watch our hands and face and a cold cup of pineapple juice. it was lovely! The hotel is nicely modern and very clean, lovely complimentary breakfast but get there early so you don't miss out on the good stuff!Room was fairly small but definitely adequate and free wifi. very close to the beach and other nice areas. We went and did yoga just up the street which was great too.

A very comfortable hotel to stay. Staffs are all efficient, friendly and helpful. Room is clean and tidy. The hotel is in a good location. Restaurants and beaches are in walking distance. I will choose the same hotel if I come to honolulu next time.

The hotel is very interesting and awesome. The staff are super friendly and make sure to make your stay very comfortable. They offer really good delicious breakfast every morning. The downstairs lobby is very interestingly designed and gives off a very laidback chill atmosphere.I would recommend this place to anyone who is staying in waikiki, honolulu.

Nice central location. All the staff was super friendly and took care of all our whims immediately. Free breakfast was a great way to start the day. Beach towels, mats and chairs extended the comfort to the beach. We plan on returning soon!

Vive was our first stop on our 4 week honeymoon holiday and it doesn't disappoint. Hotel staff are friendly and accommodating, location is perfect and in within walking distance to all the major tourist spots in Waikiki. Cannot fault the hotel at all, we'll be back one day!

The hotel is really good and located close to the beach. The rooms are very nice and comfortable. Free breakfast in the mornings is very good and has a very good selection. Free towels and surf boards for beach lovely touch. Free coffee and cold water 24 hours a day.

Modern style and very comfortable place to stay with great amenities. Location is quite close to the beach. Excellent services from all the staffs. Although breakfast is simple but full of local fresh fruits.

Very nice hotel, great location, the staff always helping you. The breakfast is provided in a unique style very comfortable. Just a two block from the beach, all the buses stops are a just steps from the hotel and the hotel also has parking and valet parking

One of the best things about Vive Waikiki is it's fantastic location. It is minutes away from Waikiki/Kuhio Beach and all the shops and restaurants. We also used the public buses around the island and there is a bus stop directly outside the main doors, the front desk were also happy to help with any questions about The Bus and were super helpful. The rooms were clean and modern. The beds were comfortable and the Air Conditioning worked well. I especially liked the use of tablets in the room and how easy it was to contact the front desk through it. The Wifi worked very well. Breakfast was great every morning and the fruit fresh. The pineapple juice was some of the best I have ever had! Iced water was available throughout the day. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We were able to borrow towels and body boards too. We adored Oahu and Vive made our stay enjoyable and comfortable. I would definitely recommend this hotel and we will definitely stay again when we return to Hawaii.

The hotel is very well located. Near Waikiki Beach, the best beach to walk, surf and to do beautifuls Photos. Near the great shoppings - Macy's, Internacional Market, souvenirs -, and good restaurants.

Loved the Vive. Although not on the beach, it was only a few blocks away from Waikiki. Very reasonable with no resort charges & added perks included such as free beach chairs, umbrellas, towels included. The free continental breakfast had more variety than expected & certainly helped start off the day. The curtain in the room was dark enough to leave out any light & we didn't hear any sounds from the street either, so had a restful sleep (our first night we slept for 13 hrs due to jet lag from travel from the east coast). Def recommend it.
user_name:
jrjfk_2000
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The hotel is located right in the heart of Waikiki right on the main road, Kuhio Avenue within walking distance to the beach, restaurants, cafes, shopping and just a short hop to the malls. There is a bus stop just by the hotel. With a bus pass, it was just perfect to explore the place a bit. The hotel provided amenities to visit the beach which was just 10 minutes walk away. We appreciate there was no crowds in the hotel amenities and no resort fees. We visited some of the larger resort hotels and felt a bit overwhelmed with the crowds in the hotel facilities. Staff was attentive, cheerful and helpful.

Vive Waikiki is a really nice hotel. Close to everything. Friendly staff. Very nice continental breakfast. It's a little small and cramped, and we had some (minor) issues with ants in the hotel (it's on a tropical island, afterall!). The hotel and the room itself are nicely renovated, and we highly recommend this hotel!

Nice and central, close to beach. Free beach towels etc. no balcony or pool though and mY room was very noisy with the wind, seems window didn't close properly or was single glazed. Room ok though and had bath as well as shower.

Away from the hustle and bustle of the main street but easy walk to Waikiki beaches, restaurants and heaps of ABC shops.clean rooms, breakfast good,front desk very helpful, maybe tea and coffee making facilities in the room would help for those early morning cravings. Free towels, chairs etc are a bonus!

If you are planning on being active and out of the hotel during the day, this is the perfect fit. The hotel is simple an d streamlined, making it easy to go in & out during the day and rest well at night. The room was clean, the staff helpful, and the location excellent. The hotel rooms, while smaller than most, are perfect for groups of two (couple or friends).

Had a really enjoyable three night stay. The Lounge was so nice, loved the decor and the books and games. Staff were really friendly and helpful. The pineapple juice drink and cold flannel on arrival was particularly welcome. Where else could you borrow towels, mats and boogie boards all free of charge, superb. Great view over the area from the 20th floor. Lovely comfy beds, tv and little tablets at the bedside - exceptional Thank you to everyone at the Vive Hotel Waikiki.

Great location, amazing staff, clean room (on the small side... But, for the time you're in the room!), good breakfast, water, juice and coffee always available!! Did I say location!! Two block from Waikiki beach, what more can you ask for!!

The staff and the location are great (3min walk to the ocean)! The hotel is pretty basic feature wise, there isn't a pool or a workout room but if you plan on being out most of the day that's not a problem. The staff was really helpful and easy to talk to. My only issue is the beds in the room were pretty crappy for me, way too soft. Also if it's important to you the wifi in the hotel was good (and free).If you plan on seeing the city and going to the ocean this is a great hotel for the price. Check out their website directly for one of their special offers (we rented Mopeds at a discount and it was AWESOME).Tip: The ocean view room doesn't have much of an ocean view. Probably not worth paying for an upgrade, but if you get a free upgrade, great.Tip 2: The free breakfast does not include any protein (eggs, etc), it's mostly pastries, fresh fruit and coffee.

From easy parking, to the location near but not on the beach, to the breakfast in the "living room" daily, Vive provides exceptional value in Waikiki. I recommend the Jr Suite for more room to move around.

Room was kept clean. Staff was friendly. Breakfast was great (Fruits and baked goods).Although lacking in amenities such as pool/gym, they are located 4 short blocks away from the beach and only 4 blocks away from a park with a calisthenics area.

Being a older solo traveller, I felt very safe in this location. Bus stops are convenient just outside on Kuhio Av, for travel in any direction around the Island; and a good selection of food shops near by. I would definitely recommend the Vive. From check in to check out a very pleasant experience.

We appreciated the cleaness of our room, the location and the breackfast with the fresh fruits the most! we stayed there for 7 nights and it the best choice to stay in this hotel. the only dissadvantage: no pool area and no balcony, but the view out of the 16th floor was nice.

I found this small boutique hotel on Kuhio, which is only 2 blocks from the beach and barely a block from the supermarket. Across the street is a cafe where one can purchase quick and delicious meal. My wife and I really enjoyed the ambiance but we especially liked the friendliness of the hotel staff and the valet staff who were sincere and always smiled. Will definitely recommend it to others and come back next time.

Anniversary trip: Everything was outstanding, from check-in, delicious fruit at breakfast, 24 hour coffee, use of towels and beach gear, fast valet parking, wifi tablet in room, modern decor, short-straight walk to beach, and best of all, no hidden resort fees. The room and bathroom were small, but very clean. Who hangs out in the room anyway! Already looking forward to staying with them again in the future! Every single employee was helpful and friendly!

I really enjoyed my time in Hawaii and the staff at Vive were amazing, personable, caring, people. I'm planning to visit Hawaii again and I will definitely stay at Vive again. The room was extremely nice and very clean we had a veiw if the ocean.The location was very close to the ocean, and it's a hop skip and a jump to restaurants, shopping, and entertainment.

We had originally booked three nights here with three additional nights TBD in case we wanted to stay on the north shore. We ended up enjoying this hotel so much, that we extended our stay. It's a quick 2 blocks from Waikiki beach with plenty of food stops and ABC stores on the way. The hotel provides beach towels, chairs (although worn and uncomfortable), mats and boogie boards which was really helpful. The valet is $25 a day but if you book through the hotel website as a Vive member it's 50% off. There is a continental breakfast with fruit, pastries and coffee - chocolate muffins are delicious if you can get one. Seating is a bit odd as it's mainly couches but it's a small area so the hotel has to balance a lobby with a breakfast area and we didn't mind. Our first three nights was in a standard ocean view room; small as others say but very nice and we didn't find the size an issue. Our second half of the stay was in an ocean view junior suite and the room was very large - it even had two ACs! Very pretty view as it was a corner room with lots of windows. Each room has a tablet which we found very useful to schedule the valet and housekeeping. Overall we really enjoyed our stay and would come again without hesitation. Also - Thanks to Paul at the front desk for all of his help!

We will be staying here every time we visit Oahu from now on. Friendly staff, comfortable bed, perfect location, simple but delicious breakfast, wifi, free to rent beach towels, mats, etc. Our room wasn't as large as some hotel rooms, but it was just perfect for the two of us. Very clean, contemporary aesthetic which we appreciate and prefer.The included breakfast was a great way to start our day with fresh fruit, lots bread/pastry choices, coffee, juice, etc.Not only is this location AMAZING because of its close proximity to the beach and plenty of restaurants, but it also is right by a bus stop! We took the bus everywhere in Oahu. Diamond Head is close as well as the zoo, aquarium, and beach parks along the way.I highly recommend this hotel.

Excellent decor, staff, atmosphere, rooms (small but funcky), no resort fee (excellent!), brilliant location, there is not much not to like about this place. We will definitely be back and highly recommend.

This hotel is clean and classy. Very impressive, comfortable lounge area where breakfast is served. The continent breakfast has a great selection of fresh fruit, toast and pastries. Coffee, tea available anytime. The rooms are small, double bed with a one person at a time bathroom, but you are only in there to sleep so it was not an issue. The noise insulation was very good although the air-conditioner was a bit noisy but aren't they all. As other reviewers have mentioned, the location is excellent. I think it is expensive but relative to other properties in the vicinity I guess it wasn't too bad. The staff were very friendly but I was given a couple of bum steers in respect of bus stops and destinations.

Great cool hotel with excellent friendly staff complimentary breakfasts all day teas and coffees free beach chairs towels and mats etc and a late check out room if you want to freshen up before your departure to the airport all for a price nowhere near the other hotels in the top ten or twenty in the Waikiki area Add to this the stunning location only 5 mins from the beach and daily housekeeping We loved It A big thank you to all staff And management You deserve it

Staff were very welcoming and always there to help! Clean and great location! Walking distance to the beach and shops. Would highly recommend and stay here again :) thank you to all the staff who made our stay exceptional :)

As we came to an end to our holiday in Hawaii, we were nearly broke! Everytime we travel to the USA we really load up our suitcases. We even had to go to Macy's and purchase another oversize suitcase for all our stuff. Unfortunately, we had to go budget during Honolulu and had to find anyway to save some dosh. Vive was an excellent boutique hotel, extremely convenient. 5 minute walk to the beach, 5 minute walk to main street where there is plenty of shopping and restaurants. The service was impeccable. I must admit we were probably one of the more problematic customers as we had multiple requests a day. But the staff were still super friendly and happy to assist us. Now some tips for being cheap, there's 24/7 coffee and tea at Vive. If you're driving then parking around the area is fairly expensive setting you back $20-$25 per day. However, one street away there is free parking near the river. But as a warning please check the parking signs and don't get your car towed. Vive also offers beach towels, mats, chairs for your use when you go to the beach. Theres books and board games in the common room as well as computers for your use. All in all, it was a great hotel offering excellent value.

This medium sized hotel is a warm and delightful place to stay in the center of Waikiki - it seems like a renovated business hotel but don't let that put you off in anyway.Good Points:1. Location - an easy 2 block walk to the main beach towards the Diamond Head end of the bay - it is also on several main bus routes that stop in front of the hotel. 2. Staff - helpful, professional and welcoming. All of the staff we interacted with did the best they could for us and helped us get what we wanted. I especially appreciated 'Cy' (according to his name badge) who is on the front desk. He seemed to go out of his way to make sure that the guests were as happy as they could be with their stay. 3. Room - we had a a junior suite on the 10th floor and were very happy with the size style and comfort it offered. It was a barrier free room showing the hotel is well prepared to meet the needs of all guests and not just be talk about it. 4. Lobby area - someone has really gone to town on this - a large open stylish space that it feels comfortable to use at any time. 5. Relaxed and laid back style - it works well in this hotel - help yourself to breakfast, hot drinks at any time, beach towels, small boards. BUT, the staff are there when you need them. 6. The room was well cleaned and maintained every day. Comment1. Noisy and basic air conditioning in the room.2. The touch screen room service ipad was often slow or unresponsive though it did always work in the end.

Stayed here for two nights. Overall it was a pleasant stay. The hotel staff were friendly and the common area had 24 hour tea and coffee making facilities, as well as microwaves on hand too. We were located on level 9 and the room was tiny! There was just enough room to walk around each side of the bed.

A perfect hotel if you wish to avoid the large chain hotels. A boutique hotel in a perfect location, a street back from the beach, away from the hustle, but close enough! Towels and beach equipment available also. Free wi-fi and a light breakfast of pastries, tea & coffee to start your day. Would highly recommend and would stay again...Thank you. =)

First time to stay here. Its new, cleaned and the price is fine for our stay. Breakfast is not continental but the breads are all fresh and fruits are always sweet. Coffee is 24 hours. Your are near the beach and restaurants that are popular at yelp the stuff are great and they help you what ever you need. They have free beach towels, chairs and umbrella all in the lobby just make sure to return it after used. Room is clean it's small but new and clean are important for me. The stuff are great I will come back next time and I hope the same genuine attitude will always be there .

Best vacation that I've ever had I've been all around the world and your hotel was by far the best that I've stayed in this hotel is excellent thank you for a memorable vacation for my girlfriend and I we thank you from the bottom of our hearts Aloha and have a good day

We stayed at this hotel for two nights and could not fault the location or the service we received. The hotel is situated a few blocks back from the main beach at Waikiki, making the walk down from the hotel for a swim very easy. The hotel provides towels and other beach accessories which was great as it meant we didn’t need to pack beach towels in our luggage. The room was quiet and perfectly acceptable for our needs. We had read reviews about the air conditioning being loud, but it did not bother us at all. The air conditioning worked really well and kept our room beautifully cool. We felt safe walking around the area at night and there were plenty of choices for shopping and food within walking distance. The staff provided a friendly, excellent service and the juice and wet towel upon arrival was perfect after a long flight. A comfortable stay.

well done - great concept hotel, modern styling, great service, great technology, love the artworks in the lift areas, continental breakfast was nice, having self service filter coffee available was appreciated, definitely a rebook for this one

very good hotel and experience. location is good, service is good. value for money. if you stay here,you will find good room, good breakfast. the only improve area is the air conditioner. a little noisy.

We booked as this was a slightly smaller boutique hotel that seemed to be just on the edge of things and included WiFi and Breakfast.We were not disappointed, and would most certainly return on our next visit to Hawaii.The staff on the front desk were helpful and friendly, always acknowledging us as we entered and exited the hotel, and were super helpful when we needed things.Morgan and KC on the concierge desk were great helping us fix up various trips and providing recommendations and advice on. Breakfast is continental and had a good selection of toast and pastries, the coffee was actually good for America and the juice was excellent.The room was clean, a little small but not enough to concern us, and had all the amenities that you would expect TV, fridge etc.The WiFi was great with a decent speed, enough to enable YouTube to play without buffering issues.

The Vive hotel provided a great place to stay. Let me rephrase that a wonderful place to stay. The staff was extremely helpful and on multiple occasions went out of there way to make our visit easy and pleasant. We loved the continental breakfast, free beach gear and on site valet parking ( a real premium in Waikiki). The rooms are a bit small but they have done a good job to make them pleasingly comfortable. Great beds! This is not a big resort but rather a quiet oasis in a busy Waikiki. You can't beat the value. We will definitely return.

Staff was super friendly and helpful upon arrival. Nice touch was a welcome gift in my room. They say the offer a continental breakfast, but it was only comprised of coffee, juice, water, fruit platters and small pastries-no protein or anything warm. The room was comfortable and rather large- I was on a corner. Somewhat of a weird layout because the hotel has an indoor/outdoor kind of concept. I did have ants on and off in my room throughout my stay, nothing so bad that caused me to contact management, just more of an annoyance. It is VERY close to shopping and a 5 minute walk to the beach. They do not offer any sort of room service- all food is order out, but will be delivered to your room.

Have stayed in a lot of hotels but this one just did that bit extra to make us feel comfortable. It was in an excellent location - so close to the beach. I would certainly stay there again when visiting Honolulu. The welcome drink and breakfast was beautiful. Thank you Vive Hotel Waikiki.

If you've never had a concierge with a red mohawk before, you're missing out. KC is the best! Everything I needed during my stay was available. You have to call down for ice, but they bring it quickly. Getting your car from the valet is also lightning fast as well. They do a great job over there. But seriously - a huge thank you to KC the Concierge for tracking down what we were in search of.

Hi everyone...You would silly to not book here. They have everything and more. The staff has been amazing, even before my arrival they answered all my questions and offered suggestions on everything from actives, transportation and printers (business travel) The room was so nice, large enough to not feel cramped I was able to unpack and make it my home away from home. In terms of location the vive can't be beat! It was just off the beach so it's not as busy and touristy but close enough that I was able to take advantage of the hotels free beach gear and walk to the beach. The wifi is great, the coffee and small bite in the morning was the perfect snack to get the day started. All of my future Hi travel will booked at the Vive

I picked out the Vive from review sites, and was very happy with my choice. Good location and value, and staff were very attentive.The reviews noted the basic rooms were small, true, but they are still new, clean, smart, mine with views of the beach (mountain view would have been fine though). A bit more drawer/shelf space, and wet gear hanging space in the bathrooms would be good - I got by fine solo, but it would have been a bit tight if I'd travelled with a partner. The inclusive breakfast was a good economiser, and tho' the mini-fridges aren't great, delivery of ice to the room was very prompt. The one thing I did miss was not having a radio in the room, as the music channels on the TV were very limited. Ten nights in Waikiki and I barely heard any Island music. Sigh!

Great location and very friendly staff. Beautiful decor downstairs and nice healthy breakfast with fruit. However, a few drawbacks. The room was very small. The air conditioner was loud even after it was fixed. The breakfast, as nice as it was, was the same every day so a little variety would have been nice. One very useful thing was the hotel gave out towels downstairs and straw mats for the beach.

The hotel is close to the beach, and transportation is convenient. The staffs are all very welcoming. Room is clean. They also offer free stuffs for beach. The breakfast is also good. I enjoyed my stay here.

I forgot several things in my room and they were all returned to me promptly. Free breakfast buffet was excellent with many fresh fruits. Location is perfect, just two blocks from Waikiki. The hotel supplies guests with towels and beach mats to take to the beach.

Stayed here for 4 nights mid July 2016. Location is at the Kuhio Beach end of Waikiki, but I liked that. Not as glitzy as some parts of Waikiki but definitely not a bad area, and it had perhaps a more authentic feel to it than some other parts of the beach strip.Very happy with the staff at reception and how helpful they were. The room (Lifestyle Junior Suite) was a great size and really good for 2 people who were out most of the day but wanted some comfort when relaxing before dinner. It appears to be an older hotel that's had a recent makeover, but I liked how it was and am hard pressed to find any negatives (so I won't).The complimentary buffet breakfast was good and an easy way to start the day.I would definitely stay here again.Got a good TripAdvisor deal and was happy with the price paid.

If you're after an affordable hotel, a nice breakfast and a modern room this is the place for you!We booked a family suite for 4 adults and found that we had heaps of space and two bathrooms which were great for 4 girls getting ready at once. The breakfast each morning was great with a selection of fruit, pastries and bread as well as tea, coffee, juice and water. You could borrow towels, beach mats and boggie boards from reception free of charge. The beach is a 4 minute walk away. the hotel can also arrange affordable shuttles out to the outlets for some great shopping as well as Pearl Habour. The local bus stops right out the front of the hotel as well, with the Pink tourist line a 2 minute walk down the street. The only downside to this hotel is the air conditioning unit in the rooms is slightly noisy, however it is incredibly powerful and will keep you nice and cool.

We returned to the Vive, having stayed several times before. The location is fantastic .. 3 minute walk to waikiki beach. The rooms  are light , spacious & modern. The continental breakfast just perfect . The communal lounge room & library are comfortable with endless tea & coffee.. Refill your water bottles for the beach or just curl up & read the local paper. Vive provides beach chairs, towels & boogie boards .. The staff are so friendly , professional & courteous . The atmosphere is so friendly & relaxed. A short , easy walk to the hub of waikiki .. Restaurants, bars & wonderful shopping. Vive has it all
