I found this hotel to have Excellent staff , location and Value. Including continental breakfast in rate increases value. Staff had good knowledge of activities in area and concierge service for booking tours and services ideal. Having the local bus stop @$2.50/ride adjacent to front entrance is a real bonus too.

Awesome jr. suite! and enjoyed every min. of my stay!! will be back for sure and highly recommend this place!! staff was helpfulness. everything was in walking distance of hotel. will be back soon cause child is in Kamehameha!! Mahalo for the Awesome experience!!!!

We recently spent 3 days at the Vive. We were warmly greeted with a cold glass of fresh pineapple juice and a cool washcloth! Our room was beautiful, we opted for an upgraded view queen: nice decor, comfy bed, view of the ocean, huge shower, large closet. The included continental breakfast offered an extensive variety of fresh fruit, baked goods, juices coffee and tea. Off hours there was always iced cucumber water and coffee.The staff was outstanding, offering tips to get around, dining and transportation. The hotel is 2 blocks from the center of Waikiki beach and provides, beach towels, mats, chairs and even boogie boards. There are convenience stores, shopping and dining surrounding the hotel. The bus line is just outside the hotel entrance.We requested a late check out but were denied, instead the hotel offered us a free hour stay in the courtesy room to freshen up before late afternoon departure. I highly recommended this hotel.

So accommodating and super nice. The rooms are great and they were able to squeeze us in at 10:00pm on a Friday night in the middle of the summer with a great discounted rate. I can't say enough about the customer service. Excellent!!!! The ONLY reason for not 5 stars is that they don't have a pool. However, they do offer complimentary beach gear for your trip to Waikiki beach! thanks guys!! Much love! ❤️

I would recommend this hotel if you don't have the budget to stay at the Hyatt, but want to be right in the middle of the action, very close to the beach and you don't mind small rooms and noisy aircon.This is a difficult review to write because of the contrast between the good and bad points. It is also reasonably priced compared to the other hotels in the area, but still more than I would expect to pay for somewhere of average quality. I'd give it 3 1/2 stars if I could.The location is a three minute walk from the best part of the beach and the iconic statue of Duke. It is surrounded by cafes, restaurants and bike/scooter/motorbike hire places. Allow approximately 20-30 minutes to and from the airport.The common areas are nice and modern and the service is really welcoming and friendly. There's beach chairs, mats and towels that are free for guests to use.As mentioned, the rooms are on the small side (but not as small as NY rooms...) and the aircon unit is really loud even on the lowest fan setting (I had to turn it off and open the window to sleep), but quite fine otherwise. The bathroom is a decent size and newish with the shower over the bath.The noise of the aircon was a deal breaker for me, glad I wasn't there longer - but some people don't mind it.

Had the pleasure of staying here for 4 nights. If your looking for a simple clean and great all round hotel this is it. Excellent trained helpful staff. Quiet and close to beach and shopping. Breakfast simple and adequate and the lifts were fast!! Would highly recommended this hotel for great all round facility and value. Congratulations and thanks.

Lovely hotel just a few minutes walk from the beach front. Compact rooms but with everything needed for a couple of nights stay. Great views from the rooms and very quiet. Staff are so incredibly helpful too. Laundry and other amenities just across the road too so overall, fantastic location.

Staff were so friendly and helpful.Location was perfect. Breakfast was great. Rooms were small but clean and modern. Complimentary room on checkout if you need to leave later after checkout. Great idea as wrre able to shower etc before catching late flight.

Spent 4 nights at Vive Waikiki. It is a good value hotel for this part of the world, very well located, great valet parking service. Very friendly, helpful staff. Our room was a junior suite with good views, very comfy bed and good bathroom. It was an excellent size with 2 AC units. The included breakfast was ok. Fresh fruit was lovely but rest of it (pastries) was a bit "samey" for 4 days in a row. Also it is just eaten in hotel lobby, not at proper tables which was less than ideal. Great service to be able to borrow beach gear.I would definitely recommend the Vive and would happily return here if we were to stay in Waikiki again.

We loved it here. The location is great, the hotel is clean and modern, and the continental breakfast is very tasty. The rooms are small but they make good use of the space and feel pleasant and cozy. We definitely plan on staying here again. PS. The staff are all very friendly!

Everything involving our stay was exceptional. From the welcoming and helpful valet crew to the fresh pineapple juice and cold towel during check-in, Vive Hotel started a beautiful trip off with a bang! We had the spacious junior suite filled with amenities that made our stay extra relaxing. A bedside tablet provided us with different dining options that could have been delivered to the door, as well as different hot spots to check out around Waikiki. From top to bottom the staff and amenities were well above average... So being a 3 minute walk away from Waikiki Beach is just an extra big bonus! Great hotel, staff, location, and pricing.

We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Staff were very welcoming and helpful, reception area and public area was nicely decorated and clean, but a little small. Breakfast buffet was quite good - muffins, croissants, fresh fruit, juice, coffee and tea. However, it did get very busy in at breakfast time and it was a struggle to get somewhere to sit at times.Room was small but functional with effective, but rather noisy air conditioning. There is a reasonable amount of clothes hanging space but no drawers. There are some small shelves by the side of the bed but I found these quite thick with dust on arrival which was not pleasant and rather disappointing. Maid service for the first half of our trip (we stayed 8 nights) was not brilliant. The bed was made and bins emptied but not much else happened. The bath was not cleaned for about 4 days possibly 5 as we had been at the beach all day and when we stepped into the bath we left footprints from the grime we had collected on our feet. This was not cleaned and the toiletries we had used were not replaced so we were left with nothing. This was also disappointing as the maid had cleared the bins so surely it would be obvious these need to be replenished. After day 5 or 6 the new maid left a card in our room to introduce herself and all of the previous issues were remedied - bath cleaned, toiletries replaced, which is how it should have been in the first place. We did find the hand basin rather useless - we had issues with the water draining away as the plug did not retract properly and also there was a problem with the hot top - when we switched it on it sounded like a very loud pneumatic drill, which I am sure would have been heard in nearby rooms. Overall we had a really good stay and I would recommend this place - pity about the lazy maid as I would have given 5* otherwise, despite the fact it is a small room, it was nicely furnished.

double bedroom turned into a small bedroom. the room is really tiny little thing if you travelling with a friend And not with Prince charming... aircon smelled like urine... but staff was very nice And friendly And is really closed to the beach

The hotel bed is very comfortable and sleeps well for two and serves free continental breakfast. The hotel is located about two blocks from Waikiki beach and nearby restaurants, shopping and grocery stores.

Great hotel except for room size and layout which was very poor. The hotel room had no place to sit except at the desk. The room was cramped and uncomfortable with the air conditioning blowing on us from only a couple of feet away.

Our stay at the Vive Hotel was a pleasant experience. The staff were excellent always ready to assist. Our room was clean and tidy with an ocean view. The location was excellent close to the beach with a lot of restaurants to choose from.

VIVE Hotel markets itself as a "Boutique Hotel". Wiki defines a Boutique Hotel as "a term used initially in North America and the United Kingdom to describe small hotels which have typically between 10 and 100 rooms[1] in unique settings with upscale accommodations." Does small mean "exclusive" as in small number of rooms or small sized rooms or both? For this hotel it is at least the latter: very small rooms for the price.The Good:-great location, two blocks from the beach, near some of the best little food stops in town.-great, friendly staff.-good common areas.-room is clean and functional.The Bad:-Not really a great value. I paid almost $300.00 per night for the smallest room.-Parking is valet only at $25.00/ day.The Ugly:-Rooms are incredibly small. Mine measured 16"6" x 12'2" (yes, I measured it)-Beds are Queen sized only at 80" x 60"-toilet is 4 ft from the bed.-hallway is 42" wide.After the initial room size shock I stayed but if I could do it over again I would stay at the Hyatt for a little more money. I wish they would have stated the room size in their description to begin with.

This is an excellent hotel, well located in Waikiki Beach. The room I stayed was pretty new and clean, with a good shower and bed. The hotel has a nice breakfast offered in the lobby, fulltime water/tea/coffee and provides chairs, towels and other stuff to take to the beach. The parking is expensive, but works pretty well.

The location was really nice and we had a room with an ocean view. There were a lot of restaurants nearby and the front desk was very eager to give recommendations. They also provided beach equipment like towels, chairs, etc. The breakfast was just fruits and breads, so we did end up going out to eat for breakfast most days. Overall the stay was really great and we would definitely stay there again.

The pineapple juice and cool towel are a great welcome. Front desk staff was very warm and professional. Our 20th floor room had a nice partial ocean view, but was a bit small. Air conditioning unit was just adequate. The Continental breakfast was plentiful and delicious, and enough to hold us over until lunch. Good location, close to main beach and just a 5 minute walk to Kapiolani Park and the zoo. Overall a great vive and plenty of Aloha!

This was our second stay at the Vive. We were here 2 summers ago and when we got engaged, new we'd be coming back to Hawaii for our honeymoon and that the Vive would be our Oahu hotel. This hotel is very small... Don't expect restaurants, pools, amenities, etc. but that's what we like about it.When you arrive, they give you pineapple juice and a towel to freshen up. Any time you go to the beach, you can get a boogie board, towels, beach mats, and other things to enjoy the beach for free. It's a short walk to Waikiki beach, passing ABC along the way if you want water/snacks, etc.The location is perfect. Short walk to the beach, rental car, awesome restaurants, and bus stop right outside. The concierge will give you a map when you arrive with all bus info too and how to get everywhere.Breakfast is included from 7:00-9:30, and coffee, water, juice all day as well as microwave and toaster. Really nice for a snack before heading out!It was our honeymoon and they gave us a card and a box of chocolate covered macadamia nuts. Staff is awesome, hotel is clean, but small. But you're in Hawai'i, why do you need a big room? Your days will be spent at the beach and exploring so the room doesn't matter. This place is cheaper than most other resorts (no resort fee either), clean, awesome staff, and perfect location. Highly recommend and when I'm back on Oahu I will be back at the Vive. They even had their concierge book a car for me when I emailed them ahead of time since the concierge (KC) would have been gone by the time we arrived and we needed the car early the next day.

My hubby and I had an awesome honeymoon experience. We will never forget our priceless memories created. The hotel was super fabulous from the room to the staff to the facility. The continental breakfast was an icing to the cake. :)

We spent 20 amazing days at the Vive Hotel which is very close to the beach.Our room had a seaside view. It was not very big but very functional. The only negative point : the air conditionner was noisy.All the free amenities were enjoyable :- Continental breakfast- Coffee, tea, water and flavored water all day long- Beach gear (towels, mats, beach chairs, etc.)- The loan of sundries (HDMI cable, etc.)- The WI-FI was very stable and had a excellent bandwidth. Thanks to the staff (Paul, Tyler, Adam, Ryan, Michael, Sato, Christopher & Marylin) for its kindness, availability and efficiency at all times.You made us feel like at home. You filled our hearts with Aloha Spirit and we will try very hard to spread it all around us.The concierge KC and Morgan were very helpful. KC was awesome. Her personality and her good mood were refreshing. Thanks to her advises, we had so much fun during our activities on Oahu and the other islands.Thanks to the housekeeping crew for its thorough work.Barbara ADOUN & Nicolas WEBER.

The staff make the Vive hotel, they are absolutely amazing. We only stayed for one night but were made to feel extremely welcome and any request we had they tried to accommodate.The room was an adequate size, very clean and comfortable with a decent bathroom. The reception area is quite nicely designed for guests to lounge around in. The location is ideal for Waikiki beach and the many shops, restaurants, bars etc.Our only issue would be with the breakfast, it is quite limited, there are no hot options, cereal or milk. It also seems to run out quite quickly, especially in the last 45 minutes so get down early if you want more than just bread and fruit. The breakfast area is not suitable for eating in and space is also quite limited so if you are staying for a few nights this could be a bit of an issue.We had a number of requests such as use of a computer/printer to print off our boarding passes, use of towels/bamboo mats for the beach which staff were able to provide without any issue.But most impressively, our flight was not leaving until 10pm and with checkout at midday were asked if we could leave our bags while we went to the beach one final time, had a wander around and got a bit of lunch. The Vive hotel went one better, they offered us use of a room for 1 hour as well as storing our luggage while we went out. We booked our hour in the room for one hour before our minibus to the airport. The room allowed us to shower, change and freshen up before going to the airport which was an unexpected bonus.I would definitely recommend staying at the Vive but get up early for the breakfast!!

This hotel has a good location about 3 blocks from the beach. The room we had was nice and the services offered by the hotel (beach gear such as towels, chairs, boogie boards) were great. Having breakfast included is a bonus. We enjoyed our stay.

AMAZING! We were staying in Honolulu for a week, July 25th to August 1st. I did my due diligence and researched a variety of different hotels in the area. Vive Hotel was perfect. I didn't want a resort hotel (or pay resort prices) because I could care less about a pool when the beach is right there! it's not Las Vegas, it's Hawaii!! Why do I need a pool or a "themed" motif? We came to explore Oahu and be outside, not to just stay in our hotel. We wanted a place that was clean, modern, and convenient. Vive was everything we wanted and more. Super cute and very hospitable. Everyone was rad and really friendly. KC and Morgan were absolute delights and very helpful.We stayed in the junior suite room and it was great. Spacious layout, great shower and water pressure, two ac window units (they were a lil noisy but not obnoxious...thankfully i like the white noise). We were pretty central to everywhere we wanted to be and to check out. I'd definitely recommend Vive Hotel. It was quaint and incredibly personable. Everyone there was awesome and very sweet. Thank you for making our stay so relaxing and care-free.

Vacation was excellent. Check in was no problem. Every day we stay in the hotel was excellent. Will stay at this hotel again. Happy with the complimentary breakfast everyday and free wifi. Thanks for the hotel staff for excellent service.

The hotel is very close to the center of waikiki. The room is clean and confortable but I suggest, if you can, to choose a room at an high level of the hotel. The lower levels are noisy. There is a payment car parking but the daily price is very convenient. The enclosed breakfast is not very good but there are several restaurants around the hotel.

Every communication prior to our visit and during our visit with staff was friendly and very welcoming. Room was comfortable, clean and good value. Location was convenient and walkable to beach, restaurants, and shopping, yet quiet.

fantastic place. Staff were excellent, friendly and personable. facilities like towels, mats etc for the beach that many other places charge for was a nice surprise. No hidden extra costs either. Close to everything.

We spent 4 nights in the Vive Hotel at the start of a special family holiday. The hotel is well appointed with a relaxed, funky vibe. The rooms are simple, yet stylish and have everything you need. The location is great - a short walk to excellent shopping and restaurants and the beach and conveniently located for access to public transport. I have worked in 5 star hotels in Australia and we travel extensively and the highlight of this small hotel is the staff and their abillity to make you welome, help with any aspect of your stay and anticipate guests needs so well. Little touches like assisting us with wine glasses so our family could share a bottle of wine in lounge area at the end of a long day, ice for an injury and the offer of 24 hour assistance if we needed help, towles and beach equipment, plus helping us find our way around - it sounds simple but not a lot of hotels get it right. Thanks to the Vive team - we will definately be back and recommend you to our friends.

Wrote This review on phone, so please excuse any errors.My entire stay was excellent. I was visiting on my own, trying to keep my hotel expenses down and I was incredibly surprised by the superior quality of my stay comparable to a 4 or 5 star resort and Consistent from the first "Aloha" to the "Mahalo”. haha Making reservation:I made my reservation by phone, I let the reservationist know "Im visiting Solo and looking for the best price available for that reason".I was given a nicely modern and refined room down to the sink fixtures. $147 a night plus some tax's. I was given special consideration ( rooms were available ) , $200 was the actual room average ( this speaks volumes about their service alone).I almost felt guilty after the fact I probably should've paid more.To start:I was greeted with a welcoming pineapple juice and cool scented towel presented on a plate at registration. I was in room 1404 a single queen room, roomy and comfortable as well modern luxury fixtures in (my opinion). An I-pad/ tablet was set near my bed said welcome Rachel T********** I found the Tablet useful in may ways, I scrolled and felt connected to the Honolulu atmosphere and energy of the area.Using the Tablet I logged onto the internet instead of having to use my cell phone (very convenient).Every morning starting at 7am ending 9am was a complimentary breakfast.4 or 5 Fresh cut fruits Pineapple mellonsstrawberriesorangesectsweet rollspatries Banana BreadBest of all 24-7nicely brewed Kona coffee(smooth and nutty )+sugar and Creamers(always hot and filled )And Tea selectionsThe person in charge of daily operations is doing an excellent job. Pat your self on the back. I travel and have been lucky enough to experience many beautiful 5 star resorts, where nightly stays are upwards of $500 and Vive's operates at the same capacity. I do believe excellence should be acknowledge and they truly made my stay a great memory and stress free.... haha I stress myself out easily (sensitive to ingenuity) but that means I pay attention to detail consistency and Vive hit all the points and did not fall short. Im confident if others have my vive experience they will not see other established resorts in honolulu as competition.

Staff are very friendly and were extremely quick to response to our one request. The location is great close to the beach, grocery store and many other attractions. There is a bus stop right out the front for Ala Moana shopping mall. The only problem the a/c is a little loud. Overall this hotel had everything we required.

Quick to take your money, and not to quick to give it back! Was informed that my 100 withhold in my bank account, would take up toFive to eight business days to be refunded to me. And this was after the fact that I wasn't informed that they were gonna hold MY money. Which was very inconvenient.

Location is perfect. Waikiki and Kuhio beaches are so very close yet this hotel is far enough from Kalakaua Avenue (busy, tourist filled street) that you feel like a local.Front desk staff are friendly and eager to assist with your transition to island life.Breakfast is filled with fresh fruits, juices, breads, coffee and teas that make it easy to grab a few snacks and head out to adventure.The room I had was small. It was comfortable and clean. It was perfect for a the small amount of time I spent in it to rest and refresh.I would recommend this hotel and plan to return later this year. Mahalo!

Excellent location even though not on the beach or has a pool, only a short stroll. Room was clean and tidy albeit small we did think we would get a slightly bigger room especially since we were staying for 10 days but then again we were hardly in the room for extended periods of time. Good selection of restaurants nearby although breakfast was included the selection was a bit tiring after the 3rd or so day. Staff were always friendly and helpful and the hotel is well maintained. Would recommend to family and friends and would stay here again.

Great location and access to the many Waikiki shopping areas, historic sites and beach.Loved the fact that they had towels, mats and floats to go to the beach with at the front desk.Very convenient access to the military installations.

Good overall ,Service was very good and the location is near the amenities and the beach. Good response from the staff and help in finding the bus stop in the map. on the other hand, the breakfast is good.

Crews have very warm heart and they always try to make a best. My hotel agency made mistake, but they fixed with very welcome. Send best regards especially Paul and Christoph. Hotel is Very close to the beach, tons of resturants are waiting for you. I recommend Hy's Steak.

Vive Hotel Waikiki turned out to be the perfect place for us. The hotel is well maintained, the staff is fantastic, and it's the perfect boutique-style hotel oasis in Waikiki! Love that they provide a continental breakfast, and the room, while small, perfectly met our needs. The staff were so attentive to us, we loved our stay.

Let me begin by saying the front desk staff are outstanding. They were friendly, helpful, courteous and very knowledgeable. At check-in on a hot and humid afternoon, they offered cold towels and cold juice and to store our bags until our room was ready. They could give lessons to other hotels on how to make customers feel welcome.So why not a higher rating? The rooms really leave something to be desired. We like to unpack our bags if staying for more than one night (we were there four nights). But the only drawers in the room were in the pedestal of the bed, against the floor. To use them means getting down on your hands and knees to pull things out from under the bed. That can be a problem for older knees and backs. There were three small cubby holes in the TV stand. But they weren’t big enough to hold many clothes. Also, there was only one luggage stand. So our other two suitcases had to stay on the floor.The TV was on a stand with little room for more than the remotes and room key. There was certainly no room to put a laptop if you want to play a DVD or stream videos to the TV. The desk in the room was also small. There was a similar problem in the bathroom. While the walk-in shower was huge – big enough for several people at once – there was very little space to put toiletries, just one very small glass shelf near the sink. Where do they expect guests to put hair dryers, brushes, shavers, creams, etc?The rooms seem to have just single-pane glass windows. So that means lots of street noise in your room, even on the upper floors. Our room had two window air conditioners that had to run constantly to keep things comfortable. That means they also had to run all night. However, that created sort of a white-noise effect that covered some of the street noise.Pros: Great front desk staff. Good location, just two short blocks from Waikiki Beach.Cons: Very little place to put your things if you want to stay for more than one night and unpack. Street noise due to single pane windows. Noisy and inefficient air conditioners.Bottom line: If I were going back to Waikiki, I would stay elsewhere.

Nice Spot, modern accomodations, coffea or tea all dayTwo blocks away from Beach and best shopsYou Get towells and chairs for the beachGreat service Parking 25 uss per day Less crowdy than hotels nearby

pro:Good location Friendly staffCons:Rooms tinyBathrooms even smallerThe room as a whole felt old, the bed is tiny. The airconditioning is an old box in the window type system which is incredibly loud and ineffective. The glass is not sound proof so you get ALOT of street noise. Overall if the room was much cheaper you would be getting a good deal.

My partner and I just checked into Vive hotel and were thrilled with the excellent customer service. On arrival we were greeted by the lovely Preston, cold hand towels and refreshing pineapple juice! Preston was very helpful and accommodating also very knowledgeable about the hotel and Waikiki. Adam took our bags up to our room and briefed us on our room and amenities he was very welcoming and of great assistance. Hotel rooms are beautiful! Great Location! Would recombined staying here :) Thanks everybody at Vive for making our holiday so enjoyable.

I'm starting this by saying the rooms are small. They are really small, but if you are on Oahu and spending time in your hotel room something is wrong with you. It's a quick walk to the beach and they give out towels, beach chairs and beach mats for free-you can't beat that. Another plus, it is valet parking $25 a day but there is NO RESORT FEE. Considering the big hotels tack a $30 fee per day on your stay, plus tax, it can get expensive quick. Vive doesn't have any of the frills, but it really does get the job done. Customer service was great also. One final negative, there is no central air and it's window units. I didn't really mind it because it kept the room cold but I can see why some people would hate it. I think it's a great value and if they could some how get Central Air and a pool, this place would be off the charts fun. But overall, really great option for Waikiki

Stayed here again during a layover in Honolulu and was met with exceptional service again and a very comfortable stay. We used the courtesy room before flying out and this made our red eye flight comfortable. I look forward to staying here again on my next visit to HNL!

The window air conditioners were really loud and disturbed my peace of mind while awake and trying to sleep. Breakfast food wasn't great except for fresh fruit. Breads and baked goods were processed and tasteless.

The vive is a pretty good option.The rooms are a bit small but very comfortable.The staff is excellent and the elevators are quick.Breakfast is fresh fruit and pastries(a couple of them savory w/ a bit of egg or spam baked in) with coffee,tea,juice etc. Plenty to get your morning started. Didn't have any problem with street noise on an upper floor. Parking is available(Valet),and they were quick with retrieval.Cost is 25 dollars,plus tips,but available for half that if you sign up/reserve on their website ahead of time. Location is good,within a couple blocks of the beach,and plenty of eating options nearby,especially to the right of the front door within 2 or 3 blocks at reasonable prices. That direction also includes a well stocked grocery store that also includes eating options for eating in or packaged carry out. The closest thing I have to a complaint is I missed having a lanai/balcony or at least an outdoor area off the lobby. Though the lobby and breakfast area were spacious and comfortable , I missed the outdoor option.

Good overall and proximity to all the amenities and the beach. Service was very good. Good response from the staff and help in booking restaurants and information about the various activities helped us plan our day well.

The comfiest beds ever...great sleep. Breakfast was a plus, nice selection especially the fruit!! Loved the pineapple juice too. It's great that the hotel provide beach towels, body boards etc. Great location, would definitely recommend.

The vive hotel is a great hotel. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are comfortable and clean. The hotel is quite central and within walking distance from most places you will want to visit whilst in Waikiki.

Perfect location 2 blocks from beach, nothing fancy but clean room and comfy bed. Awesome staff ready to help 24-hours. Would definitely stay again - would have liked more shelving to unpack but since we were only there for 4 nights we managed out of our suitcases. Bus stop right there. Totally worth $1/2 of what the Hilton and Marriott wanted just across the street!

We had a great time staying at Vive hotel ... great location and lovely decor in the reception area. The rooms were perfect for us.All the staff were helpful and friendly, but we especially loved KC who helped us out with organising our tours!

First thing, and so important, this hotel is in an excellent location - a block back from Waikiki/Kuhio beach. It's a straight line walk, which conveniently passes two ABC stores where you can pick up water, soda, beer, snacks, beach gear, etc. The reception area is air conditioned and stylish. The desk staff are so lovely and friendly. On arrival, they explain everything simply and clearly, and thereafter they always make the effort to say hello as you pass. Our room in this hotel reminded me very much of the kind of hotel we're used to in Europe. A modestly sized room with a neat bathroom and a really comfy bed. There's a good air conditioning unit which is a God send. There's also a useful fridge in the room too.A continental breakfast is served in the lounge area by reception and it is awesome!! There's fresh hot coffee (and a variety of teas, including English Breakfast for those Brits who just have to have it [like my wife]), juice and water (available at all times). These are actually available at all times, with takeaway cups which is great. To eat, there are pastries and croissants, etc. I particularly recommend the blueberry toast. To go with it, there are lots of fresh fruit (pineapple, melon, oranges). Beach towels, chairs, Boogie boards are all available to borrow for free if you ask at reception. Let's be clear. Some people will criticise the size of the rooms. This isn't fair and it's not a legitimate criticism, from my POV. We're in Waikiki. You should not be spending much time in the room. The rooms are neat, stylish, up-to-date, well-serviced and comfortable. The en suite bathroom is modern and the water pressure in the shower is excellent. If I try to be excessively critical, the views from the windows are mostly of other hotels and apartment blocks (even then, you do get a good look at the mountains behind and the beach in front).The Vive Hotel Waikiki is great value, in a great location. *Highly* recommended!

I had an amazing stay at this hotel, for my wedding and honeymoon. My husband and I greatly enjoyed the suite we stayed in. The suite was very spacious and the bed was super comfortable. We live here in Hawaii, so it was nice to play tourist and relax after the wedding. KC was very helpful with questions we had and also for things to do. Thank you so much KC!

Loved the modern vibe. Small room but space used efficiently and pleasingly. Free wifi for all devices, beach supplies galore—fantastic. Complimentary breakfast tasty: fruit and fresh pastries (some savory). All day coffee/tea/water a plus. Convenient to everything. One of the very few hotel lobbies we enjoyed hanging out in. Very chill. Will book again.

Have you ever seen such well in and give some breakfast, you have much to come to breakfast to Waikiki We're almost there. I was worried because I faced criticism that there is a small room than anywhere else, it did not inconvenient to stay two. cheap parking and beach supplies also free to lend too good.Have you ever seen such uncomfortable one thing It's not easy to find this hotel is We The shower's fixed except be satisfied all this And I always water and coffee was so great to

This place was fantastic! great location, 1 block away from the beach, helpful and friendly staff. As you would have seen from other reviews, you get free access to beach equipment, coffee, tea & water available all day in their lounge. The hotel itself is nice and modern, rooms are clean, loads of shopping/restaurants close by. Right next door to a bus stop too for those who need to use the bus stop. We would definitely stay here again if we went back to Waikiki

Hotel was clear, lobby is great very spacious with a lot of room to gather and even board games. Always had iced water and coffee available. Staff was nice and accommodating.Pros-Convenient - lots of good food nearby, beaches, etc.Free beach gear- chairs, towels, mats, body board, etc.Breakfast was fine- pastries and fruitBeds were really comfortableCons-Very small rooms and bathrooms, which is probably why they don't charge resort fees. Low clearance of garage and no assistance to find parking spot. 6' clearance, if you're getting a minivan or SUV, don't bother trying to use the lot.AC is loudConsidering its a beach hotel- should have place to hang clothes to dry

We stayed here on our return leg to Australia. The plane landed late, but the hotel reception staff were very friendly and helpful.Obviously the reviews have swayed me to choose this hotel, for both price and location. The rooms were quite small and the safe did not work. That did not put us off too much, as we spent our waking hours away from our rooms. Breakfast was included in the price, which is always appreciated.The check out process was quick and efficient.

This was a lovely, clean, fresh, looking hotel. Breakfast was very good but some cereal would have been nice. The staff were oh so friendly and very helpful. The location was only a block from the beach. Transport outside the door. Room was very small but ok for a day or so if you are out and about but not for a long stay. Overall a lovely boutique hotel.

I really enjoyed staying at this hotel:)I could walk to the beach in 2-3 minutes, and the bus stop was very near the hotel, this place was very convenient for me! Also the free breakfast was excellent!

Very conveniently located, just a block or so back from the mayhem of Waikiki beach. Great lobby, really excellent staff. Both check-in and check-out were extremely efficient, and all the staff were friendly and helpful. It seems like a recent refurbishment of an older hotel. The lifts are extremely slow - 2 lifts for 20+ floors isn't really enough. The rooms are quite nice, but already showing some wear. The shower mostly spurted water at the ceiling, and the wooden stand for the basin was water-stained. Good sized wardrobe with a safe, but v.little drawer space. Bed was comfortable. The hotel was pretty quiet, but the noise from the street meant that we needed earplugs. I think it was due to a combination of single-glazing, plus the air-conditioner unit attached to the window seemed to be letting in a lot of noise. Also, the aircon unit was pretty rubbish - it was incredibly noisy and barely coping to reduce the heat. The continental breakfast in the lobby was a bonus, and the hotel also provided beach towels and mats, which was great. Overall, we had a nice stay here for a couple of days.

Stayed here for a week in February with a friend and couldn't be more happy with our choice of accommodation. The ambiance of the hotel was fantastic and the staff were incredibly helpful and welcoming. KC and Preston displayed outstanding customer service and we were so thankful to have them helping plan our day's events, (We made it to the top of Koko Crater!) Wifi, towels, beach equipment and breakfast were all included and only a short walk to the beach. At the end of our holiday, our flight got cancelled and we hadn't booked for another night, but to our delight Vive hotel offered a bigger room for us to stay in. Couldn't have asked for more from Vive hotel and it's staff. Thank you and we will definitely return one day!

Very impressed indeed with this hotel. Not the most expensive, but stylish and very comfortable - a couple of minutes' walk from the beach. As for the staff, they could not be more helpful if they tried. All of them were pleasant and genuinely tried to please. Big shout out to Paul on Reception - he arranged an upgrade at a discounted rate when we arrived. The room we booked (a superior double with sea view, I think) was perfectly fine, but we wanted more space, so upgraded to a "mini suite" which was amazing.There is a free continental breakfast served until 10am and then fresh coffee is freely available all day. The downstairs lounge area is a cool and comfortable place to sit.The hotel even lends you beach equipment to go to the beach - towels, umbrellas, chairs - even mini "surf board" things, to play in the waves!If you are considering this hotel, don't hesitate! Book now!

We are a family of four and had to find a room for 1 night in Honolulu after our flight arrivalThis hotel on the phone proposed us a «family » room » : two twin rooms with one entranceThe price was good, the staff helpfulHave however in mind : if the lobby is « trendy », the rooms (at least ours) are not...Individual AC making a lot of noise for example Was OK for one night but would not have stayed more because of this reason

Booked for four couples for my wife's special birthday - it was amazing and everyone enjoyed their stay. Looking forward to return with children as there are lots of holiday activities in Waikiki next year

Staff and hotel were excellent. Very insightful staff that took the time to make sure everything was to our liking. We arrived early in the morning and we were still given our room which they had upgraded for us.

The location is great, the staff & service were amazing! Believe me, I'm HUGE on customer service. However, I would not stay there again because the hotel room felt a bit too compacted - they are quite small & we stayed in a Jr. Suite. It was not a bad experience but it wasn't what we expected. The AC wasn't really working and with the humidity it wasn't very pleasant to be in the room too long especially when we tried to sleep. I also didn't like that their continental breakfast ended so early. I think it was 9:30 — perhaps it was just us but we missed it a few times. When we did have it, it wasn't the best, in my opinion. The service is great though, this was a last min find for us since we planned to stay in Ko Olina during our 2 week vacation in Oahu but changed our mind last minute since Waikiki has more things to do that are walking distance, especially for younger couples. The location was the best thing about this hotel.

Good location, friendly staffs, reasonable price. If I visit Oahu, I could choose this hotel. But the sound of aircon in the night was a little bit noisy and the strength of water was weak. Entirely I satisfied for everything.

When we arrived we were greeted by a warm aloha and given some freshly squeezed pineapple juice and a warm towel that smelled like lavender. (Which I kept for most of the night) the rooms are spacious and comfortable. The location is great. Within walking distance of everything Waikiki Beach has to offer. They offer all the amenities you need to enjoy a great day at the beach. Highly recommend you should consider this hotel.

This is a 'try hard' hotel, great staff, great extras, but our standard room was tiny, with a small double bed, noisy air conditioner fitted into the window and an ensuite so tiny you would have to reverse into it! Kuhio street is super noisy so it should have double glazing but it didn't. Our room was so small that with both suitcases open, we couldn't get out of the door. Having stayed in another hotel right on the beach for less than we paid here. Alas, it was a late booking for a popular weekend so our preferred alternative was full. But if you plan ahead, you should be able to find better value for money.

Wonderful little boutique hotel one block from Waikiki beach. Friendly staff, great room, amazing views, and breakfast included.Close to lots of restaurants and plenty of shopping. No complaints about this hotel and would happily book again

I recently stayed here with my husband on our babymoon for 3 nights and I would definitely recommend it. The positives. It's conveniently located just a few minutes from the very popular Waikiki Beach and walking distance to many popular shops and restaurants. All of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We rented a car so we were able to use their valet services for $25/day. The hotel uses a tablet in each room for guests to request services, which I found useful for having our car brought up and ready to go. Since we were still on PST time, waking up at 6am to go hike up Diamond Head was easy for us, but it also meant requesting our car very early, but it was no issue! Another very nice amenity was the free use of beach towels, mats, chairs, and boogey boards. The chairs aren't the most comfortable, but the option was nice. The negatives. Even though the lobby is very nicely done, the room we had felt old. The bathroom was very small and there wasn't much counter space to put much of anything. The paint on the tub was also coming off. The AC unit is a window unit and it's extremely loud. It works well enough, but it will be running all night, so those sensitive to noise might be bothered. It's a constant loud noise, so maybe you can get used to it. I'm usually a very light sleeper and I was able to manage. The bed isn't the comfiest, but it was ok.They do have complimentary breakfast, but we never used it because we always woke up way too early, still following a PST sleeping schedule. All in all, it's a great place to stay for the convenient location, amazing staff, and nice amenities.

Great location, no balconies, view limited, loud air conditioner, small rooms. Breakfast was mostly bread and fruits no eggs or bacon. Air conditioner was weak, had to get it replace while we were there. Mats, towels, boogie boards, beach chairs, limited umbrellas provided. Concierge was great and recommended a great luau. Friendly staff at the front desk. Housekeeping did a great job. Location was the best thing about this hotel.

This hotel is one block back from the beach. It is right in the centre of things. It is a 2 minute walk to Waikiki beach. My only complaint would be the small air conditioner that was in our room. It was not efficient and was quite noisy during the night. The staff were very friendly and provided us with beach mats and towles every day.

I enjoyed my stay, hope to book again.If you enjoy walking around, this would be a ideal place to be. Close enough to the beach. Great places to have breakfast, lunch, dinner. Shopping is a plus. Ala Moana Shopping Center is just a bus ride away.

We´ve been in Oahu last May, and we just ADORE the island!! It’s such a beautiful place! We chose the VIVE HOTEL by its reviews in Trip Advisor. It was said the VIVE Hotel was well located, that it was nicely decorated with an inviting environment and that its personnel was nice and the friendly. Everything was true! Even the welcome pineapple juice and the warm and perfumed towels the hotel hostess offer you at your arrival…great to see right what you expect from a place. Even in a sumptuous town as Waikiki the VIVE Hotel does not let you down. Its location and decoration are just great, not luxurious but fancy, and not in the middle of the loud streets but just three blocks far, what is quite convenient. The staff was great, eager to help even with directions or advise. We were more than grateful for the courtesy room me enjoyed on our last day. Our plane left at 10 pm at night, so we made the check out around 10 am, we went around the island in our rented car (I strongly recommend you rent one to see the island around! The views of the island are just amazing) and around 6, we used the courtesy room to take a shower and change our clothes. After that, we left to the airport feeling fresh and happy! Just to point out a disadvantage, I’d mention the breakfast service. Actually, they clarify that is not a service but an amenity. I have a gluten-free diet and the hotel couldn’t provide me for any options, since they just offer you regular pastries, fruit, some juice and coffee. Besides that, we loved the place. The Vive Hotel is a fantastic option if you want to enjoy of Waikiki’s splendor on a reasonable budget!!

We enjoyed our 1 week stay The Vive Hotel. At first I wasn't too sure as there is no pool and it isn't right on the beach but the price was very reasonable for my family of 4 so we chose to stay there. We are very happy with our choice. The hotel was very clean, the staff were always helpful, our room was great. We had 2 rooms, 2 televisions, 2 bathrooms even though these are small they were serviceable. Air conditioning was on all the time as we were hot and it worked well. We borrowed towels and mats for the beach which was only a very short walk away. Close to Food Pantry and 3 ABC stores. The Bus also stops out the front. Juice, tea, coffee, fruit and pastries were also complimentary to all guests in the mornings. Couldn't have chosen a better hotel. Thank you Vive Hotel we enjoyed our holiday so much!

This hotel is one block back from the beach. It is right in the centre of things. It is a 5 minute walk to Waikiki beach and there is a bus stop at the front door. The buffet breakfast which is provided as complimentary is very good. My only complaint would be the small air conditioner that was in our room. It was not efficient and was quite noisy during the night. The staff were very friendly and provided us with umbrellas when it rained and beach mats and beach umbrellas which was great.

The breakfast was very poor, despite de fruits, one morning we went down during coffee time and it was no longer available. The hotel had confirmed late check out at no charge through Booking (I´m a Genius customer) and not honored. I tried to pay for late check out and even then it was not possible and was offered only a "courtesy room" for 1 hour use in the afternoon. The "courtesy room" was dirty when we used, the impression is that it has not been cleaned properly after use by the last guest. Terrible. The tablets system to schedule room service and car request did not work any of the days too. The staff is friendly , but can not solve all the problems . The air conditioning is very old, extremely noisy and has a bad smell (allergics , beware!).

We stayed here for our honeymoon and this hotel was amazing. We got a free upgrade to an oceanview suite on arrival. Breakfast was always very good and having water and coffee left out all day for free was awesome to have. The hotel was extremely clean and every staff member we came across was very nice and helpful. We loved the free beach gear that was offered such as towels, mats, boogie boards and chairs. Thank you Vive for being an outstanding host for our Honeymoon!

Can't say enough great things about the team at Vive. We arrived early and very jet lagged and requested an early check in. Preston was so lovely and helpful and did not hesitate to find us a room - also gave some great advice on our first place to eat. The complimentary breakfast is a great plus and the concierge services were also awesome. 11/10 for the very friendly and helpful staff ! So close to the beach too ! Would recommend this value for money hotel :-)

We had a great experience with their kind help and hospitality. The best thing is they give us breakfast, all day coffee and water in the lobby, beach towels and mats, and more despite of no resort fee.

Walking distance to Waikiki beach, efficient friendly staff, comfy quiet rooms, close to restaurants and shopping. Thank you to the amazing staff to located my daughters priceless sleeping bunny and sent it back to us. They definitely go above and beyond. They even gave me a gift for my birthday and are always happy to make reservations.

This hotel was really good. Modern, clean, free wifi, close to the beach. Housekeeping are on island time and most of the time didn't come until close to 4pm (so try not to plan coming back for a nap unless you are happy to tell them no service needed).

Two reasons I'm not giving VIVE five star: 1, room is SUPER SMALL. With only two people and three small luggage, there was almost no space for us to turn around! One person must back up to the other side of the room when the other person wants to open the door or walk to the bathroom. However, from what I've heard, most hotels on Waikiki have tiny rooms. So maybe this is the typical size here? 2nd reason for a four star: breakfast was BAD. We only tried it on the first day, then we gave up. We went across the street and buy musubi during the rest of our stay.Everything else was quite satisfying. Bus stop is just steps away. Free beach towels, mats, boogie boards, chairs for you to enjoy the beach. Overall we liked this place.

Staff were very nice upon arrival. Always willing to answer your questions whenever you had any and we're every clear. Room was well maintained during stay. Would have liked the fridge to be a bit colder. Continental breakfast was included as well as WiFi. A bit more selection outside of bread and muffins would be better. Easy access to beach. Bus stop right outside the mason entrance. Overall an enjoyable stay.

Overall our experience at the Vive was very good. The staff were excellent. The rooms were clean and the cleaning staff did an excellent job. The location is good for the beach, shopping and eating establishments. The only negative comment was the room's noisey air conditioning unit. The size of the rooms is a bit on the small size but you do not spend too much time there.

Waste of money if you intend to get some sleep and its a warm night the rooms are so small that the air conditioners are next to your bed and extremely noisy, or switch off A/C and open the 1 window the noise from the street is just as bad, at A$328 per night, extremely disappointed, worst accommodation in 7 weeks in the USA.

The room I booked was a "Queen Cosmopolitan". The room is on the small side but served our purpose. We honestly did not care about the size because we were out all day, anyway. Also, I did not want to spend more. I am sure they have some bigger rooms, but you will have to pay more. My only problem with the room is the AC. It is quite noisy. But on the 3rd night, we got used to it.Location of the hotel is GREAT! Short walk to the beach (less than 5 minutes) and the upscale shopping street (Think Rodeo Drive , Beverly Hills, Ca) . There are small restaurants (hole in the wall type) within 2 minutes walk. "Yelp" the restaurants. They have good reviews.My favorite with this hotel is, it is close enough to the action but when you are in the hotel, it is quiet.Lobby/ lounge area has eclectic decors. It nice and cool, relaxing.Water , Tea and Coffee available 24/7

From the moment we walked in the front door we knew we had made the right decision. Vive Hotel Waikiki ticked all the boxes for our 4 day stay. Fabulous staff, friendly and informative and having beach towels, chairs and umbrellas at our disposal was an added bonus. The daily fresh fruit and breads were the perfect start and the all day tea, coffee and chilled water topped it off. We loved the décor of the foyer, so stylish, comfortable and refreshingly different . Our room was simple, clean and comfortable with great pillows. The Vive Hotel is only a 2 minute walk away from the beach and so handy to every amenity you would require. We will certainly return.

The staff at Vive Hotel are incredibly friendly and accommodating. I liked that they provide towels, chairs and beach mats for free. The location is good, just two blocks from the beach and central to many bus lines. Free breakfast and WIFI were some nice features. On the downside, the rooms are rather small. There was some chipped paint in our room. The bed linens are acceptable but the towels and toilet paper are very rough. The shower head in our room was terrible. It either sprayed water everywhere, flooding the bathroom or trickled against the wall. The other downside was the window air conditioning unit. We arrived late at night and had trouble sleeping in the heat. It eventually cooled the room to a comfortable level over the course of our stay but wasn't the best. Would I stay at Vive Hotel again? Possibly. But after seeing what else the island has to offer, there are probably some better choices. It's a good value for the low price.

First day when we checked in Preston helped us out so much. He gave me a lot of great info on the location and things to do. He also gave me some places to visit and places to stay clear from. The location of the hotel is really close to Waikiki Beach and there are so many places that are in walking distance. The room I stayed in was small but it was perfect because I really didn't plan on staying in there often. The service was great and they have things that you can rent for free like boogie boards, beach towels, bamboo mats, and beach chairs.Breakfast was also nice because they had fresh fruit and small pastries. Free coffee all day which was fantastic.Only downside is that the parking is $25 for 24 hours but being that there wasn't a whole lot of parking in the area it was convenient. Not to mention you can come and go as you please in that 24 hour period.

Small but adequate rooms and nice service from staff. The only trouble is the outside noise: despite being on the ninth floor, from 06:00 am hours, the noise of service trucks will not let you sleep any more

We were upgraded to a suite for our honeymoon, which was such a pleasant surprise. The staff was very friendly, the facilites clean and well maintained. Overall, staying at Vive Waikiki was comfortable, relaxing and one that will certtainly bring us back again.

First the CON ... it has a window unit AC ... lots of smaller, less than 4/5 star hotels nearby have window units; therefore, it's not necessarily a bad thing but it is definitely noisier than a central unit. It nevertheless effectively cools your room as well as a central unit, if not better. I dinged them a half a star for this. Another CON is regular two bed room is tad small. I also rented a family suite with 2 queen beds and it was much more roomier and more comfortable, but more expensive. It does not have a swimming pool but the beach is minutes away. Now the PROS: 1) Complimentary continental breakfast with plenty of fresh fruits2) Free WIFI3) Comfortable lobby4) Friendly and courteous staff, who helped me pack a few breakfast pastries for my kids because our tour bus left before 7 am breakfast start time. Also, they have  a scale to check the weight of our check-in bags prior to going to the airport.5) Free chair and boogie board use / free beach towel / mat for use6) Modern and space efficient design cues and amenities in the rooms7) Overall cleanliness of the hotel8) Close to Waikiki beach, 3 blocks, 3 minute walk.9) Lots of shopping and dining choices nearby10) Relatively reasonable price

We booked this place because 1. it was in a great location, 2. we wouldn't be spending that much time at the accommodation, so it was a great price. It is only a 2 minute walk from the beach, and I found it very central (about an 8-10 minute walk from H&M, Forever 21 and the Cheesecake Factory). It was also very convenient to catch the public bus and many of them stopped outside (to go to Diamond Head, Ala Moana Shopping Centre, etc.).We got there super early and they gave us an option of putting us in a room that wasn't on a high level or we could drop our bags off and go for a walk. We choose the latter but not having our room ready was something that we expected.The rooms aren't huge, the bathroom is definitely a bit of squeeze - reminds of me the Butterfly Hotel I stayed at in Hong Kong. In saying that, there's enough space for 2 suitcases and to put all your shopping.The staff are very friendly, and don't mind having a conversation with you in the lift. They also gave us a lot of information about the places around and the public bus system. The breakfast in the morning doesn't have a lot of options but I did love the fresh fruits! It's great that they have water, tea and coffee available all day in the lobby. I loved their bed-side tablet - it was an alarm clock, internet, etc.I would stay here again because it's easy!

Great service. Welcoming staff from the moment you arrive, fresh glass of juice and moist towel provided when checking in. Much appreciated after a 10 hour flight. AM complimentary breakfast has many pastries fruit coffee teas juice and water. Lobby is nicely decorated in modern stylish decor. Valet parking is located on second floor, valet attendants were prompt and courteous. You can request for the car to be ready from the tablet that is in your room (very handy!!!) Can also schedule what time you would prefer for your room to be cleaned on the tablet.Junior suite with sea view is a great room, spacious with nice sized closet and great counter space by the bathroom sink as well as a large shower. Bed was comfortable. Room is outside a busy street, noise can sometimes be heard at night but not loud enough to keep you awake. Beach is 2 minute walk, easy, hotel provides mats, chairs and towels to borrow which was great. Concierge helped me book a couple of activities in Oahu and gave good suggestions of places to visit and the best times to avoid crowds. Everyone I met at the hotel was gracious and attentive to my needs which was nice as I was travelling solo but it was the best vacation I've had thus far. If you are okay with not having a pool or restaurant directly on site, this is the place to go! There are plenty of dining options within walking distance nearby, by bus or rental car if you happen to have one.

We stayed here one night when we had a layover on our way to Australia and wish we could have stayed longer. Great little hotel right off the beach of Waikiki. Walking distance to everything. Staff was super helpful and friendly. Room was smaller but clean. Lobby was very eclectic. Biggest complaint was breakfast selection. Literally all starches. Nothing healthy at all.

We stayed 2 nights at the beginning of our holiday in Oahu.The location is a plus - just a few blocks from Waikiki Beach.The lobby is the highlight of the hotel with comfortable seating and tea/coffee and water available 24/7. Breakfast is included in the rate - fruit, pastries and bread.The rooms are clean but very small and quite noisy.Service was friendly and great!Would recommend for a short stay - not a week!

Great location, close to the beach and the restaurants. The staff is very friendly and wants to help us. Every morning, there was a breakfast served. The breakfast was correct. The room was clean but a little bit small.

Location: Minutes from the beach and The Bus stop is right outside the door. Great shopping within walking distance & easy walk to many of the tours pickupGreat value for money as the location is perfectly situated and the complimentary extras are useful and are the daily necessities. It is less than 5 minutes to the beach and The Bus stop is right at the front door. The complimentary breakfast comprises of toast, pastries and fresh fruit, and there is always ample as a couple of mornings we went down at the tail end of breakfast service (7am-9.30am), plus all day coffee and iced water. There is also a computer at concierge which can be used by guests. We stayed in a basic room, and it was exactly that a basic room, bed, desk and a bathroom comprising of a bath/shower, basin and toilet all in one room. We basically used our room for sleeping, storage and showering. It was incredibly clean which is very important to me. PS The free coffe is actually quite good.

Great place to stay in the centre of Waikiki. Close to the shops, restaurants and beach. Easy to get around with the Bus services. The bus stop located just next to the hotel. Complimentary breakfast was satisfactory. Fresh fruit, toast, tea and coffee served every morning.

This place is a gem! It's 2-3 short blocks straight to waikiki beach and in my opinion, the best spot on the beach. When we checked in, they gave us cold, scented towels to refresh ourselves and pineapple juice. It was a nice little perk. The check in was fast and every person who works here are helpful and nice. The internet is free and it's good and fast. The room is small but honestly it's hard to notice - it still has a desk, fridge, etc. They make smart use of space and it feels nice and cozy. The AC kept the room cool and was not loud at all. The rooms were quiet and clean. The fridge had a sticker that said that it may not keep the food cold enough to eat later so that was disappointing. We had lots of leftovers that would've been great but we didn't risk it We only kept drinks in there. The breakfast was very nice. Coffee, tea, pineapple juice, toast, fresh fruit and assorted pastries. They changed it up each day. Some of the pastries even had meat in them. We ended up borrowing boogie boards, chairs, and towels for the first day at the beach. We ended up buying a blow-up raft from the ABC store a block away and they filled it up for us with air ($3.99) so we didn't use the boogie boards. We didn't use the chairs either. I wanted to have a lounge chair and umbrella so we ended up renting 2 beach lounge chairs and an umbrella for $50 for the whole day. The place we rented from (star beachboys) is right on the beach - a straight shot from the hotel. The hotel also let you borrow as many towels as you want for the beach so we borrowed 4 the 2nd day. When you get back from the beach, there's a basket that you drop your towels into right when you get back into the hotel. It's very nice and convenient. We didn't have a car so we didn't use the parking. The hotel room also had a tablet that you can order more towels, a room cleaning, more toiletries, a cab, etc. We ordered our hotel shuttle on it and also ordered room service quite a few times. It's part of the Waikiki Room Service network so you order from a set list of restaurants in the area and they deliver right to your room - so nice! I've stayed in Hawaii and Waikiki specifically many times and in many different places. We opted for a queen bed room without a view. Now that I've been here I think that was a good choice - I don't think it would be worth it to pay more money for a limited view. Especially because it's so close to the beach - just go to the real thing rather than getting a glimpse from your room. This was our first time at Vive and this will be my go-to hotel from now on when I'm in Waikiki. In fact, when we come next, if this place is booked, I might change my travel dates to make sure I get to stay here the next time I come back.

Very good stay at Vive Hotel Waikiki. Staff is very friendly and professional, always trying to help. Complimentary beach towels, chairs are provided by the hotel which is fantastic. Room was very clean, no noise and I loved the tabled in the room which we could use to surf, make a request etc. Two blocks away from Waikiki Beach and stores. Valet parking was excellent. Complimentary breakfast is an added value although it is basic (maybe a bit boring after staying a week but very good to start the day). I will deferentially come back to this hotel.

The staff were friendly and informativeThe breakfast was complimentary and was good enough to pull u through the morningThe room we had was the junior suite which was quite big and located high up with good viewsThere was also a lot of equipment to loan like boggie boards，chairs mats etc

This hotel is simply excellent! Everything there was super! It was our first stay in Hawaii and it was great! I strongly recommend this hotel. Water, coffee and tea were available during all day. Staff are very helpful and friendly. The hotel is a bit pricy, but nothing special in this location :-).

Wonderful place at a fair price.We were two blocks from Waikiki Beach. The staff was the best we have ever had. They were very friendly and helpful. They went out of their way to make our stay special!

It was our first stay in Hawaii and were scoped many hotels before settling on Vive. We settled on cost, location and need for Wifi . Beautiful hotel lobby and common area for socialising or relaxing. Water, tea and coffee 24/7. Breakfast ( fruit and pastries) were good, although could do with slight change ups e.g. eggs/ cheese. Staff were friendly, attentive, willing to assist and helpful. They were not overbearing. Room was a bit small but suited us perfectly. Shower over bathroom. All our requests and queries were dealt really well. We did not see any kids in the hotel and although we were on the 18th floor, lifts we quick and easy to access. City view was impressive but we spent lots of time in Waikiki. We were lucky to meet two of the managers on a Hotel held quiz night- light catered. They were just as relaxed and social as the rest of the staff. Great for couples and great pricing.

Loved this hotel, it has the feeling of a small boutique hotel. The staff were so friendly, helpful and efficient. Breakfast included was great. It was also a very good location close to the beach, shopping and restaurants. While we were there they held a trivia quiz night which was lots of fun a good way of meeting people and hearing of their experiences in Waikiki and also had the added bonus of good prizes. Will definitely stay again.

I found the hotel to be in good area. The hotel staff were really friendly and accomodating. They have a tour desk and were happy to give suggestions and directionsThe room itself was small however as I was by myself this didn't matter. The air conditioner was very loud and didn't cool the room.

Located less than 5 minutes from the Duke statue on Waikiki it was an ideal location. Amenities are average, but staff helpfulness and friendliness more than made up for it! Highly recommended if combining location with cost, helpfulness and relaxing.

Location, friendly staffs, cleanliness, complimentary breakfast no resort fee!! The Room was small but cozy and comfort. Everything was perfect to enjoy my vacation. I will definetly stay again at vive hotel in the future.

We had a good stay at Vive Hotel. It is in a convenient location, only a few minutes walk to Waikiki beach and a bus stop right outside the hotel. The hotel staff were very nice and helpful with changing money and helping with organizing trips. Nice welcome, they provided us with a glass of pineapple juice and a refresher towel. The room was small, but it was clean. Breakfast included tropical fruit and bread as well as Kona coffee and selected teas. While not an extravagant breakfast selection, it was all that you required for breakfast. It was great being able to help yourself to coffee, tea and ice cold water when you needed throughout the day. The hotel also provided complimentary beach towels for when you wanted to go to the beach and that was great as well. Good wi-fi.The disappointing aspect of the hotel is that there is no central air conditioning so there are individual air conditioning units inside each room. While operating, they were quite noisy. I had to sleep with ear plugs in to reduce the noise and didn't have the best night sleeps. Apart from this, the hotel was good.

Great hotel! Very comfortable and friendly. The location was fantastic, 2 blocks from the beach in a very popular area. I was able to let my 13 year old head to the beach first thing in the morning. The staff was very accommodating!

The location of this hotel made it a good home base for our recent vacation. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We supposedly received an upgrade, but the room was still very very small. Didn't mind too much since we didn't come to Hawaii to sit in hotel. Just needed a clean place to sleep :)

My husband and I were pleased with our stay at the Vive Hotel in Waikiki. The room was very comfortable and clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. They gave us great tips about Honolulu. Nice, short walk to the beach from the hotel and downtown Waikiki. Beach chairs, mats, and towels were provided. The hotel was a great value and I definitely recommend it for anyone staying in Waikiki.
user_name:
Nicole H
North Kingstown, Rhode Island

review_body: Hotel is comfortable and clean, friendly staff. Short walk to beach with beach chairs and mats available for use. Great place to stay before or after Hawaiian island cruise. Great for people who visit Oahu who want to see the beauty of the island not stay in the confines of a hotel.

The Vive has a nice lobby area which offers free continental breakfast in the morning and free tea and coffee during the day. Staff were overall friendly and helpful. The hotel is about 5 minutes away from Waikiki beach and the hotel offers free beach gear. On the negative side, the rooms are extremely small and while attempts have been made to update them, they felt tired. There is not enough storage and the bathroom was tiny. There are larger junior suites available but all were booked during our stay. The air conditioning unit was noisy and even switching it off and opening the window still meant that you heard a lot of noise from the other air con units. The view from the hotel was rather grim looking onto another grey apartment block but that is to be expected in this location in Waikiki. We had no balcony. Dressing gowns and free wifi are provided. There is also an iPad which was great because it allows you to schedule room cleaning etc. There was no resort fee. There is valet parking which felt a bit cramped and the charge is $25 per day. Overall, I felt a bit disappointed by the hotel and the worn appearance of the room as well as its size. I stayed in the Royal Hawaiian and the Modern and while both are more expensive I felt they offered better value for money.

Our hotel room was called a cosmopolitan room and the styling of the furniture, artwork, etc. was very consistent with an urban boutique hotel. The only comment is that the room is on the smaller side although not at all cramped.The complementary buffet breakfast had plenty of fruit and pastries as well as all day fresh coffee. The staff at this hotel are excellent. They really go above and beyond to help customers and provide a worry free experience. After a long day of traveling we were greeted with cold scented face towels and fresh pineapple juice. When our internet stopped working a staff member came up to the floor and fixed the problem in less than 10 minutes. If you plan to spend any time on Waikiki beach (a 2 minute walk away) the hotel provides everything including towels, beach chairs and beach mats.

Lovely, free breakfast. Great location in the heart of Waikiki near Canoes surf break and Duke statue. Walking distance to plenty of restaurants. Small rooms. Parking is extra. Don't rent a car at the airport if you are mostly going to stay in Waikiki. You can rent cars in Waikiki for day trips and then you don't have to worry about paying for parking.

The decor of the place was nice. Did like it. The breakfast was the same everyday.Bread, rolls, pastries, cantaloupe, pineapple, mango, oranges. Pineapple juice, water, coffee. One day they had pork sausage roll. But only one day. The place is 2 short blocks away from the beach. Easy walk and hotel provides towel, mats, and anything else you need for the beach. The room was really small. To small for my liking. That is why I rate the place with 4 stars. For the price I could get a full size room. But, that is my opinion, someone else may like the small room. Had a ocean side room, but it's really seeing between the building on the ocean. It was okay. If you have a car. It's $25.00 a day for valet parking. Free in and out. It was worth the money ,because there is really no place to park.

Really enjoyed my stay at the Vive hotel, great staff, great location all at a good price. Would recommend to anyone staying in Waikiki. The only downside (and minor at that) would be the breakfast however it is what it is advertised as. Cannot recommend this hotel enough.

This hotel has a fantastic location very close to the beach, about a 3 minute walk. Check in was easy and we were given pineapple juice on arrival. The rooms themselves are very clean and the bed was super comfortable. We were able to borrow beach equipment such as towels and boards, as well as a HDMI cable to connect the laptop to the TV in the room from reception.The continental breakfast contains fruit and bread/pastries, as well as tea and coffee. Tea and coffee are also available throughout the day. The only downside is that the plates and tables in the breakfast area are very small. During busy times in the morning it can be hard to get a seat to eat at. Apart from this, this hotel is excellent value for the location and would love to stay here again.

I have never heard of Vive Hotel Waikiki. I still don't know if it is a chain or not. The price, for Hawaii, was excellent which is what brought us to this hotel. Upon checking in I noticed a stark difference between this hotel and others. The normal check in provides room information and hotel amenities. This hotel took the time to show where things are on a map, like the closest grocery store and most reasonable place to buy things. The people who run and maintain this place are exceptional!The room appears to be very modern, contemporary, and makes use of limited space. While the room was small in square feet, it was exceptionally well designed to make full use of the space. It was clean and neat.The lobby was nicely planned and felt more like a large living room with books to read, board games to play, and conversation nooks all about.This is a great place to stay!

Where to start from? They greeted us with a big smile, a warm towel and a refreshing glass of pineapple juice.. what else could you want after a long flight? Amazing position in the heart of Waikiki just a couple of minutes from the most amazing beach I have ever seen and of course surrounded by yummy reasonable priced local restaurants and shops. The hotel itself is so beautiful, modern and super CLEAN (I am so picky about that but I guarantee it is so clean and always smells fresh!)! The complementary breakfast is DELICIOUS, lots of fresh tasty fruits and pastries and of course amazing local Hawaiian coffee which by the way along with chilled lemon water is available all day. The staff is great, always there for you to help you schedule guided tours or just answer questions about the area. They are all so knowledgeable and kind (Adam was so so helpful!). The room we stayed in was a cosmopolitan queen, super comfortable bed and once again great decor.. the only down side was the loud air conditioner but it saved us from hearing noise from the street which can get a little noisy if you are sensitive to that because of all the fun events and music they have down there at night! I have traveled the world and this is the first time that I am 100% satisfied with an hotel that makes me feel at home and trust me I am picky! Oh they also provide beach gear like towels and mats.. NO RESORT FEE and all this?!? Just amazing amazing place to stay, I will definitely stay again if I get the chance to visit beautiful Hawaii! Mahalo vive hotel!

My visit to Honolulu was at the end of 6 busy weeks visiting mainland USA. It was a busy trip so my visit was to have a rest in the warm weather before returning to winter. My arrival at Vive was a day later than planned and I arrived about midnight. Check in was fast, the room, while adequate for one, was very clean. A concierge organised a one day visit to Maui for me. I appreciated his help and had a wonderful day, thank you Kris.

Every employee we met from the garage attendant to the front desk crew was extremely friendly and helpful - in a genuine way. That friendliness along with the convenient location and a clean, cold room made up for the fact that the room was small. Compared to other options in Waikiki, this place rocks!

Quite nice hotel, beautiful design, but in general not impressive. Friendly staff, but not outstanding service. In my opinion the parking is too expensive. Breakfast is just fruits and pastry, good point is that tea/coffee/water is available 24/7. Air conditioning in the room is TOO LOUD. Location is good, even if the "ocean view" is just a little piece of ocean far far away :)

This is a small hotel located two blocks back from the beach. So the cost is lower while offering a location close to all the key amenities and the beach. Our breakfast was included in the room cost and offered a good range of fresh fruit, pastries, toast, juice, tea and coffee. The rooms are small but comfortable and adequate and the staff were friendly and helpful.

Excellent location near the beach. Good value compared to other hotels nearby especially with complimentary breakfast. Staff always welcoming and cheerful. We would definitely stay here again and recommend to others.

we had 3 rooms, staff friendly and helpfull, no balcony and rooms slightly smallish, new and fresh, good location, no amenity fee, good continental breakfast with fresh fruit, large sitting area on ground floor to sit read and relax, less expensive than other hotels although not for parking

Incredible location and value for money, helpful friendly staff, beautiful comfy rooms with great views, perfect amount of breakfast on offer, love love love Vive. Will definitely stay here again! Highly recommended.

This boutique hotel is amazing. It is well-positioned with a short 5 minute walk to the hub of Waikiki and busses near front door to take you anywhere you want to go!
