The staff were super friendly and went out of their way to assist with anything. The serviced rooms are adequate, clean and very reasonably priced! Free use of beach towels, mats and chairs. The dining area consisted of chairs/lounges with little tables was very quaint and informal. The continental breakfast was lovely and best of all it was included in the great room price! We will definitely stay here again!!

Comfortable, conveniently located hotel with friendly and very helpful staff. Room was smallish, but functional. Window air-conditioner a bit noisy, and opening window allowed outside noise disturbance.

I have stayed at "vive hotel" for 7 nights.The hotel seams to be freshly refurbished.The rooms are clean and the furniture is new and comfortable. Biggest plus was a really good WiFi all day around.There is coffee for free in the lobby.Breakfast was good (but no meat), fruits and pastries. The staff is friendly and competent. There is also someone in the lobby, where you can book trips and adventures. (I have only booked my airport transfer with her so I cannot tell anything about the quality of the trips)I liked my stay there and would fully recommend to stay here.

We were booked at a hotel down the street which we soon found looked nothing like the pictures, was gross and unsettling. When we moved to VIVE we felt right at home. Its cozy with a good location. Friendly staff and hip vibe. Was a great home base for our adventures on the west, north and east sides of Oahu. Great modern amenities cater to millennial nature and there was always a secure place to leave the car (no parking on Oahu streets). Do note that if you stay on a high floor (we were on 19) the wind howling through the buildings outside gets pretty loud at night. But I imagine that is any hotel in a big city like Waikiki.

We loved this place I booked like 6 months in advance so I got a good room rate. The breakfast was good it only consisted of fruit and pastries though if your looking for more plus juice and coffee. Loved how we checked in we were greeted with juice and towel to freshen up after a long flight the staff were super friendly and helpful loved the valet guys parking is 25 dollars a day but you don't have to worry about parking which is good down there. Close walk to the Waikiki strip and beach with plenty to eat and shop I will definite stay again!! The rooms are nice a little small but we were never in our room the hotel has a nice contemporary feel! I recommend staying here for this was the best place we've stayed so far for a good price from the times we been out to Waikiki before thank you Vive for a wonderful stay!

Located close to the beach, outgoing and nice staff. Parking is valet only but only $12.50 a day with registration on their website. Offer a nice continental breakfast with pastriesc fresh fruit, coffee, and juice.

We chose this hotel rather than a large beach front hotel.Just two short blocks back from the beach and a short walk to the main shopping centres.Arrived early but were able to access our rooms.Rooms were clean and beds comfy, we had a lifestyle JR suite with a "sea view"Staff all friendly and helpful, they provide beach towels, body boards, and mats.Lovely lounge area where they provide a free continental breakfast, and coffee and tea throughout the day.Stayed for a few days before and after going to another island with family and both times the rooms were amazing.Would definitely go back.
user_name:
Shootingstars R
New South Wales, Australia

review_body: We had a couple of rooms for 4 nights in this relaxed hotel in a great location a couple of blocks from Waikiki beach. The staff were really friendly and helpful, the continental breakfast was more than enough to start the day and iced lemon water was available all day. Wifi and beach towels were free. The rooms were compact but had everything including a safe, fridge (not cold enough to freeze), a desk and plenty of hanging space, the bathroom had a shower over bath. The rooms are noisy and the air conditioner in one room was noisy and inefficient and didn't keep the room cool so sleeping wasn't easy but the other room had a newer air conditioner which was quiet and kept the room cool. There is no pool but the beach is a short walk away as are the many shops, cafes and restaurants. It's ideal if you don't need a big resort style hotel with pool and gym etc, we were out every day and had no time or need to use them. We did a tour and the pick up was across the road. We used Hawaii23 transport to pick us up from the airport and return, only $37 for us all (plus the usual tip).

Booked VIVE after finding out my room at Imperial Vacation hotel had a pull down bed. Arrived at VIVE and received an early check in, upgrade to high level room, pineapple juice and warm towel. (It's the little things) Spent 3 nights with very friendly staff, good location and modern / trendy rooms and lobby. Would highly recommend VIVE to anyone. First time and probably last time I've written a review but I really felt obliged to in this case.

Great location and helpful and friendly staff. Nice ambiance. Near beach and restaurants. Visiting with family staying at condo and this was close to their place. Easy walking distance to beach, zoo and aquarium. Lovely decor in lobby with guest access to computer. Beach towels, chairs, and mats also available at no charge.

PROs:Amenities - savings on beach gears (don't have to buy/rent beach mat, chairs, towels, boogie boards) and bfast (even though just pastries and fruits, have to try out the islands' best bfast anyway on some days). coffee/tea/water/juice are avail 24/7. love the mini tablet in the room (easy room requests and for valet car daily). Value and Location - great deal from Expedia; other hotels around charge more for parking; 2 or 3 blocks from Waikiki beach (Duke statue) and walking distance to a lot of good food and some shopping; was on 15th floor, no noise overnight. Service - every employee was friendly and exceptional! esp those at daily valetsCONs:Room - bedroom w/ 1Q bed is tiny and could use a box spring under the mattress. Weak wifi and tv/signal on some nights.Location - if driving, since in Waikiki, could experience some slight traffic getting in and out of the area.Overall, pros exceeds the slight cons. Would recommend and personally go back.

My Bf and I stayed here for 5 days. We had such an incredible time. The staff was beyond amazing and very helpful. They all took time to make us feel welcome and always inform us on places to visit. I will for sure stay here again. Definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting Honolulu.

Great location , nice & helpful staff , morning breakfast fresh & nicely arranged , mellow & comfortable atmosphere , beautiful surroundings , was easy to drop car off to valet everyone we encountered were polished and professional

We were able to walk almost everywhere we wanted to go. Such a great experience. This was our first visit ti Hawaii and I must say this was the best visit ever. Nothing couldn't have been better. Thank you Vive Hotel!

We stayed at Vive for a week. The room was a good size for 2 people. Check-in was quite the first impression with the friendly employees carrying our bags in and being met with cold towels and Pineapple juice. Breakfast consisted of small pastries, fruit, coffee, pineapple juice, and tea. There's only valet parking for $25 a day, a pretty steep price when we rented a car for a day and parked it overnight, in which we were charged $50. Everything thing else was great, room cleaned everyday and new towels and robes when requested.

My wife and I spent 5 nights at the Vive and thought it was a great value for the amenities received. We had stayed at another hotel last year on Kuhio Ave. and it was also good value, but the A/C and the street noise was at times too much to bear as we are light sleepers and were always tired after a full day of leisure. We requested a room with quiet A/C and not facing Kuhio Ave (i.e., the quietest room we could get for the room type and daily rate we chose) and the Vive fulfilled our request. It was a very nice room, #702. We had a mountain view but we didn't care because we used our room to rest in. The room had a queen sized bed, a chair, some open cubicles in the furniture for our clothes and two adjustable window screens for filtered light or to black out light. The window also opened manually. The in-room safe was free and easy to use.The free WIFI was the fastest and most reliable we've ever encountered and the wide flat screen TV was almost free of defects (there was a narrow vertical line to the side of the screen) but again, it was a non-issue. We notified the customer service staff and they offered to replace the TV but we didn't feel it was necessary for us. The small in-room fridge was not very cold and there was a sign in the fridge stating this. We did ask for the fridge to be replaced in the middle of our stay but the replacement unit was not any colder. We managed to keep most things cold by requesting bags of ice almost daily, which we kept in the fridge. There is no ice machine, it had to be requested from the front desk staff or via the Android pad used as the room clock and service request device. We tried calling the front desk using the wireline phone but it didn't work. Talking directly to the front desk staff was best and the staff was always responsive and quick to fulfill our requests.The amenity we prized almost as much as the quiet room was the daily continental breakfast, consisting of fresh fruit (at least 3 kinds), non-warehouse baked pastries (savories and sweet), small muffins, fresh coffee, hot water for tea, juice and ice water. There is a toaster oven, two microwaves and a regular toaster. The free breakfast started our day on a bright note leaving us more time to enjoy Waikiki. The lobby/dining portion of the hotel was nicely decorated with comfortable sofas, chairs, cushions and small tables with one long communal cable. The A/C in the lobby was just right.Parking is $25 a day and that prevented us from renting a car for more than a day; we did take the public buses, and going home took the #20 bus from the stop just a few yards away from the Vive to the airport.We hope we will be able to stay at the Vive again soon and will highly recommend the Vive to our friends and family.

Good location, super staff and a comfortable, clean room. Included breakfast was certainly above average and the price was right. You can certainly pay more (to get another block closer to the water), but Vive hits the sweet spot in value, service and location.

Excellent location. Staff amazing, room and view spectacular. Daily breakfast including blueberry bread and fresh fruit, delicious. Close to supermarket, beach, awesome food truck for easy meals and activities. Great hotel, recommended to all who come to Waikiki.

Staff were fantastic, concierge service was great - very helpful. Location was great as far as easy access to city (public bus) and shuttle buses, also just a short walk to the beach. But it could get very noisy with street noise and sirens through the night. Breakfast was more than adequate, plenty of fruit and pastries, also had toast with jams, as well as coffee, tea, juice and water.

The staff was very friendly and helpful! We really enjoyed our stay. I would recommend this place to family with young kids. The location of the hotel was really good too only one block away from the waikiki beach. The breakfast was ok but it is close to other restaurants

Nice medium sized boutique hotel just a few blocks from the beach and upscale shopping areas of Waikiki. Surprisingly friendly staff - valet was excellent, and the friend that was driving us around ended up parking here a couple times. Continental breakfast was tasty - really fresh fruit and good coffee and pastries - but a little lacking in protein options. Comfortable bed and pillows, slept great.

Room size was small but adequate. Included breakfast was nice. Staff friendly and very helpful. Location 2 blocks from beach and bus stop next door. Clean and tidy! Reception area and concierge very helpful we booked our tours through them. 2 lifts with very little wait.

Great place. Very efficient and very helpful staff. We enjoyed our stay here! Close to Waikiki and most of the restaurants and of course the beach. They offered beach mats and other amenities free of cost. It was a great place! Thank you!

We were able to check in at 7am even though our check in was at 3pm. They went above and beyond to help us throughout our stay helping us with bus routes and tours. Would definitely stay there again the service was amazing

The location was just 2 minutes walk from the beach. And also walking distance from most restaurants and shopping. The breakfast was ok but a little more variety and choices would have been nice. The rooms were adequate for our need as we were out all day and only there at night. The fact that you could get the beach towels, chairs and other items at the front desk was convenient. They also help you book things like car rental and activities.

I stayed for 6 nights and was more than satisfied with my visit. The hotel was a lot cheaper than a large majority of Resorts/other properties in Waikiki, so I booked and treated myself to the Junior Suite (only £150 more for the stay).Arrived very late after over 24 hours of travel, greeted with an ice cold glass of juice and a cooling towel. The staff were friendly and checked me in no problem. My Junior Suite was on the 20th floor with a view of the mountains to one side and a view of Waikiki/Diamond Head/the sea from the other.The room was large and well appointed. Big comfy bed, a desk, multiple chairs, a separate wardrobe/storage area and a big bathroom with all the toiletries and a large walk in shower. Each room also has its own Tablet computer with lots of helpful info on it from local attractions to hotel info. Free WiFi is throughout and it was of a good standard. The Junior Suite has two Air Con units, one on each side of the building (the room is on a corner) and they worked very well - although I will say, on the first night, we had exceptional winds outside and they were blowing right through the vents which prevented me from getting any decent sleep. Other than the first night, though, I didn't really have any problems with that. Staff throughout were friendly, and answered all my queries efficiently. After the first night, my room hadn't been serviced so I asked at Reception whether I needed to tell them I wanted it serviced (there's a note in the room stating this) but they claimed I didn't and it should be done every day, and that I shouldn't leave my Do Not Disturb sign out - I didn't leave my sign out, so no idea why it wasn't cleaned. After that it was serviced every day. A continental breakfast is included in the price, the small breakfast area can get very crowded in the morning but I generally timed it well and managed to get a seat. The selection is limited unless you really like your fruit - but it's free, and I just stocked up on pastries instead. On my last night I had to use the Valet parking and this was very easy. Simply drive upstairs and leave it with them, and when collecting my car was ready within minutes. Excellent service, price was reasonable at $25 for 24 hours considering what others charge.Overall, I enjoyed my stay at Vive Hotel. The hotel is nicely decorated, the Junior Suites are well appointed and comfortable, and as I say it was much cheaper than the Resorts (because it doesn't have any restaurants or pools - but with so much to do in Waikiki, you don't need those things anyway!). I'd consider coming here again on my next visit to Oahu.

We stayed at Vive for two nights while in Honolulu. Our room was on the ninth floor, was clean, well kept and had a very pleasing decor. This hotel has window/room air conditioning units. This was very adequate and presented us no problems. All staff were friendly and very helpful. The included breakfast was nice but, lacked protein sources. The coffee is delicious! Would stay here again! The location is two blocks from the beach and there is a bus stop right outside the hotel.

Check in was quick and easy. They offered us pineapple juice and cold face towels at the front desk while checking in. Really friendly staff. We had a cosmopolitan queen suite which was on the smaller side but not really an issue for us since we didn't have a large luggage nor were we in our rooms a lot during our stay. No exhaust fan in the bathroom though. In-room safe. Free breakfast every morning from 7am-9:30am. Lots of fresh fruit, pineapple juice, kona coffee, tea, baked goods. Toaster and toaster oven available. Free local calls from hotel room. One block from Waikiki Beach. Walking distance to a lot of good cheap eats (like Marukame Udon, Surf N Turf Tacos, Musubi Cafe Iyasume, Me's BBQ). Bus stop right out front for multiple bus routes (Pearl Harbor, airport). Beach towels, mats available for use. No resort fees. Concierge service from 8am-2pm daily. Internet computer available in lobby. Check out is at noon and was quick and simple for us. They held our luggage after check out since we had a late flight (10pm). The best amenity was the option of using a courtesy room for an hour on the day of check out - this was basically a Cosmopolitan Queen room. We were able to shower, watch tv, nap, reorganize our luggage (had a day of shopping after check out). Since we were out for the entire day, it was great having the option of a shower before our flight home.

Not much place to put your luggage, but we over packed not knowing what we needed. This being the first time to Hawaii. Next time I will only bring my swim suit and a couple shorts instead of two full pieces of luggage.

The hotel was in a good location, just a 5-10 min walk to the beach. We got upgraded to a partial sea view so it was nice having some view of the sea from the bedroom. Room and toilet were clean. The a/c in the first room we stayed in was very very noisy, we couldn't sleep and had to turn off the a/c when we slept (room 1406). Maintenance came to check and said it was the same for all rooms, but the 2nd room we stayed in the a/c was much much better. Sign up for the hotel membership if you want to get a free room upgrade and 50% valet parking (self parking not available like most hotels in Waikiki). We chose this hotel partly because parking seemed like one of the cheapest for the area. There is complimentary breakfast but it was very basic, just bread and croissants and fruits. Acaoffee/tea available throughout the day. Staff were very friendly and overall good hotel in a good location.

Awesome place to stay. Close to everything. Staff a extremely happy and helpful from the start to the end. Breakfast was really nice great selection. Love that they supply beach towels and chairs. KC the concierge was extremely helpful she goes above and beyond for her guests. I will be recommending this hotel to my friends and cant wait to go back/

Great boutique hotel a five minute stroll from the beach. Our room was on the small side but manageable, the staff were so friendly and helpfull, complimentary beach towels, chairs and mats did the job when visiting the beach. The complimentary breakfast was a lovely, healthy feast of food and plenty to say the least all washed down with an assortment of tea, coffee, water or juice. We had eight nights at this hotel and loved it. Many thanks to all the staff and we hope to see you again one day.

Very clean comfortable hotel. Close to many amenities. Staff friendly. Breakfast fair choice nice touch to have coffee available all day and use of beach towels and boogie boards. A little traffic notice even on floor 18 but then that's waikiki for you!

Staff was very helpful and friendly. Location is close to the beach, stores and restaurants. The AC was great to have and the bed was comfortable as can be. The room was small, but for one it was perfect and did come with a safe and mini fridge. No pool on the premises but the Pacific ocean is steps away from the front door. The hotel did provide towels and mats for the beach, so no taking out the shower towels at all. They also had continental breakfast and most of all, coffee all day with two types of iced cold water, one with and one without lemon (refreshing).

This hotel was a great find in Honolulu as it was not far from the beach and all other local attractions. The staff were very attentive and always willing to assist guests with recommendations and attractions to see. It was one of the few hotels that provided a free continental breakfast and 24 hour a day tea/coffee and ice water service. The rooms were more than adequate although to be honest the air conditioners were a bit noisy but that was only a minor inconvenience when compared to the rest of the good points.The hotel also provided free beach towels and boogie boards for guests wishing to swim at Waikiki Beach which was only a 5 minute walk away.All in all a great experience at a very good hotel.

We checked in around 1 P.M., and Chris was very helpful with the process. He even gave us wet towels, and pineapple juice. We spent 2 nights, and on the first night I had accidentally booked a 2 person room, instead of 3 people. The next day, breakfast had fresh pineapple, and Kona coffee. The breakfast was quite plentiful. I also talked to Sato, and he talked to his manager who gave me an upgrade to a bigger room which could accommodate all three of us. Overall, this has been one of the best hotel experiences I've had. KC was also quite helpful in finding us a good restaurant to eat at. 10/10 I will definitely return.

Excellent location, close to the beach, stores and restaurants. Clean rooms with AC and very comfortable beds. Our room was pretty small but we were not there to spend time in the room.Very friendly staff , always helpful and kind. Beach towels and mats always available at the front desk. Breakfast served from 7-9, plenty of fruits and pastries and coffee in the lobby available at all times. Over roll, very pleasant stay. We will be back next time we are in Honolulu.

It was clean and they were very nice and helpful If I needed anything at all. Room was clean and I was greated with cool nice towels after a very long flight and fresh juice. No pool so if you want one this is not the place for you.

The hotel is pretty good, nice staff, good location (really good, near the best stores, best restaurants and beach; 2 blocks from everything). The breakfast is simple, but it's included, it's rare these days in USA. Coffee is available 24h, really nice. The room is small and the bathroom too.

room and the bathroom small.bathroom crampy not much room to move around.breakfast need an upgrade like hot food and cereal.bottles of water in the hotel room need to be compleintary inside was billed what a joke for a 4 star hotel!!!!!!!!! the only postive things i can say about the hotel is clean and modern. also the location 5 minutes away from the beach,shops and resturants.just to add on a negative thing is no specific times to clean the rooms from housekeeper.example one time we were back back from a guide tour in the afternoon and the room wasnt cleaned.we were told by the housekeeper that first prioty was to concerate on clean on the checkout rooms.wontcome back not a happy !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

There can't be a better location for the price than Vive. Great little restaurants nearby, and two blocks to the beach. And you are off the main drag, so you don't feel swept up by the human wave. Only two quibbles- wish there were balconies- that is something which can't be easily fixed; wish there was more variety at breakfast- only pineapple juice, pastries, fruit, tea and coffee. Hard boiled eggs and some yogurt would be nice. Hats off also to the front desk staff- always pleasant. Would definitely stay here again.

Do not stay anywhere else! I don't like hotel rooms, the thought of sleeping in the same bed that thousands of other people have slept, kind of grosses me out. I loved this hotel! Everything was clean, it looked beautiful, and the service was excellent. I'm sad I was only there for one night.

Even though Vive is just 3 blocks from the beach, you will pass homeless, hookers and drinks before your feet touch any sand.The hotel itself is really nice. Albeit the rooms are tiny and there are no balconies, the price is good. The staff are super friendly and the concierge does a great job.The in room tablet and free wifi was a really needed touch. We really liked the availability of using their beach towels, mats and boogie boards.But we didn't get a true feeling of being on holidays until we moved west and into the Parc Hotel. Time spent at Vive was an eye opener into the drifters that live in Hawaii, not in the hotel, but on the front door step.

Already prior to our stay we had a very positive impression of the staff of the hotel, in particular of the concierges; we had e-mailed the hotel multiple times with questions and we received a very complete answer very quickly each time. Compliments to the concierges! They were also very helpful during our stay. The hotel looked very new and it has a modern interior. Our room was clean and in the same modern interior style as the lobby. It wasn't very large but we didn't mind this since we were outdoors most of our time. Halfway our stay we had a little problem in our room but the frond desk employee took us very seriously and gave us another room and didn't charge our parking fee. The second room was much larger and again, very clean and modern. The beds were in both rooms very comfortable, the airconditioning worked perfectly and the hotels its shower items smelled great! Even my boyfriend liked them! The location of the hotel very good. Close to the beach (free bath towels, chairs, mats, etc. at the frond desk), close to down town and next to a public bus stop. The breakfast was good for a continental breakfast. Lots of different sweet buns and fruit. Personally, I missed some yoghurt but I'm not sure whether or not it belongs in a continental breakfast. We would definitely recommend Vive Hotel to others!!

The location was pretty great! The downtown area was a close walk - long enough to digest part of dinner, but short enough that you weren't tired. The beach was 3 short blocks away, so there was no need to stay at a hotel directly on the beach and pay resort fees. We easily borrowed beach towels, mats, and boogie boards before heading out in our adventures each morning. The free breakfast goes from 7-9 and has a ton of fresh fruit and pastries. We ate a lot of the delicious pineapple and blueberry bread when we didn't need to have a super early start on our day. The room was a little small, but we honestly didn't spend that much time there. There was some muffled street noise (we were on the side facing Kaiulani Ave), but it wasn't a problem for us. The hotel staff was courteous and friendly. Overall, we had a great time and really enjoyed our stay at Vive!

we've stayed in the Vive twice now. The first time was extremely impressive. We received a complimentary upgrade to a Junior Lifestyle suite which was outstanding. The room was nice and clean. The layout of the room was excellent, we didn't want to leave the room. The staff was so polite and helpful along with the tablet that inside the room, which provided information and service request easily. This is now our go to spot anytime we need to get away from home.

We stayed only one night at Vive but it was a nice stay for sure and we plan on returning the next time we're in Honolulu. Great rooms, great staff, great location, and they even serve breakfast! The hotel is located just a couple of blocks from the beach and they offer towels, chairs, mats, etc. to checkout which was really helpful.

Very friendly staff and the location was ideal. I booked through Booking.com and was not happy about being charged one night in advance. However, apart from that, I have no complaints. The breakfast was very good and I liked the seating arrangement. Unfortunately the safe did not work after opening it the first time but that did not detract from the stay.

This is the first time at Honolulu that we didn't stay in a hotel right on the beach. We actually liked it better. Not only was the cost lower, there were less crowds of people than the west end of Waikiki where the huge resorts are.

When you walk in, you receive juice and a hot towel. The staff is kind and takes care of you. One guy gave me all the tips I needed to go surfing on my own -- for the first time. The continental breakfast is a key start to the day. Clean rooms and bathrooms. It's located three blocks from the shore. Valet parking is 4$/hr or $25/day.

I have reviewed this hotel and we loved it, we had a good sized room last time and we were aware of the noisy air conditioners but that was the only negative. This time we were excited to stay again but our room was small and cramped and the air conditioner was worse that the first time we were there and the street noise was bad. We asked to stay and normally the staff are so nice and helpful but it was different when we asked to move rooms, the staff were not so friendly to help with our request. We did end up moving but the room was still small and average but slightly better. I think I will try other places next time as we were disappointed since we have given many people good reviews of the Vibe in the last year.

Reasonably priced hotel in downtown Waikiki. Very modern and stylishly appointed. Room was small but had many features including a desk, mini fridge, nice flat screen TV, office chair, tablet, toiletries and a comfortable living room chair.

The Vive Hotel was an excellent choice for our recent trip to Waikiki. Great location, not far from anything (including the beach) and excellent staff. We stayed in the cosmopolitan queen room which is small but all you need, clean and comfortable. Complimentary breakfast and no daily resort fees is also an added bonus. Thanks for a great stay, would definitely stay again :)

We have stayed at the VIVE before and chose the VIVE when we returned to Hawaii for our wedding. We loved our upgraded room and thoughtful welcome note when we arrived! During our stay the service was always excellent, especially the valet attendants who were prompt and friendly. The wireless tablets in each room also made calling for our car convenient and seamless. The clean, modern rooms and service we receive at the VIVE help us to relax the moment we arrive and we will be back!

The staff at the Vive Hotel were really friendly and helpful. They provided good information and advice about travelling around Waikiki and the Honolulu area. The hotel lends out everything that you might want for a trip to the beach and is well located only a block back from the sand. The rooms are not large but they are spotless and the beds were really comfortable. I'd stay there again.

We stayed in the Vive Hotel for 9 nights. Sometimes photos on line can be deceiving however the photos showed exactly what Vive was like. It was just amazing. The staff were friendly and most helpful. Nothing was too much bother for them. We would definitely recommend anyone to stay in this hotel. Whilst is was a couple of streets back from the beach we found this to be to our advantage as there were not the crowds around. Local bus stop was right outside the door which made for easy access to other areas.
user_name:
John L
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: The hotel was perfectly positioned from the beach with a great view. The hotel was neatly presented and very clean. All the staff were very professional, helpful and friendly. Special mention to KC at the concierge who helped us book amazing tours and went the extra distance with our many many questions and Chris who was the first person we saw walking into the hotel and made the first impression of the hotel a great one. Thank you to all the staff at Vive for making our stay very pleasant and stress free. MAHALO!

We had a really great time at Vive and even got upgraded. They were quick in replying emails and great with recommendations. KC at the concierge was very helpful! However just watch out if you wanna have a full breakfast because there are only bread, muffin, and fruits available.

Great location, one block from Waikiki beach, easy walking distance to supermarket, laundry, coffee shops, shopping and tourist bus stops.Clean, comfortable stay. Very inviting!Breakfast provided daily (fresh fruits, toasts & pastries) and coffee available all day.Free use of beach towels, chairs, beach matsFree local phone callsPerfect if staying 1-2nights....

I stayed here with my wife as an ESTA requirement for an arrival address in the states! This popped up on trip advisor so I booked it. We had two rooms as we extended our stay. The first was regular room the second a suite for 30% more cost. Both were clean and well appointed. The regular room was quite small with noisy aircon The suite was much better. But at these prices to stay in this position you couldn't do better in either room. Staff were excellent and helpful. Breakfast was a much better than average buffet of good fresh fruits, pastries and toast. Walk out the hotel door grabbing a free towel/mat/umbrella ,cross the road and two minutes in front of you is the main Waikiki beach and the statue of the Duke in front of you!

Great location. 3 min walk to the beach. Had breakfast every morning. Staff was awesome and friendly. Was able to rent stuff like mats, chairs, boogie board, beach towels. And we were able to use a courtesy room to shower and do last minute packing after we had checked out and spent a day at the beach because we had an evening flight. Overall it was a great experience.

Great hotel, I can fully recommend for holidays in Hawaii :)Nice and hopeful stuff, great localization (500 m from Waikiki Beach!), very nice room and delicious breakfasts, plus tea, coffee and water in guests room for all time. Very cosy and comfortable.

I liked the Vive for the location, the price, and the feel.The Vive is a very quick walk to the beach, and surrounded by shopping and restaurants. If you are planning on going to some of the fancier beach-front hotels for dinner, it's plenty close for that, too. It's also right by a bus stop, if you want to get out of Waikiki.The rooms are on the small side, but have cool looks and features and are in good shape. I mostly used the in-room tablet to play music, but it also can be used to plan activities or order food. The bathrooms are small but functional, and the beds were comfortable. The wifi was fast, too.The breakfast was a nice continental breakfast, with lots of fruit, and decent baked goods. We didn't have the chance to use the concierge service, but we did see other folks down there. The regular desk staff were very helpful. There's lots of gear you can check out, like beach towels and chairs. They also have newspapers you can grab.Amenities-wise, there is no pool, but I didn't miss it. There is hotel parking, but it's not included. Otherwise, there's no resort fee, which is a relief.Overall, I liked the hotel a lot, and I would stay there again.

We recently stayed at the Vive Hotel. On previous trips to Honolulu we stayed at the "big" hotels. Sheraton, Hyatt, Moana Surfrider. We were on our way home from Australia, plus 18 cruise from there, and decided on something smaller this time. The Vive didn't disappoint. We stayed in room 2006. Had views of Waikiki and Diamond Head. It was a Jr Suite with alot of room. The shower was big enough to hold a party in!Your greeted upon arrival with cold towels and pineapple juice. The staff is wonderful and the light continental breakfast was perfect in the morning. It's just a short walk to the beach, restaurants etc. Would definitely stay here again.

We recently stayed here on 2 occasions, a week apart. The front counter staff always had a smile and we found them great to talk to - nothing too much trouble. Yes, the air conditioner is noisy in the room but after long days outside we managed to get off to sleep no problems. The first day we arrived at 7.15am and even tho check in is after lunch we still had a room made available by 7.30amVive is very close to beach and transport. 2 blocks back from "Duke" statueA special shout out must go to KC the concierge who went that extra mile to sort out a problem we were having trying to finalise a Pearl Harbour trip. Thanks to all staff and especially KC

Always consistent with service. Very clean rooms with nice amenities. Convenient location and great breakfast inclusion. Parking is sometimes difficult and costs $25 per day when a car is not necessary in Waikiki.

Very good overall hotel experience. We stayed in a "junior suite". Excellent breakfast spread. Kona coffee available 24/7. Big showers. Convenient to Waikiki beach, trolley line, bus line and shave ice vendor. Friendly staff.

We loved our stay at Vive! We've already recommended this beautiful boutique hotel to many of our friends. It was just a few minutes to walk to the zoo, beach, and many great restaurants. The decor was beautiful and the staff was very friendly and helpful.

Vive Hotel has a nice vibe ( modern, trendy) to it and good location on Kuhio about 2 blocks from beach and in center of Waikiki. Our room is smallish but comfortable. Staff is great. Breakfast is just fruit and pastries ( no protein!) with beverages. An evening beer/wine would round out this place as there is no close place for a relaxing cocktail after beach time. All in all, good spot.

Good for the price but the air cond was just to poor and noisy. Couldn't get a good sleep.The room is small. But the style of the hotel is nice. Location is good and not far from anywhere. Just wish it had better air conditioning.

The Vive Hotel was a fabulous find thanks to other TripAdvisor contributes. It isn't in the 5 Star range but it is easily up there as a great place to stay. It is a boutique hotel, compact in size but don't let this put you off as it is a great place to stay.The rooms are comfortable, beds great and within easy walking distance to Waikiki Beach and all other activities. It provides a good range of a Continental breakfast as well as free boogey boards and beach towels.The staff are extremely helpful and are prepared to go the extra mile to make your stay better.Strongly recommended.

I'm am writing this review in the ocean view room I have on the 11th floor. It's 3.00am on a Saturday night and there is heavy construction (drilling) going on outside the window. just spoken to Beverly at the desk who say that it is not there fault they are not doing the construction. The windows do not block any sound so you can hear everything from people talking to the bleep of unlocking cars outside. How are you supposed to sleep with that. The air-conditioning is broken (I reported this the day after we checked in 5 nights ago) but does at least cool the room slightly, unfortunately the rooms are very small and it is positioned so it blows directly at your head and shoulders and is a window unit so again is very noisy. There is almost no water pressure so when you turn the sink on it literally dribbles out and makes a screeching noise. The shower is okay but you cannot move the spray head so it only sprays a little part of your body at once. There are 2 lifts which are used by every guest and worker so there are times when housekeeping on floor 6 will lock off a lift for a few minutes so it can take 5 minute wait. There are some good bits. The furnishings Are nice. The rooms are presently decorated. The fruit at the continental breakfast is lovely (however on 3 days this has not had normal white, brown, or seeded bread (small thing I know but I thought continental breakfast included toast). I have stayed in many hotels both much better and worse than this. But do to the fact that the main purpose of a hotel is to sleep and do mostly to the windows it is very hard to do this I would say avoid this hotel if you can

Great location, friendly staff, small room. I stayed for 3 nights, picked this hotel after reading reviews on tripadvisor and it being one of the more affordable hotels in the area. This was a good location about a block to the beach and close to shops and restaurants. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, giving good restaurants recommendations. The hotel has beach towels, chairs and boogie boards to borrow. The room was very small, I had a partial ocean view.

last stop before Auckland. hotel was small with smallish rooms but big enough clean and tidy. very helpful cheery staff, walk to beach less than 5 mins, Mexican cafe bar half way to beach then the choice is yours. went on tram to diamond head, driver wonderful helpful knowledgeable even took photos of every one on tram, individually. went to Pearl harbour, good but realy only for Americans, had an evening dinner cruise and show on last night only average. i would recommend this hotel to all but rich people.

Amazing hotel, very hip and trendy, super comfortable, great amenities and value!Can't wait to visit again! Worth going back to Waikiki just to stay at the Vive and its soo close to the beach and great restaurants too!

Rooms are small but clean. ROm air conditioning needs to be improved. Staff were friendly and helpful. Continental breakfast was good. Close to beach. NO "resort fee" as with most of the hotels. Good value.

We selected Vive based on the reviews from other guests and, indeed, Vive lives up to our expectation. Its location is close to famous eateries, bus stops and Waikiki beach. Lots of fruits in the included breakfast for the people who love healthy food. Staff are very friendly. No issue at all with the free Wi-Fi.

We stayed 7 nights in two bedroom suite. There was no door between the two bedrooms which was unexpected but was ok. The rooms are small but we didn't spend much time in the rooms. The downstairs area where breakfast is served has lots of nice seating areas so sometimes we would get take out and eat there. The breakfast was good selection but no cooked food. The coffee was available downstairs at all time and it was good! The staff were very helpful. I had left behind a bag of cookies in the downstairs area it was a few days before I realized but I got my cooked back they had kept it for me! The beach is nearby and the hotel can provide beach towels, mats, boogie boards and small chairs.

The hotel is just two blocks from the beach in the heart of Waikiki. Nice staff. Continental breakfast included which is pretty good. Room is clean. Valet Parking $25 per day. In general it worth for the price.

A very clean and friendly hotel. the coffee was available all day and night!! that was great for the east coast folks who were up at 3 am thinking it was 8 or 9am back home:). the location was prefect for getting around and an easy walk to the beach. we were able to open our window in the room and get fresh air and a great breeze!! the rooms are not big but sufficient enough for 2 people.

My experience here has slightly shaken my trust in the reviews on TripAdvisor. Room was really cramped, but that doesn't really ever bother me. Even for a 3-star property, these are spartan accommodations. The noise from the window AC wasn't a big deal, but didn't add any charm. Bed was OK. Furnishings are dorm-like. The walls were a bit scuffed, painted dull colors, and there wasn't any art or a single decorative element anywhere, except for a little print hanging inside the door. The bathroom, though, was pretty bad. Shallow sinks with faucets that are barely high enough to fit both hands under. The shower head needs to be replaced--water kind of sprayed out in a mist, getting everywhere. The finish on the bottom of the tub was literally flaking off as I was showering. Pros: The courtesy room is a nice touch if you have to check out but have a later flight. Yes, it's a short walk to the beach. The lobby is spacious and there are plenty of cozy areas set up for relaxing and conversation. Had I been here for more than one night, I would have spent more time here to escape the dreary room. By far the best part of this hotel is the staff--they are friendly and extremely helpful. An extra star for them.

Booked through trip advisor to get a discount. Hotel was easy to find, two blocks away from the beach. Room was clean, modern and with an ocean room. Some may argue small, however my husband and I weren't in Hawaii to stay in a hotel room, but to be out enjoying the sites and culture! Service was great, all receptionists were very helpful! The hotel allows guests to use their beach towels, beach mats, boogie boards and goggles. Bfast was included which consisted on an array of fruit and pastries (lots of carbs, no protein). All in all we would stay here again!

We had a very pleasant stay from the time we checked in and someone took our bags up to our room until the time we checked out and used the courtesy room to get ready for our flight home. The hotel is clean, the rooms are small, but we weren't in it much. The staff is so friendly!! There is a complimentary breakfast every morning, no protein offered, but really good juice!! Only a five minute walk to the beach. We got a car the last part of the week and they have valet parking. The person that parked/retrieved our car always opened the door for me. Very polite! Would stay again!!

Rooms are small. Continental breakfast is good, with fresh fruits. Staff is friendly and helpful. It's a good place if you're on a budget and want something clean. Valet parking is $25 per night. I prefer to self park, and sometimes stay close to this place and pay $17 per night for parking. That's $40 on a five day trip I can use dining. Actually more, since I do tip the attendants. I'll likely try another spot next time.

Great Hotel, close to Waikiki, clear and with breakfast included. The room is very good and the staff was very kind. The price for the location and quality is very good. Surely it is to come back again

We stayed here for 4 nights in March. Is in a great position being a block back from Waikiki beach. Tour pick ups are just across the road. Check in was smooth and we were given a refresh drink and towel when we walked in. Rooms are very small and clean, but being in Honolulu, you're not in the room very much anyway. Wifi is free. Continental breakfast is included.

Stayed for 3 nights. Everything as expected by previous reviews. Good location to everything. Beach is 1 minute walk away. Bus stop is next door. Nice selection of food for breakfast, very friendly and helpful staff. There is an aircon unit which sits at the window, rather than ducted, but it didn't bother me.

Upon check-in, I was immediately greeted by name from very friendly staff. Interior is very modernly designed yet comfortable. Location is great, it's close by restaurants that I wanted to try out and only couple blocks from Waikiki. Housekeeping did a good job taking care of our room. Our room itself is very cozy. It's got everything needed and it's very comfortable for the two of us. We liked it a lot. The only thing I would say something on was the position of the AC. It's directly aligned with the bed where you put your head at. So I had a little trouble sleeping with constant cold air blowing to my head. But it's not something big, I put something to cover it. So it was not a big deal. We would definitely visit again!

We had a great time in Hawaii, also because of this hotel. Very clean, very friendly staff and a good breakfast with a lot of fresh fruit. The location is also very good, just a 2 min walk to the beach.

I really liked this hotel, from the lobby to the room. Great location for everything in Waikiki and transportation. Friendly and responsive staff. From the front desk people to housekeeping. I would stay again.

My first time at this hotel establishment and it will not be my last. Everyone from the valet, front desk, and management were very helpful. The room that we had was beautiful with a spectacular view. It was clean, spacious, and was stocked with the hotel essentials. The hotel is in a very convenient location where a lot of venues or stores are within walking distance. We were able to walk to our destinations within a 5 to 10 minutes without having to fight the hassle of driving or finding parking. This was definitely a big plus.Overall, our stay was phenomenal. I will highly recommend this hotel.

Vive is a great simple hotel. The rooms are not massive but big enough. The hotels is clean and in a good location two blocks from the main strip. Staff are friendly and helpful. The breakfast was a nice bonus- fruits, pastry, toasts and drinks

Hi ,just arrived late last night and am currently having a bite to eat for breakfast which is free.This hotel was chosen by me for the rating it gets on Tripadvisor, it was in the top ten when I booked. I am a regular visitor to Oahu and have stayed in many hotels and this hotel by Hawaiian standards is EXCELLENT. Firstly let me dispel some of the incorrect reviews that have been posted,it does have mini bar fridges,the lifts are not slow, the rooms are however very small,but it is a very clean ,modern hotel.Chris on reception when we checked in was very personable enthusiastic,and a very proud employee,which does make for a very good first impression. The rooms are via an opened walkway which is a bit daunting and I probably wouldn't recommend this hotel for families,it has a family room but don't know the specifics,but not having a pool might be a disappointment for some children.All in all a nice hotel.

We only had a one night stay at Vive as we flew from Hilo to Honolulu for our flight to LA at 0700 the next day. Arrived at the hotel at 1230 and a pleasant reception from Paul, cold drinks and face towels. Unable to give us a room but looked after our luggage and suggested a restaurant for lunch, which was a good choice, and a room available shortly after. Room not the biggest but good amenities and spotless. Loved the location, 5 minutes from the beach and the main shopping area. The Spam Jam festival was on the evening we were there which proved very entertaining. Taxi booked through reception waiting for us at 0445 the next morning which unfortunately was too early for the breakfast, although we helped ourselves to tea and coffee in the reception lounge. Definitely recommended.

Highly recommended. Very nice room and bed, friendly staff and great free breakfast. Located in Kuhio St just one street back from Waikiki Beach. Our room had ocean views and was quiet. The Bus has a stop right outside to Hotel.
user_name:
Daryl J
Perth, Western Australia, Australia

review_body: Pricing was excellent, location was central to beach and public bus stops, resturants and shops. Modern décor and excellent customer service. Comfortable rooms with views of beach, city or mountain. Staff very friendly and happy to assist with bookings of tours and any other issues.

While it wasn't exactly a bargain price, the hotel offered good value for the price paid. We had a nice, clean room, continental breakfast and the location was close to Waikiki beach. It was also near the pick-up points for most of the tour companies. Overall an enjoyable three night stay.

Loved this hotel for the money. Convenient location, lovely staff and plentiful buffet breafast. Yes, the rooms are small but comfortable. And a very short walk to Waikiki Beach, restaurants, bars and shops.
user_name:
kkhayden
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed for 6 nights, excellent location just a few blocks from beach and shops. Room wasn't huge but quite well laid out. Air conditioning was adequate but didn't seem to get really cool no matter the setting. Staff were excellent and very helpful - complimentary breakfast was good. $25 for parking per day seemed steep but I didn't have any really idea of parking downtown. Wife really like the convenience of the shopping :-) and there are a wide variety of eateries available close by. Would stay again in Waikiki.

My girlfriend and I stayed at the vive last week for 7 days and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The staff were very friendly and always made us feel welcome and comfortable. The location was perfect only a 5 minute walk from the beach and the main area of shops and restaurants. The only reason I didn't give the place 5 star rating was the breakfast, I know it was only a continental breakfast but I felt all it was was bread, muffins and croissants not very good for the waistline lol.. Other than that our stay was perfect!! Also a special mention to Kris who works there he pretty much planned our holiday and saved us a lot of money with his recommendations, awesome guy!

The rooms are small. This isn't much of a problem, but it's good to know. I wish they had more space for putting clothes. The rooms have a place to hang up clothes and two drawers that slide from the end of the bed, but that's it. You have to keep most of your clothes in your luggage.Good breakfast, friendly service, and good location. Quiet at night, quick valet parking, and free beach stuff.

We chose this hotel because of a combination of location and price. The location was indeed great - very close to Waikiki. We thought the price was reasonable given the location. The rooms were much smaller than we were originally led to believe, and it was rather noisy due to a combination of the A/C unit and the outside street noise. The staff was excellent and provided great service, particularly the valet crew. The breakfast buffet was rather disappointing - a few fresh fruit choices consisting of pineapple, honeydew and oranges (the latter two I don't even associate with Hawaii), and some stale pastries.

We only stayed overnight at the Vive, but highly recommend it.It is modern, clean and the staff were very helpful.Free wifi and free contintental breakfast were included.There were no extra resort fees charged, like so many of the Honolulu hotels.A great stay at the Vive! Thank You.Free wifi

Great little hotel, bus stop at door, walk to beach, complimentary towels and chairs to take to beach, helpful staff, could expand breakfast choice a little more, good base to start your exploration of the island, would stay again

Great place to stay at a good price very close to the beach. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The hotel had very cool decor and was very chic. Location can't be beat as it is a quick walk to the beach and numerous restaurants and shopping.

I was interested in finding a comfort stay where the focus was on the room and stay. I didn't care so much for a view, instead I preferred a nice bed and room. I was treated with an amazing view of diamond head and a very nice and comfortable room. Using the little tablet was a nice niche that showed how modern the hotel was for me. Staff and service were on point and My girlfriend and myself really enjoyed the experience. We will be sure to stay here again.

Excellent customer service at reception. Small but clean and comfortable room. Continental breakfast is sufficient, loved the fresh fruit, there is fruit juice, tea and coffee, water flavoured with citrus and plain water. Excellent choice of teas, hot coffee, water available throughout the day and evening. Free beach mat and towels available. One street over from where most tourist bus tours leave. Great location. Cross opposite the hotel and the road takes you to Waikiki beach at the Duke Kahanamoku statue. Lots of local buses leave from there but you need to figure out which bus to catch because there are so many that pull in and out it can be confusing and the destination is not always prominently displayed. $2 bus ride to Ala Moana shopping centre. The hotel is a wonderful place to meet people, especially at breakfast. The Aloha spirit is alive and flourishing at Vive.

Overall the hotel was great! It was very close to the beach! Juice and cool towel when you arrive! Room was a little small but not a big deal!! All the staff were so nice and helpful!! Looking forward to staying there again!!!

The Vive was great: first it was at the perfect location which was close by to Waikiki Beach. Secondly the price was also decent. Our room was clean & comfortable which made our stay enjoyable! Thank you Vive Hotel & we would certainly love to stay with you again in the future when we return to Honolulu :)

Lovely room, clean, roomy, good amenities! Safe with easy access to all the sites and resturants. The parking garage is valet, so expect to pay 25.00 a day, but everywhere else is 30+. The parking garage is low ceilings, but the valets are superior! Comfortable beds, blow dryer, small fridge in room. Stayed for 6 days.

This hotel suited our needs for our week in the islands and the staff made it all the better. We loved the fact that we could start the day off with a little lite breakfast before heading out. The location was ideal and the concierge did everything he could to make our stay a very enjoyable and memorable experience

Great value for the rate paid. Includes a continental breakfast, free use of beach mat and towels, fresh water and coffee during the day. Nice relaxing décor and clean bathrooms. The rooms are small, individual AC units are not the greatest and a soft bed. If you read the reviews you won't be surprised about anything. It is worth staying here. The best staff and free internet.They do offer a late checkout if space is available for a fee and not many hotels will do this. You can also get a room to use instead for a smaller fee.

Enjoyed the entrance , lobby and breakfast areas. Staff very obliging, willing to help with all requests. Room small lack personal space for luggage lack of curtains to reduce light, bed very comfortable.

I stayed at Vive Hotel for three nights while on a business trip. I originally was trying to book a room at a bigger chain hotel but it was all sold out. I am glad it was. Vive has great personality, and although the rooms are a little small (it is a boutique hotel, after all), they are very comfortable and clean. Besides, who spends most of their time in their room when they're in Waikiki anyway? The location was excellent, and the staff were perhaps some of the friendliest I have ever dealt with at a hotel; always with a smile and very helpful. I would make Vive Hotel my go-to hotel in Waikiki if I were to return. It also has no resort fees, which is important for me because our company does not allow us to book rooms with resort fees.

Where do I start? The room is way too small. I have stayed in a lot of hotels before, from brand names to many boutiques, this is by far the smallest. Some of the room types are bigger but you need to pay extras. I would expect a standard room should not be this room. The sink in the washroom is flat! It is ridiculous, I can't even rinse a cup under the faucet! Also, if you leave the room in early morning and come back around 3 in the afternoon, don't expect your room to be cleaned because that's what happened to me 2 days in a row, even after I complained. I have never had this experience in any other hotels before. Definitely a first in a really bad way.The breakfast is also really limited. If you are going to offer breakfast, at least include some milk and eggs....Location is good, that's probably the only good thing about this hotel.

We stayed here for 2 different nights. Excellent location and very helpful staff. Excellent value for the area, nice lemon water available all day. Beach towels and mats free to borrow and pleasant hotel atmosphere.

Excellent hotel. My boyfriend and I stayed here for 5 nights recently. Excellent location and very friendly staff. Restaurant recommendations were top notch! Bus stop for travel to Diamond Head and Pearl Harbour close by. Beach equipment provided by the hotel; towels, mats etc save you money and hassle. Breakfast was full of delicious fruit.

I've stayed at the Vive a few times now and find it has everything I need. Away from the noise but close to great restaurants and a quick walk to the shops. The motel is beautifully decorated, simple and understated. No pool but who needs one when you are that close to the beach.

Fantastic little hotel. Greeted with pineapple juice and cold towels. Check-in was a breeze. The room was small but clean,comfortable, and modern. The continental breakfast and availability of beach gear was an added bonus. Only two blocks from the beach. Welcoming and helpful staff.

Outstanding value for the money! Great, polite staff. Great location, modern art and decor in the rooms and free WiFi. Many cable and international channels to watch on TV. No hidden fees, no resort fees except the transient tax? Not the hotel's fault there. Breakfast was simple but just fine for free. The coffee and tea available 24/7 was great. The towels, chairs, mats, boogie boards etc were all free to use. Valet was polite and prompt, also cheaper than most but paying for parking is never fun right? Many complain the rooms are small and that the AC is weird on the wall. Yes the rooms are small but the space is well utilized and very modern with a tablet in the room to cater to your needs. Have realistic expectations here, if you are a larger person or plan on staying in the room alot, maybe elsewhere or a suite here is a better option. I found the AC more than adequate and I slept fine but everyone is different when it comes to noise tolerance. If you need a clean modern room with great services and amenities at a value stay here, especially if you are out most of the time and don't need to pay for a huge luxurious room you won't spend much time in. The beach, Marukame, Iyasume Musubi, Food Pantry and much more right in the area! Public transit too. 24 Hour Fitness is 1 block away. A fitness room in the future would be great. I'd happily stay here again. We stayed 2 weeks and they exceeded our expectations. We normally stay at Hotels like the Sheraton etc but this place is the best value and experience we have had in awhile. See you again soon!

Great little hotel. Good location, friendly staff, clean rooms. The issue we had was the noisy A/C. They are the older window type of A/C. Made it hard to sleep at night while A/C was running. Overall a pleasant stay.

My girlfriend and I just spent a week at Vive and it was a great stay. We checked in with a nice man by the name of Sato. He was very respectful and very professional. He even offered us glasses of Pineapple Juice and warm towels, which was awesome. We'd just gotten off a long flight and the juice was very refreshing after being in a dry plane cabin for six hours.Later we got some great travel tips from the concierge, KC. I can't say enough great things about KC. She helped us throughout our entire trip, everything from booking a trip to the Polynesian Culture Center, to helping us rent a car so we could explore the island for a day. She also had some awesome food recommendations.For the times when we wanted to go to the beach, Vive provided free towels, beach chairs and even a beach umbrella.The room we stayed in was very clean and the bed was super comfy.The location was also really great, just two blocks from Waikiki beach. It wasn't right on the beach and the view from our room wasn't the best, but that hardly bothered us.The one piece of feedback I would provide is the continental breakfast was a little weak. The fresh fruit was great but there was no real protein provided.Overall, our experience was great. I would totally recommend the Vive hotel to anyone traveling to Honolulu.

Kuhio is cleaning up. What used to be full of rando drug dealers, prostitutes, seemingly angry local youth, UH Kids, and military on a night out is now less prostitutes, Military on the night out and " adventurous tourists. Vive is new the East end of Kuhio . It is a swanky boutique hotel with a lobby that looks like a representative for Pier 1 Imports decorated it. The continental breakfast is an extended range of local fruits, "local pastries"., juices, coffee, and toast. The concierge offers beach chairs and towels.I was here for business. The parking lot is small and valet only @ $25/ night is average. The tablets in the room are nice modern touch. You can use it to call your car before you leave, highly recommended.There is not an in-hotel restaurant and not much by way of food in the immediate vicinity. The room i was parked in was small but modern. The bathroom was cramped but also modern with spa-y soaps.There was a flat screen TV to enjoy.Iron and ironing board were available in the room, although little space to actually use these was available. In room safe was available.Overall I would say the hotel value was worth it at the pre-paid price. Over $200 other options maybe a better value

This boutique hotel is in a great location, about two short blocks from the ocean, and one short block from a very major high end hotel - you know you are in a good spot. The advantage is that you are close to the action but not having to pay as high a price as the other resorts since there is no pool or area like that. So if you need a really nice, clean hotel with very friendly staff at a reasonable price, you've found it. If you are looking for mega resort, this is not for you. Helpful hint, join their rewards program prior to coming in and your parking fee is cut in half. I would stay here again - definitely.

My husband and I met my brother and his wife in Honolulu for a few days before going over to Kauai. Our stay was wonderful, but primarily because of the accommodations and people at the VIVE. We didn't have an ocean view, but our view was wonderful. We weren't in the room much during the day so the city lights at night we gorgeous. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable.

We stayed at Vive for only two nights, but had great service while we were there. The front desk staff is so friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a perfect location and provides all the supplies you need for the beach. The lobby is decorated very contemporary and is designed to feel like one big living room for all its guests. The continental breakfast was a nice touch with mountains of fresh fruit, pastries, toast, coffee, juice, and more. Our room was small but it felt cozy and was very clean. We would stay again if we are ever in Waikiki.

We stayed for one week at Vive Hotel Waikiki. It was a fantastic experience being there. The hotel staff is very friendly and pleasant. They are ready to help anytime.If we book the stay with their website using their rewards program, we will get a discount and complementary services.Car rental services are available at the lobby every morning. There is no resort fee for Vive hotel unlike all other hotels in Waikiki.They also provide continental breakfast and complimentary wifi. The breakfast is awesome with variety of items including fresh fruits. The wifi is fast too . They also started some games about Hawaii on a particular day of the week and the winners will get great prizes.We had a late flight on the departure day and they stored our luggage after the checkout and provide a courtesy room for one hour(any time of the day) to get ready for the airport.They also provide beach gear such as towels,beach mats,chairs and boogie boards. The room is clean and tidy. Complementary breakfast, free WiFi,Beach gear,Courtesy room, no resort fee and great staff makes Vive different from all other hotels in Waikiki.What more to ask with such a low rate in Waikiki?...If we go to Hawaii in future, we will definitely stay at this hotel...

Vive became one of the unexpected highlights of our honeymoon. We chose it because of its good location and value for money, but didn't expect how lovely and comfortable and welcoming it would be. The staff were great; they were helpful during our entire stay and also in the weeks leading up to the stay, replying to any email queries very efficiently. We were greeted with pineapple juice and moist towels upon check-in. Our room (a junior suite) was lovely and spacious; our shower and TV were huge! Coffee, tea and chilled water (both lemon and plain) were available 24/7 in the lobby, and beach equipment (such as towels, mats, inflatables) were available upon request. The breakfast included a variety of fruits, pastries and breads; toasters and microwaves were also available. The bus stop is literally just outside the door, and the beach is a minutes' walk away. In terms of value for money, very little can come close. The only negative was that there was quite a bit of wind noise on a few nights - this may be due to our staying on the 20th floor, and also just due to the fact that it was really windy in general! We loved our stay, we will recommend to anyone heading to Waikiki. We were both sad to leave Vive.

We absolutely loved the Vive Hotel Waikiki. The hotel is quiet and zen like yet contemporary and eclectic. Their young staff is wonderful, accommodating and professional. We loved everything about this hotel that is located just off the busy tourist streets of Waikiki yet just 2 minutes from the beach and surfing. We especially loved their breakfast of fresh fruit and rolls with tea and coffee that's included in the room price. Their open lounge with separate little tables is used for breakfasts or for coffee, tea and lemon water that is available to guests throughout the day. It's a great place to meet their interesting guests - many who return to the hotel annually. We highly recommend this unique hotel.

Other than a loud aircon which we have alerted to management, the hotel stay was fantastic and I'd stay here again if we came to Waikiki. Coffee and Tea and Drinks were always available. breakfast was mainly fruits and sweet breads which was fine. The staff were exceptional

My boyfriend booked this trip for us for my 21st birthday and I could not have been more impressed by Vive Hotel! All staff were so kind and friendly, the room was clean and comfortable. Breakfast was a little crowded some days. Very affordable compared to others in the area. Location was only 1 block behind the beach so very close to everything. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay, thank you!

Excellence from start to finish. The facility looks just like the online photos. Valet parking at 25.00 per day for the car and he took the bags to the room while we checked in. Greeted with cold pineapple juice and a smile. Very friendly, but professional staff. We booked the 2 room suite with 2 full bathrooms with very good use of space. Comfortable beds and cold AC for a first night sleep after 16 hours in airports and on planes to get here. Breakfast this morning was very good. Fresh juice, coffee and teas, fresh fruit, breads and muffins. Nice lobby to sit and enjoy the first morning here in Waikiki. Very short walk to the beach (3 blocks) with shops and food everywhere from high end restaurants to local food vendors were out and about last night. Would definitely stay here again if the need arose. Wonderful accommodation and well priced compared to close establishments.

From check in to check out this hotel has exceptional service.Fresh water and towels on check in. Boogie boards, mats and towels for the beach.... Which I'd a quick two blocks straight ahead from the front door. Mac 24/7 is a quick walk to the left as you step out.  The hotel has water, tea and coffee available all day. Complimentary continental breakfast. In the heart of Waikiki and close to everything. Did I mention how great the staff here are.......Awesome!

A few blocks from the beach, breakfast and coffee in the morning, super clean, what more could you ask for? Chris with the Concierge and Sato at the desk were particularly helpful and went above and beyond with recommendations and helping us make plans during our trip. I'm forgetting a few more names but every single staff member we interacted with was professional, courteous and eager to help. Love this place, will definitely be back.Jake

Great location and clean rooms made for a pleasant stay. We couldn't have asked for more for the price we paid. Breakfast is a selection of breads, pastries and fruits. Coffee was always ready anytime of the day. Highly recommended! Would love to come again

This little gem of a hotel is walking distance from all the Honolulu beach and nightlife (just a few blocks), but the walk makes the price moderate. The rooms were tiny but clean and stylish. The concierge was extremely helpful in setting up a shuttle to Pearl Harbor for us. I'm recommending it to friends.

Wonderful and friendly staff. Location was just 2 blocks from Waikiki Beach - convenient. The rooms were small - seemed a little cluttered when we opened our bags. But for the price (includes a continental breakfast) and location - can't be beat.

Overall this is a great hotel choice! The location to the beach is perfect just a short 1 minute walk. The valet parking is simple and the attendants are extremely kind and were very helpful. Parking was 25 dollars a day which is not bad given the hotel has no resort fee, which is common for Honolulu. Upon check in we were given Pineapple juice and a cool towel which was refreshing after a long flight. The front desk staff was also very welcoming and made sure to accommodate our requests. The only downfalls are that housekeeping was inconsistent, the first three days we had to call for service after being gone all day and no service had been completed. Also the breakfast is less than impressive, but its free. Overall, this was a great choice if you are looking for simple and economical accommodations.

Excellent value for the price, very economical. No frills, but provided all the basic necessities without the ridiculous resort fee. Conveniently located, clean facility, and excellent continental breakfast!

We think we left a good tips because we received the good service and liked the hotel so others will do if they get the good service from the hotel staffs, liked the hotel amenities and enjoy staying there.

One step removed from the rat race of the beach strip, very conveniently located,great casual lounge amenity, very obliging staff ,extremely economical. All day tea/coffee-cold lemon water and a pleasant inclusive breakfast without the unjustified resort fee.Vive has a good vibe.inclusive

No restaurant or bar but there are plenty close by and the hotel participates in a food delivery service from many local restaurants for a very reasonable price. Room was good, location was excellent. A little pricey, but worth it. Skip renting a car; mandatory valet service is $25 per day. Much better to get a taxi/shuttle from the airport and then get a bus pass from one of the many ABC stores nearby.

thanks for your always greeting when we come back to hotels and provide services based on our requirements. the location is great. Only waling distance to beaches and main street. we can very easily to go out for our activites by waling, bus and other transportations. this is the second time i've been in Honolulu, but your hotel is better than the one i stayed last time. thanks fory ur great service, looking forward to staying there again!

Had a great stay at Vive Waikiki. I experienced exceptional service, a modern atmosphere and cleanliness in our guest room. The room was great but the refrigerator was not very cold and but that as the only drawback. Overall it was a great stay!

This is a great hotel. There is not a bad thing I can say about it really. On arrival we were greeted with a scented wet towel to clean our faces after our long flight and pineapple juice to drink. We arrived at just after 6am, there was not a room available at the time but they took our suitcases from us and allowed us to have the free breakfast. We eventually got our room and were even given a room upgrade. The hotel is in a great location, 2 min walk to the beach, 2 min walk to the supermarket, bus stops on the same street. Staff are always friendly and helpful whenever you need something. Always a friendly greeting when leaving or arriving back to the hotel. The free breakfast was amazing, I didn't have high expectations however it was great! They have fresh bakery sweets and fresh fruit every morning, everything tasted great. Also had 24 hour coffee and tea which was great! Hotel has beach towels, chairs body boards and other things for guests to use on the beach for free. I will definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends and will not even think about staying in another hotel in our next stay in Waikiki. Thank you Vive hotel for making our stay a special one.

Location is good, close to the ocean. Breakfast is free, but average. Coffee, tea and filtered water is available for free 24 hours, that is very good. Few good restaurants are nearby, not expansive, affordable price. The only disadvantage - the room is small. But good equipped - wall TV, fridge, bath tub. Free beach umbrella, sand chairs (but very small), beach towels The staff at help and look friendly, but not always provided service as you requested. I would assign all of them with middle name "Unfortunately" :)
user_name:
Alex S
New York City, New York

review_body: We thought this hotel was great ocean view, free breakfast, and friendly and helpful staff. With beach gear included and a very reasonable rate we would recommend this hotel. There are some great restaurants nearby, including Korean and Mexican, and only 3 blocks from beach!

Awesome hotel VERY VERY nice staff. Everybody was so helpful. They have beach towels and chair for all guests for free. The breakfast was really good with a lot of fresh fruit. Coffee and tee was complimentary all day. Great location too, very short walk to Waikiki beach!

Excellent location in Waikiki within walking distance to the busier areas but away from the crowds and noise. As this was a three-day business trip for me I appreciated staying in a hotel that offers great WiFi coverage, breakfast, and coffee 24 x 7. I was working from my room part of each day in between meetings in town and at the convention center. As well it is easy to get in and out of the hotel due to its size. It can take forever to get to and from your room in some of the massive resort hotels in Honolulu, and they are often crowded and noisy. The staff was super helpful and the hotel is clean and well managed. The Jr. Suite was a good choice as I spent part of my day up at 5 am on phone calls for work. It was quiet and the bed was very comfortable. I slept quite well. The hotel is also close enough to the Honolulu Convention center that one could walk if so inclined, or it is a short ride via Uber. Downtown Honolulu is a bit more of a reach though, but still easily doable via Uber. Traffic in Honolulu is bad no matter what. I also appreciated the many different restaurant choices offered in Waikiki. And take out is everywhere too. I especially enjoyed the Korean short order take out restaurant across the street from the hotel. They offer a huge menu of authentic Korean dishes. If you are in Honolulu for business, definitely consider Vive Hotel as an alternative to some of the more hectic and crowded resort hotels.

If you plan to stay in Waikiki for a few days, look into staying at the Vive Hotel. A boutique hotel with a relax atmosphere and away from the hustle and bustle of big chain hotels. Refreshing!
