The staff is very friendly and attentive to guests' needs. Very chill, no rush, no pressure. Perfect if your plan is to relax.

great location, easy to catch bus to Ala moana Mall, free breakfast was bonus, i would stay again if breakfast is included, they provide iced water or tea or coffee downstairs, you could also bring your own food and heat up down stairs, lots of sofas to sit around so it was ok for breakfast time. you can borrow towels and body boards and mats to go to the beach (very handy)

Overall a great experience at five Waikiki. We stayed over two separate weekends. The second weekend we were able to book a larger room (Jr. SUITE) on the 20th floor which made all the difference as compared to the smaller queen sized suites. The larger room also had an ocean view which was a bonus.

Upon arrival, the front desk was welcoming and gracious. The attitude and atmosphere was relaxing and they made you feel like...you were on vacation. The rooms are cute and especially clean and yes, I said cute.The hotel provides a Continental Breakfast from 7am-9:30 am, get there early, a lot of folks wake up early to get their day going. But there is plenty of food, fresh fruit, pastries and toast, fresh juices and especially Kona coffee. Wonderful breakfast spots walking distance but why not take advantage of the nice breakfast that they provide.Conveniently located 2 blocks away from Waikiki Beach and a ton of retail shops- personally I do not like shopping but the beach was awesome. If the beach is your thing, the Hotel provides: beach chairs, towels, body boards and beach mats...just ask the front desk.10 Stars for their concierge KC. Local and knowledgeable! Small world, KC has lived in SF, bar tended in a couple of Epic spots out there and played in a couple of venues in SF and Oakland. I forgot the band that she plays in...She recommended a Sunset Cruise- Holokai Catamaran, sailholokai.com.A great cruise, the sunset was beautiful and the liquor was flowing. The crew was awesome.KC also recommended a couple of hikes that, unfortunately we were not able to try. Next time though.Overall the whole stay was awesome. The price per night was very good and the customer service/ambience was great. Looking forward to our next stay at the Hotel Vive.

Awesome place. 2 blocks from the beach. Offer towels and beach mats. Ruffage foods across the street has some great ahi poke bowls. In the heart of Waikiki. Will hold luggage for you if room isn't ready and vice Versa for pick ups

Stayed in Hawaii for the first time and this hotel was absolutely amazing! The location is ideal for walking the main strip. The staff are extemely friendly and go above and beyond for you. The hotel offers wonderful extras such as complimentary breakfast every morning and a courtesy suite that you can use free of charge on the day you depart for an hour. This was a wonderful surprise when my husband and I had a late flight back home and the hotel offered a new and clean room for an hour that we could freshen up in. More hotels should be like this one! Thank you for a lovely stay!

Vive Hotel gives you the comfort any other hotel in the area provides, but as a boutique Hotel, it has great character and personality the other large hotels in the areas don't have. If you are looking for a great quality hotel and a more personal/private environment, this is the hotel for you. The staff was great! That's all I'm going to say about them. The location is ideal and centralized. Most things are walking distance. I will definitely stay here again!

It was my honeymoon. Many peolple said 'Don't go expensive hotel in hawaii' so I booked vive hotel. It's not expensive but hotel were great. Staff were very kind. Room was small but everything was good.

This hotel's location is great and close to everything around Waikiki. The room and bathroom is small if you go for the standard room. BUT the rooms are clean and the bed is comfortable and the tablet provided it great. The aircon is very loud so I couldn't have it on while I was sleeping. The breakfast is very simple with coffee, tea, toast, tropical fruits and pastries but their is great musubi joint close by if you want some protein with your breakfast. The staff here is very friendly and helpful also the airport transfer they offered was cheap and efficient ($12 one way/pp). The let you borrow boogie boards, towels, beach mats and chairs which is great. Had a great stay and will stay with them again if I am visiting Oahu again.

Excellent Service and friendly environment. Good continental breakfast and free coffee and tea all day. The concierge was very helpful in providing information for our around-the-island trip. Would highly recommend.

Warm hospitality, knowledgable and helpful staff, prime location near the beach and constant coffee and water in the lobby was much appreciated. We had a great time here as a family. We will definitely be staying here again!

This is a very good spot in Honolulu. Everything was within 3 blocks or less of the hotel. The staff was great. Continental breakfast was included. A very good buy for the money. Would highly recommend. Should have gotten 4.5 stars but didn't see spot to do half ratings & wasn't perfect, so not a five.

We spent a week in Waikiki and this place was an ideal location to be. We walked to many great restaurants and shops within a few blocks.. and The Beach!!! And for further spots the bus went everywhere!!

I recently spent a week at the VIVE Hotel in a junior suite. It is in a great location, handy to Waikiki Beach, shops, restaurants and the bus/trolley lines. The staff were very friendly and helpful. My room was lovely and very clean, with a view of the beach (although it's 2 blocks back). It was great value for money.

Large rooms. Clean. Very friendly staff. Convenient location. Two block walk to paradise. There are plenty of other hotels nearby with similar comforts, however the best bang for your buck is at The VIVE. It's also a remarkably quiet hotel with a very nice free continental breakfast each morning. We will be back.

Not my most memorable hotel stay for the price I paid. Location was great, staff were mostly friendly.......however overall for me it was not a memorable hotel experience. I felt sick most days because of the mould contamination throughout the elevators and the old carpet. Carpet was so dirty throughout the building. The place was so dusty.

The staff was always helpful and happy. They always gave great recommendations and helped make The stay better. The room was clean, well maintained, and set up perfect. The tablet in the room to make automated service requests from extra towels to bringing my car to the valet stand was awesome too. I will defiantly come back here!

It's two blocks from Waikiki beach , so it's a really short walk from everything. It's in the perfect location. Rooms are really clean and always smell great. Breakfast has fresh fruit and bread and everything was kept clean. As a couple that wanted to go out and see it all, it was a perfect hotel- plus, we didn't have to pay resort fees like all the other hotels in the area

My boyfriend and I stayed at the vive for 7 nights before moving to another hotel. we chose to stay here as it was a great cheap alternative to your luxury hotels while still providing great service and accommodation. upon arrival they checked us in straight away, gave us pineapple juice, hot towels and said our room was ready for us (this was at 8am) which was great as we got to freshen up and hit waikiki beach. the hotel staff is great, very helpful and welcoming, KC is one the concierge's and she is the most helpful and genuine people who really wants you to have the best of both worlds. the hotel has free housekeeping daily, complimentary breakfast (just fruits and breads) and towels/beach mats for the beach! all in all, we enjoyed our stay here, room was always comfortable and perfect for just the two of us and i would definitely stay here again when i return to hawaii. thanks vive!

I wouldn't normally write a review during my stay but as I have another 11 days at the hotel I thought I'd share my experiences. I seriously can't fault this hotel or its staff. Everyone is here to help and they'll go out of their way to offer any assistance if it is required.From the moment I arrived I felt relaxed, a warm welcome with a drink, quick check in process and I was in my room. I decided to upgrade my room before I flew to a Junior Suite and I am so pleased with it especially after reading other comments about rooms being on the small side, something I have heard during my stay here. Fortunately the Junior Suite has plenty of room and is spacious and comfortable.It's the little things I love about this hotel. The free tea, coffee and water 24/7, the free breakfast served daily, the free wifi, local calls and a huge lounge area to relax during the day and listen to music. Oh I forgot the beach towels and mats! I could go on but this will sound like a commercial and it certainly isn't! I noticed a few people coming in with take outs and as I didn't feel like dining out I did the same, the fact that they have free plastic cutlery available is another huge thoughtful plus.Location is great for the beach, around 5 minutes walk and within a day or two I found I had my bearings of Waikiki. Close to all the shops and places to eat, you don't really need a bus!I'm here to run the Hawaii Half Marathon and never thought I'd be back in Hawaii but from the welcome I've received and standard of this hotel, I'm considering coming back next year!

We stayed here recently and found the hotel to be excellent. Considering the price we expected a "budget" style hotel and whilst the rooms are small they are very clean and the beds were super comfy. We weren't after "luxury" as we spent very little time in our room so it suited what we needed. It was in a convenient location - short stroll to everywhere and just up the road from the ala moanna trolley stop. The staff were really friendly and helpful at all times - we were very impressed by this. The only downfalls (and they are minor) were that the small bar fridge in the room really wasn't cold enough to safely keep food in it that required refrigeration and the parking was a bit pricey, however it was valet and the attendants were very friendly and nice. We would definitely stay again!

We didn't want to stay in one of the big corporate hotels, but still wanted a modern, clean environment. The Vive Waikiki fitted the bill perfectly. A modern feel to it, room was plenty big enough, and shower was actually a wet room and fabulous. Nice continental breakfast, delicious fruit and pastries. Conveniently located in central Waikiki, literally 2 mins walk to the beach. I had just one criticism, one of the two lifts was broken on two of the days of our 4 day stay.

We stayed at the Vive Hotel for 7 nights in April! Having been the first time to visit Waikiki, Honolulu this was a great place to stay. On the earliest flight into Honolulu we arrived at the hotel at 6:30am, check in isn't till 3pm. Thankfully the staff were kind enough to let us check in early and told us that breakfast is served 7-9:30am! Bonus! And to top things off we got pineapple juice and a cold face cloth of arrival. Perfect after a long flight. The room was quite small, but was manageable for 2 people for a week as we didn't spend much time in the room, it was clean and had everything we needed. All the staff at the hotel were really helpful and friendly, greeted us every time we entered the hotel lobby. The location of the hotel was great, only a block to the beach and the heart of Waikiki, very easy to get around. This hotel was great as it was affordable and close to the beach. There were also no hidden costs like Resort fees, you also get free breakfast and wifi. We plan to come back to Waikiki every year and this is the place we would stay. Highly recommended.

friendly staff - very helpful; clean, quiet, well lit and ventilated room; nice location - public bus stop next to hotel, a good and affordable eating place across the street, beach is short walk.The only odd thing is the shallow sink (less than 2 inches deep) in our room.

Although the staff and location were very good the size of the room was simply terrible. Matchbox size aat best. Also the lack of safety rails in the bath/shower really needs to be addressed by the owners. More like a backpacker hotel than an upmarket one as they try to impress upon you.

From the minute you pull into the valet parking off the street, to a daylit, clean and well furnished valet stand, you know you are in for something special. The valet takes your things to your room. (Thanks Tyler!) We were free to head straight for the beach after our pineapple juice and cool towel check in. A very short walk with our free towels and beach chair took us to Kuhio Beach park. Stop at the ABC along the way for a few refreshments and you are all set. Our spotless and well done room had a tablet that we used to order some ice, extra towels and pillows. They arrived within minutes. I really enjoyed the open air hallways. Seems so fresh and eco friendly. Everyone at the desk was super nice. The breakfast was delicious. All for less than half the price of our hotel the last time and even more luxurious. Keep up what you are doing! It is perfection.

Thank you for a wonderful stay. The one challenge was address quickly and the staff was very accommodating and helpful throughout. We would definitely come back if we ever get a couples weekend again.

This hotel is an excellent choice. Staff was extremely friendly and while my room was smallish it had a great view from the 19th floor. This was my 4th trip to Waikiki and I can only recommend this hotel to anyone. Breakfast in the lounge and coffee/the microwave all day and night . The hotel has none of those nonsense resort items, such as gym and pool etc. which ends up costing in "resort" fees. Highly recommended place very centrally located.

We are locals who didn't have the time to leave island for a birthday weekend. We had the Junior suite. Lovely, comfortable King size bed. Awesome walk in shower (a size of a large closet). Didn't care for the validated parking fee of $25.

Great continental breakfast, internet, and concierge service included. Beach towels and beach supplies provided. Very helpful staff and always ready to help. Very convenient location, close to everything if you are vacationing on a budget.

We had a very early arrival and the desk clerk was able to check us in...well before the recommended time AND we got to have breakfast as well!!Very happy with our room(junior suite), short walk to the beach and reasonably good views. Will happily come again!

Price & location is pretty good! Also offered services were very satisfied. Wifi, breakfast, rental, cleaning.... Some future. .. if we have chance to visit hawaii, we will stay again at the vive hotel!!!! Good

Stayed two nights in this perfectly situated hotel just minutes walk from the beach. The staff were helpful and courteous and we were given an upgrade to a junior suite on arrival when they discovered it was a special anniversary/birthday trip for my husband and I. The complimentary continental breakfast was great just what we needed to start the day. Only downside is they have no pool but we knew that when we booked. The use of beach equipment was greatly appreciated. Would definitely use this hotel again.

My stay at The Vive was excellent! I stayed for three days and two nights over a long weekend and received a complimentary room upgrade by booking through the hotel's website directly (we received an ocean view room on the 19th floor). Our room was clean, fresh, and modern. The hotel staff are extremely helpful and accommodating. The location of the hotel was great, and my guest and I walked to and from all of the surrounding restaurants/activities with ease. On our last day, we had breakfast delivered to our room from a great restaurant down the street! If you're looking for a hotel with awesome value and employees who provide quality customer service, look no further. I will definitely be staying here again.

great hotel with even better staff, the guys and girls were extremely helpful and knowledgeable and nothing was too much.room was very clean and comfortable and the hotel lobby was really unique and breakfast was plentiful.will recommend and be back someday.also 1 min walk to the awesome beach and only 3 ABC stores on the way haha.

The Vive Hotel, is a truly gem of a boutique hotel. It has a great vibe, a very good location, and a super friendly staff. Also, it is one of the few remaining hotels in Waikiki that does not charge a bogus "resort fee." The complimentary continental breakfast was a great way to start the day and featured high quality breads, fresh fruit, and coffee, served in the ultra hip and super comfy lobby. The room I stayed in was tiny and had no balcony although it did have a nice view of the ocean but they do make the most of the compact space. Overall, a very nice visit.

Great location, staff were amazing, perfect if you're looking for a base in Waikiki and you spend most of your time out and about! Free breakfast is a nice touch, and the price was so good compared to other big name hotels in the area.

Stayed here for 1 night with family in 2 cosmopolitan queen rooms on 18th floor. The corner room had an extra window which added more light. The rooms were small, but doable for a short stay. We could open 2 large suitcases, though the bathroom is very close to the bed. The hotel has a great vibe and is beautifully decorated. Walking in to check in and being greeted by juice and cool towels and a friendly face is always nice. The front desk staff (I didn't get his name!) was fantastic! He gave us great options for bars and directed us to a great desert! For the price, Vive hotel is a great find, modern, comfortable, Ideal location and with a free breakfast, what more could you want!

Stayed here for 1 night with family, and the experience was great! My brother and partner were just staying for a couple of hours before catching a flight, so had some time to kill. The staff was great in providing them with towels and boogey board to go out for a swim and providing great tips for cocktails and deserts! Very helpful staff at the front desk :) great valet service. Rooms were small and bathrooms a bit crowded but very clean and modern touches. Great breakfast in the morning. Would definitely stay again!

The room was amazing. Very hip and modern but also comfortable. The staff make you feel welcomed. Honestly the best customer service I've had at any hotel. Will be staying again. Stay at the vive you will not regret it

We had a great experience with Vive- staff were beyond polite and helpful and gave us great tips and advice for day trips etc. We enjoyed the free daily breakfast, access to beach towels and mats, and the prime location. Room size was sufficient for us, however it wouldve been good to have more space next to the bathroom sink. Aircon was good too, we didn't think it was too noisy or anything and we had a good rest each night. The only bad thing that happened was my friend and I broke out in hives around the 2nd day of staying there, which could've been an allergic reaction to the bedsheets or towels, but staff were more than happy to change these daily for us. Overall, we were very happy with our experience at Vive and we would definitely choose to stay here again should we come back to Waikiki. Thanks staff at Vive!

The hotel was perfect for our needs. I wouldn't say the room we had was anything special but it was clean and kept orderly. The location of the hotel was perfect for what we wanted to do while visiting Honolulu. The staff was great. They were friendly and took great care of us during our trip. Thank you!

We stayed for 4 nights at this hotel which is located very close to Waikiki beach. The room was small, but very clean. Bathroom is very tiny. AC was in the room and noisy. Location is good, but it gives a noise from the street, as our room was facing street (they call it "ocean view"). It's difficult to get a proper rest.Breakfast was good, in a nice breakfast hall. The staff was very helpful and always willing to help. They helped us to reschedule shuttle bus by calling to the company. The safety box in the room did not work properly, but they immediately sent a technical assistant to fix it.Overall, a pleasant experience.

We had a fabulous stay at Vive Hotel and thoroughly recommend it to anyone planning to stay in Waikiki, Hawaii. The staff were incredibly professional and helpful, allowing us to check in early, they gave us lots of information on what to do in Hawaii, provided free boogie boards, chairs, mats and towels for use at the beach and instructed us on how to get around the Island. The Hotel is a 3 min walk to the beach and two blocks away from the glaring lights and noise of the main street in Waikiki. We had friends and family stay in various other hotels around Waikiki (including very exclusive and expensive hotels) and Vive Hotel was definitely the best value for money hotel! The room was excellent with wonderful views of Kuhio Avenue, shower/bath facilities, desk with comfortable chair, huge range of TV channels, fridge, VERY comfortable king size bed, wardrobe space, money safety box and a variety of books / magazines about Hawaii. The room was cleaned every day and the service was excellent. There is a free continental breakfast available to all hotel guests which includes pastries, breads, muffins, fresh fruit, tea and coffee. There is a microwave, two small electric heaters, toaster, hot and cold water, juice and tea/coffee facilities that are available 24hrs a day. I miss the delicious breakfast already! We had a wonderful stay at Vive Hotel and would definitely stay here again if we returned to Waikiki in the future. Thanks to the staff at the hotel for a truly excellent stay.

Stayed Tuesday and Wednesday March 15 and 16. Room on 12th floor with a view down a main street and a view of a sliver of ocean. Small and efficient room the size of a cruise ship stateroom with very nice bedding and bath amenities. Excellent AC completely controlled in-room. Quiet. Very pleasant lobby and breakfast area. Continental breakfast a little overloaded with carbs but adequate with surprisingly good coffee. Easy walk to Waikiki sand and promenade. Would stay again.

Our family wholeheartedly recommends VIVE Hotel, Waikiki, Hawaii for your business or pleasure lodging. We stayed for 5 nights and found the location to be perfectly suited for our daily travel adventures. Having outstanding coffee available at all times was an added bonus.

Room was small with little counter space in bathroom. We could hear street noises from the Waikiki strip at night too, but overall can't beat the price for location, accommodating staff, and very clean modern atmosphere.

Stayed here for 4 nights in March and really enjoyed this boutique property.Very well appointed lobby and chill out area. Continental breakfast offered daily.Super friendly staff who are always at your disposal.Best part is the location, less than a 5 min walk to the beach and they provide towels, bamboo mats and chairs etc!Only issue is that their rooms are smaller but if you're not spending too much time in them then it's fine! They offer amazingly comfortable robes also.Shout out to Michael Otto and Christopher at the Front Desk!Mahalo guys!

My wife and I recently stayed at the Vive Hotel for a weeks holiday to spend time exploring this beautiful island of Oahu. We arrived at 6am Hawaii time after a long flight from Australia. Due to this early arrival time we had planned to ask if we could stow our bags somewhere at the hotel and go out exploring until our check in time later in the day. We were warmly welcomed at the reception desk with a cool scented face washer and glass of fresh pineapple juice, refreshing after an overnight flight! We spoke to the friendly gentleman at the front desk and explained the situation...we were pleasantly surprised when he said that he may have a room available for us so that we were able to check in early without needing to wait around. He was able to allocate a room for us and shortly after we made our way up to level 8 in an ocean view queen room. The hallways were nice and quiet, clean and private. Our room was very neat and clean, a tad small with not a lot of hanging room we found out (for things such as swimmers, towels etc). The items in the room seemed to be of high quality with classy fittings and a modern bathroom. Plenty of linen was supplied and the toiletries seemed adequate. In each room there is a nifty little tablet in which you can utilise for things like requesting a taxi, booking your next stay, requesting more toiletries etc. The FREE WiFi within the hotel is also incredibly useful!The mini fridge in the room was quite small and would only fit a couple of small cans or bottles. The fridge also had a sticker on it warning that it may not maintain adequate temperature and perishables may not be suitable to be put in there, however we found that the fridge kept suitable temperature over the time of our stay which was great. The window air conditioner was slightly noisy at times but not a nuisance (if you are used to the noise of a window aircon then this won't be an issue), it cooled the room adequately and was nice to walk into the cold after a big day of sightseeing! The hotel was in a fantastic spot to catch public transport with bus stops on both sides of the road heading in either direction. ([$2.50 USD one way for an adult] Bus number 42 is good to catch if you want to head to Ala Moana centre for great shopping or the Pearl Harbour Memorial). It's also easy enough to catch a taxi from the main road at the front of the hotel ($45 USD from the hotel to the airport). The hotel is also located only a 2 minute walk from the beach (the hotel supplies beach towels on request).The only thing that I could fault is the noise from the main road, I understand that this is something that's difficult to fix but just a heads up for anybody planning on staying here :) on the other hand, another fantastic aspect of the room was the double blinds on the windows, one for privacy and one for block out, this did help to cut out a small amount of the noise.The continental breakfast each morning was nice with a range of different sweet and savoury pastries, two types of bread, a range of fruit and tea and coffee, available as a buffet all you can eat located down in the relaxing modern lounge area. Checkout was seamless and super quick.Overall, we had a great stay at the Vive Hotel Waikiki and would recommend this hotel to anybody. We will be back to stay next time we are in Hawaii. B&T Williams

Great location: few minutes walk to Waikiki beach, 15 mins bus trip to the shopping center and business center. Staffs are nice and helpful. Free beach mats and towels are available. Room is bright enough and desk is wide enough to do desk work.

This is my second time staying at The Vive Hotel and let me tell you it's still a great place to stay. The rooms are modern, new, and SUPER clean. Me and my friend stayed in a room with two single beds. The room was spacious enough for us and all our luggage and the bathroom was also a good size. Since my last stay they have added tablets to every room and that was a great new amenity. The staff is welcoming and kind and try their hardest to make your stay a pleasure they try to accommodate every request. The complimentary breakfast is wonderful but I wish they would replenish more during the breakfast hours. Two days I arrived after 8 and there was no more papaya and they didn't replenish it. Also the sausage bread is delicious wish they had it everyday and the blueberry bread is amazing I loved it last time and this time was just as great. I love that the hotel supplies you with all the beach essentials a huge plus in my book. The concierge was nice and she gave us great tips, my friend went to a Luau and tour and she loved it. The location is WONDERFUL you are close to everything. I love the Vive Hotel so looking forward to coming back later this year. The hotel keeps getting better and better.

Stayed for 7 nights partly business and partly leisure. The room is used but in good condition and it is clean which is the most important thing to me. Staff was great and helpful. I would stay again. Location is very good by my opinion.

My 6-night stay was excellent. I chose this hotel because it was one of the few hotels in Waikiki that had modern style rooms. The only thing I would like added to the hotel is a fitness room. I would come back to stay at this hotel again.

Pros- included free breakfast, close to the beach, free beach gear, great staff membersCons- small rooms (very tiny), no balcony, no pool, not closer to the beach (they are close, like two small blocks, but wish it could be closer)Price is good compared to the other hotels. But I wish we knew there was no balcony. Next time, I would want to reserve a hotel with a balcony and partial/full ocean view. It's worth it. I had that the first time I went to Waikiki, and it was so tranquil to sit out late at night or early in the morning and listen to the waves crash.

Great location, nicest staff, best beds (so comfy!) and the best water pressure! So close to everything, beaches, restaurants, shops and tour pick up locations. Best stay we have ever had and would definitely recommend!

We stayed at the Vive for a week and every time we walked past a member of staff i said to my partner 'oh my god i love these people!' They had no faults! so so kind and helpful. The room was so clean and tidy as well as the rest of the hotel. The main reception has such a lovely layout and theme. The breakfast was nice and simple, lovely food. I loved it here, i definitely want to return to the beautiful island and will recommend this hotel!

The staff was super friendly and very helpful. The location is superb. Just off the very busy Main Street but a quick 2 block walk to the beach. Greeted with fresh cold juice and a cold cloth at check in. The fruit at the complimentary breakfast was devine especially the papaya! The room was clean and had everything we needed. Thank you for a wonderful stay.
user_name:
stephanie p
New York City, New York

review_body: Only cons...only carbs and sugar for breakfast options...no fans in the tiny tiny bathrooms. The staff and location we great. The sheets were very very soft and the beds were comfy. Very clean environment.

Comfiest beds ever, lovely staff and good location. There's a bit of noise from Kuhio Ave, but I have stayed in other hotels on this street and they were no different. Earplugs are a small price to pay for an otherwise gem of a hotel. Will return for sure!

Waikiki hotels are incredibly expensive and since we don't really like the big chains, we were happy to find this boutique hotel on Trip Advisor, which was a little more reasonably priced, around $200/night. We enjoyed much about it. The location was great - close to all of Waikiki, the restaurants and shopping, and 3 short blocks to the beach. The bus right outside would take you many other places, so that was convenient. The downside of that location is that it was noisy. We had a noisy air conditioner that fortunately blocked out much of the street noise, but we still heard it anyway. Some other pluses were the wonderful staff and an okay continental breakfast. There was a wonderful offering of fresh fruits and then some breads and pastries. I would have loved some yogurt, but I don't believe they have much dairy on the island so that was not an option. We enjoyed going to the beach and the hotel provided towels, beach mats, and beach chairs for free. Now the downside - our room was the tiniest hotel room we've ever had except for once in New York City. The bathroom was equally the tiniest. The "closet" space was not enough for one person's clothing, let alone two. In addition, the rooms and the halls just look a little "tired". A fresh coat of paint would have helped and the bathroom could have been cleaned a bit better. There was obvious mold growing in the overflow valve of the sink. Nothing terribly major.. But just some cosmetic changes that would have upgraded the hotel, despite the tiny rooms!

The reason I chose this hotel was because of it's location, it's fairly central in Waikiki and a couple minutes walk from food and shopping. A little over an hours walk to Aloha tower. One thing that really endeared me to the hotel were both the rooms and the staff. The main thing I looked for when reading reviews was a clean hotel, that's what I got. The rooms are small, but nice. They can easily fit four adults, but only one person per bathroom area at a time. Some other reviewers discussed street noise and WiFi signal issues, I didn't experience any of these on the tenth floor, but I travel with a white noise machine, so take that with a grain of salt. I didn't have a view of the ocean, I didn't specify that I wanted that in my room so it's not a complaint, but this property is one street back from the ocean, so if you're dead set on an ocean view, this may not be what you're looking for.Now to the staff, my check-in time was 3pm, my plane landed around noon, so I figured I'd stop at the hotel and check my bags and walk around for a bit. Instead, Sato and Paul took care of me right away. Sato "upgraded" me to a new room that allowed me to check in at noon and Paul was johnny on the spot with a damp towel and pineapple juice. Most of my staff interactions were with these two, and they were awesome people. Every time I had some tourist question, they were always friendly and informative. Overall, I would absolutely stay there again and I would recommend my friends and family.P.S. Vive management, seriously, Paul and Sato were awesome!

Nice little hotel that is right in the heart of Waikiki. A few steps to the Waikiki beach and Kalakaua Avenue where all the trendiest shops and restaurants are. They provide beach towels and mats. Free breakfast from 7:30 AM - 9:30 AM which includes fresh fruits, pastries, and coffee! Staff are very helpful and approacheable. This is just being nit-picky but sometimes they don't clean the bathroom as clean as I would wanted to. I would recommend this little hotel to my friends and family.

I walked in tonight and spoke with Chris about rates and availability for an 11 night stay. He informed me that only a junior suite at about $259 was available for the first 2 nights, then a standard room for the remaining nights at about $151. I asked since I've stayed there before and I was staying for a decent amount of time, could he give me the rate of $151 for the junior suite as well. He said no, but I could go to another hotel and come back in 2 days. I was a little insulted by that and said if I go to another hotel I'm staying there and not coming back. He said he wasn't going to lose his job over saving me $100. I said it's almost 7:30 pm what if you don't book it, then you lose $250? He said that's a risk I'm willing to take. I said that's a nice way to treat a returning guest. Now you lost an 11 night booking. Which when you factor in parking and other fees amounts to about $2,200.I'm not complaining about not getting the room at a discount, I'm complaining about his attitude. It was very rude and dismissive. Very poor service amd reflection on the entire staff.

Hotel is easy to access and centrally located in Waikiki. Bus service is just steps away. Excellent and attentive employee's always greet with a smile and acknowledgement. As a repeat customer I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Charming boutique hotel. Situated a block from Waikiki beach front and near the shops and restaurants. Great lobby to sit and meet with friends. Wonderful lobby seating pits to chat with friends and a great continental buffet style breakfast. Rooms modern clean and efficient use of space.

Wonderful petite hotel in the heart of Waikiki with a warm and attentive staff and amply supplied and comfortable accommodations. I would recommend it to anyone. New and most enjoyable. I found the hotel to be convenient to all shops and beaches. Walking is a must as you are within reach of restaurants, shops, park and transportation routes.

My wife and me went to celebrate our 29th wedding anyversary.Nothing could be better than choose Oahu, Honolulu, Waikiki, Vive Hotel.Staff receive us with a welcome letter and some complimentary chocolates due to our annyversary.That was real unique!Thank you Vive!!!

All the staff were very friendly and helpful. There was juice on arrival, and we were able to check in early. The room was not large, but perfectly adequate for a couple, and the bathroom was well laid out but did feel a little small. It was just a short walk to the beach, with interesting restaurants/cafes nearby. We really appreciated being able to use a courtesy room before our evening flight.

The welcome is perfect! Some fresh juices and a cold towel. Paul checked us in and helped us perfect. The lobby looks very sleek and would rate it 4 star. However the room is basic and the bathroom is very very small. We could not fit with 2 persons. Room is clean and well appointed. There is a tablet next to bed to ask for additional services like extra pillows. Very high tec! Only thing they could renovate is the airco. Very loud. We were also next to the emergency exit and every time the door closes out walls would tremble. There is a complimentary breakfast from 07-09u30. Fresh fruit and a lot sweet pastries. Simple but very nice. Location is perfect, next to bus stops to go to Honolulu centre and the Shopping Mall. They provide beach towels as the Waikiki beach is only 5 minutes walk away. In general very happy with this hotel. Good location but the quality is good for the money you pay!

We had a fantastic stay at the Vive with the beach, shopping and restaurants at our door step. Staff were great to deal with and available to answer any questions. Rooms were clean and view was wonderful. Breakfast was nice and great range to chose from.

Vive is a nice little boutique hotel in a good location, only a couple of blocks walk from Waikiki beachfront. The location is good and the trolley and bus stops are very close. Buses and trollies go continuously to the large Ala Moana shopping centre, Walmart etc and make it easy to get around. We cannot complain in any way about the staff at the Vive, they were warm, friendly and very helpful. We arrived at 7am and they let us check in at that time which we really appreciated after a long flight from Australia.It's a nice modern hotel with comfortable chairs in the lobby and breakfast area. However, the rooms are tiny, really tiny and the twin room beds are just singles. The rooms were very clean and we had no complaints on that score.Brekky was fresh fruit and pastries with muffins and toast, juice, coffee and tea. The eating area is lovely with armchairs to relax and eat in.The downside for us was the fact that there is no pool or gym so we decided to truncate our visit and switch to another hotel.Coffee of course is the ubiquitous drip filter common to the US but there is a Coffee Bean place only a block and half away so we walked there to get our morning lattes.So, overall a nice little hotel with lovely staff, just didn't suit our needs.

Excellent staff. Very nice breakfast in beautiful setting. Great location. Easy parking. Close to Waikiki Beach. Many restaurants within walking distance. Quiet. Very clean. Provides chairs and towels for beach.

Very nice boutique style hotel just a few block away from Kalakaua Ave. (beach). The lobby is charming and comfortable. Very nice area to have the breakfast that's included. The breakfast includes lot's of great fruit and breads and pastries. Kona coffee was good.We had a larger room which was comfortable for 2. The smaller rooms are small and 2 people would be a bit tight but doable if cost is important.I would stay again if I wasn't requiring a hotel that offered a pool and gym.

Excellent service, staff is extremely friendly. The 1200 check out time was very nice as well. I felt safe and secure staying here. Highly recommend this hotel. God has blessed this establishment and its staff.

Great accommodations, great service and very clean..wished there was extra toilet paper. Had a great night sleep. Wished there was some eggs or waffles for breakfast..valet service people were outstanding

My partner and I loved our stay at Vive. Very welcoming arrival. Breakfast in the morning was great, lots of fresh fruit, bread and pastries, the sitting room was comfortable and a great quiet place to chill out. Room was small but fine if you don't spend all day in it. We even got an ocean and mountain view :) the tablet in the room was really useful. Only con is the street noise and aircon was loud, but that didn't interrupt us too much. It's so close to the Main Street we loved the location, felt very safe. Would definitely stay here again.

It was excellent experience staying at this hotel. We loved staff friendliness and clean room, access to internet and coffee. Close to everything is a big plus! Booking again next time we visit Hawaii!

Great location - very clean and modern. Small rooms and unfortunate. window views of neighboring buildings. Wifi was free and strong, breakfast was good and prepared early, lobby was nice to lounge in and get advice from staff. Parking was easy.

Had the chance to stay there for 4 nights last week and very much enjoyed my stay there. The front desk staff went above and beyond to ensure an amazing stay. I can't thank PAUL and SATO enough for all they've done for us the entire time.The room was nice, but on the smaller side and definitely needed refreshing. The wall had countless of paint chip all over and the bathtub kept peeling every time I showered. The "ocean view" was also a BIG stretch as it was extremely partial with two huge buildings in the way. These factors were mostly the reason why this place didn't get an Excellent rating from me. Breakfast was nice, but not spectacular. There were no hot items (eggs, bacon, oatmeal, etc.) but everything on the buffet every day was fresh and tasty. The amenities were outstanding including free beach chairs, umbrellas, mats and beach towels. The front desk staff even provided us with sunscreen! That was a very nice gesture. Location only a few blocks from Waikiki Beach was also very nice and convenient. This is a great place to stay at with awesome amenities and great location. The free breakfast, Wifi, and NO RESORT FEE is also amazing. But beyond everything, they have a phenomenal staff there that will cater to your every need. Thanks again PAUL for an amazing job!!!

This hotel has a great location and many nice features for the area on a budget without feeling like you're slumming it. Check-in: All parking is valet only and $25 per day with unlimited in/out privileges. This is not uncommon for the area. We arrived a bit earlier than anticipated and by the time we dropped our car and made our way to the lobby, the front desk had cold scented towels and pineapple juice ready on the front desk counter to greet us. The lobby looked a little worn in places but overall very tastefully decorated and funky looking. The staff were awesome and offered tips for the area. There is a concierge desk as well which we did not use, however any staff member we came across seemed willing to direct us however they were able. The hotel and room: As mentioned above about the lobby, overall it is a little worn. However, I have found this to be quite common for the area and how busy it is. We had an ocean view room. The view was somewhat blocked by buildings ahead of it but you could see Waikiki. The window is high and I wouldn't expect to be able to lie in bed and watch the waves by any means but it was nice to see the ocean. It was very small, but clean and had everything you would need. Decorated very modern and utilized the space very well. Location: Very good location. About three blocks away from the beach (5 minute walk) and central on the Waikiki strip. We walked the area lots and never felt too far away from anything on Waikiki. Value: This hotel included many things that other hotels nearby charged for. There was no resort fee, we had free wifi, complimentary breakfast that had many types of bread, rolls and fruit, and you could get beach towels, chairs and boogie boards etc included from the front desk also. Overall: it's not the fanciest hotel but certainly feels like an upgrade from many others for the price. Would definitely stay here again or recommend for the Waikiki area on a more limited budget. (But by "budget" I wouldn't say "cheap" hotels here are definitely on the more expensive side)

We recently had a four day stay in Waikiki and enjoyed our time at Vive. Very friendly, very helpful and in a great location for all activities. We had a lovely view of the water which we always prefer.

The staff at Waikiki were always ready to help with anything that might be requested (including stamps for postcards). They were also full of local knowledge and could answer any questions I had. The morning breakfast was toast (try the fruit loaf, I am still thinking about it), various pastries and a lot of cut fruit. Great way to start the day before exploring. There is a bus stop just outside the entrance and the beach is about 30 seconds away. I highly recommend if you are looking for a good base of operations for your stay.

Sooooo, I switched my booking from a different hotel after reading that it was more like a hostel than a hotel. I picked Vive Hotel after finding a 15% off rate through Orbitz. For a 5 night stay I still paid just over $800. Let's not forget the $25/day valet charge that alllll the hotels charge in the area (such a scam). I was drawn to this hotel because they did not charge a resort fee....I mean, it's not a resort so why should they?But for the price I expected more quality. The staff, they're great. They were very helpful, kind, efficient, and quick. I can't say anything bad about the staff. However, the hotel is old, but "renovated." Throw on some new paint, change out the old dated fixtures for newer cost conscious ones, a tablet, flatscreen TV....BAM! Nope. My room looked beat up, despite these renovations. The walls were banged up and scuffed from people's suitcases, the refrigerator, though plugged in, kept nothing cold. They even give you a warning about that. What's the point? Even the paint on the toilet seat handle was worn....huh? Oh, and there's no ice machine....but there's a bucket for ice in the room. To get ice you call the front desk and the same guy who parked your car brings you a bag of ice from the kitchen. Say what? The room was otherwise clean, and I don't usually consider myself picky, but for the price.....I just expected a little more sparkle and shine.

I live on Oahu but had to find place to stay during Hawaii Salsa Congress . This place was recommended by friend and surpassed all my expectations . It started with very easy Valet parking and welcome with greeting me by name, fresh pineapple juice and cool face towel. The room was very modern and tasteful. The shower was huge. The continental breakfast buffet was plentiful of tropical fruit and pastry selection . A huge bonus was that after check out I could reserve a room to shower for up to an hour! Hotel is located on Kuhio street and it was surprisely quiet at night, another bonus . All staff was friendly , professional and super helpful . Wakiiki beach, the better part of it by the park was one block away and I could see the ocean from my window...overall it is a high class experience and I just felt pampered :)) Oh I am already inventing a reason for me to come back for another Staycation :))

This hotel had an excellent location (central to everything and calm at the same time, very clean, fair price and the staff was awesome. Staff was very helpful with everything: how to get at touristic locations, helped call taxi cab.

We wanted to break up a long flight from LA to Sydney, Australia so decided to stay overnight in Hawaii. Normally if are main destination was Hawaii, we would splurge on a beachfront hotel. So this is exactly what we needed. Very clean, small boutique hotel in a great location. Room was a little small but that really wasn't a problem being that we arrived later in the evening, just in time for a quick shower and then jump into bed! In the morning we enjoyed the breakfast buffet in the lovely lobby area. Would definitely recommend this hotel for a short stay or even a little longer if you want to save a few bucks.

Good size room, clean, good shower, everything we needed. Just 5mins walk from waikiki beach, bus stop 100meters walk with regular buses to all places of interest for just 1dollar 75cents.Breakfast basic but ok

Room was great and has what you need. Staff were always friendly and willing to assist. 2 minute walk to the beach, complimentary towels, chairs and matts provided by hotel. Free breakfast. I recommend and would stay again.

The Bad: Please be aware, you can hear all the noise in your room from the street below. I found the "rainfall shower" advertisement misleading... seemed like a normal shower... maybe that was just me. The Good: The 400 sq. ft. suite was spacious and the bed comfortable. Nice layout. Overall: My recommendation is spend an extra $25 - $50 and save your $250 for a place with a better view. Most service men and women can get a great rate at other comparable hotels.

This small boutique hotel in the midst of Waikiki was a welcome oasis of quiet and calm. Situated just a couple of blocks to Waikiki Beach but seemed miles away from the crowds. Friendly and competent staff were welcoming and happy to help us with whatever we needed. I also liked the fact that free beach towels, mats, umbrellas and chairs were available to us with no resort fee. Walking distance to great restaurants. Alternatively, you can order room service from a good selection of local restaurants via a tablet in the room. A bus stop right next door allows guests to avoid the use of a car in the city. Our room was large with a very nice corner view of Waikiki, Diamond head and the ocean. Bathroom was well appointed with a huge walk in shower. Perfect for visitors who want more personal attention than what is typically available at the huge Waikiki hotels.

stayed here for a week, based on the TA reviews, they were spot on, the valet parking was great, if your gonna have to pay for parking at least the valet it for you as part of it, bed linens were very good, sleep quality only lack sound proofing to the outside noise with wasn't to bad but my only real 'this is where they could make an improvement on' comment.I liked the comp breakfast, simple basic, everything u need in the basics. I did like the no tea and coffee set-up in the room, rather they have it all available in the lounge area if u want it.If we go back to Oahu we will stay here again.

Small hotel experience that is really special. Responsive staff that were extremely helpful and nice. Perfect size hotel that made it more intimate, not the huge crowds of people that are more typical in Honolulu. No extras like resort fees that are really annoying. I would highly recommend Vive Hotel as a great beach holiday

Staff was friendly, attentive, and helpful. Room was great - very comfortable. Lobby was very inviting. Complimentary breakfast was healthy (a lot of fresh fruit) and outstanding. Beautiful beach only a block away.

I booked 8 nights. Price is perfect and amnesties are great. The room was really small than I thoughts but it was okay. Vive location is perfect really close to waikiki beach and shopping centers. and staffs are nice overall. one of the best service was valet parking we thought price are expensive but we looked other public parking and everything we decided to to valet parking in here ! $25 it is worth it. Valet staff is really nice and kind.

From the reservation process began with Chris down to time to board the shuttle to the airport, our stay at the Vive Hotel couldn't have been any better. Upscale and clean, we felt like we were in a European boutique hotel. Our every need was anticipated with open friendliness. Greeted with fresh pineapple juice and cold refreshing towels, the helpfulness continued throughout our stay. Not only did we receive beach gear and towels to use, but we were offered sunscreen and aloe gel, too! A tad late for breakfast, we were still generously served. We had to check out 8 hours before our flight left, but the staff made certain we were able to continue our day at Waikiki with supplies, access to our luggage, and even a room for showering and final preparations for our flight. Thanks for a wonderful time at Vive Hotel!

We stayed at Vive for 4 nights and had a very enjoyable time. The hotel is greatly located, just 5 min walk from Waikiki Beach and rooms are very good, although rather small. The breakfast buffet is ok, but could benefit from some more healthier options (youghurt, porridge, whole grain bread etc).We also want to especially recommend the helpful staff and the concierge service - they helped make our excursions truly great.Many thanks to Vive Waikiki and its staff!/Linus Wiebe and extended family.

You can easily walk to the beach, the zoo, the fine restaurants in Waikiki and shopping. The staff are friendly and super helpful with directions. Continental breakfast is very good for a quick bite before heading out to the short walk to the beach. I will definitely stay here next time I go to Waikiki.

Walking distance to the waikiki beach and nice food nearby.Room is small but still manageable. Our room are ready when we check in in the morning around 10am and these is already welcome drink and our checkin detail on the front desk after we hand our car to the valet parking guy.

Loved Vive Hotel! Would highly recommend to anyone looking for a place to stay in Waikiki. Staff are SO friendly. Upon check in you receive a complimentary pineapple juice and cool face towel to freshen up. All beach equipment (boogie boards, chairs, umbrellas, towels) is provided at no cost - just ask for whatever you want at front desk on your way to the beach. Breakfast (also complimentary) was super nice (fresh fruit, toast, lots of different pastries, tea and coffee). And the room was very clean and modern - had everything you could need (blow dryer, shampoo and body wash, free wifi etc). Bed was super comfy! Hotel is very quiet so no problem battling any noise to get to sleep!And just a 2 minute walk to the beach - so easy! Couldn't be any closer unless you were beachside. Overall I would DEFINITELY stay here again - we had a great time and were super impressed with every aspect. On our first night in Waikiki we stayed at the Moana Surfrider - was beautiful inside and lovely grounds but cost us an arm and a leg and had no inclusions (no beach equipment, breakfast etc) and the staff didn't really do much to make you feel special. So when we got to Vive we were stoked and had a much better experience whilst paying a fraction of the price!

I booked 4 nights last minute (walk in) while all other hotels were stiff arming me, these guys were relaxed yet completely professional. in particular Paul who gave me a great room at great deal with great location.

Good location and clean rooms, I had an issue with the A/C smelling a little weird. There is a 25 dollar daily valet parking fee, but if you book through them directly they cut that 50% off. Something good to know before booking, check their site for deals. Unlimited in and outs with parking, tablet style services for ease of use and no need to call front desk, just place in the request through the tablet.Not super close to the heart of the shopping centers but walk-able distance. Just across the street there is a restaurant that makes really good mini bento bowls and musubi's.

The hotel is close to everything and cosy. The staffs are friendly and helpful. We like the breakfast however it is unhealthy on the pastries but we always have frsh fruit everyday. I would recommend that the hotel can replace the fatty pastry by some healthy brown bread and cereal.

I booked this hotel because of it's location in Waikiki and other positive reviews that I had read. The staff was definitely the best part of staying at this hotel! We got to know most of the people working at the front desk and valet and they were extremely friendly and helpful for our entire stay. I would highly recommend this place for anyone looking for an affordable stay in the Waikiki area.

During our vacation we spent 8 days at the Vive Hotel Waikiki in Honolulu. The Vive is a small, but very beautiful and boutique hotel. Hotel staff were very friendly, helpful and welcoming. Particularly polite and friendly was Mr. Cato at the front desk. We were very happy with his kind attitude towards us. Vive hotel has a great location and a block away from the Waikiki beach, plenty of stores and restaurants nearby. Hotel provides free complimentary breakfast and all beach essentials. On the next trip to Hawaii we will definitely consider coming back to the Vive hotel and will recommend to all our friends.A couple from San Diego, CA

Vive has FANTASTIC service!! Upon arrival we were given a glass of pineapple orange juice and a cool towelette to relax. We arrived around 8am at the hotel just wanting to drop off our luggage before we explore Honolulu - we did not expect to check in at all as we knew check in was at 3pm but the staff gave us a free upgrade to a room that was twice the size of our original room and let us checked in right away. They also kindly offered complimentary breakfast (coffee, juice and cakes).The hotel is newly renovated - Very good value for money. Free WIFI and free breakfast. Location is ok -approx 10-15mins walk from main shopping strip. 5 mins walk away from Waikiki beach.Only downside is the hotel rooms are on a noisy side .. throughout the night you can hear a few loud trucks and buses driving past. Might be a problem if you're a light sleeper but definitely fine if you sleep like a log. Vive hotel's best feature is their customer service - definitely made our trip more memorable!

Small but clean & comfortable rooms. All beach essentials provide by hotel. Breakfast was filling. 24 hour coffee & water. Hotel staff are very friendly / helpful and welcoming! Would definitely consider coming back to Vive and would recommend to others.

We found this hidden gem of a hotel on line. It is a very special boutique hotel in a city where most hotels are overly large, too expensive, and filled with too many tourists. The VIVE is stunning, beautifully decorated, new and clean, and a treat for anyone with an eye for beauty. The decor is top notch, contemporary, exotic, and very appealing. We were greeted by a very friendly staff. Chris at the front desk couldn't have been nicer. He gave us 2 glasses of pineapple juice as soon as we arrived to check in, and the nice guy in their valet parking garage had our luggage up in our room before we took the elevator up there. We were given a double room, # 801. It was truly beautiful with nice artwork, a mini fridge, air-conditioners and 2 small bathrooms. It was very quiet and comfortable. The complimentary breakfast was varied with different breads, fruits and rolls, a toaster, micro wave oven, and unlimited coffee all day long for the hotel guests. This hotel is a great find, at a good enough price for a prime location a block away from the beautiful Waikiki beach and there are plenty of stores nearby. We can't wait to return to the VIVE on our next trip to Hawaii. It was an exceptional find. This hotel was wonderful!!!!!

The stuff is reale friendly and allways helpfull! The rooms are very small; and Insider it is loud from the street; also it is windy Insider because the door did not fits well!The location is perfekt so you can walk to all good places in town! The parking fee with 25$ is to high!

Nice hotel with acceptable price for Waikiki location. Staff is perfect all the day. We recomend this hotel, it was very pleasant to stay there.Complimentary services are very good, valet parking service perfect.

Great location,warm welcome and friendly staff .We arrived early and we were going to drop our bags off until our room was ready but when we got to reception they informed us that our room was ready and we could check in which was great after a 9.5 hour flight, clean and tidy room,close to beach. Wold definately stay here again and highly recommend it to friends and family

We were looking for a reasonably-priced hotel that didn't have that overwhelming 1980s seashell and wicker furniture vibe. Thankfully, we found Vive Hotel. The room wasn't huge, but it was clean and modern and, let's be honest, you're not in Waikiki to spend all day in your room. They have beach amenities, continental breakfast, and free Wifi. Only downsides were a lack of enclosed drawers for storage, and a bathroom that was very tiny and lacking space for toiletries. We would definitely stay here again on a return trip to Waikiki!

I'd recommend the Vive. We are a couple and the rooms were a little small but adequate and expected after reading the reviews. The room was clean and all staff were extremely friendly. The free wifi and breakfast came in handy. The breakfast wasn't overly extravagant, but it was all we needed. We liked the location. It was handy to the beach, supermarket and bus stop without having to step out into it all everyday if you didn't want to. We have stayed at the Outrigger Reef before but liked this location better.

We had a late night flight, so we chose Vive since they offered luggage storage, and the use of a courtesy room after we checked out (Checkout was 12pm). It was our 30th anniversary, and we were updated from ocean view room to a jr. suite ocean view room (1208), which was great since it had a partial ocean view and partial view of diamond head. Check-in/out was super short/easy. 3 block walk to Waikiki Beach was no problem, and we shopped and ate many times in between. Free Continental Breakfast was satisfactory, and the eating area was pleasant. 24/7 coffee/tea was also great. Our particular room was wheelchair accessible so it did not have a bathtub, but the shower was extremely large. Westbound bus stop was steps away, and the eastbound stop was about a short block further. Yes, standard rooms are small, but good enough for 2. The a/c was a little noisy.

The location and rooms are not great, its a 3 block walk to the beach and the rooms are a bit small, however the common spaces and services are really nice. I would recommend it. The staff is great. Theres a breakfast service every day what is great. They hand you towels and beach stuff.

The Vive is a good value with friendly staff in the heart of Waikeke Beach area. Smaller but very clean and comfortable room with a view of the ocean. Staff went out of their way to assist with dining choices, directions, and beach supplies. We would definitely choose the Vive again.

Great experience staying at the Vive Hotel Waikiki. All staff members were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is very close to the beach, easy access to nearby stores and restaurants. Perfect location and price point for downtown Waikiki area.

VIVE was amazing, from the moment you step inside, staff were amazing smiling and always willing to help whether it be with activities, new food places or anything we needed help with. Room was perfect for what we needed a bed and a bathroom that were always kept clean. Definitely helped make this trip to Hawaii magical for us.

The title says it all...great way to be welcomed to Oah'u after staying on the Big Island for a few days!The hotel was perfect for what we wanted, close to the main thoroughfare of Waikiki, a bus stop right outside to go to Pear Harbor and the Iolani Palace/Downtown, and at night it's quiet enough to get a good night's sleep. The breakfast was also very good, with lots of fresh fruit every morning and pastries. The staff were very friendly and the tablet in each room makes it very easy to make requests and discover things about the local area. We used it to arrange transport back to the airport and we were given confirmation in minutes that this had been booked for us. Another handy feature was the fact you can sign up for an hour in the courtesy room on the day of your departure, which gave us time to freshen up before our late night flight to the continental USA.The only thing that I would say is that the hotel should make sure it's postal address is written on all email correspondence. When we arrived at Honolulu airport and got in a taxi I took out the confirmation email and there was no address, nor was there one on the calendar reminder that was uploaded on to my phone from my email confirmation. As a non-US resident I was unable to look it up on anything as well, due to usage restrictions on my phone. So it would be a good idea to note it down, as we discovered our pronunciation of the hotel's name (me and my fiancée are both English) was incorrect and our driver didn't know where we meant until we spelt it out for him!If you are planning to stay in Waikiki, don't rule this place out because it's a resort, the beach is a stone's throw away, there are no added resort fees, and you still enjoy the shops and bars of the resorts/Kalakaua Avenue. I would definitely stay here again
user_name:
tdh050388
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: On arrival I was greeted with a refreshing glass of juice and a slightly dampened face cloth to freshen up. Chris checked me in and it took all of two minutes. The room was your average size room and it was very clean as was the bathroom and shower. The bed was very comfy and I think Vive have the best pillows I've ever slept on, super comfy. There is a small fridge in the room along with a safe to keep your belongings in. I found all the staff at this hotel to be very friendly and very helpful, nothing was too much trouble. The hotel has free Wi-Fi and I always got a good signal, they also offer a free continental breakfast, it's nothing fancy but it gets you through the morning, one nice touch is they offer free tea & coffee and cold water all day long.Located just a couple of blocks from Waikiki Beach it's perfect, not too much noise or foot traffic, there are bus stops either side of the hotel so commuting around the island was very easy, Chris who was working the front desk gave me a great tip, if you get on the bus and you pay cash ($2.50) be sure to ask the driver for a transfer ticket, if you decide to head back to where you came from within a three hour window you can use the transfer ticket as your return ticket, can't beat that deal, $1.25 each way! I found Vive to be a perfect place to stay, apart from all the staff being on their game I found it very affordable as to other places I checked out in the same area and Vive will not charge you the "resort" fee other places will nail you for. Upon checkout I had a few hours to kill before heading back to the airport, the hotel offers courtesy rooms for free, you just need to book it with the front desk the night before, it's great if you wanna head the beach for a few hours and then take a shower before you head off. Overall you wont be disappointed, if and when I return to Waikiki Beach this will certainly be my hotel of choice. I hope this was of some help, enjoy Oahu it's a beautiful island.

Great experience!! We loved the proximity to the beach, the other hotels, restaurants and shops. It was a perfect location and for the price... Perfect! The staff, specifically Paul and Tyler set us up perfectly with great dinner locations not recommended in our guide books!

Absolutely amazing boutique accommodation right in the heart of Waikiki! We stayed at the Vive hotel for our honeymoon in Feb, the staff were warm and welcoming, and did everything they could to make our stay memorable - including a personal welcome note and chocolates on the bed! Fast wifi, delicious breakfast, clean facilities, airport shuttle, beach equipment. I would definitely recommend this accommodation to others

I would highly recommend the Vive hotel for anyone who is looking for a relaxing and clean hotel. The staff were very helpful and we found the room to be just what we needed. Always clean, a short walk to the beach with beach mats and towels always available! The breakfast in the morning saved us from walking around everyday trying to find a place and we loved the fresh fruit. Would most definitely stay here again and have already recommended it to friends and family!

My boyfriend and I absolutely loved how this hotel catered to us. We were told each room comes with a mini tablet from which you can order food, request amenities and request for your vehicle to be made available. The breakfast was also amazing. They had toast, assortments of other breads including these breakfast rolls which tasted similar to the Kings Hawaiian dinner rolls but which have a small amount of tuna baked into them right in the middle of the roll, which was very tasty, fruits including pineapple, coffee, tea, water and pineapple juice. The only thing I would've loved is if they had in house room service. The only type of room service available is nearby restaurants delivered to your doorstep which is nice but a little pricey. They probably just don't have the room for this kind of amenity. Other than that, everything was absolutely perfect!

This hotel was awesome. The staff is super sweet and very helpful! It's a great hotel for a very reasonable price!!!!! The rooms are not huge, but they have everything you need. It was quiet and cozy and I felt very safe.

Stayed here last month with some fri nods for a few nights. Convo entry located and the accommodations were great! The service was excellent and KC at the front desk was as helpful as could be. Highly recommend!

This is a small boutique-type hotel that is well-located. I took a shuttle from the airport ($16.00) and the city, because I had read that parking in Waikiki is expensive. A variety of restaurants are within easy walking. Every staff member was outstanding! Upon arrival, I was offered juice and cold wash cloths. (Nice!) At check-out they held my bags so I could have one last day in the sun, AND offered a "freshen-up" room before I caught the "red-eye" flight. (Extra Nice!) My room seemed recently updated, however the halls could have used a fresh coat of paint.

The hotel is located just 2 short blocks from the heart of Waikiki beach. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They provided us with several good food recommendations. They valet was fast with the car and he was always available. The continental breakfast was a nice assortment of breads and fruit, plus beverages. We have certainly seen more choices at other hotels, but this is one of the few hotels that offers this amenity in this price range. The only complaint, and I had read this on TripAdvisor in some of the reviews of this hotel beforehand, was the small air conditioner unit. It never really kept up with cooling the room. Otherwise, there is free wifi, cozy rooms with nice views, access to beach gear, and a very nice decor. We had a great time and would stay here again.

the room is not large, no place to hang swim suits or any to dry, but it's tidy. And I'm glad to have coffee in 24 hours. And location is great, it's really convenient to go anywhere. Next time when I visit Hawaii, I will stay again.

Staffs are nice and efficinet. Close to the most popular coast in Waikiki. Shopping stores and restaurants are all around. Car parking charge $25 per night. Bar is available 24hours for drinks.But breakfast hasn't many choices.

My mom and I were in Honolulu for a mother/daughter winter break at the end of Jan. Since we were scheduled to arrive 9pm at night, didn't feel like paying premium price plus resort fee for our first night in town. So, I decided to book a cheap and cheerful hotel in the Waikiki area. We arrived at the hotel around 10:30pm local time, the concierge was friendly, helpful and gave us a complimentary upgrade to a much bigger and better room. What a nice surprise and great way to start our vacation in Hawaii!!! The hotel also offers free breakfast daily, and provides beach chairs and other related gears to all hotel guests. This is chic boutique hotel, located in the heart of Waikiki, just a 5 mins walk from the beach. If you are on a bit of a budget, and doesn't care for all the fancy stuff that comes with a big chain hotels then this is a great place for you!

A great place to stay and close to everything i.e. the beach, different eateries, with the shopping centre and cinema just a bus ride away. The complimentary breakfast was more than enough to kick start your day (esp. the blueberry bread) and the staff were friendly & accommodating. The rooms are not big but then you only need it for sleeping as most of your time will be spent exploring Waikiki. Overall, a nice place to stay and value for your dosh.

Staff was superb and helped us out whenever we had any questions. Especially Chris at the front desk was helpful. Tablet in the room was great if you are not that comfortable using the phone, and it really worked as fast as a phone call too. We had a broken safe and after 10 minutes it was fixed when we sent a request via the tablet. We ordered food delivery from a pizzeria and that went smoothly as well. Rooms can be a bit noisy on the street side.

It's really nice to stay with VIVE hotel. The place is just about 3 mintes walk from the beach. Staff are very firendly and helpful. Ice cold water and coffee are offer 24 hours a day at the lobby. I'm willing to stay with VIVE next time when I visit Hawaii!

Good amenities, great staff, short walk to the beach and food. Staff were so helpful with borrowing items, local knowledges and willingness to help. Will definitely be coming back. Thank you for a great trip!

Two blocks away from the beach. There is a bus station right outside of the hotel. Many good restaurants within walking distance! The stuff are nice and helpful. We really enjoyed our stay. The room is clean!

Many hotels around, but their prices are far more expensive. I was very happy about the location and price. Staff was excellent. It's not your typical large hotel, it's boutique style, but this was fine by us, seeing how we were only there to sleep, and eat their free breakfast.

Small room, clean with window A/C. great location near beach. breakfast buffet lack luster.Friendly generally helpful staff. Excellent house keeping. Upper floors quiet. Shopping within walking distance.

Nice location with easy access to Waikiki and Honolulu Zoo. Room we stayed in was very small, but efficient. Even had a partial view of Diamond Head. Although we didn't recieve beverage or towel upon check-in as advertised, staff were friendly and nice. Free beach towels and mats and daily decent continental breakfast in hotel's "living room" were a real plus!We had to have a car during our stay to visit family & friends around Oahu and there is only valet parking which is really the only way to go for the location.

Excellent staff and spotless accommodations. Perfect location. Double queen bed comfortably allowed two adults to have their own bed, bath, desk and TV. Plenty of space to relax together or separately. Would definitely stay here again. Outstanding housekeeping staff.

A great location; easy walk to shops, beach and dining. Breakfast in continental, but adequate. Décor is pleasant, valet parking is available, which is a must. Concierge services were helpful. A nice way to end a memorable vacation in Hawaii.

While the rooms and windows are small, this hotel has done the best with the space available.The rooms are modern and nice, the lobby is functional, the location is great, the breakfast and amenities are good and the staff are fantastic.I would have no hesitation recommending VIVE! A great place to stay

We stayed here for the last 3 nights of our honeymoon and it was lovely. A great location, very easy to get to beach and bus stop which was right out the front. Only thing missing is a pool. We enjoyed lazing by the pool most of our honeymoon so we missed that however the beach is about 100m down the road. The staff were very helpful and friendly too.

We really enjoyed our stay. Our rooms were spacious and very clean. The staff were always helpful and friendly. VIVE provides complementary wifi, continental breakfast and everything you'd need for a day at the beach towels, chairs and body boards. We loved that it was close to great shops and resturants. The price was right as well!

Great location, great staffVIVE is easily accessible by bus from the airport. The staff were very polite and very genuine. We were greeted with pineapple juice and cold towels upon arrival, and you are always greeted with a friendly smile throughout your stay. The lobby is funky and modern; we enjoyed the decor.A very convenient location - a 2 minute walk from Waikiki Beach, and there were plenty of food options within walking distance. There were also several different bus stops located around the hotel, and you are provided with a map of bus routes to several popular destinations.The room itself was clean and modern, and the whole hotel is non-smoking. The hotel also provides free wifi, and continental breakfast (pastries, fresh fruit, juice) and coffee, tea and water are provided complimentary 24/7. VIVE provides complimentary beach towels, mats, and boogie boards to use at the beach – a great touch, and it saves you from having to pack or buy your own.We would certainly re-book our next trip to Waikiki with VIVE.

We found this hotel to be in a great location, close to the beach and shops, nice atmosphere with modern daycore. The continental breakfast was generous and fruit was very fresh, the staff were always accomidating and friendly and made our stay enjoyable. I would only have a few small critisisms which would be that the room was a little smaller than first thought , as the pictures on line made the rooms look a little larger, but really this didn't effect our stay too much, the air con was a window box air conditioner which was noisy and didn't get that cold and the vallet parking was a tad pricey at $25us a day. Overall a great hotel for the price. I would defiantly stay here again

The hotel was very clean and close to everything. The continental breakfast was great with lots of choices. Would recommend Vive Hotel to anyone. The price was very reasonable, don't let the low price scare you away. We stayed in a room with twin beds. The space was small but all we needed.

There is some Consistency with Chain Hotels like the Marriotts, Hyatt's, Starwood's and Hiltons...They are a CONCEPT and they believe on CONDITIONING their Hotels and Staff to give you a Signature Service and Product...IF you are board with that and you are looking for a Real Boutique hotel. Try Vive Waikiki...This Hotel is Independently owned. Something that you would expect in Miami Sans a Swimming Pool Each room is unique in its design and theme and it is trendy and contemporary.
