The lobby is very unique with a great room concept however there is no dining outlet. Just an infused beverage and coffee station in the lobby which is complimentary. The Lobby for Mingle and Rooms Upstairs for Moments of Relaxation. No Frills like Fitness Center or Gift Shop or Lounge. This is a great place to stay if you are on a run. After all who travels to Hawaii to enjoy a Hotel when there is Surfing? Aloha...
user_name:
Seventhnana
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Location is ok. Size of the hotel and rooms- is reasonable, good, affordable. Decor in lobby is pretty and original. The only thing I'll change is maybe little bit different breakfast and morning meals. To be more different options every morning or every second morning. Rooms are small but clean and nice. I mean if you are already in Hawaii who cares of the room. I was there to be out there and enjoy in nature. Staff great and friendly. Beach gear - is huge bonus as well.Aloha and Mahalo guys from Washington DC… :-)
user_name:
max m
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The location was perfekt. Close to Waikiki Beach and shopping streets.Good service, Nice room with a spacious bathroom. Very friendly staff.Nice breakfast. Valet parking very convenient. To be recommended.

Vive's main floor is very attractive & welcoming. The regular rooms are small (spent first night) & was upgraded to a corner room with much more space which accounted for a very comfortable stay. The shower was massive, 2 ACs & in-room safe was great to store 2 laptops etc.. Everyone was very helpful at the front desk, especially Sato. The other staff were also very friendly. Beverlyn & Salve did a fantastic job stocking the breakfast area & was very accommodating when the late-sleepers arrived after breakfast hours. They brought the food/fruit back for them to eat lol. Above & beyond. Three short blocks (5-minute) walk to the beach, shopping & restaurants. What is very much appreciated is a courtesy room provided to us to relax/shower/freshen up before our 11.30 pm flight back home. The 24-hour coffee, tea & water is an added bonus we did not take for granted. We are coffee & tea drinkers. Vive is highly recommended & would return in a heartbeat.

One of the best Hotel that we have stayed in Hawaii. We have been commingled to Hawaii for many years. Almost every year for our Anniversary in January.Great location. Easy access to everywhere.And the staff made us feel welcome and as we were special guests.Thank you all for making our stay soecial.We'll be back many times more.

Great service by everyone here and very clean and tidy. The room we had was level 8 and overlooked Kuhio Ave so the single glazed windows didn't provide much soundproofing. Go higher and away from the roadside and this would be ideal! The location is as good as you will get without being on the main drag!

Excellent location, staff, rooms and breakfast was a bonus. Short walk to the beach each day. Great view from our room. Loved the shower and the king bed. Staff were very friendly Will definitely be back.

Highly recommend this hotel. Great location, service provided by staff and value for money. Staff went above and beyond our expectations to ensure that our needs were met. Thanks for making our first trip to Hawaii memorable!

We had a great time staying at the Vive and will do so again when we come to visit Honolulu. We stayed in the Junior Suite which was spacious and cleaned every day by the hotel staff. The wifi was great, laundry close by and can't say enough about the friendliness of the front desk, valet and housekeeping staff. Great hotel!

I don't normally do reviews but for this hotel I gotta! It's a smaller hotel yes but soooo clean everything is still new. We enjoyed our stay at the Vive. Loved how they were walking distance from beach and most eateries. They also had towels chairs mats and umbrellas for us to take to beach. Valet was awesome 25$ a day not to bad. Fresh fruits and pastries in the am! Free wi-fi and no resort fee. Only complaints was lighting in room was dim and one light actually went off but they fixed it immediately once we told them. The bed was soooo comfy! Never said that before for a hotel but yes!

The hotel is located close to the Waikiki beach (2 blocks), so location is good and staff is friendly. When we arrived, we had no idea that parking was $25/night. We did not see it listed on Expedia as a charge. We stayed 5 nights, so it got pricey. When we got in our room, it was about the same size as a cruise ship standard room, in other words small. The bed took up 85% of the main living area. There was about 18" between the bed and wall. The bathroom was tiny. If you're over 5' 5" tall, be careful sitting on the toilet, because you might hit your head on the sink on the way down. They tried to charge us for the two bottles of water in the room, which we didn't touch. The windows are single pane, so you hear every and I mean noise, siren, chatter, conversation, bus stopping, reverse alarm in the room like you are right there. We were on the 15th floor.A minor inconvenience was that they have to change all of the door locking mechanisms while we were there, a minor inconvenience, but still an inconvenience.The staff is very personable and accommodating.

This hotel is in a fantastic location near the beach and tons of great food. The staff is very helpful. There was some ambient city noise in the room but it didn't bother me much. Wi-Fi works great. I would definitely stay here again if in Waikiki!

Location is great, short walk to everything you want to see at night. Price was OK, hotel lobby/entrance is beautiful but rooms and hallways need updating. Looks like the walls have been painted over a few times and looking a bit rundown. Rooms are pretty small but do the trick. Room was always clean, always a plus! Front desk staff were super helpful and friendly.

I had been stayed here two times in 2012 and 2016. I asked my room upgrade if there was available to upgrade. Hotel provided me with a good and cosy room to relax and enjoy my vacation for 4 days. I really appreciate their hospitality and good service. Every day, I could rest and enjoy the good time during my stay. Always, I could drink cup of coffee, Kona coffee bean that is produced in Hawaii, and Ice water at the Hotel cafeteria. Also, I could borrow equipment to enjoy snorkel and/or relaxation at the beach. They always ready to provide a good service and happiness to us.

Booked this after reading lots of trip advisor reviews. We loved our stay--very convenient. Short walk to the beach--if you've never been to Waikiki- the beaches are public and there really aren't many hotels ON the beach unless you want to pay a ridiculous resort fee on top of the tourist prices. Front desk has chairs, towels, mats and the occasional umbrella, all free for beach use--super convenient! Parking is valet only, but that is almost all the hotels. Valets are very efficient and helpful. Rooms are small-many people complained about them, but come on-- you're in Hawaii! Go outside! And no need to pack a huge suitcase either- everyone wears swimsuits and Hawaiian shirts. Rooms reminded me of European hotels, but have much nicer bathroom upgrades. We had an issue with our toilet flushing and had to use the lobby bathrooms a few times, which was fine with me. The ones downstairs are very nice. The issue was fixed quickly so it really wasn't a problem. Breakfast is typical continental, light on protein. But they have coffee down there all night.Also stayed at the embassy suites this trip. Very different hotel styles and prices. Doing it again, I think I would stay more nights at Vive. We enjoyed our experience.

We stayed 7 nights at Vive Hotel and couldn't of been happier with our choice of accomodation. From the moment we arrived to the day we departed the service and friendliness of the staff was exceptional. The staff were more then happy to answer our questions and give advice and we were always acknowledged when coming and going. It was a great location, and we loved the relaxed casual atmosphere of the foyer and seating areas where we had breakfast. The complimentary breakfast was very satisfying and the all day complimentary tea, coffee and cold water was a great refresher after a day of walking. We would definitely return to this hotel and recommend to anyone travelling to Hawaii. Thankyou to everyone at Vive Hotel who made our stay and enjoyable one.

Great location, close to tours pick up spot for (Turtle Cove, Atlantis Submarine, Pear Harbour) and only 200 metres from the beach. Bus stop right outside the Vive with regular services that stop near / at major tourist sites (Pear Harbour, Diamond Head, Ionia Palace, Bishop Museum). Free breakfast is a bonus and in a very nice setting.

We booked Vive based on the great reviews here and to be honest we were pretty disappointed. I think the hotel is ok if you want to save some money, but if you're coming to Hawaii to relax you will probably want to stay somewhere a bit nicer. Pros: Great price. Friendly staff. Location pretty good, short walk to beach. Cons: Breakfast not so great (fruit, selection of cheap pastry things). Small room with noisy air-conditioning. Depressing view of old apartment block next door. Lifts are tiny and slow.

Nice hotel 3 blocks from Wikiki beach. 22 floors with cool interieur and a nice lobby area. Nice stuff. We had a room in the 22nd floor which gave us a good view over the city (directiin diamond head). Hug bed, nice interieur, toilet and bathroom seperated.
user_name:
Herbert G
Luftenberg an der Donau, Austria

review_body: The pros, great location a few blocks from the beach. At check in your provided with a cold towel and some pineapple juice. The decor is modern chic - clean. They offer beach towels and beach stuff free of charge. Coffee served all day and breakfast in the morning. Juice,coffee, fruit and danish. No resort fees - that saves you $35 per night and free wifi. Cons - only valet parking at $25 per night. However you can rent a car at the hotel. Might be better to take a cab ride from the airport cost about $45 during non traffic days. Rooms are small and it's a window ac that can be noisy.Overall I liked the place and will stay again. Mahalo!

I always book a hotel based on comments here on Trip Advisor and this hotel got a good rating. So I booked it even if it's a little more above my budget. Since my husband and I are celebrating our 25th Wedding Anniversary, I wanted this trip to be extra special and Vive Hotel made Hawaii memorable for us.FIrst, Sato (front desk man) explained everything and even upgraded us to Ocean View room (be a My Vive Member). He even helped us on our transportation to Waikele Premium Outlets at no extra cost. And all our wake up calls are personal, not just recordings.Next, my husband was happy about our room so I had no problems with it being small so long as it was clean.We even got an anniversary card and a small box of Godiva Chocolates on our special day. Breakfast was also okay.Lastly, the location. It was just a minute or two away from the beach and the bus stop to Ala Moana Center, Pearl Harbor, etc was just 7 steps away. Sato congratulates us again when we checked out and that was very thoughtful of him.I would highly recommend this hotel to my friends.

Value for money. Very friendly staff who went out of their way to assist. Great location just a couple of blocks back from the beach. Eclectic furnishings and a library - a nice change from the big manic hotels

We were given one of the new rooms. It was like having two separate rooms. It's a good idea for families or business partners that would like a bit of privacy but since it was just the two of us we would have preferred one larger room with a larger bed & bathroom. The beds were very comfortable & had good pillows. The linens & towels were nice. Shower had lots of pressure. We loved having a hospitality room to use after check out & use of towels, beach mats or chairs. Also had a garage to park our car for $25 a day & no resort fees. Super fun place to stay.

My husband and I booked this hotel based on a review in our local newspaper in Ottawa Canada. It was our last day in Hawaii and what a way to finish. This hotel is outstanding in all aspects...room, SERVICE, locations. It has it all. We had a late flight on the Friday and we were provided with a complimentary room where we could shower and change after our day at the beach. What a treat. All staff were the best we have encountered in our many years of travel. The hotel is a short walk to Waikiki beach, restaurants and shopping. Everything you need. Would definitely book again.

The location is excellent (only 3-minute walk to the beach in Waikiki, very near Diamond Head) and the service is terrific. There are plenty of more expensive, fancy hotels in Waikiki, but why spend too much when you are not in your room except to sleep. The l is a terrific place to stay..

We just returned from a 30 day stay at this hotel and what a great experience it was. The hotel itself is fantastic, beautifully decorated with vibrant colors and the most comfortable furnishings.But what set this hotel apart from the rest and makes it stand above the expensive luxury hotels of Waikiki is its staff.They are by far the most friendly and helpful people we have ever encountered in Hawaii or any other hotel.We could say so much about the great breakfast buffet every morning, the ice-cold lemon water on returning from the beach, the super comfy beds or the "living room" that is made for relaxing and visiting.We could say more about the super nice rooms, go as high as possible, with its great beds and a shower so big you could play tennis in it.But at the end of the day we have to come back to its staff and management that made this visit so special.They look after everything you can think of and have your beach accessories ready for you every morning.Thanks again to all of you see you again in 2017 , our new home away from home.

The hotel is walking distance to the beach and all the shops. I loved the breakfast (fresh fruit and many different breads). Rooms are comfortable and peaceful. Then you can't really beat the price for this quality of service. Staff is amazing!!!

The staff at this hotel is second to none. Very helpful and friendly and truly made our experience in Oahu. The rooms aren't large but they are very clean, comfortable beds and all the amenities one would expect. We would definitely visit Vive on our next trip. Complimentary breakfast was a bonus. Mahalo!

Small rooms but clean and comfortable for the price. Excellent continental breakfast. Friendly staff. The rooms were very small but okay for good nights rest. The location was very convenient and close to the beach.

Spotless, contemporary little hotel with easy walk to the beach and all the shops. Small but bright comfortable rooms, nice open lobby, great breakfast with awesome Kona coffee. Super staff. Would definitely stay here again.
user_name:
Chris S
New Bern, North Carolina

review_body: Though the booking company Amoma made the check in process an extreme pain, the staff at Vive went above and beyond to assist and make things right. Though I will no longer book through Amoma, I will definitely be staying at Vive again in the future.

We spent the last 4 days of our Hawaiian trip in Honolulu. Vive has a great location close to the beach & on major bus lines. The staff was very helpful answering questions to help us explore. We walked the area as well as explored downtown using the bus to get there. We would definitely recommend Vive!

Small rooms, but very nice property and conveniently located in Waikiki. Breakfast was continental, and very nice. Staff was very helpful. They had some nice touches included like beach towels, boogie boards, beach matts and chairs to just check out. The cold towel and pineapple juice upon arrival was a nice touch as well.

We were at the Vive for 4 evenings. The desk staff upon arriving were ready with fresh pineapple juice, cool towels and an eagerness to help. The breakfast was a great way to start the day and the use of beach towels, chairs and mats was great especially with the beach being 2 short blocks away. The concierge , Chris , was extremely knowledgeable and a great ambassador for the island. He catered a special trip for us that took into account limited walking due to a knee injury. All of the staff were pleasant and willing to help. Would definitely stay here again.

Overall accommodations were great for us and the staff was helpful and friendly. rooms were a bit small but we weren't in them except to sleepBreakfast buffet contained coffee, juice, fruits and pastries

My wife and I went to Honolulu for the first time. We were satisfied staying at Vive Waikiki Hotel. It is convenient located 2 blocks from the beach. It offers free breakfast with hotel coffee, tea, pineapple juice, hot water, cold water, fruits and bakeries. The "living room" area is big and all of the staff is polite and helpful. The hotel also offers free beach towels, mats and boggie boards. My room was on the 15th floor and it was equipped with AC. It is relatively quiet and clean. Also, there are many restaurants around the area. There is a bus stop adjacent to the hotel.

My partner and I really enjoyed our recent stay at Vive. Our room was clean and comfortable: a little on the small side but we were only there to sleep and shower, so this wasn't an issue. Service was excellent: we arrived from Australia well before check in time but were given access to our room within an hour after being invited to help ourselves to the complimentary breakfast whilst we were waiting. I was very pleased with the breakfast: some reviewers have complained about it being too carb oriented but I was happy to have some of the blueberry bread toasted, accompanied by the plentiful fresh fruit. There are plenty of cafes nearby if you want something more substantial but this can work out to be quite costly every morning! The location of Vive is great: a two minute walk to the beach, bus stops immediately outside and lots of shops and restaurants within easy walking distance. The availability of free beach mats and chairs was also appreciated. I really liked the iPads provided in each room which enabled visitors to organise food deliveries from nearby restaurants, contact the front desk with enquiries, surf the Internet and even read a range of papers! Finally, the staff were always helpful and friendly: I have just now received a follow up email, thanking me for staying with them. If I ever return to Waikiki, I will be sure to return to Vive!

Room was small but nice. Vive is a short walk to the beach and we loved that chairs and boogie boards were included in the amenities.The staff was wonderful!Breakfast is a variety of pastries and fruit.

We had a terrific 8 day stay at Vive. The staff was terrific, especially Tyler and Adam- they always had our car ready right when we asked. Beach chairs, towels, and mats were always available. It is less than a 5 minute walk to the beach, with multiple convenience stores within the route. Every restaurant and bar on Waikiki beach is within walking distance from the hotel. Will be recommending this hotel to everyone!

Convenient location and very nice amenities for this hotel. Foyer was beautifully thought out and decorated and breakfast was a nice touch. Rooms were smaller than I personally prefer but as others say we didn't spend much time in our room. Room was clean and like foyer, thoughtfully designed to get in as much as possible in a small space. Staff were pleasant and requests handled with speed and a smile. Would recommend this hotel to others. Valet parking only for those renting a car.

This is a great place to stay. About 3 blocks from the beach & very well lite. No problems. Would stay here again. Clean and very helpful with any questions. The rooms are very small but we didn't come back until bed time. I would recommend this place for a vacation.

A very nice place to stay. Close to the beach, restaurants and shopping places -- walking distance. Public transportation accessible. Staff very friendly and helpful. I would stay here again and recommend to family and friends.

Couldn't have asked for a nicer place on Waikiki for the price. It was very clean, the breakfast was wonderful, and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I would recommend this to anyone wanting a beautiful, affordable place close to Waikiki.

This was a great hotel! Stayed here for a week, and loved it. The price was perfect for everything you get. Rooms are small, but it's not like you're spending a lot of time there. I'm confused by all of the complaints about breakfast. True, it's not bacon and eggs, but there are a ton of options between fruit and pastries. You're only 2 blocks away from the beach, and Vive provides you with beach towels and mats if you need them. The best part was how friendly the staff was. We needed an iron and they immediately brought one up with an ironing board. We also asked valet about places to go to eat, and they gave us some good suggestions. I'll definitely be staying here when I come back!

You'll find that most hotels in Waikiki are old and run down, but the Vive looks very new and upgraded. The hotel itself is very small but the cleanliness of the hotel and the nice decor made up for the size. The staff was super friendly and provided the BEST service, always making us feel welcome every time we walked through the door. The rooms are a bit small (similarly to most hotel rooms in Waikiki), but my boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights comfortably. The location is great- only a couple blocks walking distance to the beach and main road in Waikiki. I would definitely recommend staying at the Vive Hotel, especially if you're on a budget. The hotel prices are relatively cheap and look nice compared to many other Waikiki Beach hotels so it really is the best bang for your buck.

I had an incredible stay! The rooms were modern and beautiful, everyone was very friendly. The incredible concierge, KC, was very helpful and sent us to some amazing spots we would have never seen without a local showing us where to go. An incredible trip!

Average facilities & amenities & very limited food offered at breakfast . No coffee or tea inside room.This is designed for single male with limited personal belongings since room is very small. Staff are excellent , facilities are clean
user_name:
Abelardo Alto A
La Mirada, California

review_body: We just stayed at the Vive Hotel and we were disappointed to leave. The room was on the small side however nice and clean, we were only there to sleep, shower or change so it was perfectly adequate. Breakfast was limited but delicious lots of fruit and pastries with tea, coffee and iced water available all day. The casual nature of the tables and chairs was a lovely touch. Reception and concierge staff were extremely polite,friendly and helpful they try to accommodate you in any way they could. Our return flight was delayed till 3 am so they allowed us to use a complimentary room to shower and relax until our late flight, even though we weren't meant to be there.The beach is one block away as are the shops and restaurants.The bus stop is right next door except for the E bus (mostly express to Waikele Shopping Outlets) is one block up the road. All hotel staff were wonderful and helpful big thanks to all of them. I would definitely recommend staying here.Gordana b

The hotel is in a great location, just a couple of blocks from the "main strip" of Waikiki and from the beach. A zillion bus routes pass by right in front of the hotel and can get you to anything you can't walk to.Our room was a bit on the small side, but very elegant and clean. We were on the 15th floor and noise was almost non-existent. The window A/C was a bit wishy-washy, though. We had to constantly adjust the temperature up and down to stay comfortable.The free wiki (a big selling point with us) worked great. The free breakfast was a little basic. Fruit/bread/pastries and juice/coffee. Not bad, but I always hope for a little more than that.

I stayed here for 4 nights to run the Honolulu Marathon. I was pleasantly greeted at the front desk with a warm hand towel and refreshing pineapple juice. I picked this hotel because of the great value, convenient location, and amenities. It's 3 blocks away from the main street (Kalakaua Avenue) and the beach which they also provide you with a beach chair, towel, and mat for. There are also great places to eat right across the street. My personal favorites are Me's BBQ for lunch plates, Isayume cafe for "the best" spam musubis, and Hawaiian Crown Plantation for acai bowls. The hotel also provides a free breakfast self service buffet with coffee, tea, pineapple juice, breads, pastries, and fruit. You just pick a seat in the common reception area and choose what get whatever you like. I preferred this rather than a traditional sit down breakfast because I like to eat more during lunch. It's also convenient because you can grab and go so you can have more time outside. The room is minimal in decorations and furniture but provides all the essentials. The room was a perfect size just me but might feel a little small for a couple but when you're in Hawaii you spend most of your time outside. The bed is cozy and the AC works well so if you wanted to stay in it's comfortable too. I particularly like the tablet they provide in the room. You can use it to schedule a taxi, when you would like your to be cleaned, food to be delivered, browse the internet, and many other things. I'd definitely consider staying here again and recommend it to other as well.

The staffs are very nice and happy to help.The location is very good and convenient. The hotel is good for fully scheduled event outside, which means you are not expect to spend whole day long in the hotel. Try to book higher floor to avoid road noise.BTW, don't use the Speedi shuttle bus the hotel had the links on their website. The service is bad.For 30 mints driving distance, the shuttle bus used one and half hours taking me from airport to hotel.

For retired couples please consider a suite for comfort and space. The upgrade is affordable and perfect. Location to all amenities, continental breakfast and concierge are commendable. Air Conditioner noisy but ear plugs work so not an issue.

The Vive Hotel is in a great location, near bus stops and a 2 min walk from the beach and shops. The staff are great. However the rooms aren't so good; they are tiny, the aircon is very old the TV Is outdated for how much we spent the room was defiantly not worth it. so I won't stay here again.

This hotel is in a great location and offers good value for Waikiki. Their valet service, laundry service, housekeeping and order-in restaurant service are top notch. The staff are excellent. I spent 3 nights here and they went out of their way at every opportunity to be helpful and make my stay an excellent experience. A shout out to Paul at the front desk and the concierge who was working on 1/16/16. Both demonstrated exemplary customer service. I will stay here again on future trips to Hawaii.

I recently stayed at the Vive Hotel with a friend in a share room. The room was on the small side however, we were only there to sleep, shower or change so it was perfectly adequate. A chest of drawers and bench/cupboard in the bathroom would be good though. Breakfast was limited but delicious with tea, coffee and iced water available all day at no cost. The casual nature of the tables and chairs was a lovely touch. Reception and concierge staff were extremely polite and helpful. They lallowed us to have breakfast the morning we arrived, even though we weren't meant to be there until that afternoon - they also found us a room early. The beach is one block away as are the shops. The bus stop is right next door except for the E bus (mostly express to Waikele Shopping Outlets) is one block up the road. I would definitely recommend staying here.

Staying in vive was amazing. I was actually shocked at the affordability of it and the amazing location. Going to Waikiki as a young couple we knew we would never be able to afford a beach front hotel. But when we saw the location of vive we were shocked. The location was amazing. 2 min walk from the beach. The staff were helpful and polite. The rooms were cleaned beautifully. I couldn't fault vive in any way.

This is a charming boutique hotel in the heart of bustling Waikiki that provides the visitor who isn't "action" oriented with a refuge of quiet and repose. It is within walking distance of the social frenzy, of the beach, of the big "glitzy" hotels and big name shops but provides an oasis of charm and tranquility. The rooms are small but comfortable and perfect for the traveler who needs the room for quiet, a place to bathe and relax. The service is superb, the employees enthusiastic and helpful, a generous complimentary continental breakfast in a delightful garden-like area of the lobby. I give it a galaxy of stars!!!

Location was perfect and accommodations were great. This was our first trip to Hawaii and KC at concierge was super helpful. She recommended lots of restaurants and set us up with a few excursions. Truly made the trip hassle free. The hotel offers breakfast which was a bonus for us. Looking forward to already coming back!

I absolutely loved staying at Vive last week, rooms and lobby were very clean, continental breakfast (fruits, breads, coffee, tea, juice) was a great start to my day. Plenty of transportation at your reach and only a 5-10min walk to the beach. The staff & management were so kind that they left a special note and chocolates to wish me a happy birthday!

The staff was very friendly and helpful and always with a smile. We were able to borrow all necessary things for the beach. Great location. Close to main street and beach. Nice lobby and guest area. Great place to stay!

location was very good and walking to everything was very convenient. staff was very good and very accommodating. the window did not dampen street or air conditioner noise and made for not the best sleep.

Excellent location, great service. Within walking distance to everything. Rooms are a bit small but very tidy and clean. The only thing is the air-conditioning is quite loud but overall a great place to stay.

The staff was courteous and helpful - got us checked in quickly and with a smile. The hotel was close to downtown Waikiki and not far from the airport. The room was smaller than we anticipated and the mattress wasn't very comfortable but the room was clean and the shower / bathroom was excellent. A great value for the amount we paid.

It was a great experience. At first sight the room was small, but it was ok for 2 people. The bed was comfortable. Staff people were very friendly and helpfulness. The breakfast service was good, different types of bread, natural pineapple juice, tea, coffee, and many fresh fruits. I would only add cheese and ham and hot chocolate. The location is excellent, near from many turistic places and next to the hotel was the "city bus" stop. I would definitely stay again.

It is great experience staying in the hotel. We like its location, services, and staff with reasonable price. Even though the hotel does not have own pool or beach area, it is very close to the beach. I would like to recommend this hotel to my friends.

Great choice of hotel for location, close to everything. Very friendly and helpful staff. Hotel is pretty much what you pay for, good value hotel away from Waikiki beach so lower in price but easy to walk to the beach and a bus stop right outside to access the local attractions.

This hotel is a happy, in hospitality and efficiency. It was my first visit to Hawaii to mark my daughter's birthday week and the friendly staff at the Vive Waikiki Hotel helped make our 4-night stay on the island memorable. I appreciated the very warm welcome we received at the reception on arrival. The staff handed us cool pineapple juice as soon as we stepped inside the building on a blistering hot afternoon. Our room was quiet, on the 14th floor, with a panoramic view of the north and west of the city. Priceless! Very clean high quality cotton bed and bath linen throughout our stay. The staff gave us useful hand-outs explaining the lay of the island and all the important sites to visit, and they patiently answered our questions on the local bus service. They had a concierge on site to help map our daily visits in the most cost effective and efficient manner to wherever we wanted to go. In just four days, the staff were just like family. Fantastic location for swimmers and beach goers; throw on your bathing suit/cover up and stroll to the beach less than five minutes away. Oh, I was delighted that the rate included complimentary breakfast and free wifi. What a lovely treat. This is a world class hotel, and I would highly recommend Vive Waikiki for anyone looking for a beautiful location and have a holistic stay on the Island of Oahu and a home away from home.

Great location, price is unbeatable, excellent customer service, the room itself could have used a little more cleanliness in the bathroom, but overall I would come back and stay at this hotel and recommend to friends and family

Excellent hotel, very friendly staff. This was our second time at the Vive. From checking in to departure the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. We had an issue with one of the shuttle bookings to the airport and the reception staff member on duty called up the company on our behalf to sort it out. Excellent breakfast of fresh fruit and pastries provided in the lobby each morning and 24-hour self serve coffee and tea is available. Location is perfect, one street back from the beach. The hotel provides towels, boogie boards, and mats to take to the beach. Rooms are on the small side, but everything you need is there. We will definitely stay here again!

My husband and I went to Hawaii on our honeymoon and the vive was a good choice! They didn't do anything special for our honeymoon which was unfortunate, but is is a great location. Very close to the beach and a lot of restaurants and stores!

This hotel is in the perfect location two blocks from the beach and a 5 minutes walk to the main streets. The rooms are spacious and thoroughly clean. You are able to open windows or use the air conditioner. The room is very quiet The bed and pillows are soft and there is a bath in the bathroom. Highly recommendable.

Windows are pretty old and therefor noisy at night. The room have a very good view to the beach. Staff are very friendly and very helpfull by arrange trips and give ideas what to do and what to see on the island.

The location and staff make this hotel unbeatable. The staff share responsibilities and work hard to accommodate your needs. The location is great to walk to the beach or to restaurants and nearby shopping. The hotel is a boutique hotel - only 7 rooms/floor (we were on the 21st floor), which keeps it quaint, quiet, and a great experience. Our room was small but clean and had everything we needed, including a view of the ocean. All the staff were wondefully helpful and friendly. We will definitely choose this hotel again in the future.

Excellent front desk service sets this hotel apart from most. We arrived early, and were immediately assigned a room. Every morning we were offered beach towels, mats, chairs. While the breakfast pastries were bland, the fresh fruit was lovely. Coffee, tea, and water are available 24/7, a nice touch. Vive is located a short walk to Kalakaua and the beach, essentially in the heart of Waikiki. Highly recommend.

Good location, just a minute to go the beach and Waikiki shopping center. There are many restaurants nearby. The staffs are good to help you about any problem in travel and they are very friendly. Overall it's a very good experience during my stay in Oahu.

Great location, clean, modern with wifi in the room. HOWEVER, concierge was unhelpful, the rooms are very small and the air conditioning system was incredibly loud to the point where we avoided turning it on, making the temperature very uncomfortable in the room.

.This is a great little hotel for those who want somewhere nice to stay in a great location for a good price. I didn't want a hotel with a pool as I planned to make the most of my stay in Hawaii and explore the whole island. If you want somewhere comfortable and clean to sleep in good location with amazing staff then this hotel is great. Everything in walking distance with easy buses to get around. The front desk and concierge were wonderful. I would definitely stay here again.

3 star hotel with 4+ star personnel. One block from Waikiki beach surrounded by all one would want. Have stayed before and will stay again. Continental breakfast save copious money vs. eating breakfast at restaurants. Short bus ride to Diamond Head. Highly recommend to Waikiki visitors. Walking distance to all Waikiki has to offer, including restaurants, bars, music, beach. Highly recommend to all casual (vacation) travelers to the island. Staff is most helpful and will guide you to anything you wish to find or experience.

Great location and fantastic staff! I would definitely stay here again. My only drawback is that the Rooms were a bit small and no dining or room service. Staff was very helpful and hotel is only 2 blocks away from Waikiki beach.

Very comfortable stay - nice rooms and extremely helpful staff. Sato (Front Desk) was very helpful in terms of assisting with local transport, sight seeing and logistics. Made the difference in our stay from being good to excellent. Hotel is conveniently located 5 min walk from Waikiki beach and most importantly has a bus stop 100 m away from where you can get buses to every place imaginable you would want to visit from a sight seeing perspective. Far more economical, reliable and efficient compared to taxis.

Service was great however the breakfast was quite boring unless you like continental type. One thing that really is disappointing is that there is no swimming pool. Outside of that I don't think I can fault the hotel. Room's are clean and the hotel is nicely situated close to the beach. They also provide beach equipment. The air conditioner in the room also kept tuning off and on but I am not sure if that was because it was on constantly.

This is a convenient hotel to Waikiki beach without being right on the esplanade. It was 2 blocks walk right to the middle of the strip.The staff in the hotel greeted us with Pineapple Juice and cold towels which was nice after a 9 hr flight. We arrived at 1pm but they were able to give us a room immediately. The service throughout our stay was helpful and professional.We ordered a mountain/city view lifestyle junior suite as we wanted a bit more room. We ended up with an ocean view junior suite on the 19th floor (room 1908). It was a great pad for the 2 days we stayed. there was a sizeable luggage space near the door. The shower was huge but not powerful. The toiletries were okay but were not restocked overnight. The bed was comfortable. There were 2 airconditioners which were required as the room gets lots of direct sun from 10am through to evening. They had 2 sets of blinds on each of the 3 windows, one being slightly light with the other complete blockout which we used during the day to keep the sun from overhearting the room. The room had nice view of Waikiki although there is a building across the road blocking some. The room itself had nice touches for the price and was convenient without being luxury. This was chosen as more affordable option and we were very happy relative to Waikiki prices.The continental breakfast included was good but limited to bread based products and coffee and juice. The dining area was funky with lots of different lounge chairs and tiny tables. Not a fan but it was interesting.One benefit was it was right next to HG Steakhouse so when we ate there it was quick stroll home.
user_name:
Offpeak
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed for 4 nights that included New Years eve 2016. Great location to walk to access the beach (2 min), Diamond Head (45 min to start of hike), Ala Moana (40 min) and within a few minutes to outstanding shopping, dining and drinking.Hotel staff were informative and friendly.We stayed in a suite on the top floor but I don't think it was worth the extra $150, that said it had a great view and a bit extra space.Rate includes a bakery breakfast (muffins, pastries etc) with a plethora of fruit and all day coffee and tea. There is free wifi and beach towels/mats/chairs available. No pool (good) meaning a few less younger families around. Overall a good place to sleep and recover from shopping and dining.

The location was good and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Having great coffee available in the lobby 24/7 was an added perk. Offering free beach equipment was an added benefit that wasn't expected.

Stay here! The staff are wonderful. The most helpful group you can imagine. If you are cool with no pool, no in-room coffee maker, and being off the beach (barely) this is the place! 24-7 coffee/tea in the lobby or they will bring it to your room, also any time. The Included breakfast is continental, but there was some fruit. Tip: use the toaster oven to crisp up your croissants! Delightful. In-room tablet (nice touch) and Internet, plus wi-fi for your devices all worked perfectly. Waikiki has a company called Waikiki Room Service, but you'll want to eat out near the beach! Your room will probably be small. Leave a tip for the maids, ask for "ocean view" and a higher floor if you haven't already secured it and you'll see the ocean a few blocks away. Thanks Casey, Gary, Chris, Marilyn and everyone else for taking such good care of us!

Experiencing a flight delay and got to the hotel 5 hours later than we expected, we got a warm welcome at Vive with pineapple juice and towel to clean our hands. The staffs was super friendly and gave us many tips on how to enjoy Hawaii. The hotel provides free towel, chairs and mats to use for guests to enjoy the beach which was such a convenient service. Their courtesy room solved our problem for using additional hotel service after checking out was a blast! Definetly will recommend this hotel to others!

Booked this hotel after reading good reviews on TripAdvisor. We're glad we did. From the minute you step inside the lobby, you are convinced. Beautiful lovely, decorated in lively colours, smiling and helpful staff greets you, and you feel welcome. Location: Perfect, two blocks from Waikiki Beach, and when you walk there, you hit the beach at the famous Duke statue. Bus stop right outside the hotel (20 meters to the right), where you can take buses all over the island. Room: OK, clean, good room service. I don't like carpets, but as with many other hotels in the US, Vive doesn't have rooms without carpets. Too bad, since I am highly allergic. Size of room is sufficient. Not tiny, but not big, either. Enough closets, shelves and drawers for all of your clothes. (We stayed 10 nights). Could need a few more hangers, though. Good aircondition. (With some noise). Bathroom: OK.Not too big, but a large bathtub, with a shower that had quite good pressure (I hate it when water just trickle out of the showerheads).Staff and service: Perferct. Always smiling, always accomodating and eager to please the guests. Free beach towels, beach mats and chairs. When I told them that our sink was almost clogged, the sent a janitor to fix it right away. The way it should be. We also got som good advice (on restaurants and sightseeing) from the concierge and the rest of the staff. Breakfast: LOADS of fresh fruit: Melon, mango, oranges and pineapple. Toast and toasters, only butter, strawberry jam and peanut butter for breadspread/topping. No cereals, no milk, no full grain, bot loads of croissants, muffins and so on. Best thing about the breakfast: They have one. Loads of fresh fruit. Good Hawaiian coffee. Lovely breakfast room with atmosphere (lobby). Worst: Loads of sugar/wheat. Few healthy options, apart from the fruit. Would I stay here again? Yes. No doubt. Should I go back to Hawaii some day, this is where I will stay.

Only a block from the beach at Waikiki. Very helpful and friendly staff. Free beach chairs and towels etc for use on the beach.Adequate sensible breakfast in relaxed atmosphere. Very central to everything. Will definitely return !

I booked Vive Hotel based primarily on high ratings, and that was a mistake. it's a solid 3 star hotel with a great location and some nice perks like waffle robes and free beach equipment, but it's still a 3 star hotel, and it shows.PRO:Perfect location, nice service extras.The front desk staff are great. They were very friendly, helpful and patient. The foyer is very nice and spacious with a few too many Pier 1 wooden animals.CON:The rooms are "cozy". English translation - small. They did a good job making them look bigger, but at the expense of furniture and storage space. The "modern" furniture is so ascetic, it gives a college dorm vibe. There are only two clothing drawers under the bed (I didn't even find them on the first day), and a few uncomfortable shelves pretending to be nightstands. The only large storage was inside the wardrobe, but with only 6 hangers(2 of which were taken by bath robes), it wasn't of any use.We stayed 15 nights (which means 30 sets of clothes), so my wife lived two weeks out of a suitcase (she's a quarter Gypsy). I managed with 2 drawers and 4 hangers.The bed was rather uncomfortable - too soft, so if you need good back support, stay away. I had to sleep on my side to prevent back pain.The bathroom was smaller than we have at home, in a very poorly designed 15-story 1953 NYC building.The complimentary breakfast is extremely continental (not even a piece of cheese) and is complimentary for a good reason - nobody would pay money for that food. Please do yourself a favor and skip half-baked pastries with what they call "coffee" and go for papaya and pineapples, which are excellent.Bottom line: if you are young and don't mind a few inconveniences, Vive is a good choice for a short stay.

Very close to the strip, everything was great but the walls are too thin. You can hear everything: other guest talking, doors slamming shut, elevators opening and closing. But overall great, staff is amazing!

I forgot when I gave a hotel 5/5 but these guys did everything to make us and our stay happy. From courtesy room to free room tablets to friendly staff and service. I don't think it happens anywhere even in trump hotel. I stay anywhere from 0 star to 6 star places and these guys know what means to keep their guests happy. Check their penthouse suits. Nothing less than a 5 star hotel. The only thing that can be improved is the breakfast.

Location - close to beach and good restaurants. rooms were quiet and cleanStaff - very helpful staff. Other than giving us directions to places, they were helpful in so many ways - gave us takeout bags after knowing that we won't have enough time to eat breakfast; offering guest room when they know that our flight is late at night etcBreakfast - light breakfast with pastries and fruits. They are delivered fresh daily. I really like the tea selection as well

I was very pleased with every aspect of the the Vive. From start to finish, everything was great! First, the valet service was super efficient and the cost was no worse than anywhere else, and actually seemed to be less expensive. Certainly a better value than valet parking at a big hotel. The front desk folks were all amazing. Very helpful and they made sure to get to know us. Our room was a junior suite and had plenty of space. The breakfast area was a good area to hang out in and the food was good considering there wasn't really any protein. The property is really close to Waikiki beach and it was nice to have access to the complimentary use of beach chairs, umbrellas, etc. the price was also about at least a hundred dollars less per night than places like the Marriott and other bigger places nearby. The place was awesome and I highly recommend it.

Location, price is perfect. In my opinion, Vive hotel is better than sheraton waikiki. I really want to visit vive again. Free water and coffee is in lobby all day. Room is also cosy and nice. Believe me!

We were instantly upgraded into Jr. suite which had a vieuw not only to Waikiki Beach, but also to the Diamond Head and the busy street below us. Room was very tidy and the noise of the traffic didn't reach us at all. Location is perfect if you looking for to spend some time on the Waikiki beach which is two blocks away. Towels and beach mats are available at reception. Bus stop is right next to the hotels entrance so basically you have all Honolulu and Oahu on our reach. Breakfest is being served every morning with fresh fuits, coffee and different pastries. Enought to get your day going. In case you are looking for spending time only at the pool this is not your choise.

The location of the hotel is very good. The rooms are small but clean. The staff is friendly. Breakfast area is too small for the size of the hotel. Breakfast items are not replenished when finished. Small bed.

Clean rooms, great staff, cool view. Love breakfast. Have nothing negative about Vive. Location is just perfect to the beach. Kuhio ave dont bother at all cuz hotel is just to perfect. Loved everything. Got help with anything i needed.

All the staff were friendly and the stay was good. The food could have been better in terms of variety. Front desk employee Paul was really nice and 5 he concierge KC was really helpful and friendly. Thank you

Single traveller so small room/bathroom was not an issue. Convenient location - walking distance to everything important in Waikiki and a bus stop next door for the rest of the island. It's not the quietest location being right on Kuhio Ave. but no major problems. Staff were great and the breakfast was more than adequate, as was the 24 hr coffee service. Free borrowing of beach gear and towels was a nice touch (beach is less than 5 min walk away|). Would have been nice to have a pool for a late afternoon swim but given the cost of nearby hotels with pools, the Vive was an excellent choice.

The hotel looks very nice with a good style, easy to get a reasonable price food (across the road there is a Japanese restaurant). The location is two blocks away from the beach. The guest room is very clean, tidy, and modern. I would come back when I am going to Hawaii. If you looked a reasonable price hotel, Vive hotel would be the best option.

Hotel staff was exceptional and very helpful. Rooms were small, but clean and comfortable. After all, we were not visiting to sit in a room. Breakfast was ample and tasty. Overall, stay was outstanding.

This place is not for everyone. The least expensive room is NYC style, very small. Fine for us but others might not like it. Location is at the southern end of Waikiki, away from the shopping. This was great for us. We could walk to Rainbow Drive In (.5 mi), Leonard's (1.4 mi), and Seafood Ono (Great Poke)(maybe 1 mi). Good breakfast included. A computer in the lobby to use. Very helpful staff.

This hotel is in the ideal location for beach and you can also get body boards, beach towels ect. free of charge from reception. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The room was small but clean.

Very good central location and near to everything, ABC stores were every where and close to restaurants, King Village is just nearby. There was coffee and tea facilities at the lobby and very good breakfast the only one negative thing is not comfortable to eat your breakfast we still love the traditional way of having your breakfast in the table and siting comfortably. Also Wi fi is excellent and the room is small but always clean, then it was another bonus you can borrow some of the beach gear with no extra charge. Thanks to all the staff it has been a great holiday and nice hotel to stay to discover Waikiki, what a shame we did not have enough time seems 7 days is not long enough.

Great spot for the price. Centrally located, a block walk from the beach and Waikiki shopping. Staff were great and helped out on anything/everything. Rooms are small, but the breakfast and coffee/tea all day make up for lack of space. Clean and cozy place.

Good central location, excellent and friendly staff, clean (but small) room. Coffee and tea all day, and very good breakfast included. Wifi is excellent and available everywhere, no pool but the beach is only a short walk.

The location was great. Close and walking distance to beach and to restaurants.breakfast was fanatics tic and having fresh cool water every day when coming back to hotel was a great treat. Having beach chairs available was a treat , plus being able to book other activities thru Casey was good, he was friendly and courteous and most helpful.

Don't look anywhere else if you are staying in Waikiki. Vive is not a big chain so prices are reasonable, but the location is amazing and the service is unbeatable. Everyone goes over and beyond for you. The valet service, the beach accessories they provide and the awesome breakfast. They also have coffee and tea all day long. Since our flight was at 11pm, they even kept our luggage, and offered us a courtesy room free or charge for an hour so we can freshen up after a day at the beach before our flight. We had a hiccup with the billing where they double charged us a certain night, they quickly fixed it and even gave us a discount on 1 night. Thank you Vive for making our stay in Waikiki very enjoyable.

My husband and I stayed in Vive for 6 nights. It had been recommended by other trip advisor travelers. I could not have been happier. The location was central to Waikiki, within walking distance of good restaurants, the beach and the bus stops. It is not a "luxury" hotel - the room air conditioners attest to that. But, in every way that counts it was among the top hotels I've stayed at. All service personnel - desk agents, valets, and concierge, were familiar with the area and with the attractions. They gave good directions, told us of personal experiences and asked if we had a good time after the day was over. With breakfast included - continental with fruits, juice, some pastries and coffee - this was a very good value. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely stay there again.

We didn't read any reviews about this hotel before booking - our travel agent gave us a list of hotels & we chose this one because of the location. I have to say since staying here I haven't even thought about staying anywhere else in Waikiki. We are planning to come back in November 2016. The staff are awesome & friendly especially KC who helped us arrange tours & went out of her way to help us. I can't wait to come back :)

The room is clean and the location is excellent, within walking distance to Waikiki beach. The air-conditioning in the room, however, was pretty loud so I had to switch it off in the night. There was no kettle for coffee or tea in the room but the staff was very quick to direct me to the ground floor to get some hot water and offered me a kettle for the room if needed. The most disappointing part for me was that the breakfast bar was close at 9:30 on the dot and I was 5 minute late for that. It would be nice to have a good breakfast to start my first day in Honolulu, but the fault was mine...

This hotel is a gret place to stay when visiting Hawai'i. My husband and I stayed there for 7 nights, breakfast was included - pastries and fruit. Coffee and tea is on tap in the lounge - there are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room, but you really don't need them. The room we had was lovely - a great size for us. A small fridge to keep our soft drinks in. The bathroom had a shower and bath - toiletries were great too. There are bus stops just outside the entrance, and only 3 blocks (5 mins walk) from the beach. There is no pool at this hotel, but you really don't need one with the beach being so close.

I booked based on reviews and was really disappointed. I could never recommend this hotel. The staff is nice but not able to do anything to fix a problem. Unfortunate - looked great online. The cleaning staff sprays some type of fragrance to hide the smell of mold or to freshen the room. I asked that they not do it but they continued to each night. It literally made me sick.
This hotel was fantastic!!. The staff was excellent. They went above and beyondThe coffee/tea service was great as was the breakfastOverall a fantastic experience - would certainly stay here again!!

Even though this hotel is a block from the beach it is one of the quieter hotels we stayed at. It is right on the bus route to get all over Honolulu and the rest of the island. The fresh fruit for breakfast was a refreshing before hitting the beach or shops. The wifi was also super fast with in room tablets for browsing news, weather etc.

Free wifi, coffee, tea and water.Free rental for towels, beach mat and boat. Reasonable price and we really enjoy our stay. When we go to Honolulu again, we will absolutely stay here!!!Lots of Japanese around the city but I didn't see any in here. Which made me feel that I am traveling!!

First off, I would like to mention that I stayed in many different hotels all over the world including boutique hotels and westins, sheratons and so on. THIS hotel stands above them all! Mostly because of the customer service. Each staff member will go above and beyond for your needs. We booked through the hotel website using a myvive account which gives complimentary upgrade when available and 50% off valet. We booked the same day as check in and got one of their regular rooms which was very clean (i'm picky with bathrooms). When I saw continental breakfast I was seriously expecting comfort inn style breakfast but I was wrong. They had delicious blueberry bread, croissants, variety of fruits, pastries, juices, coffee and tea. It doesnt sound like much but it was great ! they also have comp. coffee,tea and water all day long. The next day we inquired for a free upgrade and the front desk did some shuffling of guests to accomodate my request which was very very much appreciated! We got the junior suite which was very spacious! They also give complimentary beach gear (boogie board, mats, chairs, beach towels) which was amazing! This hotel is only 2 blocks from Waikiki beach and the shopping strip. We also had a few issues with billing as they made some mistakes but they quickly corrected it and credited us on top of that to make sure we didn't lose money in conversion rates. They have a courtesy room that you can book for an hour if you are flying hours after check out which totally helped! we were flying out at 11pm and were able to take a shower and organize our stuff before we left in the courtesy room which was a standard hotel room. They have a tablet service ordering system in the room which totally blew us away, you can order your car to ordering extra towels all with a touch! I would recommend this hotel 100% if you are staying in Oahu. They take care of everything for you so you can have a wonderful vacation!

Unlike any other hotels, this hotel is quite noise proof. If you hate noises, I would recommend this hotel.The only thing lacking of this hotel is there no lanai, so we can't dry our wet clothes from the beach.Room is way smaller than average hotels around Waikiki but new which is what we prefer to have.

The staff were absolutely FANTASTIC, I can't say enough about how well we were treated. The rooms were clean and the rates were reasonable. Only a couple of blocks to the beach. Supplies for the beach provided, chairs, towels and beach mats. Well done Vive Waikiki. I highly recommend.

I highly recommended the Vive to all of my family & friends. Breakfast was excellent fresh fruits and a lot of assorted pastries and breads. Loved the pineapple juice at check in they gave us our fresh pineapple juice and wet towels too cool us off from the heat outside, which was most refreshing.

Hotel is in great location, only a few blocks from the beach. We were travelling with teenagers and had booked 2 rooms, on check in we had been given rooms on different floors even though we had requested months prior to our arrival rooms on the same floor. The woman at check in wasn't that helpful and keep telling us that there was nothing she could do to fix the problem. We requested to speak to the manager, he was fantastic and after a short time we had rooms on the same floor and he even upgraded us to a junior suit. We understand that requests can't always be accommodated but we thought given our request was made months prior to our arrival they could have done better.Other than this little hiccup the rest of our stay was great. Breakfast was ok, enough to get you started for the day.We would stay again

Great experience! Two short blocks from the water, kind and accommodating staff, clean and modern room, free breakfast, free beach towels, close to shopping, nearby dinner dinner options, Great spot, great value

The location was in the middle of Waikiki only 3 short blocks to the ocean. Excellent bus connections. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was a lot of fruit and bread/muffins. But no milk or cereal. And after a week, we would have liked a little more variety.Room was small, but clean. Good bed and TV. There was a sliding door for the bathroom which could have used a bumper when being opened as there was a loud bang if you weren't careful. The no charge safe in the room was appreciated. The staff was very helpful when planning excursions.There was a small library, but no book exchange was allowed if you donated a book. Lounge area was very nice and the courtesy room was available by signing up the day before you left. A computer was available in the lounge and wi-fi was free, but we had to resign up several times.I would definitely stay there again.

Had a great stay at Vive. The staff were friendly and super helpful. Rooms are modern, comfortable with plenty of space. The lounge/common area downstairs was funky and user friendly. The continental breakfast was great, particularly the fresh fruit. Loved the coffee and tea that was available 24/7. All in all a great stay, close to everything. Would definitely stay here again.

Hotel is located just a couple short blocks away from Waikiki beach, with free wifi, beach gears, and free continental breakfast. It's close to many restaurants, shops and transit. My room was average at best but I likely didn't get the best pick of the room selection since it was 100% full and my arrival was late at night. However, the staff was amazing and I very much enjoyed my stay overall. I would definitely recommend this place and would stay there again!

Very nice decoration even in your room, wifi perfect and service always willing to help you fast and excellent. Price is very good for all you receive, breakfast included was a total surprise , not any other hotel offered it.

The hotel was great. The breakfast was awesome fresh fruit daily. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location was awesome. We was close to everything for us. Only one issue was with one cleaning staff.

The Vive is located off the Main Street but still only a short walk away. It is next to a bus stop which was very convenient. A laundromat across the road. The lobby of the hotel is great. Free breakfast of fruit toast and pastries everyday and tea and coffee is available 24/7 as a serve yourself along with iced water which is serviced regularly throughout the day. The negative is the rooms are very small. They are clean and comfortable but again, very compact! We spent most of our time out and about so it didn't impact us too much and I would definitely stay there again as the staff were wonderful.

Came across this little boutique hotel and glad took the chance that it would be quiet, in a location that would offer good access to public transport and services, as well as also safe for solo female travellers. Front desk staff very friendly and helpful, and the house maids were always pleasant and cheerful. While room was compact, it was clean and neat, with a comfortable bed and block out blinds (much needed early in morning :-D). Lobby area was setup with clusters of lounges, tables and bookcases in an eclectic style that was nice to just chill out in for a bit with cold water or free tea / coffee. In the mornings the area included an American style buffet with some basic offerings - basically consisted of couple of bread offerings, some pastries and fruit along with the tea and coffee. I found it ok to grab something quick before heading out to explore and to find something more substantial for lunch; however if expecting cereal or hot offerings you will be disappointed. The hotel was on a road serviced by regular buses, within a short distance from a couple of convenience stores and a 24 hour laundromat. Also within easy walking distance were a couple of hole in the wall Asian restaurants for those nights didn't want to go to far. Also only a short walk to Waikiki beach as the hotel is only a 2 blocks from the esplanade and the plethora of swanky hotels and shopping. Only downside was no pool - but then again with Waikiki beach being so close not something that I found to be an issue. Oh and the other delight that I found was so useful and a huge bonus was access to the courtesy room - especially helpful if you have an evening flight and want to freshen up after a day out and about. The courtesy room can be reserved 24 hours before; from memory you can use the room for an hour - plenty of time for a freshen up shower and change of clothes.

The room was modern and clean, but rather small in the American standard. Note that several constructions are going on around the hotel (as of Dec. 2015), so expect some noise. The breakfast was just OK. Valet parking service was not prompt.

We just stayed in the hotel for one night recently, we arrived early at noon as our flight from LA was early, our room wasn't ready yet but we were able to leave our luggage at the hotel while we go for our lunch.. The staffs from the hotel are all very friendly and helpful. Our room was nice and comfy. The hotel is in a very good location, 5 mins walk from the beach, you can get a mat and towels from the reception for free. Opposite the hotel there is a very good Korean take away place... Huge portion and yummy too. Overall we had a good time.

Located near the beach, shopping, transportation and restaurants, this was a great stay with excellent staff. Wifi was strong, coffee always available and staff incredibly friendly. I would stay there again.

We stayed for 14 nights in this special hotel. It was clean, bright and roomy. Breakfast each morning was an array of pastries and wonderful fresh fruit. The staff was always friendly and helpful. Parking was easy. Easy walk to the beach and the busy fun ocean drive. Close to the zoo. Thanks so much to all who made our trip special.
user_name:
Jeanine J
Hot Springs Village, Arkansas

review_body: Really enjoyed our stay, staff were great and the hotel very close to the beach. We upgraded before we left New Zealand which was a good choice as our room had extra room to entertain the other travelers who also stayed at the hotel for a friends 60th.Tip: cheaper to catch local transport to attractions.

Great hotel 2 blocks back from the beach, 3 minute walk. My guess is the cost savings are due to the smaller rooms BUT they are clean, comfortable rooms with everything you need and I had no problem with the size. Towels and chairs available to take to the beach as well as a free courtesy room on check out day if your flight is later in the day. Front desk staff are kind, professional and helpful. I'll be recommending this hotel to friends and family. Air con unit was a bit loud, and the breakfast isn't anything to write home about but I didn't pay extra for it so no big deal.

Great stay everything was of a high standard. Service and room was fantastic. Excellent value for money as location is great and the breakfast being included was an extra touch. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Stayed here 3 nights. Just a couple of block from the beach, but we had an ocean view room which was great! It was a corner room and very large. It is near the south end of Waikiki, so you can go either direction. The staff was young, energetic and ready to help. KC is a great concierge.

Staff are very friendly & helpful. Room is not so big but very comfortable,clean and tidy.Breakfast is kinda simple,but fruits are very fresh,and bread is soooo good !!!nice location. I'd like to come back again.

Standard rooms are very small, we had a ant problem and were upgraded to a larger room facing the ocean and the street probably was a mistake, this room also had ants and the single pane Windows made for very restless nights since the bus stop is next door and every bus that stops lowers the hydrolics which makes a darn beeping nose, the trash truck comes at 5am every morning. Needless to say I spent 7 days not getting any rest.

Centrally located to all the shops, restaurants, take out places, and of course the beach. The staff was extremely pleasant, and helpful, we were supplied all we needed for the beach; chairs, towels, mats. Starting the day right, a fantastic continental breakfast. Selections of pastry, fruits, juices, coffee etc. If I have a chance to come back to Oahu, would not even think of staying anywhere else. Highly recommend VIVE to all my friends.

We stayed here for one night, and wished we stayed longer! The hotel is about a 3 minute walk from Waikiki beach, and near many restaurants. The staff were very nice, and offered beach equipment. Bed was incredibly comfortable, toilet was modern, and the WIFI was free.

We booked this hotel based on its good location, short walk to main beach and for the low room rates compared to some of the more upmarket hotels in the same area. It certainly met our expectations for excellent value accomodation in walking distance of beach and main shopping strip in Waikiki. Room was of a good size and very clean and comfortable. Staff were very courteous and helpful. Hotel provided a continental breakfast which was quite adequate to get us going each morning and we enjoyed the availability of a 24/7 coffee & tea station. Overall we were very happy with our stay at The VIVE and would recommend this for anyone seeking accomodation in the low - medium price range

This is a great little hotel. Less pricey than other beach hotels, it is only a block (3 min walk) away from Dukes Beach on Waikiki. The staff was always pleasant and very helpful when asked for assistance. The complimentary breakfast was just pastries and fruit but will do the trick. For a great full breakfast check out ShoreFyre just 100m away towards the beach. A lot of other great eating options nearby. The room was small but we expected that from the description before booking. Enjoy!

The hotel location was great, only 2-3 minutes walk from the beach and Duke Statue. The staff greeted me warmly and the check-in was quick. Information provided by the staff was very informative. The Lobby is decked out in a slight Balinese or Asian theme, very exotic. But i feel that all the money was spent on the Lobby's decorations. If more money and upkeep was spent on the room, it would have been an enjoyable stay.My air conditioning unit was very noisy, especially at night time, and sounded like someone was trying to break into my room every night. I had a very restless sleep.The bathroom is very small, and there are no non-slip matts for the shower's tub so i felt like i was always going to slip over in the shower whenever i washed my hair.The only 2 plus things i liked about my room was the comfortable Queen bed and the TV was decent size.The hotel has complimentary breakfast - toast, crossaints, fruit, muffins and coffee/tea and juice. However, there are no dinning tables that you would expect to find at other hotels, so half the people dining were holding their plates in the hands while sitting on the sofa.This is because the area used for the breakfast is used to relax and read/ chill out. If a hotel is going to offer breakfast, than there should be a decent area to eat comfortably. Many people were sharing a tiny table with strangers and they did not look comfortable in doing so. Everyone looked like they were just trying to eat and leave as it was not a comfortable experience. I myself thought it a waste of time and never ate breakfast at the hotel again.

six (6) days at the hotel were very pleasant and memorable experience. The entire staff were professionals, helpful and very friendly. I will highly recommend to my friends and surely when we visit Oahu next year we will be staying in Vive hotel.

Great little boutique hotel in a great location in Waikiki. Only a couple blocks from the beach. The staff displayed lots of ALOHA, always friendly, helpful and welcoming. Great continental breakfast spread every morning. Lots of dining options and shopping within walking distance. Special kudos to the parking attendants. We were very well taken cared of!

The Vive Hotel was very clean, modern, and convenient to local sites. Access to the beach and the local bus system allowed us to easily enjoy the beach, the local shopping centers, and sites away from the city center. The room was clean, comfortable, and modest sized. The staff were very helpful and provided useful suggestions.

I really enjoyed staying at the Vive - it's close to Waikiki beach & the shopping district, a short walk to many attractions. The hotel facilities are excellent - beautiful light breakfast, helpful staff & good WiFi.

My room was spacious and comfortable. There was a complimentary breakfast every morning, consisting of fresh fruits, muffins and pastries. :) It was about a 5-7 minute walk to Waikiki Beach and the Duke Statue. The bus stop to Ala Moana, Pearl Harbor was right in front of the hotel. The bus stop to Waikele Outlets was about a 2 minute walk. I loved the location - it was close to everything. The Waikiki shops and restaurants are all within walking distance so we just walked everywhere. The hotel let my husband and I borrow 2 umbrellas during our stay which was very convenient as it rained alot. Thank you Vive Hotel was such a pleasant stay. We will definitely be back! (We're actually staying 1 more night on our way home next week!)

Room was small but very comfortable, exactly as advertised. The ground floor guest area is ideal for relaxing and complimentary breakfast is a bonus. Being close to the beach & no resort fees (as charged by other hotels) were the main attractions for choosing this hotel. The staff were friendly and attentive.

rooms could use some wallpaper due to age of building despite renovationswindows could be renovatedcontinental breakfast is OK for being free, nothing specialcheck in was good, friendly staff, great location, near waikiki beach

My partner and I stayed for 6 nights at the Vive. ON ARRIVAL: When we arrived (At 7:30am) we were greeted by the friendly hotel staff who offered to hold our bags for us and told us to help ourselves to the continental breakfast whilst we waited for our room to be ready and also handed us a glass of much welcomed, delicious, pineapple juice. BREAKFAST: The breakfast itself was pretty "meh", it served its purpose having bread and muffins and some fruit but there was no cereal or cold milk. The coffee you could get was out of a heated canister but tasted alright and was available all day, complimentary. Sadly the breakfast was only from 7am until 9:30am which means that my partner and I missed it 3/6 days! ROOM: The staff let us know our room was ready at about 11am after we had gone out venturing, 4 hours before the usual check in time which was really great. The room size wasn't large but it was accommodating, there was enough space to walk around and breathe. The bed was fine to sleep one and the pillows were easy to sleep on as well. The bathroom was medium sized with very little storage, but enough room for basic toiletries. There was a hair dryer provided, as well as things like soap, shampoos and shower gels. The shower had very good pressure and was easy to use. The view from our room, a Standard Room; Cosmopolitan Queen, was average, and was of some buildings and the mountains, but we did book last minute and on the cheap as well. If you request it I'm sure you can get a room with a view. There was also a really nice flat-screen tv (my favourite channel had lots of renovation shows!) in the room as well as a tablet that had various apps and allowed you to order room service from approximately 24 different restaurants which was amazing! The delivery fee was a bit much, but as it was pouring with rain for most of our stay we decided to take the plunge and order some delicious waffles from one of the delivering restaurants. Finally a small fridge is provided in the room so you can put your water bottles and various other things in there also. Overall the storage in the room was pretty bad with only two draws and some pigeon holes but there was enough room for two suitcases and a stand provided as well as a safe and two waffle style bathrobes in a beaurau.STAFF: The staff were very friendly and helpful the entire time, telling us when the bus to the Waikele Outlet Shopping Mall was, directing us where to go and booking us a seat. When asking about an airport shuttle they also booked that for us at the most needed time and even called the company to ask where the shuttle was when they were running 5 minutes late. They even brought our bags up to our room on the first day which was very pleasant. When it rained they let us have one umbrella to share between us (free unless for the day where they put a deposit of 25 USD on your credit card), as well as giving us beach towels for the beach when we needed them.HOTEL: The hotel itself inside was very nice was lovely decor, maybe not ideal to have breakfast there... but the lobby was well air conditioned and the hotel was updated. LOCATION: The location was superb. It was maybe 2-3 blocks/200-300m from the beach. Right out the front of the hotel, cross the road and there's several places to eat (notably a cheese and fast Korean BBQ place called Me B-B-Q, huge sizes, cheap and delicious!!!). There is also a large strip of amazing shops on when you walk right and venture down and if you cross the road there is a shopping plaza. There is a Victoria's Secret, Sephora, Coach, various surf shops, as well as a food court in the shopping plaza, various restaurants, a Forever 21, many high end stores and most importantly a Cheesecake Factory!!!! If you walk much further down you'll come across the Galleria which has a variety of expensive shops (e.g Hugo Boss, Armani, ect.). The beach itself is stunning and the water spectacular. TOURS: Around the area there are lots of tourism booths with people with brochures and even if you just walk down the paths people will come at you with tours, but I recommend you check out several different places and get different prices so you can get the cheapest possible.
