TLDR;Pros: Proximity to beach, shops and restaurants, service, free-wifi, free breakfast, complimentary coffee, ability to borrow umbrellas and beach towels, updated room, rooms cleaned daily, towels changed when desired, safe in room, room serviceCons: No swimming pool, no gym, breakfast wasn't extensive choice and only went from 7-9:30am, no in hotel restaurant, the curtains in the room weren't black outNote: There was no smoking on the balconies and you had be 20 feet from the front door, so depending how you see it if can be either a pro or a conWe stayed from the 20th of November and checked out on the 26th, 4 of our days rained but we went shopping and on some tours to make the most of our time. Would I stay again? Probably not, I like a little more resort to my hotels but if you just need a place to sleep and eat in some kind of luxury than I can recommend this hotel.

This was our first trip to Hawaii. The Vive Hotel room was small, but nice and the staff was very friendly. I was a little disappointed with ocean view, was not worth the extra cost. Overall, I would stay there again.

We were welcomed by very professional and accommodating front desk clerk after a rough start of our trip. They provided us with a cold towel and pineapple juice. The Cons: The room is very small with queen size bed. The curtains were not black out curtains. The AC is a window unit, not central, so it was quite loud. The bathroom vanity was also very small. The hotel was 3 blocks away from the ocean. There was no hotel pool. The Pros: They hotel had adequate continental breakfast daily. Served ice cold water and coffee all day. Provided beach going gears at front desk. Friendly and professional staff. Clean and modern room with a tablet. Comfortable bed with soft sheets. Cost was good compare to other hotels, on top of it there was no resort fee .

Vive was a fantastic modern hotel especially with the poor Australian Dollar, this was an extremely reasonably priced hotel that was not dated like literally every other hotel in Hawaii. It was very clean, air conditioned and had bathroom amenities provided. Each room had a tablet that you could either do research on, order room service (from surrounding restaurants that would deliver to your hotel room) and also communicate to reception if you needed to request specific services. I am super picky with accommodation to the point I am averse to shower curtains and horribly patterned (and likely never been washed) duvets. Vive had clean doonas that you know get washed and even though we had a shower curtain it was very clean and had little magnets at the bottom that stuck the curtain to the bathtub so you know it wasn't touching the previous occupants body! WiFi was great until halfway though our stay it stopped working on our floor. Despite a few phone calls to reception, it never got fixed for us. Although it still worked in the reception area, it was abit annoying to have to keep going down there. No resort fees are charged which is great. You can still borrow towels, beach mats, umbrellas etc with no extra charge. Local phone calls are also free. Aircondioner was noisy especially when it rained as it is an old school air conditioner that hangs our the window. It works well, but when raining gets pretty noisy. Breakfast was simple but quite delicious. Lots of pastries, bread, coffee, tea, juice and fresh fruit. More than ample to start the day off well. Location is excellent. Only about 300m down the street is Waikiki Beach. Bus stops are also pretty much outside the hotel so it's easy to get to Diamond Head, Ala Moana Shopping Centre and Pearl Harbour. There is also an ABC store not far to pick up snacks, drinks etc.Valet parking is $25 a day but I think if you reserve the room through the vive website you can actually get it half price. We loved our stay at Vive but I guess the biggest let down for us was the WiFi not working in our room. Would definitely stay again however.

We chose this room based on other travelers reviews, location, and wifi availability. We had booked the King suite and it was pricier, but overall it was a very nice room with obstructed beach view. Upon check-in, we were greeted with moistened towels to freshen up with as well as glasses of pineapple juice. The room was spacious and clean, but if you leave the A/C on next to the bed it was too loud. There was an alternate A/C that we left on and it was sufficient. The room was quite loud with the rain/wind during our trip, especially the water drips on the A/C; I am unsure if this was just due to the strength of the storms. The location was superb, just minutes away from almost everything we wanted to do. Self parking is not available. If you are lucky, you can find a spot on the street or there is valet parking for $25 per day or rated charges per hour. Valet service was efficient and you can also message the valet service to ready your car from a wireless pad in the room. Our stay would have been more enjoyable had our wifi service in room functioned properly rather than having stopped working the second day of our five day trip, so we had to always stay in the lobby to use internet. There was also a false fire alarm at around 6 am one morning of our stay. The pillows also required some getting used to for us as we were used to lower pillows, but overall that did not affect our stay too much. We did appreciate that you can request a courtesy room to freshen up in for an hour on the day you are leaving, as that allowed us to shower/rest prior to our red-eye flight. The breakfast was good as well, with an abundance of fresh fruit, and there is always coffee or tea available in the sitting area any time of day. You can also reserve beach equipment such as mats, towels, and chairs, so that was very convenient as we had some beach excursions. Overall, we would stay here again.

Stayed her for three nights in September 2015 for $230/night. This was a boutique hotel with a great location within a two block walk of Waikiki Beach (and fabulous sunsets), tons of shopping and restaurants, buses and trolleys. The first four floors are indoor parking. We stayed on a high floor.PROS:Lobby: Tons of seating for lounging around, A/C, books and games available, all day ice water, FREE towels/beach gear for use, free pineapple juice and cold towels at check in, reception was always friendly and helpful, and a computer for use to print boarding passes or surf the net. The continental breakfast consisted of fresh juices, fresh fruit, pastries and muffins.Special shout out to Jacqueline the concierge, who gave us very specific directions to which buses to take to hike Diamond Head, what restaurants we could dine at along the way, local spas, bus schedules and maps and wouldn't accept any gratuities for her assistance.Room:Pretty large room with two chairs and a work desk, minimalist but modern décor, free WiFi, flat screen TV, two thin waffle (not terry cloth) robes, mini fridge, digital safe, and an Android tablet in the room for your use(!).Bathroom had single sink, but large shower stall with decent water pressure, a rain shower head, hairdryer and decent toiletries in scents of green tea and willow and rosehips and lavender.CONS:The A/C was two old and small window units that were pretty loud when running, but they worked well and ran on a timer to program as you wished.TV remote did not work correctly, so you had to scroll manually through all of the channels and could not just key in a specific channel. There were NO drawers, just one stand alone bureau with hangers.

As this was our first overseas holiday we were a little apprehensive. We found theVive Hotel on line, checked out reviews and website and liked what we read and saw.We were not disappointed. Most friendly and genuinely helpful staff.

The staff were very friendly and assisted us in all aspects from directions to booking of activities. The hotel has a nice lounge area where people can have coffee and tea 24hrs and is a great place to relax. The location was central to Waikiki with the beach just a few mins walk and the bus stop just right outside which goes to all the main attractions. Shout out to KC from concierge which we bothered almost every day with directions. Overall a great hotel and will definitely rebook!

Small rooms but nice and clean, and who stays in the room on Hawaii. They had all you need for a trip to the beach free of charge. 2 min walkBreakfast was toast, fresh fruit and a variety of backed goodies.

Good location...small rooms which we knew...overall pretty good for the price.Walking distance to beach, shopping and restaurants. Breakfast wasn't the best...would he nice to have cereals or something like that.

There's nothing flashy about Vive when you consider many of the Island resorts but the team tries to make up for it in the best way -- good front desk service.The desk staff were very friendly, and went out of their way to answer questions not only about their services but also about experiencing the island. The hotel had complimentary beach towels which was great for this solo traveller (it's probably a common offering but it was appreciated).My room was small and looked out onto another hotel, and the air-con was a little noisy but the hotel managed to meet my three expectations: it was clean, had a comfortable bed and strong hot shower.I did struggle as to whether I would give a three or four rating on Trip Advisor.The breakfast is disappointing. The offering is very limited with pastries, toast and fruit. More problematic is that there aren't enough spots in the dining area for the people trying to eat breakfast!There is an AM concierge but on one occasion I couldn't find them and on another there was a long wait for help.I decided to go with a rating of four because the young, friendly staff on the front desk helped make me feel like I was there to enjoy a holiday.

Aloha! and Mahalo to Vive Hotel for an awesome experience.From the first day to the end of our first trip to Hawaii, Vive Hotel did not let us down. We got their 8 am due to an early flight, and our room was ready right away and did not wait until 3pm! Reception welcome us with complimentary hot towels and pineapple juice upon arrival.Wifi was readily available, hassle free. Breakfast, beach gears, wifi, and all day hot beverages are complimentary. Waikiki beach is two streets away, very convenient.Service was amazing and the facilities are very clean too! We lost our key in the beach and was replaced with a new one free of charge and hassle free.The 24/7 reception also accommodated us in making sure our luggage did not go over the weight limit.I definitely will stay here again when I come back to Oahu! And I will also recommend this place to anyone.

We enjoyed our stay very much. The location was perfect. The room was very clean and new. The ac was too loud to sleep. The staff was very helpful and friendly all time. On an other trip we choose the vive again.

One issue, small rooms.Other than that:Continental breakfastBeach useables (chairs, towels, mats)All day coffeeExcellent staffSpa feelOne bkock from the beach.This is one of the best properties I've stayed at. Yes it's an older hotel that's been remodelled, anything in Waikiki has been there for 30+ years. Really the only drawbacks for me was a toilet almost beside the bed, but with a bathroom downstairs, not a big issue. I can't recommend this hotel enough. With the proximity to the beach, the great staff, a basic continental breakfast everyday (where else in Waikiki can you get that), boutique feel. If you want to spend a lot more money, pay for a name brand hotel you won't be at (who stays in their room in Hawaii), then go for that. If you're just a normal traveller like myself that wants location, a coffee and toast with fresh fruit in the morning, and you're going to plan your vacation with gong to multiple locations and properties, than you found your place.

Very nice, clean and comfortable but room was very small. Modern fixtures. Nicely decorated. Everything worked as needed. Helpful staff. Good continental breakfast. Great location close to beach. Would recommend.

Very clean hotel , 5mins walk from the beach and restaurants , service was great.Only recommendation is they should serve hot breakfast along with the continental breakfast.Check in was great , fresh pineapple juice on arrival

We stayed here for three nights and would highly recommend this hotel for the friendly staff, cleanliness of the hotel and excellent service overall. Our room was small but quite sufficient for our short stay of 3 nights.

this place is reasonably priced if you book long enough out. no pool but only two blocks from the beach.Breakfast is the same every day so if you stay a little while gets a little boring. do not accept roo 1102 unless they have fixed the window or the wind whistling in and the blinds banging will drive you nuts!

Vive could not be better located. Close-enough to all the things you'll love to do in Waikiki, but not on a busy street so you can still rest. The hotel itself is very nice (the rooms and bathrooms are small, as others have said), and the service is excellent. My only comment service wise is that on some days it was 3:30pm and our room had not been serviced. This is normal for them, but not ideal, in my opinion.The reason for the 3.5 stars, vs. 5, is that the breakfast was not great. They had fruit (very little variety and not all ready to be served) and breads. Lots of cheap bread. They should have some yogurt and granola for those wanting a healthier breakfast that is not carb-loaded.

i stayed here for 3 nights back in 2014. The hotel has a great interior, very trendy. the staff at the front desk were super! The room was a decent size, bed was quite comfortable. the bathroom was on the small side but was clean and worked well for the 2 of us. In the morning, we would go down to the lobby to have some of the fresh fruits, but we usually went nearby to one of the restaurants as there were plenty of options. the one downside was the view. We had an oceanview room, but you could'nt see much due to other buildings obstructing the view. Not much you can do about that though. I loved the hotel and would certainly stay there again.
user_name:
Bello2luv
New York City, New York

review_body: We really liked the vive hotel at Waikiki although the rooms and especially the bathrooms are on the small side. why? Because the boutique atmosphere and the service are spotless! The complimentary breakfast, coffee and tea all day, free beach towels and chairs, boogyboards and so on are far more important! The hotel is conveniently located two blocks from the beach.

Friendly and professional staff. Very helpful concierge. Great location. Clean rooms. The free breakfast was great; amenities like boogie boards and beach mats were a nice touch! We enjoyed our stay and would return!

We chose Vive for the first leg of our honeymoon as we wanted something in Waikiki that wasn't overly priced and was in a good location. Vive was a great hotel. We had a really good rate for the Jr. Suite and the room did not disappoint. But I will start with the customer service. It was amazing. We were greeted by a very friendly staff, delicious pineapple juice, and a refreshing towelette. Check in was painless. Valet was easy. The room was spacious. The bathroom even more so. We did have a view of the ocean. And I loved the tablet provided. It was very easy to use. The free wi-fi was a plus, too! The only reason the room felt dated was because of the two window a/c units. I was not used to seeing that, but they worked. The location was also prime. It was 2 blocks from the beach. The restaurants around the hotel were some of the ones we enjoyed the most, and everything else was within walking distance. We also had a rental car and getting to/from the hotel from outside Waikiki was very easy. We'd gladly stay here again and suggest it to other friends, as well. Mahalo!!

We were in Waikiki for a week and stayed at The Vive. What a great decision to stay here. Was just a stroll to the beach. The room was a good size, as you are not in them that much and the included breakfast was good value. Internet was included also and was fast. The breakfast room and unlimited coffee and tea all day and night was a great inclusion. Just pick up a cup when you come back to the hotel or on your way out. The staff was very polite and nothing was too much trouble for them. I would definitely stay here again if we go back to Waikiki.

staff was great, helpful and very punuctual. The hotel room was perfect, no strange bugs crawling around, no dirty bathroom (first thing to look at other than bed before u stay at a hotel). Will go again

When I planed the trip I looked for a hotel, which is resonably priced and within a wakjubg dustabce to the hotel in Waikiki Beach, where my relatives from San Francisco would stay. I used customer reviews as reference. And I am sure I made a good choice.The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. I arrived at 1:30 pm but they prepared me the room in 10 minutes.Wi-Fi connection was very good. The tablet of the room was helpful. The breakfast was good. The free coffee and water service is good. Just one regrettable point: the noise of the airconditioner at night. So, I cooled the room a lot and put it off before I go to bed.

Very, very helpful staff. Rooms were quite nice. Very good location. A minute or so walk to Waikiki Beach. 5 minutes walk to a Ross store. 10 minutes walk to Zoo. Negatives are that there is no pool and breakfast was average.

Overall we enjoyed our experience. It was a no frills room, but it was clean, quiet, and the employees were all pleasant.My only complaints are 1) The room was much smaller than I expected. 2) the ocean view was a view of a parking garage through a tiny window. 3) there was not enough room to store clothes for two individuals for 8 nights. We lived out of our suitcases.

Nice hotel a bit away from the more heavily packed tourist areas, but close to everything. Three short blocks to beach. Breakfast: assorted fruits, breads & pastries, juices, coffee - all tasty. Room was small but adequate for our short stay. Did like being on 19th floor above the street noise. Easy access to bus if without a car.

My friend and I stayed in the junior suite with an ocean view -- perfect size for 2. The shower door was missing and there weren't any bath floor mats -- we had to request for them. The breakfast selection was ok -- wish they included eggs and yogurt. I like that there's always coffee/tea and water available at the lobby. Beach gear is nice too. KC is cheery and extremely helpful.

Location was great. 5 minute walk to the beach. Minutes from many restaurants and shops. The staff was very friendly and attentive to our needs. Would stay here again!Frank, Vancouver CanadaFrank, Vancouver Canada.

Nice view from my room and easy to access to visit everywhere.24hours I could drink coffee and water. It is really good service.The hotel lent me swim items so I could enjoy swimming at Waikiki beach.

Amazing hotel, staff very helpful, terrific breakfast in a beautiful setting. Great Wifi very fast and free. Hotel provides mats and boards to take for the easy walk to the beach. Close to restaurants, shopping strip and to public transport.

We stayed a week in one of the upgraded room. The hotel lobby has a crips clean look.+ Clean room and thorough cleaning staff+ Polite staff+ Good wifi+ PC tablets in room with room service stuff on it.+ Inexpensive bottled water in room+ The concierge "KC" was really really helpful organising touristy stuff- TV sometimes had reception problems

Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights back in the end of August as part of a package booked through Hotwire. Not sure how much the hotel would've costed on its own but the package turned out to be a good deal!We picked this hotel mainly for the location and complimentary wifi and breakfast. That alone was a win since most of the other hotels charged extra for wifi and breakfast. In terms of breakfast they offered mostly baked goods and fresh fruits. There was also pineapple juice every morning during breakfast, which was a nice touch.The bus stop was also right by the entrance of the hotel so it was very convenient to get around. There was a storm hitting the week we visited and the hotel lent out umbrellas and beach towels free of charge.The hotel was mostly blocked by other buildings so there wasn't a direct view of Waikiki beach but from our room you still got to see a part of the beach. That didn't bother us at all though because who sits in their room looking out the window when you could be outdoors in the ocean roughly 2 blocks away?All in all we enjoyed our stay here. Would definitely consider returning should we visit Oahu again.

Great little room close to the beach for a couple's getaway. Very helpful and friendly staff make you feel welcome. Complimentary wifi, continental breakfast, and water/coffee throughout the day. Just 3 blocks from the beach...close enough to all the activities but nice to be able to retreat to peace and quiet at night.

Great location, close to everything in Waikiki. The hotel staff is great, also there was a nice continental breakfast. Try for a room on the upper floors, there's a lot of traffic noise around. We had a room on a lower floor on the first night, and the staff were very accommodating in moving us to a higher floor for the next 2 nights. Thanks Beverley!

Small rooms but good location and we loved the breakfast/coffee area. It was a great spot to meet up with family and friends with a cozy, at home feel about it. The hotel was in a good area - just a couple of blocks to the beach.

Just arrived home after a 10 day stay. Very happy with the Vive hotel. Staff were very friendly and helpful - particularly domestic services and late night concierge. Great location, room was small but comfortable.

It was great, perfect location and complimentary breakfast was a nice touch I really would love to give this hotel 5 stars but I can't as I dealt with a rude staff member at concierge with pink hair, the person questioned why we would want to visit some certain tourist attractions as they seemed a waste of time and effort to get there really put us off. Other than that pleasant near perfect stay.

Recently had a seven night stay in this very good boutique hotel. The staff were excellent and the accommodation was great. Stayed in a Queen Cosmopolitan room which was a great size and did not consider it small as some reviews report. The hotel is well placed in Waikiki to all attractions including city bus stop at front door. Highly recommended.

19th floor when booking the jr suite...well worth the extra money...nice size room with large shower. Morning breakfast was good, especially the papaya. All of the staff had a smile with their greeting. Very close to the beach and lots of fine restaurants within walking distance. I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

As a local, I really appreciated the prime location for walking the strip on Halloween night. Upon arrival, the staff was so friendly and offered us refreshing pineapple juice. The valet guys made our night super stress-free and let us enter and exit as we pleased. Had an awesome stay. Thanks Vive!

For the price you cannot beat this hotel. While the rooms are small who spends time in your room when you are in Honolulu? The staff was very friendly, the room was spotless, great location and the free breakfast was a bonus! We had a wonderful stay and visit this place again in a heartbeat!

We stayed for 1 night before flying on to Big Island next day. + Good location close to restaurants and beach+ Very friendly staff and nice welcome- Noisy room. We ended up with only a couple of hours of sleep. The air condition is very load and turning it off didn't help as the street noise was overwelming. We have already booked another 2 nights on the way back and have requested a room facing the back (see our second review for this hotel). - Motel-style breakfast

Recently had a 6 night stay - wonderful hotel, friendly staff and so close to the beach and shopping and restaurants of Honolulu, two short blocks away. Our room was excellent, we chose a Junior suite which provided the extra space and what an oh so roomy shower. We were on the 21st floor with a partial view of the ocean and Diamond Head. Enjoyed the included breakfast to start our day and the hotel provides beach towels, mats etc which was so good when we went to the beach for a swim a couple of days.The hotel is within walking distance of car rental companies which we used a couple of days, as well there is a coin operated laundry diagonally opposite the hotel. We will be recommending the Vive to all our friends and would definitely stay here again if we go to Hawaii.

Excellent hotel, staff wonderful, room great (we had upgraded to junior suite), Ask for room on high floor, our friends on lower floors heard lots of traffic noise. Value for money, excellent. Close to beach

This was our first trip to Hawaii and we found this when we booked our tickets. What a gem amongst the monster hotels around us! The rooms may be small but they were very clean and comfortable. The staff was extremely courteous and helpful and did whatever they could to make our stay more pleasant. With being only a couple of blocks to the beach, it was a perfect location and value!We would definitely recommend the Vive and stay there again.

Our visit was fantastic, and everyone we came in contact with was not only super professional, but exceptionally helpful. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Hawaii, and would certainly stay again.

My boyfriend and found ourselves on an impromptu vacation in Honolulu. Although the room was barely bigger than our queen-sized bed, it was clean and modern. The beach is two blocks away and free towels, mats and chairs are a plus. The price was competitive with surrounding hotels and I am glad we chose the Vive. No need for fancy details, you're just sleeping and sunning in paradise. Staff thoughtful and efficient. Bypass the crowds on Kalakaua and stay at the Vive. We will definitely be back.

VIVE hotel is an affordable and centrally located in Waikiki. Beach and Shopping is only a few minnutes walk from the hotel. Staff are friendly and helpful. the only grudge is the price of Valet parking.

We went to Hawaii to celebrate my little sisters birthday, and it was well worth the trip. The service was top notch I was able to talk to the front desk for just about anything I needed to know (where to take the bus, what’s a good and reasonably priced place to eat around the island, etc). The staff really went out of their way to make us feel at home. The lobby was also awesome, it had a coffee house vibe to it, so it was a good place for us to hang out when we where waiting for our shuttle back to the airport. . Their morning continental breakfast was also outstanding I loved the varieties of pastries that they had including this one that had a sausage and pineapple inside.

Seeing as going to a destination like Hawaii the goal is to enjoy the beach and tropical environment you can't go wrong with the Vive. The rooms are not very big and it is located 3 blocks away from Waikiki but you visit Hawaii to be on the beach, not hanging out in your room... save a lot of money by staying at the Vive and not right on the beach. The Free Breakfast provided is very basic but is a nice amenity not found at more expensive hotels. The only downside to breakfast is that there are a lot of seats but lacks adequate table space for comfortable eating. Another negative is the $25/day Parking but with space limited the fee is applicable at most hotels so it's hard to avoid. Join their email list and save 50% on parking for the next visit. There is a Bus Stop right next to the hotel and with a great Bus system it is very convenient because you can ride The Bus all the way from the airport and be dropped off door side without having to change busses. Unfortunately The Bus changed their luggage policy and they no longer allow larger bags so we were forced to rent a car for 3 extra days that we did not budget for. All in all my wife and I were very impressed with the Vive and we would definitely recommend the Vive and we will stay there again on our next trip to Honolulu.

We stayed at Vive in late October 2015 through to November and my partner and I really enjoyed our time there, the hotel offered towels, mats, body boards and chairs at no extra cost and Waikiki beach was no more than a 5 minute walk.We would definitely stay again as we enjoyed the way the staff treated its guests and were very helpful when we had questions.The only bad thing I can say about our time there would be the free breakfast offered but we understood that it's free and it's better than nothing.We strongly recommend to check out this place.

Great location just 3 very short blocks from the epicenter of Waikiki Beach...excellent staff..helpful..friendly...hotel provides a 'courtesy' room, no charge, after check out to shower before your red-eye home...clean..comfortable...best value for Waikiki Beach.

This hotel appears to have been newly renovated. The downstairs common area is fabulous, the rooms are quite small without balconies or views. Breakfast was a variety of pastries and fresh fruit. Overall a good 3 star hotel

Excellent location , very friendly staff Everything was very clean,fresh fruits ,fresh juice and coffe every morning . Only " low point " is that you pay $25 per day for parking. But that's everywhere.Would definitely come back!!

My mum and I stayed here 9 nights. The staff were exceptional, so friendly and nothing was too much effort. Breakfast each morning was lovely with a range of fruits, pastries, breads and juice. There was an assortment of beach gear to hire free of charge. The hotel itself was impeccably clean and modern, unlike some of the other hotels we saw which can look abit run down. Perfect location as well, just one street back from the main street and about a 2 minute walk to the beach. The rooms are a little small but it is all you need as you only sleep there anyway! I will be recommending Vive to anyone travelling to Waikiki!

This hotel was a great choice for our stay in Waikiki. Located one street back from the beach and restaurants it was clean and functional with amazingly helpful, friendly staff. Free Wifi and light breakfast every morning was appreciated.

I had a great trip for a week at the VIVE Hotel Wikiki. Room was clean, bed was comfortable, pillows were great, and staff was helpful with providing boogie boards, bus information, advice on beaches and there was constant availability of free tea, water, lemon water and coffee. I thought the breakfast was a little weak, but the location is great and by mixing it up with the good breakfast places close by more than made up for it. The price was really great for the location, that can't be understated. In the room there is a nice safe which we used to store the engagement ring and all that, would definitely recommend this for someone looking for a reasonably priced solid hotel with great staff this is definitely worth looking at.

staff always friendly and happy to help, rooms clean and stylish. Bathroom could have had more storage no "shelf" space. Breakfast was good but there wasn't a good place to eat, especially for children.

Pros:Chaming and helpful staffClose to bus stopVery cleanReasonably pricedTwo blocks plus to Waikiki BeachNeutral:No pool or garden (should have looked better when deciding!)Cons:Small roomA/c fan engine made a racket the first night that made me think it had been salvaged from the ArizonaTraffic noise during most of the nightFresh breakfast, but some carbohydrates would have been appreciatedFew restaurants in the immediate vicinity

We had a really enjoyable stay at VIVE Hotel. We received exceptional service (food and towel upon arrival, helpful concierge, bag storage...). The hotel/room was clean and well appointed, and the location is great. What really stood out was the complimentary room for an hour in the evening, having checked out earlier that morning. This allowed us to freshen up before continuing our trip that night. Would definitely stay again next time we are in Honolulu.

My stay at Vive Hotel was excellent. Room though a bit small was clean and staff was friendly and helpful. The 24/7 coffee and tea is also great. The hotel provided an airport shuttle service @ USD12 per head which was good value.

Vive Hotel is now my favorite hotel in Waikiki. The location is perfect, the room (#2005) was comfortable and quiet. It also had a nice partial ocean view. The hotel staff were friendly and the continental breakfast and free Wi-Fi were added bonuses. They have beach towels, mats, and chairs available for their guests at no charge. I traveled solo, and even though the room was small it was perfect for me. It could be a bit of a tight squeeze for two adults. I didn't see many kids (only a few infants) at the hotel. I believe the small rooms makes it impractical for families. I don't have kids of my own so this definitely was another plus for me. I highly recommend this hotel for singles and couples without children.

Everything was perfect. The only bad thing is that my cam charger disappeared (I left it on the night stand). The rest is outstanding. Breakfast, beach gear for free, location. I would come back and recommend it.

enjoyable and affordable downtown hotel with tight parking garage but an OUTSTANDING STAFF of people to make it go smoothly. Do NOT rent an enormous SUV, but our Jeep fit in the parking garage without a problem.

I stayed in Mountain Suite for 4 consecutive nights. The room is on 20th floor with very good mountain view. The space is enough for a couple. The breakfast tastes much better than expectation. The staff are very kind and nice. Really unforgetable experience here. Vive Hotel is affordable and I will choose it next time when I travel in Hawaii.

one of the best hotel i've ever stayed. it's cozy and medium size. location wise it's convenient to all places. bus stop is right in front of hotel, beach is only 5 mins walk. all convenient stores are close to the hotel.

I was satisfied with vive hotel located 3 blocks away from Wailkiki beach. Facilities are convienent to use and complimentary breakfast allows us to save travell budget. free wi-fi,beach tools (mat, boogie boards, towel) also would be helpful to enjoy time. I and my wife also receommanded vive hotel one of our colleague who plans to make visitation to Hawaii next year. compact and well-organized room definately make any trallvers satisfiied to stay.

Vive Hotel is centrally located and the amenities are amazing. My expectations were exceeded. The customer service and beautiful interior was absolutely amazing. I enjoyed the complimentary breakfast. I will always book with Vive.

From check in to checkout, everything was great. The staff was courteous and helpful and went above the call of duty. It was just a few blocks from the ocean with a great view of the sunset and easy walk to food, entertainment and fun!

from checking -in to checking out our experience in this hotel was excellent... our room was always cleaned , always had the ammenities that we needed, the ambiance was very very nice.Even though I have to pay for parking it was all worth it, the valey staff were always there to greet you and ready to assist you.

We were on Oahu for a wedding and decided to stay in Waikiki. Vive is on Kuhio, which is a couple of blocks off the main drag, so it's quieter and less hectic but very close to all Waikiki has to offer. The hotel is modern and in good upkeep. Our room was spacious, had pretty good views and was clean. I stay in a lot of hotels and this one had a nice feeling to it vs. stock big-brand hotel rooms. The staff was very friendly and helpful at every interaction - although that's my experience anywhere in Hawai'i. The breakfast is free and you get what you pay for. Instead we went to a great place across the street called Hawaiian Crown Plantation for wonderful pour over Kona coffee and açai bowls. I'd recommend Vive Hotel Waikiki and would stay here again.

The Vive is in a great location-3 blocks from the beach and in the center of the Waikiki strip. The hotel provided beach mats, towels, and boogie boards to use on the beach for free. Complimentary breakfast is provided in the lounge with your basic pastries, fruit, coffee, juices etc. I stayed four nights and the selection was pretty much the same my whole stay. It would have helped if they changed up their selection once in a while. After two days we just started going out for breakfast. The room we had was small and had some wear and tear. Bath tub finish was peeling and a lot of paint chips on the wall. But overall the room was clean. Windows are of the old single pane type so you can hear the street noise below.

The Vive Waikiki is close to the action, very clean, modern and the staff is extremely friendly. Just a pity that the continental breakfast does not match the otherwise high standards! Our room was not huge but just fine for what we needed it. Watch out, the air conditioning unit in the window might be noisy.

Location was good, staff were very professional, helpful and made you feel welcome. Lounge area and garden was delightful. Rooms were well appointed. I would stay there again, however, road noise at night was an issue.

Free breakfast/location/ staff/ price so good!! But only valet parking ㅠㅠ25$ too expensive. There is no self parking and twin room is small ㅠ Free rent beach towels, chair, boogie bord ,Thank you!!!! ♥♥♥

The Vive was a great hotel. It is well located and it is fresh and clean. It's close to the beach and the free towels and basic beach things like boogie boards was great. It's also close to shopping and restaurants. The staff were helpful and very nice. Honolulu accommodation is expensive no matter where you stay Vive offered good value compared to other hotels we have stayed in at the same price point. We loved the lounge area in the lobby it was a great place to just chill out with fresh Kona coffee and chilled water available 24/7. The complimentary breakfast was very Hawaiian it consisted of fresh Hawaiian fruits,some toast, pastries,fresh Hawaiian juice, and Kona coffee. The room was very very small but it was well designed and appointed and it was fresh there was no musty/moisture smell that you often get from hotels in humid locations like Hawaii. The air-con was noisy but it was effective. The 7 inch tablet in the room was handy and the free WiFi was excellent throughout the hotel. Overall the hotel was brilliant and we really enjoyed our stay and so did the group we were with. We will be back and we hope nothing changes.

Friendly staff - lovely room - not the best windows (noisy) - nice beach equipment - nice location - fancy mobile pad on the room - only fruits and sweets for breakfast - nice services - air condition in room

We just got back from Oahu and stayed in Vive for 10 nights. I read the reviews prior to booking and had an idea of what I was getting in to but things were a bit different once we arrived. They honestly were much better than what I thought they would be. The customer service you get from this place is amazing. They go ABOVE AND BEYOND to make sure you are happy and comfortable during your stay. Now, keep in mind, you are getting a cheap price which means they have to cut costs somehow. The rooms are pretty small but very modern and have everything you need. If you read the other reviews the only thing people really complain about is this. They really aren't that bad and the hotel does a great job with the space! They are super clean and well taken care of. The beds are CLEAN!!! The breakfast is pretty basic but plentiful and tasty. Also, they have 24 hour Kona coffee for free. This is now my favorite coffee. The only sad thing is we cant get it in Minnesota!! When you go to the beach they give you towels, chairs and pretty much anything you need for free. The concierge, Kasey, really knew her stuff and gave us great suggestions. Chris at the front desk was also very helpful and kind. I honestly could write a longer more detailed review but we just got back from an amazing vacation and am a bit tired so I wont. Bottom line is this is a great hotel for a even better price. You definitely get what you pay for plus some! If we stay in Waikiki again we will for sure be staying at this hotel! I hope you enjoy your stay in Waikiki as much as we did. Mahalo!! :-)

Great Location and Price, All staff were awesome. Stayed Three nights and had a room at the front of the hotel near the main road this was a little noisy. On our return after two nights on the big island our room was at the back of the hotel and was a lot quieter. Great place to stay

Excellent customer service, very friendly staff and always helpful. For the price we paid, it exceeded our expectations. So great value and in a great location - 2min to the beach and other major hotels, shopping and only a bus ride away to a major shopping centre! Loved it!!!

Very neat place with tons of (good) character. I'd far rather stay at a cool place like this than a cookie-cutter "safe" place like the Hilton. I highly recommend the Vive Hotel for anyone hoping to stay downtown, but not at a boring chain.

Upon arriving to the Vive Hotel, service from the staff was exceptional. Our bags were taken care of, concierge provided us with a map of the island & we were given directions for some nice places to eat. The staff helped us in hailing a taxi too (we later discovered using Uber is much easier and cheaper in Waikiki so do yourself a favour and download the app).The hotel is two blocks away from the main hub of Waikiki Beach. The Hyatt Regency is on the beach front so you're located about 500 metres back from there. Vive Hotel has complimentary continental breakfast but apart from that, there's no other facilities at the hotel so don't expect anything too fancy. You just get the basics, which to be honest is all you need when there's so much to do outdoors anyway. The rooms are small - we had the ocean view room. It's comfortable for two people but it is crammed. The bathroom is tiny too and your shower is via stepping into a bathtub. We made do with what we had and it was still very clean so we can't complain about anything much other than the space was small. Our air conditioning in the room was very loud... I express 'very loud' - I think this was partly because the unit was old. Each room comes with a tablet including wifi for you to use which was very convenient! Also, complimentary wifi was available for guests too. It's an affordable and central hotel so I would definitely recommend it. If you're ok with being a little walk away from the main shopping strip (about 5 minutes) and the beach (less than 2 minutes) then you'll be fine to book at Vive Hotel. Some restaurants we would recommend within walking distance: - Hau Tree Lanai (book at sunset & expect to spend a little more $$$, it's divine seafood! - Duke's (located inside the Outrigger Hotel, great for the family & serves buffet breakfast - also has live music at night) - Il Lupino (Italian trattoria amongst the main shopping strip, across the road from H&M) - Yard House Restaurant (big sports bar, loads of options and big menu. Great atmosphere and the surrounding street had many food options too) - Buho Cantina (must visit rooftop Mexican at 2250 Kalakaua Avenue, this is again along the main shopping strip. Go for lunch or dinner, you won't be disappointed!)Lastly, we walked to all these places from our hotel and the maximum walk was 15 minutes which meant soaking in the atmosphere and walking off our food.So, rather than go with a really expensive hotel just to be closer to 'everything' there really is no such thing. Waikiki is small. Save your money and book affordable!

Vive hotel was great. Rooms are small as other reviews state but still comfortable. Great location, great value compared to nearby hotels, and staff was simply amazing. Always smiling, friendly, and willing to help with anything. Fresh pineapple juice and cold towels at check in was a nice addition. also unlike most other hotels in Waikiki there are no parking fees unless your actually parking a car. Breakfast is delicious but does need some sausage or bacon and egg to go with it. P.S. The hallways are hot because its an open balcony behind the elevators.

From the moment you step in you can feel the difference.The reception and layout of the lounge area is inviting.The breakfast consisting of pastries and fruit is always scrumptious.The rooms are clean with ample room to spread your stuff out.The location is A1, beach close and bus stop is 10 meters away.Very pleased and would come again.

Good location! Nice staff! The hotel provided pastry and fruit daily. Also towels and mats for beach. Enjoyed beverage and towel at check in! KC had great suggestions for outings! We enjoyed our stay in Oahu!

Stayed on oahu for 3 nights during our honeymoon and chose vive for stay. I couldn't have asked for a better time. After arriving we were immediately greeted and provided a wet cloth and nice cold pineapple juice, which was greatly refreshing. The front desk happily gave us dining recommendations (which ended up being great!) and a rundown of everything at the hotel from breakfast to beach supplies. There was also a tablet in the room we didn't try but looked to provide requests for room services , transportation and other services which is pretty cool. Breakfast was a nice start to the day, nothing special but was more than enough for us. It consisted of different breads, danishes, tons of fresh fruit ( pineapple was sooo good) , and muffins. Coffee, tea and water looked to be provided 24/7 .We were also surprised with a complimentary room upgrade and a very nice hand written note with chocolate for the occasion ( thank you!!)As far as the room everything was clean and had a nice view of the ocean. Beds were comfortable, I think we fell asleep at 8pm every night, time difference was a bit killer but we're getting more on track. Oh, and for anyone worried about not being close enough to the beach ( we somewhat were) it's seriously about a 3 minute WALK from front door to sand. If you're looking to head to pearl harbor or other sights the hotel also provided an awesome guide sheet with all the major destinations and which buses to take to get there and to get back. Better yet, the bus stop is 10 feet from the front door. This ended up being very useful for us. ( front desk will help you with exact $$ change for using bus)I'm likely forgetting to mention something else, but it for sure was nothing against the hotel, everything was perfect and 0 complaints from us. We're now on Kauai enjoying the rest of our honeymoon, so I should sign off now before I get yelled at ;)But once again, thank you for everything!!! -Charles
user_name:
McChazo
New York City, New York

review_body: Great value and location. Had a great ocean view from our suite. Only amenity missing was guest laundry facility. Would recommend to anyone wanting an affordable visit to Waikiki. Continental breakfast was excellent!

I recently stayed here for 6 nights on a holiday to Honolulu and it ticked all the right boxes for me. I found the room to be spacious, with the staff friendly and helpful and since I planned on spending large amounts of time on Waikiki Beach the location is perfect as it is less than 5 minutes walk from there. The hotel is also on a bus route which took you past pearl harbour or the Ala Moana mall. A few of the other reviews mentioned the noisy air conditioner, personally I didnt find it a problem and it certainly did not interfere with my sleep. I would have liked there to have been a hotel bar but there are plenty of bars and restaurants nearby so this wasnt too much of an issueI would certainly hope to stay here on future visits to Honolulu and Mahalo to the all the staff for making my stay so enjoyable

The hotel is in an ideal position and offers great value especially with the included breakfast which was really good. The staff throughout the hotel were extremely helpful and always keen to be of help.

Great little boutique hotel only a couple of blocks away from the beach. The lobby was great and check-in went really quick and smooth. All of the employees were fantastic. We stayed for two nights and it was perfect for what we needed. That being said, the rooms are small. Very small. As long as you know that going in, the place is great. Breakfast in the morning was a nice bonus and if you needed beach gear (chairs, umbrella, towels) they provided that for you (no charge!). We would definitely stay here again if we were in Waikiki for 2-3 days. If we were going to be in town longer, we would probably opt for a bigger room, but that's just us.
user_name:
Mike W
New York City, New York

review_body: Staff are friendly and very accomodating to your needs. Location was fantastic. I will book again here for my future travel. Breakfast are always a plus to guest. Hotel well kept and maintain. Thank you

The hotel is an incredible deal! The location, price, convenience, and staff made our trip a great time! The breakfast each morning was a great start to the day, and we certainly took advantage of the all day coffee available. Plus, they offer beach towels and other items for you to use for free. I would definitely stay here again! Great location, staff, and price. Thanks for the great trip!

We stayed here at our honeymoon for three weeks. The room was great but we upgraded to a Junior suite and we didn't regret that. There is also a nice healthy breakfast included ,the environment are newly decorated. The stuff is very nice and very polite. The good thing here is that that you actually get free rental of boogyboards and towels and beach chairs. That location is only two blocks from the beach Waikiki Beach it's perfectly located take takes you around two minutes to get to the beach.

Hotel is in great location and close to transport & major attractions. Housekeeping was prompt when requested. Staff are very personable and friendly. Décor was tasteful and modern & clean - though the lounge/breakfast area has small tables not conducive to multiple plates/mugs during breakfast!

The hotel is nice and clean. The room is small and the bathroom is even smaller. We used the room mostly to sleep, shower, and get ready for our next activity, so it was suitable. The free continental breakfast includes fresh fruit (very sweet pineapples, melons, etc.) several pastries, bread, coffee, and pineapple juice. It isn't fancy but it is fine. You can see the beach from the hotel - it is about 3 short blocks away. Beach towels, bamboo mats, chairs, inner tubes, and boogie boards can all be checked out to take to the beach. A comfort room is available for reservation for one hour on the day you check out if you want to freshen up later in the day (make your reservation the day before you check out). Lots of restaurants are within easy walking distance - all types of cuisines, prices, and service styles. The bus stop is right next to the front door which makes it easy to get around the island (downtown, Chinatown, Ala Moana shopping center, or even Pearl Harbor). The staff is very friendly and responsive.

We definitely enjoyed our stay at Vive hotel while visiting Oahu. We appreciated the variety of fruit and delicious muffins served with the continental breakfast each day, as well as the beautifully decorated lobby with such a neat variety of chairs, couches , and tables to sit and eat at. As I sipped my coffee and ate my morning croissant I couldn't help but enjoy the soft tones of modern music as I took in the unique and tasteful decorations that are throughout the lobby. Our bed was soooo comfortable with fluffy white silky soft sheets and duvet. Divine! Small room but plenty of space for two people with everything you need. Only drawback, we didn't have a balcony but it wasn't a big deal since we spent minimal time in the room. The beach towels and mats at the front door were also greatly appreciated .

It's refreshing in a a tourist-magnet area like Waikiki beach to find a hotel that does exactly what they set out to do: no unpleasant surprises or hidden fees and a top-notch staff.Located two short blocks from the beach, Vive is aggressively priced: the location is still very convenient and you don't have quite as many drunks stumbling around outside at night. The bus stops almost right outside the hotel, and the 'ocean view' rooms offer good views even with other hotels between Vive and the ocean.Every hotel room in Honolulu is small, and Vive is no different. For two people, the Queen bed was just fine and we didn't feel cramped. Our only complaint was that we wished there'd been one more elevator to serve the 22 floors!The staff are the best part. The hotel's systems are such that you don't get long lines of guests forming at the front desk. We got several great recommendations from Christopher and appreciated not only the courtesy but the efficiency - no time wasted on trying to sell you anything (though they're happy to arrange tours, of course) and when we needed to replace a couple of items lost on the way here, they pointed us in the right direction.Free + easy use of beach gear was a nice perk, too.Vive clearly wants your business and is willing to work for it.

the rooms are pretty small and there's not a lot of storage space and no iron for your clothes.We loved the location and the lobby is very nice. there's also no ice machines or snack machines, you have to ask the front desk for ice.

We had a fantastic stay at Vive on our recent trip to Hawaii.The staff were excellent, very friendly and helpful. Our flight home got cancelled and they promptly organized another nights accomodation. The hotel is in a very handy location for walking into waikiki to the beach or shops also a two minute walk to the bus stop and the trolley stop.The rooms were very clean and had everything in them that you need fora comfortable stay. We will definately stay there again and would highly recommend vive to anyone visiting Hawaii

From the moment we arrived the team were super friendly and helpful. Michael and Chris on the front desk were fantastic, and couldn't help enough.The morning breakfast was just right, with plenty of fresh fruit which was a nice change from most of the food we ate during our holiday!!The room was great. Everything we needed including a beautiful view of the ocean from our upgraded Junior Suite on the 14th floor.We will definitely be back again soon!

Travelling to Hawaii for a wedding I needed somewhere to stay that was centrally located in Waikiki and affordable and found Vive hotel fitted the bill. The Aussie dollar was in a bad way and I always prefer to spend on eating and attractions. Rooms were small but spotless and the staff were great. Breakfast was a bonus and wifi free. Bus was right at the front door and the beach was only 2 blocks away. My only complaint was a noisy air conditioner in my room. All in all, Vive is a great little hotel!

beutiful hotel, new, clean , best location, very freindly stuff , great value for the money. Couldn't ask for more! the hotel is near everything. 1 street from the sea, 1 minute walk, restaurants are everywhere

Staff esp Chris- Amazing! Close to beach, shops, resturants! Unexpected room upgrade- bonus and thoughtful for our anni! Courtesy room on check out day- great to freshen up before flight! Towels, mats and chairs provided! Will return soon and highly recommend to others!

If you are looking for a less expensive hotel with a good location, this hotel is a good option. It is in the middle of the strip and only 2 blocks from the beach. They also provide continential breakfast, beach chairs, and boogie boards.

Very friendly and helpful staff, clean rooms, everything good. Valet parking is 25$ ( I knew about that). Not the biggest choice on breakfast but it was ok. We enjoyed it and would choose Vive again!Aloha

Although we were warned the rooms were small, we did not expect how small they actually were. The continental breakfast was very basic, with no cold meats, cheese, cold boiled eggs, etc. The 4 fruits were of poor quality and the pastries boring.

My only issue would be with the complimentary breakfast. No protein of any sort. All rolls, donuts and fruit. Room was huge, clean and in good condition. The front desk attendants were more than helpful and made us feel welcome.

Small room with tiny washroom, mattress was too soft which made me having back pain, but general, I enjoyed our stay there, all the staff were really friendly and helpful; location is awesome, 3 minutes to Waikiki Beach; the breakfast was okay, it would be perfect if there were a lot more varieties; we really like the valet parking service.

This is a very good priced hotel for what you get. Clean and modern looking establishment, albeit rooms are a bit small but you are only using the room to sleep anyway :)Front desk staff was almost friendly and helpful.$25/day for valet parking but you can take the car in and out multiple times during the day, and from what we saw this was pretty standard for the area.They have free continental breakfast! Not many hotels offered this when we looked around. It's just nice to have something to nibble on and some juice to sip before you head out for the day :)I was surprised that they offer free beach wear-- so beach towels and little seats you can sit on (not very sturdy but easy to travel with), Definitely a nice perk.Best part is the location! As it is less than 5 minutes away from Waikikki Beach boardwalk, and other establishments so you are definitely getting the best bang for your buck in terms of convenience.Will be having a wedding in Honolulu, so will be recommending this place to my family and friends.. and likely we will book at least a few days here as well :)

Pros: Attentive, knowledgable, friendly staff. And I'm speaking of each member from Front desk, to house keeping, to valet etc. Free continental breakfast, free wifi, no resort fees, free beach gear, super convenient location, modern lookingCons: There's really no cons, except for maybe size of regular rooms, but you're barely in there anyways, and maybe valet only parking (no self parking)

I reserved a Queen room with an ocean view and stayed for 5 days and 4 nights. Unfortunately, the view I got were 2 other hotels that were blocking my ocean view. However, I did not go to Hawaii to have a good view from my hotel. Not much time was spent at the hotel, but for the short time my wife and I actually did spend there was not too bad. A tablet awaited us in our room where we were able to request all the services that the Vive offers, from extra pillows to an airport shuttle. Continental breakfast was from 7am-930am, which we were able to catch every morning, because we were always up before 6am. We were literally at the Vive for the shower and resting for all the activities we had planned and booked. The Vive is in a location that has everything available in walking distances and the beach was only 1 block away. Lastly, the staff we did get to speak with were all friendly and welcoming. My only negative about my stay was my view. I paid for an ocean view which I did not receive.

Stayed for 8 nights with no complaints. All staff very friendly and helpful. The hotel supplied towels, beach chairs and mats which was great. Breakfast was included which was fresh fruit, pastries juice and coffee which there was plenty of and was enough for us if you wanted more plenty of shops close by. Bus stop close by which was great and a couple minutes walk to the beach. Only issue AC was really loud. Overall spent a great week and would stay their again.

So glad we picked this hotel. It was exactly what we needed and brilliant value. The rooms are small but very modern, neat and clean. The common amenities are beautiful and the breakfast was fantastic. Only gripe was the room fridge which, as I was told by staff, isn't designed to keep things cold. Go figure! However staff were more than happy to quickly deliver ice on demand for the room's ice bucket so it wasn't a big deal in the end. I'd definitely stay here again and I highly recommend.

Hotel was well located to all sites of Waikiki. The Queen room was too small especially the bathroom. Should have gone with the King. The concierge was very good but perhaps should start earlier as there was always people waiting for assistance.

Upon arrival, This cute boutique hotel had a lovely looking street appeal. All the staff was extremely friendly. We arrived on a late flight and had to leave early hours of the morning. Whenever we needed anything, the staff were super accommodating. There were many reviews indicating the limited breakfast options with just pastry and fruit which may put some people off however there are plenty of shops and cafés nearby. The fresh fruit, coffee and pastries were enough for us.The use of beach towels and mats was great expecially given the two minute walk to the amazing beach. The AC unit in our room was a bit noisy but after a while you get used to it.Definitely would still recommend this cute modern looking hotel to anyone visiting Honolulu if you're looking for a reasonable priced boutique hotel in a fantastic location!
user_name:
detanra m
North Yorkshire, United Kingdom

review_body: Exceptional staff with clean and comfortable rooms. Location is great for access to the beach, shopping, food, and transportation. If you are going to spend a lot of time in your room while in Hawaii (why would you do that?) then this might not be the best place for you. However,if you are looking for a clean, comfortable, relaxing place to stay after spending the day exploring all the beauty Oahu has to offer, you'll be hard pressed to find a better place with such a great value.

The location can't be beat, the breakfast is free, and there is all-day coffee/tea/water in the lobby. The rooms have mini-fridges, which is always a win for me! The shower gets very warm without scalding, which I loved since I'm a hot-shower kind of person (most hotels cap the temperature at sort of a medium-warmish; not Vive!). The rooms are also equipped with tablets that provide information instead of the usual hotel room binder, which I found very cool. Staff was excellent as well without giving off an intrusive vibe.You can get towels and a couple of other beach essentials for free to borrow from the front desk, so no need to bring your own beach towels.The high speed internet is actually high-speed. The wifi works very well, which was an extreme plus for us, a pair of software engineers.Despite all of these upgrades, the facility is a little dated (like most places in Waikiki) and there were a couple little odd things about the room. The electronic room key card reader usually took anywhere from 5 to 15 tries before it would read the card, which was frustrating. The bathroom had very little sink storage space - my toothbrush fell on the ground at least once.Overall, a very, very nice stay at Vive. Would definitely stay here again if I have the chance to make it back to Honolulu!

Wonderful staff; clean and comfortable room. No resort fees a real plus. Location good for access to beach as well as public and tour transportation. Very enjoyable stay. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

The location of this hotel just made up for the tiny room (comparable to Tokyo sizes!!) with no balcony or pool. Clean and friendly though, so if you don't intend to spend much time in your hotel it's fine. breakfast isn't great and other than fruit all unhealthy pastries, so that lets it down a little too. Location really is its draw card.

Stayed for three nights. Nice clean room and awesome service! Breakfast was included so that was great. They also provided free beach towels, beach mats and chairs, and boogie boards. Beaches, restaurants and main shopping area are within walking distance. The room is a bit small but the location made up for it. the Overall, a positive experience.

Excellent staff with daily continental breakfast. Rooms are compact, tastefully decorated and clean. No resort fees was a plus despite the generous amenities offered. Location is iffy at night but is two blocks. Miss the international market food court.

The hotel was so much better than we expected, we were greet by a lovely concierge who gave us cold towels and fresh pineapple juice on check in. We were upgraded for free to a oceanview room, which was great, the hotel is clean, breakfast fresh, easy walking distance to all the main restaurants and beach!! and the best thing was no hotel fee!!!

The foyer and service were a good start but the suite was showing its age. We did not feel it was value for money even with the continental breakfast included. The street noise woke us at 5.15am the two mornings we stayed there so Maybe a room at the back would be better. It is in a good location, just 2 blocks from Waikiki beach and within walking distance to high stores and restaurants. The staff were very professional.

Staff polide, nice and clean room, wifi fast and everywhere in the hotel. Air conditioned too noisy, free breakfast poor and not a good view from our room. Easy and fast acces to Waikiki beach which is perfect. Really comfortable bed and the lobby level really nice. Parking too expansive! (25$ per day)

On our last trip to Honolulu we stayed at the Vive Hotel for seven nights. We found the staff very friendly and efficient. The bed was comfortable and the hotel is only two blocks from Waikiki beach. Breakfast was adequate and the wifi worked great. The hotel does not charge a resort fee and we found it excellent value.

We stayed for 3 nights and were given an upgrade to the junior suite-it was amazing! We had views of the beach (which was so close), huge bed, massive shower and modern touches like a bedside touchpad that gave you access to spotify, netflix and the internet.We also loved the polite and attentive staff, the location, the free breakfast, the valet parking, the two air conditioners, big tv with cable channels and the free beach towels/mats. We have stayed in Waikiki several times in the past, this was our first time at the Vive and we will definitely be coming back to this hotel and would not hesitate recommending it to our friends and other travellers looking to make the most of their stay in Hawaii. It is great value for money and a gem!

We were fortunate enough to stay in the penthouse and enjoyed the comfort of the sitting areas and 2 TV's, the abundant space, the views and the kitchen. The staff was friendly and helpful. They provided beach chairs, boogie boards and towels. Vive is a short 2 block walk to the beach. There are plenty of restaurants and shopping nearby and the concierge was very helpful with planning our activities. My husband has some mobility issues and the concierge arranged for a mobility scooter to be delivered before we arrived.

Enjoyed our stay greatly at Vive. Good location, very friendly and helpful staff, great and clean rooms. Concierge was helpful, check-in was very nice (cold, damp towels and a refreshing drink was a nice touch), room furniture was of a good quality and the room service was thorough and cleaned nicely. Only single letdown was the breakfast, which was not very varied and was very heavy on carbs and sugar, though the fresh fruit was nice.

Great value for what the hotel has to offer. Great location - a block away fr the beach and close to a lot of good restaurants & shopping. Complimentary continental breakfast and all day tea/coffee service was very much appreciated! So were the towels, beach mats, chairs, etc. for the beach. Despite the small rooms, they were always clean and well maintained and staff is always helpful and friendly! Will definitely consider this hotel again in the future and will tell my friends and family about it. Great for the budget conscious traveler!

Complimentary breakfast in the lounge, short walk to the beach with beach gear ready to go. Perfect location for our stay. Only complaint was that the bathroom sink was shallow and didn't drain very well.

As we prefer smaller more personalised places to say we chose Vive Waikiki over a large chain hotel. What a great choice! One street back from Waikiki beach and Duke statue, we were close to everything. The hotel provides beach towels and mats and a quick 2 minutes to the beach lets you swim at this beautiful location. There is a bus stop taking you to Ala Moana mall right on your doorstep if shopping is your thing and the handy bus trolley lines that go all around the city are at the Duke statue. Breakfast is a laid back affair with a good selection of fruit and pastries until 9:30 in the foyer seated at a funky selection of comfy lounge chairs and sofas rather than traditional dining set ups. Iced water, tea and coffee is available 24 hours along with really friendly front office staff. The concierge is available everyday as well and they were great with transport tips and dining recommendations.There have been numerous comments as to the noisy air con and I do have to agree with that. A bonus however is the opening windows which allow fresh air in which Is pretty rare in most hotels. We had a great corner room (junior suites) with views straight down to the beach and it was really large which I wasn't expecting given previous reviews. The bathroom was excellent. (A makeup mirror would have been a great addition but that is just a really a very minor quibble ) Would recommend Vive to anyone visiting Waikiki

Really friendly and helpful staff, the hotel is in a great location.Roomeas lovely with a comfy bed, great breakfast and handy check out room available to freshen up on the last day. All you can ask for really

Enjoyed our stay at Vive. Great location with friendly staff. Loved the breakfasts in the Living Room as well as the all-day coffee and cool drinks available. We would choose this hotel if we returned to Waikiki.

A one minute walk and you are at Waikiki Beach stading next to the Statue of Duke! Plenty of food/drink spots and evenening walks. The hotel supplies your towels/chair/floaties...The lobby was a great spot to sit for a cup of tea, always available.

Enjoyed very much staying in your hotel. Whenever back in Honolulu we'll contact you again. Staff was very nice and friendly all the time. Reception was very helpful and also the girls on the concierge desk. So please keep going like this. Thank you all to have made the stay so enjoyable.

What a great place to stay. I am a hotel manager who came here to attend a conference with 2500 other managers. I am so impressed with the staff. Upon arrival, you are greeted warmly and offered fresh juice and cool towels to refresh. Lobby is pristine and has awesome décor. Room was clean, inviting, quiet and I slept well. Cannot wait to come back. Thank you Beverly, Sahara and the bellman who all are priceless. The tablet in the room with my name welcoming me was great to use to order a cab and delivery service. Great touch.

Friendly warm welcome, with fresh pineapple juice and a refreshing towel. Staff are excellent. short walk to the beach. safe location.Room was clean but the bed was not comfortable. Air con available but drips all night.

The staff was wonderful and very helpful. Never felt like i was inconveniencing anyone. Able to book tours easily and quickly. Close to the water and nightlife. I would recomend this hotel based on amenities and price. Decent breakfast. Only complaint is that we spent a lot of time in lobby with freinds drinking and partying while listening to the worst background music ever. The manager needs to change it.

Great location, well-equipped room, friendly staffs. If you are looking for the hotel for some quality time by yourself or family vacation in Waikiki, Vive will be the perfect choice for you. I will definitely come back to Vive if I revisit Ohau island.

room condition needs to be improved. (Airconditioner, beds and soundproof facilities...)But good value for money anywaysStaffs are friendly and the location is perfect. Satisfied Other than a room condition

Lovely hotel, friendly, helpful staff. They even arranged for a mobility scooter to be delivered for my husband. Location is close enough to the beach (2-3 blocks) to be convenient and far enough away to be quiet. They provided beach chairs and towels.

No point to pay for $20-40 daily resort fee and stay at those gigantic and outdated hotels. Vive is a true boutique, refreshing, friendly, updated and has one of the best locations. I really enjoyed my stay and I will stay at Vive if I come back to Waikiki.

Very clean and modern, staff is awesome.Hotel Is located perfect for beach and shopI read one of the reviews and complain about the air condition. It is not that cold but it was perfect for us.If we go back will definetly stay here again

If your planning on spending all day out at the beach or touring the islands and want to try the local resturants every night then the Vive is the hotel to stay at. There's no pool or restuarant. Breakfast is in the foyer lounge (they say it's continental breakfast but there's no cereal) so you get to juggle your plate and coffee as there's no tables.the rooms are small but clean. There is a small bar fridge to keep water in but are not designed to keep perishables so if your plan is to buy sandwhiches at the local ABC shop and keep them for lunches think again. The staff are friendly and helpful and you can borrow a range of items for the beach including towels mays chairs and inflatables. Overall a good place to stay at a good price and minutes from the beach!

The room was very clean, a bit small but it is such a great location for a good price so you can't really expect them to be much bigger. The AC is a bit loud but they work well. Breakfast is basic but gets the job done. I would definitely stay there again.

Great service overall, $25 valet parking (unlimited entries though) were very handy specially if you have a baby travelling with you. For the heat sake don't border looking for a parking that's 2 blocks away it would simply ruin your trip.Breakfast is average but complimentary, I enjoyed the unlimited Hawaiian coffee and the iced water.Room was small but clean, aircon (non built-in) was not that noisy (baby could sleep through whole night).access card room entry require 'special skills' (in average it took 5 attempts before getting in successfully).our room was not facing the main road and we were glad that we made the right choice.

All staffs are kind and awsome. Location is perfect and room is really cleaned always.And VIVE rent the ocean towels & board for swimmingAlso there's Korean TV channels.if i go to Hawaii again, i will stay there.
user_name:
tae wan k
Incheon, South Korea

review_body: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on our recent trip to Oahu for our 20th anniversary. We were very happy overall with our stay. On arrival we were greeted warmly and provided with a cool face cloth and a glass of juice. Check-in was smooth and efficient and as we had arrived before check in time, and our room not quite ready, there was no trouble leaving bags with them whilst we went and had a walk and drink for an hour.The room is compact, but I knew that, but was perfectly adequate considering we didn't spend much time there. Some more hanging space would be nice and some drawer space too, as most of our things had to just stay in the suitcase. There is a notice in the room stating that to save the environment, only the towels left on the floor would be changed, so I was very conscious of hanging our towels up each morning as didn't feel that they needed changing every day, but each day we would come back and they had been changed regardless. Not really a complaint more a frustration.We only used the free breakfast a couple of days as we had early tour starts a couple of times and also went out for breakfast, but it was adequate enough to get you going for the day with fresh fruit, pastries, bread for toast and tea/coffee/juice.It was a great price, with free wifi, free tea/coffee/water available all day and free use of beach towels/chairs/boogie boards without the resort fees that other hotels charge.As long as you are happy to have no outside space (ie; balcony or pool) then its a great choice and great value for money. The beach is only a couple of minutes walk away so easy enough to relax there instead of a pool.We had an ocean view room, and were happy with the view considering that it is a couple of roads back from the beach front.Definitely worth considering and comparing with other hotels.

A very clean and modern hotel with great and dedicated staff who made our stay a very good experience. We would return again. We were particularly impressed with KC the concierge. She is very friendly and good at helping guests figure out what is best for their own particular needs during their stay on Oahu.

This hotel was located ideally for the beach and shops in Waikiki. The hotel offers beach towels, chairs, boogie boards etc to take down the beach free of charge! Great service and very welcoming staff always saying hello when entering the hotel.

first time Waikiki visitors, enjoyed staying at a boutique hotel instead of a large hotel, felt like we were staying at someone's home. Breakfast was enjoyable but would have liked more variety for example yogurt or oatmeal. We know our room was small but why would we spend time in a room when we're in Waikiki? A balcony would have been nice too.

Great hotel, super friendly and helpful staff. The beach view wasn't as good as I'd hoped as there was a huge multi level hotel directly in front of our window and we were on the 19th floor. But the location to the beach, the main street and the bus was perfect! I would definitely recommend staying at Vive.

This hotel was beautiful. Staff was exceptional. The location was great (three small blocks from the beach) but the views from the rooms are absolutely horrible. I paid $800 extra for an ocean view and when i got to my hotel room i could barely see it because of all the other hotels in front of it. I was very upset. Rooms are rather small but my room was fine. Breakfast is very small and usually end very early. Staff was exceptional. NOT A CHILDREN FRIENDLY HOTEL. The hotel management would rather not have a family with kids in the hotel keep in mind when booking this hotel!

Stayed at the Vive for 5 nights on our honeymoon. Cannot fault this hotel! Excellent location, close to everything! Small rooms but we knew that before we went, room still had everything we needed. Provided beach towels, mats etc and even an umbrella when it rained one night. Free breakfast every morning was a bonus. The courtesy room was a nice touch, especially if you have a later flight. Would definately stay again!

This is a great boutique hotel in Waikiki. We picked this one not only because of the price, but also the location and great reviews on internet. We feel welcome during our stay. Friendly staff, great location, and excellent customer service. We'll definitely go back again.
