We booked this hotel after reading the reviews and looking at the pictures. PROS:*The location is close to the beach. *The hotel is clean. *There are free beach mats and towels *spam musubi is directly across the street!*staff are wonderful, helpful, polite*free wifiCONS:* the studio room is much smaller than the picture represents. You open the door to the hotel room right into the bed in some cases. For two average sized persons with north american sensibilities you will find it tight. For those used to some smaller rooms like Tokyo or some places in Europe it will be no issue. *the walls are thin (noisy)*air conditioner is a single unit in the windowI think for the price the hotel is good value. For us we booked another hotel the next night with no difficulty cancelling from the staff. We did this because there were no larger rooms available.

Staff were amazing so helpful and always friendly. We stayed for 11 nights and the room was quite small for a long stay but the location was great. The bed was super comfy. Downside was no belcony.....

Excellent hotel. Perfect location with the bus stops, beaches and shops a short distance from the hotel. Rooms are on the small side, but the room had all the facilities we needed. Rooms were very clean and serviced daily. Breakfast was good with fruit, bread and pastries available. Tea and coffee available 24/7 in the lounge area. Highly recommend this hotel. Thanks Vive for a great experience on our first trip to Honolulu.

Great location - very close to the Duke's statue in Waikiki beach which is a central point of the area. It's not a resort, so no fees, which is great because if you're after a pool then you might rather visit Waikiki beach and the Pacific Ocean! You can borrow beach mats, towels, mini boogie boards and umbrellas from the front desk for free. Breakfast is included (croissants, pastries, toast, fruit, coffee and tea) and there's free WiFi. You can schedule your room cleaning through an in-room iPad. Would definitely recommend this hotel and stay here again. The only downside is the clunky looking air-conditioning, but hey it works! And you want an air-conditioner that works on days when it hits over 30*C .. which is basically everyday.

Could not fault the service, would definitely stay here again. Close to the main beach and public transport. Not too many people and not a resort with extra fees. We were given a room upgrade on checking in without requesting it.

What a wonderful gem the Vive is! From the very second we arrived and were greeted with a fresh glass of cool pineapple juice and cool hand towels to refresh our face and hands with every minute was delightful! The front desk personnel we chatted with...Chris, Judy and Ryann....were knowledgeable and so friendly! You walk out the front doors, cross the street and walk down two blocks and you are on the sand at Waikiki beach. There are loads of ABC stores on every block which is where we would buy a couple of bottles of beer and keep them in the fridge in the room to enjoy while relaxing. The city bus route stops to the immediate right of this hotel and the front desk personnel will help you with maps/routes or have the concierge help you. There is a very nice, light continental breakfast offered of fresh fruit, coffee, tea, juice and assorted breads. An excellent library and an assortment of games are available in the comfortable sitting area which looks out over a lovely water garden while soft contemporary music plays. The room was small, but we really did not care as we were always on the go and there was enough room to be comfortable. Robes are available for your use and you can purchase them if you want but I do not know what that price would be. Ask at the desk for towels, umbrellas, mats for the beach and they will set you right up. We would highly, highly recommend this wonderful hotel and we absolutely will be certain to stay here our next return to paradise.

Cannot fault Vive hotel, wonderful experience. Will definitely stay there again. Staff are fabulous, well trained and very polite. Welcome drink and hand towel.was unexpected and delightful. Thank you.

This was our first time visit to Honolulu. When we arrived at the hotel the desk people were very courteous and helpful. The breakfast was amazing with lots of fruits choices and other things. The coffee and ice water was available 24 hours. In overall the stay in the hotel was excellent. The room was clean and services was excellent.

After a long flight and Speedy Shuttle ride we arrived at our accomodation in Honolulu . Vive Hotel looks great but the people make it special. From the lovely welcome Michael gave us (fresh cool washers and pinapple juice) and the insightful, friendly advice and help KC gave us, we have had the best start to our holiday. Well done.

We stayed here for 7 nights in September. The room was quite small but we were out most of the time so it didn't matter. The bed was comfortable, the staff were friendly and they provide beach towels for free at reception which is useful. The bathroom was a little bit run down but we did book through wotif so we probably had one of the lesser rooms. We would definitely stay here again.

This was my first stay at Vive Hotel Waikiki and it was wonderful. The staff are first class and the service was exceptional. The customer service cannot be faulted, rooms very modern and clean. Great location also. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and will stay there again on my return.

Came for our 10 year wedding anniversary. The staff chose to upgrade our suite choice and was so accommodating. It it is a great location, priced reasonably and the valet and front desk staff were amazing. Had a great time, thanks!

A beautiful young lady at the front desk was so helpful. We arrived at the hotel about 6:30am. She found a room for us and checked us in right away. We were so happy to have a room to rest after a long trip. Her service was excellent.

We arrived fairly late in the evening after a flight from Vancouver. Our Junior Suite, with king bed on the 12th floor was extremely spacious, neat and tidy. The staff at check in were polite and helpful. The following morning we looked out of our corner window to a perfect view down the street to Waikiki Beach just over one block away, with the waves breaking, umbrellas out, and the palm trees swaying gently in the breeze. The included continental breakfast in the trendy open dining section on the ground floor was more than adequate. Tea and coffee making facilities were also available all day in this area. The hotel also provided beach towels etc to take to the beach. Would certainly recommend this affordable, conveniently located, boutique hotel for anyone visiting Waikiki, Honolulu.

We stayed at Vive 3 nights before our cruise. The staff was very nice. The rooms were kept very clean. Housekeeping did and excellent job. Also the staff provided a very nice continental breakfast and kept all areas very clean.I would stay again but I do hope they replace the noisy air conditioners. They also provide towels, mats etc. for the beach. Thank you to all staff at Vive.

We booked for six nights. We were greeted with cold towels and pineapple juice on arrival and friendly staff who organised a very early check in for us after a long flight. The rooms are small but clean. We were on the 11th floor and had glimpses of the beach. The only down side for us was the street noise which was masked by the sound of the air conditioner. The air conditioner was very noisy. The hotel is located a short distance from the beach (about two blocks). The bus stop is only a few metres from the door which made getting around easy. Breakfast whilst basic (bread, pastries and fruit) was included. We also had access to free wifi which was reliable and a reasonable speed. I would be happy to return. Loved the foyer - a bit eclectic and very unique.

We chose this hotel because of the Trip Advisor ratings from previous visitors.We arrived at about 10.30am after a 11 hour flight from Melbourne and first up was offered a cold towel and drink of pineapple juice. What's more, our room was ready and throughout our stay, the staff proved to be very professional, friendly and helpful. If you don't want swimming pools and hot tubs, you couldn't stay at a better place the the Vive.

the room was modern and clean, the staff were friendly and very helpful. The hotel was located very close to the beach and restaurants whilst being in a location that was not too busy. definitely recommend this place!

I am still congratulating myself for chocosing this hotel. Location ist just perfect. Service provided was excellent. Breakfast área si different; it is located in the living room. Tons of fresh fruit during breakfast. Room is ok; not big at all; but it was very well informed in advanced. Beach towels and other items are provided for enjoying Waikiki Beach that it is located just two blocks away. Good restaurants are nearby.

Enjoyed all that was provided here. Friendly staff and great service from everyone. Highly recomended. Will stay here again next time I we visit. Central to most things we did. Enjoyed our time there.

I think I really regard my decision to book Vive based on TA reviews as one of my great decisions when staying in Waikiki. We were on the 27th floor on had a great view of the water. Clean rooms, with friendly staff and strong room wifi. Yes the rooms are a tad on the smaller side, but we tended to be out at the beach or driving around the island. The beds were comfortable and it was well serviced. The negative in most reviews was the loud air conditioning: It didn't bother me, slept like a trooper, in fact a find the distant hum quiet therapeutic! There's an individual air conditioning unit to every room and it's there when you walk in. Rather have one than not. Highly recommend. Two minutes from the beach. Towels and mats supplied. You can't go wrong - highly recommended, would definitely go back. When I consider some of the beach fronting resorts are now charging $600-$700 US a night, I'd rather spend the money on fine restaurants etc thanks.

Hotel small but clean.Junior suite was comfortable however air conditioner extremely noisy. Bathroom requires an extendable mirror to allow for applying makeup without having to saddle the vanity to see yourself.Over charged for additional bottles of water which was discussed at check out and rectified however credit card charged days later for water we did not purchase which is disappointing.Overall hotel and rooms nice but lacking in amentities such as gym/fitness centre.

Greeted by staff with a cold juice and towels, location was great a few minutes walk to beaches shopping and tour collection points. The complimentary breakfast was perfect to get the day started and having coffee available at times was a bonus. The room was small but clean, the only downer was the air conditioning was loud. Would definitely stay again!

Just a couple blocks from the beach. Staff was very friendly! The vibe there was very laid back and modern!! Rooms and lobby very clean! Loved the complimentary beach towels, mats and boogie boards! Also the Concierge service was a great amenity! Loved staying there!!

We really enjoyed our 5 night stay at the Vive. The room was a little small for 2 friends to share but would be find for a couple. The hotel provides a free breakfast with continuous tea, coffee and iced water, and free beach towels & chairs. The staff are awesome, nothing was too much trouble. They even provided wine glasses so we could toast my friend's 40th birthday. The best thing is the location, one block from Waikiki Beach and a bus stop right outside. I will definitely stay here again.

Lots of favourable reviews here from one hit wonders but I can safely add my thumbs-up vote as well and I've stayed in lots of hotels both for business and leisure.Warm welcome on arrival, and throughout the stay the front desk folks were very personable and helpful. The breakfast buffet is fine (and free) with lots of fresh fruit and baked goods but no protein. Even a selection of yoghurt or cheeses would help round out the buffet. But the 'living room' free-style seating is a great concept.Our room was a 20th floor junior suite with views (with other high-rises of course) of Diamond Head and the ocean. The junior suite is a good deal and gets around the complaints of small space in the room and bathroom.I would happily make a return visit here.

Everything about this hotel was awesome. The highlight would have to be the fantastic customer service; very friendly and very helpful staff. Also, the amenities; complimentary breakfast, coffee's through the day and bodyboard/umbrella hire. We also had a late flight on the day of our checkout so they held our bags and then let us use a room later in the afternoon to freshen up so that we could enjoy our last day in Waikiki comfortably! Highly recommend!

The Vive hotel was located in an ideal location. Close to all the shopping and restaurants; two short blocks from the beach. The hotel staff was very accommodatingand we thought the convenience of having, towels, chairs, etc. for the beach was great. Umbrellas were also available for the guests if needed. Rooms were small and AC's a little noisy.

Vive was a lovely, beautiful, intimate surprise in Waikiki. Conviently located up the road from The Duke's statute on Waikiki beach.Rooms were modern and clean. Close to buses which goes to Pearl Harbour, International Airport, Ala Moana, Waikele and more, just outside the door. Staff were the best. Friendly in the 'Aloha' spirit of Hawaii. I'll be back!

While definitely giving off a minimalist Japanese efficiency vibe, everything was clean and crisp and in perfect working order. Loved the complimentary beach towels, mats, and boogie boards (though mine was broken). And the bag check with a complimentary courtesy room for an hour is also a great amenity.

When I first arrived at the check-in counter after a long journey and some (slight) shock at how humid and warm it was even at 10pm at night, I was greeted with cold towels and a glass of pineapple juice! Very unexpected (I have very little hotel or resort-staying experience) and very pleasant because they knew exactly what I needed without even asking me!I booked the Cosmopolitan Queen suite, and although it's definitely not the most spacious or the most well decorated compared to the other suites, at the end of the day I was vacationing on a budget and I really only spent part of my morning and late evening in the room when I needed to crash. The compact size of the room meant it was quicker to air condition and I didn't have to worry as much about packing for my return trip because there were less areas to clean and double-check that I hadn't left anything behind.The hotel was modern enough to include a small android tablet to request room service, browse the web, and other things like check the weather, etc. And there was free wi-fi, and the wi-fi was actually pretty fast for a hotel! They also had free beach towels, mats, and boogie boards to use at the beach (very handy as I didn't have to pack that in my carry-on), and even a bottle opener and HDMI cable available upon request. The TV was a decent size. What would have really added to the experience would be some sort of sound system in the room (i.e. bluetooth speaker) or a music playlist loaded with Hawaiian music. We would have also greatly appreciated some artwork on the walls or some added visual zest/character like the other rooms clearly possess (maybe a fresh flower for the room?). This one was pretty bare in comparison, but very neat and compact.The one downside of the room was that the AC unit could get loud, and every now and then there would be too much condensation and I'd hear rain droplets from the AC unit from the floor above hitting my room's unit/window. Imagine thinking it's pouring outside when it's actually really sunny. The fridge was also very small, and not that cold, and not big enough to save many left-over meals or store-bought drinks in there.What made up for the negatives was the fact free breakfast was offered from 7-9:30am every day, in a lobby that was nicely decorated and enjoyable to lounge in. The front staff and valet were very friendly and helpful, and housekeeping was prompt at refreshing toiletries. Also, it was a 5-minute walk from the beach!

This hotel is in a great location just a few blocks from the beach, shops and resturants. Rooms are small but as we did n't spend much time there it was fine for us. Wardrobs are small but beds have drawers on the bottom of the base.Hot tea , coffee and cold water is always available in take away cups with lids,from the lobby. We got in very early and were lucky our room was ready for us before normal check in, so nice after such a long flight. We also were able to have a courtesy room for one hr in the afternoon after we checked out so we could freshen up before our late night flight .  We would be happy to stay there again.

My room and housekeeper were terrible but the rest of the hotel seemed good. I think I got the worst room in the place and had a housekeeper that only did the bare minimum (even after I tipped the first two nights).

A one night stay on my way to New York and it was great. Probably could have found a cheaper way to get there from the international airport, cost me $40, but journey was not too long. Hotel is very clean and fresh. Lobby area is welcoming with a great lounge area for sitting. Room is compact, ideal for the solo traveller, very clean , modern fittings and the most comfortable bed and pillows. Free wifi , big TV. Located a short 2 block walk from Waikiki Beach. Area felt quite safe to walk around on my own . Highly recommend!!

The AC is quite loud in the room, which are a tad small, and the windows don't open and there's no balcony. But the location is excellent, the staff helpful, the hotel clean, and the value for the money is great

Our stay was very satisfying. The location, staff, room, service, and more importantly the price of this trip was great. When we checked-in, our room was quite smaller than what we saw in the hotel's website; however staff was very helpful and with a small amount of fee, they upgraded it to a much larger room. We stayed at Vive Hotel Waikiki for 6 nights and I highly recommend this hotel.

Centrally located, close to Waikiki beach (Duke statue). Free Wifi and continental breakfast. Pastries, fresh fruit and fruit juice. 24 hour ice water plain and with lemon, 24 hour hot coffee incl decaf and a variety of tea bags. Help yourself in the lounge. Excellent customer service, of note KC the concierge and Chris at reception. We arrived close to midnight after a long flight and Chris welcomed us with cold fruit juice. He was full of the Aloha spirit at that late hour. Just what you need after the ordeal we encountered at the airport. KC was helpful in recommending and booking activities, transport and tickets to American Football, Hawaii v Colorado. KC has a bright coloured mohawk. Gotta love a hotel that embraces diversity. Everyone we encountered at Vive Hotel was friendly. I would stay here again without hesitation. You meet lots of different people in the lounge area and that was a highlight. The place lends itself to socialising if you choose.The bus stops outside, pick up location for tours varies so check and double check. Most leave from Koa St outside the back of Hyatt Regency, about a 3 minute walk. Do Not J-walk, it's a $140 fine. You must cross at the marked cross walk at the signal. Activities and most tours start early in the morning especially anything to do with the sea as that's when it is calm. If this is your first visit to Hawaii, take a circle island tour as Oahu is large. You will see the different parts of the island so you can return later at your leisure. Traffic is heavy, take that into account when going anywhere eg. 1.5 hours travel to the Polynesian Cultural Center. Maholo Vive!

Vive makes you feel like you are staying at one of the more expensive hotels near Waikiki but not paying nearly as much. One of the only hotels we could find that has free continental breakfast in the area. The free checkout of beach gear was amazing. Any time you needed it staff was there to get you beach chairs, beach towels, or even a boogie board. Probably other things too but those were just the few we used. Also the first time I have ever been to a hotel that has a tablet in the room for you to use the internet as well as request services on such as new sheets or toiletries and even to have your rental car brought down for you so as soon as you get the the valet desk your car is there. Forget paying lots for a fancy name hotel, Vive has everything and more at a much friendlier price and still only 3 blocks straight off the beach. I will Definately stay here next time.

The room I had was very very all but usable. Unless you are very small it is hard to wash your face due to lack of shoulder space. Staff very friendly and breakfast is acceptable. Ice only in the first floor and staff needs to get it for you. Room acceptable for short business stay

Was very satisfied with my stay. Price is reasonable for hotels in Waikiki area. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. They offer a full continental breakfast that comprised of coffee, fruits, and pastries. Strongly recommend to couple needing a place to stay in Honolulu.

Hotel is in an awesome location. We were more than happy to stay at Vive, which is literally a 2min walk to the beach. The hotel have beach mats and towels and even chairs and boogie boards if you get in early enough. The only gripe I would have is that the room aircon is a new box airconditioner. While it is cold, it can be a little noisy. Breakfast also had lots of pastries and fresh fruits.

Is a fancy hotel, boutique and the people is really nice. The price is no so cheap but is a good hotel. The breakfast is tasty. nothing more to say. I recomend this hotel. thank you very much and aloha

My wife and I celebrated our 25th year wedding anniversary from August 22nd to the 26th. We stayed at the Vive Hotel, and it was well worth it. Management left us a nice card, and a little box of chocolates. We really appreciated that. The lobby decor was beautiful, and welcoming. The complimentary coffee all day was a treat. They also give you complimentary fruits, and pastries from 7:00-9:30am. Also at check-in they welcome you with a glass of pineapple juice. All in all, the Vive Hotel was a win win. In close proximity to the beach, restaurants, and shops. Mahalo!
user_name:
thepr0ducer1
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed 2 nights in September 2015, the service was excellent, the staff is super nice and the rooms are clean and comfy.You can ask the reception for beach towls and walk 2 minutes to the ocean. Breakfast was OK, and there's free coffee all day in the lobby. We had a wonderful time and highly recommend this hotel!

Staff great,location great, better than some beach front hotels.good value. Good wi fi connection,nice surrounding foyer,fresh freight etc available for breakfast.Close to Waikiki, beach,all restaurant

Stayed 2 nights in August 2015. Not beach front but only 2 minute walk to the beach. Very modern lobby. Friendly staff. Room was a little on the small side but was very comfortable and had a good view of the beach from our window. Had a good view of Diamond Head from the area to the back of the elevator. Came with free breakfast and free WiFi and no resort fees which saved us additional cost. Continental breakfast included coffee, juices, pastries, fresh fruits, muffins, different breads, etc. Breakfast was really good. I especially enjoyed the fresh pineapple each morning. Would definitely stay here again.
After doing much research, Vive made me feel like a genius after my expectations were exceeded during my trip. The only issue was their hallways were not air conditioned. Everything else was perfect.

I am really happy with my 4 days stay at VIVE. the location is good, room is small but clean. free breakfast, 24 hours coffee and water, free towel, umbrella, beach chair are really helpful. I like VIVE more than those big hotels always have hundreds of customers in the lobby. you can get the help you need right away. plus the valet parking is 25 dollars a day only. the a/c is a little bit out of the time though.

Not the best hotel in Waikiki BUT definitely a good hotel. Your best bet is to get the suite. Otherwise, the standard rooms are very, very tiny (I peeped while one was getting cleaned).Pros- Great staff!- Clean- Walking distance from the beachCons- If you don't get the suite, teeny-tiny rooms- Airconditioning is loud and sometimes not enough to cool the room- If you can ADA compliant room, the bathroom has a strange set-up

We really enjoyed our stay. The lobby smells amazing and is zen like decorated. What we loved: great staff, they went above and beyond to please us, very clean, close to the beach, comfortable bed, amazing breakfast.All in all, we couldn't choose any better.

Stayed for six nights. Hotel is high quality and very affordable. In a central position in Waikiki. Room was air conditioned (which was great as the weather was very humid). Some great suggestions on what things to do while in Hawaii. Very friendly staff - always willing to assist with towels / boogie board for the beach. No pool - but that was not a priority for me. I would definitely stay again.

Great little boutique hotel. Would absolutely stay here again. Hotel is very modern. What it lacks in amenities it makes up for in service. Beds were very comfortable and rooms very clean. The continental breakfast every morning was a nice touch.

We LOVE this boutique hotel and make it our first choice. The concierge manager Jaqueline even went out of her way to get me breakfast when we came down to late for their danishes! We also love the bench on the 18th floor. Very comfortable place to take a break on the way to the room.

Good. Clean and nice. Especially the breakfast, but there were not enough tables to sit. However, the overall service and quality was good enough in a famous trip location. I will recommend this hotel to others.

My wife and I celebrated our 25th Wedding Anniversary at the Vive Hotel from 8/22-8/26. The staff was very friendly and kind to us (all of them). Management left us some Godiva chocolates, with a note, congratulating us. We appreciated that. The room was small, but comfortable and clean. We were out and about most of the time. The bed was also very comfortable. We were on the 11th floor and there was no noise. The only con was that there weren't any drawers to put our clothes away. The lobby was beautiful and the continental breakfast was good especially the coffee and fruits. Overall, it was a very good experience. Excellent value and we got what we paid for. We booked this hotel based on the excellent reviews. And they delivered.

Pros:1)Very friendly and helpful staff! 2) Great Location, very close to the heart of Waikiki, stores and restaurants 3) Cleaness 4) breakfast & coffee 24 hrs. 5) positive and modern vibe 6) wifi was goodCons:1) well, the AC at our room was a bit loud. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Thank you for great experience.
user_name:
Chi Yung C
Seoul, South Korea

review_body: Love Love Love the Vive Hotel Waikiki. From the moment of check in to the moment if check out I loved it. I was greeted at check in a smile and a fresh glass of pineapple juice. The clerks name was Trajan, he was very nice and helpful by providing info and a map of things to do and see. The decor of the hotel is breath taking. While very stylist it is very comfortable. The best ever continental breakfast is supplied every morning from 7:30 to 9:30 am. Fresh fruit, danish, raisin toast, coffee, fresh juice, there is always a meat provided each day. The room itself was small but very plush. The hotel maximize every inch of the space. Very clean and neat. The bed was so comfortable I did not want to leave the room. However, I pulled myself away from thus beautiful space so that I could see mire of the beautiful Island. Enjoyed my visit to Pearl Harbor. It was a mind blowing & soul stirring experience. Waikiki beach was so relaxing. The water was amazing. There are an unlimited amounts of shops and restaurants to visit and enjoy. I think the largest Ross Dress for Less is in Waikiki. Loved my trip to Hawaii. I will return soon & I will most definitely stay a Vive Hotel Waikiki.

Our stay at Vive Hotel was great! We weren't looking for an overpriced, grand hotel for our honeymoon since we were not planning on spending lot of our time in the hotel. The staff were very helpful and the rooms were pretty clean. The continental breakfast was good and I did enjoy the pineapple juice very much! The complimentary beach gear was extremely convenient with Waikiki being a couple blocks away. If I was going back to Hawaii I would definitely stay here again!

Picture a small Boutiques Hotel, fairly brand new with the following amenities -- You're in the center of Kuhio where all the restaurants and small food places are walking distance within 1 to 10minutes.- It's a couple of blocks walk to famous Waikiki Beach- They provide you chairs, towels and even umbrellas when it rains ( yes folks, it rained on our trip- They provide a breakfast bar with coffee, tea, juice, assorted tasty pastries, local fruits. They give you pink boxes to pack the food if you'd like to have breakfast in the park or the beach.- The front desk is always ready to answer your every inquiry and always have that welcoming smiles/greetings on their faces ( they look like they really love to work there ). They can call cabs or whatever private transportation you might have in mind .- They have a tour booth if you'd like to book a tour or just ask directions . They make honest assessment of the weather and advise you promptly i.e. Luaus, the best ones are always outdoors and we were advised to weight our plans as it started raining cats and dogs ( which apparently all the locals swore has never rained that bad in the Island with scary thunder and lighting ) - They offer a courtesy room. It's a room reserved after you have checked out and your flight is not for a few more hours. They let you use the room to freshen up and rest for an hour and it's free to use it.- Honest room service crew.- They have a big lounge area that you can relax and/or sit down to eat and read .- Extensive cable and good wifi. - They have a PC you can use in the Lobby- Your Bedroom is equipped with a tablet that can provide you all the hotel services and infos you need for your stay like directions, events , etcThings you need to know:-bottled water in your room are $1.50 (all the hotels in the area do that)-the breakfast bar doesn't have eggs or bacon, go to ihop or across the street if that's the breakfast you want.-the hotel do not have a restaurant but they provide food through room service . Read the brochures in your room or fiddle with the tablets.-rooms are smaller but very concise . They are equipped with full size tub and shower.Everything is functional in your room. There extra storage under your bed, check it out. They provide you Robes as well, check your closet .We had a wonderful stay! Thank you Vive!P.S. They don't charge you resort fee

One of the best hotel stay ever. Check in time is at 3pm but my flight arrived at 5am and the staff were able to accommodate an early check in with the same specs. They serve daily complimentary continental breakfast which consists of a few selection of pastries and exotic fruits and all day long coffee/tea.The hotel offers free use of beach umbrella, beach towels and boogie boards. We had a late flight at 10pm and was able to request a courtesy room a day in advance to wash up before our flight (check out time is 12pm). Valet parking is $25/night which is the norm for waikiki. The nearby hotels charges resort fee PLUS parking $25-30/daily. The cosmopolitan ocean view rooms are small but comfortable and clean for a couple who doesn't plan to stay in the room for extended amount of time. Thank you Vive for your wonderful hospitality.
user_name:
Kerry L
New York City, New York

review_body: A clean sleek hotel with minimal amenities. Parking sucks. No pool or balcony. I loved the Asian influenced decor. Awesome customer service. Nice size TV in the room. Love the view of Waikiki. Wish they provided complimentary discount or something for being on our honeymoon.

I stayed at the Vive Hotel for 6 nights on a recent trip to Honolulu. My stay was pleasant and uneventful. The facility appeared recently refreshed and was clean and comfortable. The breakfast was not particularly large or heavy but had an abundance of fresh flavorful fruit, which was pleasing to me. The tablet / information center on the night stand, which displayed my name, was a nice touch. The window air conditioning unit was a bit loud but kept the room comfortably cool. The location is central and minutes from the Waikiki Beach front. The staff was pleasant, kind and accommodating, even assisting me with the weighing of my luggage on the last day. Thanks very much for that. I would definitely stay here again, on a future visit.

Great hotel if you are looking for a quiet break from Waikiki/Honolulu. The rooms were comfortable (albeit small) and clean. The staff was excellent, and very helpful. We loved spending time in the "living room" downstairs for coffee and breakfast! Vive also provides beach gear (towels, mats, and boogie boards) which makes planning your day on the beach or out on the island easy.

Nice hotel with helpful staff. Well located near the beaches. Good value with the included breakfast and fast Wifi connection. Given the heavy trafic on the avenue, a better noise insulation would be welcome in the rooms.

Nice hotel at great location (5 minutes from Waikiki Beach). The hotel was very clean, cleaner than many 4-star-hotels. Provides beach gear, which is not common for a 3-star-hotel and so a very nice plus. Breakfast is ok but is complementary. Coffee, tea and water are complementary the whole day, which was great. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We had a junior suite which was very good value for the money

This is the perfect hotel if you need a quiet, mature space in the wildness of Waikiki. The rooms are very comfortable and modern, very close to the beach, staff are friendly, good breakfast with hot coffee and tea 24/7, and even a little library in the lobby. The other guests are usually low-key since it's a boutique hotel, so rarely any noisy families. I don't stay often anymore because their prices rose a lot last year, but it's a great hotel.

The rooms were ALWAYS clean. The valet/bell hops were great. Good personalities. Always willing to spend some time answering questions. Great experience all around. Even offer you beach amenities if needed.

We stayed here 5 days after our NCL cruise. Was a great choice overall, would stay again. Really liked having tablet in room for requesting services like car from valet, towels, alarm, general browsing!

Great customer service from check in to check out. Friendly, helpful staff was awesome. Good location, and the hotel was clean. Provided beach gear which was a plus, as it's two blocks away. Enjoy your stay!

Great hotel. Staff was very friendly, rooms were clean, amenities were great, complimentary breakfast was a nice addition, and the location is less than a 5 minute walk from the beach. I would definitely recommend others to stay here.

This hotel is very clean and the employees are excellent, very helpful and polite and personable. The location is outstanding for surfers or Waikiki shoppers. You will be happy at the Vive Hotel, and the breakfast is nice.

We arrived at the Vive Hotel for a 9 night stay. The staff went out of their way to be helpful, friendly and just made our stay so special. The rooms are cosy, but the bed was comfy and what more do you need. Breakfast was mainly toast, muffins and fresh fruit. More than ample. The coffee and selection of teas was great. Lots to do and see within easy walking distance. Bus stop at front door which was also handy. A must do for the shoppers, go visit Macy's. Our next trip will be with empty suitcases.

Great location! Just a short walk to the beach. We stayed in a King bed room, and it was super spacious with a large bathroom and closet. Worth the extra money. We rode the trolley mostly to get around, and a central pickup location was just a 5 minute walk. We loved the breakfast every morning (big savings!) as well as no resort fees. We would definitely stay again

Great modern hotel only a short walk from the beach and steps away from restaurants, cafes and shops. Very friendly and helpful staff. Clean, modern and comfortable rooms. Breakfast was very tasty and included a range of options, such as pastries, fresh fruit and hot tea and coffee.

All very good. Lobby and breakfasts provided were excellent. Only problem or surprise was how small the bathroom was and the noise made by the air conditioner. We were particularly impressed by the young man on the front counter.

Vive is a clean space with friendly enough staff, it's decorated nicely and the morning breakfast consists of bread, pastries and juice/coffee/tea. There is no soundproofing at all apparently so you will be able to hear your neighbors chatting quietly as well as any and everything they do in the room - including the bathroom because it's a sliding door rather than a real door. Additionally, the bathrooms have no fans so air quality is poor - this would also assist with white noise. Might be best to think of it as camping with other tents close by, an inexpensive solution to housing but maybe not the most comfortable.

I absolutely ADORED my stay at the Vive Hotel Waikiki! There's nothing quite like waking up every morning and getting to eat a continental breakfast with pastries and the best pineapple I've ever had. Really epitomized Hawaii and my stay. Didn't hurt that it was just a short 5-10 min walk from Waikiki beach and conveniently located next to a bus stop. We didn't need a car at all during our stay, just hopped on the bus to see Iolani Palace and Diamond Head. This will hands down be the only hotel I ever want to stay at in Waikiki--anything else would just be sub par.

Wonderful helpful staff, fantastic location close to the beach and main strip, clean (but small) rooms. Can get a bit noisy from the aircon and street noise but this wasn't a huge issue. Simple breakfast without a huge variation but was enough. Good value for money.

Greatl little boutique hotel - staff extremely friendly and helpful. They couldn't do enough for us!My only complaint is that the rooms, although nice, are just a tad too smallWouldn't hesitate to stay here again though

KC was awesome with her service and knowledge which made everything easy for for us. Nothing was too hard and we booked 2 more nights at Vive! Highly recommend the hotel great location and service, especially KC to make the most of your stay in Hawai!

Located very close to convenience stores, laundromats, high end shopping centers, restaurants and, of course, the beach. Hotel staff was highly accommodating and friendly. The amenities are consistent with the lodging prices - good value.

Loved the look and feel: very hip, very chic, but the beds are way too soft. Invest money in good beds and I will recommend to friends. Reviews must be at least 200 characters, but why? I've said all I have to say.

This place is so awesome. Everything you needed was right there. Would absolutely stay again. The staff went above and beyond. Our flights got cancelled and they made arragements within our budget for another night. Thanks heaps

we recently made the vive hotel our home and base for 9 nights.we booked it based purely on the reviews,and the people were not wrong.the location was brilliant,close to the beach,bus stop right out the front,minutes walk to the shopping strips and restaurants.from the moment we checked in till the time we checked out nothing was too much trouble for the staff.the continental breakfast was more than adequate,with fresh fruit every morning included.the only thing we might be able to fault was the size of the room ,but who cares when it's clean,comfy bed and all you really do in the room is sleep.

Staff was very helpful. Hotel was only 3 blocks from the beach. My wife is a vegetarian and vegetarian restaurants were right across the street. I was shocked to see that. We very much enjoyed our stay.

Great hotel at very reasonable price. Besides having very friendly & helpful staff, they offer the little things like beach towels and equipment that everyone forgets to bring on vacation. I don't usually do valet, but these guys are very positive, helpful and efficient.

This was our 6th visit to Oahu and 6th different hotel. The others had a pool and exercise room which we did not use nor did very many others use them. Your staff was fantastic and always friendly. Breakfast was more than enough. We were on the 12th floor and the WIFI worked great.

Great hotel - very central and close to the beach and shops. No balcony or pool but you won't find yourself staying in the room for long anyway as there's so much to do in Waikiki. Nice breakfast and free Wi-fi. Highly recommended.
The hotel is near the beachRooms are small and bathroom is very close to bed( less than 0.5 meter,Breakfast is so brief but healthy,Staff were friendly,Rooms View are not good ,Air condition is noisy

This place is good if your were traveling solo. Though the room we stayed in was very clean, it was too small for us. The bed was right next to the bathroom. I feel uncomfortable sleeping next to the bathroom from a sanitary perspective. When my husband uses the bathroom, it is over for me. Luckly, he knows how to flush right away so the smell doesn't linger. The bathroom was also cramp. I like to have lots of space between the toilet, the sink and the shower. I didn't like their AC. It was right close to the bed. When we had it on, it felt like a freezer inside our room, but when we turned it off, the room was an oven. We couldn't win with the AC. It is probably the reason why I got sick being exposed to extreme cold and heat. Also, I like to mention about their parking. I don't like paying for a valet. This make no sense to me. It was hard to come in an out because then we have to tip the valet boy everytime we came back to take a break, so we rarely used the car unless we had to go to an activity outside the vacinity.Pros:Lobby is emmaculate.Free continental breakfast=yum ( however we wanted to try out food outside, so we only had one free day)Hotel is close to the strip which is close to restaurants.Bottom line, I would come back here if I was traveling by myself or I need a room to myself. I would not stay here with my husband or my family whom I might share a room with.

Hotel was great, staff very friendly and accommodating. Hotel foyer looks fab. The only down side was not having a pool or a bar but if that doesn't worry you, it really is a lovely hotel. It could also do with updating the air-conditioning in the rooms, some split systems would probably be a bit quieter.

Great location, friendly staff and clean rooms if a little on the small side. The breakfast is not extensive but not bad for a free continental. The lounge is a lovely room to meet friends or family for a quiet chat. This hotel is very good value for money.

We had a Junior Suite, it was very spacious and the bathroom was huge. The air-con was a little noisy as other reviewers have noted, it didn't bother us too much. The breakfast was adequate with no frills but plenty to go around. The location was exceptional, walking distance to everything and 3 minutes to the beach. You can book day tours directly at the hotel and the pick ups for tours are across the road or very close by. I highly recommend this hotel as an alternate to high priced resorts if you don't normally lay around a pool or look for other facilities but happy to wander down to the beach and walking distance to many varieties of eating places close by.

I am writing this review personally for our concierge during our stay---KC,Thank you so much for helping make our stay in Oahu such an amazing experience! We were so pleased with your helpfulness as our concierge. Unfortunately, we weren't able to do everything you recommended to us but everything we were able to do was perfect!!! (Buho was my all-time favorite restaurant during our stay---thank you so much!) My husband and I truly appreciate you!!! Hope to see you again soon! Missing Hawaii already :)Sincerely,Mr. & Mrs. Good

My room was small but still cozy. I especially loved the sweet way they had my name on the tablet welcoming me. Daily cleaning was awesome. Friendly staff...yummy pastries...Definitely will stay again

The staffs are wonderful. Everyone is so friendly and willing to help. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Although the hotel is located in a convenient location, it is still two blocks from the beach. Breakfast is ok but not changing on a daily basis. The valet parking person is very good and nice.

Great location, excellent staff. Continental breakfast provided was good but would be better if the fruit provided was not the same every day...it got a bit monotonous,so we did go to the cafe across the road for pancakes one day.Location is great, just a 5 minute walk to the beach.Absence of a pool may noy suit families with young children, but as a couple we would be happy to return

Did not disappoint, staff allowed early check-in and were very helpful. 3 blocks from the beach. Breakfast was a little pastry-heavy. Easy bus access to other parts of Oahu. We used speedi-shuttle for airport access both ways without incident.

We had an excellent stay at Vive, the location of the hotel and value were very good. The only issue we can even mention was the noise from the window unit air conditioner, it came on pretty often during the night and was a bit loud, other than that everything was perfect.

Took th family to Hawaii, Waikiki this year and as always this hotel is awesome!!! The staff si very friendly and extremely helpful. The daily brunch is nice and the coffe is fantatic. Favorite hotel.

We got good help from KC :) KC was helpful and friendly when we needed help to book tours in Oahu. We can highly recommend KC. The location of this hotel is super, so near to the Waikiki beach and restaurants.

Excellent location, staff is super friendly and helpful, we had everything we needed! Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Honolulu. The rooms are small but that hardly matters as you're on the beach all day!

Rooms very clean just small. Staff was very friendly and helpful. If you needed anything they were very promt with assistance. The hotel is within walking distance to beach, stores, and restaurants. Breakfast was average and fresh.

Overall Vive Hotel was fantastic value. The rooms were clean, modern and comfortable. Slight noise from other rooms, but mostly undetectable. Great location only two blocks from the beach. Wifi was fast and had a strong signal in the room. Breakfast was decent. No resort or additional fees. Staff were competent and friendly.

VIVE is a wonderful hotel just outside the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, where you're in walking distance of the beach but still away from the madness on Kalakaua. The decor is cool and modern, not campy island style, and the service is excellent. Book VIVE, you won't regret it!

Great place to stay in Waikiki! Excellent value with nice continental breakfast in the morning. So close to Waikiki yet far enough away to avoid the noise and hustle and bustle of it all. Great variety of restaurants near by. Staff super friendly and very helpful when needed. Concierge very knowledgeable and gave us excellent suggestions for local restaurants and events. We were there for our 10 year wedding anniversary and would definitely stay there again!

As soon as we walked into the Vive Hotel we knew we'd picked a winner. We were greeted by reception with cold towels and a fresh glass of pinnacle juice which we didn't expect from a 'boutique' hotel. Although the rooms are small and there aren't any facilities (pool, gym etc) the location and the service fills in this gap. It's literally a 3min walk to Waikiki Beach and close to all of the shops and restaurants. The only negative we had was the noisy air conditioner. We will stay here again if it was for a small trip (5 day max)

junior suite is beautifully decorated - not far from the food pantry and only 1 block from Kalakaua, for us its great as its close to the giant sea pools where we swim all the time!! staff are awesome and the complimentary beach gear is a real bonus
user_name:
Sandra W
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: Read all reviews, so I was prepared for the small rooms. They are cute, and decorated very modern, and plenty of room for two people. Reminded me a lot of hotels in San Francisco. Staff was very friendly & accommodating. LOVED the courtesy room & the fact that they will hold your luggage all day until you leave for your flight. Very convenient. Thank you!!! :-)

Enjoyable stay! Would def visit again! Highly recommended. Complimentary brekkie. Fantastic lobby chill out area.. Books to read & so close to everything! Really enjoyed ourselves. Stayed with family..

never stayed in a hotel so bad as this one. Rooms really suck, tiny cracker box, nowhere to put clothes, had to leave in suit case, no closet, no chest , NO cant live out of suitcase for 11 days.paid a good price for it Checked out very next AM. No way could I stayed another minute, online they make it look like a great place, all the money went into lobby to suck people in, was offerend another room for additional 204.00 per night, only had 1 penthouse to offer.

We received a friendly welcome on arrival along with a cooling towel and glass of fresh pineapple juice. Just what you need after a long flight. Our room was small but well equipped with a mini fridge and usual hairdryer and toiletries etc. We always think you don't go to hotels to spend all your time in the room so size is not really important. The free continental breakfast was great with a selection of pastries, fresh fruits and plenty of tea and coffee. The hotel loans out chairs, mats and towels for the beach which is an excellent idea. The concierge was very helpful with bus times and booking a trip for us. All the staff were very friendly and professional. The room was cleaned daily. All in all a brilliant hotel. If it wasn't 7000 miles away we would definitely be back.

I very much enjoyed my experience at the Vive Hotel in Waikiki. Upon arrival you are greeted by friendly staff along with a glass of pineapple juice and refreshing coconut towels. The exterior of the building looks a little old (except for the main entrance) however the interior of the hotel is brand new; everything from the lobby to the rooms are modern and fresh. I had a corner room with a queen bed overlooking Kuhio Avenue and the apartments and mountains behind. The corner room was spacious for the main room with two windows and a small bathroom with a combination bath/shower. The small bathroom doesn't worry me much as it is not like I am spending a great deal of time in there and all I need is space for my shaver and toothbrush; bench space is limited for those with a lot of hair and body care products however. The bed was very comfortable, the TV has a large selection of channels to watch and there is a tablet in the room that acts as a means of communication to order extra amenities for your room as well as a clock. Unlike a great number of hotels in the US I have stayed at this hotel does have an in room mini fridge! For those bringing a large number of clothes that need to be hung there is a large wardrobe for hanging items and plenty of space for baggage. A Continental Breakfast was included in the rate however I did not have a chance to eat breakfast whilst I was there. The only thing that lets this room down is the air conditioning. Window mounted units are used and these seem to be a little underpowered; however blinds are installed to stop the room from getting hot during the day. All staff I encountered at the hotel were friendly, courteous and very helpful.Surrounding the hotel there are plenty of shops, restaurants and bars. Everything from sit down to take-away restaurants are found within a 5 min walking radius from the hotel and there are two or more ABC stores within a 3 min walk from the hotel front door. The beach is only a 2 min walk from the hotel and the hotel does have some beach supplies if you wanted to borrow them from the front desk. For those that wish to shop there are plenty of clothing and general merchandise stores along Kalakaua Ave which runs along the beach as well as along Kuhio Ave and streets in between. The "TheBus" service runs from just outside the front door of the hotel and will take you to Ala Moana Centre and downtown Honolulu for a $2.50 cash fare. You can walk to Ala Moana (I did) and it will take at least 30 minutes depending on the route you travel (you can take a direct route or a bit more of a longer route but via the beach).All in all this is a great little hotel with a very friendly team and some great facilities; I highly recommend staying here.

Extraordinarily friendly and helpful staff, impeccable decor and lovely rooms. We were impressed by the ease of access as well as the loan of boogie boards, beach mats, etc. I absolutely recommend Vive.

Had a very lovely experience here at the Vive hotel. Service was top notch, everyone seemed happy to help with our needs. We were always greeted with genuine smiles it was an overall welcoming feeling. They have a beautiful lounge area to hang out and relax in. Location was very convenient and close to pretty much everything you need, restaurants, convenient stores, shopping malls and most importantly the beach.

Great location, two blocks from the beach and the bus stop is right outside the door. Excellent and friendly staff. Modern rooms are small but provide good sound insulation. Heard traffic but no sounds from the hotel corridor or room next door. great place to stay!

Had a lovely time there. Rooms were clean, nice, and modern styled. Having Items to take with you to the beach that the hotel offered, was amazing. Breakfast wasn't a cheap store bought thing either. Could use some more protein in the meal though, but I wouldn't sacrifice anything for that addition. I loved it and would stay there again.

Beside the fact that the rooms are pretty small I have nothing to complain.Modern and stylish hotel with friendly staff and good amenities.Location is very convenient. Nice extra is free coffee and water during day/night

Best service, best rooms, best location, HANDS DOWN! They didn't hesitate to take care of our every need and went above and beyond to make us feel at home! I couldn't have asked for a better place to stay, even the guest are polite!

This my third time staying at the vive. The service is awesome and the staff really makes you feel welcomed. The staff is genuine and not "fake nice". I love the way the hotel looks and the rooms are perfect and very comfortable. I cant wait till my next staycation. Stay at the vive you will not regret it

From the check in to the check out the staff to good care of us. We had a lot of questions and no matter when we asked they always had time to answer. Fresh fruit every morning. Towels. Chairs. Excursions. The whole deal. Thanks

We loved everything about the Vibe. It was close to the beach, bars and shops, a lovely trendy hotel, super helpful staff. Close to tour pick ups. The breakfast is nice. We will definitely stay again. Highly recommend it.................................. Thank you!!

Excellent Junior Suite. Clean, tidy and comfortable. Value for money. Staff [plus Concierge] were exceptional - cheerful, helpful. One was treated as a valued guest. On visiting the larger hotels one couldn't avoid noticing that many people were like little ants scurrying around! Air con was a bit noisy but one got used to it. My wife and I would elect to stay at Vive should we return.

Very clean smaller hotel. Staff very helpful, check in an check out was easy. Location fantastic, only a block from Waikiki Beach. Breakfast included was a bonus. Room small but very comfortable. Great that they provide free beach gear.

Great about the hotel: Location is superb, 2 min to the beach, on bus and trolley routes, great breakfast to start a day, very friendly staff, coffee, tea and water all day.Cons: smaller rooms and noisy Aircon, we had some issues with internet with our room which has been sorted our last day of stay, but we have been given credit for parking so very happy at the end.

Very clean, updated look. All the staff are friendly, helpful, and beautiful. We booked the standard room which was small. but all that is needed. we upgraded to an oceanview suite which was perfect for us and worth the extra bit. If you want to be at that end of Waikiki then this is the place to stay.

Staff from the very first step were so helpful and friendly!! Great location 5 minutes stroll to beach and plenty of shopping restaraunts in close vicinity!!  Rooms cleaned daily to a high standard air conditioner and tv to make the room comftorble when actually indoors although in such an amazing place this is rare!! Mahalo Mahalo Mahalo Mahalo Mahalo

Great location just a short walk to Waikiki beach and shops. Friendly service and easy check in. Rooms are a good size and comfortable bed and pillows. Short walk down the road to IHOP and other restaurants. Hy's steak house next door. Amazing steak and food there. Would definitely stay again. We were a bit late checking out and the front desk was flexible and friendly.

My only issue is that the small rooms are a bit small, the bed especially, and the price is a bit high considering. Otherwise it is excellent for the area, and the hotel is clean and in a perfect area downtown. Rooms with Ocean view (which allows full viewing of other tall condo/apartments in the way of the Ocean) are spacious and nice with the King size bed. But the price should not exceed $200 MAX in my opinion. Its easy to get lost in the high prices in Honolulu, but there are values to be found with research.

We usually stay at the big major hotels. Stayed here because it was advertised as "boutique". VIVE is chic and did not let us down, except that the room was small and walls thin. AirCon a bit noisy and tolerable. Mahalo

This hotel exceeded our expectations based on the price we paid. Staff were super helpful and friendly. Our room was modern and perfect to come back to at the end of each day. The lounge room was a great place to chill out at any time of day with readily available coffee and cold water. Breakfast each day was excellent. Lovely relaxing atmosphere and very central to everything. Beach was walking distance - very close, as well as convenience stores, coffee shops and public transport was right outside the hotel. No negatives, highly recommended!

Just 7 minutes’ walk from Waikiki Beach, Vive Hotel Waikiki is a boutique hotel that offers free Wi-Fi and modern guest rooms with mountain, city or ocean views.A flat-screen cable TV and small refrigerator are featured in each room at VIVE Hotel Waikiki. The en suite bathroom includes a walk-in shower, plush bathrobes and a hairdryer. There is no in room coffee/tea making facility, however cold drinks and coffee and tea are available 24 hours in the downstairs lobby/lounge/breakfast area with take-away cups should your desire your caffeine fix.You definitely don’t need a pool when your this close to the beach. I could see why it could feel slightly small for two – but in this location why would you want to spend all that time indoors anyway.I liked having beach gear available, such as towels, mats, chairs and boogie boards – making it simple and easy to enjoy the beach just a short walk away.I really like the Courtesy Room, a place to shower and change after spending your final hours enjoying the waters of Waikiki, this option was very welcome and most appreciated. It needs to be booked in advance at the front desk and is available in one hour slots – best of all, its FREE to guests!The only let down was the continental breakfast, which was minimal and repetitive. After a few days it gets boring, but having coffee and drinks available certainly is welcome.All in all, I would certainly return here. It wasn’t huge like nearby chain hotels offering a more unique experience. There are no ‘resort fee’s that most other hotels in Honolulu charge on top of your stay, making the VIVE Hotel Waikiki very good value. I really enjoyed staying here and hope to return again .

This was my first stay - small but efficiently designed rooms - conveniently located - walking distance from Waikiki beach - good public transportation available from the door step of the hotel. Good for a short stay!

For the money there wouldn't be too much better in Waikiki. Rooms are not huge but they are modern and clean and contain everything you need. Staff are incredibly friendly. Free breakfast is excellent with tea and coffee in the lobby 24/7. Free beach gear too. Will definitely stay here again.

Usually, my visits to Hawaii are on other islands staying at "resorts". This trip I wanted something quick, comfortable and easy on the wallet. The Vive exceeded my expectations. The location is excellent. No need for a car. The bus and trolley line are right outside the door. Plenty of shops, restaurants and beaches within easy walking distance. The best part of staying at The Vive was the staff. They could not have been more helpful. From the front desk to housekeeping. I have to give a shout out to K.C. at the concierge desk. I gave her a list of things we were interested in doing and went off to lunch. When I came back, everything was arranged perfectly with an itinerary and all the information attached. Finding someone so professional was refreshing and really made the entire trip for us. I haven't seen service this exceptional in awhile. I'll be back!

This was my second stay at this hotel. My previous was exactly a year ago. It was only one night this time around but it was a great experience beginning to end. Will come back for a third in the future!

Great middle class hotel, located 3 walking mins away from waikiki beach. the Hotel is so modern and the room (we got upgraded) was really nice and big. The breakfast which is severed every morning is good too, not a huge variety but still good enough :) the staff is friendly and helpful. you can rent towels, bodyboards and similar stuff for free - which is a great offer too. wifi is inlcuded.

Felt like home. The lounge was a great chill-out zone. I even borrowed some novels for light reading at night. The in-room tablet that allows us to request services was fantastic and easy to use.And oh-so-conveniently located to Waikiki Beach. Loved having The Bus stop at the door heading towards Ala Moana and Pearl Harbour.

After traveling for over 10 hours I was thankful that we were able to check in early. The room was quaint with ocean facing windows. Restaurants and stores were all within walking distance. The location allows visitors to enjoy the busy scene but also escape for rest. I would stay here again!

We stayed at Vive in Waikiki and it is an excellent location to be close to the action and just far enough away from the beach and the wandering crowd of people.The rooms look renovated and are impeccably presented. The facilities in the room were all good and we had a great stay for a couple of nights. Breakfast buffet is sufficient and has a great variety of fresh fruit.Staff at the hotel are really friendly and they offer beach gear and will help you arrange anything you need.The only drawback of the room we had (which was otherwise awesome with a great view) was that the a/c is noisy and vibrates. We would happily stay at Vive and recommend it to friends.

Very nice place, very friendly staff. Rooms are small but hey... You're almost on the beach! Very nice and clean. Lemony water always in the lobby, so fill up your bottles! Very convenient. Very pleased with our stay. But like I said, rooms are small: better be well organized! Maybe a couple of hooks would help...

This suited our needs, clean, comfortable, convenient location, excellent service, and fair price. This is not a resort to lounge around in; rather a great base from which to go out and experience Hawaii.

Aside from the parking price at the hotel being high, overall stay was great. The location being just a couple of blocks away from the beach wasn't to bad either. The staff were wonderful and nice. :)

My boyfriend and I recently stayed here just for a little getaway and also so he could attend a conference that was being held in Waikiki. I must say the hotel was very nice and in the perfect location!PROS:Great Location!!Clean rooms, and lobby area24/7 coffee and tea available which was a plus!continental breakfast(although we never had it, it did look pretty decent)free wifino resort feewalking distance to everythingCONS:valet took forever to bring our car every time we would call aheadno valet guy when you arrive you have to wait for him to come from downstairs which sometimes took 5 minutesour sink in the bathroom would back up every time we used it so instead we would brush our teeth and wash our faces in the shower bent over the lip of the tub( quite uncomfortable)the front desk lady charged my boyfriends card twiceA/C unit very noisy and didn't really keep the room cool it would constantly turn on and off throughout the day and would only be on for about 5 minutes each timeour window broke towards the end of the trip so we couldn't open it after thatOverall it was a nice hotel to stay at just work on your valet guys maybe staying up at the valet kiosk so guests don't have to wait every time and fix the a/c units in the rooms.

This place.... was amazing for the price. We had a 7 day, 6 night stay on Waikiki. This hotel is about 3 blocks from the beach. We got a junior ocean view suite on the 19th floor. We woke up every morning to gorgeous views of the beach. PROS:-no resort fees-FREE wifi-FREE continental breakfast-FREE beach mats, beach towels, and boogie boardsCONS:-parking is $25, valet only, but this is standard in WaikikiWe would definitely stay here again. Great price, amazing location, excellent service.

First visit to Hawaii and we chose the perfect hotel. Minutes walk from the beach and parking onsite at $25/nt with in and outs - about average for Waikiki. Excellent buffet breakfast and superfast wifi. Definitely a great choice and we'll be back!

The hotel is in a great location in downtown Honolulu. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The rooms are small but adequate. The continental breakfast was nice. They loaned us chairs and towels for the beach. It was an overall good value.

My partner and I stayed at Vive in Summer of 2014 and cannot recommend this hotel enough! We stayed for approximately 14/15 days. We were given drinks when we arrived to check in and reception staff were lovely. Our room and it's bathroom were clean and tidy, some may consider the room small but my partner and I are only small ourselves, and use hotel rooms mostly just to sleep in! Staff were more than happy to give us a map of Honolulu and even wrote down some suggestions for us for places to see and get food. We were given complimentary breakfast, Wi-Fi and use of beach gear to take down to Waikiki beach which was barely a 5 minute walk away. There was also a bus stop right outside the hotel. I'd be more than happy to stay at Vive again the next time I'm in Waikiki!

This hotel is great, No pool is the only down side, it would be nice to have during evening times. :) but who needs one when u have a beach 3 blocks down. Valet is pricey at $25 a day. overall A+ Stay

My first time stay here in Waikiki area. For the price u can't beat that . Convenient & in walking distance to most popular places . The staffs r nice , friendly . My first night I had a little issue but wasn't their fault , the people behind us were noisy but when I told the girl @ Front desk ( forgot to get her name but she's the pregnant one ) she moved me to the next available room in 30mins . Great job guys ! I'll def come back here !

Close to everything including the bus stations. The lobby smells fresh and clean. The hotel room is smaller than an average room, but it's clean with newer furnitures. Breakfast is good, but wished there was a choice of oatmeal.

We stayed here as the first leg of our anniversary trip to Oahu. It's just a couple blocks from the beach and the perfect place to stay if you want to be close to things. The rooms are on the small side but we didn't find that to be a problem since we spent most of our time out and about. The room was perfect for the two of us. There are bus stops right outside if you want to use public transportation. We also used SpeediShuttle and they had no problems with dropping us off there. The staff was very friendly and very helpful. We had lots of questions as first time travelers to Oahu and they were very accommodating. I would stay here again and would recommend to friends traveling here.

Good service and good room condition.Vive hotel provides complimentary breakfast. It's very useful.Best part is there are no resort fees. The hotel is very close to the beach and a local grocery store.

This property is near the best beaches in Waikiki and walking distance the best restaurants. The breakfast every morning was varied and plentiful. The concierge was the best part as she gave us great advice on restaurants and the best tours for the money. The rooms are continental (small) but we were not in them for most of the time. All the children were at the resorts so you won't see many here. The construction across the street will be beautiful when finished but until then, the ocean view rooms will be noisy (starting at 5 am). That was the only negative in a truly good stay.

It has been a bit since I have visited, but the impression that they have left me still carries over. It reminds me of those TV shows based on a restaurant or hotel. Everyone is so friendly, service is awesome and love the little breakfast they put out to start your day. Needless to say, chic looking, clean and centrally located, that you can walk or bus anywhere on the island.

I have just returned from 5 nights at the Vive Hotel, travelling on my own.I used Roberts for my airport transfers and they were excellent and to be recommended. Check in at the Vive was a breeze and within a couple of minutes of arrival I was in my corner suite, 1208. I had a partial view straight down to the beach which was nice. The room was well appointed, the bed and bedding excellent. The bathroom was fine and the shower pressure great. As some people have written, the air conditioning units are extremely noisy but within a couple of minutes of putting them on, they do a great job of cooling even the hottest room! I found that if I switched them off just before I went to sleep I was fine for the night so no issues there.You have to take into account the location of the hotel - right in the middle of the action. There are busy streets around the hotel and there is considerable traffic noise even if you are higher up the hotel. The sound proofing with the outside world (I.e. windows) is not the best but bring some ear plugs if you are a light sleeper. I heard no noises from the room next to me which was great. The hotel provide beach towels, beach matts and boogie boards for you and I found there was never a shortage of any during my stay.The beach is 3 minutes walk away and although I was perhaps there at the busiest time of the year (4th July weekend) I still easily found a spot. I found all the staff helpful and friendly with any interaction and they are to be commended.The WiFi was good throughout my stay.I did not have to wait more than a minute at any time for a lift which was good considering there were only two. Rooms are serviced anytime between c. 8am and 4.30pm but if you need your room servicing earlier rather than later, just ask at reception and they will accommodate this. One of the only negatives is something that I have seen mentioned so many times here before on Tripadvisor about the Vive....and therefore I wonder why nothing is done about it? This is breakfast. Not one hint of anything with protein anywhere. The fruit is lovely but all you have then are pastries. It would not hurt to put a big bowl of 0% fat Greek yoghurt or the likes out to go with the fruit to add a bit of variety and nutrition. I did not have breakfast at the Vive and instead frequented the close and many abc stores for bits of food and snacks. Not the cheapest but very close and the range in the larger branches is amazing.In summary I can recommend the Vive for a stay in Waikiki. If I returned to the area I would have not hesitation in staying there again. As I was leaving, they were about to install tablets in each room as well.

Beautiful lobby. Best part is there are no resort fees. The hotel is very close to the beach and a local grocery store. The rooms are very tiny & the bathroom was even tinier. Once u step in the bathroom there is no where to go. If u have a lot of things this isn't the hotel for you. It would have been nice if it included a dresser instead of just a closet. I prefer to leave my clothes in drawers instead of hanging them up. Because of its size and lack of color in the room it felt more like a dorm room than a hotel room. The lobby is much nicer than the room - I think they should paint to warm up the rooms. Friendly staff & clean rooms. I would stay here again due to price location $ cleanliness.

Very few things in this world are what they seem. VIVE is what it seems and more. Affordable luxury, with great service and style. Full on YES!Location is excellent, breakfast is lovely, the lounge is comfortable and very good to work out of during the day.I really loved my stay.

I spent four nights at this hotel in June of 2015 - had a wonderful corner room on the 20th floor, with two A/C units that kept the room a comfortable temperature throughout our stay, which given the 90+ temperatures was no small feat! The room was spacious, with a nice city view. The bed was very comfortable, and I enjoyed four nights of wonderful sleep.My experience was wonderful from start to finish. The hotel staff was friendly and accommodating, from the front desk, to the concierge, to the valet, to the housekeepers. The location is perfect - just a few blocks from Waikiki beach, within walking distance to everything in downtown Honolulu. Valet parking is convenient, and reasonably priced given the location. The continental breakfast was more than sufficient, and I utilized it every day - I really enjoyed the variety, as they did change it up slightly every day of my stay. The complimentary beach towels, boogie boards, and all-things-beach were a great touch!Thanks Hotel Vive, I will be back!

My room was reasonable, old air conditioning unit but they worked well, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was great. The shower is huge with a nice rain fall type head, great temperature maintenance too. The bathroom has good lighting for doing make up!

We booked this online for 6 nights through Expedia based on location, price, and the economy of included breakfast and wifi. The foyer was lovely and welcoming, staff greeted us with juice and hot towels, no issues at all with our booking, and given room 17/04 - spacious, with a view North along Kuhio Ave. Aircon, comfy bed, clean bathroom with a tub - all newly renovated I believe. The lobby has a comfy range of couches and chairs and a 24 hour coffee/tea station, with a small honour library nearby with a range of books to read while you stay (nearly all English, but I think there were a couple of foreign language that guests may have donated). I had read some people's criticisms of the breakfast options but we found although it is nearly all pastry based it was really good quality. The range changed every day, but you had croissants, toast, savoury and sweet pastries/buns/minimuffins and lots of sliced fruit. And there were takeaway cup options for the hot drinks so you could make one to go! Some days we loaded up our plates and ate in our rooms instead of downstairs. Our wifi worked well, staff helped us with taxis and bus information, and Waikiki is a very short walk away. We never utilised the free beach towels etc but good to know the option was there. The bus stop is 20 metres away for Pearl Harbour/Ala Moana/Downtown etc, and being a main road taxis were going past whenever we needed one so didn't bother booking them after the first night, just hailed one down. For those like us who like to get good walks in, we found it was a straight and easy walk from there to Diamond Head, to Ala Moana, and inland to other food options like Ono Hawaiian Foods. And as a runner I really appreciated the nearby paths used by runners and cyclists a block or two inland around the canal and past the golf course. Highly recommended.

My husband and I stayed for the week of our wedding and it was great. The staff was friendly and the room was small but super clean. The free breakfast was awesome! The had blueberry bread. What more can you say.

Perfect location close to the beach and very central. Close to public transport. Great staff who were friendly, helpful and attentive. Clean room and bathroom and free breakfast was great! Worth a visit!

Good hotel and good value. Close to the beach. Staff very helpful. Had a great time in Waikiki. The room was a bit smaller than we expected. The staff had great recommendations on restaurants and activities

First time to Hawaii, 4th of July weekend, super-crowded, however, staff helped us in every way. Location is great. 5 mins walk to waikiki beach, 1 min walk to 2 ABC stores(for drinks and snacks), 5-10 min walk to most restaurants. Room was small, but for the price we paid, it was ok. Breakfast was decent. Amenities were ok. Neighboring room and our room had a connecting door which was not sound proof. So words and noises could be heard from across. It was like having an unknown roommate who can be heard but not seen. So sleep quality was bad. Overall, had a pleasant stay and enjoyed our vacation here.

This is a great location that is near the Waikiki strip without being on it. The rooms were comfy and cozy. The staff was friendly and helpful. It was a great bonus to get free towels, mats, and chairs for the beach.

I travel to Oahu almost monthly for business and always trying to save $$$ I try lots of hotels. This is not a hotel I recommend for anything other than price. The rooms were tiny and not setup for really anything except sleeping and leaving. Tiny 'desk' area with only 1 open outlet. No storage for items if your here for more than a couple of days. Bathroom was clean but there was no counter space for my bathroom stuff. Looks like this place used to be condos that they split up in many tiny units.
