Wi-Fi was great strong signal and great speeds...the best part of the room. Maybe since I was a discount traveler I got the worst of the rooms, but this room was not up to my standards at all.The lobby is the nicest place in the hotel. The free continental breakfast was always packed and a good place to chit chat with other guests in the morning. No real place to sit and eat though and as already mentioned there's not really a place in the room to do this either.Staff was okay, friendly but not very helpful when asking about local breakfast places. I already knew where they are but am always looking for something new. The staffs reply was "There are some places on Kalakaua", which is to say figure it out yourself.

So I have spent most of my adult life traveling and have logged in thousands of hotel stays. Some that I'll always remember and many that I wish I could forget.This place absolutely rocks! It is small and a couple blocks off the beach but the hotel has a personality is unique and exciting.Each staff member that I came in contact with were extremely helpful and went out of their way to answer and assist with. Everything from sight seeing recommendations to grabbing me a cab. They anticipated my needs. Always greeting me with BIG smiles and a sincere welcome.Big box hotels should take a lesson from these folks on how to deliver outstanding guest satisfaction.I am going to post this in trip advisor as well so more people will see how fabulous you are! Thank you, thank you!

We have been to Waikiki many times and stayed at oceanfront hotels. This time we were on a budget. The hotel has a great location, 2minute walk to beach just where the statue of Duke is. Rooms are modern and clean.Comfy bed and good water pressure in the shower. The staff are super accomodating and friendly. Complimentary continental breakfast. Down side, no balcony and the rooms are a little small(we stayed in the regular room, there are bigger rooms available) but for the price they are not really a big deal.

Staff very friendly and helpful. Free wi fi (good speed) and breakfast a bonus. Good location -only a couple of minutes walk to beach and shops. Noisy air conditioner that was difficult to regulate was an issue.

This hotel experience was great from the time of booking to the time we printed our airline boarding pass to leave!! The staff was great and the hotel is very close to everything you need. We stayed on the 21st floor as recommended by former Trip Advisor reviewers and it worked out really well. Great view of the ocean.

The staff was very friendly, location was close just minutes from the hotel. lots to eat and snack on. free WFI and breakfast which had fruits and pastries the room was comfy and roomy thanks to samantha.

From time of booking cannot fault hotel. Location close to everything.Room was clean & tidy. Free WiFi & breakfast a plus. All staff friendly and helpful. Beach a short 3 minute walk and great that they provide beach towels & Bogie boards

Staff very helpful and friendly. Location close to beach and shops.Room was clean. Free WiFi and breakfast. Breakfast included fresh fruit and breads and pastries. Noise from A/C in room was only issue.

The basic room could be bigger but overall, I enjoyed the hotel. The free WiFi and breakfast is always nice. It's only 2 blocks from the Waikiki beach. All staff was friendly and very accommodating. I appreciate the nice decor in the lobby.

From start to finish our stay was great! We had no issues at all while staying at the Vive! - Great value for money, Clean, tidy and Modern!- ALL the staff were super helpful and friendly. - The rooms are small but all you need for some where clean and modern to rest your head at night. - We loved the fact we could grap, tea. coffee and water whenever we wanted and breakfast daily really set us up for our days exploring.- Location is perfect as you can walk to shops, restuarants and the beach within minutes! The bus is right outside to the right where you can travel to the mall, Pearl Harbour and other attractions.Thank you for making our honeymoon so special and affordable Vive! We loved our stay!

Just returned from spending 4 nights at this hotel. Booker it through Expedia. When we got there i was schocked and dismayed at the size of the room. Immediately requested a change and had to pay an additional amt for a similar size pokey room but atleast it had a view. Staff were very accommodating. The initial room should be used as a storage locker!! Location - greatBreakfast - decent but we skipped it after the first day and elected to eat less carbs and more proteins. Cleanliness: Good. Overall you can expect a 3 star and nothing more.Kudos again to the front desk, bkfast staff and room staff their customer service.

The lobby is very stylish and has coffee and water around-the-clock. The breakfast of fruit and pastry is very nice.The hallways and rooms, however, remind me of my daughter's college dorm room. OK, nicer and bigger, but not by a lot. The room was Ikea-meets-zen and tiny (the door barely clears the corner of the bed). The room fridge wasn't deep enough to hold a standard takeout container, so we had to throw out our leftover food. That said, someone put a lot of thought into the design of the room and bathroom, so it was utilitarian, attractive, and modern given the strict confines of the room. I think this hotel would appeal more to younger travelers, who would appreciate the fast wifi and minimalist room.

The location of this hotel is very convenient and given the price of many other places in the area, good value for money, especially with Wifi and continental breakfast included. The service there was great and guy booking the tours (?CK), etc., as well as front of house staff were all friendly and professional. The room we had was extraordinarily small with no closet (we were there mainly for a shopping trip - not much room for all our purchases!!) and had a window rattler aircon which was very loud to try to sleep with. On the up side, one of the windows opened so we could have some fresh air overnight instead of the noisy air conditioning. I was a little disappointed there was no muesli or yoghurt with the breakfast - besides one wholemeal bread everything else was very high carb/high sugar content which I was not used to for breakfast so we ended up getting our own from the supermarket a couple of blocks away. Excellent that they had towels, chairs, boogie boards to borrow and the beach was only a block away. As much as I was happy enough with the accommodation, I don't think I would stay here again.

Vive was the final hotel on our honeymoon. We did the Royal Hawaiian for a few days and then Turtle Bay up in the North Shore and then came back for a few days at the Vive. We were a little worried about this hotel but those concerns were immediately squashed. We loved everything about the hotel. It was clean and felt more modern than the previous hotels we stayed in on the trip. We actually felt the Vive was a much better experience than Royal or Turtle. We would most definitely stay there on our next trip to Oahu and will definitely recommend this property to friends.

I can't say enough great things about this hotel. Staff was very helpful and services were great. In a great location. Two blocks from the beach and close to the bus stop. Only negative was no closet. Two drawers under bed for clothes.

What a fantastic place to stay. The decor is amazing... from the classy lobby, to the stylish dining area. Our time at the VIVE Hotel was an unexpected highlight of our time in Waikiki. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was modern, clean and ideally suited to our needs. On top of that...free beach towels, boogie boards, beach chairs and a sun-umbrella. Brilliant - thanks!!

If you want to have some space, definitely book a junior suite. We weren't going to spend much time in the room, so we were ok with a regular sized room. The room itself wasn't terribly small, but the bathroom was a bit small for our liking.The Good:We really enjoyed having the complementary internet and use of beach chairs, towels, and mats. The hotels rooms have AC, which is a definite plus as I hear this is not always standard in Waikiki. The location of the hotel was also a plus - lots of places for shopping and eating within walking distance.The Not-So-Good:The beach that is within walking distance of the hotel is small and not that great. We had a rental car and my husband has been to Oahu before, so we drove about 35 minutes to a nicer beach for our beach time. I think the rooms could use a bit of updating. This might just be a personal preference, but I'm not a fan of carpeting in hotels.While I wouldn't have a problem staying here again, if I had a do-over, I would upgrade to a larger room. If we return to Waikiki, I will probably look for other hotel options to see what's out there before booking this property again. If you are honeymooning here, def treat yourself and go for a bigger room or look to another property for your trip.

Everything from the check in process, pineapple juice and cool towels at check in, to the free breakfast, wonderful valet guys, comfy room to location was awesome! Our view from the 12th floor was spectacular! I will absolutely stay here again when I return to Waikiki! The room was clean and perfect!

We planned just one night but decided to extend an additional night which wasn't a problem at all! We even got the same price as we booked months ago. The lobby is super chic and has an awesome I vibe! We received fresh pineapple juice and cold towels at check in. The continental breakfast is a great addition. We were able to borrow towels, mats, chairs and boogie boards for the beach which is just a few blocks away at no charge. The staff was super friendly and accommodating. Valet was a quick and easy process. Hardly any wait time. The rooms were comfy but small. Which isn't a big deal considering you are there just to sleep. It would be nice if they carried the feel of the lobby into the hallways and rooms as well. Other than that I would stay here again!

The Vive is a wonderfully located hotel , only a few minutes from Waikiki beach. It is very modern and the rooms are beautifully appointed..particuarly the suites with ocean views. Breathaking scenery of the water and up to Diamond Head. The continental breakfast included is more than adequate, and is provided in a communal lounge area which provides 24 hour tea and coffee and daily newspapers.The Vive also provides beach chairs and equipment for the beach.Thw staff are very friendly and courteous and so friendly. The rooms are spacious and so clean.. Will be planning my next trip back as soon as possible...aloha.

The Vive is a short 100m walk to the beach and the Duke statue(one of the landmark reference points every one uses, tour companies etc)Taking note of the reviews on TA we booked a junior suite which was Huge and only a bit more expensive. The shower was extodinary, I'm not sure if it was set up for Sumo wrestlers but space was never a problem.You get good service from the staff, beach gear is available free of charge. Wifi is good and continental breakfast is included.The ABC convenience store is 40mt away and a crazy Korean BBQ take out is just across the road me-b-b-q cheap and cheerful. The Cheesecake Factory is a 300m walk. Pick a trolley up at the duke statue and it's a $2 ride to al-amona. The bus stops outside of Vive and the 8 & 20 and there is heaps of others. In fact you can get the buss to diamond head and any where from here including pearl harbour.Other motels may be flasher but for size of rooms, service, cost and location this place is a winner.

This hotel was clean contemporary, and is in a great location a 5 minute walk to the beach and several shopping centers. All it needs is a fitness room and I would have given it 5 stars. Staff was friendly and very helpful from the service desk to the valet parking staff. Highly recommend staying here and its much cheaper than staying at the hotels that are directly across the street from Waikiki beach.

Just what we needed. Lobby is great and front desk is helpful. We used the free beach chair and boogie boards available courtesy of the hotel. Rooms are small but clean and modern. Breakfast with pastries and fresh fruit was a perfect way to fuel up for the day. Would definitely visit again!

Amazing, amazing, amazing. Cool hotel with lots of little perks, free delicious breakfast, all day coffee, beach mats, chairs, towels and body boards. Clean rooms, air conditioned and with good sized bathroom. And all this just a 3 minute walk to Waikiki beach, literally one block away! Must be a two thirds the price of some of the other hotels, and considering you can use all of the 5 star resorts amenities anyway, it is a no brainier to stay here. You will not be disappointed!!

This hotel was fantastic and I would stay there in a heartbeat, the rooms were a bit small but good enough for me. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is going to Hawaii for any reason. The staff were very courteous and attentive.

The room was what we needed the night before we left Hawaii. We were in the perfect location in downtown Waikiki. Easy to walk everywhere. The lobby was very trendy. We received cold towels and juice when we checked in. Our room was clean, but very small. The wall AC unit was not turned on when we checked in, so it took a while for the room to cool down.

This hotel is great value, with exceptional staff, and in a good location. It's a short walk to the beach and the hotel provides beach mats and clean towels every day for guests to take to the beach. The rooms are a little small, but comfortable and modern. The complimentary breakfast is simple but hey, it's free. The Hawaiian coffee is a great way to start the day. I would deffinitely recommend this hotel and I would deffinitely stay again.

Good location, but room smelled of mildew and the mini fridge has a posted sign that says does not keep perishables cold. Breakfast also is not Celiac friendly - tons of pastries and a little fruit. Overall, staff was nice and accommodating, but don't plan to return.

This hotel is clean and well managed. Internet connection is excellent throughout the hotel and within the room. Continental breakfast was good and staff were helpful. I would stay again. Beach towels were provided by front desk.

We stayed for one week here, and loved the location and helpful staff. I liked that the hotel had boogie boards that we could borrow. Continental breakfast was nice (lots of fresh fruit like papayas and melons). Rooms a bit on the small side.

Vive was very convenient to beach & activities.Beach chairs,towels & mats available for useStaff very helpful.Room a little small but very clean and comfortable.Very nice reception area with coffee & lemon water at all times

Vive hotel was in a great location.Two minute walk to the beach and surrounded by restaurants. Service and friendliness by reception staff was A++. Breakfast was good but only served toast cakes and fruit. Drinks of course too. Cleanliness good, ah ok, but the air conditioning was very noisy. Oh you couldnt swing a cat in the bathroom. The only downfalls. Ah, no pool or gardens to sit in. I guess its a hotel not a resort. Overall 8 out of 10. Would recommended for location and friendliness of staff.

Versatility, Chic, Comfortable and Affordable boutique hotel in the heart of Waikiki. You can read all about them on Yelp, Trip Advisor, tons of highly raved customer rating and honestly, excellence values for money!Here are top 10 reason why I love my stay and you should give it a try. Fresh pineapple juices upon entrance and complimentary breakfast every morning! Hotdog buns, croissants, blueburry toast, coffee, fresh fruits and etc. The breakfast was delicious, and a perfect way to start our day. We haven't stopped talking about how much we miss that breakfast selection! Can’t finish your leftover or having a midnight craved? They have microwaves and toaster! Yup, I did enjoyed the microwaves 5-6 times throughout my stay. #leftoverComplimentary beach gears. Google the rates of renting your own beach mats, umbrellas and chairs… Forget it, you can have this free of charge every day, when you come back from the beach 2-3 times with your wet towels, just pick up fresh new ones at the front desk. There is a bus stop right outside the hotel which can take you to Ala Moana, Pearl Harbour and the airport, and the buses are only $2.50 no matter how far you go. The buses came regularly and we believe great value compared to a rental car. And there are parking spot for bicycle. Distance to the beach, just few blocks away. And it is perfectly located in the middle of the strip, closer to Duke statue and Waikiki beach wall. I thought it was perfect as it is less crowded than main street. Hotel room is newly renovated and updated with modern contemporary design. Love it!5 out of 5 stars from front desk to housekeeping service! Very chill, donw to earth and welcoming environment. Jacqueline the concierge made our stay even better with her outstanding service! Service room : If you are taking a red eye flight back and hotel checkout is at 12pm, you can leave your baggage at the front desk, hit the beach and come back during your reserved hour to get freshen up or nap. It does required 24 hours advance reservation. One of my favorite place is Me BBQ, which is right across from the hotel. Easy, cheap and good. Pricing!!!! After writing through all the things I love about this place and still get to feel good for the price you pay. Two words: Worth It.

Our first time visiting Waikiki in Hawaii. We really had a wonderful experience staying in Vive hotel, good location close to beach, great helpful staffs. The beach gear rentals and guest room before departure to the airport were particularly useful. This will be our recommendations to our friends and relative s who come to Honolulu.

My friend and I stayed here for 12 nights last week. Our first impression was that the hotel looked beautiful, staff were so friendly, and despite some reviews we found the room to have plenty of space for us and all our shopping. The breakfast was delicious, and a perfect way to start our day. Upon arriving home, we haven't stopped talking about how much we miss that breakfast selection! The hotel is perfectly located, literally steps away from a bus stop, and it took us no more than 2 minutes walking slowly to get to the beach. Plenty of great restaurants, shops, and nightlife were within walking distance, making our stay easy as we didn't have to worry about transport. When we did want to get somewhere further away (e.g. Hanauma Bay) the friendly and helpful staff were more than willing to assist us with arranging transport.The bed and pillows were some of the most comfortable I have ever slept on! Usually I can't wait to get back to my own bed after a holiday, but I honestly miss the bed at Vive.Would definitely stay here again, and will recommend this hotel to anyone I know travelling to Waikiki. Thank you for a great stay!

I loved this hotel. It warm and the welcome was so friendly. The 24 hour reception was extremely helpful, given our flight coming into the Honolulu was delayed by 3 hours and we didn't arrive at the hotel until after midnight. We were greeted with a cold towel to refresh out face and a cold glass of orange juice. So nice!! Our room was basic, but very nice and the bad was super comfy. The shower was excellent, and the facilities great, the only downside was the air conditioning unit, it was so loud. We had to turn it off on a few nights, as trying to sleep with it on was difficult. We asked for our room to be serviced on the 3rd morning, and thinking they would service it just the once, they came back every morning there after with fresh towels, and the bed beautifully made. The continental breakfast was nice, basic, with fresh fruit, breakfast muffins and toast, tea and coffee but it was enough to start off the day. They also provide towel, mats, boogie board etc to take down to the beach, and you can have this free of charge every day, so you come back from the beach with your wet towels, and you just pick up fresh new ones the following day! That was a great highlight as there is nothing worse trying to dry out your soggy beachtowel ready for the next day. The staff were excellent, so friendly, and they couldn't help you enough,We highly recommend staying here.

This was my first trip to Honolulu and the hotel was in the perfect location to walk every where and close to transit. will recommend and will stay at Vive again. Staff were very helpful, always friendly. Hotel very clean and great amenities, only thing was no iron in the room. Stay was great will be back soon.

Great place, good price for its location and very friendly staff. We had the Junior Suite which had plenty of room. Would have like a bit bigger fridge that wasa able to keep things a bit cooler than it did.

Great hotel! Friendly employees and the amenities such as beach towels, beach chairs, and boogie boards. Would stay again! the rooms were a bit small, but we spent most of our days outside and whatnot.

I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family! It offered everything we wanted for our first time in Oahu. The staff were helpful and friendly,the location couldn't be better, and the pastries and fruit offered in the morning allowed us to start the day off right!

great place to stay. probably not a great place for a family with kids. Very clean. Uptodate and modern. The only issue was the shower. The shower head was so powerful, it belonged more at the circus for cleaning elephants than humans.

We stayed at Vive Waikiki for a week in June and it was the best decision we could have made. The rooms were modern and had nice furniture and were a great size for a couple. The ensuite was lovely and well maintained and the shampoos etc smelt amazing!! The walk to the beach is only 1-2 minutes if that and the staff downstairs will give you beach towels, boogie boards etc. We found all the staff we dealt with so friendly and helpful. We found the breakfast options a bit too sweet compared to what we are used to, i.e. the muffins and sweet toast but you could buy muesli and yogurt at the ABC store 1 minutes walk away for only a couple of dollars. The fresh fruit and ice cold water on offer was fantastic though. In the downstairs area where you have breakfast there is a little library of books you can borrow to read on the beach which has some great titles and was a real bonus.There is a bus stop right outside the hotel which can take you to Ala Moana, Pearl Harbour and the airport, and the buses are only $2.50 no matter how far you go (be warned they don't give change though!) The buses came regularly and we believe great value compared to a rental car. We would love to come back to Hawaii in the future and will definitely stay at Vive if we do! Thank you so much to everyone at Vive for helping us have a wonderful holiday!

The "Queen" size room doesn't really seem "Queen" like. The bathroom was really small. The TV was more adjusted for the person on the right side of the bed rather than the middle. Overall, the staff was nice and greeted. The room was clean and had enough towels in the bathroom that covered our stay. Even the housekeeper greeted me in the hall! They did well with the complimentary breakfast... The coffee kept running out and they refilled or brought out new containers. I also liked the set up in the dining/check-in area. Very stylish but simple. Lots of colors and bold colors that complimented the room well.

This hotel is filled with an excellent staff, great location and gives a homely feeling. The continental breakfast was great. Would highly recommend to others. Great Value! Had a great time, service was excellent!

good location, great appearance, friendly and helpful staff, very clean.Rooms are WAY TOO SMALL for 2 people! Can´t hardly move around in the bathroom, not enough space for baggage etc.Overall the Hotel is very recommendable!

We went to VIVE Hotel Waikiki for our Honeymoon. We stayed for 8 days.We arrived early, but were able to freshen up and change. We were given complimentary beach towel and beach chair and we went to the beach (2 block straight ahead of the hotel - past plenty of 'ABC' grocery stores where water is $1.10).The room was a Queen and there was enough space for both of us. I had requested a room towards the top of the building. The room had AC and blinds. Room cleaned and soaps refreshed everyday! The decor was modern and there were no signs of deterioration. The shower was a good pressure.The location is perfect for Waikiki Beach and all attractions around Honolulu. You can either get the public bus to most places on the island (bus stop outside the Hotel) or the VIVE Hotel Concierge can arrange everything for you including shuttle buses to attractions.As mentioned already, 2 blocks straight ahead of the Hotel is Waikiki Beach.

Vive Hotel offered excellent Value and Service. We found all staff to be most helpful and would highly recommend to others. Location was excellent and Buffet breakfast was adequate although not to our liking. Generally a very pleasant stay

We were extremely impressed by the Vive! If you are looking for a clean, modern hotel in a great location and you aren't fussed about having a pool etc then look no further! There is soo much to see and do in Hawaii so this is the perfect base its a two min walk from the main strip, beach, shops and restaurants. The staff are super friendly and always willing to go the extra mile :) We will def stay at the Vive when we return to Hawaii.

Great hotel, nice staff, great value. Highly recommend to others. The continental brekfast and free coffee/tea though out the day is really nice. The basic room is a little small, but who cares since you are in hawaii anyways ...

A great location 2 minutes walk from the beach. Beach towels available from reception; who needs a pool?! opportunity to have a courtesy room to shower and change on our final day was fantastic (we had an evening flight and spent the afternoon on the beach). All in all highly recommended.

I don't get people who think they need to spend $500 a night for a Waikiki beachfront hotel room when all they're there to do is to sleep in the room! Instead, save some money and book a couple of block off the beach. That's what we did. We booked Vive Hotel Waikiki after reading the Tripadvisor reviews and were more than pleased with the place! It has an upscale vibe, yet it's affordable (you can save your $$$ for fun Hawaii activities!). The rooms are clean, the beds are comfy, and the shower is great. The continental breakfast is an added bonus. Only one minor complaint: we could hear some traffic noise although when the A/C was running it was a moot point. What sets this hotel apart is the staff: extremely friendly and helpful. Always great with directions, recommendations, and beach gear. We appreciated the beach mats and beach towels! You're a 5 minute walk to the beautiful beaches of Waikiki. We LOVED staying here and would definitely book again!

My husband and I stayed at the Vive for the weekend. The location was great,within minutes from Waikiki Beach and shopping. the room was spacious and quiet. We really enjoyed the intimate, peaceful, friendly, boutique hotel environment and complimentary breakfast! A big Mahalo to Samantha, Sahara, and Chris for the warm, friendly and efficient reception! Thanks to Tyler, Nick, and Adam, terrific valets who greeted us with a smile, and we never had to wait for our car! The Vive is truly a gem in the heart of Waikiki!

We loved our stay at Vive, the breakfast was just enough and the staff was super friendly and helpful. My only complaint is that the room did not have a dresser for our cloths, other than that everything was extremely perfect!

This hotel was in a great location. Nice area to walk around, the beach was right down the street. Hotel pickup for Pearl Harbor was around the corner. After a full day of travel, being welcomed with a cold washcloth and fresh juice was a nice added touch.

We stayed at the Vive for three nights at the start of our trip in Hawaii. It is a small boutique hotel two blocks from Waikiki beach on a main road . The service is good and when we check-in they offered a cold juice just what we wanted after a long flight. The rooms are small but adequate and breakfast is supplied in the lobby in a casual setting made up of fresh fruit, toast , croissants and muffins with tea , coffee and juice available. Being on a main street it was noisy during the night but after staying some where else in Waikiki later in the trip we realized it is noisy everywhere with garabe collection very early in the morning. All in all this is a pleasant place to stay at an affordable price with strong WiFi included.

Except for the noisy airconditioner we felt the room was more than adequate. It was very clean. Shower was great. Hotel staff were amazing and so friendly. The breakfast in the Lounge was a great way to start the day and the coffee, tea and iced water was greatly appreciated at any time through the day. We were constantly refilling our water bottles. The location was perfect.

I was in Hawaii for business and went with the Vive because it had a great location. The rooms are small but the price, welcoming staff and great location can't be beat. The hotel is located three short blocks from the beach and about 4 or 5 blocks from the major shopping district.

Only a short walk from the beach, shops and the best udon restautant in Waikiki. Beach gear was available and the free continental breakfast in the morning was a nice touch. Room was a nice size and bed was comfortable. Only negative was aurcon in room was very loud and the bathroom and shower. I've travelled to Europe, so a small bathroom is not a surprise but this one was very poorly designed. There was no window and virtually no ventilation. Shower was also terrible - water came out like a jet stream rather than a spray making showering a bit uncomfortable. Not sure if this was just my room (1709) or the shower facilities generally. All in all, a nice hotel that is good value for money but avoid room 1709 if you can.

From the moment we checked in after that long flight from the mainland (including an 8 hour layover in one airport), and were greeted with fresh pineapple juice and much appreciated cooling towels, we knew we had found the perfect place to stay in Waikiki. It only got better with every day. We had read of the rooms being small, but found ours to be of more than ample size, with great views of the area and that all-important easy access to the beach. I can't say enough about the total professionalism of the staff. Every detail of our every need was given their utmost attention as though we were their only guests. From the fresh fruits and pastries of breakfast in the morning, providing us with beach towels, mats and even boogie boards whenever we headed out to the beach, to our numerous requests for ice throughout the day, to offering advice on places to find our evening meal, or even just chatting about how our adventures of the day had gone, every member of the Vive staff was extremely courteous and helpful. Upon learning of our later flight off the island, they graciously stored our bags after checkout so we could make the most of hour remaining hours in Waikiki, provided us with a room to freshen up in before leaving, and arranged for our shuttle service to the airport. It simply isn't done any better than that anywhere. We'd like to offer a sincere Mahalo Nui Loa to our favorite hotel in all of Waikiki. Rest assured we will always return to the Vive for our next visit and highly recommend them to anyone.

The good - OK for a short stay. It's clean, 10 minutes walk to the beach, close to restaurants and the staff are efficient and friendly. The price includes continental breakfast, free WiFi and coffee, tea and water are available downstairs all day. The average - The rooms are very small and the bathrooms are tiny. We could hear the people in the next room talking, laughing, showering, using the toilet. The bed was small with a hollow in the middle and the air-con was too loud. There is no real dining room, it's just a room with odd shaped chairs and coffee tables which looked chic but were not practical. The food selection for the continental breakfast is very limited and I would not call it a breakfast.

Location is great because it is only a few blocks from the beach (like a 3 minute walk) and it is central to great places to eat and drink. Staff is awesome, provide beach goodies and breakfast. WiFi is fast. Rooms are not super large but comfortable. I've read reviews about the bus stop or noisy neighbors but didn't experience that during my trip. Only thing to be aware of the bathroom is only a few feet from the bed and its a sliding door so you can hear everything. For me, it wasn't an issue but some might not be comfortable with that. Anyways, it is a great hotel, service is wonderful, breakfast is great, close to the beach and no resort fee! It really helps to save some money by staying at this hotel.

Only a few blocks from Waikiki beach with great value compared to some of the other big name hotels in the area. Breakfast is provided along with towels, mats, and boogie boards for the beach. One small negative is that the ice machine is only on the first floor.

Had a great time, staff is very professional and helpfulContinental breakfast a plusGreat location, near everything in Waikiki! Close to great restaurants and shopping Highly recommended for business or family stay.

Vive has the best staff; a traveler couldn't ask for more friendly and sincere service from this hotel. Well done!Vive is a good value for families, they are very close to Waikiki Beach, they offer great amenities and the continental breakfast and constant water supply was a great touch. We also loved the lobby/lounge area (it was tastefully and practically renovated). The rooms are a little small, but you can tell it's an older building, so it's not too big of an issue as everything else makes up for it! Love this place!

Stayed at the Vive for three nights on a quick Hawaii getaway from the mainland. We had a great experience here--its only one and a half blocks from the beach but is much calmer than the main strip. The rooms are small but modern design. The free continental buffet (pastry and fruit and juices) is very impressive.Its not the youngest clientele (seemed like older couples when we saw people in the lobby) but the staff was friendly and attentive. Overall in terms of value for your dollar it was a great find!

Good location. They provided beach towels, mats, boogie boards. The courtesy room was a nice feature, we had a late fight and were able to book the courtesy room for an hour to shower and clean up before our flight

Vive was a great value for the price. Great location, nice amenities (towels, mats, gear, etc) and super friendly staff. The continental breakfast was really nice and the rooms were small but completely adequate--it's not as if you want to spend your time in Hawaii sitting in your hotel room.

This was our second stay at VIVE and as the last time it was brilliant. All staff are always going above and beyond to help you out. Rooms are extremely clean and well air conditioned. Minutes from Waikiki beach, restaurants and shops. Thank you VIVE!!

My husband and I stayed here for 1 week while visiting my sister. This hotel truly is beautifully decorated and very warm and welcoming. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful with all requests. I like that they offer beach towels, mats, chairs, and boogie boards that you can borrow for the day. The location is great, less than 5 minutes from the beach, and within walking distance of all the shopping/dining we needed during our stay. Make sure to check out the Coconut Cafe across the street for great sandwiches and shaved ice!! The only (minor) criticism is that the room was a bit small, but did not really affect us much since we did not spend a lot of time at the hotel. Also, would have been nice to have a gym facility, but again, not much of a real issue with us. It was very nice to also have the courtesy room after our check out, as we were flying on the red-eye home and did not leave Waikiki until 6pm. Continental breakfast was good, mainly for the abundance of fresh fruit. Thank you to the staff for a great stay! We will be back when we visit Honolulu again!

Traveled with my son. Not a good hotel when traveling with kids. No roll away bed, no pool, no kid friendly amenities. Don't recommend for family travel. I had to sleep on the chairs in the room for 9 nights.

My husband and I stayed at the Vive for the second leg of our Hawaiian honeymoon. The location of the hotel was excellent just across the street from the beach. The hotel us modern and we found the rooms a sufficient size. Staff were friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was great. There's no pool in the hotel but with it being so close to the beach that wasn't a problem for us. The air con is very loud however and our room was noisy even though it was on the 19th floor. Overall we would use this hotel again as it offers excellent value
user_name:
Lowri R
Merthyr Tydfil, United Kingdom

review_body: We have just returned from a week at the VIVE and loved it. The location is excellent, just two blocks from the beach. Room was quiet and large (we had a suite). Regular rooms are a bit small. The staff were wonderful and went out of their way to be helpful. Hotel amenities (beach towels, boards, mats etc) were appreciated. Would highly recommend to anyone looking for a hotel in Waikiki.

As others have mentioned the hotel is only 3 blocks to the beach, about a 2 mins walk.Staff were great. You can get beach towels and body boards from them free of charge. Breakfast was so so, you can find better places to eat elsewhere.Room was small but clean. The only problem was the ridiculously loud aircon that would grunt every 10 mins and the sound of vans/trucks beeping and backing up next door.There is also free wifi and tv for those who don't like to go outside.Valet parking is provided at extra charge and they were quite prompt.

Great Location - Reception was helpful, concierge helped with bookings for tours and shows. Only a few hundred metres to the beach. Basic but sufficient continental breakfast available every morning, rooms a little small, access to a pool would be a huge improvement.
Property quiet and clean with an upscale feel. Exactly what I was looking for. Would stay here again and recommend to others.Morning continential breakfast was good for a start to each day...........

The hotel has a welcoming lobby to make you feel relaxed. Staff members are helpful and have a great attitude. Easy access to the beach that is 3 blocks away. Beach towels and accessories are free. Very nice boutique hotel indeed.

Have just came home from 10 night at Vive. You would struggle to find better accomodation for the price anywhere in Waikiki. The location is perfect - beach a short stroll away, bus stop at your door, walking distance to all of Waikikis restaurants and shops. The staff are all so obliging. A big thank you to Chris. From the welcoming drink and towels, advise, free beach gear and friendly aloha everyday. The free wifi is great. The breakfast basic but really nice. Try the blueberry bread! We had a junior suite which was a great size and had views of Waikiki beach and Diamond Head. As others had mentioned the only negative was the noise, but we turned the air-con off at night and was still very comfortable. There was no noise from within the hotel, only street noise which I guess you would get anywhere. We are recommending Vive to all our friends that travel to Ohau.

Great boutique hotel in the heart of Waikiki with a 5 minute walk to Waikiki Beach. Our room had all we needed - safe for our valuables, fridge. Don't miss the drawers underneath the bed for extra storage! Bed was super comfy! We lucked out and got a corner room with two windows, so we got a great cross breeze. Staff and service was top notch. Always said hello with a smile and helped us with anything we needed. We rented a car at the airport, so we used their valet, which was $25 a night (unlimited ins and outs). Really good continental breakfast with fresh fruit, pastries, coffee and juice. For some cheap great eats, make sure to check out Musubi Cafe Iyasume right across the street. Liquor store directly across the street as well for evening beer runs! I would highly recommend this place for a chill Waikiki experience. Avoid the tourist trap resorts and their hidden fees and stay at Vive Hotel! Mahalo!

We booked a room at this Hotel with partial ocean view & King-size bed. When we arrived, turns out that the type of room we booked only had Queen size beds despite the booking form we had. The hotel upgraded our room to a ocean view suite for a huge discount. Room was great, very spacious, King-size bed and had a great view down to the beach almost to where the statue of the Duke is. Found the staff very friendly & were greeted with chairs to sit in, cold drinks and face washers when we arrived. Was all very much appreciated and made feel very welcome. Free wifi is included in the price and a continental breakfast is also included. Breakfast is mainly fruit, toast & sweet pastries but is a satisfying way to start the day and convenient right in the ground floor of the Hotel. Location of this hotel is convenient to the Beach and shops. A very convenient location. Overall we were very happy with out stay.

We had a great stay at the Vive Hotel. When we checked in, we were given glasses of pineapple juice and cold towels - a lovely touch. Our first room had some problems but after a quick phone call to the front desk, we were immediately changed to another room. The room that we had was clean and had everything that we needed. The only slight problem we had was with the air conditioning - this was a plug in unit and was quite noisy as it came on and off (presumably because of the thermostat).The hotel is in a great location - just a few minutes' walk away from the beach and near to a supermarket, Food Pantry, if you need one. (The supermarket looks small from the outside but is actually quite large inside). There is also a bus stop right outside the hotel where you can catch buses to the major spots, such as Pearl Harbor.There is a nice lounge area where coffee and tea are available all day. A simple help yourself continental breakfast is put out until 9:30am every day. There was free wifi throughout the hotel and unlike most hotels, the connection did not drop and require reconnection as soon as you put your phone down.I would definitely stay here again and would recommend the Vive if you are looking for a good value, clean and conveniently located hotel.

We are truly happy we stayed at Vive Hotel. All of the staff was outstanding and more than happy to assist us in every way! Staff was always available for assistance with our car and any other service!

An amazing place nestled only a few streets away from the main hub of Waikiki. Close enough and yet far enough.Stayed in an ocean view room which was clean, new yet a little tight, ended up upgrading to a junior suite - well worth it for the amount of space you have. Loved the fact that there's coffee & tea on tap downstairs, and that a continental breakfast is included. Kudos to your wonderful front desk staff, in particular the lovely Samantha.

Was pleasantly surprised at my stay at the Vive. Was in town for business and stayed for 10 days and throughout my stay the service by the staff there was excellent. It obviously was an older motel that was currently in the process of having renovations done to it as there was a hole in the wall on the floor I exited the elevator to my room. The room was modern and sufficient for my needs with a large comfy bed. Only issue was the toilet got easily blocked. Overall a good stay.

Extremely small room, very noisy. Appears to have been renovated recently very badly. Bath tub paint was peeling. Could hardly move in the bathroom. Foyer is nice. Continental breakfast provided with standard pastries.

If you're a frugal vacationist, VIVE Hotel Waikiki will be your best bet. Small boutique hotel located 1 block away from the beach! With zero resort fees, free welcome drinks and cool towels upon arrival, free continental breakfast during your stay, free coffee/tea all day and free beach gears! Clean place with friendly staff! By booking with Vive, we are saving $$$ but still able to enjoy what a 4- or 5-star hotel would offer. Perfect 10 for us!

Vive Hotel had a wonderful feel, it was classy.The decor and the layout of the front foyer and beyond was amazing. The staff were very welcoming and helpful.The hotel was in a very good position, a couple of blocks from the beach.Our room and bathroom were small,but very comfortable. The bed was great.The hotel was a very good price for what it offered. Shops etc were a block away. We highly recommend "Vive"

Hotel's location is two blocks from Beach front, we woke up daily to see Pacific Ocean!!! Bus Stop is only a few steps away. Hotel Staff are friendly, room clean, Housekeeping Team were flexible, and you can see Clean crew working throughout the Hotel....felt like staying at home, coffee, tea, hot water anytime of the day, Hotel also offer daily free breakfast. Beach Towel available at Front Desk. We will recommend Vive to friends, relatives and we shall return to Vive to REVIVE!

Hotel very clean great ambiance friendly staff who were very helpful. Location perfect and on bus route, few blocks from beach, would totally recommend this hotel for value for money. Hotel has boogie boards beach towels and chairs available for guestd.

Vive was a nicely priced hotel and was occupied with a very friendly and accommodating staff. Their continental breakfast was very well done and the decor of the hotel reminded me of being at Las Vegas with how swank and chic it was. Thanks Vive, I planto return soon

Location is great and staff is very helpful! Everyone always had a smile on their face. Perks included great simple continental breakfast and loaner chairs, mats and towels. Upon arrival we received fresh towels and pineapple juice. Coffee, water and tea was provided all day.

This hotel is better than the larger hotels and resorts as you get a more personalised experience. The staff were fantastic from check in to check out. Our room, although smaller in size, was absolutely perfect and contained everything we needed for our stay. The blinds do let in a bit of light and the room can get noisy on weekends so if you are a light sleeper just ask for a quieter room and you should be fine. They even offer free access to beach towels and little deck chairs which was fantastic. Every night we would grab them and take a 1 minute walk to the beach to watch the sunset. Very close to great eateries and shops for all the little things. Will definitely be back.

I usually stay at name-brand hotels (Marriott, Hilton, Hyatt, etc.) when I travel but I decided to give this hotel a chance due to the package deal I received. I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised with what I got for the money. The hotel was within walking distance to the beach. The staff was friendly, welcoming and helpful. The room was small but I was expecting that because it is a boutique hotel. The air conditioning unit in the window was a little difficult to regulate but it was not a deal-breaker. I didn't miss having a pool because the beach is right down the street. I didn't miss having a gym because we went and ran at the park which was a couple of blocks away. If I were to return to this property, I would probably pay a little extra and upgrade to the Junior Suite or an Ocean View just to have a little more room. But for the service and the price, this was a deal that couldn't be beat.

I got more than I expected .Hotel is very clean atmosphere amazing. Brand new rooms with beautiful view.We were very impressed with KC who helped us with our stay and acivities.what a beautiful and pleasant personality.Congratulations to this hotel.Will be back for sure.

Friendly and helpful staff. Check in and check out are simple and straight forward. Very close to everything. Good value for money. The room we stayed in is just enough in size and was cleaned everyday.

Great location and staff were friendly, informative and welcoming. Close to everywhere for easy commute. Good value for money given proximity to all attractions and beach. Would highly recommend to others.

Was ready for a new hotel and chose the VIVE based on reviews. Very good value for the price. Great amenities, excellent service, and conveniently located. Very close to the beach, shops, restaurants, and public transportation. The room was small, but clean and efficient. Liked the hotel and will definitely stay there again.

We chose this hotel based on a friend's recommendation and absolutely loved it for so many reasons: The location was perfect. A two-block, five-minute walk to the beach, close to great restaurants, and near the bus stop. Musubi Cafe and Me's Bar-B-Que (Korean food) were two hole-in-the-wall restaurants across the street that we discovered and loved.Decor was modern and clean. Everything felt so posh and comfortable. The lobby and "living room" area were lovely and great just to sit in to eat or read. The rooms, while small, were great. It was just my husband and I so we didn't need a lot of room. It had everything we needed and having a mini-fridge in the room was super handy. We also really liked the grapefruit-scented body wash.We really appreciated having the continental breakfast every morning. Even though it was simple, the variety changed slightly from day-to-day, and it was nice to not have to go hunt for food first thing in the morning. We loved the pineapple juice! We also loved having the coffee, tea, and water available throughout the day. The hotel also provided beach towels, chairs, and mats as well, which was very convenient. Finally, the staff were SO great! Everyone we encountered was incredibly friendly and helpful, from the front desk staff to the housekeeping staff. Even if we only shared an elevator ride with them, they were so cheerful and friendly. When we couldn't get the microwave in the living room to work, the front desk staff were prompt in getting someone from facilities to check on it. And when the printer attached to the guest computer wouldn't work to print our flight boarding passes, the staff immediately let us use the computer behind the front desk to print. The only cons about the hotel was not having a lanai (balcony), which would have been nice. I understand a lot of hotels don't have balconies, so it's not a big deal. The other cons would be that the air conditioner is a little noisy (but tolerable) and to have more hangers in the closet. Since there isn't a dresser to put our clothes, it would have been nice to hang up more items instead of leaving them in our suitcase.Will definitely stay here again!

Outstanding customer service, value, and location. The staff has an upbeat "can do" attitude and it is evident that they believe in the product. This was my third stay on business and look forward to staying with my wife on a future visit

Great location in Kuhio St 5 mins walk to Waikiki beach. Hotel staff were friendly and very helpful. Room was clean and decor was modern and funky. The hotel is also very good value considering the location. Will definitely be staying at Vive again.

If you are on a tight budget, look no further. This is the hotel for you. Like everyone else said, it's in a great location and easy walking distance of restaurants, shops, bars and the beach. However, if you're debating between saving some cash or spending just a little more to get you some additional amenities, read on. Here are some things I wish I had clearly understood before coming here. This is my review after staying 4 nights and 5 days during May 2015. Every aspect of our stay fell a little short:- Their standard rooms are tiny. Think Europe, NYC and San Francisco tiny. Had they put a little more effort into room design, the space may have been better utilized. We had to keep most of our items in our suitcase because there weren't sufficient hangers and/or hooks to hang up most of our clothes. We spent most of our time exploring and sightseeing but it made spending the little time we had in the room messy and difficult. - Their bathrooms are tiny and the toilet is literally 3-4 feet from the bed (in the standard queen room). Make sure you are traveling with a tight traveling companion as you can hear EVERYTHING. - The room does not have central air. There is an AC unit that it mounted next to the window and is quite noisy. It was warm a few of the nights and sleeping with it on was quite loud. Also, even when it's off, the room is super loud because the vents of the AC unit let the street noise in. We were facing the main street on the 7th floor and could hear every bus and every car that drove by during all hours of the night. - The mini fridge is not cold. They actually had a sign on it that said not to put perishable food items as it would not preserve the food due to temperature. This was disappointing because we couldn't keep any juice or yogurt in there for a quick snack. - The bed is soft and lumpy. I would imagine importing mattresses into Hawaii is quite expensive and would be cost prohibitive to change out as needed. Who knows how old these mattresses are. Loud noises coming through the vents + poor quality mattress does not equal a good night's sleep. - Lack of attention to detail of the cleaning crew. We only had our room cleaned once during our whole trip (per our request). For some reason they did not take out all the trash or replace dirty glasses with clean ones. This was a head scratcher. - No pool or hotel bar. Why does this matter if you're steps from the beach? After 3 days of visiting various beaches, we wanted to have a lazy afternoon and lay out poolside and have some drinks. Unfortunately, neighboring hotels with pools reserve their pools exclusively for guests which is when we officially regretted booking a hotel without a pool. Overall I'd give this place 2.5 stars. If you read through the other reviews, you'll find lots of comments about "I got a great deal" or "great value" so the overall rating should be tempered with that context. We go on weeklong trips like this only once or twice a year and are fortunate enough to have a little spending capacity for modest upgrades. Our rationale for booking one of the cheapest hotel options was so we could put those savings towards activities. What we failed to realize was that despite spending so much time outside, we still spent about 35-40% of our time in the hotel room (sleeping, resting, changing, etc). So in conclusion, if you only need a hotel for a night or two, stay here. If you're on a tight budget, stay here. If you work hard and this is one of the only vacations you'll take all year and have the option to spend a little more, I would consider doing so. In the grand scheme of things, it'll be worth every penny.

Clean,comfortable. Loved the spacious shower. Bed was comfy. Perfect for the business traveler or a couple.Conveniently located in Waikiki; close to shopping and the beach is only a block away! Recommended

The hotel is located right next to bus stop that can take you to ala moana, Pearl harbour, Chinatown, downtown Honolulu. It is a short walk to the main stretch of Waikiki so location is very central.They also provide beach towels and continental breakfast.Room was clean, air con rather noisy, space wise a bit tight but it's okay. The walls quite thin so we could hear the guests next door having conversation.Concierge helped with booking shuttle to airport and waikele.Overall we would return and recommended to others.Thanks to Michael who provided efficient check in for us after a long flight.

Our trip to Hawaii was nothing short of absolutely awesome and the Vive Hotel is a big reason why . We booked this hotel based on the great reviews we read. I can confirm that the positive reviews we read about the hotel were very accurate and worthy of the praise . The staff ( Britt , Bev & Cody to name a few) are truly wonderful and extremely helpful. The fact that there were no additional hotel fees only made the stay that much sweeter !! They had a room open up and gave us a free upgrade on the night of our 25th wedding anniversary ....classy !!

For this to be my first trip to Honolulu, this hotel was a great experience. Reasonable, and very close to the beach, great amenities, excellent service . I love the location of my room (909). I defiantly return to The Vive Hotel, on my next visit.

Nice place near the beach. Got very good service from KC of the staff on arranging our snorkeling and our surfing trip. Nice clean, simple room. Good wifi. Free continental breakfast (simple and healthy). All staff is very helpful.

I like this hotel. Everything is good. The staffs are very nice. 2 mins walk to the beach. The room is clean enough. But the room is small, and the ocean view room only can see very small pics of ocean.

In Hawaii for our belated 10th anniversary. Decided on the Vive based on reviews. The rooms are small like everyone mentions but who lives in a hotel room while on vacation in Hawaii? After first night we asked if we could move to a higher floor and away from the birds that wanted to wake us up so early the first morning we were there. They happily moved us to a higher floor and on the opposite side of the hotel for our next 2 nights. The room was a little bigger, and in both cases very clean and had what you needed. The WiFi was great so we could keep in contact with friends that were staying elsewhere. The continental breakfast was very good, the eating area was great and the music they played made it very relaxing. And last but not least was the staff. Everyone we dealt with at the front desk were amazing--outgoing, friendly, willing to got the extra mile.

I like to have coffee before I shower and dress, but couldn't because there wasn't a coffee pot in the room. Couldn't heat leftover from a meal somewhere because we didn't have a microwave. Had to go to the lobby for coffee and to microwave food.

Kind of small but not bad. The aircon was little bit noisy but okey. There's parking. Needs to order or get out to eat. Not much room for clothes. Better for short stay than longer. Rheres free wifi, tv to watch on, mini fridge, etc.

My boyfriend and I were in Hawaii for a week for a wedding, coming from Sydney, Australia. After a lot of research we chose the Vive Hotel as the best option for our budget and needs and we were definitely not disappointed. The hotel is beautiful, modern and clean and provides complimentary wifi for the duration of your stay, which was a saviour for us trying to keep in contact with other wedding guests to coordinate our days and nights. The staff were absolutely lovely and friendly and made our trip. We asked for help finding a good show one night, a booking for snorkelling at Hanouma Bay and a taxi home (departing at 5am no less). The staff were always helpful and friendly to us and delivered their service with a smile. The room itself was a little bit smaller than I anticipated, but this was no big deal as we weren't planning to spend a great deal of time there anyway. As mentioned before it was immaculately presented and clean and we would happily stay there again. The hotel itself is 2 blocks (2 minute walk) from the beach and the shops so extremely central. We would recommend to anyone to stay here, the value for money was simply amazing and we could not have been happier that we picked the Vive to spend our holiday.

Excellent location, customer service and room condition (small room but clean), but seems like they try to save their hotel amenities as much as they can. I had to leave a note on my 4th day asking for an extra set of amenities (shampoo, shower gel etc). We were running out of them from day 2 but there was no replacement until i asked for it. (The hotel is right next to waikiki beach and ppl do beach swim nearly everyday and need a shower more than twice a day).The continental breakfast was much better than i expected. Nice breads and fruits! There is no coffee/tea facilities in the room but you can get them in the dining room on the 1st floor where you have breakfast.

Location of hotel was convenient on Kuhio Ave which is one street parallel from the main st where most of the shopping is. Waikiki beach was a short walk away - under 5 mins. Bus stop to go to Ala Moana S/C right in front. Room itself was clean and simple. I stayed in the mountain twin B/R. Ear plugs come in handy as every sound comes through the thin walls - rubbish collection trucks, guests talking in adjoining room (can even hear them showering), traffic, etc. Beds were comfortable enough although personally a tad softer than I usually like. Wifi was OK although can be slow at times. Nice to have full length mirror in the room. Bathroom is quite small - bumped against the glass shelf which made my things fall into the basin, also poor design placement as towel rack was placed over the toilet and on one occasion the towel almost fell into the toilet. The shower head is fixed (hot hand held) and very high up so when you turn on the water it hits the tub very loudly.Breakfast was okay - about 3-4 types of pastries (plain croissants, apple danishes, etc), two types of sliced bread, fruit (pineapple, honeydew, rock melon & orange), coffee, tea and juice. All in all, the stay was good enough for me.

You would be hard pressed to find a better hotel, nice quite, great location lots places in area to eat within walking distant to most thing bus stop at the door and across the road a booking agent for tours

The staff was excellent, hotel clean and stylish (boutique), room clean and up to date, bed comfortable, ac worked well, breakfast delicious, and price-to-value unbeatable. Location is just two blocks from the beach, and the hotel provides complimentary mats, towels. Would definitely stay here again.

Excellent location and value for money. Perfect spot for easy access to beach and two minute walk to rental car depot. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly and the rooms were serviced to a high standard
user_name:
Junell R
Kapiti Coast, New Zealand

review_body: We stayed here on our honeymoon and it was a great place to stay. It was great value for money and the staff were great and very friendly. The room was a little small but we knew this before staying here but who goes on a holiday to stay in the hotel! It was super close to everything especially the beach, restaurants and buses. Breakfast was not that great but it was free so was good for what you were expecting. Great that it had free wifi as well. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would gladly stay here again.

The hotel is very clean and the breakfast is very good as well. All staffs are friendly and I will go back again in the future. Also, the hotel is located at a great location that I can access to all convenient stores or the beach or shopping.

What a great place to stay - respectful, polite and professional staff all the time and the hotel is so handy to everything on foot or by bus.The front desk staff were very helpful with tips for getting about and recommendations.Loved the Balinese theme each time as you walk in the door and being handed a cold fruit juice on check-in - was a nice touch.

Hotel was Marvelous. Close to everything. We were amazed by hotel and the staff. I don't have one complaint in the 10 days we stayed at the Vive. Our concierge KC was incredible. He even bought me a present for my birthday, he booked all our trips with ease and had Hawaiian leis delivered from my brother. We will go back and I pray KC is still there. I consider him my friend now.

Stayed here for four nights and we are full of praise! Good location , about five minute walk to beach , supermarket nearby , major shopping close by. Central to many things. Staff were professional , friendly and helpful. Rooms are not large but good and a free breakfast in a relaxed lounge downstairs is provided each morning. Tea and coffee available constantly. HIGHLY recommended.

Really enjoyed my recent stay at the Vive. The hotel is in a great location only a few blocks from Waikiki beach, staff are very friendly, helpful and they offer beach towels/chairs (etc) for free. Nice to have muffins/pastries and fruit for breakfast and there's coffee available all day. Would definitely stay again.

pro-good hotel. excellent staff. very nice location. close to bus, restaurant, beach, stores, car rentals and everything. excellent front desk staff and concierge. front desk's Samantha was extremely nice and helpful. cons-room was a very compacted. air conditioner was loud. Thats it.

Hotel Vive has a great price value. It's got everything that you need and is convienently located! The personnel is very friendly and the rooms are nice and clean. I can recommend this hotel and was totally satisfied.

Room was very small and bathroom was right next to the bed.The refrigerator wasn't cold enough so i didnt trust eating my leftovers.I had to ask for wash clothes on 2 occasions and they bought hand towels bc they ran out.The continental breakfast was fresh and a good start to the day. No pool or balcony to hang out at but other hang out spots are within walking distance. Good choice if you wanna save a buck and don't need all the nice amenities that come with a 4 or 5 star hotel.

Pros:• Friendly staff (front desk, valet, and cleaning)• Free WiFi • Free breakfast • Free beach towel and equipment rentals • Great location (2 min walk to beach)• 24/7 valet service• Clean and stylish rooms and lobbyCons:• Loud A/C unit• Thin walls• Small room • $25 valet per night (same everywhere I believe)Despite the cons, I personally didn't mind them especially at the price they offer. My boyfriend and I both enjoyed our stay and will recommend it to people who don't mind a smaller room.

The hotel is in great location and you can enjoy the beach since the hotel gives you what you need for the beach. Breakfast was included and it was very good with exotic fruits and cakes. Room was small and air-condition made noise. We stayed 5 nights and we could store our luggage when we checked out.

This was my second time staying at the Vive hotel and they are just as helpful and wonder full last time if not more!! (Aug 2014) the rooms are average sized but plenty for me as I was solo this time. I requested to change rooms after checking in after midnight to find that the people in the room next to me were noisy,yelling and banging the walls.Upon notifying reception, the very nice lady (I presume the manager) offered to see what she could do and ended up moving me to a much higher floor, thank you so much.The wifi works well no matter where you are in the building, the food is basic but tasty, coffee is nice too, come early to avoid the crowds! The courtesy room to freshen up is a great option and much appreciated before a long flight and the scales to weigh my bags was great to minimize additional chargers for luggage at the airport (the shoppers know what I mean for all those extra purchases!!) Thanks to all the staff at the Vive, you have a great, friendly team of people and I will continue to recommend your hotel always! Look forward to staying here again in the future :) Mahalo

This was our second visit to Vive. I looked at other places- not because our first trip was not fantastic but because there are so many hotels in Waikiki and I figured it would be fun to explore. Guess what? I just could not find any other place that offered the same location (literally minutes to the best part of the beach for little ones, with the breaks and central to everything) and price point. the room are clean, spacious and very updated. Only complaint is that we will probably come back here again next time!

The rooms were decent but the location was fantastic. only thing missing from hotel room was a balcony.Also free continental breakfast was always decent, no complaints. the Staff was always friendly and helpful.The best part besides the room cost (no resort fees) was the location. it's 2 SHORT blocks from waikiki beach and close to everything. The hotel also gives you EVERYthing you want for the beach, just ask.Parking was a bit steep but it was similar to all other hotel valet parking cost. 25 a night with unlimited access.
user_name:
lukdojo
New York City, New York

review_body: Complimentary pineapple juice, bathrobes, HDMI cables, beach towels, mats, chairs, storage for luggage (in case you have to checkout and want the hotel to hold your stuff), a courtesy room if you want to chill out before a taxi/shuttle arrives, and overall really nice people. What more can you ask? There's also fresh water at all hours of the day, a big plus for a big water drinker like myself.

I've just had a brilliant holiday in Honolulu, I stayed at the Vive, a delightfully stylish hotel in a great location with a fabulous team in the reception area. They were so welcoming and nothing was ever a bother, even down to offering me a bucket of ice to cool my aching feet on return from one of my excursions. You are greeted on arrival with a glass of pineapple juice and an ice cold face towel..such a nice touch! Do check out KC on the excursion/travel desk, who went that extra mile to ensure I had the best experience of Oahu. Helicopter tour and coach trip around the island, visit to the Polynesian Culture Centre, necessary transport etc. all arranged by KC, I just had to turn up BOOM! My room was very comfortable, clean and tastefully decorated it included a small fridge for keeping drinks cold.

Lovely Hotel. We arrived to stay for 3 nights as part of our 40th Wedding Anniversary trip and were greeted by very friendly staff and we were upgraded from our room to a top floor Junior Suite. It was very nice and done out as the John Lennon room, it is not a massive room but adequate for us a couple, it was very clean and the bed comfortable. The Hotel includes a buffet breakfast in the price and there is a nice range of food and good selection of drinks. Also coffee is available 24/7.We had booked this through Expedia and I contacted the Hotel direct with a question about the room, I received a reply within 20minutes of my e-mail being sent, and that was the middle of the night in Honolulu, excellent.There is parking at the hotel and even though we didn't drive it would be great for people who do.The Hotel is positioned 2 blocks back form the beach and they provide beach towels and mats. It has a great range of excellent restaurants all round the area and within walking distance to the major shops.Wish we could of stayed longer.
Great location, ideal for singles or couples travelling. Great staff!Loved the complimentary breakfast and beach towels. Excellent value for area.Would return to this hotel again if in Honolulu. Thx

Service was absolutely fantastic, front desk/valet/concierge all go above and beyond. Room was nice and tidy but very small but bigger rooms are available. Only about a minute walk to the beach, overall 10 out of 10 especially for the price paid.

Location, service, amenities, and overall vibes were great! The hotel was located only blocks from the beach and was surrounded by a lot of great food/snack places. Also, can't beat the free wifi, continental breakfast, and equipment rentals! Would definitely come back!

Beautiful hotel and great locale, close to the beach but not that close that it's always busy and noisy. Free wifi, breakfast, beach gear, luggage hold, courtesy room etc. The service was amazing, everyone is super friendly. The downside is that the smaller rooms are really small and the pillows were barely satisfactory.

Hard to find a newer hotel by the beach in Waikiki but this one is awesome! The Staff was energetic and helpful. Not one single problem. They even have free beach supplies. Check in, check out and valet experience were awesome.
user_name:
Benito M
Salt Lake City, Utah

review_body: Great place to stay in Waikiki! Lovely boutique hotel with great amenities and location! Short walk to the many shops, restaurants, and beautiful Waikiki Beach. Complimentary breakfast, beach gear and more!

Vive accommodated us when our previous accommodation fell through at the last minute. They made sure we were comfortable, and we enjoyed our stay on level 20. The view on the way to the room of both ocean and mountain was excellent and the suite was spacious, clean and modern.

This hotel was offered at a great price. The staff was wonderful. The bathroom sink, however, was not designed well. I could hardly get to the water to wash my face or brush my teeth and there was no place to put my toiletries.

Taxi from the airport was 30 min and 40$. Check in was fast. I complained to have such a tiny room (2 beds) and they gave me another one: this was exactly the same size (just a few floors higher, but 1 bed instead of 2) - then I gave up... Free breakfast. No in-room coffee (but available for free in the lobby). A/C was loud and not very efficient; it blew directly into my face when trying to sleep, finally I turned it off. WIFI was free but very slow in my room (they told me it must be my Laptop - which worked faster in at least 50 other hotels!). Housekeeping came into my room after 3pm. If I would have to return to this island, I would check other hotels first.

Attention all fellow kiwis, this is a great find. Tucked away only a block back from the Waikiki beach, it's a 1-2 minute walk to the beach (max), this haven is the perfect retreat. Recently refurbished, now sporting a luxurious yet relaxed interior. Friendly staff, fab location, includes wifi and a light b'fast. Highly recommend.

Pros:Great, exceptional staff....all staff. Cleaning staff, kitchen staff, front desk staff, parking staff and every staff was friendly and helpful. I was amazed. Great location, great value for the price we paid.Cons:Air conditioner was so noisy that I had difficulty sleeping through the night on the first 2 nights (we stayed for 8-9 nights). Every time when air conditioner starts, it sounded like a compressor of a power wash machine. Walls are thin and we heard the couple next door ... "doing stuff". (I think they're on their honeymoon.)

Perfect location one block from beach. Hotel staff recommended some great restaurants to eat and enjoy the beach from. Quiet location and really clean room. Definitely would stay again and would recommend to others.

If you are looking for a quiet, trendy or relaxing place, this is the place for you. The staff was so helpful and friendly. The mood of the hotel is very relaxing and inviting. I would for sure stay here again.

Very friendly and helpful staff. Close to beach and amenities. Bus-stop outside front door. Good off-street parking. Facilities are reasonably modern and well maintained. All round - a great place to stay.

Great location and friendly staff. Close walk to the beach and the shopping area. The hotel provide towels and boggieboards for the beach. Friendly staff who wants to help you. The room is small but clean. Kind of noisy AC but you get used to it. Breakfast is ok but nothing extra, you'kl find the basic stuff. There are plenty of restaurants/cafés around if you want breakfast outside of the hotel. Overall a good experience with no hidden costs.

We've stayed in the hotel for several nights and we really liked it. Taking into account other hotels in the area, this one has a normal room size and nicely furnished.There's also an option of a breakfast, don't be fooled, it is an american kind of breakfast - coffee and pastry, but there a lot of different pastry and lot kinds of tea, so we liked it, it helped us get through the day. Though it is not the cheapest hotel in the area, but it still worth its price, we've stayed in several, but this one has been chosen to be stayed in for several days.The staff is fantastic, that is for sure. And you will love the lobby.

We booked this hotel as it got great reviews from media back home and we were not disappointed. The hotel is in a great location 2 blocks back from the main strip in Waikiki, as well as the beach. Check in was fast and we were greated with fresh pineapple juice and a cold towel which was a nice touch. We were originally booked into a room on the lower floors, however i asked to be put on a higher floor due to reading about traffic noise being a problem of a night time. The reception staff had no hesitation in doing so and changed our room to the higher floor.The rooms are good- clean, modern and comfortable. They might be a little bit pokey but that was fine with us as we were out for most of the day. Complimentary breakfast was a nice touch. It was a selection of pastries, breads and muffins as well as juice and coffee. My only criticism would be the lack of fresh fruit available. It was pineapple or pineapple! The staff are super friendly and always greeted you on your return to the hotel of an evening. KC in concierge was very helpful. She gave us some great inside tips on places to eat, particularly the italian place a few blocks away- Arancino and activities to do. Our only other criticism would be that of the inconvenience of dragging all our bags down to reception for check out and to book a cab, only to realise we had to drag them back up to level 1 for the cab to pick us up.I would definitely recommend this hotel, particular for couples. The price is great for the location and what it has to offer. The lack of a gym or pool didnt bother us as there was so much to explore. We will be back!Mahalo.

Loved this hotel. Short walk (4-5 minutes) to Waikiki beach. The staff are super friendly and helpful. Upon arrival they offer you a glass of fresh pineapple juice and a cold towel- a nice,unexpected surprise!

The hotel was a good choice, good location, nice staff and excellent services. Free breakfase and free wifi were really a plus. Bus stop is nearby and easy to go to shops and places to eat. I will definitely stay again.

We had a good time staying at the hotel. Even though it's a three star hotel (i guess because it's lack of pool and gym), the service provided was excellent. We had a late flight on the day of the check out and the staff offered us a courtesy room so we can take a shower before our late flight. It makes a HUGE difference for us! I believe even 4 star hotels would not offer this kind of service! The room is small as expected but it's very clean. The only drawback is we can hear wind blowing through the windows at night (it was very windy during the period we stayed at the hotel). We got used to the noise on the second night. We would definitely stay at Vive hotel again!

This hotel is exceptional. Location is great, just a SHORT walk to the center of Waikiki Beach. And the amenities they provide are wonderful. Staff is helpful and value for the stay can't be beat. You will be please with a stay here.
