We've stayed in many hotels before, but Vive was an exceptional experience. It was our honeymoon and I relied on my husband to book everything for our trip. Good job, honey! When we arrived, they greeted us with delicious pineapple juice; check in was quick and painless. They mentioned that they provide free beach towels, beach mats, chairs etc. so we don't have to buy them ourselves. The lobby is beautiful (and always smelled amazing... like fresh flowers) and had an amazing selection of books that we could borrow. Our room was small (Hawaii obviously has limited space) but very clean, stylish, and efficient. We had an ocean view room on the 16th floor; there are a couple of buildings in the way but we could still see some ocean. Anytime we needed assistance with something, the staff were so friendly, helpful, and professional. KC, the concierge, was amazing and not only gave us advice on what sights to see and things to do, but printed out all the driving directions for us. Tyler/Taylor (sorry, can't remember the spelling) was also exceptionally helpful throughout our stay. Mahalo!Note though, that if you have a car, valet parking is your only option and it is $25 per day. This is standard for all hotels (in Waikiki at least, not sure about the rest of the island) so I can't really fault Vive for that. However, it is unlimited entry/exit all day which was very convenient, and the valet staff were always very friendly and helpful.We HIGHLY recommend this hotel for your next stay in Oahu. It's in a great location with many restaurants and attractions nearby (and just a couple blocks from a beautiful beach).

This hotel was great. For a 3 star hotel, it was awesome. We were very close to the beach and many buses are nearby. The staff is really friendly and helpful. I loved that the coffee, tea, and iced water available all day in the lobby. The simple breakfast in the morning and free wifi were all great touches. There isn't a gym or pool, but you are so close to the ocean and you get plenty of exercise walking around. The room was very simple and a little small, but we didn't spend a whole lot of time in the hotel. I would stay here again for sure.

I live here in Hawaii, and I wanted to take my wife on little "staycation." Vive fit the bill perfectly. We stayed in one of junior suites, and it was everything we were looking for. The room was modern, but comfortable. Everything was clean and luxurious. The ONLY downside was that the small fridge did not get very cold. In fact there is a warning not to consume perishable food after eight hours. That might have dropped the overall value and experience by .001% at worst. Everything else was perfect.

We only had 1 night at Vive but it was a great stay. We walked in and were given a room straight away still a few hours before normal check in time - greatly appreciated after 24 hours on no sleep! The toilet roll holder fell off and 5 minutes after telling reception, maintenance were fixing it! The rooms are updated and comfortable, the robe was a nice touch. We had a great sleep. If we go back to Hawaii we will stay again.
We love this place, great people very help full good location and very tidy.The room was great we stay at the 21 floor with a sea view stunning view.Breakfast was great to good valet parking service

Everything great!The staff is very friendly and the rooms are small but clean! The hotel is located very close to the Wakiki Beach. Beach towels are free. High recommendation!We will be happy to stay in Vive Hotel again. I hope next year: o) ALOHA!

Highly recommended hotel. Staff are very professional while also very friendly. Nice, short walk to the beach and lots of shopping. Breakfast options are limited but taste great. One drink of pineapple juice will have you hooked for life!

Stayed for 8 nights, first time in Hawaii and wanting to have best experience and after few toss and turn I decided Vive hotel purely base on trip advisor reviews and what a good decision i have made, This boutique hotel situated on one of the main Road in honolulu Kuhio Ave, so convenience with restaurants and shops along the rd nearby, also with bus stop right outside the hotel which u can go almost anywhere in Honolulu such as to Ala Monoa shopping centre the biggest in honolulu bus #8 or Hanauma Bay bus #22 for $2.50 each way.This hotel have nice ambient, clean, modern and close to Waikiki beach abt 3 blocks away (5mins walk literally) my room 1504 (cnr room i think) with clean/modern room, decent size nice comfortable bed with open window so can get breezy fresh air at night time, great staffs very helpful and good idea with coffee/tea/water available free all day long, breakfast with fresh fruits is best, if you're looking for a nice cosy hotel with reasonable price and close to all the attractions then this hotel is the one, ohh and one big plus is free strong WiFi in room love it!Me and my partner really enjoyed our 8 nights stay Mahalo to Vive and no hesitation to stay again and highly recommend for anyone who looking for a cosy nice boutique with clean and friendly can do attitude hotel.

We enjoy small-ish hotels with character and a great staff. So, with Waikiki Beach two short blocks away (beach gear happily provided by the outstanding staff at no extra charge), we found no need for a pool or other amenities that accompany a larger hotel. The rooms are small, but beautifully appointed (stylish IKEA eclectic) and immaculate with plenty of accessible outlets for tech gear. Whomever designed the rooms put great thought into maximizing the available space. The neighborhood is full of food outlets ranging from cheap eats to fancier fare; local buses (for which Oahu is famous) stop just feet from the front door. All this, plus an included continental breakfast, made us very happy - Keep up the great work!

We've always stayed at high end, name brand hotels but this time around, we decided to stay here based on a recommendation of a friend. Let me tell you, it was a pretty delightful experience. From the lobby and its swanky and inviting ambiance that extended to our clean room all the way to the friendly and cordial staff. Not to mention it's location; just a walk to the beach and strip of retail shops! Definitely coming back when we're due for another staycation!

In the heart of Waikiki, services like gear to use on the beach, towels and newspaper provide for free. Other hotel apply fees for the same. Breakfast choices limited but, again, included. Staff very friendly and supportive.

This boutique hotel is located two blocks from the ocean with nice accommodations such as free breakfast, Wi-Fi, excellent value and location to bus stop. The two disadvantage to this hotel is it does not have a pool and the rooms are small, but still very usable for a couple of travelers.

This was my second stay at the Vive and I would stay there again. The location is very central to everything in Waikiki, including the beach. The staff is friendly and responsive. The continental breakfast is adequate with fresh fruits. The room was quiet, even though the hotel is by a busy street. My room windows did not open so I had to rely on a.c. but maybe you can request a room with windows that open to allow in the cool, fresh air at night. A plus is the tasty, quick Korean take-out restaurant across the street!

This was a great value hotel for the location - staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was very convenient and well looked after. I'd recommend this to other business travelers - desk in rooms, good consistent internet connection.

Will definitely stay again if I'm ever lucky enough to make it back. Thanks for everything! The staff was absolutely amazing and went out of their way to make sure you're happy. Great value and a great view.

Received a chilled and delightful scented towels and pineapple juice at our greeting. The staff was genuinely friendly; you could tell they enjoy their jobs. Quick and easy check in! We had a corner junior suite with oceanview! Love all the décor in the hotel and room. Everything was very clean and fresh. Loved the 12noon check out! Complimentary beach chairs, towels etc. Our concierge KC was awesome! Recommended some great places to eat, made sure we had transportation and well taken care of. Not to mention KC has the coolest Red Mohawk. I highly recommend Vive Hotel and stopping by to see KC for all your questions and needs. Mahalo nui loa KC!

We were greeted upon arrival with refreshing, cool towels and fresh juice. What an unexpected treat. From the hot street outside this was very welcome indeed. The staff was very warm and friendly, and checking in was seamless. KC at the concierge was so helpful and nice in setting us up with lunch recommendations and took good care of us.I absolutely love the vibe and styling of this hotel. It is smart and modern yet cozy and very boutique-y. from the colors and the artwork to the lounge area. Good sounds playing in the lounge, a wall with books to read and fast wifi. The continental breakfast was just what we needed to get the day going. The room was very clean and fresh. The bed was so comfortable. Beautiful ocean view and a HUGE shower! 10/10 would recommend. And this will be my hotel of choice upon return visits to Oahu.

I tried this hotel for my first short stay in Waikiki. It was fabulously located (less than 5 minutes to the beach) and the staff were exceptional! They have beach gear available for guest use (beach chairs, towels and boogie boards) and offer a courtesy room for one hour for those with late flights out (ours was at 11pm). These touches were greatly appreciated! A continental breakfast is also included (the only downside was that it only offered pastry items and fruit) but coffee and tea were available any time of day in the lobby. I will definitely stay there again!

Last year we stayed at your hotel and this year we brought 20 people. We love this place!! Couple friendly and family friendly. The fresh fruit in the morning. The complementary towels, chairs and yoga mats are an added plus!

This hotel was fabulous! The staff was outstanding and accomodating. The facility was clean and the continental breakfast was very good. A great value and close enough to the beach. Would stay here again!

Although the rooms are small and not well insulated I would stay again because the location was perfect, the staff superior and the many amenities - free wifi, breakfast, beach towels/chairs. We definitively got our money's worth.

Experience was so positive. I was spending my last two nights solo and loved every minute of it. I never felt insecure in the area, going out alone at night by myself. The staff were helpful and always acknowledged my comings and goings. Did not find the room noisy as I had read on reviews. Will stay here on my next visit.

The service was excellent and the room was very clean and modern. Location was perfect and valet parking was very helpful. No DVD player and the busy street at night were the only issues I had with this hotel.

Great location and great price, friendly staff, 5 minute walk to the beach, had a great time. the free wifi is a bonus , the staff were most helpful. I would recommend this hotel Great value for money and within walking distance to every thing you need .

vive looks like a recently refurbished room. The rooms are compact but clean and modern. There is free wifi at the hotel and also a complimentary breakfast They also provide water downstairs and beach towelsThe breakfast was kind of busy and small selection of pastries only. The air con is actually pretty loud - this would be my only gripe

The experience was perfect - friendly staff - always greet guests with smiles and can-do attitude, good location - 5 min walk to the beach and it was a bonus having tea/coffee all day. I really enjoyed my stay.

Hotel staff were friendly and knowledgeable. The hotel itself was modern and in a great central location just off the Waikiki beach. The hotel room whilst small was clean and compact.Would happily stay here again for the price and location.

Enjoyed nine days here in March 2015. The Vive is a former condo building that transitioned to a hotel a few years ago.The Big Plusses:1. Great bed. Really great bed.2. Nice quality HD flat screen.3. Excellent, extremely helpful staff.4. You can come back after you check out/before you fly back to the mainland and they'll give you a room to take a shower and change in, so you can have a full day playing in Oahu and get clean and refreshed before 12 hours of flying :)5. Strong in-room Wi-FiSpecial kudos to the staff: great help from the concierge, morning breakfast staff (fresh fruit selection, good coffee, and croissants provided free every morning) was lovely, and the housekeeping staff were all top notch. The hotel provides you with beach towels and beach supplies at the front desk, so you can grab and go the two blocks to Waikiki Beach. You just drop off your damp towels and beach board at the front desk on your way back in. With the amount of traffic and sand, this could generate a serious mess, but the lobby and elevators were continually spotless, a testament to quality housekeeping. Were there any issues? Yes, a couple of issues with my room which was a "Jr. Suite" on the 17th floor (chair was broken, things like that) but staff responded and fixed IMMEDIATELY. The furniture and hallways could use some freshening (floorboards, scuffmarks) -- things you notice while waiting for the elevator. The issues I list in this review were far outweighed by the plusses and good pricing for a Waikiki stay. I would not hesitate to recommend the hotel or stay here again.

We stayed at the Vive hotel for 6 nights in April 2015 and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We arrived to friendly reception staff who also provided complimentary pineapple juice which was a lovely gesture. Our room was on level 7 and it was a corner room facing the street so there was a bit of noise during the night but it is only a couple blocks back from the main strip so this is to be expected. It was bearable though and didn't wake us up during the night. Yes the rooms are a little cosy so if you plan on lounging around in your hotel room this is probably not the best choice. It is perfect for those who want clean amenities after a day out exploring the beautiful island. The continental breakfast was enough to kick start the engine in the morning with offerings of bread, assorted pastries and fresh fruit, tea, coffee and juice. The hotel also offers free use of beach towels, beach mats and chairs, body boards etc which is a real added bonus seeing as your just a block away from the main beach.What we found most helpful was the hotel concierge - KC. It was like having your own personal assistant when looking for things to do or places to visit on the island!! We hassled KC almost every day and the level of customer service was second to none. KC even helped us book a rental car for a North Shore road trip and also our tickets to Hanauma Bay. I strongly recommend speaking to KC before you book anything through other operators. Just look for the gravity defying mohawk :DReally enjoyed our stay, would definitely stay again and would recommend this to anyone looking for a value for money, quality, clean hotel with friendly staff and service.

We stayed here for about a week and had a great experience. The rooms are SMALL and there are no balconies. However, you get what you pay for! Great location and nice finishes! The garbage trucks are loud in the morning, but the price is affordable! Overall great experience. If you vacation just to stay in your room, look somewhere else. If your room is just somewhere to sleep, this is a great place to stay!

Good price, short walk to the beach and local attractions. All beach equipment provided for you (towels, chairs, mats, etc) Excellent service from the staff, everyone was attentive and professional. Would stay again!

We decided to stay here even though the rooms are smaller because we didn't plan to spend a lot of time at the hotel. The location was great and the service was excellent. I would not stay here with a family, but for singles and couples it was perfect. Air conditioner is loud if you're sensitive.

This hotel is located 5 minutes from the beach . We were very pleased with Complementary breakfast and 24 hours coffee, tea and water service in the lobby . The food was very good . Roma are very clean and staff extremely friendly . We will definitely stay in this hotel during our next trip to Honolulu .

Great hotel! Yummy breakfast, wonderful staff, great location. Feels luxurious at a great price. Wish there was a pool area or bar area to hang out during the day, but otherwise it was awesome. Loved!

Well located, excellent service, breakfast provided is above average (lack protein, just carbs are offered), excellent price compared to neighbor hotels. Only issue is with air conditioning which is noisy and unefficient ; expect high level of humidity.

Very small units. Tiny fridge. Shallow bathroom sink. Not a place to hang out, but fine for sleeping. Three blocks from the beach. Twenty five dollars a day for parking. Had a good time here but next time i am going to look for something with a bit more space.

My husband and I were pleased and surprised by the excellent value of our stay and the helpfulness of the staff. We were upgraded to a top-floor ocean-view room (hurray, the windows opened to let in the breeze!), greeted with a glass of pineapple juice and offered beach gear. The location was great, just two short blocks to the beach, on a bus route and just down the street from the Food Pantry. Across the street, there's a great Korean barbecue place. The desk staff always greeted us and bid us goodbye, plus helped us with shuttles. Breakfast was pretty good, lobby decor is interesting and attractive. The room was small, but we didn't care because we were out all day anyway and the bed was very comfortable. A great place!

The staff was extremely helpful and sweet. Our stay was for 5 nights and every night felt comfortable. I stayed here with my 8 year old daughter and will definitely be coming back! Ambience was nice, staff even nicer! Can't say enough about this place.

Great location, Very good wifi. Provide every beach facility - towel, mat and beach chair. Very tasty "fruit bread" for breakfast. Can't do much about the AC window, ours was rather noisy but we could tolerate it. May be not so for some who need extreme quiet to sleep.

My husband and I recently enjoyed a week at the Vive Hotel Waikiki. We stayed over the Valentine's day weekend, and although the hotel was full, service was fantastic. We had a car and made use of the valet parking. Our car was always available within 10 minutes of us calling down. Usually the car was waiting for us before we made it to the parking lot. The front desk staff was great and we made use of the courtesy room to freshen up before our flight. The breakfast consisted of bread, danishes, and fresh fruit. Great to grab something on your way out. There was also coffee and tea available in the lobby with takeout cups so I didn't have to buy coffee all week!I have noticed some negative reviews speak to the room size, lack of coffee machine, no dresser etc. Yes, this is all true, but it didn't bother us at all. The room size wasn't what you would find at a resort, but this hotel isn't a resort. We specifically stayed here to avoid resort fees. We had the smallest room type, but it was still totally fine for two people. If anything it was large compared to rooms in New York and Europe (it had a desk!). We travel a lot, and I can't remember the last time I've seen a chest of drawers in a hotel room (was at a Shareton last night, no drawers). If anything I would compare this hotel to a European style boutique hotel. A perfect place to use as a base while you enjoy the island.

Can't recommend enough! Everything at this hotel was top notch! The staff was very welcoming and courteous! Room was clean and comfortable. Daily breakfast was always fresh and original with great food. Would highly recommend for anyone looking to get away in honeymoon or vacation.

After reviewing other travellers experience in this hotel it would appear that my wife and I are at odds with most and it would seem to be dependent on size of room allocated.The room we had was one of the smallest, most claustrophobic hotel rooms we have experienced in our travels. We tried three times to upgrade to a larger room but were told no rooms were available.On the positive side we found the staff to be pleasant, cheerful and helpful. The hotel supplies a complimentary continental style breakfast every morning which is served in the main lobby. The lobby itself is beautifully appointed with plenty of comfortable chairs and occasional tables, although it did get a little crowded during the 'breakfast rush. Coffee and tea were available 24/7 in the lobby. The hotel is centrally located just a short walk from the beach and the main tourist area. Beach towels and chairs are provided free of charge..Unfortunately in our opinion our room did not measure up to our expectations. As someone else has mentioned, this size room is more suited to one person with minimal luggage.There were only two drawers for clothes and they were under the bed. There were some small shelves scattered around but we finished up having to live out of suitcases. There was one 30" wide closet with no door (due to space constrictions). Likewise the bathroom had a pocket door rather than a normal one due to its proximity to the bed.One of the most disappointing things for us was the lack of a balcony. This seemed to be the only hotel we observed in Waikiki, that didn't have balconies. This combined with the fact that the rooms single window was relatively small added to the claustrophobic feeling.. the window was made even smaller by the "1950's" style air conditioner that is installed. I honestly cannot believe that a modern, updated hotel does not have central air ?.There was one small desk chair provided so our pre dinner drink had to be enjoyed by one person either standing or sitting on the bed. Actually after the first night we took our drinks to the lobby for some comfort.The hotel doesn't have a pool, but that was less important to us than the fact that it didn't have anywhere to sit outside for a little fresh air.Overall a disappointing experience......maybe if we had one of the larger rooms this would be an entirely different review.?

My fiance booked this hotel for our honeymoon based on excellent reviews and we were not disappointed. This is a modern classy hotel and its only 2 blocks to the beach. We also rented a car for 2 days and Enterprise was a block away. It is a perfect location, you will not be bored. It's also a little smaller than some of the other hotels nearby and not extremely crowded, which is what we preferred. The concierge was very helpful in getting us a deal on the rental car, maps, appointment for a couples massage, etc. They give juice and a towel on arrival and also have beach towels, boards for you to borrow. I was even surprised when it was time to leave, we checked out at noon but our flight did not leave till 10:30 pm... So we went to the beach and they had a room reserved for us for an hour before our flight to shower and freshen up. I would definitely stay here again!

Booked a Junior Suite with King Bed on the 21st Flr. Had a lovely view of the mountains and even the beach. Was reasonably priced and we decided to upgrade to this bigger room for our honeymoon. Not sure what the standard rooms were like. Room was clean and spacious. Bathroom was large as well, huge shower! This hotel has no pool, but we swam at the beach anyway (only a short walk down the road) - the hotel price includes complimentary mats, chairs, towels, and boogie boards which is great! Complimentary breakfast is also included which we found fantastic - range of fruits, pastries, breads and juices. The living area next to the lobby is also spacious and has plenty of tables & chairs for guest use. Wi-Fi was free, and fast. On-site parking is available as well for a fee. Very friendly and helpful staff, i would definitely come back again.

Staff were excellent. Very helpful. Like eating cereal for breakfast. Very nice lobby for relaxing. Room was big enough for myself on my own. Would have liked a bigger room with a balcony if travelling with my partner.

Wonderful attention, location And services. The only thing to improve is the breakfast, maybe add some protein. The staff was always very helpfull And kind. They gave us all the things to go to the beach And that was very good

Excellent service and location; very good value for money; breakfast was just right not like other bigger hotels with massive buffets. The check in service was very good. Although no pool, the beach is just a few mins walk.

Lovely atmosphere and the staff were always so helpful. Loved the juice and washcloth on arrival, a special touch to after a day of travelling. Keep up the good work. Only a short walk to the beach, shops and restaurants.

From check-in, to valet, to front desk, to concierge, to housekeeping, always the very best service I have received. The rooms and hotel are consistently clean and welcoming and the service can not be beat! Thanks Again Vive for a pleasant and rewarding stay!
a good stay~ would add a towel holder next to the dink in the bathroom, and also a couple of hooks for wet suits....The staff was very nice, and the location was great! We enjoyed our little getaway!

Great style & vibe. Warm welcome with cold juice and fragrant washcloth. Very hip hotel steps away from the Waikiki beach. Our room was cozy - my daughter described it as a dorm room furnished by IKEA. Very nice continental breakfast each day.

This little hotel towers over the others around it in quality, design, cleanliness, and service. Its short walk to the beach was a big plus, the free breakfast and wi-fi also added to our overall satisfaction. I wish our room was a little bigger and the bathroom had a couple more shelves but other than that, our total experience was wonderful. And I can't say enough accolades about the staff. Every single one made our stay memorable.

Fantastic little hotel only 2 blocks from Waikiki beach, easy walking distance to everywhere you want to go in Waikiki. Nice clean rooms & lobby, good basic continental breakfast in the mornings, able to borrow towels, beach mats, body boards & umbrellas at no cost - so handy! The vallet parking service was excellent, all staff (front desk & concierge) were very accommodating & pleasant.Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!!

I can't say enough about the staff; their customer service was EXCELLENT! The location and amenities were great as well. I will definitely return to this hotel and recommend it to my family & friends.

We spent our five nights on Oahu at the Vive, based on excellent TA reviews. If you want to stay in Waikiki, the location is central, a short walk from beach, shops and restaurants. Downside of this is the noise at night. It wasn't hot, but we ran the A/C just to shut out the noise from traffic and people in the street.Staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful. Our contemporary twin room turned out to be very tiny and bathroom was not cleaned for five days although beds were made up and towels changed. Guest room décor is non-existing (the entire budget for interior decoration must have gone to common spaces. These sport a hodge-podge of all kinds of art which is interesting but not always functional, e.g. in breakfast area). Complimentary breakfast buffet is basic but a nice touch, as are the welcome drinks, and coffee / tea made available throughout the day. Valet parking at $25 day seems a lot, yet considering the overall cost of the room does not make that much difference and for us was well worth the hassle free (and safe) parking in the same building. We had an issue with phone calls made to a toll-free number being charged to our bill, but this was rectified on check-out.Value for money compared to what is available in Waikiki / Honolulu overall is good and staff were definitely great.

Great location as could walk to most stores, beach, and restaurants. Very clean and a very good breakfast. Rooms were small but think most are in Waikiki. Very clean. Staff very friendly and willing to help you.

Our stay at the Vive Hotel was awesome. Seriously, you won't find a better value in Waikiki. It was 2 blocks to the beach, and it takes like 5 minutes tops to get there. Everything you will need is within a 5 minute walk. The rooms are a bit small, but otherwise really nice and updated, and really, you arent spending much time in there anyways, so who cares? The staff was very friendly, and the free breakfast and wifi were both nice added bonuses. Also, they have courtesy beach gear you can borrow for free as well as unbrellas if its raining. This was so convenient. Then when we checked out, since our flight was at night we had 6 hours to kill, they not only allowed us to store our luggage, but they provided us a courtesy room to shower and change before we got our shuttle to the airport. I never heard of another hotel doing this, so for that they get 5 stars. Highly recommend, and will return next time!!!

I stayed here during my one-week trip to Hawaii. The hotel is nicely located about 40 m from Waikiki beach. With breakfast included and the possibility to get beach supplies, I think that the service provided by the hotel was great. Definitely a hotel I can recommend as it is located on the more quiet Kuhio avenue instead of the heavily busy Kalakaua avenue.

Excellent location and the staff was always extremely cheerful and willing to meet your needs. Everyone greets you with a smile and hello. Great ambiance in the lobby and I love the art work throughout the hotel.

I think this is the best experience of staying in a hotel I have ever had because all staff were so nice and helpful! They always try to help you no matter what problems you have. It was such a nice experience. I would definitely book their hotel if I ever go again!

I spent 6 days and 5 nights in this hotel last week. From beginning to end, our experience was nothing other than superb. We had a small snafu with our reservation, but it was handled quickly and professionally by the front desk. When we arrived, our room was ready for an early check in. I never heard the word "no" at the front desk throughout my stay. Additiionally, they were happy to hand out fresh beach towels, beach mats, beach chairs, boogie boards, and umbrellas to us at no charge! The free breakfast was good, and the great coffee was available 24/7. I can't imagine having stayed anywhere else. Absolutely a top-notch hotel.

The lobby and rooms were clean. The staff was helpful and friendly. The hotel was a great price for location. The only dislike was the high price for parking at the hotel. Everything else was superb!!

Stayed there with my 4 year old and was exactly what we needed. Just a quick walk to the beach, Starbucks (for my much needed coffee), food and buses it was the perfect location. Would definitely return

Budget friendly boutique hotel with none of the frills of a large resort, but reflected in the price tag. Great location near the beach and loved being able to borrow chairs, mats, and boogie boards for our beach fun.

Loved my stay at the Vive and would totally stay there again!Close to the beach, tour pick up location for most major tour operators right around the corner.The staff is really nice and helpful.Grocery stores can be found all around the hotel as well.

Hawaii, as I've discovered, is worth the hype. While all the rest of the world tries to emulate the flavour of aloha with their plastic palm trees and cocktails with the cherry on top, Hawaii makes the cliche authentic.Vive Hotel is not that sort of Hawaii.Located literally one block from Waikiki beach, Vive sits on one of Waikiki's main driving strips and is a comfortable walk to restaurants, local shops and mesmerising views. It offers something quite contemporary and comforting, placing it as a modern alternative to the gigantic high rises and resort style hotels you'll find along the shoreline.Something of a boutique hotel, nestled in the heart of Waikiki, Vive has a lot of strong points that would certainly have me staying here again.Upon our arrival from Australia, we headed straight to Vive from the airport. It was a good 6 hours before official check in time, but we went there anyway, hoping we could store our luggage for the day. However, we were treated by the hotel's reception to a complimentary breakfast, an opportunity to wash up in the lobby's bathroom, stored our luggage, used the boogie boards and beach towels and even managed to organise a rental car through the concierge. And we hadn't even officially checked in yet.They made everything so easy that our introduction to Hawaii was off to a brilliant start.When we tried to tip the concierge (a custom that we're not familiar with in Australia) he gave us some advice on how tipping works and reminded us not to 'overdo it'. This was something he didn't have to tell us, but clearly showed that he understood the issues faced by non-US travellers.During our stay in Hawaii, we splurged at some other top resorts, but Vive provided us with everything we needed to make our stay extra special and I certainly would recommend staying here for anyone who wants an alternative to the busy resort style accomodation, but still wants a fabulous Hawaiian experience.

We had a great four night stay here. The hotel is modern, tidy, and close to everything. We found the staff really friendly and helpful ... nothing was a problem for any of them.A big thanks to KC the concierge for her help organising some events for us. She also recommended a local tattoo studio - please see our pics KC for the finished results. We LOVE them. Thanks to everyone.

We booked a package to Honolulu through Expedia for a one week stay at the Vive Waikiki and we loved it!!! The hotel is new and only a brief 3 minute walk to the beach! Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We loved it that they provided complimentary beach mats, chairs and boogie boards. One day, I saw a guest return some towels and mats and a chambermaid who happened to be in the lobby, took it from the guest. Right away, a female staff at front desk stepped forward and offered to take it from the chambermaid and return it to the store room! Wow, I thought that's impressive!We also picked the hotel for its complimentary breakfast which was alright... there were pastries (some mornings, they were stale), juice, coffee, tea, and toast. It would have been nice if there was protein of some sort as well. The rooms were impeccable (we took two rooms), decor was new and contemporary...the beds were very comfortable and the pillows were soft. They are not the biggest rooms but we knew that when we booked, so it wasn't a surprise to us. We would definitely book there again and would recommend it to all our friends.

Hotel is close to the beach, main restaurants, bars, bus stops (on main street) etc. Well priced and rooms were clean and regularly serviced. Staff were very helpful and knowledgeable about the area and organizing tours etc...

This hotel offers excellent service, it is close to the beach , two blocks away and it is the only hotel that offers a continental breakfast included. The breakfast, although continental, it includes a selection of fresh fruits. The room we had was one of the largest rooms but I heard that the regular rooms are a little small. Ours was a corner unit facing the ocean. You could see the ocean because the hotel faces the street that leads to the beach. The front desk people were very helpful and polite. The hotel provides beach towels and beach chairs for free.

This hotel is within walking distance of Waikiki beach, includes wifi, and offered some basic items for breakfast. The price was high per night but that is to be expected for a hotel close to the beach. The room was extremely small for two people with luggage. Don't bring someone you just started dating here, unless you want them to hear every noise you make in the bathroom. The toilet is 3 ft from the bed. We arrived very late and hungry. The staff member kindly recommended a 24/7 restaurant in the Hilton just a short walk down Kuhio Ave. Overall the hotel was alright for what we needed on this trip.

I booked 2 nights in Honolulu at the Vive Hotel at the beginning of our Hawaiian vacation. There are lots of hotel choices in Honolulu but the Vive offered free WiFi and free bike rental at a local bicycle rental shop. We weren't disappointed with the Vive. The building is very attractive and the service is impeccable. The free continental breakfast is a cut above most offerings.Our room was "City" view but given the hotel location that was not surprizing. The hotel is very conveninetly located and is just a couple of blocks from Waikiki beach.We took advantage of the bike rental and toured west around Diamond Head. Great way to see Honolulu up close.The room was a little small (not a issue as we weren't in the room that much) and had a very comfortable double bed. Having a king at home and normally having a queen when we travel meant that it took a little getting use to. We were on the 12th floor and noise (inside or city) was not an issueWe would definitely stay there again, given the opportunity.

This hotel is located in close proximity to the beach at Waikiki. It was a short and easy walk. The hotel is modern. The rooms were comfortable. Brunch was served daily. Coffee and juice were available at all times. The valet parking was convenient. We enjoyed our stay.

This was my second trip to Honolulu & I decided to stay at Vive Hotel again. The service & amenities were just as great as the first time! I stayed at the hotel between Feb 28-Mar 9, 2015. Everything was wonderful! The staff were extremely nice & very attentive. Some highlights below:- Great value hotel for those who are looking for a simple, clean place to stay - Free breakfast buffet (pasties, juice) & free wifi - Rooms/ bathrooms are small but not a big deal because everything was very well kept & clean- 5min walk to beach & very close to major points of interest- Checkout was at 12pm & my flight was not until 8pm, they offered me a complimentary guest room for an hour to freshen up before heading off to the airport. HUGE PLUS! I was able to hit the beach one last time before flying out :)I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again for my 3rd visit! Thanks Vive for making my 2nd trip to Hawaii as amazing as the first. Will be back soon!

The service was great, the free breakfast was nice, and the location was awesome. The room wasn't as big as I thought it would be, but other than that it was perfect.The hotel is also close to bus stops

The hotel is in a great location, a short 3 blocks to the beach. Near several restaurants and lots of shopping. Rooms are small, but cozy and great for 1 or 2 people. The service provided by the hotel staff is excellent. And breakfast is good but simple. Would have loved to have some cereals provided besides the pastries. I will definitely stay here again.

Customer service was the best I have ever seen. Friendly and helpful staff in all 4 corners of this hotel Valet staff was exceptional.Yes the rooms are small but perfect for a couple. We had a basic room with a queen bed and although there was no dresser there was a large closet that fit all of our needs.If you are a light sleeper you may have trouble sleeping here. I was in the far corner on the side of the hotel and the street traffic was really bad on the 10th floor. Also walls are thin so hearing the people in the room next to you was not un common. The A/C unit was loud but if you programmed it to stay on all night it did help take away the street noise.Breakfast was amazing. Fresh and filling and always somewhere to sit.Close to beach, shops and restaurants.Would stay here again but I would make sure I was higher up to avoid the street noise. I did not ask to change rooms as we were exhausted from our trip but the A/C unit helped by masking the other noises.

Just got back from an 8 day stay at the Vive and Wow!!!Rooms: Rooms are quite small but perfect for a couple. May not be ideal for a family travelling with children but great for 2 people. The added closet was great since we did not have a dresser. Everything fit in the closet no problem. The bathroom is also very small so only 1 person can get ready at a time. We were in no rush so this was not an issue for us. Rooms were spotless and housecleaning service was wonderful. My only issue is the noise factor. If you are a light sleeper this could be an issue. I am a light sleeper so called ahead to request a quiet room away from the street noise. We were given room 1003 right next to the bus stop. Every time the bus stopped to let people on/off it would beep. 24 hours a day so it did get annoying. Also walls are very thin so we could here our neighbors. A/C units very loud however if you set them to fan 3 they run all night non stop and drown out the street noise. It made it easier for us to sleep.Breakfast: Wow what an added bonus!! Food was fresh and really good. Fresh fruit, pastries, breads, juices and coffee. The blueberry bread and cinnamon rolls were fabulous as was the fresh pineapple juice. Breakfast area was clean and always had somewhere to sit. Staff kept adding items when needed. Only thing is you sit on couches and armchairs so although it looks cool it is not ideal to be eating on. We saw many people struggling as did we. Some of the tables barely fit 2 plates and 2 cups.Valet: These guys were wonderful. Always ready to help us with suggestions on where to eat, where to go and what to see as well as directions. We never waited long and service was A+. These young men also help out inside the Hotel and they work very hard to keep things running smoothly!!Hotel: Location was wonderful. A short walk to the beach, restaurants and shops. They have a computer in the lobby for guests to use. We were having problems with our phones/Wi-Fi so were glad to have the courtesy computer in the lobby to keep in touch with home. Hotel is spotless and very hip/modern.Front desk staff: Once again A+. Always welcoming us when we returned from our day and willing to help by getting us beach towels and chairs. The complementary pineapple juice when we arrived was truly appreciated after a 18 hour journey. Also the consierge was able to book us a shuttle back to the airport.Overall this place is FANTASTIC and I do recommend it 100%

We stayed for our anniversary, and upon entering our room, found a nice note and small gift left for us -- very thoughtful! The hotel is centrally located -- close walk to the beach and to all the shops and restaurants. It is also located on a main bus route that we used to get to farther locations such as Diamond Head and Iolani Palace. Staff are very nice and helpful, and always greeted you as you came and went. Breakfast included was a great perk, as was the ability to borrow beach towels, chairs and mats to use. The hotel also seemed like a great deal considering it was one of the few we saw that did not charge a daily hotel resort fee on top of the daily room fee. The rooms were a bit small but didn't bother us, as we were only inside to sleep! I would absolutely stay here again!

Noisy if facing Kuhio St. Rooms are small but clean and modern. Breakfast very basic....pastries, fruit and toast. Staff very pleasant and helpful. 24 hour coffee/tea/water in lobby was nice. Nice seating area. Good location

great location only 2 min walk to the beachBus stop a few steps from the door to get to the shopping centres.Staff always genuinely friendly and helpful. Room was comfortable with lounge chairs and mini fridge which is very handy for a few beers or a bottle off wine when you just want to chill outThe lounge area in the lobby is great for relaxing with a drink

The hotel and it's staffs were very friendly and welcoming. Our family had a great time during our stay at VIVE. Thank you for all you did for us during our stay. Thank you; we enjoyed our stay at VIVE

The hotel is strategically placed, in a very convenient location, near the beach, close to a large array of restaurants and metres away from the bus stations in both directions.The rooms are not very large but they are modern, very clean and well maintained. All personnel was extremely friendly and very professional and made our sejour a very pleasant experience. The continental breakfast included with our accomodation was not very spectacular but pretty diversified and sufiicient to keep us going pass the lunch time. Our room at level 20 had magnificent ocean and mountain views and we really enjoyed admiring the spctacular views in the morning and at night. Mahalo to all personnel for their very friendly and welcoming attitude!

Vive Hotel was amazing! As soon as the new we were in our honeymoon they upgraded us to a better suite. They received us with cold and sweet pineapple juice. The staff was very friendly at all times. Pros: perfect location! They provide you with clean towels and bamboo mats for the beach daily. The concierge was very knowledgeable and nice, she gave us useful tips. 24hr coffee and water available at the lobby. Breakfast is included. Free WiFiCons: breaksfast is only bread and fruit, but we bought cheese and jam at the closest Walgreens and kept it at the room's fridge. No swimming pool, but who wants a swimming pool when you have Waikiki Beach two blocks from there?Anyways, if I come back to Oahu I would stay here!

I recently stayed at the Vive hotel in waikiki and was pleasantly surprised on how nice it was. All of the staff were very helpful and showed attentiveness without being overbearing which I appreciate. I'd like to acknowledge the concierge Kasi in particular, it's so refreshing when someone really enjoys their job. On a few different occasions during our stay Kasi was able to point us in the right direction; it's her job to book packages outside the hotel, but it didn't feel that way. In my expierence with Kasi it just seemed more like a hawaii native giving me the inside scoop. I highly recommend staying at Vive and I will personally be back soon. I hope!!

The rooms are somewhat small but clean, comfortable and close to everything. Chris at the front desk did an excellent job organizing all of our requests and followed up to be sure our stay was just as planned. We has a great time. I would definitely stay there again.

Best staff I have dealt with at any hotel. Every was genuinely friendly and professional. Convenient location close to beach and restaurants. valet staff are great if you are driving around he island.

The hotel staff were amazing-from house keeping, to the front desk staff to , the ladies that fed us at the continental breakfast to the bellhops. As soon as we asked for something, we received it. The free wifi was a plus as well. So were the beach chairs and towels etc...Since we didn't fly out until 9 pm on the check -out date, they held our bags for us and even gave us a complimentary room for the last hour to freshen up. That was a nice surprise. They also arranged an airport shuttle for us at the cost of $12/person. They also offered to weigh our bags for us. The hotel location was fantastic! We were a 5 min walk to the waikiki beach and there were shops and restaurants all around us. Just don't use the food directory menu left in your room. My husband found out the hard way....they charge an extra $10 on top of your order and they tell you that gratuities for the drivers are appreciated. He ordered a boston style pizza and he paid $40.00 It tasted like paper on top of that...so take the 5 min walk to the nearest eatery.

Stayed at this hotel twice and both times, it was excellent. Great location, comfortable, and the staff is 5 star! . I stayed in a Junior suite - 2107- super comfy, massive shower and super clean. Any time I needed anything the front desk answered on the first ring and was accommodating. Coffee and breakfast in am a plus- and concierge on site to handle all questions. KC, Daniel, Mike, Jackie and the crew made both times a home away from home. Cant wait to go back.

If you are traveling for business, on a honeymoon, or as a family...this is the best place. I have stayed in the 5 star hotels in the area, and this one is great. Easy in/out, no "resort" fees, good complementary breakfast, beach towels, concierge, and free wifi.. Have stayed here 4-5 times. GREAT staff too. Great location to everything. Ask for a corner suite with a view of the ocean. PERFECT! Great restaurant "kitty kroner" from there for $5 meals. Great laundrymat half block away and can do FAST loads in 25 mins. Thanks to Dan, Adam, Ty, Samanaha, Beverly and all the crew. Mahalo...JW!

The hotel location and staff friendliness will bring us back. The size of our room is our only complaint. Thanks a lot for all of your recommendations. The complimentary breakfast was fantastic with great coffee 24 hours.

Great boutique hotel in an awesome location ! The free breakfast and wi-fi were great amenities as well as the free beach gear ! K.C. The concierge (red Mohawk ) offers amazing insight and ideas for what to see on Oahu ! Great restaurants close by : Blue Water Shrimp Truck , Me's BBQ and Musubi Iyasume !

Was so excited to stay at Vive. Rooms were nice, but small, but location is amazing. Nice continental breakfast and really nice touches throughout the hotel. All would have been perfect except our initial greeting upon arrival by front desk staff person by the name of Christopher ( arrived at 1030 pm on March 12, 2015 for reference to management). Christopher proceeded to speak to us incredibly condescendingly and rudely when we asked questions about timing for valet parking. He was one of the rudest individuals I have ever met at a hotel. Was appalled that this caliber of person could ever get a job in customer service. Two days later in our last night he proceeded to yell at us to " him get out of that room!" When we attempted to return our towels from the beach day. Let's just say he would be the reason we would not recommend this hotel as I'd hate to have this experience occur to another guest.

Vive is a modern and luxurious boutique hotel offering something different from the over the top resort experiences on the shore line! Only a minute stroll to waikiki beach, vive offers a comfortable stay with clean, comfortable and well equipped rooms.We arrived really early but they started the check in process, offered us breakfast and let us wash up in their bathrooms. They also stored our luggage for free, helped us with a rental car and lent us towels and boogie boards and we hadnt even seen our room yet!!!The rooms do get a bit of road noise, but we also spent a night in a top luxury hotel and experienced the same so its the area, not the hotels.The concierge was outstanding and helped make our stay perfect! Id stay here again as it was a very welcoming experience for our first few nights in Hawaii.

Great location, Good Valve, Excellent staff on hand.. Willing to help with everything.. I would stay there again... There wasn't any balcony, but for the price it was a nice hotel. The local buses were at the door. 3 short blocks away from Waikiki Beach.

Excellent place, nice location. It is a simple hotel that has everything you need to launch your Hawaii vacation. The breakfast in the morning is light and refreshing, perfect for a quick and easy start to your day.

Our stay at the Vive hotel exceeded our expectations. Super short walk to the beach, tons of restaurants along Kuhio Avenue- everything you need is within walking distance. The hotel decor was very unique, the rooms were clean, quiet and the perfect size for two people. The complimentary breakfast was just what we needed to get a quick start to the day- pastries, fresh fruit, coffee/tea and juices. The staff were very welcoming and incredibly helpful. Couldn't have asked for a better experience. Mahalo!

I have stayed at high end hotels this is not but I would stay here again. The rooms are small yes but I did not come to Hawaii to stay in a room, get over it. The plus side Staff really good really helpful. Location location a short walk to main beach and I mean short, you are close to everything, stores, shopping, transportation buses. This has it all tours we went on had close pickup. Safe area etc. Breakfast included, towels pickup at desk drop of at desk when done. The room we had was clean no complaints, bed comfortable. If you need a big room then don't stay here. No extra service fee as some places charge $30.00 per day

This was definitely a great hotel. We were very close to the beach and many restaurants. Breakfast was decent and the lobby is very nice. The room was small compare to other hotels but it was good enough to rest and relax. The room was very clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

I called the hotel few hours after I checked out when I arrived at my next destination. I left items of clothing, much needed for my return trip to the northeast.The items were in a bottom draw under the bed. This additional storage was useful as there is little space for storage within the room. I thought this was a good idea. BUT as I have not been accustomed to checking draws under beds I forgot to look when checking out. I called the hotel within hours but they claim nothing was found. I called a few times and still nothing was found. Someone did find my items but chose not to turn them in. A male assistant at the front desk after a few calls informed me that "no one wants your shawl!" Rude, yes. My recommendation is that you look for any stored items under the bed before you check out.

Super short walk to the beach. The breakfast is reasonable relative to the cost vs. cost of other places near by. Rooms and baths were small but we must be realistic here... One of the more popular surf breaks for beginners is super close. Our 6 yr old son was catching 10 second rides and keeping his life guard/dad very tired. The great O'ahu transit system has many stops very close. We took the bus all over Honolulu for about 10 days. We also rented a car for two days and then later for three days to bounce to the West, North and East coasts rather than spend hours on the bus.

My friend and I recently stayed at Vive for the first time. It was a great experience. The hotel was in the midst of waikiki, where everything and anything was in walking distance. The hotel rooms are clean, well kept and have just enough space for the small amount of relaxing you'll be doing while adventuring Oahu. The parts that stood out most, were the beautiful and well renovated lobby as well as the killer staff. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. In particular KC, the concierge (there almost everyday) was phenomenal. She did everything she could to get us the best deals, was incredibly kind and went out of her way to help us with everything we requested. And, every morning we came down for breakfast KC was there, ready to go with a smile and a laugh. I have been in the customer service industry for over 11 years, and have to say KC gave the best cust. service i've seen in a concierge. Thank you KC, Vive staff and Vive hotel for this great experience! We will definitely be staying here any time we return to Oahu.

Good- Very friendly staff- Free beach gear- Good value- Free breakfast (light breakfast, fruits, muffins but nice)- TVs accept USB so you can watch your own movies- Close to bus stopsBad- No wifi in room (but free in lobby)- Small rooms and small bathroom. Compared to the description of others, our room was a decent size, it was fairly small but more than enough space for 2 people on holiday. The bathroom is also small, with not enough space for toiletries but none of it was a deal breaker.- Strange concierge - there was a girl with a Cherokee haircut, young and inexperienced and she really could not offer a lot of insight on things to do. HOWEVER, they seemed to rotate the person who was concierge and the next day was Japanese gentleman who was extremely knowledgeable and helpful. You expect from concierge to go beyond just answering questions with short answers, which is what she did, and you want them to elaborate which is what he did.- There is computer access in the lobby but you cannot transfer files from your camera to your USB storage device which was a let down and concierge did not to much to help us there.- Noise - even though we were pretty high up, there was quite a lot of noise around, not coming from the hotel. However, you are in the middle of a city so I expect other hotels also have similar issues. However, I do believe double glazing would reduce noise greatly. Window can be opened which is nice to get some air.- No restaurant so no room service but they allow you to order from other places and have it delivered to your roomAll in all, the hotel is 2 blocks from the beach, and a couple of blocks from shops, friendly, safe and cozy. We stayed there for 10 nights and were quite happy with it. I would recommend it definitely, perhaps not highly, but definitely good value for money without any major letdowns.

this hotel was great The foyer is beautifully laid out. The reception staff were always pleasant and helpful,nothing was too much.The breakfast was great and plentiful and plenty of well thought out seating for breakfast and relaxing downstairs and only 2 blocks to the beach.we thought we were in heaven until we opened the room door. I do not think I have ever slept in a smaller room and I know it was the smallest room in the six states we visited and yes the air conditioner was noisy but not as noisy as the guy snoring or coughing in the room on the other side of the wall so they would have heard me too.For two people it was way too small and it was such a shame because once you step out of the elevator you are just stepped in to the holiday inn but I think their rooms are bigger..I know that getting as many into the hotel is money and what you are in business for I completely understand but it was just sad.

We stayed at Vive Hotel for two nights as a stop over between Australia and Canada. We arrived well before scheduled check in and the staff kindly let us into our room so we could rest our weary, jet-lagged heads for a bit before heading out to explore for the day.The staff, it should be said, were lovely and helpful without exception.The room itself was tiny, however... really, uncomfortably small. So much so that we were glad to be only a couple of days at Vive for this reason. To give a sense, there wasn't enough room to store our 2 large suitcases comfortably, and there was just enough room to get between the foot of the bed and the wall of the room. The room was simply a bed, a single chair and a wall mounted TV. The bathroom was equally tiny - just enough space for a tub/shower with the toilet cramped up next to it and the small sink. There wasn't even enough room to store toiletries anywhere.On the plus side - we were very close to the heart of Waikiki beach and we spent most of our time outside the hotel. Breakfast was spartan (a couple bits of fruit and pastries). We found that eating down by the water was good.The hotel's little library, boardgames and beach gear are lovely touches. Being able to use the computers and printer were really excellent adds as well.All in all, if we were going back, we'd request a larger room and perhaps one facing Diamond Head as it might be a bit quieter. Though we were nearly on the top floor, the noise from the city was still very loud, so be prepared to wake in the morning to the sound of traffic.

Room lovely, bathroom nicely upgraded, water pressure excellent, bed and pillows comfy. Noisy in-window air con, no balcony, no tea and coffee making in room, and no double glazing, perched over one of the busiest streets in Waikiki. We could hear people talking on the path below our 14th floor window. Fab location, and doubt you could get better value, however i will take my money elsewhere next time. Tea and coffee is available in lounge, but often late in the day coffee was empty or only warm, suggesting they had sat there since breakfast. Plenty of tea to select from, abundance of hot water, but no coffee sachets to help yourself. I am not asking staff.....I expect them to have systems in place to sort this simple problem, given that this basic resource is unavailable in the room. When I see 3 staff chatting at front desk and 4 empty coffee pots with no coffee sachets, then systems need improving.

I stayed at the Vive hotel for four nights in early February. The hotel itself is decent enough. The staff is wonderful; everyone was very friendly and willing to help in any way they could. Location-wise the hotel is set off a little from the major tourist trap area. For me, that's a plus. I don't much like over touristy destinations, and Honolulu is just that. You'll find that the Vive, while in relatively short walking distance to the busy areas, it's far enough away that you won't get swept up in a wave of tourists as soon as you walk out the door.For me, the major drawback was some of the design features in the room. I'm a solo traveler, so room size is usually not an issue for me. However, this room was really tiny. It was the size of a child's bedroom. Also, there is a door, a heavy 'outdoor grade' door in the room between my room and the room next to mine. Of course the door is locked and all that, but I could hear the gentleman's every move, phone calls, bathroom trips, everything, while he was in the room. He wasn't loud or anything, there's just a little gap at the bottom of the door that makes the close quarters a little more intimate than i would have liked.Lastly, the bathroom sink had a major design flaw. I get that they were going for a modern design, but the sink itself was a wide square, but only about an inch and a half deep! It made things like brushing my teeth and rinsing the sink out a complete chore. So, would I stay here again? I really don't know. I liked the location. But, I like a higher level of privacy in my room.

In previous trips to Hawaii I've stayed at other hotels that seemed dated to me with their floral patterned bed covers. The staff at Hotel Vive were warm and professional from start to finish. The valet service was very reasonably priced and convenient. If you sign up for their loyalty program you get 50% off valet parking. The hotel is located very close to the beach. It is also right across the street from Musubi Cafe Iyasume which was super convenient. In the lobby there was always cold water and cold water with lemon. In the mornings there was a free continental breakfast.Overall I am so happy we chose this hotel, I will definitely be back!
user_name:
Matthew H
South Pasadena, California, United States

review_body: Had a great time. Wonderful service staff was very accommodating. Hotel was beautiful and a great view from room. We had an excellent time on our stay. Will recommend to all my friends. We will be coming back to waikiki again and the vive hotel will be our preferred hotel of choice.

We stayed 3 days in this hotel and I must say I was impressed by the modern touche, at least in the reception area. The room it self was small, but simple, and even though the aircon was ridiculously loud and they could have added some more details (flowers, pictures, coffemaker etc), we can not really complain on the general standard. Breakfast was way too sweet for my liking (muffins, jam, pineapple etc), but fresh ingredients. Add some ham, cheese or cereal to this breakfast, and we would be happy.

From the moment we stepped arrived, we were greeted by welcoming and friendly staff. We were fortunate to be located on the 21st floor in an ocean view room. Although not directly located only the beach (3 minute walk), this hotel provides an escape from the hustle and bustle from the main strip, but is still very close to everything you need. The complimentary breakfast is an assortment of fresh fruits, a variety of pastries and toast, which is a great way to start the day. This hotel was definitely a highlight of our trip and we look forward to coming back in the future.

The Vive Hotel is an unbelievable boutique hotel in Waikiki.We stayed for 2 weeks and felt very special the way the staff treated us!All the staff are very friendly and extremely helpful.The hotel is located 2 blocks from the beach and close to everything in Waikiki.A wonderful continental breakfast with lots of fresh fruit is included daily.We had a junior suite with an ocean view that was very clean and very quiet.This was our second visit to the Vive Hotel and are looking forward to going there again next year. You can't beat this hotel for value and fantastic friendly service!!!

My wife and I spent ten days here recently. We had a really great experience with the hotel and it's staff. The rooms are small, but very nice. We were on the 19th floor with a beautiful water view .Room's were clean and the maid service was excellent. Flat panel television as well as a fridge and air conditioner in every room.  Upon check in we were greeted with a warm towel and a glass of fresh pineapple juice for each of us and a friendly smile and aloha from the front desk staff. Staff was very accommodating with all our requests. They have towels, chairs, mats, and umbrellas, for the beach, all at your disposal for free.Continental breakfast of fresh fruit ,juice ,tea and great coffee, toast and other assorted baked goods was decent but not extravagant. The hotel staff was great with information about tours,points of interest, and bus schedules. All in all a great place to stay for a reasonable room rate. 2 minute walk to the beach, bus stop right out front, walking distance to all kinds of shops and restaurants.

We stayed in the Vive Hotel for 5 nights during January. Even after reading the reviews of how small the rooms were and how you felt like you were going to take off with the noise of the air-con, we still booked. On arrival at 1 am the reception staff were most welcoming and the towels and pineapple juice were spot on! There service and information received was excellent at all times, booking taxis, shuttles, meals, excursions. Breakfast was more than adequate, ICE was supplied 24/7 too.Simply, we could not fault this hotel at all (except no milk for my cereal, just creamers for hot drinks) If I ever find myself back in Hawaii to re-live my 40th, I will be booking into the Vive Hotel, no doubt there, thank you all you made my birthday trip special!

What a wonderful little boutique hotel in Waikiki! We 'splurged' on one of the 'Junior Suites', so we had no complaint about the size of the room. We were given a free upgrade from 'mountain view' to 'ocean view', on the 7th floor. The views are between buildings, but we could see part of Diamond Head and also had a bit of an ocean view, about two blocks down the street. The staff was young and very pleasant and helpful! We were greeted with cold pineapple juice when we checked in. Wi-fi worked well. I was a bit concerned that it would be noisy at night, since our room faced Kuhio Street, but we found that things quieted down well at night. Breakfast was an assortment of fresh fruits, baked goods, juice, tea and coffee. Location was great for walking in Waikiki, and there was even a supermarket a couple of blocks down Kuhio. If we get back to Waikiki, we will stay here again!

This place is really great! Only a couple of short blocks walk to a wonderful part of Waikiki Beach. We were on a high floor with great views, mountain side, and could see the sun rise and set (February). Small suite was more than enough room. Bed quite comfortable and staff kept both the room and the whole hotel clean. The staff at front desk became sort of a family to us - Daniel, Samantha, Michael and Kasi -always greeted us with warm smiles and most helpful in all regards. Continental breakfast was good. Coffee 24-7 was a nice touch. We enjoyed the "boutique" feel to the hotel. Remodeled rooms and bathrooms. We recommend The Vive in Waikiki to all who travel to Waikiki. We shall return! Bob & Cynthia from Colorado

I recently stayed here for four nights. As others have mentioned, it is nicely decorated in a modern style and the staff were very polite and helpful. Rooms are clean and small. I liked having free wifi, a safe in the room, a free breakfast, a comfortable bed & pillows, and the view. I liked being close to the beach and lots of places to shop or eat.I did not like having no drawers, no counter in the bathroom (though there was a small glass shelf), and the not-so-good soundproofing for outside noise. The windows were single pane and the AC was kind of loud. I was on the 15th floor but could hear noises at street level. A room facing the mountains might have been better - mine faced west. Since I wake up super early, I would have liked to have had a coffee maker in the room. They do have coffee in the lobby area. Coffee shops nearby open early.

Stayed at the Vive for 5 nights in Feb, 2015. This place was awesome! Fantastic location, excellent service, very clean, fresh and up to date. Continental breakfast was adequate, rooms were on the small side but had everything you would need. The staff were wonderful. I would recommend to anyone staying in Waikiki.

It was an absolute perfect holiday for us!!! From start to finish!!! :)Shout out to KC for making all our fun adventure arrangements! You ROCKThank you Marcy for your always smiling face and for all your help! :) Also to the staff at the front desk, cleaning staff and car park boys and breakfast staff you guys are great! :)Keep up the great work!!!! :)Thank you kindly, Allister & Gilda S

We stayed here on our honeymoon for 3 nights. They had exceptional service from start to finish, including a hand written thank you for staying with them. Delicious continental breakfast, free wifi, request a room up high for a great view. It's 3 blocks from Waikiki Beach and has a ton of restaurants all around it. I would absolutely stay here again. The only drawback was the room size was a bit small, but it didn't bother me at all as we expected that going in. The prices cannot be beat! STAY HERE

We stayed here for a week, over Christmas, and thoroughly enjoyed it. The hotel was friendly, spotless and in a great location. The staff were excellent and made our stay such a pleasurable one. I thoroughly recommend this hotel!

We booked the room through an external site at good promotional price just to find it's a lot smaller than we previously visualized. So we opted for an upgrade ( additional $ 75/night) to a bigger room (doubling the room size, but actually getting bumped to the lowest floor, due to availability ) I do appreciate the face lift works on the building, re-design job done to the rooms , the staff's super friendly attitude and the thoughtful complimentary basic breakfast.However, the noise level from two small air conditioners plus relentless buses on Kuhio Ave below is just way too loud. I imagine it'd be a better staying experience for those who get higher floors.

-Located in the heart of Waikiki, you get free internet, free continental breakfast, complimentary beach gear (mat, towel, chair, boogie board). Classy in bathroom soap/shampoo/conditioner/gel/lotion, Quality sheets and pillows/towels, A.C., big flatscreen TV, safe, hair dryer, small refrigerator, robes.-Very attentive, super nice hotel crew.-Great late checkout policy :)-Next to the public bus-stop. $2.50 cash paid on the bus gets you to HNL airport in 45 minutes.-Great food options nearby, beach is 5 min. walking distance.-Some people might consider the rooms to be on the smaller side, walls a bit thin. No ice-machine on floors, just call guest services for ice.

Vive is a great hotel filled with friendly professional staff from top to bottom. Very clean and cozy with house keeping daily and the breakfast is wonderful with coffee, hot tea, and water all day. They all made our stay a great first time trip there. Close to the beach with knowledgeable staff, especially Kasi who booked all 6 of our tours and was absolutely wonderful to work with. He is very personable and searched for the best deal out there every time.

The Vive Hotel is an amazing place to stay while you're in Waikiki. Me and husband stayed there for a week on our honeymoon and we couldn't have asked for better. The we had an ocean front room that even though it was a little small it was perfect for a couple. The room was very clean with house keeping coming everyday. The location was amazing because everything was in walking distance. The service was great! KC the concierge was amazing! If we had any questions about any tours or things to do they were answered for us and we were not disappointed! The breakfast was basic but very tasty with fresh fruits and different pastrys. If you need anything for the beach they will give you towels, boogy boards, chairs you name it. So if we were to go back we would definitely stay there again.

Vive is a modern boutique hotel with small cozy rooms. It's a convenient location for walking to the beach, restaurants & shops. We loved all the friendly helpful staff, especially KC with her good tips, booking our shuttle and helping us find a restaurant for New Years eve.

Great location close to Waikiki beach and shops. All staff were friendly and helpful--especially the valet Adam! Room was good size for two people. Nice continental breakfast! Highest recommendations!

It's a very tiny boutique hotel. Much more attractive than the outdated hotels surrounding Waikiki, and half the cost. The room we had was tiny, but you can ask for a corner room for more space. The staff was more than helpful, Chris especially! They gave us towels and body boards each morning we went out. The breakfast was simple; pastries and fruit....better than nothing!We were able to walk everywhere, we even hiked to Diamond Head from the hotel, just because it's so beautiful to walk around! The beach is two blocks away, shops are right outside, and plenty of restaurants are down the street. Also, there is a bus stop right outside.Pros: Everything! The way the staff treated us was amazing. Also, they offer a "temp" room that you can reserve and will hold your luggage so you can enjoy the beach. Check out is at 12, but if your flight is later in the day (like 8pm for example), they allow you to reserve a room for an hour to shower and get ready for your flight. Cons: The room we had was tiny, but we only were there to sleep and get ready...we didn't come to Hawaii to sit inside! Thank you to all the Vive staff, we would consider staying there again if we get the chance to return!

Believe the positive reviews. This place is great. A few blocks back from the Dukes statue and central to the main Waikiki shopping, eating precinct. The staff are really helpful and have a host of things they offer to make your trip run smoother. Rooms are not huge, but they are a good size for two people who are only going to be sleeping and showering in there. Do it, stay at The Vive Waikiki. You won't be disappointed.

The hotel has a wonderful location two blocks from waikiki Beach, near restaurants, zoo; hotel people are nice and helpful. The hotel has paid parking; in the reception facilitate items to go to the beach, chairs, mats ...

A small hotel in a great location. Friendly, helpful staff. Modern decor and groovy breakfast area. Would absolutely recommend to others and also stay here again myself. So much Better than one of the 1980's hotel towers with 1,000 plus rooms in Waikiki.

We have stayed there for 7 days during New Year vacation. I can't recommend this hotel enough. I would like to thank everyone who works at reception as they were very kind and helpful. Upon arrival we got a glass of pineapple juice and cold wet towels to refresh face and hands. It was really sweet.Room wasn't really big but pretty good for the price we paid and in a very good condition too. There were safe and small refrigerator in the room, which is nice. They don't have resort fee like many other hotels in Waikiki.Free breakfast was a nice addition and helped us to save few bucks and a lot of time in the morning. They also provide beach towels, mats and chairs for no additional charge and we have never had a problem getting it.I would recommend this hotel to everyone who's looking for affordable but comfortable stay in Waikiki.

This hotel for sure did match our expectation.We did choose this based On location and that it should be a new hotel (we do NOT like old and worn).The location is perfect, it is only 2 min walking from waikiki beach and the main shopping. There is alot of restaurants in The area of all kinds and pricelevels. And There is bus stops just infront of The hotel so you Can go to diamond head, Pearl Harbor, airport etc easy. The location could only get better if it is was first row to The beach.The hotel seems new, clean and tighty AS we wished. The rooms and toilets are small, but was not a problem at all. We had a room On one of The lower floors and to The back side, but the view was still okay.This is NOT luxury or wellness but is a great City hotel AS we fore sure Will concider again or recomend if a great City hotel is the request.The plus sites of The hotel:LocationNew and tightyFriendly stadf that Can help and guide for turist toursGreat wifi (we could stream a movie)Free beach towels, mats and bodyboardsFree coffe and tea all dayThe minus:Breakfast is very simpel (we did NOT expect any so it was fine)Small roomsNo balkony (we did not expect so)We got a room that shared a door with The room next to, do request not to, since it is more noisy.Waikiki/honolulu is great, have a good holiday.

Vive totally exceeded expectations from the moment we walked in the door. The staff is considerate, and helpful.The rooms are awesome: very thoughtfully designed. In sum they are cool. Vive is about interior architecture, and design.The location is excellent, two blocks from the uber crowded shopping district. Walking distance to the beach, zoo, excellent restaurants, etc.The day we checked out and went to the airport, we learned our flight had been cancelled. The airline sent us to the Waikiki Marriott. While the view was nice, for ten minutes, everything about the hotel design was impersonal. It was so sprawling, I got lost three times. There are other supposedly hip hotels in Waikiki, but Vive trumps all.

We stayed at the Vive Hotel Waikiki for six nights and we loved it.Despite the room being small, it did not take long to get used to it. The main advantage of staying at this hotel was its location. On Kuhio Avenue it is a quick 5 minute walk to Waikiki Beach. The Bus stop is right outside the door and it is central to everything in Waikiki. The hotel is clean and the included breakfast was a bonus. If you are not looking for a resort-style accommodation, the Vive is perfect.Oh! The staff are wonderful!

Spending the Holidays in Waikiki is fantastic but spending them staying at the Vive Hotel in Waikiki makes it amazing!.
