I stayed there with a friend for almost a week around New Year's Eve and I couldn't be happier with my choice. This hotel was designed to meet your needs. My room on the 14th floor was very comfortable, clean and quiet. The fridge in the room is an amenity that very few hotels provide but many travelers appreciate. The complimentary breakfast makes your day easier to start and the complimentary beach towels and chairs make packing for your holiday a lot less cumbersome. Perfectly positioned at just two blocks from Waikiki beach, Vive is perfect if you want to ring in the new year sitting on the sand watching fireworks. But what makes Vive really stand out is its staff. In tune with the style of the hotel, Vive's staff is as young and vibrant as it is professional and competent. Ready to answer all your questions and help you navigate your holiday's plans, KC at the concierge and Christopher at the front desk provided an exceptional service and friendly advice. To them and all the other staff members at Vive Thank You! for making my Hawaiian holiday a truly memorable one and Happy New Year

I stayed at the vive for 17 nights in November 14. They had great service, pleasant clerks and a relaxing atmosphere. It is close to the beach, restaurants and shopping. The only thing I missed was a hotel bar and a better breakfast, but with jamba juice 5 minutes away breakfast was never hard to get!

I was at vive for 5 nights with my girlfriend back in March 2014. The staffs were super friendly and helpful. Girl at the concierge was very helpful with direction as i bothered her every morning, she was very patient. Room was small but modern. Our room was on the higher floor so the view was not too bad. Very nice location as it is very close to wakiki beach, a lot of local shops around the area as well. Many different parking options if you do not wish to valet park at the hotel. Free internet was a nice touch as well as the continental breakfast. Not much selection but it was convenient as we grab a cup of coffee on our way out every morning. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay again when i visit hawaii again in 2015!!

We stayed here for five nights in the John Lennon themed penthouse room. Our room was perfect apart from the A/C being noisy. Staff were also great and helpful. Also very knowledgeable with the local tours in the area. Continental breakfast was also great.

My parents, my wife and I had a very nice time during our stay during Nov 12-22, 2014.We booked two rooms during our stay. We enjoyed the simple continental breakfast every morning, the clean spotless rooms, and friendly staff in all departments. My father was very impressed with KC's friendly personality at the concierge. The lobby is very upscale looking. Although, the hotel rooms were smaller than normal american hotels, we found it very cozy and clean. We weren't vacationing in Hawaii to hang around in a hotel. We wanted to explore the Island and all of its beauty. That's why we rented a SUV for the 10 days and used the valet parking. The A/C in the rooms could use an upgrade due to the noise (even at economy setting), however, opening the window was a nice option with the trade winds.In my parents hotel room, they found their bed "softer" than what they're used to. Also, the bathtub needed a rubber anti-slip matting. What do you expect, they're seniors. They did like the variety of ethnic channels on the TV. My wife and I realized this is a small boutique hotel with no restaurants, swimming pools or hot tubs within the building. Many restaurants and shopping stores were within walking distance and the beach was only 3 blocks away. Our room was just perfect. You make the best of what is provided to you with a positive attitude. The neighbourhood is a little louder because of traffic and other uncontrolled sounds i.e. ambulances, emergency vehicles. However, you are in a densely populated area of Waikiki. Beach towels and chairs were easily provided by the hotel. The parking valet guys were very professional and friendly. They looked after our used beach towels and chairs when we returned back to the hotel to drop off our car. (Be sure to have $ to tip them, they deserve it!).Overall, we found our stay was very pleasant. We made a lot of new friends during the continental breakfast. The breakfast provided lots of papaya's, pineapples, melon, toasts, pastries, coffee, tea and juices. ….. we really miss the fresh fruits! Especially the "pineapples"We were able to stay 10 days because of the affordable rate this hotel provides. We will be back!Albert F.Coquitlam, Canada.

My partner and I stayed in this beautiful place for 10 days for our 3 year anniversary. We travel a lot through the world and this was a top of our list of best place to return to. Breakfast every morning was incredible and the staff were amazing. One staff member in particular was the best I have ever come across she did everything to make our Hawaii experience incredible and she did just that. Beverly is her name and the one to see. Thank you to the vive hotel for a unforgettable stay. We will be back :)

My husband and I stayed 7 nights in December 2014. The room (1807) was small but was all that we needed. We had beach views, although they were obstructed by other hotels. The air-conditioning is loud as others have mentioned, and the traffic from below was also quite loud. Woke up a few times from ambulances or beeping on the streets in the night. Overall, we were happy with our experience. KC at the concierge desk was also really helpful and when we hired a car for a few days she lent us the hotel GPS for free which was sweet. The hotel is only a 2 minute walk to the beach, and they provide towels, bodyboards, beach mats and chairs if you want them. The breakfast was pretty basic but it was all you need really - toast, muffins, american style coffee, fruit, juice, pastries etc.The hotel was very clean and modern. We spent the majority of our time outside of the hotel too, so it was perfect for us. If you want a hotel that you can spend time in with restaurants, bars, and a pool - then this isn't the place for you. Probably not a good option if you have young children as not many options within the hotel itself.

Great location, only two streets from the famous waikiki beach. The rooms are new and clean, but its REALLY small- the smallest " hotel" room that I have ever stayed actually. Service is good, warm and friendly but the part that is most annoying is the aircon that sounds like a boeing 747 in the room . Stayed 5 nights , didn't get a single night of good sleep. and I'm not a light sleeper....Overall value for money - so i guess you pay for what you get. But please do the tourists a favour and get the air-conditioning replaced?

Stayed for one night post cruise. The hotel lobby is well appointed. The staff are very accommodating. The room is very tiny. I bumped into the night stand exiting the bathroom. You can hear your traveling partner in the bathroom, the room is so small!! The bed linen I very thin and the bed mattress is soft. The air conditioner was very noisy - had to turn it off to get some sleep. I was told I would have a mountain view room, my room faced an apt bldg. I could look into the apts and the sot dwellers could look into my room. The beach is approx 3-4 blocks away - not short blocks. I was given watered down pineapple juice to quench my thirst upon arrival, it was not good therefore I opt to have breakfast out I.e., Duke's. Upon my return to Oahu I will chose another hotel.
user_name:
NewJazzhead
New York City, New York

review_body: We were there for 6 nights, It's seems pretty new, only two blocks from the beach and they supply towels, mats, and chairs and sun umbrella's and boogie boards, Breakfast is good lots of fresh fruit, muffins, breads and juice and coffee. Staff is super helpful and an extra shout out to KC, the tour director who is very helpful!!!!!!!!!! Close to shopping, bars, and dining and buses, and free wifi ....Downside ... rooms are super small, think express rooms in Europe, and no pool. But I would stay again.

I have just had the genuine real pleasure to have spent 13 nights from 25th November 2014 until the 7th December 2014. at the Vive Hotel WaikikiHow would I describe my stay? That is easy, superb, superb & even more superb. The staff especially Chris & Sahara on Reception & Jacqueline & KC on Concierge were a credit to the hotel as were the remainder of the staff, nothing was too much trouble for them. The customer service was superb by all. A message to Dan of the Vive Hotel Group, give the staff a pay rise.Do not expect the rooms to be huge in size because they are not massive but they are more than adequate. The beds are comfortable beyond words.The room was kept spotless throughout my stay Would I recommend & return to the Vive on a 26 hour flight? You bet your life I would no problem. Many, many thanks for a wonderful & memorable stay, Thanks to you allJ.P.PS. Dan You can up my "rate" for a staff pay rise, I will happily pay it & some for such good service. .
user_name:
Jan P
Cleckheaton, England, United Kingdom

review_body: Well,this hotel a definitively a city european touch.More destined to younger people,there is no pool,no restaurant,no bars but a most pleasant lobby lounge area where you can have a complimentary continental breakfast an nice and efficient staff to guide you around.The beach is at 3 blocks ,one of the best steakhouse of the island HYS is next door and you can order meals from your room if you wish from a list of restaurants available in the room. Rooms are small by american standard and too small if you spend a lot of time there....but there is so many things to do outside!and value for money is good when you know that WIFI is free and you are not charged resort fees which can be be very high in Honolulu!

We had planned on staying at the Vive Hotel for five nights based on previous reviews but after one night we cancelled our reservation and moved down the street. The deal breaker for us was there is really no where to hang out in this hotel -- no pool, no decks, no patio, no bar and the rooms are very small - think cruise ship cabin small with tiny bathrooms barely big enough for one person. If on business this would probably be fine but on holiday we want a place to hang out. The lobby is funky, the staff are friendly, breakfast is included (though pretty mediocre even by continental standards), and the rooms are clean but I just can't recommend staying here for a holiday. There are much better options for less money.

Before I get into the negatives, I do want to say this hotel definitely has some positive things going for it:#1: Customer Service. Every staff member was friendly, professional, and helpful. #2: Location. Only 3 blocks from the beach and easy access to dining and shopping. #3: Modern, updated decor. The lobby is beautifully decorated and the rooms have had some upgrades, although the quality doesn't compare to the lobby. Now for the reasons I won't stay here again:#1. ANTS. I did not bring food into my room when I arrived, but within minutes I started noticing them on the desk and nightstands. I alerted the front desk, who sent up housekeeping within minutes to spray everything down. However, the ants did continue to come back and I even found a few on my bed. I could not keep any food in my room because I knew it would have been worse. Every time I ate, I had to put it in a back and leave it outside. #2. Very small room and tiny bathroom. There was no dresser or drawers available. The bathroom had no area to lie beauty products on other than one very thin glass wall shelf. I had to use the sink when using the dryer and curling iron. I think I had a basic room and you may get more space in a deluxe room, but I have never stayed in such a small space before. #3. Loud window A/C units. I did read about this in another review, but wasn't sure what to really expect as some people are light sleepers. But you do need to be aware that at least once an hour it vibrates the room and makes a very loud noise for at least 5 minutes. So much so it woke me up several times a night, every night. Bottom line: It is a decent hotel in a great location. If you're traveling alone and need only a bed, this could work for you. However, this room would not work for more than one person. I think it has so much potential but some improvements definitely need to be made.

We stayed here for 3 nights, the rooms were small and very noisy.someone next door was yelling 2 of these nights, and I called the frontdesk only to be told that they can't hear any noise from the hallway.The following evening the same thing happened and the staff told us that theres nothing they can do about yelling and loud music. Staff was rude and and had no knowledge of how to treat Japanese guests.
user_name:
Jenson F
New York City, New York

review_body: Great location, only a couple of blocks from Waikiki beach. Rooms were good and clean . KC the concierge was amazing, friendly, helped us plan out our days and booked the tours that we were interested in. Just wished that the continental breakfast had a little more, like cereal and yogurt.

My partner and I stayed at Vive Hotel for four nights in October during an eight night visit to Oahu. - Location and surroundings - The hotel is located about three minutes walk to the middle of the action at Waikiki beach and other restaurants on the main Waikiki strip. Closer by, there are other eateries, as well as a couple of ABC stores. The hotel is also not far from Marukame Udon, which we highly recommend. Although there is a good variety of restaurants in very close If your situation permits, I would suggest venturing further into central Waikiki to find somewhere to eat. - Staff service and facilities -All staff we interacted with, from the receptionist to the bellboy and valet parking attendants, were all very friendly, helpful and genuinely welcoming. Coming from a non-tipping-service-culture, this is the kind of service that I do not mind tipping for. I also did a bit of online shopping and had it sent to the hotel, who kindly kept this for me until check-in.- Complimentary breakfast -The complimentary breakfast was simple but great for a complimentary breakfast. The spread consisted of pastries, fruit, and Hawaiian coffee and teas. Good enough to get you started before a day of sightseeing.- Room -Our room was on a high floor and had view of the ocean. It's important to note that the hotel is located a two or three blocks back from the beach, so while you can see the ocean, it may be slightly obstructed by other buildings. Nevertheless, this is better than a non-ocean view room. It's up to you to decide how much you value the view and how frequently you will be in the room to justify the extra cost. Should you stay here?Considering the price, location, service, and close proximity to Waikiki beach and action at Waikiki, I can recommend this hotel for people who want a clean and central place to stay and will be out of the room for most of the day.

We were welcomed at the Hotel with a glass of pineapple juice and a hot flannel.This set the tone for our stay here.Everyone was very friendly and helpful.Our room on the 15th floor was small but adequate. It was very clean.There was a view of the mountains (between other hotels)It had limited storage for clothes, but we had taken a lot.The bed was very comfortable.Our Air con unit was a bit noisy, but I'm a light sleeper and it didn't keep me awake.It made a good job of keeping the room cool.The walls are thin and a couple of nights we had noisy neighbours.Our over bath shower was both powerful and hot.The bathroom sink howeveris a good example of style over substance. It's too shallow.There were no tea / coffee making facilities in the room.The Hotel's Concierge "KC" couldn't have been more helpful and was very knowledgeable. This helped to make our break as enjoyable as it was.Thanks KC :-)The hotel offers free loan of beach equipment. It's a 4 - 5 minutes easy walk to the beach.It's adjacent to a bus stop and the islands buses are very good. Cost for an adult is $2.50 with two time restricted transfers allowed.There are plenty of places to eat within a few minutes walk of the Hotel.24 hour tea and coffee is available in lounge area.Buffet style breakfast of fruit and pastries is also available in the lounge area.It wasn't always easy to find a seat for breakfast ( 2 mornings out of 15)Would we stay here again? Yes definately.

This hotel is conveniently located within three blocks to Waikiki Beach. The daily continental breakfast included a variety of fresh fruit, pastries, muffins, toast, and juice. Unlimited coffee and tea is available all day. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance.Room is a bit small, but comfortable and clean. The staff are very friendly and attentive, Valet parking is expensive at $25 per day, however; this hotel is within walking distance (3 blocks to your left as you exit the front door) to the Aston Waikiki Banyan. There is an independently 3rd party operated parking garage monitored 24 hours at $15 per day or $80 per week. A monthly rate is also available.The only down side was the window air conditioning unit which was very noisy, and you cannot take a bath because there is no stopper for the bath tub.

Honestly, we were extremely satisfied. My husband and I went for our honeymoon last week (11/15-11/22/14) and everything was great. They even sent up a personal note and a little box of chocolate for us! The beach is two blocks away, they have beach towels, chairs, mats and body boards to borrow - free of charge. On arrival, we were offered pineapple juice and cold towels. The front desk staff was super friendly and informative with recommendations on places to eat. The concierge helped us with a Luau (Germaine's - also fun!) and a shuttle to Pearl Harbor. The lobby is spacious with plenty of room to sit. There are books provided, and always water, coffee, and tea available. The free wi-fi was convenient to have and continental breakfast each morning was delicious. Fresh fruit and pastries. Pineapple will never taste as sweet again! Thank you so much, Vive, for a wonderful stay!

We had 2 nights as a stopover between Melbourne and San Francisco. The price is excellent value, the staff terrific and we loved the stylishly decorated lobby and lounge area. Someone has very good taste.The fruit for breakfast was superb.We were kindly allowed our room at about 9am and we were very grateful. The staff are keen to please However, as has been stated, the rooms are small and and disappointing but not in the context of the price. It really is a bargain.Not for your resort holiday unless you are on a budget but great for a stopover.

Stayed 1 week in this hotel.New clean rooms we had a corner room on the 19th floor with great views.Very friendly and helpful staff easy check in/out.Short walking distance to Waikiki beach.Bus stop right outside the hotel for the public buses that can take you around Honolulo for 2.50 Great breakfast and free WiFi.Good value for your money

Overall a great hotel to stay in in Waikiki! For the price & what you get, I would recommend it.Pros:- New, clean, modern-loking hotel- Great location: walking distance to the main Waikiki strip & beach- Great service and nice staff - we got a free upgrade to room with partial ocean views because it was my birthday- Free continental breakfast in the lounge area every morning was a nice touch (consisting of pastries, toast & fruit)- Free wifiCons:- Found the beds a little bit on the soft side and possibly sagging a little- Can be a little noisy at night with the buses & emergency vehicle sirens. But shouldnt be a problem unless you are a very light sleeper- No swimming pool to chill at, but you can always walk to the beach

Gorgeous lobby, helpful staff, breakfast provided, lovely toiletries. I really wanted to like this hotel. They are trying really hard. Unfortunately it doesn't cover up the fact that the rooms are tiny with old fashioned window air conditioners that are very noisy and make the room vibrate. I unfortunately shifted to another hotel after one night to get some sleep. I felt sorry for the reception staff because there was nothing they could do.

Had a fabulous time at Vive during our recent visit to Honolulu. A big thank you to KC at Concierge who was more than helpful and extremely knowledgeable of the area. The hotel was perfectly located a 2 minute walk to the Waikiki beach and shops. We loved the Continental breakfast each morning and the hot and cold beverages available in the lounge throughout the day. Our only complaints would be the noisy air-conditioning unit and the view we had from our room, we booked Ocean View and could only slightly see the water in-between two buildings. Thank you Vive for a wonderful stay, will definitely return!

We really loved this hotel. It is just perfectly located, around 200m from the main place of the honolulu beach. You can really enjoy the beach and the night life.The reception team answered to all our questions, even the concierge which brings some funny touch with his hairs!The hotel is perfectly clean , you will enjoy the breakfast and the lemonade available all the day long. If you are lucky you can even get some candy!Only one thing was just horrible THE NOISE They should change their windowsYou can sleep there!!

Vive Hotel thoroughly exceeded expectations. Our flight was 6 hours delayed and they had no problem checking us in at almost 5am, greeted us with juice, cold flannels and a smile. Breakfast was simple - toast, fruit and pastries - but enough to get us started without having to worry about what to eat. The rooms were small but modern and comfortable, just what we needed when we weren't spending much time in the room. An easy 2 block walk to the beach (maybe 3 minutes?) and great views from the room. The free wifi was so helpful, and the beach towels, chairs etc were greatly appreciated.But the absolute best part of the stay? George the concierge. He was AMAZING! He gave us fantastic recommendations including food in the next town that was fabulous local food. Got us a great deal on a convertible mustang, and lots of tips and suggestions for us. He made the whole trip, not just the few nights at Vive. If I ever find myself back in Waikiki, I would definitely stay here again.

I didn't know what think when I pulled into the hotel but I'm so glad I stayed at Vive. If you walk slowly you can be at the beach in 5 mins. The hotel is gorgeous inside; the staff are fantastic, they could not do enough for us; the lobby & hotel floors were always kept spotless. The room, although smaller than most, felt bigger & had everything you need. Although the hotel has no balconies, I implore people to book with them, who needs a balcony when you're in the centre of Waikiki anyway? Small touches, like a book collection, board games & free coffee/tea always available, make a for a great stay. Also, did I mention free beach towels, mats, chairs & body boards? I will return to Hawaii & I'll be booking with Vive again.

I got a room for one. The room for just myself was more than enough space. Well air conditioned room, good carpeting, and clean bathroom and bed. The hotel was literally 2 blocks away from the beach (4-5 min walk right out the hotel entrance straight down the street). You can also ask for supplies for the beach from the front desk like a beach mat or towel. They do not charge extra for that. Wifi is free as well and is fast on a computer or smartphone. Only downside I really found during my stay was parking. That was if you had a car with you, which I had a rental car with me. Quick solution to that? Park somewhere along Ala Wai Blvd. Its about 2-3 blocks away walking distance from the hotel, but worth not having to pay $25 valet parking at the hotel. I stayed two nights and avoided having to pay that fee for the two nights by scoring free street parking. Just have to be mindful of street cleaning rules where you have to move your car which I will tell you now is MOVE YOUR CAR ON MONDAYS AND FRIDAYS FROM 8:30-11AM. Hope that tip helps your planning.

6 nights at this hotel was adequate enough for us. Not a resort hotel but offering a pleasant atmosphere and service. Greeting upon entrance was grand with fresh pineapple juice and a moist towel. The room offered all the basic amenities from free wifi, cable flat screen and compact fridge.  The continental breakfast could have been above average, only offering fresh juice and coffee, fresh sliced fruit and a verity of pastries and toast. Clean and updated hotel for a fraction of much larger hotels on Waikiki. One of our highlights during our stay happen to be the concierge "KC" !!! Talk about the local hospitality, offering us multiple activities and attractions for the common vacationer and knowledge of all the local action. Thanks KC .... Walking distance to the beach and main strip. Overall you can't go wrong with the VIVE HOTEL

Imagine the ocean view in your sleep cause that's where your ocean view is. If your clasterphoabic and like to sleep on your side, for this box and be prepared to stare at the toilet. Rooms are perfect for small people.Continental breakfast is as real as Santa Clause. Rip, rippity, rip off and very clean!

We spent two nights at the Vive at the end of our stay in Hawaii, after spending the better part of a week on the big island. It was a great choice for us! We arrived early and just wanted to stow our bags while we grabbed a late lunch and checked out Waikiki. We were immediately greeted by friendly front desk staff with cold pineapple juice and wet towels to freshen us up. Then, we were upgraded to a bigger room with a beach view that was available immediately! I can't say enough good things about this hotel, especially considering the price! Clean rooms, top notch staff, a great continental breakfast and three blocks from the beach and about five blocks to some serious shopping. I was even able to swap out the paperback book I finished with another from their library. Other attractions, like the zoo, aquarium and restaurants are an easy walk.My only critique would be of my first impression when we walked in the lobby. With techno music thumping over the intercom, the decor and all the staff dressed in ultra-trendy clothes, it seemed like it was trying way too hard to be chic and modern. I felt like I was in a SNL skit and that Fred Armitage was going to greet us at the concierge desk with some wickedly funny quips. At that point, I really wondered if I'd steered us wrong booking here. But first impressions aren't everything,stay and the rest of our was excellent. I would highly recommend the Vive!
user_name:
Teresa M
Boulder, Wyoming, United States

review_body: I was able to spend 5 nights in this hotel which is centrally located near the heart of Waikiki. The room we stayed in was comfortable, and nicely appointed. It had all the amenities one would want. This hotel is not a resort, so it has a different feel than some other places. I have stayed in several resort hotels in Hawaii and while this hotel does not have those resort features it makes up for this in the nice rooms, great location, and staff that make you feel at home. The staff separated this hotel from others in my opinion. They were accommodating and helpful in every respect. The hotel provided a small oasis from the bustling of Waikiki, which I could access at anytime if desired. It was in close proximity to restaurants, shopping, and two short blocks from the beach. Once you head out of the hotel you can see the ocean. I enjoyed having a quiet retreat and not being over run with lots of other tourists in this hotel. Even though resorts have some different features those hotels can feel impersonal. I enjoyed receiving a warm welcome from staff each and every time I entered the hotel. I would return to this hotel again, and appreciate the attention to small details that made myself and daughter feel welcome. They also were able to arrange a shuttle to get to the hotel for $12 per person to (or from) the airport (which is better then the $45-50 taxi ride). I would highly recommend this hotel.

Just finished a week at the Vive - it was a great choice for us - we had a penthouse room and it was really great (I highly recommend getting a penthouse if possible - so much bigger - especially the bathroom and shower.) Check web for specials.This is the cleanest (spotless really) hotel I have ever stayed in - which is so important to me. Decor is modern. I cannot say enough about the staff - always at the desk - very friendly and helpful - always called me by name - (you will not get that at one of the big hotels!!)Breakfast is free - very nice - not much protein - but great fresh fruit and rolls - good variety of both.Free 24 hour coffee in lobby - no coffee pot in room.Only 2 blocks straight into the main part of Waikiki beach (very easy walk) and all the shopping (most pretty high dollar).We made our island tours with the Hyatt tour desk (the Vive was very helpful - booked our shuttle back to the airport, but help desk hours were about 8 to 2 and we usually were not at the hotel during those times). When you book tours at the Hyatt (just straight up toward the beach from the Vive - 2 blocks) the bus picks you up at the Hyatt which is very convenient (tour desk on Hyatt 2nd floor).Vive has free beach chairs, mats, etc. Which is great. Just ask at the desk.Also on the day you check out - you can reserve a courtesy room for an hour to clean up before you leave to the airport (our flight was a 9pm so that was really helpful).I loved this hotel! I have been to Hawaii 4 times and stayed at a 'big' hotel in the past - I much prefer the Vive.

Only few blocks from Waikiki beach. Wonderful continental breakfast, it will be great if there's more selection. Free wifi which was great.Free beach towels, beach mats, chairs, and boogie boards, we can borrow for free. Service was AWESOME. everyone was super friendly and nice.KC gave us great recommendation and did most of our activities booking for us! KC was fantastic.Complementary shower room for one hour, after we checked out.we highly recommend vive hotel to our friends and family

This was a very clean, modern hotel. Nothing was too much trouble, from the welcome at check in to the complementary breakfast. The loan of beach towels, mats, chairs and boogie boards was a nice touch.

Three blocks from Waikiki beach. Wonderful continental breakfast. Free wifi. You can borrow beach towels, beach mats, and boogie boards to take to the beach or around the island for no extra charge. Valet parking only, $25/day with unlimited trips (it was the most affordable parking I saw in that area of Waikiki). The service was fantastic! Everyone was friendly, helpful, and always smiling. The rooms are small...but who is staying in their room much while in Hawaii anyway? My sister and I had one of the rooms with 2 twin beds with connecting door to the room next door (it would be great for families) and the door wasn't horribly soundproof but we always headed out early and we're back by 2000ish and the neighbors always stayed out late so it worked well. I 100% recommend the Vive Waikiki.

The location of the hotel is excellent, only two blocks from the beach. The rooms are on the small size; however, one spends so little time there it did not matter. The air conditioner is rather loud and was a minor problem for my husband. We were very pleased to be offered a continental breakfast although we would have appreciated more variety. The concierge KC was absolutely invaluable. Nothing was too much trouble; a full day excursion to the Polyneasian Cultural Center as well a full day car rental were reserved within moments. Thanks KC!!!In summary, we would recommend the Vive Hotel as accommodation; moderate price, good location, and above all a very friendly and helpful staff.

I can't really think of the words to thank all the people at the Vive hotel, I do work in the hotel industry and I always compared hotels every where I go, I want to walk in and see someone at the front desk and yes I was glad to see someone there with a smile and ready to help me, I was too early to check in but no problem I got help anyway and welcomed with cold juice and cold towel for me and my friend, that's how every hotel should welcome their guests. Check in was very fast and courteous, they took my luggage and I was off for some food while I wait for the room, OK now the room, I see people complaining about the room size, but I can only speak of my room, 22nd floor penthouse #2, very spacious, great decor which it also have a great painting of John Lennon, I had a closet, and enough space for my luggage and my friend's luggage, the bathroom was also great, walking shower, and stocked with everything I needed. The great part of it I had a balcony with ocean view, city view and mountains view, I was really pleased with the room, the bell service was excellent, and housekeeping did a great job everyday, I know I would leave a mess everyday because of me bringing sand and water, plus trash and the use of towels but no problem at all, every time I would come back the room will look just as I got it in the first place, we had breakfast everyday and leave the plates I the room and everyday the room was clean. Speaking of breakfast, keep in mind they offer continental breakfast and that is what I got, no complaints there either. The extras!!! Free Wi-Fi, free concierge, and free beach items to take with you to the beach, which includes chairs, towels, umbrellas, etc.etc. over all I do recommend this hotel, and just remember, you do get what you pay for here and in my opinion more, way more.. the way I see it, don't expect to eat a five guys or whataburger hamburger if you only pay for a cheap McDonald's or in&out burger. Well, have fun fun and enjoy your vacations. Oh and Waikiki is just 2 blocks away, very convenient hotel to just walk around everywhere.

The only positive thing I can say about our stay at the Vive is that the staff are very helpful and very knowledgeable - other than that it hasn't got much going for it. The rooms are so small it's a struggle to fit your bags in there let alone any shopping you do during your trip. Our bathroom was a total nightmare - the showerhead shot water out the side so the entire bathroom was drenched after each shower; the toilet seat was broken; and it took 3 days to get the plug in our basin fixed after it was stuck shut. The walls are paper thin so you can hear every bit of your neighbours conversation. The air conditioners, despite being the loudest units ever, do little to block out the noise coming from the street at all hours of the night. Oh and if you want to get into your room right away keep dreaming - you have to swipe the key card 20 times before you will be let in. You will also have to wait until 4pm to get your room cleaned. We booked the hotel based on the positive reviews on here, big mistake. Don't do it.

Vive Hotel provided the best service I have ever had in Waikiki, from the welcome juice and cold towel to the quick and easy checkout. Great free breakfast of fruit and pastries, free fast wifi and everything you need for a day at the beach. Staff were very friendly, and the concierge provided good information often pushing us towards the less expensive solution. (Thanks Casi)Rooms and foyer are well maintained, and a perfect sanctuary when you need a break from the sun and crowds.Highly recommended.

Our stay in Vive Hotel was absolutely great! Hotel stuff was always nice, helpful and friendly. Hotel is really close to the beach and Main Street. Room was always clean. Special thanks to KC which made our stay memorable because of advising great tours around the island! We're going to recommend this hotel to our friends and family, the price was absolutely worth it and we wish we can come back one day to Vive Hotel :) Best regards,Monika and Natalia from Poland

For a relatively small boutique hotel this place has almost everything going for it; an ideal location only a few blocks from the beach, great staff with excellent customer service, comfortable communal areas and a quality buffet-breakfast included in the room rate. The guest room was decorated to a high standard and was really clean and well appointed, with quality toiletries an added bonus. There was a small fridge to keep water and snacks cool, which provided welcome relief after a hard day at the beach...!On the downside, however, the room was quite hot and the air-conditioning unit was noisy to say the least...Despite booking a 'queen size' room the bed was really quite small for two people...Bottled water was provided in the room, however, this was charged for, which we only realised afterwards. Despite these drawbacks the hotel was good value for money and clearly deserves its rating...I booked it through an on-line agent and received a very good deal on a week long stay in Waikiki - I would recommend it to discerning travellers who are looking for quality and style at a price that won't break the bank. It's almost 5 stars but not quite...4.5 stars for me represents a fair review and a good all round result. Mahalo!

we flew from Sydney to Honolulu on the night flight arriving at hotel around 8am. The room was not available but we anticipated that. What we didn't anticipate was the welcome! Cool towel to refresh enjoy some breakfast before setting out and we will take care of bags, would you like a call when room ready.The room whilst small on Australian standards was clean well appointed and on 20th floor looking out to beach and ocean. Now that is the way to start your holiday

Plusses: The staff is absolutely the best in over 400 hotels I've stayed. I cannot overstate their professionalism and friendliness. The best.Minuses: Breakfast was the same every morning. Just a small change each day would be a welcome addition. The sinks in the room were too shallow to be used. They need to be changed to a deeper one. A coffee maker in the room would be a good change if possible.My wife and I had a delightful stay and we highly recommend this gem.
user_name:
Roger D
Buffalo Gap, Texas, United States

review_body: BJ at the concierge, Sahara and Michael of customer service were excellent. The rooms were clean and the house keeping crew marvelous. Rooms were a bit small but hey.......the weather and experience over the top. Cheers. Moses 801/809

This is a great hotel. Everyone my mother and I dealt with were friendly and helpful (from the front desk staff to the cleaners). Kasi the concierge was awesome and arranged a car rental, tours and shuttles for us... she even chased up my missing luggage with Qantas! The hotel has a great location, located one block back from Waikiki beach and the shops/restaurants. They also offer free use of towels and beach chairs although one suggestion for the hotel is that they provide umbrellas also.If you are travelling with someone (a parent or friend) who you wouldn't usually share a bed with, can I suggest you book a junior suite rather than a twin room. The suite was huge and the king size bed was big enough that you don't feel cramped or uncomfortable.

Located conveniently to the beach, clean, modern hotel with great continental breakfast included - this was a great find. It is however the staff that made it a perfect place to stay from the welcome when we arrived with fresh juice and refreshing towels to the brilliant KC, the concierge who booked us a rental car, gave us restaurant suggestions for an anniversary dinner, arranged shuttles to Pearl Harbour and gave us tips for great bus trips round the island to beaches where the locals go. We had 6 days and it was a great place to relax. Thank you
user_name:
Pandora C
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: Stayed for 6 days and had an amazing vacation thanks to the Vive.Attentive staff all goes out of their way to make sure your stay is comfortable.Free breakfast is great, but get there early as it does get busy later.2 block walk to Kuhio beach which is excellent, 2 blocks in the other direction gets you to the shopping area. Easy access to everything you could possibly need.

We stayed here for 5 nights in a junior suite on the 15th floor facing the ocean and it was a great view straight down to the ocean, the room had plenty of space and we were really happy with it. It's a great hotel and I won't repeat all the positives that everyone else has written about except I will emphasise that the team that work here are all really good and helpful with everything you ask of them. They checked bus times for us and pointed us in the right direction to catch them, got us a good deal with renting a car and advised us where to explore on oahu which is a must, leave Waikiki and drive round the whole island and stop an hour or so on any beach that takes your fancy, it's brilliant. Pearl harbour is well worth half a day, get the bus just outside the hotel, get there early, get a ticket to USS Arizona which is free and wander around , amazing! Diamond head is worth a visit, again , go early before it's too hot, bus goes just near the hotel, just ask at the hotel and they'll tell you where to go, it's easy. We would definitely stay again.

I just returned from a perfect 5 night stay at the Vive Hotel Waikiki, this is an amazing place to stay. The location is PERFECT right behind Hyatt one block to the beach. I had a queen sized bed room on my first night and changed to a room with two twin beds a day later when my friend arrived, both rooms were new, SUPER Clean, and comfortable. The rooms are a bit small but who sits in the room all day when your in Hawaii!? Breakfast was great and fresh. With a lot of fresh fruits options and delicious pastries. The blueberry bread is out of this world!! The staff really is what makes this hotel so special. Everyone goes above and beyond for you. The ladies who did my check in where great and the valets Cory and Adam super patient with me, when I needed to retrieve somethings from my luggage after check out Adam was a saint and so patient. The hotel offers beach mats, towels, and boards at no charge so you can take to the beach. Both concierges Kacey and George were fantastic. But I will hold a special place in my heart for George, he gave me and friend so many great places to see and do especially in the North Shore. He recommended a great Snow Cone place and suggested I try it with the beans, I did and I wasn't a fan of the beans and we had a good laugh about it a day later. He really loves his job and Hawaii, he loves sharing information not only about Oahu but about all the Islands. I can not find one negative thing about this hotel! Everything was 5 stars. I cannot wait to be back at the Vive!

The Vive is a refreshing departure from the Hawaii-themed decor that many Waikiki hotels overindulge in. The staff was friendly and attentive, and the concierge was a great help in finding activities, booking shows, and recommending local restaurants. While it is $25 a day to park in their garage, Waikiki parking is expensive everywhere. The rooms were comfortable yet somewhat spartan--a nice bed (which slept well), table, mini-refrigerator (needed for my new love of POG fruit juice), and a flat screen television. My room had a (very) partial ocean view. The bathroom had a sliding door which did not appear to have a lock; it was certainly different, but my wife and I did not mind. We had a lovely stay and would not hesitate to come back to the Vive.

Went here for our Honeymoon, trendy and modern! The hotel fit our budget, doesn't have any hidden costs or resort fees. The staff works hard to meet guest needs. The continental breakfast was very fresh, it could use one source of protein such as yogurt to offset the breads and fruits. Our room was very clean and functional. Location can't be beat. Literally 400 ft to Kuhio beach park and the Duke statue, plus free beach towels, umbrellas, and boogie boards from the property. Valet allowed us to lock up our rental bikes for free! If not for the information below, this hotel would have 5 stars. Since this is a newly launched property management could tweak a few things to make some easy fixes.The housekeeping staff was very nice, but they didn't all seem to be on the same page. i.e. not emptying the trash, leaving melted ice and an old liner in the ice bucket, not giving us new glasses to drink from. Small items, and not all of these things happened at once, but over the course of a week it becomes pretty noticeable. The concierge was not helpful, treated us like we were in over our heads and our couldn't fulfill our request. All we wanted to book was a luau, so I went upstairs picked up the phone and booked it myself in less than 5 minutes. Definitely a lost opportunity for revenue for the property. There were several faces manning the concierge desk and our only interaction was with one individual. ymmv on that one.

I attended a wedding and had to stay the weekend in Waikiki. I was traveling alone and thought this would be great for a quick trip. Service is great. I liked that when you valet car, elevators took you right to your floor. Very convenient. Check in was very easy, greeted with cold towel and glass or orange/pineapple juice. Room was a bit small (almost felt like a dorm), but that was expected. I had 2 single beds in my room. The only thing I noticed in my room, was the door didn't shut all the way on its own and I had to remember to check door every time I left. One time, I didn't and I came back to my door ajar (thankfully nothing was taken). I also noticed a few teeny tiny ants in the bathroom around the sink. Not sure if this was just my room, or common in the hotel. Breakfast was good. Nice display and the fruit was always fresh. I liked how they had lemon or orange water out throughout the day/night. Only issue I had was the price of valet was not clearly listed. Their is no self park. Valet is $25 per day. Also, this is not the hotels issue, but I did walk to beach from hotel (2 block walk), and had some of my personal stuff on beach while I was in ocean. A man did try and steal my stuff. I was able to catch him and get it back. Be very careful about what you bring to the beach or downtown (no wallets, valuables etc).

We stayed at this great hotel twice during our recent trip to Hawaii. It was great from start to finish, both stays. The hotel staff are courteous, friendly and helpful. The room we had on the 19th floor was clean, modern and comfortable with everything we needed, free wifi, fridge, robes and a comfy bed with gorgeous partial views of the ocean and Diamond Head. The continental breakfast provided each morning was fresh and delicious with good perco coffee. Stand outs would be the lovely staff (especially Sahara from Oz) and the position, being one main street back from Kalakaua Avenue and the beach it was convenient but quiet. Also the free beach equipment and all day coffee/tea supplied. It is close to some great restaurants, our favourite would have to be Mac 24/7 at the Hilton Waikiki Prince Kuhio a few minutes walk. All in all the Vive Waikiki was a wonderful place to stay and great value for money, we will return!

We stayed at the Vive for 3 nights. Our room was functional, clean and well made up daily. The hotel does not have central A/C above the lobby. The rooms have window A/C units that do a good job of cooling. However, if A/C unit noise is bothersome to your sleep, you are going to have a problem. The hotel has an included continental breakfast consisting of breads/pastries, fresh fruit, coffee and juice. Very refreshing. Front staff are very friendly and helpful and greet you upon arrival with fresh pineapple juice and a cool towel. Parking is valet only at an additional $25/day. The hotel is only 2 short blocks from Waikiki beach and the shopping area. Overall, if window A/C noise does not bother you, I would recommend the Vive

Vive Hotel stands out from its immediate surroundings by offering an upscale look and great service - although surrounded by an older and more worn neighborhood (hence the diamond in the rough reference). But, it is convenient to a great section of the beach and lots of shopping a few blocks away. Authentic eateries can be found close by too. Buses conveniently pass by in front of the hotel for those who are taking a bus to get around, and if you have a car, plenty of parking in the parkade. One thing that I have to make a special note of, is that the front desk staff were very friendly and helpful without being pretentious. I really liked the fact that everything that we needed for the beach was provided by the hotel: towels, beach chairs, boogie boards... Major points for service to Vive Hotel.Although my room was clean and neat, I found it very small and no view at all - so the blinds were kept closed the whole time. I really missed having a balcony. It would have been nice to relax with a glass of wine and a fresh breeze on my face. My room just felt too claustrophobic to really be enjoyable, and there was a certain amount of noise from outside from time to time, but nothing extreme. In the room there was a fridge, good desk area, the bed was very comfortable, and a good shower.It is nice that they provide breakfast, but it is a typical continental, which is fine for some, with good coffee and juice and lots of fruit. There is plenty of seating too in a variety of arrangements, which makes this breakfast room very pleasant. I felt comfortable in the environment of the Vive hotel, which as a single female traveler, was a major benefit. Again, thanks to the lovely staff.

We stayed here for a few days on our 5 year anniversary. Good things - GREAT concierge service, appreciated the breakfast, nice look and feel - modern. Not a far walk from the beach. Overall great place. They even give you pineapple juice when you check in.The downsides were that the room was small, the $25 valet fee, and one night we could hear the neighbors music. Other than that, we had a great time.
user_name:
Andrew H
San Marcos, California, United States

review_body: Great hotel. Fantastic price. Very close to the beach if you want to hang out in Waikiki. We had a rental car and the garage was very convenient. There was always someone in the garage to valet your car and they would always take your beach towels as well. Staff was absolutely fantastic. Always available to help and very friendly. We were greeted with fresh pineapple juice and a damp towel for our hands when we walked in to check in. One of the nights we were heading out for dinner it was raining. One of the gentleman working the front desk ran right over with umbrellas before we headed out. Rooms were clean, super neat and tidy. We had a view of the ocean. Breakfast was great as well. Continental. Nice selection of fruits and different croissants. I recommend this place to everyone travelling to Oahu, Hawaii. My husband and I were super impressed!

Vive Hotel is a quaint but modern style hotel about 3 or 4 blocks inland from the beach. Apparently repurposed from a condo style building the feel is avante guarde without being stuffy. Staff was welcoming and helpful and provided a cool towel and cool fresh fruit drinik during check in. The room was small but nicely done (we were a party of two) including a queen bed (great mattress and pillows) and also included a room air conditioner and refrigerator. In the morning a free continental breakfast was offered to start your day right. There is no restaurant in the hotel but there are plenty within easy walking distance.our stay was only for one night as we were transitioning to an outer island so we didn't venture far. However, we walked about 3 blocks to the Hilton for dinner. The International Market is walkable distance too.All-in-all, a pleasant and affordable experience.

My husband & I stayed at Vive Hotel for 10 days at their Cosmopolitan Room with mountain view. I knew before arriving at the hotel that the rooms are small and we didnt mind as we wouldnt be at the room most of the time. The room has AC, fridge, tv, safe, hair dryer (iron/iron board are available upon request) and a fast free wifi! They also provide free continental breakfast which is filling. Cofee & are available 24/7. Beach towels, boogie board, mat & chairs are available free of charge which is awesome as you dont have to buy it. Location is perfect, just 2 mins walk to Waikiki beach. Bus stops are close to Vive. Lots of restaurants & shops around the area. I love the Korean food across Vive called Me BBQ! Awesome job to Christpoher in reception for being accomodating to our questions. I highly recommend this hotel.

If you are doing research of which AFFORDABLE hotel to stay in while in the Waikiki area...choose this hotel! My wife and I just returned last week from a 5 day stay here and couldn't have been happier. It is a boutique hotel so the rooms are not large, but everything is very well maintained, clean, and who can argue with a free breakfast!? The location is awesome also...it is only about a block and a half to the beach, literally less than 2 minutes walk to the statue of Duke on waikiki beach. The hotel provides everything you need for a beach day..towels, beach chairs, bamboo mats, and even boogie boards! The staff were all amazing as well..very friendly and helpful. We asked them multiple times for recommendations (specifically Poke and Shave ice) and their recommendations turned out to be great places! I have seen people complain about the noise from the AC unit, which is understandable as it could be a bit loud, especially when turning on and off. Overall we couldn't have been happier with our stay.

Vive hotel!! You cannot go wrong! Loved my stay here, booked it based on a price, and the style and look of the rooms! First time to Hawaii so upon entering the front doors from my shuttle I realised that it was positioned so close to the beach and it wasn't costing me an arm and a leg to stay there!! Reception staff were friendly (especially a young Australian female who was beautiful). Upon entering my ocean view room immediately I got a great glimpse on both sides of the city and ocean!! Room was spacious and bedding was comfortable! Room service would come around twice a day should they miss your room for bedding sheets, fresh towels etc. Would recommend Vive to any individuals/Families who are after value for money!! and a hotel that is central to the main strip! It has a very modern boutique look and feel to it which makes it unique to the rest of the hotels in Waikiki that seem outdated based on what I saw online when researching for accommodation! Would stay there again on my return to the sunshine state from Sydney, Australia.Mahalo Vive and thank you for having me!!

We chose the Vive hotel in Honolulu based on the price and the look of the rooms. Waikiki is an expensive area to stay in but this hotel seemed to be good value so we went for it. The location of The vive is superb for Waikiki beach, it is about a 3 minute walk to the beach. The friendly and helpful staff gave us an upgraded room on arrival, with cool towlels and a glass of pineapple juice which was perfect after our flights. I can't recommend this hotel anymore. It is small, but you won't get any better.

Stayed here for a few days . Superb staff , a genuine cut above most other places. Good location, and easy access to the beach. Noise free throughout the hotel as there is nothing on one side of the hotel .Good restaurants nearby with plenty of ABC stores and souvenir shops really close as are the guys renting cars or scooters

I travelled recently to Hawaii on business and on the advice of the Hawaiian Airlines sales team I booked to stay with Vive Hotel Hawaii. Thank you Hawaiian Airlines - GREAT advice.The easy taxi ride delivered us directly from the airport to level 2 at the Vive Hotel Waikiki - and we checked in and were in our rooms, in a matter of minutes.I was on level 20 and the room was exactly as I would have liked - especially for business travel as there was plenty of room to meet with colleagues AND enjoy both the great view of the beach (and most of Diamond Head) and the location. The Vive Hotel is a very easy walk from the "centre" of Hawaii and of course on the bus routes to Ala Moana etc! It is a very convenient location.Vive Hotel is one block back from the beach - and while there is no pool at present - who would want a pool when Waikiki beach is both that close and so very Hawaiian!The Vive Hotel staff were fantastic - Friendly, helpful and attentive - and nicely "chatty"...Check-in , concierge services, breakfast service and most importantly the daily servicing of the room by Vive Hotel staff was simply outstanding.Complimentary breakfast each morning, was light, delicious and presented in a manner that allows all the guests to enjoy a relaxed and delicious start to the day. I am a light eater, and found the breakfast each day set me up for most of the day. A nice touch!I do not have the best eyesight - and I would have liked the option of more light in the bathroom, but that is just me! I just left all the blinds up during the day and there was sufficient light most of the time!Importantly, I (sadly) spent quite a lot of time in my room working or meeting business colleagues and customers. the WIFI is fantastic - Fast, Free of Charge and easy to set up. This to me was a key sell point, on top of all the benefits as to great rooms, relaxed but chic surroundings in the public areas, and of course great staff and location. If in Hawaii on vacation I would still want to use the great WiFi at least some of the time - so this is an important offering!I am returning to Hawaii and the USA in the course of business and will be using both Hawaiian Airlines and Vive Hotel Waikiki as the core components of any travel to the USA that involves Hawaii.I recommend the Vive Hotel Waikiki to both leisure and business travellers - It is a great hotel, great location, enjoys wonderful staff and has it all in my view. I will be returning!

My husband & I stayed here for several days before taking our cruise. The place is spotless. Yes the room is small but it is certainly good enough. As long as the room is clean & comfortable that then is all that we needed. The breakfast is plenty: you have fruits, breads & pastries etc. It was good, fresh & enough. The beach is so close. You are provided with chairs, towels & boards etc. The main road that is full of shops & restaurants is right across the street from the beach.We also booked a tour from the concierge. All the staff were friendly and helpful.It was a lovely stay & we would gladly stay here again.

We stayed there on our way to New Zealand and on our return from New Zealand. It was close to every thing. Beach ,shopping and restaurants. The rooms are small but clean. One of the positives was the complimentary room. Each of our flights out of Honolulu were evening flights. Check out was 11AM, so we would have about 8-9 hours to wait before our flights. They have a room that you can use for an hour to rest , shower and get ready to leave for the airport. So we would get up , have breakfast, checkout, walk around have lunch come back around 3PM rest and shower and leave for the airport around 5:30 PM. The staff as very helpful. We would stay there again.

We booked through their hotel a regular room and when we got there they upgraded us to a Junior Suite. The lobby looks great. Location is perfect walking distance to the beach. It doesn't have a pool but you are in Hawaii for the beaches. Very friendly staff. Room was great.

I suspect this hotel used to be the old Continental Surf Hotel which has undergone a major overhaul and been re-branded to Vive Hotel. First the positive...the hotel is in a great central location; the refurbishment modern and trendy; and facilities great e.g. the complimentary breakfast included, free WiFi (a must these days), complimentary guest computer and concierge. We were on 17th floor so didn't experience any street noise. On the negative side...despite the refurbishment the hotel is still fundamentally an old design building with no balconies that I could see and narrow windows in the rooms which can't be opened. With no natural ventilation and the rooms themselves very small, the confined space becomes a little sweatbox in warm weather. Our room was fitted with air conditioning but it was the old-style "window rattler" and quite noisy. Having the air-conditioning running is a must because of the poor air circulation, otherwise the room gets too stuffy. The downside of this is that it is almost impossible to sleep at night because of the noise. The only other significant annoyance I had was with the bathroom vanity basin. Whilst it was trendy and modern, from a practical point it was useless. The basin took up the entire space and had no depth. There was insufficient space on the basin to rest your PC items like razors, hairdryer, deodorants etc. And it wasn't possible to get a decent fill in the basin with water. The in-built plug system would not seal properly so water would continually drain away.

All staff members were friendly. We were greeted with cold towels and juice upon check in. Rooms were really clean but on small side, but this was expected. Location is close to many restaurants, including Marukame Udon. Besides that, it was convenient eating the free breakfast there, and they had complimentary coffee all day. My husband accidentally left his watch behind, and the cleaning lady saved it for us! Nice to know people are still honest :) Will stay here again!

Wife and I were in Waikiki for a friend's wedding for 5 days. Since we been to Waikiki before, we decided to book a boutique hotel without ocean view or pool for a cheaper price. We were glad we chose Vive.Vive is located within a 7 minute walk from the center of Waikiki. To us the center of Waikiki is the area from Royal Hawaiian, Westin Moana Surfrider, to Outrigger on the Beach. We landed with 4 other people so we shared a cab to various hotels that only costed each couple less than 10 dollars including tip.The lady who checked us in was super friendly and explained everything we needed to us. The room we were given was on the 20th floor with a great view of the city. The room was tiny but it has a fridge, a closet, a chair, and a safe. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was clean with regular amenities. The hotel provides free daily continental breakfast which consist of toast, pastries, fruits, coffee and pineapple juice. A hotel with no resort fee, free breakfast, free WiFi, clean rooms, what more can you ask for really?Wife and I both enjoy walking, we always choose to walk anything under 2 miles. From the hotel, we walked to places such as Leonard's Bakery, Nakamura Ramen, Marukame Udon, Arancino, Waiola Shave Ice, Ala Moana Mall, and Rainbow Drive-in.We would def. be back to this hotel again when we come back to Waikiki.

We stayed at Vive Hotel Waikiki in our July'14 trip to Hawaii. This is a good hotel but not outstanding. Expect small rooms with old (but clean) carpets - at least in the room we stayed. It is close to attractions, though. Just 5 minutes walk and you will be in Waikiki beach. A longer walk will get you to where all the major Waikiki restaurants are. We loved the location of this hotel.We also rented a car and be advised that parking is a bit expensive at the hotel (ours was 25/day with in and out privileges). I think the overall cost-benefit was within our expectations.

We stayed for a week early June and were more than happy. Yes everyone states that the room is small and it is. Its just a matter of getting yourself organised and putting away what you don't need with your suitcases in one corner and its not a problem at all. Our room is just a base and we are always out and about during the day. Who goes to Hawaii to sit in their hotel room anyway.Breakfast was great, more than expected. Lovely fresh fruit, pastries, juice and coffee. Plenty to keep you going until lunch. Coffee and ice cold water available all day which is a great touch. And the coffee is good which is an added bonus. Location for breakfast and foyer has been decorated really well, furniture really nice. Would be good to see a bit more of a Hawaiian influence though rather than Asian to get more of a feeling of where you are.Great location just a couple of minutes walk to the beach and right on the bus line. Only issue other guests room doors can be quite loud when closing.The Godiva chocolates as a welcome gift was a really nice touch.Would definitely recommend and stay here again.

We liked this hotel. It's very attractive and the location was nice. This was our first "groupon" try and we were happy with it. It's nice that the breakfast (croissants, etc) was included but they tasted a bit stale and we ended up grabbing breakfast out instead.

We stayed here for 2 nights and everything was great. Location, staff, rooms & price was exceptional the only problem for us was air conditioning (loud) and fire alarm at 3am.Would definitely stay again.

Our first time at this hotel but will return. Standard rooms are clean,small but adequate - next time we shall upgrade to the Junior suite. The lobby provides an excellent area to relax and as well as the complimentary breakfast provides hot drinks and ice water all day. Cannot say too much regards staff as all we met and had dealings with were pleasant, efficient and extremely helpful. All in all a good experience and recommended.Only downside we could possibly find was that air conditioner struggles.

I am what you might call a very discerning traveller. In life, as in travel, I maintain a set of standards. These are by no means too high, but they are higher than most other people. At first glance, stepping into Vive Hotel you get hit with the modern decor, the high end finishes, etc. but once you get to your room, you see the unkempt appearance, the trails of ants in the corners, the bathrooms, the hallways. The glasses that are provided are dirty, and visibly only rinsed from previous usage.I immediately went down to the front desk, and informed them of such things, and the two front desk associates called up to housekeeping to have everything taken care of immediately. This was reassuring.I set out to a friends restaurant down the road (location is key here) and a couple hours I come back, and nothing has been done. Note: The glasses have been "cleaned" aka wrapped in new cellophane but the dead fly that was in there previously was still within the cup.Many other disgusting instances happened in this hotel to which I ended up having to check out, and repaying the trusty Marriott with my presence.I would not book this hotel again, it may have a shiny new facade, but it has seedy roots.

Michael, Sahara, Beverly, Cody & the concierge guy (forgot name)!!! You guys are AWESOME!! VIVE is a great boutique hotel!! The entire staff was very pleasant genuinely nice! Cute lobby & rooms. Great location & a 5 min walk to the Waikiki Beach. The continental breakfast was a hit and helped a lot to hold us over until lunch time! Close to restaurants & shopping. I would 100% stay here again and recommend this hotel to a friend.~ Small rooms but that was OK cause your in Hawaii...do you really need a big room...PERFECT to sleep-shower- & you know the rest!~ Cody let us know about the Airport transfer on our out going fight. That was great because we got long-hauled to the Hotel. Thanks Cody!! ~ AC unit was a bit ODD & a lil' noisy ...but it worked just fine to cool the room. ~ Beds are not that Comfy...we had to flip the mattress on the 2nd night Stayed 7/18 - 7/22Really HOT & HUMID.HAPPY TRAVELING.

We stayed for 9 nights in early August. The previous reviews fairly reflect this well located hotel. Staff were fantastic. Not having a bar or restaurant was not an issue as the many other beachfront hotels have excellent dining options. Bus services are easy to navigate with the standard $2.50 fare brilliant. Don't miss Pearl harbour! Get the shuttle from hotel. No need to book tour. If shopping at Ala Moana take pink line ($2.00) from Duke Statue, but come back on the number 8 bus from Nordstrom/Barnes and Noble end of shopping centre. You will avoid long queues. Stops adjacent to Vive. Chilis restaurant surprisingly good. La Caucaracha, surprisingly bad! Ala Moana food hall, noisy busy, brilliant. Breakfast ok, (I missed eggs!) but great coffee! Thanks team. ABC shops very useful. How many are there?? Moana Surfrider beachfront bar - nice. Pinot Grigio, Kona Rock Fire ale and margarita pizza!

Just got back from staying at the Vive Hotel in Waikiki. I would highly recommend this hotel. The free continental breakfast had beautiful pastries, fresh fruit, and bread as well as a toaster available to make your own toast. The fruit was delicious especially the oranges and pineapple. The staff are extremely helpful and in your room they have booklets with maps with the bus routes as well as maps with the restaurants in the area. The location of the hotel is fantastic, only two blocks from the beach and highly recommended to any Hawaii Five-0 fans, as they were filming directly in front of the hotel as well as on the beach nearby! The hotel is also beside the bus stops which take you the Ala Moana shopping centre, the Iolani Palace and Diamond Head. The only negative was that it is loud at night time and we were able to hear sirens from police regularly but it is worth it for its location. We would most definately stay here again.

This is an excellent hotel. It is in a great location just two blocks from Waikiki beach. On arrival we were given glasses of pineapple juice and facecloths to refresh ourselves. We had two rooms, both were modern. They weren't huge but they were fine, each having a double bed, lockers, widescreen tv, wardrobe and desk as well as ensuite bathrooms. The staff on reception were superb, with advice and help on where to go. In the evening, on returning, they would always ask how we got on. If you want to go to the beach, they will give you towels to bring at reception and then you just return them. Breakfast is included, it's nice, croissants, pastries, bread for toasting or just eating, fresh pineapple, melon and other fruit, juice, tea and coffee etc. The hotel is a boutique hotel, the reception is modern as are the rooms. There was a concierge who booked trips if you wanted to take an organised trip. The bus stop is just a few yards away on both sides of the road. The hotel have a map with the numbers of buses and where they go to. We hired a car and parking in the hotel is valet only, at 25 dollars per day. However, we found this quite convenient. There may be on street parking but we didn't bother looking for it. We found this hotel great value for money, excellent customer service, very friendly and in a great location. All the restaurants, shops and beach of Waikiki are literally a few minutes walk which is great. We loved this hotel. I would highly recommend it to anyone going to Waikiki. My husband booked it online but I think the rate compared very well to other hotels in the area. By the way buses charge a flat fee of 2.50 dollars for adults which is very good. Have exact coins or notes with you if using the bus. Oh, rooms also had fridges and we had free wifi also. There is nothing about this hotel that I can fault. It is one of the nicest I have ever stayed in. On our last day, our flight out of Honolulu was late evening. We were able to leave our luggage and our car at the hotel until we had to go to the airport. They told us if we wanted to return during the day and have a shower there would be no problem.

We found this hotel on Expedia and booked it because of the great deal! For 12 nights/13 days, non-stop round trip flights from JFK, and hotel/airport transfer, we paid less than $4,000!!! We couldn't pass up that deal! The hotel was perfect for us. It doesn't have a pool or restaurant, but does offer free breakfast daily which consists of fruit and pastries. The cinnamon rolls were quite good. They also have coffee and water available 24/7, as well as a microwave and toaster. I had some leftovers one night and they gave me a plate and utensils to heat it up. The staff was very accommodating. A lot of people questioned us about the lack of a pool and restaurant when we told them about the hotel. With a short (2 min tops) walk to Waikiki Beach and so many restaurants nearby, you're not missing anything. The only thing I wasn't completely thrilled with was the lack of space to unpack. I like to put all my stuff in drawers and take everything out of my suitcase, and I had to move some stuff around to do that. They have a closet, 2 night stands that have shelves, and some shelving in the closet. My boyfriend and I were both able to completely unpack with no problem, but just know that your clothes will be out in the open. This hotel is the perfect location. You're 2 min from the beach, all the restaurants, and central Waikiki, and there's a bus stop right outside, as well as an Enterprise place down the block, if you want to explore other parts of the island. Would definitely stay here again!

Great location because I wasn't driving so ideal being close to everything. Does come with some noticable evening noise but then if I wanted to pay more I could get peace in an expensive seafront hotel. I had a budget, this hotel was brilliant.The staff like the people of Hawaii were really friendly and accommodating. Like the Aloha, "Welcome what's yours is mine, please share"I personally loved the breakfast lots of lovely juicy melons just what you need when combating dehydration from long flights and lots of sun. Lots of nice pasties on offer, but I loved the blueberry bread, yum.Brigette the lady who sorts your trips was excellent, so, so helpful. Thank you PS I got to the hotel so easily by shuttle bus located at Honolulu airport and they sorted the return journey too. Easy does it.
user_name:
Veronica R
Port Talbot, United Kingdom

review_body: We stayed here between July 16-19, 2014. From the time we checked in to when we checked out, the customer service was excellent. We arrived in the later part of the evening and were greeted graciously with scented towels and a welcome drink. Our room was small but lovely, had all the necessities we required. Wifi in the hotel was great. The continental breakfast was plenty and gave us a great start to the day. The location of the location is perfect. It is only a two block walk to the beach and the main strip where all the shops are located. There are many restaurants around the hotel, (Korean, pizza, japanese) and there is a bus stop beside the hotel that can take you many places around the city. We really enjoyed our stay and highly recommend this affordable, centrally located, cool boutique hotel, enjoy!

nice hotel for our 2 night stay before heading to Kaua'i. Very friendly and helpful staff, wonderful breakfast with fruits, danish, toast, juice,... Room very small but cozy - side view of the ocean - had all we needed. Great location, just Would definitely stay there again!

Stayed here last week and I don't think you can beat the Vive in Waikiki. It is centrally located and the beach from this literally right out the front door and down the street. You are there in way less than 5 minutes unless you are real slow. I rented a bike for the week so I went to many of the attractions via bike. Diamond head is about a 20 minute bike ride from here. The morning continental breakfast was good and a quick way to get the morning started with fresh pine apple juice and a variety of pastry as well as fresh fruit (water melon, cantaloupe, honeydew, and pine apple). When you first arrive they give you fresh juice and a cold towel which is nice to revive from a full day of travel. The service at this hotel is second to none in my opinion. I have heard some say the rooms are too small. I say they are just right cause I was only there to sleep and eat breakfast and that was it. I did not hear any of the noise that I noticed other reviews had mentioned. There were a couple of days where Hawaii-50 was supposed to have been filming on the street directly in front of the hotel but I did not get a chance to check it out. So every now and again I would hear sounds like guns being fired which I assume was part of their filming during the day but this is not the hotel's fault and was kind of cool. The rooms at the Vive are clean and well maintained and did not have any maintenance issues during my stay. Also the staff was very nice and friendly.The concierge was very helpful in setting up transportation and tours especially to Pearl Harbor. They recommend just taking a tour bus then you can pick your own specific tour when on-site. This is a great way to do this. That way you don't end up with tours and you don't want feel obligated to take since you paid for a “package”. The tour choices on-site were: USS Arizona Memorial (free) and Mighty Mo (25 bucks) and US Bowfin (25 bucks). Took both the Arizona and Mighty Mo tour and they were fascination and each took about 2 hours to complete. The Done Tours that the concierge also recommended is a great way to see the entire island in a day including Hanauma Bay which was spectacular BTW. You can get to the Iolani Palace (the hotel concierge recommended this too) on bike in about 25 minutes. It is a nice tour of inside of the palace and the famous statue of King Kamehameha as seen on TV is right across the street (see photos) I was apprehensive about booking at the Vive since I had never been to Waikiki before but it turned out out to be a great decision and I will definitely be back soon. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to a friend to family member.

This is a very nice boutique hotel. Good location. Staff is friendly and helpful. Breakfast could use some improvement, but still good. Rooms are comfortable, and clean. We arrived fairly early in the morning, and the lady at the front desk did her utmost to have a room for us as quickly as possible. Would definitively recommend.

The front desk staff were very nice and helpful. They give you pineapple juice and scented towels when you check in. You can also borrow beach towels and other beach accessories. We stayed here twice and the first time the room and the bath rooms were very simple but spacious. The second time we stayed here the room was tiny and the we noticed the walls were so thin we can hear the conversations in our next room very clearly. The shower room was also very small. They do have free continental breakfast and free internet.

Fantastic service, location, and breakfast. Provided little extra's like complimentary bottled water and robes in room, juice and hot towels on arrival, towels and mats for the beach. We were lucky to be upgraded to penthouse room with the most awesome electric toilet (don't laugh until you have tried one!). Fantastic views of city and sea. Only criticism was that the air con was fairly old and extremely noisy, making my ear plugs invaluable. A small inconvenience amongst all the awesome benefits. The check in staff (Beverley I think) was extremely friendly with a genuine smile. Other hotels should take lessons from this one!
