This was a nice end of vacation hotel after the cruise. Well located, a few minutes walk from the beach with towels and other stuff provided by the hotel. Staff was extremely driven to meet you needs. Rooms are nice but smallish, window mounted AC was a bit noisy. Free wifi worked well. Also, we had stinky pillows in the room. Probably from the high humidity. They had a nice setup for the continental breakfast: fresh and plentiful. Coffee, tea, decaf and water was available 24 hours in the lobby.Overall a good stay.

I have had many stays in Waikiki and this expereince was a treat! The hotel is a charm with quick access to everything Waikiki has to offer. Just a very short walk directly to the beach where the Duke statue is and shoppng in every direction. The Vive was refreshing; from the fahionably attired staff, the modern yet chic lobby and the small details through out the hotel. The room we had was on the Penthouse level and the room was gorgeous, clean and quiet with great views of the ocean and the city. Our 7 day stay was highlighted by the courteous and friendly staff and we certainly enjoyed the daily breakfast in the great room, with fresh local fruit and yummy baked goods. What impressed us more than anything is that you can feel a genuine spirit of hospitality that obviously comes from top management. It was a great home base for the week and the complimentary towels and beach chairs made our excursions so easy. Thank you to the entire team at the VIve for sharing our special visit to Hawaii. We highly recommend this hotel and hope to retun soon.

Awesome staff and supercute waiting/lounge area!! Very modern and cozy, with some of the best artwork and accesories that I've seen in a hotel/resort. Guests feel welcomed with a cool glass of pineapple juice and handtowel to cool off with while checking in. The valet/bag custodian is a very nice guy that deserves BIG tips for all of his hard work and multitasking. Only downsides are No pool, and I would barely describe the rooms as "oceanview," (more like cityview, and I think this would go over better so that guests dont expect more) but other than that, its a perfect location for a weekend getaway. Very close to everything Waikiki, yet very quiet at night when necessary. Two thumbs up!!

We came to this hotel cause we thought from reviews looked good. BUT it was off when we went to the room the walk way to our room was still not finished their was a blue foam on floor and the doors looked like they were being still fixed. Also when we went in the room we felt like we were in a cruise it was so tight and cramped. Their was also no pool or regular parking only valet but it just felt like a apartment building trying to be a hotel but one thing good is they had free internet they also had free breakfast but it was only bread and fruit but it was fine. The down stairs was nice. Also one other thing was their is no service elevator because everyone that is fixing hotel came on elevator and felt like a apartment building. We might not stay here again. Just letting people know if it will help. But great location two blocks from beach.

My wife got us a room for two nights by using an auction site. I read reviews, both good and bad, so I wasn't sure what to think. The staff is very friendly. We arrived at about 10 pm and the two who greeted us acted like we were long lost relatives. We were given a glass of pineapple juice to drink while checking in. Our room was upgraded for free to an ocean view room. Yes, it faced Kuhio Avenue, but I didn't mind that. The street I live on is much louder. With only a short walk to the beach, there are no complaints about location. It is pretty close to many restaurants, fast food and shops. There is also plenty of night life around, if that is your thing. The complimentary breakfast was pastries and juice. If you are on a protein diet, you might want something else, but I found it satisfactory. The breakfast is served in a large room with tables, chairs and couches. This makes a nice place to sit and check email or update Facebook. Speaking of the Internet, their WiFi was fast and free. The room was small, surprisingly so. There was a mini fridge, TV, safe and bed. The queen sized bed was comfortable and the pillows were just right. Don't drink the bottled water, though, unless you want to pay for it. We didn't rent a car, but there is on-site parking available. Our only complaint was the lack of a pool. This is not a deal breaker, though, since we were so close to the ocean. We just enjoy being able to lounge once in a while. I would definitely be happy staying there again. That is the best recommendation I can give.

I've stay at the Vive hotel 4 times already and I always leave a happy customer. The staff is A+++++, They are always so professional and friendly. you can tell that the staffs help/customer service is genuine and not fake. The vallet attendants are AWESOME, they go above and beyond and provide top notch customer service. The rooms I've stayed in are really modern and comfortable, I like the concept and the designs of the rooms. I recently stayed in the penthouse and it was Gorgeous. I will definitely be staying at The Vive in the future. If your on vacation or just a staycation I would HIGHLY recommend staying at The Vive

The best thing about this hotel is it's location - one block back from the beach, practically running straight into the Duke statue. Unfortunately that's where the good points basically end for me. This hotel is more corporate then holiday. My room was "cosy", thankfully I was a solo traveller, if I'd been a couple it would have been almost uncomfortable, the bathroom was tiny! One of my main reason's for booking this hotel, besides location was that they offered a continental breakfast. It certainly was to the continental breakfast you might be use to, it was fruit and toast and that was it. At certain times of the day the internet connection was very slow. Also, during my stay, there were a few nights of heavy rain and gusty winds, this made for very noisy nights. Finishing on a positive, the staff were very friendly.

If you're looking for a conveniently located, fairly priced hotel with complimentary breakfast then Vive Waikiki is for you. It's literally a couple of steps away from a bus stop, less than two blocks away from the beach and a short walking distance to several cool stores and restaurants. I'd say it's even possible to walk to the famous Ala Moana Mall even though I didn't try. Housekeeping was great, the bed was comfortable and air conditioning worked fine. I should also add that this was one of the quietest hotels I've ever stayed at!I was very happy to see they had a mini "business centre" in the artfully decorated lobby as I don't travel with a laptop (there was free wifi in the hotel as well). My only very small complaint was that the breakfast wasn't too filling (no protein or cereal offered) but if you only require some toast, coffee and fresh fruit, you'll be set. It is also worth mentioning that the staff were very friendly and accomodating--the glass of pineapple juice I received upon arrival was a nice touch.

The vive Waikikigorgeous, clean, modern Rooms very clean and roomy!Amazing staff, very friendly and made sure you were okay and asked how your day was which was a nice feeling. Even if staff were off shift and saw you on the streets they would say hello and enjoy your night !!Definitely recommend this hotel

We were in Waikiki for our honeymoon, and this hotel was perfect for us. When you arrive you are greeted with a cold towel and a glass of pineapple juice. Yum! The room and bathroom were very clean. The AC is a little loud at times. As other people have stated, the rooms are small. This came as no surprise since they say that on their website. That being said, who wants to stay in their room when they are two blocks from the beautiful beach! There's also shopping and many restaurants within walking distance. Their breakfast choices are great. There is a good variety of fresh fruit and pastries, along with coffee and pineapple juice. They only have valet parking @ $25 per day which to us seemed pretty expensive, but we found that is what other hotels in the area charge so what are you going to do. I must say that every day we went out, our car was ready and waiting for us as soon as we came out. All the staff, including the valet guys were super nice and very helpful. Would definitely stay here again.

We all know the amount of competition Waikiki has in hotels. If you're more interested in enjoying what Oahu has to offer rather than staying in your hotel room, and for great savings, try booking a package flight and hotel deal at Vive. Its in the heart of Waikiki, offers daily free continental breakfast of pastries and nice fruits, and while it does not have balconies or a pool, they offer free beach equipment including towrls, chairs and boogie boards. I think the staff understands the common amenities it may lack, so they really go out of their way to provide excellent service and get you anything you need to better your stay. Wife and I stayed for two weeks and loved it. It was simple enough and cost efficient so we could really have a great time doing outside activities and restaurants.

I found Vive Waikiki on TripAdvisor and booked based on the multiple positive reviews. We were able to book with a Military Rate and got an even better deal for booking over the phone (FYI) My husband and I had a great 7 day stay at Vive Hotel Waikiki. For the first 6 nights (our original booking) we stayed in a Cosmopolitan Room. We expected a small room based on the description from the Vive website and from reviews on trip advisor. Therefore were not disappointed when the room was in fact small!(It was actually quite comparable to the size of rooms at European hotels I have stayed at). It was important that our vacation to Waikiki was affordable and the cosmopolitan rooms at Vive allowed us to visit Waikiki without incurring a huge expense for excess space that we didn't need! We are not the type to stay in our hotel room while visiting such a beautiful island - but if you like to relax and lounge in your room, you may want to book the Junior Oceanview Suite. We stayed in one of these suites on the 7th floor for our last night at Vive and it was much more spacious than the Cosmopolitan Room. The shower in the suite was also fantastic! The WIFI and the Air Conditioning worked wonderfully. As other guests have stated, the Air Conditioner is loud - but it cooled the room down significantly once you change it from the ECO setting. Valet service worked wonderfully and our room was always clean. I was shocked to read another TripAdvisors comments stating that Christopher "lacked people skills". I had the complete opposite experience at Vive and found Christopher to be the most outgoing and friendly staff member during my stay. He recommended various restaurants, explained bus routes and greeted my husband and I with a smile and a friendly greeting each time we entered or left the hotel. His hospitality made us feel very welcome at Vive. Thank-You Christopher! Things I would tell my friends: 1) Breakfast is very light - think European Continental - fruit, bread, croissants, juice, coffee 2) Bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper - the bus that stops in front of the hotel is very loud3) If staying in a cosmopolitan room, ask housekeeping for extra hangers. We found it very hard to organize our clothes, dry our bath towels/swimsuits etc. without them as the room does not have many places to hang clothing4) Eat at Hy's next door (Wonderful steakhouse) 5) Stay at Vive!

For all the groovy and cool features of the Vive Hotel one thing let it down for us. The rather antiquated aircondtioners. This is an older building that obviously has a/c retrofitted. Each room has its own unit that clatters away continuously. Ear plugs might help here. We did like the location though, two minutes to the beach and shops. And we couldn't fault the friendly staff especially George, the concierge who knows how to put tours and activities together.

Rooms are small, bathtub trim was peeling and would catch water, air conditioner would turn on for 14 seconds then off for 5. We were on the 15th floor and could hear everything as if the window were open. Most staff were nice except Christopher, his people skills are severely lacking. Won't return.

This is a lovely hotel, especially the spacious junior suites. The lobby is incredibly large and always has coffee and tea available. There are lots of little perks included such as continental breakfast with fresh tropical fruit, and beach stuff (air mattresses, mats and boogie boards) that you can borrow from the front desk. The staff is very accommodating and friendly. The location is just 2 blocks from the beach and there are plenty of inexpensive places to eat nearby.

We recently had a team meetup in the Vive hotel for the week - partly business and partly pleasure. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful - the nicest I've come across in any hotel. The communal area was great, and we spent a lot of time hanging out, drinking, and eating when we weren't working. The only thing that I would have liked to see is some outdoor seating. Hopefully we'll get to come back again!

My daughter and I stayed at Vive Hotel Waikiki for 3 nights. It was a good experience. The rooms were clean and updated. The furnishings and decor were pleasant and modern. The lobby and "living room" were chic, well-appointed and welcoming. The service and amenities were great. Everyone was very nice and helpful. The hotel provides beach towels and all kinds of beach equipment that we checked out at the front desk. There is also a convenience room that we were able to reserve for clean up after a trip to the beach between check out and the time we needed to head to the airport. The continental breakfast was good, but lacked protein. The valet parking was easy. Our car was always ready by the time we got to the parking floor. The surrounding area is classic Waikiki - high rise hotels, shopping (from upscale to flea market) & restaurants. Coconut Cafe is directly across the street and has excellent shave ice. The front desk clerk recommended several restaurants within walking distance. Our favorite by far was Marukane Udon Tempura Musubi - worth the wait. It was an easy walk, also, to Waikiki Beach. This hotel is a very good value in a great location. We would definitely return.

I must admit I was going in almost blind... it's hard to chose a Hotel in a city you know nothing about, and choose a hotel from a "non-chain" big name.I admit it, I went for Price and boy was I not deceived! Vive hotel is litterally 2 minutes walk from the beach, 2 minutes walk from all the restos and bars... it's central to everything and all the Buses (or almost) stop right in front.The hotel is pretty modern, has a posh look and the staff is amazing. I read in the comments below that the staff made this hotel what it is, and he's right, they are friendly & helpful x 10000. They made sure we felt welcome; the Concierges were also great (Thanks Akemi for all the help), make sure to deal with them if you need to rent a car, DO NOT GO TO THE STANDS IN FRONT OF THE HOTEL, beleive me! they got me a car, last minute on July 4th in the morning for 55$ for the day... the guys in front wanted 45$ for a moped for 4 hours! Rooms are ok, quite small for my liking, but who needs a room when you have paradise outside? The continental breakfast was great; fresh fruits, croissants, cinnamon buns, rolls and coffee every morning!What was also great is that they lend you beach equipment if you need any: towels, buggy boards, chairs (ok the chairs are totally uncomfortable, but hey not everything could be perfect right? )All in all, I would go back anytime, but would probably opt for a bigger room.

We stayed here for 5 nights for my cousins wedding. This is a decent location 2 blocks away from everything. Continental breakfast of pastries and fruit, coffee, tea etc was very nicely served in the lobby. Room sizes are very small, we stayed in the standard king room with a view of the street. Thank God the AC worked. Only real complaint I had is that they are under construction and lots of banging on the walls and slamming of doors. Considering the other properties I've seen in Honolulu away from the beach this is definitely one of the nicer ones for a decent price.

Greeted with moist towelette. Staff was friendly and knowledgable on local activities and upcoming events. First impression was it looked new and we were happy we booked it. So nice to bathe and slip into their comfortable robes and lay on their clean beds. Parking is valet only and they charge $25.00 per night.

Just two short blocks from the beach, the location is very central, but tucked away on a quieter street. It has a modern design so steers away from more Hawaiian tourist style some of the resorts have, which is a plus for me. Very clean, comfortable room, and the staff were awesome - friendly and helpful. Highly recommended.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights from 26th June 2014. Good location with just a short walk to the beach and the main center. Staff were very nice and accommodating from the reception desk to concierge. Hotel room itself was clean and comfortable. The only complaint I have is that it was fairly noisy as they have the older style air conditioners sticking out from the window which allowed noise to seep in easily. Would stay here again if I came to Waikiki.

I love this hotel. It is located perfectly only to blocks to go to the beach and the main shopping street. Staff is super friendly and helpful!!! Free Wifi, free delicious breakfast with lots of fruits. The design if the lobby is gorgeous and very vintage chic. Room is small but totally ok. It's clean and has a comfortable bed. Please exchange the lighting in the bathroom - I think the light was awful but that's it! I can totally and highly recommend this hotel. Staff and location top notch!

Well, I have two more days left in Hawaii, but I decided to write the review this morning. My wife and I rented the suite. The suite is nice and roomy. The shower is huge. Some people will say who cares where you sleep, your not going to spend much time in your room. Well, when I rent a room, I want it to be as comfortable as my house, if not more. I'm a Marriot man by choice, but for the cost of a non-suite at the Marriot, I got a suite at the Vive at my wife's request/demand..lolCons: fridge - keeps my beer lukewarm warm. I advised guest services. I don't know if they came, but my beer is still like warmIce machine: There is no ice machine. You have to call guest services and they will bring up the ice..WHAT?? With 20 floors to this building, they can have at least three ice machines. One on the fifth, tenth, and fifteenth floor. parking - 25.00 a day. I was told this was the norm. Well my question is..do you have to follow the crowd? How about 25.00 for the week. That way, i'll feel more obliged to tip the valet person.Pros: location is about 70 yards from the noisy beach. The employees are great!! The complimentary breakfast is fruit and Danish. Fellas, if someone offers you 3 Vive Hotel pineapples for your wife fiancé, girlfriend , take it. These pineapples are to die for. With 3 pineapples you can save two and trade one for a new woman... lol.The hotel is clean and comfortable. This is not a five star hotel. There is no bar, no pool, and no fridge for that matter.Now how would rate this hotel..... cleanliness... excellent, location..excellent sleep quality... excellent value and service also excellent. Would I stay here again..only if my wife is up as I am making the reservations. I'm spoiled by the amenities of the Marriott. Don't get me wrong, this hotel is good, but lacks the umph of a Marriott, Hilton. The EMPLOYEES make this hotelHere is a great analogy. This hotel is a Days Inn on steroids. Wait a minute.Wrong analogy. The Days Inn have an ice machine, a pool, and a working fridge. Idk....Ok, I've been here almost a week, and I haven't regretted it. I'm comfortable and happy. Corner room decent view. I will post a pic or two.
user_name:
watch-seeker
New York City, New York

review_body: A comfortable, relaxing and clean establishment in a quiet location with very helpful and friendly staff... Surrounded by some great little cafés, bars and restaurants and only a short stroll to Waikiki Beach. I am a solo traveller and will most definitely stay here again
user_name:
L9544LXjuliek
Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

review_body: This is a pleasant, comfortable and cost-effective establishment less than 5 mins from the beach (near the Duke statue). From certain other reviews, it seems like some people have the wrong expectations before showing up... so to be clear, this is NOT a 5-star luxury resort. If you want the real high-end stuff, right on the beach, in Waikiki you're gonna have to fork over the big bucks. For those who don't need the most expensive place but still want to be decently comfortable, this is a very good choice. Besides being close to the beach, it is also pretty close to convenience stores, cafes/Starbucks, car rental (at the Hyatt building) and yummy restaurants. There is some great pizza at Lovin' Oven inside the Aqua Bamboo hotel across the street. The friendly front desk handled check-in smoothly, and can provide towels and basic beach gear for free. There is a handy desktop PC on the ground floor. I had a queen bedroom, which had an adequate amount of space for 1 person, and had a decent view out towards the beach. Room cleanliness and housekeeping seemed fine. The bathroom sink area is a bit small, and I didn't like that the storage shelf is pretty high, but the bathtub is fine. Plus, there are some good bathroom products (The Archive). Free Wifi worked well, as did the AC. The small fridge came with 2 free small bottles of water. The TV was decent size and had a surprisingly decent number of channels. The staff responded quickly when I asked for an iron and board. No problems with noise from other guests. I had no issues with checking out. I had a rental car for 1 night, and there is valet parking onsite, which was quite satisfactory and friendly. The price seems like the norm for this area. The included breakfast is pretty basic and just OK, more continental style with some breads and fruit. But the sitting area is pretty comfortable and spacious. There was some construction going on inside, which occasionally had some noise in the daytime, but really wasn't too bad. This was definitely a great stay and I'd seriously consider returning the next time I visit lovely Oahu.

Comfort, location, service,and value! Couldn't ask for a better stay! My room was spacious, clean, renovated, and more than I expected! I lived in Waikiki for 7 years and this hotel surpassed my expectations on all levels. The stay was helpful and courteous. I WILL be staying here again.

We only stayed 1 night, but we were impressed, my wife and I were greeted with a cold towel and pineapple juice, on check in, the room was nice, clean, and comfortable, The lobby was very impressive, seemed like a place to hang out, they did offer us beach equipment, not sure exactly how far the beach is, but they have everything you need. Parking was 25 dollars a day, I've paid more at other places, but the parking attendant "Ty", who also brought our bags to the room, what a nice, courteous, and helpful employee...he really made an impression... we were having problems with the key, when he arrived with our bags, he got the key to work, but went downstairs got us 2 new keys to be sure, and brought us a bag of ice for the room. Then when we went out for dinner that night, he got us our car, asked where we were going and if we needed directions, and when we got back, asked how dinner was and just very friendly... and on check out, the girl at the front desk, again very friendly, had our car waiting for us..only stayed one night, very impressive, friendly staff, and the entire place is run very efficiently...

My wife and I stayed here for a week in early June 2014. We've been to Waikiki quite a few times in the past and have always stayed at hotels that are closer to the ocean and have more of a resort feel. I knew that Vive Hotel was not a resort, but was I wasn't expecting it to feel so un-Hawaiian. The hotel was clean and modern, but it could have been located anywhere in the country...there was no Hawaiian feel or decor anywhere to be found. There's nothing in the place that says "You're in Hawaii!" I'm sure that works for some people, but my wife and I found this to be a big downer. Our room seemed smaller than any other hotel we've stayed at before. That didn't bother us too much though. The bed was very comfortable and everything seemed to be super clean. We did find ourselves longing for a balony/lanai so we could walk outside and enjoy the breeze and fresh air. We also found the sink area in the bathroom to be awkwardly small. I bumped my head on the shelf several times due to the tight layout.The best part of our experience at Vive Hotel was the great service we received. The people there are very friendly and accommodating and always seem to have smiles on their faces. The worst part was that our room was located in an area of the hotel that was under construction. The carpet in our hallway was covered with plastic for the entire week we were there, making it seem like we were staying in a construction zone. Also, there were sounds of drilling and sawing coming from the rooms across the hall from us on a few days we were wanting to sleep in a little. So, in summary, the place was just not for us. It would have gotten a 4 out of 5 if it weren't for the construction zone feel of the room we stayed in. If you're looking for a clean hotel that has a modern feel and is centrally located, then this place is worth a try. If you prefer a more Hawaiian-feeling hotel for your Hawaiian vacation or if you prefer a normal-sized room or lanai, then this place is not for you.

I stayed 4 nights here and truly enjoyed it. I came in with high expectations but this hotel was everything I thought it would be. Great location in the heart of Waikiki but tucked away from the hustle of Kalakaua Ave. Walking distance to the beach, shopping, and restaurants. Good location to head off on adventures as you don't get stuck in traffic like other hotels, but bus stops are near by too if your not renting a car. I have stayed at a few boutique hotels in Waikiki and this one I feel has the best value for all the amenities included. As other travelers mentioned, the rooms are on the smaller side, but who wants to stay inside while vacationing in Hawaii anyways. The room was tastefully decorated, clean, modern, well appointed, and included everything you would need. I didn't interact much with the staff but when I did they were always very friendly. I will definitely recommend this hotel and will be sure to stay here again on my next getaway!

This hotel is wonderful!. The rooms were very clean, comfortable beds and most respectful and courteous staff. Continental breakfast was okay. Beach is two blocks away, shops two blocks over. Our first trip to Hawaii was nice but the hotel was terrible it was called the Castle back then, the name has changed since then.The Vive is a wonderful hotel and we stay here agai.

The Vive is a solid choice for those who don't need many amenities but want a great location. you are just 2 mins (walking) to the beach. Rooms come with free wifi, the lobby is NEVER crowded and has a very lounge-y feel. Overall, I enjoyed my stay there. Pros:The hotel made check in very easy. They have Valet (I think it's roughly $18/day). They serve a light breakfast of pastries. Also, they have tons of stuff to borrow for the beach including Boogie Boards and Towels. Boogie Boards are fantastic!Cons:Rooms are on the smaller side. But who stays in their room when their on vacay? The breakfast is light and consists mainly of pastries so if you want something substantial you should probably just snack there. We had a room on the 15th floor. With the window open, you could hear people early in the AM but you'd simply need to close the window to keep the quiet.I'd suggest staying here although one thing to keep in mind is that we stayed on a Groupon which really made it worth while.

I absolutely loved staying at this hotel. Comfortable and tastefully decorated rooms, very clean and well maintained. When I arrived, they upgraded me to a suite because of my disability. Very friendly front desk staff (including Samantha and Tai), Concierge and Housekeeping who were so kind and helpful. Great location, literally a few minutes from the beach, buses, local shops and restaurants. I would definitely stay here again and will absolutely recommend Vive Hotel Waikiki to family and friends. Thanks to all the staff.

We stayed at the VIVE for two nights prior to departing for our Hawaii cruise. I came across this hotel via hotwire.com and got an amazing rate for our room. We were very impressed with the hotel and it's location. As mentioned in other reviews; the rooms are a bit "cozy" or small, but they were well appointed, clean, and suited our needs just fine. We had a view of Waikiki Beach from our room and it was just a convenient 2 block walk to the beach, and very close to restaurants and shopping. I was also pleasantly surprised with how quiet the room was. I did not hear noise from other rooms or from the busy street below us. The customer service of the hotel was excellent. The staff were always willing to give recommendations, directions, etc. They even had beach equipment to sign out and use free of charge. They also stored our bags for us on check out day until we were ready to leave Waikiki and board our cruise. The city bus stops right next to the hotel; which was great because we did not have a rental car for our time. We took the bus to Hanauma Bay to go snorkeling and Diamond Head to hike the crater.

I just came back from Hawaii and i would highly recommend this hotel.Location was good,room was clean and the best part was that front desk staff were very nice people.Especially,Ricoh and Robb were very helpful.(Thank you!!)For some people,you might feel that rooms are little bit small,but i didn't mind at all.I would definitely stay there when i visit Oafu again.

This place was great!!! We enjoyed our stay here, it was close to the beach and central Waikiki. It was very clean, the staff was friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was good, free WiFi and provided us with beach towels, chairs, mats, etc... We would definitely return here!!! Thank-you!!!

I recently had a 8 nights stay here (May 28 – June 5) and loved it. Excellent location, within easy walking distance of the Beach and to the rest of Waikiki.Also the bus stops next to the hotel & is a cheap way to travel around if you don't have a rental carI had a room on the 16th floor, which was clean, modern, and had everything that I could have wanted, including free Wi Fi. I didn't have a view of the beach, but it’s my choice how to spend money.Endless breakfast (large variety of good fresh fruits !) is included and it’s not a trifleIf you are looking for a nice hotel then I would suggest this hotel. Friendly staff, very good location, excellent value for money.

Everything about this place was great. Close proximity to the beach and central Waikiki, very clean and modern, friendly and helpful staff, continental breakfast and free wifi included (why can't all hotels provide free wifi in this day and age?), and free use of beach towels and chairs. The room was fairly compact but it still worked really well. There was more than enough room for the two of us to spread out. The Vive is great value for money and we intend to return when we're next in Hawaii.

My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon in May 2014. The service was OUTSTANDING! The hotel and room were beautiful. The hotel has a great staff, great location for beach and shopping, and the concierge can hook you up with for almost anything. People on the street will try to sell you trips and rentals, but go to the concierge they have the best deals. Jackie and George were awesome, and so was everyone else at the Vive. I would stay there again.

My wife and I have just spent 4 days at Vive Hotel - before and after our Pride of America Cruise.Previous reviews on this hotel are correct - this is a great place to stay. We were treated to an ocean view room on both occasions and a complimentary early check in after the cruise. The breakfast was great and the rooms were large enough for two. I would definitely recommend this hotel which is ideally located just two blocks from Waikiki beach

Hello,I wanted to thank the staff at the Vive Hotel, I had a great time last week on my holiday. I would highly recomend the Vive Hotel to my family and friends. My room was very comfortable.Thank you,Katharine

Stayed in vive for 3 days in April, We got a fair price from Living Social since this hotel was under renovation/maintenance. Valet parking service was very efficient (cost $25/day). Beach towels/chairs/boggy board can be borrowed from the reception. Location is excellent with short walking distance to the beach, restaurants & shopping malls. The only downside is you will have to deal with heavy traffic around Waikiki area. Continental breakfast was included, with small selection of pastries but excellent kona coffee! In general all the staffs were very courteous & helpful. Our only complain, as others mentioned, is the size of the room which is only good for a couple. Street noise was a problem since morning, however, it's okay during night time.

Booked a twin room because I was in need of two bed configuration, however due to maintenance work in these particular room configurations, the hotel made alternative arrangements of reserving two separate rooms next door to one another to still provide two beds. This was absolutely fantastic service by the hotel. The two rooms were very basic and clearly renovated within an older feeling building, but modern furnishings with all the basic complimentary toiletry needs. The view from the room we had were facing other apartments, but it did not feel too obtrusive and certainly not close enough to block out natural sunlight shining into the room windows, so that was good. Light breakfast consisting of a variety of pastries, fresh fruits and juices including tea/coffee was just right for a quick breakfast.Location is very convenient and walking distance around the area, only two blocks to waikiki beach, one block from the strip of shops and on the same street where major buses run either to Ala Moana shopping mall or towards Diamond Head or beyond. I would consider staying here again.

Stayed here for 5 nights, booked 2 rooms, 1 double and 1 with 2 single beds for our adult children. Could not supply room with 2 single beds so we were upgraded to junior suite for us and 2 standard rooms 1 each for our siblings. We could not be happier with this arrangement. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Beach is 5 min walk away and hotel will supply beach towels, boogie boards and beach chairs if requested. Also will supply umbrellas, although they ran out of them one day. Would recommend to anyone although the standard rooms are quite small in size.

My partner and I stayed here for three nights after I'd read a lot of reviews on TripAdvisor. The hotel itself looks fairly new and is clean and tidy and has tasteful modern décor. The cost was approximately $500 (NZD) for three nights for a standard room on the 20th floor with ocean glimpses. The hotel is situated about two blocks back from the beach and there are a couple of high rises in front of it. The Best thing: - The staff. They were at all times polite, friendly and helpful. The Worst thing: - Street noise was clearly audible and made it a little difficult to sleep (my partner and I are both quite light sleepers). Not really the hotels fault as it's so close to the hustle and bustle of Waikiki and on a main road but if that's a huge issue for you you might want to pay to stay somewhere a bit quieter. General points of note:The rooms are small. We had a king(?)size bed, bedside tables, a long desk with a tv, writing space, minibar, two chairs and a wardrobe with basically just the space you need to move comfortably around. The bathroom was bath/shower, toilet and vanity with standing room only for one person haha. As long as you don't plan on spending your entire holiday in Hawaii in your hotel room and your not trying to fit a family of 5 in there I don't see any problem with the size of the room. There is a safe in the rooms. Valet parking is $25 per day. We didn't have a car so this wasn't an issue for us. Breakfast was just the basics - tea, coffee, cereal, toast, melons/pineapple, mini croissants. Overall I would definitely recommend the Vive Hotel to anyone who wants to be close to Waikiki beach for something in this price range. I've paid more to stay at far worse places. I would definitely stay again.
user_name:
Rochelle K
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: I do think this place is quite pricey for what you pay. The good points to note are its location, cleanliness and, most of all, its service. Whilst not being a beach location, it is only a few blocks away from the beach, plenty of ABC stores and food options near it. The place is clean and obviously very new. The lobby and lounge is modern and fresh. Common areas on the floors are a bit sparse, but still clean. Rooms are modern and clean as well, with basic needs catered for in the room. The staff here are super helpful, friendly and efficient. The best feature of this place and really wish I could give a higher rating. Another thing this place does provide is complimentary breakfast, including juices and a continental breakfast buffet with a small selection.On the down side, I do think the prices at this place are quite steep, given the tiny size of the rooms. They have been smart in the layout to maximise space, but at the end of the day, when your friends come around to visit, then you will feel the cramp cosy size of the room. Given the place is designed to be more of a place to crash and dump and store your luggage, then this should be ok, but the pricing should reflect that too. The facilities are very bare bones here, but at least wifi is free and in all areas of the hotel and in the rooms. The housekeeping was a little slow as well here. I had stepped out for the day and came back to my room at 2:30pm to find everything was still as I had left it that morning. I was able to go down and request the room to be cleaned, as I had wanted to quickly rest before heading out again, and my room was ready to go by 3pm. A little disappointing that it took a request to have my room cleaned by mid afternoon. Finally, the walls are quite thin. I could hear the mumblings of a phone conversation next door and every bit of shuffling with drawers and footsteps. Not good for light sleepers.All in all, front desk staff are superb, a bit pricey for the room and basic facilities provided, but still enjoyed my time in Waikiki.

My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights after a cruise and before departing for home in Vancouver, BC.As previous reviews indicate this is a recently renovated boutique type hotel. The staff are so friendly and helpful and really try hard to look after all guests requests such as arranging a shuttles bus to the airport or Arizona Memorial etc. and providing help with printing boarding passes. The excellent continental breakfast is set up in the charming and very comfortable frontt lounge and is available from 7 am.The rooms are a little small, however, this was not a problem in any way, however, the air conditioner unit was very noisy.One of the reasons we were attracted to the Vive is the availability of a courtesy room on the day of our departure ( 8.30 pm flight). After checking out and storing our luggage we were provided a guest room from 2pm to 3 pm to freshen up before leaving. This is a very convenient amenity and was much appreciated.My wife and I will definitely stay at the Vive again.

Visited May 2014. The hotel is in a great location less than five minutes walk from Waikiki Beach. Pros: modern, impeccably decorated, flat screen tv in room, beautiful lobby & lounge areas. Friendly helpful staff, very useful local map with directions to visitors attractions (and how to use local buses to get there!), complimentary wifi.Cons: no coffee making facilities in the room, small rooms with no closet space, limited choices in the continental breakfast offer. Would definitely stay again for a short trip or if alone. If a couple may be worth getting the suite for more room
user_name:
Dapsyd
Cape Town Central, South Africa

review_body: We have stayed at this very nice boutique hotel, which has been nicely rennovated and up-graded. The rate is very reasonable and the hotel provides complimentary continental breakfast, beach towels, boogie board, beach chairs. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly with great Aloha spirit. The hotel is conveniently located on a major street, Kuhio which is THE BUS route (USD:2.50 a ride with free transfer.), 3-minute walk to the Waikiki Beach and many shops and reasonable restaurants nearby. The hotel is for all age groups and family or a couple. The room is modern and well equipped with free wifi and nice flat screen TV. The hotel can arrange airport shuttle around USD 15 one-way upon request. I will for sure come back to this hotel when I come back to Honolulu next time.
user_name:
takakazulouislot
New York City, New York

review_body: I decided to propose to my girlfriend on this trip. Prior to this trip I corresponded with the concierge, to be specific Jacqueline Co. She was an absolute pleasure getting to know her electronically and even more so in person. The staff do everything to they can to make your stay as comfortable, as memorable, as exciting, laid back..whichever way you would like to spend it. We made a really good relationship with the concierge (Jacqueline and George) and encourage everyone else to do so. Ask for recommendations on where to go, what to do and they will give you the inside scoop. This place stands out from all my hotel experiences just because of how personable and approachable the staff is. It felt like they really cared about your stay and weren't just running through the motions. As for location, the beach was just a pleasant walk away. George and staff will always recommend less touristy areas too if you ask. I don't think we could've had this much fun if we had stayed anywhere else. Thank you VIVE HOTEL. Thank you George! Thank you Jacqueline! Thank you Cody (guy I saw around a lot)! Thank you Vive Staff! I'm glad we chose your hotel! If ever we decide to come back, we know where to stay. :-) I Miss Waikiki already....

Great location, literally 2 blocks from the ocean! Highly recommend staying in their junior suite. The room was spacious, clean, and the bed was so comfortable. I loved how spacious the room was, not to mention how huge the bathroom was. I travel a lot, and have stayed at many hotels. This one is hands down, one of the best, if not, THE best one yet! The decor was modern, and eclectic. Breakfast was great with fresh fruits, pastries, juice, and great Hawaiian coffee that is available 24 hours. But what really stands out the most is the impeccable service this unique hotel provides. Everyone from the front desk, concierge, and valet. I was blown away by how great the entire staff is. Whoever did the hiring, kudos to you! Management has done a fantastic job. I have to especially thank Jacqueline. It was because of her that we had such a memorable stay. She was genuine, friendly and you could tell she really loves her job. Thank you Jacqueline for everything you have done for us! Thank you to the staff at Vive Hotel for an exceptional stay! We will definitely return here!

My fiance and I stayed here the nights before and after our wedding ceremony on the east coast of Oahu. I actually had my hair and make-up done in this room. We were greeted at the front desk with smiles, ice cold pineapple juice, and refreshing cold towels. The front desk, concierge, and the valets were all super friendly and accommodating. We needed an iron for our room - brought up in seconds. We needed some forks and plates to eat our leftover wedding cake - they were brought right to us from the kitchen in the middle of the afternoon. The complementary breakfast included coffee, tea, juice, toast, FRESH tropical fruits and a variety of pastries (different every day - at least one including some kind of protein like sausage or chopped pork). The location was perfect - a couple blocks down a shaded street and there you are, right on Waikiki beach and close to all kinds of shopping. We would stay here again in a heart beat. A few things to know when booking: they offer rooms with two twin beds (apparently to serve Japanese vacationers) so be aware of your room description, the rooms are small for the average American couple but have everything you need, and the parking deck (valet only) has a one lane entrance and exit which could lead to some close calls getting out of the deck. Also, we were upgraded to a "partial ocean view" room. It was pretty much a tiny sliver of ocean between two buildings, so not much of a view at all. Fortunately, we did not mind.

Excellent location, professional staff, nicely remodeled building all made for a good 7 nights in this moderately priced Waikiki hotel. The hotel has a cool vibe. All of the staff were pleasant, helpful and upbeat. Samantha and Adam were exceptionally helpful. My room had a minor plumbing problem that I was not aware of, so I was upgraded to an ocean view suite. But even without this upgrade, my entire experience was positive, easy and relaxing from start to end.

This is a fairly new remodeled building and the room was nice. Not like you'd find in a four or five star but very comfortable and clean. What impressed my wife and I the most was the pleasant smiles and greetings every time you ran into someone from the Hotel. We stayed 5 nights and the service was always graciously consistent from the valet to the front desk to the person who coordinated the morning breakfast. When you're traveling, and maybe we feel particularly when you're on the islands, you want to enjoy yourself and relax. One can generally find nice accommodations in Waikiki but that in itself doesn't make the stay. Kudos to the staff and management at Vive ! Thank you for making us feel very welcome :-)

My wife and I enjoyed everything about this hotel.We stayed 5 nights and from the time we checked in and was offered a glass of pineapple juice,a cool towel and a welcome greeting what can anyone want to start a vacation.The staff was so friendly from the front desk, morning breakfast staff even the workers keeping up the fine appearance of the hotel. We had the jr suite which was big enough for any intimate setting looking out from the 21st floor. The beach is close, public transportation is right outside the door shopping is just as close as the beach .Would recommend to anyone and would come back again. Great job Vive staff. from the George Family.

A nice boutique hotel in a great location. Dont bring the familly expecting a resort, there is no pool or amenities.Close to the beach, shopping , ect. The rooms are brand new inside, the beds are very comfortable and the staff are professional and friendly.I will definately return.

Room with a tub too small; Had four pieces of luggage and no closet space. Shown a good size room on the 21st Fl. shower only for an additional $115.00. No Pool or restaurant. Two Draws under bed for cloths

I was so impressed. Early check-in was no problem and they even invited me to have breakfast and coffee straight away which was much appreciated after a long flight. The rooms are small, but clean and modern. The location was amazing, I couldn't believe how close it was to the beach for the price and they have beach towels and chairs available complimentary. And free wifi in the room. Great hotel, great location.

After getting off a flight from Australia at 630am the hotel staff kindly organised for us to check in early so we could shower and relax. Yes when we first got there the rooms were smaller than average but we expected it as it is stated clearly on their website, they were clean and adequately sized to fit two people comfortably. The staff were friendly, excellent and always helpful. Being able to borrow beach mats, towels chairs and other beach gear was fantastic! Fantastic location only one block to the beach and main shopping strip! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Vive hotel and would stay here again.

Although the rooms are small they are clean, well appointed, have a modern decor and are very comfortable. No tea or coffee making facilities in rooms however there is coffee and tea available 24 hours in the lounge area (which is amazing).Staff are friendly, helpful, very happy and also willing to share their tips as to the best places to go and the cheapest way to get there.. Every person on staff smiles..........................so refreshing.Bus stop is just outside the door. The beach is a five minute walk at the most. The hotel supplies towels and boogie boards.The only negatives are; the in room airconditioners are very loud and there are no balconies off the rooms. However this is minimal compared the wonderful atmosphere of this hotel.Would definitely stay here again!

I and my daughter had a wonderful 6-day in Vive! The staffs are friendly, the room is comfortable, the breakfast is a good and nutritious start of the day, the beach is just 2 blocks away with free towels, beach mats and chairs - everything is a blessing! The hotel is so well located that, during our stay of the March Break, there was a once-a-year festive (sorry that we did not find out the name), we watched the fireworks directly from the window of our room - it was beautiful. Yes, the room is small, however everything is clean and everything you need is there - meanwhile, how much time we would stay in the room in Hawaii? There is one more good thing about Vive that I have to say is - Vive offers complimentary room service one hour in the day that you check out. Our flight was late in the evening, and of course we wouldn't miss the chance being as late as possible on the beach. We booked the complimentary room 6:30-7:30p.m., enough time for us to take the shower and do our final packing. The room was so clean that I assumed the cleaning lady does her job every hour (?!). Our shuttle came at 7:50p.m. and we were right then to the airport. To sum up, this has been a wonderful stay in Vive and Hawaii, we will be definitely coming back again!

Looking for a fine boutique experience without the price gouge of the big box hotels of Kalakaua Avenue?Then look no further than Vive Hotel Waikiki. From the moment you enter, service is at your fingertips and style pervades the entire hotel from the decor to the wall color to the flooring and even a clean fresh scent. (Fun Fact: I learned that the GM hand-selected all of the features and decor. Attention to detail is apparent at Vive!) Check-in is a tropical breeze as you are provided white cloths to wipe your travel-weary hands and as you sip complimentary pineapple juice. The refreshment continues as you receive your key with your WiFi passcode already on your key pouch.There are two elevators to take you to your room. Once you enter your room, you'll discover smart furnishings with clean lines and intelligent storage. Some rooms are larger than others but no matter what you'll find the right spot to put your things. You may also appreciate the Korean toilets which have more buttons and features than I would ever need...but it's there if you wanted!A nice feature is that complimentary breakfast is served from 7-930AM every day. Includes tropical fruits, pastries, croissants, coffee, tea, lemon water, and pineapple juice. A great way to start your day!Parking is available for a fee but if you're staying in Waikiki and not traveling around, then you don't even need a car because Vive is conveniently located to all of the beaches and spots you plan to visit. I highly recommend Vive Hotel Waikiki. Price, location, service, and attention to detail make me a soon-to-be-return-customer.

I arrive at night time, was greeted with the warmest welcome and fresh juice as well as cold towel. Hotel was quite small, but very pretty. Checked into the room and quite surprise with the room size, as I was expected to see a big room (you know.. US = big size). It is like checking into Japan's hotel room. But it was fine for me because I was checking in by myself, Continental breakfast is included, enough to fill your hunger till lunch time with coffee and water infused lemon serves all day!! Perfect coffee too, I can't ask for more.Bedding was soooooooo comfy. There was a moment where I really want to stay in bed and not going anywhere.Location is perfect, I dont hear noise from the street, 1 block to the duke's statue beach and right next to a bus stop that takes you down town and anywhere you want to go!On check out time, night shift staff helped me to weigh my bags and helped carry to the bus since it was accidentally getting heavier. :)All in all, I would definitely stay here again and might be staying in the suite if I am taking my boyfriend with me.

Over our 12 day stay we thoroughly enjoyed the courteous and helpful staff. Requests and questions about local attractions were answered thoughtfully. Admittedly our room was small, but for the price and location we feel like it was a bargain (we didn't go on vacation in Hawaii to spend all day in the hotel room). The hotel is less than two blocks from the beach and the main tourist street. You can walk to everything in Waikiki or if you park a car at the hotel, it is $25 a day, but you can take the car in and out as many times as you want per day. Seems expensive, but after more research in Waikiki, it is actually a decent price. The hotel provides beach towels and beach chairs if you ask for them. Our favorite "extra" was the included breakfast. The fresh fruit and pastries each morning were wonderful and the coffee was tasty, not the crap a lot of hotels serve.If you have allergies you will be happy to see how they set out each item so they do not mix. For me this was key when avoiding some fruit. My only suggestion would be if you are diabetic the breakfast doesn't have any protein, so plan accordingly. Overall, yes the rooms are on the smaller side, but the price allows for you to enjoy other things in Waikiki instead of spending all your vacation money on just the hotel. We were very happy with the hotel and would return. We've recommended it to several friends.

From the moment we pulled into the valet, we both felt taken care of. The valet, front desk and maintenance staff were friendly and upbeat. After check in we were greeted by Jacqueline, who I believe is a manager (?), who offered us juice and info on Waikiki happenings. The room was nicer and roomier than expected. Comfortable bed and roomy shower. Noise level was super low, considering we were on a lower floor on the street side. We've stayed at larger hotels in Waikiki, and have both agreed, that this has been the best hotel stay yet.

First and foremost the staff from the front desk,concierge,breakfast staff and cleaning staff were all excellent. Very efficient and always with a smile. Checking in and out took only a minute. The room was not big but had everything you needed and it was cleaned,fresh towels and the bed turned down daily. For the price, it far exceeded my expectations. Will stay here whenever I come back and will recommend it to anyone who is coming to this paradise. Thank you Vive staff for a wonderful stay at your hotel.

A good base for exploring waikiki, just a couple of blocks back from the beach and right in the heart of everything you might need. A very smart looking hotel with a clean and cosy room, it was a pleasure to return to after being out exploring all day. The only minor grumble i had was the traffic noise, which even from up on floor 14 was still a bit loud, but probably not enough to put me off staying there again.The staff were always friendly, polite and helpful. One minor issue was being mistakenly woken at 4am on my second night with a wake up call mistakenly being logged for my room, but was made up for with a box of chocolates and a letter of apology. These things happen.I'd be happy to return anytime.

This small hotel was just to our liking and started our Hawaiian trip off to a wonderful start. We stayed here at the beginning and the end of our holiday and neither time disappointed us. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Especially Jackie the concierge who assisted us to get married in Waikiki beach with only a few days notice. Had it not been for her our marriage would not have come off. We will be eternally grateful to her!!The hotel lobby is modern and welcoming with comfortable lounges and furniture. The continental breakfast is a great way to start the day. We had 2 rooms and both had everything one could need with a comfortable bed and a spacious bathroom. The location is ideal - a block back from the main road along the beach with good bus access just outside the door. This location is convenient to everything in Waikiki. If you are planning an active holiday where you only sleep in your hotel then this is ideal. We cannot recommend it highly enough.

What this hotel lacks in size and amenities it makes up for in customer services. The rooms a very small and dark but location is only three blocks from the Waikiki beach. The front staff were very helpful. They suggested great places to eat and and shop. They also helped us organize getting around without a car. Having access to beach chairs, towel and boggie boards was an unexpected bonus.

Great place to start and end a long vacation at. There is a free breakfast each morning and free internet in all the rooms. The rooms are small, but you will not stay there long. The beach is less than 2 blocks from the hotel and they provide towels, chairs and/or umbrellas if you wish (all for free). There is parking, but only via valet parking for $25 a day. It is well worth it for that section of town if you have a car, as they allow multiple in and out privileges and can use it as much as you wish.Only bad part is that there isn't any fitness center of any sort at the hotel or nearby.

Poor customer service, was lied to about the total cost of the trip on several occasions, the room was tiny and did NOT look anything like the room pics potrayed on this site, housekeeping left dirty plates in our room, they charged $25/day for Valet Parking- No you can't park your own vehicle, our vehicle was not ready when we requested it and at other times the valet attendant was not present upon returning to the hotel, they turned off our air conditioning EVERYDAY when we left to explore the island. Needless to say this was a terrible hotel experience. I would NOT recommend this hotel to ANYBODY.

I recently traveled to Honolulu on a business trip and after reviewing many hotels in the Waikiki area I decided to go with the Vive Hotel. I was very please with the location as it was centered just a few blocks from the beach and walking distance from several great restaurants as well as world class shopping. Most important was the very friendly and helpful staff at the hotel! Just a few days after I arrived, they knew me by my name and were always eager to assist with any of my needs.The hotel has a beautiful lobby and sitting area where I was able to meet with clients or enjoy a continental breakfast of fresh fruit, pastries, coffee or tea. The basic rooms were modern, very clean but depending on what you want, could be a little on the small side. However, I do know larger rooms and suites are available if your looking for more space.Another great feature about the Vive is they have a courtesy room that you can reserve if you have a late flight. On the last day, I was able to check out of my room, spend time enjoying the day at the beach and return to shower and change for a late night flight If you looking for a quiet, personal and well located hotel, I would recommend the Vive to anyone.

We have been coming to Waikiki twice a year for several years. We normally stay at the same hotel in a beachfront room. This time we saw a promotion at The Vive so checked what Trip Advisor reviewers were saying. We trusted the positive reviews, took a chance and weren't disappointed. Our room was smaller than at our normal hotel. But our bill was smaller, as well, and that was nice. As others have said, the hotel is neatly modern, the breakfast of fresh fruit, pastries, coffee and juices is lovely and the staff, as advertised, is very friendly and very helpful. The location is convenient. No pool, fitness center or beachfront but we enjoyed the change.

My husband and I recently first spent a week at this hotel, it was our first trip to Hawaii and we chose the hotel based on previous "4-5 Star" reviews. We typically rely on TripAdvisor for most of our trips, eating, and excursion choices where ever we vacation and have not been steered wrong until our experience at the Vive Waikiki.First, the hotel assured us of the prices while booking and claimed our deposit would be credited back upon check-out...yet after our week stay they claimed the deposit would Not be credited back as it is a hotel tax. Which is ridiculous because if they are advertising these "discounted rates" and assuring customers of them.....then there should be NO HIDDEN FEES upon check-out.Second, there is NO parking at this hotel. All of the street parking in the city of Waikiki is metered and with Waikiki being a very busy city with a blend of locals and tourists....finding parking on the street is extremely difficult. The Vive offers "Valet Parking"...BUT THERE IS A $25 PER DAY FEE ...you also have to take into consideration the tips for the valet guys.Third, our room DID have a beautiful view of the ocean....but the room was very small, there were NO DRAWERS anywhere to store our clothes....just a few open shelves under the TV-Stand and a very small open closet that had no door or curtain for the privacy of your items. Due to this....my husband and I just decided to live out of our suitcases for the week.The bathroom was SO SMALL, I didn't even have room to store my blow-dryer, flat-iron, hair products, lotions....so they stayed in my suitcase as well and I took them out as needed. And EVERY SINGLE time I showered....The bathroom floor flooded. After a long day of driving to the north shore (WHICH IS AMAZING AND HAS GREAT BEACHES AND REALLLY GOOD SHRIMP TRUCKS) I showered....we went to bed...and around 11pm I had the maintenance guy knocking at the door to ask if "water is running in the bathroom bc the people under us were complaining of a leak in their ceiling" First of all...it was WAY TOO late to be knocking at the door, they could have at least called our room so we weren't so startled by the loud knocking. And second...I noticed this issue the first day we arrived when I showered and I notified the front desk who seemed to just disregard it. Anyways....I ended up using ALL of my bathroom mat towel, shower towels ,and hand towels each day to sop up the excess water. NOT FUN.The "Mini" Fridge did not keep out food cold.....We purchased deli meat and fruit so we could pack lunch for the beach and not have to rely on buying out for every meal...also saving us from waiting on lines for places to eat near the beach. We contacted the front desk and they sent a maintenance guy up...who told me "this is not really a refrigerator...its more like a cooler for water...it doesn't really get cold enough for food storage."Fourth, the daily cleaning service kept turning off our air conditioner. Coming from a long hot day at the beach to a HOT room is NOT what we wanted. We notified the front desk who assured they would take care of it....Yet it happened 5x days in a row...So someone is obviously NOT doing their job here. Another thing, each morning when we left the hotel for the day I made sure I placed ALL dirty towels, any sheets I wanted cleaned, food plates, glasses I wanted replaced....in a neat pile at the front door...So it was OBVIOUS that everything in the pile was to be taken out of the room. But they left our food plates and glasses 3x days in a row....Even after we called the front desk. I ended up taking my own plates and glasses down to the main lobby each morning and leaving them in the dirty dishes spot at the continental breakfast area.Last but not least....upon arrival our "Key Card" did not work, we called the front desk who sent up maintenance....whose key card did not work either. They said they had to replace the entire door lock. We figured it would take about 10minutes so we said sure. But it took 45minutes in which there were 2x maintenance men working on it. My husband and I planned each of our days with excursions and dinner reservations far in advance.....And this door malfunction greatly effected our first night in Waikiki. It prevented us from showering, or going anywhere, and resulted in us missing our reservation for dinner which we were not happy about...And the front desk seems to agree with everything and say they will fix it.....yet nothing ever changed. PLEASE don't be fooled by this hotel. My husband and I are super laid back....we barely spend any time in our room when we vacation...and we have NEVER EVER had to complain this much and are both really shocked that this was such a falsely advertised hotel. We usually just let things go....but this hotel was consistently inconveniencing us. And the hotel manager has no regard for customers.....bc after all the "room problems" we had, they never apologized nor did anything about it....AND still charged us for an extra night they claimed would be just a "holding deposit"It would be nice if this hotel realized that customer service is KEY when running a business....And were true to their customers especially when it comes to FEES. I would really like my husband and I to be refunded or discounted for our inconveniences....I feel we truly deserve it.... We are very disappointed and will absolutely share our experience with EVERYONE we know.

The Vive was a great experience for us.......we were there 6 days the first part of March and had the best time. Hotel faces Ulunio Ave. 3 blocks straight down to the happpening part of Waikiki Beach and the Pacific Ocean. Room is small but comfortable, quite comfortable queen bed and room 1507 looks out on Kuhio beach (Waikiki) and the Pacific. Staff is most accomodating and will do what they can about any concern.... Continental breakfast is the best around and seldom crowded. Oh, and we encountered ZERO bugs anywhere for our entire stay!

This really modern hotel is a gem in Honolulu. No worries about outdated décor here. Yes--small bathroom with square vessel sink and little space for cosmetics but lovely shower with nice wave pattern. This is two short blocks to Waikiki beach by the Duke's statue. The location is wonderful for beach and catching bus/trolley. Watching TV from the bed is not a hardship as the bed is very comfortable. 24 hour Beverage lounge is divided into comfortable chairs and sofas to sit 6 to 8 people in each setting so always feels inviting. In our oceanview room we could see on either side of the Hyatt Regency the ocean and part of Waikiki Beach. WiFi and TV worked great--better than some 4 star hotels! For a short stay you cannot beat this place for value. Staff make you feel at-home and book cheap transportation to airport.

**Complimentary: beach towels,mat,chair and boogie boards****Continental breakfast****24hours refreshment: coffee, tea, chilled water with lemon and chilled water**We are currently staying in this Hotel and I love it!Location is good and convenient (Behind Hyatt regency) .We booked the Standard room but I wish that I booked the suite as it is roomier BUT the standard room serves it purpose to shower and sleep.I was advised to call the manager or front desk directly to book the room and they will work with you for amore competitive rate.Everybody was friendly and always wiling to help.Thank Vive stuff. We will surely be back :-)

This is a lovely small boutique hotel. Great location near the beach. We stayed in a junior suite on the 10th floor which included two lounge chairs and end table in front of a flat screen TV with a huge bathroom with a walk in shower. The complimentary breakfast was lovely with fresh fruit, juice and pastries. There was free coffee 24/7 and free wifi. The staff was very helpful. We went from there to the Hilton for a conference and much preferred this hotel.

Spent 3 nights in Waikiki and would return to the Vive. Upgraded to a corner room, junior suite with a great view. Clean, modern and the staff couldn't have been nicer. They even supplied beach towels, chairs, boards and umbrellas at no cost and no hassle. Really liked the contemporary feel that extended from the lobby to the rooms.We are Marriott gold members, and our stay at the Vive was better than many of our Marriott stays at a fraction of the cost.Thanks VIVE!

Modern and clean with attention to guests and their needs. This hotel was a real gem amid the expensive bigger chain hotels near the city centre. Room was at back of building as we requested quieter side and was a reasonable size. Small bathroom with full bath. Loved the breakfast feature. Fresh fruit, juice and freshly baked croissants. Only drawback to hotel was the air conditioning unit which was really noisy. We didn't use it at all but could hear upstair's unit going on and off....A fair amount of noise, (cars, sirens, people coming out of bars,) filtered up to our room from the street but nothing compared to the first hotel we checked out of..because of incessant traffic noise. All in all a really good hotel, and 5 minutes to beach! Also supplied us with umbrellas for rainy evening and beach chairs, towels etc for days at beach!

The Vive was great. They were very helpful in giving directions, getting us set up. The beach towels and chairs were very helpful. We would definitely return. It's great for the price. My only downside was the food, there wasn't much.

My wife and I spend two weeks in Hawaii. Two days at the Hilton, a week long cruise & then five nights at the Vive. The Hilton was very nice but you were just another tourist paying your bill while the Vive was like being at Cheers " where everbody knows your name". The entire staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We were greeted with a smile and offered beach supplies on the way out & were met at the door to receive our towels and chairs on the way back in. We especially were thankful for everything Jacquelyn did for us. It was our 37th wedding anniversary and she arranged everything to make it one of our most memorable anniversaries ever. The rooms were clean and it was just a short walk to the beach. We had a late flight out and they even gave us a hospitality room to clean up before we left. Nice hotel and fantastic people.

We stayed at the Vive hotel in Waikiki, Honolulu, for two nights at the end of February. We booked this hotel after extensive research over the internet based on price and location. It was our second stay in Honolulu and we wanted to be closer to the beach and the nice boutiques/restaurants.The Vive hotel was perfect, we have been upgraded to a bigger room upon arrival, which was great as this hotel seems to have been completely renovated recently (it does not look as a new building but there it is very modern and comfortable). The staff is very helpful and the internet is excellent. The breakfast is very good although it would benefit to have some protein included.The hotel is on the Kuhio street so it may be noisy if your room is on the front of the building.Overall we had an excellent stay.

We were staying for a week there in january 2014.Hotel is pretty new, built 2012 I think. Located 2-3min walk from Waikiki beach.Rooms might appear small, but for us we only needed a place to sleep, and to leave our luggage.Most of the time we were outside, either on the beach, or doing tours/excursions.Rooms are clean and well maintained. Had a big LCD TV, very good WiFi.Hotel is nothing fancy (no swimming pool, restaurant, spa, laundry), but it's great value.Breakfast is in the lobby, and consists of fresh cut fruit, pastries, coffee and juice. Only downside is that...they could change itoccasionally (some variety of pastries or fruits).As most of the hotels, they got garage. Although, garage valet parking attendants were very helpful, I think 25$/day for parkingis...li'l bit fancy.The Staff is very friendly and helpful. They will assist you to find transportation, directions, anything. Great guys! (And I've been inlot of hotels...). I would specially point out guy named Kevin (Others are great too, but I cannot remember their names, sorry)As for the front desk/staff services they really exceeded our expectations!Also you have complementary: towels, chairs, boogie-boards that you can use on the beach.And very important: possibility to use "courtesy room" on the last day (if you have late flight etc)All in all: GREAT value hotel, if you're not in something fancy, and you need a clean place to stay, we recommend it.If you're looking for fancy...well you always have Hyatt one block away, or Hilton, or...cons:-2-3 min from Waikiki beach-Nice bed, big TV-good WiFi-clean-breakfast includedpros:-No laundry-breakfast variety-parking 25$-Sometimes noisy if you have window towards main street (ambulance, firefighters sirens)

My husband and I stayed here for a week. We booked via Travelocity and received 12% off, costing around $185/night (includes tax) for a cosmopolitan room. Overall, we had a great stay.As many comment, the service and staff is outstanding. Everyone we talked to was pleasant and helpful. I forgot my toothbrush and getting a free toothbrush, scope and toothpaste was no problem. We stayed on the 19th floor and found our room to be clean and well suited. The size was similar to NYC hotels, which I knew in advance. The coffee and water during the day was a great touch! I couldn't find bottled water for a reasonable price so the amenities provided were great. Something that can be improved on is the clicking noise that the air conditioner makes. Also, the bathroom was tiny, but manageable. We rented a car during the last 3 days of our trip. We took the bus ($2.50/person) to the airport to pick up the car so we would avoid a transportation shuttle on the way back. In addition, we parked at Aston Waikiki Banyan which only costed $15 for a 24 hour period (unlimited in and out). This was a great cost savings as the Vive charges $25 and the Aston was only a couple blocks down the street.Last tip - there is a hidden gem pizza restaurant in the hotel across the street (Aqua Bamboo Waikiki). It was very reasonably priced, secluded plus had a FREE corkage fee so we were able to get a bottle of wine at ABC prior to going and enjoy it with our pizza.

We actually booked this hotel for our anniversary this year because of a Groupon that we had found. The lobby is quite lovely and modern....and then it started to go downhill from there. We were trying to check-in with the front desk and it ended up being a big hassle because of the Groupon. Although we had everything that was indicated on the Groupon itself, the individual at the front desk insisted that we needed an entirely different document. Eventually it was all sorted out, however it took almost 45 minutes to get checked in and, not to mention, the individual at the front desk that we were dealing with was quite unpleasant and a little snobby (and please note that once we went to the room, we double checked - and confirmed - that we had all of the proper documentation as stipulated on the Groupon.) Anyway, it was our anniversary, so we weren't going to let that ruin it - and perhaps the individual at the front desk was just having a bad day. We finally made it to the room ....and wow.... well, it was very clean and fresh, but it was literally the size of a dorm room!! We have been in many boutique style rooms in this world, but I'm fairly certain that this was the smallest one. It was so small that if you were to get up from the bed to go to the washroom, you would crack your knee on the door frame (which both my husband and I did.) Now, I don't mean to be overly negative, so here are some great positives; the location is great (you're just a short walk to the beach and the Waikiki "strip"), because it is a brand new hotel, it is very clean and the beds are very comfortable.All in all, we probably wouldn't go back to Vive for another anniversary or staycation, but if you are able to get a good deal and you're not bothered by a small room, then you might want to give it a try.

My wife and I were celebrating our 1 year and it was both our first time in Hawaii. When I was planning our itinerary, I came across Vive Hotel on a popular Vacation package site. I came here for reviews and thought this would be a nice hotel to stay at. We booked a 5 night stay and could not be any happier with our choice. We booked a standard room with ocean view. The view was not spectacular, but we could see the ocean from the 18th floor. Our room was very small compared to big chain hotels, but felt cozy and clean. The toilet gave this foul smell every time we flushed, but I noticed the same smell at other establishments during our trip around Oahu. The customer service was superb. My cousin called Vive Hotel a week before our trip and spoke to Jacqueline to set up an anniversary surprise for us. The staff made sure the surprise was set up as described when we checked in. I took a picture of the boxes of choc dipped strawberries and candies on the bed and my cousin gave it a thumbs up. Another staff that stood out was Robb. My wife and I went out to dinner and had some left overs. We figured we can save some money by boxing it up and eating it for lunch the next day. We went down to the lobby and asked Robb if they have a microwave we can use. He stated that it was staff use only, but was willing to heat up our food for us. He walked us towards the back where they set up their continental breakfast. He came out with 2 plates and utensils and asked if we wanted to just put our food on a plate since microwaving a to-go Styrofoam tray was not ideal. I offered him food, but he respectively said no thank you. He stayed for a while and we talked about things to do nearby and places to eat. Valet is $25/night and we used this service 4 out of the 5 nights we stayed. I did not get his name, but one guy seemed like he was somewhat waiting for a tip when we dropped off our car. He had a tribal tattoo sleeve. It was unfortunately that he was only there when we dropped our car off. We always tipped every time we picked up our car. If you don't mind staying near a busy Waikiki, this is the place to stay. Clean, cozy rooms. Two blocks from Waikiki beach. Great service.
