We will most likely stay in Ko'Olina and its quiet, less busy surrounding on our next Oahu visit.

Only reason I picked this hotel was because it was a listed on a travel flash sale website. I have absolutely no regrets.Positive:- The ENTIRE staff was professional and friendly, from the housekeepers to the concierge- On that note, the concierge will go out of their way to assist you with your itinerary, Jacqueline assisted us for most of our stay and she was professional, consistent and persevering! I haven't encountered plenty of people in customer service who is like her.- Clean amenities (yay no hair in the sink!), lobby, halls, everything- Basic daily breakfast provided - pastries, fruit and juice- Front desk provides towels, chairs and boogie boards for when you go to the beach- Nice, modern aesthetic - you will enjoy your surroundings if you don't like big, blockbuster chain hotels- Walk-in shower (I stayed at the Junior Suite) with separate room for toilet- Location is great, not on the beach but just 2 shorts blocks away, the bus station is right outside (I did not take the shuttle though), near plenty of restaurants and food stopsNegative:- Very tiny: the activities sheet they gave us on the first day was not updated, better to call for updated events and activities- Valet parking only and it's $25/night

My wife and I had time to spend in Honolulu both before and after a cruise. We liked this hotel on the first leg of the trip and came back for the second stay. It is just a short block from the beach. The hotel has a European feel to it including the small but adequate room. Staff is friendly, accommodating and helpful. On our return trip they found us a room hours before we expected to move in. Good coffee and fresh fruit and pastries in the morning, in a very comfortable lounge area off the lobby. The only small issue was that it is difficult for shuttle buses to stop on the busy street - but they will. Be ready. Taxis can go up the ramp.

We picked this hotel as our stop-over place for the last night in Hawaii, and we LOVED it. Chic and modern style, friendly & helpful staff, compact yet clean & stylish room, yummy pastries & fruits for breakfast, close to many spots in Waikiki.The only downside we experienced was with the shuttle bus service that was recommended by the hotel (Hawaii Super Transit). We waited over an hour for the pickup at the airport, and an additional 30 min for the pickup at the hotel. Yes it is the more economical choice, but if you ever consider using their service, be ready to waste your vacation time waiting. It was quite upsetting to find out that the hotel refers a service to their guests that doesn't meet up to their standards. I would kindly recommend the hotel to reconsider this referral.That being said, we would definitely return to this hotel for our next trip, we'll probably just grab a cab next time!

This trip was in celebration of a milestone birthday for me this year and I wanted it to be special. My husband and I chose Vive Hotel Waikiki because of the positive reviews and I was not disappointed. The location is very convenient, about a 5 minute walk to the beach and close to good restaurants and ABC convenient stores. There is also a Farmers Market a few days a week, just a couple, of blocks away. The hotel staff were exceptionally attentive, pleasant and very helpful. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We made use of the beach towels and mats but they also offer beach chairs and other beach gear. Breakfast was included and when we went on a tour that left before breakfast started, the staff packed some fruit and pastries for us to take on the bus. A courtesy room was offered for us to freshen up after checking out since our flight left at 8:00 p.m. The hotel manager was very kind and prompt to act when there was a bit of miscommunication. Thank you Mr. Sakakibara, our stay in Hawaii was perfect and you helped to leave a lasting positive impression of our visit to your wonderful islands. I would certainly stay at Vive Hotel Waikiki if I am lucky enough to visit Honolulu again and would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Amazing hotel and amazing staff !!!!! Staff was welcoming and helpful. Perfect location!!!! I will be stayig again and again. Hidden gem !!!! Excellent rooms!!! Everything a traveller needs. Free continental breakfast is a bonus. I had one of the ocean view rooms. It was awesome just waking up and checking the surf first thing. I will be recommending this hotel to all of my friends. Complimentary beach equipment, everything you need. Couldn't have asked for better hotel. Can't wait to bring the family !!!!!!!!!! Vancouverviv

Just got back from a trip to Waikiki, and the VIVE was a great place to stay. The entire staff was friendly and cheerful at all times of the day and night. The room was immaculate and, being on a high floor, had a great view of the Ocean. Very warm lobby with use of Beach Towels, Mats and chairs. A great place to stay while in Waikiki if you are looking for a personal and friendly touch. Would definitely come back.
user_name:
VictorK99
New York City, New York

review_body: Perfect location, close to everything but a block away from the noisy bit. Good rooms, good service, better than average amenities, very nice staff. Walking distance from VARIOUS restaurants, of different qualities and prices. It is an advantage to just walk to a very nice restaurant or a quick unpretentious meal. Downsides: the beach chairs are awful (but the same offered by other hotels);the breakfast area, though interesting and of good taste, is uncomfortable: though products are of good quality the breakfast experience is rather awkward;expensive (though competent) valet parking with no discount for longer stays (you can leave the car in the back streets free of parking meters, but need to be lucky). Someone wrote this hotel is a "hidden gem on busy Waikiki": we will second that!

Great location, great decor, but best of all the staff was amazing. Everyone that I dealt with that worked here was exceptionally friendly, accomodating, and helpful. I can honestly say that this hotel staff had the best customer service that I have ever experienced at a hotel. The only negative thing I would have to say about this place is that the queen comopolitan room was a little smaller than expected. However, if you don't mind spending the extra money, they have bigger rooms. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it for others.

Booked this hotel after many reviews. It was our 2nd time on Waikiki and we did not like the old style and tiny room which most of the Waikiki hotels are. This is a fresh and very contemporary hotel . The room is great and very clean. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The free breakfast they offer was great ! Love fresh papaya every morning and the chicken cream bun is yummy, make sure put them in the oven and toast it hot! Kona coffee was tasteful! Our hotel even offer complimentary service up to 1 hour before we head to the airport for our long flight back to NY! The location of this hotel is super convenient , abc stores and bus stops right in front! The beach is two blocks down! Complimentary beach gear to take to the beach! Overall it was well worth it! I even think with the service and price it's way better than the big names hotel chains ! Definitely check them out ! Could have not been happier!

What a great place to stay. Friendly, efficient staff make you feel very welcome. The rooms are well laid out with maximum use of space and great beds. The lobby/breakfast room is beautiful and comfortable. The coffee and goodies were delicious. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who likes friendly service and great value.

Who cares if the room is tiny? The room itself was very new and modern with a comfy bed and big flat screen tv. The staff were by far the hotel's best asset, each and every one of them had our best interest in mind. They have secured returning guests just for the service! (And location, price and free brekky too of course)

We arrived hours before check in and I was not well. Beverley rushed us through so I could lay down. The staff are willing to help any way they can. The rooms are clean and tidy and close to everything you need.

Nice hotel with excellent staff. As other reviews point out, the rooms are a touch small but for what you're paying it still seems like a good deal. They have valet parking, but it will cost you 25 bucks a night. The beach is two short blocks away.

We stayed there for a week and it is our first time in this great hotel, but not our first time in Waikiki I've told the that it's our honeymoon and they've made it super spacial. The staff was extremely nice the room was cleat comfy bed and great location. The provide beach chairs. They serve breakfast as will. Great hotel keep it up guys and we will see u soon!! MAHALO!!

I stayed at the Vive Hotel between February 12-18, 2014.Pros:- Clean rooms with modern furnishings - Close to Waikiki Beach (5 mins away) and other main points of interest (Diamond Head Crater, Honolulu Zoo, Honolulu Aquarium, main shopping strip, restaurants)- Free of charge beach towels, boogie boards, beach chairs, mats - Free breakfast (pastries, juice, fresh fruit)- Friendly and helpful staffCons:- Cosmopolitan rooms are small but at the price I paid for I didn't expect to get a huge room. Bathrooms also don't have much countertop space.Overall, I had a great experience at the Vive. If you're looking for a simple hotel with good value and location then I would recommend booking your stay with this hotel. I will definitely be back for my next trip to Hawaii!

We found this hotel to be just what we needed for our 6 day stay on Oahu. Kevin from Guest Services was so helpful as well as being a really nice fellow. His recommendations re: food, transportation, sights were interesting and turned out spot on. Well done Kevin!!!The location was close to many amenities without having to pay the really high room rates. It was right on the main bus line which helped because we didn't rent a car (found public transportation very good to Diamond Head and Koko Head Crater). Kevin and other front desk staff arranged our Shuttle Bus services as required. The room wasn't really large but was very comfortable. We were typically gone most of the day so didn't need a multiple room type of accommodation. The breakfast consisted of plenty of fresh yummy fruit - as well as misc pastries. The setting is living room style as well as a large dining room table. It was at this table that we met some great people and had interesting discussions during our morning meal. Beverages were available all day - perfect for late afternoon return to hotel to freshen up for the evening! Thanks guys. The cleaning group do a great job. They were friendly and happy to have a brief chat whenever we crossed paths. All in all, we felt very much at home - welcome and comfortable. Thanks to all for improving our experience.

My girlfriend and I firstly couldn’t decide on which hotel to stay at, luckily we found Vive and the many positive reviews via TA.Prior to our arrival we found the customer service to be top notch, via emails they were quick to reply, they happily stored a package we specially ordered from Alaska without any issues, and stored our luggage while we went to the Big Island (which was very convenient as I know some hotels don’t provide that service). They not only provided great customer service, but exceeded our expectationsBreakfast was perfect for us, as we’re not big breakfast eaters. When we couldn’t make breakfast, they packed breakfast in sandwich bags two hours before breakfast started.Thanks to both Robb and Enriqueo who helped make our holiday worry-free!We highly recommend Vive Hotel and would stay here again!

As first time visitors to Hawaii, we were so impressed with Vive. Kevin and the rest of the front desk staff were amazingly helpful and courteous, always offering us a beach chair or towel to take with us to nearby Waikiki beach. Free daily breakfast was appreciated - fresh cut fruit, pastries, coffee and juice.....although a little variety from day-to-day would've made it even better. Free wi-fi. The rooms themselves are clean, modern and comfortable - small though, although that didn't matter much since we were there to be outdoors! It's so great that they offer a courtesy room after you check out for later in the day to freshen up before an evening flight back to the mainland.....that allowed our last day in Waikiki to be as fun as all the others with hanging out at the beach, etc. All in all, an excellent stay. Excellent value with great location and amenities make this an easy recommendation.

My wife and I stayed there for a week during our visit to Waikiki and it was an excellent experience: friendly and helpful staff, clean room and complimentary breakfast !Location is amazing: very close to everything and just a few steps from the beach with great places to eat (korean and japanese).Definitely recommended !

I just checked out after a 2 day work trip to Honolulu. Once again I experienced fantastic service. I've stayed at the hotel quite a few times and the staff seems to understand my specific needs and really go out of their way to accommodate me. The hotel is modern, clean, and very comfortable.

As a new mother I do not often have the opportunity to get away. Recently I was fortunate enough to take a trip with a few of my girlfriends to O'ahu. The phenomenal service that I received at the Vive Hotel was simply the icing on the cake to an amazing trip. I have always heard of the aloha spirit but the staff at Vive truly gave me the opportunity to experience it! Everyone I interacted with was friendly and extremely genuine, qualities that are often hard to come by in the service industry. Unfortunately I do not recall the names of each the staff members who helped us but a gentleman named Kevin stands out in my memory. Kevin always had a smile on his face and warmly went above and beyond with accommodating us. Neither myself nor my friends are particularly planners but Kevin truly went out of his way to suggest activities for us to do and sights to see. The team at Vive hotel truly helped make our trip one to remember and if I ever do get a chance to visit Hawaii again I know where I'll stay and exactly who to call!

This hotel is in the heart of the action. There are restaurants, souvenir shops and the beach right within walking distance. The staff was great and very friendly. Concierge was very helpful. The only negatives is the noise from the street if you have a beach facing room. The ac unit was a little noisy as well. With ear plugs, the noise was bearable enough to sleep through... Although, I'm a light sleeper. They provided complimentary breakfast but was very limited in the selection, just a handful of different baked goods, plus coffee. The hotel provided complimentary Beach towels, mats, and beach chairs for borrowing. Elevators were fast. Rooms were small but very modern. I compare the size to a typical downtown New York apartment. No laundry or kitchen tho. Rental car hertz is right around the corner. Bus stop is right next door to the hotel entrance. Great for the price!

I really wanted to like this hotel but I just feel like it was way overpriced for what you get. Pros: The hotel is clean and the location is niceNeutral: The staff was friendly but there was no "wow" factor that you'd expect from a boutique-type of hotel. No recognition - we felt like we were just another room number (and this isn't even a big hotel).Cons: way overpriced for quite possibly some of the smallest rooms in Waikiki. And I mean small. It was just so hard to see any value in the hotel when amenities were few and the price was so high. Admittedly, we booked in January and apparently that's a pretty busy time in Waikiki. However, there are definitely other choices in Waikiki that offer a much greater value. I wouldn't have minded the price if the product and service matched - but unfortunate those two things didn't live up to the expectations.

Really nice hotel! We were there in a peak season (December/January) and the price was good enough in comparison with other locations. Very small rooms, but very clean. The hotel seems new and all the furniture etc was in a very good shape. The location is awesome, 5-7 minute walk from Waikiki. The complimentary coffee, tea and water is in the lobby round the clock, and the coffee was the best we had in USA (Europeans will know what I mean with American-style coffee). Continental breakfast (sweet bread and fruit) is a very good bonus, especially in expensive Hawaii!! :)Worth recommending!!!

We stayed at the Vive for the last two weeks of January, 2014. It is a very stylish and clean boutique hotel. The continental breakfast was very good; it included pastries, fruit and juice. Coffee and ice water were also available all day long. They also supplied chairs, boogie boards, towels and umbrellas. The housekeeping staff did an excellent job. We have stayed in five different hotels in Waikiki over the past five years. The Vive is our favorite because of the friendly, helpful staff. Every time we came back to the hotel we were given a welcoming smile. One particular staff member, Kevin, made our stay extra special and he is our favorite! He was helpful, accommodating and funny. He went the extra mile to make our stay special. Because of our experience, and particularly thanks to Kevin, we will definitely return to the Vive.

I purchased a Groupon for this hotel and what a score! Initially I was not able to go and then my luck changed. I was in contact with Daniel from my panicked stage (almost cancelling) to my joy (proceeding with booking). He was amazing throughout my entire ordeal. We were there for our 10 year anniversary celebration. We were accommodated with a Lifestyle Jr. suite and welcomed with a box of chocolate and a note to congratulate us on our anniversary. What a lovely surprise. We had a small but lovely view of the water. The room was large and nicely airconditioned with two A/C units. The fridge was great as we were able to buy some drinks for our excursions. The shower was HUGE and at first I was worried about the Rain showerhead because water pressure is a big deal for me as I have waist length hair; however, it was fantastic. The king bed and pillows were nice and comfy.My only complaint is that I could hear so much noise outside during the night. Seems like all trucks have beeping sounds when backing up and there were lots of police sirens. I woke up every morning at about 5am due to these two noises. However, this is easily overlooked by everything else that was great.I thought that the continental breakfast was actually quite nice. Pineapple juice instead of Orange but that was a nice surprise. Fruit and some tasty (sweet) pastries, coffee and tea. There was a toaster oven so you can heat up your pastries (which made them taste better). Location was fabulous. Only a few blocks from the Waikiki beach and shopping. While there was no pool they provided us with free towels, boogieboards and beach chairs. I thought at first that the $25 per night valet parking was a bit pricey but realistically there was no resort fee and the parking lot was very tight. The valet parking attendants were amazing. Nice, funny, accommodating, and so helpful. Front desk was also very helpful. We loved being able to use the courtesy room too! Our flight wasn't until 11:25 pm so it was great to be able to use the shower and relax before our trip home.I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. From beginning to end we were thrilled. I will recommend this hotel and will return when we go back to Oahu!!

This is our first time in Waikiki and thank you to Hawaii and this very stylish, clean and friendly hotel will not be the last. Mahalo and many thanks to the always smiling and helpful staff! We will be back and would definitely recommend the VIVE for anybody visiting Honolulu. Location is walk distance to the beach, shops and bars.

I have stayed in the TOP hotels in area on 10+ trips here. HIGHLY recommend this hotel for families, couples, or business stays. Short 2-3 minute walk to Waikiki beach and shopping. Great breakfast included. Staff is super. Especially the valet guys. Don't spend $400 a night. KY's steakhouse is best in area, right next door. Also some "local" restaurants just across street you can eat for $6 a meal. I packed light, did laundry myself across street for $5. Stay here...Aloha!

Pros:- Excellent location: Central Waikiki, you're a 10-15 minute walk from most places in Waikiki- Modern: All the furnishings were new and the decor was very pleasing - Free WiFi: Coming from Canada it surprised me that most places in Oahu (US in general) lacked free WiFi. Having free WiFi was a treat as it allowed us to pre-plan our days.- Complimentary Breakfast: Selection was a little small (Fresh fruit, Pastry, Juice, and Coffee), was hoping for some veggies or eggs but beggars can't be choosers. Can't beat the free Kona coffee and the fresh and fresh sweet pineapple. The pastries were delicious when baked in the toaster oven provided- Cleaniness: Room was always very clean when we got back. - Lobby: Very nice modern looking lobby, relaxing music.- Staff: All of the staff had really positive attitudes and were very helpful, I was very impressed- Luggage Storage: This was a fantastic perk to have. Our flight wasn't until 11:25PM so this service gave us a free full day to enjoy lounging around Waikiki beach.- Amenities: Free beach towels, beach chairs, umbrellas and boogie boards.- No Mandatory resort fees.Cons:- Small Room: Rooms were a bit small. However, the overall layout was well designed so the space was used very efficiently. Plus we weren't in our rooms for the most part anyways so it wasn't too much of an issue.- Road Noise: You can hear noise from people who can't control their volume (drunk). we were on the 10th floor but I figure the noise is somewhat unavoidable since Waikiki is a bustling with activity day and night. When it rained the water would hit the back of the air conditioning machine causing the thunking sounds to travel into the room. The A/C operates intermittently rather so you can compressor go throughout the night. It was nice since it would drown out the sounds from the street. Overall, our stay at the VIVE Hotel was excellent. Would definitely recommend others to stay.

My partner and I stayed at the Vive Hotel during Probowl weekend (Jan 23-26th 2014) and we absolutely loved it!!! We were upgraded to the King bedroom suite which was very spacious and very clean. The hotel offers a continental breakfast every morning which consists of pastries, fruit, pineapple juice, coffee and tea (make sure you use the toaster oven for the pastries, it’s a must). We learned this the second day. The hotel also offers free wifi (which you don’t get free at any hotel unless you pay a daily resort fee of $30.00) and they provide you with complimentary beach towels, mats, and even chairs for the beach, which you would typically have to buy elsewhere. The hotel also provides their guests with a complimentary room for one hour on the date you check out in case you want to go to the beach and need a clean room to shower in before your flight. Like which hotel offers that for free???? Although we didn’t take advantage of this the option was definitely appreciated. Furthermore, the hotel is located only minutes from the beach so it was only a short walk each morning. The staff was incredible as well! Kevin was awesome in letting us know about the cool hot spots in Waikiki and basically helped us with anything we needed. He was amazing! My partner also proposed while we were there and George was fabulous in making arrangements to ensure our room was decorated with beautiful flowers upon our return. It was stunning! Overall, we had an amazing stay at the Vive Hotel and when we return for our wedding we will definitely be referring our guests here!

Vive just opened up in July, 2013 and is located where Uluniu intersects Kuhio in Waikiki. It is a short walk from the beach where the iconic Duke Kahanamoku statue is located.This is a European boutique style hotel. There are leather couches in the lobby, continental breakfast is served, and there is no pool. Although there is no restaurant or bar, you don't have to wait 15 minutes for a crowded elevator like the resort hotels either.The service was excellent. Robb at the front desk is da kine!!! He's super friendly, helpful, and gave good recs on dinner and nightlife. The remainder of the staff was also friendly and gave an Aloha spirit.Unfortunately, IMHO there are many downsides to the rooms. They are tiny for $179/night (Expedia): Two people would feel very cramped in the room. You basically walk into the room and nearly trip on the bed. In addition, there is no real closet, the air conditioner sticks out the window, and the bathroom is narrow. Additionally, one of my pillows really smelled, as though the pillow case was not changed. It also smelled on the second night. Lastly, there is no ocean view.I would not stay here again. There are better deals in Waikiki at this price that have bars and a view.

What a great little hotel. I booked through Hotwire, so I didn’t know I was going to get this hotel but I’m really glad I did. My first impression was a great one with the front desk staff. Friendly and efficient. The room is small, and the bathrooms are very small. However, my personal “thing” with hotels is cleanliness. I don’t care if the room is big or small, it’s got to be clean. (I worked in the hotel business for 17 years, so I’m a little picky). Vive exceeded all of my expectations. There was nothing wrong with the rooms and their cleanliness. I was very impressed, and thoroughly enjoyed my stay because of the care with the room.Vive is a select service property (No restaurant, no bar, etc). What they do offer, they do well. The continental breakfast in the morning is simple but nice. A couple types of fresh sliced fruit, a couple types of fresh pastries, coffee, tea, and juice. The location is great. 2 minutes to the beach, and fairly central to everything else. I would definitely stay there again.

I really enjoyed my stay here. Wonderful location/1 minute walk to the beach, great staff and nice amenities. Sure, $25 for parking is expensive, but every hotel charges this. The free breakfast is basic, but does what it needs to do (rolls/coffee/fruit/juices). My room was small, but nicely equipped/comfortable. I was by myself, so I did the smallest room they offered, for reference. The absolute best part of this hotel is the fact that they well let you come back later in the day after you've already checked out and park for free and use a room for free to change/shower/get arranged before you head to the airport for an overnight flight back to the mainland. This was a life savor as I was able to fully enjoy the island (swimming/getting full of sand) and then change back to my Minnesota winter-wear before heading back to the frozen tundra. Highly recommend.

This was our first time in Hawaii and thanks to the Vive Hotel and beautiful Waikiki, it won't be our last!We arrived into Hawaii very early and extremely exhausted from a long flight - we were told our room would not be ready for a while but we were welcome to have breakfast and coffee...About 15 minutes later, a room was found for us. I can not express how grateful we were for that, thank you Beverley! For the first night we stayed in a cosmopolitan room which is a good size for singles and couples. From the second night onwards, we stayed in a junior suite which really suited us (and our shopping bags!) The décor was beautiful, modern, clean and new, really lovely.The location of the hotel is perfect, not even a 2 minute walk to the beach, main strip and endless ABC stores! What makes the Vive Hotel really shine is its staff. I'm afraid to name people in case I leave someone out but here goes...Jacqueline has a smile for you every day, remembers what your plans are and genuinely cares about your time in Hawaii. Kevin couldn't do enough for you, you'd ask for something and in a blink of an eye Kevin had it already organised. Beverley did so much to make our stay comfortable and was extremely informative and helpful. Michael assisted us greatly with a special request that we had. The ladies that organised breakfast every morning were so beautiful and friendly, even re-ordering my favourite muffins when they had finished so I could enjoy them the next morning! If I have missed anyone, I am sorry. You are all appreciated and equally special and unique!Thank you very much for making our stay amazing, can't wait to come back! Dario & Amalia.

We had an awesome stay at this hotel. Kudos to the staff who were friendly and helpful. A special shout out to Kevin and Cody. This hotel is very close to the beach, it's modern and centrally located. Vive supplies beach towles and chairs, boogie boards, AND a complimentary breakfast. The rooms were clean and the furnishings were comfortable. Free Wi-fi was a nice addition. Mahalo to Vive. We can't wait to go back.

It's an excellent hotel to stay at in Waikiki. It is chic yet very comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful, especially the parking valets. This hotel is in a great location - walking distance to beach, restaurants, shopping and bus stops. The hotel provides great amenities such as complimentary continental breakfast to start the morning; complimentary beach towels, chairs, boogy boards (upon request) for trips to the beach. I love the set up of the hotel breakfast area, there are various comfortable sitting areas with small tables and there is also a breakfast bar. It is well appointed and inviting. The rooms are modern and very comfortable. It is very clean and we loved the HUGE walk in shower. The bathrooms very clean and neat. There were two air conditioning units that quiet and kept the room nice and cool - very important for me after being out in the sun. The room had lots of outlets for my electronics. Our room had a lovely view of Diamond Head and partial ocean view, very enjoyable while I work on my computer. Parking is by valet only. I really like it, the valet were great. They were friendly and provided fast service.We really enjoyed the stay at this hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Great service and great place!

We flew over to Oahu for the weekend from Maui to get away for a bit. We had reservations at a very large resort which isn't really our style to begin with. We ended up moving over to the Vive, and are extremely pleased that we did. The lobby has a very fresh and chic look to it with contemporary furnishings and fun electro lounge music. All the staff we encountered were extremely helpful and genuine. We stayed in one of the junior suites. The room was quite large, extremely clean, there were ample outlets as well as a desk for our electronics, a huge closet and more storage under the bed. The bathroom was our favorite part. Again, very clean and fully equipped, but the ginormous shower is what really stood out. There is something fabulous about having a shower that is probably larger than some hotel bathrooms I've seen. The atmosphere at the hotel was great. It was large enough that we definitely felt that we had plenty of privacy but small enough that you didn't feel as though you were going to get lost in a crowd. We encountered several of the same staff members throughout our stay. They were always willing to give suggestions and make sure our stay was fantastic. This hotel has a great location and would be a lot of fun to travel to with a group of friends. We will definitely be back to the vive and will be recommending it to our friends on Maui.

In a nutshell I'd say fabulous staff and great location! One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in for sheer helpfulness (and I've travelled worldwide and stay in a hotel on average once a week). The concierge, Jackie, absolutely stood out for me, as she was unbelievably helpful before I'd even arrived. I had a lot to plan and I'd been emailing her weeks before I'd arrived (my parents were joining me over Christmas for their 40th wedding anniversary), nothing was a problem. She continued to help me throughout my trip recommending great places to eat and drink, as a single girl, as well as fab activities I could take part in. I left feeling like I was leaving a friend behind! The rest of the staff including George (concierge) and Kevin and Beverley (reception) were supremely helpful and friendly too - day and night (the reception is manned 24 hours). I simply can't fault them. The hotel is literally two blocks from the beach and the main streets with all the shops, restaurants, bars, other hotels. I felt very safe walking around at night from the hotel to these locations. Nothing was more than about a 10 minute walk away along very busy streets. The breakfast was simple - fruit and pastries, with a selection of teas and coffee, but that was perfect for me as I'm not a big breakfast eater and was off to learn to surf. Throughout the day and night there was always complimentary teas and coffees. The breakfast area is really cute with a range of breakfast bar, comfy chairs, benches and tables and chairs. The rooms are immaculate, comfy and minimalist in a modern, cool way, with neutral decor. I felt very at home! I would have no hesitation recommending this hotel. It really is an obvious choice, especially if quality of service is the most important thing to you! Outstanding.

The Vive Hotel is an excellent hotel to stay at while in Waikiki. Staff was knowledgeable and friendly. The hotel is walking distance to the beach, restaurants and shopping. The hotel will give you complementary beach towels, chairs and boogy boards upon request. Also, they have a complementary breakfast as well. If you have a night flight back to the mainland like I did, the hotel will offer a room for you to shower and freshen up in before you go the airport. The rooms were kinda small but that was not an issue since I did not spend much time in the room. I would like to personally thank staff member, Kevin for his wonderful hospitality. If I come back to Waikiki, I will definitely stay at Vive.

The 20th floor view where we stayed, is remarkable, at this very stylish, clean and friendly hotel. Our ten day long Christmas vacation was wonderful there - Mahalo and many thanks to the always smiling and helpful staff! We will be back and would definitely recommend the VIVE for anybody visiting Honolulu.

It was a WONDERFUL stay! I purchased a Groupon deal for one night at Vive. I emailed Vive several months in advance and requested a room upgrade, and rose petals in the room, as a surprise to my fiance. The Vive representative (Brittany K.) was very responsive, kind, and accommodating. When we arrived, everything was in place, the room upgrade and additional touches were PERFECT! The attention to detail was very touching, and it was a great experience.Some business do not treat younger guests with respect (we are in our late 20's), but that was not the case here! We were treated as valued customers, and would gladly return as a result.

A reasonable choice if you seek for a place to stay with a friend and don't want to spend too much money. Clean, relatively new hotel in the central of Waikiki. The room was pretty small, although there was a balcony. The continental breakfast was terrible.

The hotel is a 2 minute walk from the beach and you can borrow beach towels, chairs and boogie boards for free. Free wifi and continental breakfast are a huge plus as well as a courtesy room you can use if you have a late flight out and want to freshen up after a day at the beach. The staff are always smiling and very helpful and the hotel is clean, fresh and modern. For the price and the brand new rooms you can't get a better deal than this.

We found the location to very central to activities in Waikiki. The hotel looks very new and looks and felt very clean, they must have just completed a remodel. Kevin was very helpful upon check in, very friendly. Our room was well decorated, housekeeping staff checked on us to be certain all was good. WiFi was complimentary and worked well, no hassles. Nice continental breakfast in the morning also complimentary. No need to bring beach towels on your trip, they have towels and other beach gear you can use during your stay. I will be back, thank you.

We stayed at this hotel only one night due to flight change and previous booked hotel had no room availbale for the change.Location is quite good, near the beach and shopping, food. My room is the the basic type and has everything basic enough. Due to long journey, we spent most the time sleeping and rest. Hotel was very good for us to check in early in the morning.The only drawback was the air-con, it was the window type and was quite noisy. The bed is too soft for me.The inclusive breakfast was a very simple but good enough one. Juice, coffee, milk and tea, bread and desserts, buffet type.Overall it is ok if the price is not expensive but the aircon noise must be improved.

Wow! I have to say that this hotel was quite impressive. The rooms size is fine for 2 people the lobby is chic and most importantly the rooms are very clean. Rob, Cody, Jackie and Kevin provided services that exceeded our expectations. We had a late flight so they offered to hold our luggage and then carried it up to a free courtesy room where we showered before leaving. Then, we forgot our sonic-care toothbrushes and they shipped them back to NY for us. Boogie boards, mats, and towels are provided as well as a free continental breakfast. There's a $25.00 fee daily for valet parking. Definitely get a car to explore the east/west coast and north shore of the island. There are great beaches (pokai bay) that aren't crowed like Waikiki and many places to hike and eat. (izakaya gaku= best japanese and roy's=amazing food)

Staff are fantastic! Very welcoming n helpfu Always smiling n professional. . Booked this hotel because it was a good price. Rooms were small just a bed n tiny bathroom. No facilities eg pool restaurant etc but in a fantastic location about 2 min walk to beach n shops. Breakfast was dissapointing. Continental breakfast should Inc at least toast n cereal.. they only had fruit n some pastrys juice n coffee. I would recommend this hotel for ppl who will be out most of the time n just need a bed because it's great value for waikiki

My family used to stay at the Hotel Renew, but with the new management things aren't the same, so we decided to give the Vive a try. When traveling I tend to choose boutique hotels, because of the personality and intimacy of each individual property. The Vive will not let you down. There attention to detail in design and customer service are on point. The art, furniture and design of the lobby and rooms are very classy and not too much. The rooms are perfect for Waikiki. They have very comfortable beds and beautiful bathrooms with tasteful art throughout the room. Conveniently located in the heart of Waikiki, a block up from the Duke statue, the Vive will definitely be our boutique hotel of choice when staying in Waikiki.

The hotel served as quite an ideal budget accommodation and we enjoyed our stay here. We had always wanted to visit Honolulu,Hawaii and when we got the chance, we managed to squeeze in a budget trip to Oahu. The hotel was nice, the décor quite cheery and yet, elegant. The staff was very warm and welcoming and their smiles were as inviting as the aura and ambiance of the hotel. The rooms were nice, cozy and comfortable. The bathroom was clean just like the room and was well stocked with the basic toiletries. The room also had the basic amenities like TV etc. and all worked quite well. The best thing and the thing that we most liked about the hotel was the provision of coffee/juice all day long and provided complimentary. The location of the hotel was perfect especially for us beach lovers. The beach was so close, we could walk to it in minutes. The staff was very friendly and helping and helped us out a lot by providing information during our sigh seeing spree. We recommend this hotel highly to all.

This newly opened hotel is located 2 blocks away from the beach. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel offers free WIFI, breakfast and courtesy room for guests to use - what more can you ask for? The hotel staff was excellent from the housekeeper to the front desk staff. All were very knowledgeable, polite, professional and very attentive to our needs. The only downside was the A/C unit noise. We had to turn it off at night, but then again, we could hear the street noise from the busy Kuhio Avenue. Anyhow, we got used to it after a night or 2 so it was not too bad. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Vive and would definitely stay at this boutique hotel again.

Vive Boutique HotelMy husband and I took a short get away to Oahu December 5-9, 2013 and stayed at the VIVE Hotel. This is our second trip. We simply love this hotel. They offer complimentary breakfast, which includes coffee, tea, pineapple juice fresh muffins, seasonal fruit, and pastries in a stylishly designed lobby, which looks more like an upscale lounge.The beach is 2 1/2 blocks away with many restaurants to choose from in the area.Our junior suite offered us a perfect view of the ocean and Diamond Head. Jackie, the concierge, referred a bike rental just blocks away. We rented mopeds for three days and toured the island. The front desk staff, Daniel, Robb, Beverly and Brittany are simply amazing. They are the epitome of servant leaders. Our entire family will visit again in March 2014 and we are definitely staying at the Vive.Book your next stay here! You won't be disappointed.Five stars!!!KEITH & NICOLE

We stayed at the vive waikiki hotel after making a last minute booking due to an error in our booking at another hotel and can i say "thank goodness" because the vive was awesome! The lady at the front desk was so lovely and warm and even let us check in early which was especially appreciated as we had come from a 7am flight from sydney.The downstairs hotel foyer is beautiful and very modern. The room was comfortable and very clean, only complaint is that the bathroom was a tad small but seeing as we didn't spend a whole lot of time in our room that didn't bother me much (being female I probably just have too much stuff! :p).The staff were very accommodating and also happy to provide us with complimentary beach towels, beach mats, chairs and boogie boards. Breakfast selection is small and consists mainly of a small selection of pastries and three different types of fruit. There's also fresh coffee which is 24/7, juice and water. It's all complimentary so you can't argue with that! The hotel itself is in a good location - literally 2 min to beach and also very close to shops (5min). I would highly recommend this hotel!

A pleasant stay recently. The staff are all friendly and attentive. It's nicely cared for rooms, we had a corner one looking toward Waikiki Beach. Very close to town, I would stay again if I went to Waikiki. They ran out of English Breakfast Tea while I was there, if you're a tea drinker you may make comment on this. Hawaii seems to be full of coffee drinkers. This small incident was no reflection on the pleasant stay we enjoyed.

We found by chance this brand new hotel perfectly located few steps from the best part of Waikiki beach. We stayed in a standard room city view. Right size for 2. Furniture very stylish in its simplicity. Complimentary breakfast simple but really enjoyable. Staff at reception and garage very kind and professional. Room rate very competitive considering location, service and the advantage of a brand new property.

This is my third time in Waikiki and I try new hotels each time. Let's start with the location. It's the perfect walk to the strip of Waikiki. Great location with great views. The hotel was very modern from the furniture to the design it was perfect. The front desk was extremely helpful and courteous from the check in to check out. The checking in process was fast and easy. Rooms was a bit small but a decent size, rooms was very cleaned. Would definitely recommend and would stay again!

My wife and I were greeted by an excellent reception at the front desk upon check in. Chocolates and a handwritten note recognizing our honeymoon were placed on our bed in advance. Having booked the room online we were surprised how small our original room was. That was quickly corrected by one of Vive's greatest assets, Jacquelin Co, Chief Concierge. She was extremely helpful in setting up reservations and activities during our 2 night stay. Housekeeping and front desk staff were also top notch. Even had a chance to meet Dan,Vive GM prior to departure. Definitely a must consider.

Very clean and new furnishings. The rooms are small by US standards but not by European. Having a hospitality room you can reserve is a great plus. It was nice to have a place, after checkout, to relax and freshen up before heading home. Keep in mind you do have to reserve a time to reserve the hospitality room. Also the lobby offers coffee and hot or cold water all day.I can't say enough about the staff. Eveyrone was fantastic! Even if the hotel was so so, which it wasn't, I would stay here again because of how terrific the staff is. I spoke with most of the staff on multiple occasions, front desk reception, concierge, valet, breakfast room, and housekeeping. All the staff was very pleasant, helpful, friendly and always smiling. I've stayed at 5 star hotels and not found as good a staff as we experienced at VIVE hotel. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to friends.

Overall, I had very good impression from the hotel. Pros:* relatively low price for Waikiki;* everything is clean, everything looks new -- in the room as well as in the lobby;* free WiFi;* complimentary breakfast: might be too minimalistic for some (fruits, pastry & coffee), but all fresh and tasty.Cons:* the room is small (Cosmopolitan Ocean View Queen), pretty much most of the space is taken by the bed;* the A/C is loud, may be disturbing at night.

I am a local here living in east Honolulu but decided to take a few days of stay-cation in Waikiki over the weekend. Chose the Vive since it is so new.....and my instinct was absolutely spot-on. This is a great place to stay with reasonable price points for what you are getting. I have zero concerns or complaints. Clean, neat, customer-oriented from the second you walk through the doors. While not overplush....it is very well decorated and all furnishings are chic and fabulous. I travel all around the world and stay at some very nice resorts/hotels....and I can say that this Vive ranks well with anyone. It is what it is.....simply eclectic and remarkable. The lobby area is a great place to relax and chill....great taste in the style. All employees were very engaging with their conversation but not pushy or patronizing. They genuinely care for you and your needs. Kuhio Avenue can be a dog and pony show with all kinds of activities trying to get your attention....but this is truly an oasis in the middle of all the entertainment. The street noise was no big deal in my estimation....especially with the AC turned on. Very comfortable room indeed. Bed was awesome....and good for everything you need or desire! ;-) If you want to avoid the parking costs and don't mind walking....just park up on Monsorrat Avenue across from the Shell at Kapiolani Park. Free on-street parking on the left hand side of the road....safe in my opinion. Only about a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel....and will save you $$ if you have to pay either at the Vive or any other local structure. As well, up the street at the Waikiki Banyan parking is $15.00 per 24 hours....only a couple blocks east up on Kuhio Avenue. Parking at the Vive will run you $25.00 per day....which is about what you will pay most places if not more. Save the $$ and just walk a few minutes to Monsorrat Avenue. If you are looking for a fantastic experience.....you cannot go wrong with these folks. Continental breakfast was good....but some people may want something more substantial. Plenty of options from which to choose all around the property....but that always comes with a price, right? So enjoy all the comforts of the Vive.....just do it!

Hotel was modern, nicely furnished with a very nice lobby and staff was very friendly and welcoming. The rooms are cozy, VERY CLEAN (stayed at many Hawaiian supposed 4 star hotels and been subjected to heavy mildew smell) and the room nicely appointed. Ocean view rooms have glimpses of Waikiki water and nice views of the city. With all of these great factors it's also very reasonably priced, in fact for the money, you feel you are getting an upscale Starwood hotel at a deep discount and I've stayed at The W in Honolulu several times for triple what this hotel cost me and was WAY more satisfied with my room, service and friendliness at Vive. Easily one of Honolulu's best kept secrets.

I've been in many hotels in different countries but this hotel beats all. we decided to stay here again on our most recent trip. Other people have already mentioned the convenient location, and included breakfast,

We stayed at the Vive for almost three weeks. Between business and family travel I've stayed at a lot of hotels from budget to premium. I've never been made so welcome in a hotel by literally every staff member we encountered. And the hotel was super clean.

I was on Oahu for business this week and stayed at the Vive. I knew I wouldn't be spending a ton of time in my hotel, so I really didn't do too much research...I based my decision pretty much on price alone. For the price, the Vive wasn't a bad choice. The rooms are clean, the staff is super helpful, and the location really isn't too bad...just one block from the beach. The only negatives are the parking prices ($25/day) and the size of the rooms. I have never stayed in a smaller room in my career (and I've stayed at dozens of hotels in NYC), but it really didn't bother me, because I wasn't spending much time in my room. Also, the shower flow was weak...again, not enough to complain. Overall, a nice place to stay in Waikiki.

I stayed at the Vive Hotel for 7 nights at the beginning of November 2013 with my mum. We chose the Junior Suite from a previous review on TripAdvisor, and we were thrilled. We booked through the hotel directly, as they had a better rate than the one on Expedia. From the moment we arrived, the friendly staffed were ever so helpful with assisting us in whatever we needed, and although it was early in the morning, they had organized a room to be ready for us ahead of check-in time. We were in room 1808 (I think) and we had a corner room on the building, with Diamond Head on the left and facing straight down to Waikiki Beach. The room was impeccable, clean and brand new inside. The huge king bed is so comfortable, and the bathroom is amazing!! So much bench space for all of our toiletries and a HUGE walk in shower. I've never seen anything so mind-blowing in all my life - showering at home is just not the same!! The room includes free WiFi which was super-fast and great, and breakfast downstairs was good. You get a choice of fruits and pastries/croissants. If I could add anything, some hard-boiled eggs and maybe toast would be a great addition however there are so many places to go out for breakfast so this really wasn't a big deal at all. The hotel is literally a 2 min walk to pretty much everything, with bus stops and trolley stops all around, and a quick stroll down the road will take you straight to Waikiki Beach where the Duke statue is. Fantastic!! This was our second trip to Hawaii and I would highly recommend this hotel - in fact I already have told everyone I know about it. If you are wanting a view, do yourself a favour a pay the extra money for the Junior Suites. You may not be right on Waikiki Beach, but you can see it from the window and that was sure as hell good enough for me! I thoroughly enjoyed standing at the bathroom sink every morning, brushing my teeth and having a view of the ocean and horizon in the mirror's reflection!! Also the hotel has no pool or restaurant on site but seriously who cares?! For the price we paid, which was much less than any oceanfront hotel in Honolulu, this is without a doubt the best value for the location, convenience, service and cleanliness. Just book this hotel NOW!!

I chose this hotel on Expedia originally because of the location. I am happy I made that choice. The staff are very friendly and helpful to all my questions and needs. Location is excellent as it is a 5 min walk to the beach, shops and restaurants. I stayed there for 7 nights. Rooms are nice and clean.
user_name:
Jonny C
Richmond, British Columbia, Canada

review_body: My wife and I, stayed at Vive Hotel in Waikiki for 8 days and we loved it. The price was just right and the staff was excellent. Very nice breakfast too. Close to anywhere we wanted to go. Will return. The room was a bit small, but it was enough for us. They do offer bigger rooms for more money if thats what you want. So in a few words.. Best Hotel for your money..

Excellent location, walking distance to everywhere we wanted to go.Plus the bus stop is right out front. The staff is awesome. They provided a great map of the area, bus information, and great recommendations on what to do and where to eat/drink. The continental breakfast is delicious and the yummy kona coffee is available all day. The hotel is chic and very clean. My room was a little smalller than I expected, but it was fine. The decor is great, bed is very comfy, and the room was very clean!My only suggestion would be to add ceiling fans in the rooms. The weather was not too warm during my stay so the small ac was enough to cool the room, but a ceiling fan would really help circulate the air and keep the room cooler in warmer months. Especially since the bathroom does not have a fan.There is no pool or restaurant but you are a short walk away from the beach and several good places to eat/drink. Just ask the staff, they had great recommendations.I thoroughly enjoyed my stay in this hotel and would certainly stay here again!
user_name:
Sylvia N
Torrance, California, United States

review_body: Stayed at the Vive Hotel in Waikiki for five days and four nights. Located very close to Waikiki beach and the main strip in Waikiki. Rooms were clean, with simple but chic furnishings/decor; the Cosmopolitan room was a bit small, but catered to our needs....I do have to say that we could've used a bit more water pressure in our shower (the shower in the courtesy room was a lot better). Other services included free WiFi in each room, cable TV, in-room safe, continental breakfast, had fresh coffee/tea/water in the lobby for guests (available all day), free beach towel/mat/chair/boogie board rentals. What made our stay were the staff - they were excellent. They were there to help us book our car rental, and answer any questions regarding excursions and local restaurants, etc. They were also very accommodating when we needed a late check out time as our flight out of Honolulu was not until midnight (e.g. offered us to stay in a courtesy room, kept our luggage after check-out, made sure we had a way to the airport).Overall, it was a great place to come back to after a whole day of exploring Oahu.

The service and front desk staff was super helpful and nice. We had an early check-in and late check-out and staff gladly accommodated us with that, also held our luggage. They provided map and a list with events in the area.The hotel was very modern, clean and located near Waikiki beach. It also included continental breakfast, beach towels, boogie boards, free wireless internet. What else do you need for perfect vocation? Thank you for an amazing stay!

The room was just right. The people were friendly and helpful. The location was amazing (Halloween in Waikiki is crazy); we were able to walk to whatever we needed – the beach, food and entertainment were all a short walk away. We will choose the VIVE Hotel Waikiki again.

I just enjoyed a lovely stay at Vive Hotel Waikiki. This is a new boutique hotel that has been completely renovated and refurbished. Vive has an urban chic decor/feel and I loved it. Don't get me wrong, I love the whole Hawaii-ana and tropical feel of Waikiki, but you get that every where you go. At the end of the day I liked coming back to my room at Vive and walking into that feeling of casual sophistication. I had a junior suite and highly recommend this category. It is a bigger room and my room, on the 21st floor, had amazing views. The rooms do not have lanais but when I'm in Hawaii, I want to be on the beach when I'm not in meetings. I loved that the Vive is only a short 2 block walk to Waikiki beach. Because it's not beachfront it has a great price point. It's a smaller property so it definitely feels less crowded and more intimate. AND the best part, a simple continental breakfast is included, there is no resort fee and there is free WIFI. No hidden costs to add to your bill. I honestly don't think you can get that at any other hotel in Waikiki. Lastly, the staff was great -- they all remembered my name and were available to answer any questions I had or ready to offer any service needed. Thank you, Vive!

My family and I stayed at the VIVE right after it opened in August 2013. We were only staying in Waikiki a couple of days and it met our needs quite well. It is newly renovated so everything is very new and clean. The rooms were a pleasure to stay in but are very small. The staff was very pleasant and its location is ideal...just two blocks from the beach. It offered a very nice and simple continental breakfast. For a short stay in the area I would highly recommend it.
user_name:
Joe H
Staten Island, New York

review_body: This is a boutique hotel, giving a very hip feel. The expansive lobby is quite attractive with comfortable seating. The rooms are on the small size; the bathrooms have pocket doors, and are a little close to the bed. Breakfast was included in our cost; a continental breakfast is served (fruit, croissants). While not on Waikiki Beach, the hotel is located just a few minutes away; the staff will provide you with beach towels, chairs, etc. I can't say enough about the staff - they are young, friendly, and very eager to help in any way possible. They give the impression that they enjoy making your stay a pleasant one.The price compared quite favorably to other hotels in the area. All in all, we were quite pleased with our stay there.

Perfect hotel for us, located so close to the beach and shops, restaurants etc. Rooms compact but with everything you could need, and all new and smart. The staff were awesome, couldn't have been more helpful, they let us check-out late and then use a courtesy room to shower and change as we weren't leaving until late. Breakfast was good, and the free tea, coffee and water all day was a nice touch, as was the free beach towels, mats and chairs. We originally booked for three nights but enjoyed it so much we came back later in our holiday.
user_name:
Ben W
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: The Vive is two blocks from the beach!!! I walked everywhere. I even walked to the golf course. This place is in a great location. You will pay less because you are not right on the water but trust me distance is not a factor. The hotel has all of the beach supplies your need: towels, chairs, and boogie boards. All are free. There are two "ABC Stores" within a one minute walk. You can walk to everything!!!!! The rooms are very small but the TV has 150 channels. The room also has a safe. It is very clean and in great shape. The place has been renovated with Ikea style furniture. It works! The AC is a window unit but works well. The bathroom is very small!!!! You have free wifi in the room and a free breakfast. Now, the breakfast is a joke. It was juice, cut pineapple and a danish. That is the only negative. The staff is very nice. "Beverly" is a gem. She is super friendly and extremely helpful. She is the kind of person that makes you come back to a hotel over and over again. I really like this place! It is a bit small but you will not be in your room anyway. I can't stress enough that you are within walking distance of everything!!!!!!From the airport, take a shuttle. It is a good deal. You can also take a bus everywhere. They have a good bus pass deal as well.

Wow what's the word for no worries in Hawaii...vive. We arrived 10am and thought we wouldn't be able to check in. Our room was ready and not only that but they offered us breakfast as well.We didn't want a buffet so the fresh fruit, juice, breads and coffee was perfectGeorge concierge knew everything and really loved his job and his islands and was very helpful. The rooms not huge but that's normal for $150 in Waikiki. The bed was really comfortable. Window AC? A lot of condos and hotels built in 70s. Rental cars near by for $50 perday.Don't expect ocean view but Location is central and close to beach. Wifi free in rooms an lobby is welcoming with sofas, chill music and coffee whenever. Not espresso but that would be expecting too much

This place was home for the past two weeks. Everything from the modern furnishings, fixtures, amenities, towels, etc are in like-new condition. The room was well-kept, it felt clean and sterile which added to the high level of comfort. Everyone on staff from front to back of house are friendly and professional. Overall, a very pleasant stay.

Our second visit to Oahu and we used the hotel for sleep and breakfast as we were out and travelling the island every day. The free continental breakfast was nice, but could be enhanced with a little daily variety...by morning 7 we were a wee bit bored! Our room was well appointed but the location offers very little in the way of a view other than other hotels, apartments and street scenes. The staff were pleasant but haven't yet developed the art of enhancing the customers' holiday experience with knowledge of the island or even the local area. Parking is a nightmare! The hotel rate ($25 per day) is slightly undercut in price by the parking garage opposite, but adding even $20 a day there is too much... the first hotel to not punish you financially for hiring a car will make a fortune! Too deep in the streets of Honolulu for us... we stayed in a similar hotel last time on a street half a block from the beach and the location added loads to the holiday island feeling!

We recently stayed here for 2 nights before heading to Maui. Really liked the location and the staff was great! We were upgraded to an ocean view room on a higher floor and enjoyed thefree continental breakfast as well. The room was on the small size but for only two nights and only the two of us it was fine! We enjoy the "boutique" hotel experience and with the Vive being recently remodeled it was clean,fresh and a great stay!

Just got back from our trip to Hawaii and we stayed at Vive Hotel Waikiki. Newly remodeled hotel with free continental breakfast 7a-9am and free towels, beach chairs and boogie boards. Our room was clean and comfortable with queen size bed, fridge, safe and view to mountain & ocean..it did the job for us since we were out and about the whole day. Great location, short walk to beach and main street with shops, bus stop right outside of hotel, and cross street infront leads you to king kamehameha statue on waikiki beach. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We would stay there again.

We just back from Hawaii yesterday, we stayed in Vive Hotel Waikiki for 5 nights for celebrating our anniversary. Hotel was very sweet to give us a congratulation note and a box of chocolate, also upgraded our room from city view to ocean view. The hotel and the room are new and clean. The location is great. 3-5 minutes walk from beach, lots restaurants nearby, and a bus stop in front of the hotel. Friendly staff made our stay quite enjoyable. Special thanks to Mr. Daniel who arranged a late check out (1pm) and a 1 hr free use of room for showering before we left for airport.

Stayed in this hotel for 8 nights and never regretted our choice. Cleanliness is the most important factor I will look out for a hotel room and VIVE hotel never let me down. The room is small but good enough for couple like us (The bed is a Queen-sized bed). For family with kids, you may need a bigger room than this. This is a relatively new hotel in Waikiki. The lobby is big and grand as compared to other hotels in the area. The concerige George gave good ideas as to where we should go since our trip is a last minute one. Not much research done on our own. The famous Waikiki beach is only 3 minutes walk from the hotel. Somemore, hotel guests can borrow their beach chairs and towels for free. Just remember to return when you are back! Some suggestions: 1) can have floats for guests too as I realise some hotels do provide that too.2) Beside cold breakfast, some toasts or cereals can be added to the spread. Eating 9 days of cold bread really scare me off.3) an option for King sized bed.

Exceptional friendly and very helpful staff which was what made our stay so pleasant. It's very clean and comfortable. Located two blocks from the beach. Only complaint I have is that if you're a light sleeper it's noisy. There's a lot of traffic going by the hotel as Kuhio Ave is a major thoroughfare with buses going by every 5-10minutes. But that's beyond the control of the hotel the other noise that kept me up all night on the first night was the air conditioning which makes a loud humming noise. I had to turned it off in order to sleep. Otherwise it's all good!

Staff exceptionally friendly & helpful. We stayed in king suite - huge room & bathroom. Free wifi & continental breakfast great value. The hotel is 2 blocks from the beach, cross over Kuhio & you can see the water.Also close to shops in particular Ross in Seaside, best value shopping in Waikiki!

Nice new hotel, with staff that care. Felt like we were special to the hotel, always welcomed back, and any requests for advice, bookings were rapidly attended to. The most pleasurable, was the use of a complimentary suite, to freshen up prior to our late night flight. The Taxi was waiting, loaded with our luggage, at the requested time. Only downside, was the noisy air-conditioning (not just this hotel though). Handy to the beach and towels provided. Recommend for a relaxing, pleasurable stay.

Staying at VIVE right now as I right this. My husband and I have a few more days stay here but it has been absoloutly wonderful so much so that we don't want to leave. The hotel is is in a great location, right along the bus routes and Waikiki beach is just about a 2 minute walk. There are many restaurants in the area and for those of you who need a car rental Enterprise and Alamo are literally around the corner. There are many ABC stores in the area if you need to pick up the odd item. Inside the hotel, the staff go out of their way to please. Every morning the front desk will greet you with a friendly Aloha and welcome you back after your day out, George and Jacqueline at the concierge desk were tremendously helpful in organizing all of our excurcisons, car rentals and shuttles to the airport. The hotel has a nice breakfast spread which we were very pleased with each morning and was included as part of our stay here. All the rooms are suited with free Internet and free local calls. Having said we definitely would stay here again, it has been heaven on earth so far. It's just a shame we have to leave this place. Definitely a must stay!

Saw it on groupon for almost $100 off/nt so I jumped at it needing a place to stay QUICK! (Talk about perfect timing) What got me was "new hotel". Well turns out it's just a new name for a building thats been recently renovated. It's located right next to Hy's, a fine dining steakhouse. Across the street there was some kinda little bbq restaurant with outside seating. Didn't bother going there. When you drive into the hotel, valet is on the second floor. Front desk is in the lobby. The room I had was really small. There was a little closet to my right as i entered the carded entry to my room. It contained a luggage rack, hangers, iron, mini digital safe, and ironing board. The mini fridge could barely fit my four water bottles and perrier, but I did get a slightly larger than reg sized bottle for all of them. None could fit on the door and I couldn't understand why it had a bar going across to brace...? It has a flat screen tv (40"?), WIFI, 2 chairs, queen bed and a nightstand on each side with 2 lamps. The ac was a 7800 btu, but it did the job for the small room. They also had blackout curtains. I didn't know where to put my boxers and stuff, but later realized there were drawers under the foot of the bed... duh! The bathroom had a sliding door with no lock. It doesn't have much storage space for the ladies that carry tons of makeup and whatever else they use so if you are looking for counter space, forget it. Even the sink has about a 2 1/2" rim, but what blew me was the depth of the sink. It was only 2" deep! Man, I had to watch where my boogers flew because they would bounce right back up! Lol... I used to watch my aunts fill the sink with water to wash their faces so I felt I had to mention that as well. There's a tiny black bag on the bottom of the sink with a blow dryer inside. It has a full size tub and the water runs well with plenty of hot water. They supply shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, lotion, and bar soap. They serve free breakfast from 7am to 930am? Coffee, decaf, water, pineapple juice, tea bags, muffins, pastry, crossaint, strawberry and grape jelly, melon, pineapple, and cantelop. To the left as you exit the hotel, there's mac 24/7 that's open 24hrs serving a wide variety with local foods. It's a couple minutes walk on the same side. To the right there's Chili's about a 5 minute walk and a few other restaurants around there. Fattys is a great "hole in the wall" place for chinese. No dim sum though. It only has about 10 counter seating so just wait on the chairs outside or make takeout at the other door. Hula dog serves interesting puka ("hole" in Hawaiian) hot dogs with Hawaiian relishes. If you like udon then marukame udon makes their udon and everything that goes in it from scratch. Expect to stand in a long line! Dukes is nearby which is an open restaurant on the beach. Good place to chill and watch the sunset with some good food. There are several open markets around and the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center which is the biggest shopping center in waikiki. Great restaurants and name brand department stores. Man, so many things to explain that I need to end it right here. To sum it up, bad for barbie doll and good for ken. Walking distance to everything and couple blocks from beach. Enjoy!

The rooms and bathrooms were unbelievably small. However, because of this, we didn't spend much time in the room. Also, when we arrived in the room we were shocked that there were no curtain. The only thing that blocked out any of the lights from the city below was a small shade that didn't really cover much. We also noticed that the windows were able to be OPENED from the 16th floor! That just seems like a terrible idea from a liability stand point. The hotel was average overall but I definitely wouldn't recommend it or go back.

I searched online for room availability before purchasing a Groupon. With the assumption that there are available rooms, I bought a Groupon and called to make a reservation only to find out there are no "Groupon" rooms left, but regularly priced rooms are available?!?! It sounds to me like, we have those subpar rooms set aside for Groupon guests, which are all taken, but we have those standard rooms still available at full price.I guess this is more of a "dislike" of their business practice than their actual service, which I will probably never experience. It feels like being treated as a second class citizen.

very new and clean. My room was very nice and with a bath!The wifi worked perfectly, was so happy of my stay in vive and I was glad of my choice to book with you.The only thing the time of breakfest if you have a late night make sure you wake up early if not you will miss it as finishing at 9.30 am. But he most important the customer service is exemplar.The front desk was always smiling and wishing you a good day.Particularly, the front desk staff name “Kevin” is so nice and helpful if you have any question about activities to do in Hawaii as : “IE :Best place to eat ,shopping don’t hesitate to ask him ,he is so helpful. Thank you again staff of vive and specially Kevin.You made my alone holiday trip fantastic thank you all Frederic
user_name:
Frederic121
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: We stayed from 9-19 to 9-22 and the accommodation was great! The staff were very nice & friendly. Excellent customer service. The room was clean, nice & modern. The view from our room we can see Waikiki beach (17th floor). Very nice & clean. And you can't beat the price!!! Free continental breakfast (server did a great job). We definitely stay again.

My wife and I are from Oahu but like to 'saycation' once and a while. We usually stay at one of the bigger resorts. We decided to try this new boutique hotel mostly because it was about 50% cheaper than our normal hotel and closer to the Hawaii Five-0 premiere party we were going to. The Hotel was gorgeous and must have been recently renovated. Very upscale and 'hip'. The room was large for a boutique hotel and the decor was top notch. Of course the bedding and bathroom are the most important to us and they were both superb.We know Hawaii customer service pretty well so we don't expect a lot. lol But from the valet guy to the front desk girls we were more than impressed. And the second morning i came downstairs 5 minutes too late for the complimentary breakfast and the Concierge must have seen my disappointment in my face. She asked if I was looking for breakfast and I said yes. She proceeded to call housekeeping to bring up a tray of goodies and a pot of coffee they had just put away! Thank you Jacqueline the concierge!!!!!My wife and I are looking forward to our next stay at VIVE!!!

Arrived on 9/22 and checked out 9/27, we got upgraded to a room with partial ocean room on the 19th floor, very smooth check in! Clean room with bathtub and comfy beds, fresh fruit/ coffee and drinks with simple pastries for breakfast is complimentary! Needless to say, good speed free wifi and great customs service! On our last day, we asked for a late check out at 1pm and we were provided a courtesy room for shower/ nap for an hour before we head to the airport in the evening,how great is that!This place is def great for people wanting to explore honolulu for its great location ( one blk from beach) and good nights sleep that give you all you need! :D will def return again!

We booked this hotel through Livingsocial, and we were a little unsure of how good this hotel is, because it is new. The location is very good, pretty much right next to Waikiki beach, international market and royal hawaiian centre. Staffs are very friendly and helpful. Valet parking was a little over my budget, but parking is expensive in Waikiki, you can't avoid it. Morning breakfast is complimentary and simple, coffee and water are provided in the lobby.

Vive was exactly what my girlfriends and I were looking for for our weekend stay-cation in Waikiki. A boutique style hotel that gives the full-service treatment to all guest, not just the high paying visitors.It was modern, stylish, and the customer service was top notch. The valet and concierge were so accomodating and one step ahead of our every need. It took our weekend stay-cation to the next level and made us feel like we were in vegas, LA or even NYC for the night. Just what a group of local girls needed for a night out in town:-)THANK YOU HOTEL VIVE! We will be back again for sure...but next time in the sweet penthouse I've heard so much about:)
user_name:
Keely B
Honolulu, Hawaii, United States

review_body: Breakfast was great every morning. Pastries with fresh fruit. Location was close to everything. Everyone was so helpful from the valet boys, front desk, and concierge. I would definently stay here again.

Vive is a lovely boutique hotel in a really convenient location. In just a few minutes we were able to walk to the beach, the zoo, many shops, restaurants and more. The lobby is welcoming and modern and the staff makes you feel so welcome - not only when you check in, but each time you come in the lobby. Jacqueline was the perfect concierge -- make sure you ask for her. I understand this hotel has just been completely renovated -- and every detail has been thought of. The sleeping rooms are comfortable and the showers are huge! We really appreciated the free Wi-Fi and free continental breakfast. Make sure you inquire about the shuttle service to and from the airport, Pearl Harbor, etc. -- much cheaper than a cab. If our plans allow for another trip to Honolulu we will definitely stay at Vive.

Took a tour of this property as it has just opened after a complete makeover. Result was a stylish three star property that could hold its own in Paris or Manhattan and a fresh addition to the Waikiki hotel scene. Hotel starts above in house parking facility on seventh floor. Most all standard rooms have queen size beds, though there are some twins. While on the small size at 225 square feet, the rates are good for such an inviting comfy room. Prices increase with the view and height of floor.Kuhio Avenue is not beachfront so any ocean views are partial.The well priced king bedded junior suites, while oddly oblong in shape, were spacious for Waikiki at 390 square feet. The bathrooms are much larger, with a huge walk in shower. Breakfast is included and beach chairs. towels, and boogey boards are complimentary.Air conditioners are new window units. Junior suites had two.None of the rooms had a lanai. Otherwise the property is a solid trendy choice.

Why you should stay here: 1) Magic Mike-like sexy valet boys ^o^2) Free breakfast; local fruits, pastries and kona coffee 3) Central location in Waikiki; local restaurants, high-end shops, gym, bars, grocery stores, sex shop and a church ; ) - rainbow friendly 4) Spacious, modern rooms, well appointed decor, with views to die for; ocean, city, mountain, volcano (comfy bed and soft-clean linens)5) Friendly and knowledgable staff (shout out to Beverly, Jacquelyn, Jeff and "Laura"-inside joke) ---- This will be my hotel of choice upon my return to Oahu!!!!

Nice modern lobby very cozy and comfortable with free wifi for the guests, Free breakfast buffet unlimited bread basket, fresh fruits coffee or tea. You can also borrow beach towels, beach chair, body board and the staff are friendly

Cons (we'll get the bad out of the way): Small rooms.
