Ridiculously shallow sink (simply spitting toothpaste causes a tsunami backwash that sprays the room!). 15th floor was not high enough to avoid the stench of the street below (a kind of Bourbon Street funk, if you know what that is, mixed with the cloying scent of coconut tanning oil). They lost power twice while I was there (though it was quickly restored). "Ocean view" blocked by UGLY concrete buildings reminiscent of 1950s soviet-bloc construction. Parking is ONLY valet and expensive @ $25/night, plus valet tip. GIGANTIC chicken bone in the breakfast pastry. Waikiki Beach isn't really a beach! Pros: Good price for the area. Recent renovation. Friendly staff. Beautiful lobby. Free fruit/pastry/juice/coffee breakfast. Free loaner beach gear. 2 blocks to beach. Really comfy bed -- I mean, really comfy. Easy access to restaurants, etc. Park for only $20/day directly across street w/easy in & out. Overall, the hotel was probably one of the better things about the Waikiki area (which I quickly realized was not my cup of tea). You have to try to udon noodle house just down the street on the same side of the street as the hotel -- Murakame Noodle House was perhaps the name? Find it by the presence of the line out the door.......

I would be lying if I said this was a five-star hotel, but the service is definitely top notch. My wife and I travel so much we wanted to save some money by choosing some less pricey hotels. This hotel does not have nice amenities and the windows in the rooms are not large. The rooms are clean and the cleaning ladies are thorough. The hotel has been renovated recently so it has a very stylish look. The hotel does not have room service, which is something I usually love to have in my hotels. I did not miss it, because of the service we got here and there are so many great restaurants within walking distance. This hotel is in close proximity to the beach. The hotel provides a continental breakfast that has pastries and fruit. All of the workers here were very informed about Waikiki and the entire island of Oahu. They were also very polite and helpful with everyday things in the hotel. This hotel has boogie boards, beach chairs, and beach towels that they will loan out to you when you go out to the beach. The valet was nice enough to pack the items for us in our car as well as return them for us to the front desk when we returned. The last day of our trip my wife and I were very sick, so we did not get to explore before we left. The hotel offers a courtesy room you can stay in before flights after check-out. My wife and I were able to rest before our flight. It was such a nice and courteous gesture that my wife and I decided that The Vive Hotel will be our choice next time we return to Waikiki.
user_name:
kscorreia
New York City, New York

review_body: I was really blown away with the level of service at this hotel. Throughout my one week stay, the staff at the VIVE, specifically the concierge were extremely helpful in planning activities and answering questions about the area - they truly went above and beyond to accomodate me. For example, Jacqueline at the concierge desk went through the trouble of arranging a car rental and planning an itinerary of activities for me throughout the week. Aside from the service, VIVE is newly renovated and miles ahead in quality of other hotels in the area - most hotels on Waikiki (especially in this price range) are run-down and falling apart. Several other reviews cite how small the rooms are, but in truth I prefer a new, modern/clean room to one that is larger and dated. Overall, VIVE is a great value compared with other hotels in the area, and the personalized service is a huge plus. I'm sure I will be back.

I love small, boutique style hotels and this hotel met all of my needs. Please know that I am extremely PICKY, but I found this hotel cozy, clean, well decorated, well located, well staffed and well priced. The staff was so sweet, especially Jackie, the concierge, who made some excellent recommendations and reservations for me. There are a lot of overpriced, ugly hotels in Waikiki, so do yourself a favor and choose VIVE. You'll be happy there.

We stayed at the Vive Hotel for one week. The hotel staff was courteous, friendly, and accommodating. They made us feel welcome. The room was clean and large and it was worth the cost since it also included a continental breakfast. The hotel is centrally located and it was easy to take local transportation and also walk to the beach, shops, restaurants and other places of interest. We had a pleasant stay and we would recommend it to our friends and family.

We booked a room at VIVE in spite of all the reviews warning us about how tiny the rooms are, because we got a good deal on Living Social, and because we knew we'd be out all the time and not really spending any time in the room. Which was true, but it's worth noting that all the reviews are correct: the rooms are indeed tiny. There are also two "extra tiny" rooms on each floor, and we got one of these, on one of the lowest floors (I suspect because we booked on Living Social - many hotels seem to want to punish you for circumventing the system in order to get a cheaper deal!). The room was barely larger than the queen bed within it, and had almost no flat surfaces to put things down on. Because we had no room to unpack anything, all our stuff remained jumbled and disorganized in and on our bags for the duration of our stay. The bathroom was nice, and modern, but also tiny, and with no counter space at all. The elevators were small and slow, and inevitably by the time it finally reached the lobby, there'd be twelve other people waiting there with you, and you'd all cram on it together.All that being said, the staff were friendly for the most part, the complimentary continental breakfast (coffee, pineapple juice, croissants, danishes, muffins, fresh pineapple, honeydew melon and cantaloupe) was tasty and convenient, and the lobby and breakfast/lounge area was clean, modern and stylish. Most notably, the hotel is located just two blocks north of Waikiki Beach (the Duke statue, to be specific) and this goes a little way toward balancing out some of the negatives mentioned above. In summary, the VIVE Waikiki is trying hard to be an upscale hotel, but even with the great location and modern look, the rooms are just too tiny to justify the regular price being charged. I would stay there again only if I were able to find a similar discount.

The Vive hotel should pride themselves on the decorating and color scheme they provide throughout the building. This is not a boring drab hotel like many others you will find. The welcoming staff and atmosphere made for a smooth check in and a wonderful stay. The BEST part about the hotel is the massive shower!!! Biggest and best i have ever used. The bed was comfortable and the room was perfect. Would stay here again for sure. Adam the valet guy and Jacque the concierge made my stay even better with their outstanding service! Thanks everybody!

I am giving this hotel 2 stars because it is a nice price for the location (3 blocks from the beach, close to main attractions), the rooms are nice, modern and clean (small but nice), there's a complimentary (small) breakfast every morning, you can use their beach equipment and lastly the staff are friendly (excluding one very uninterested staff!)I stayed at Vive August 8-12, and this stay was during my 25th bday weekend. My stay was pleasant up until I was trapped in their elevator for 1 hour. I am a pretty grounded person so I remained calm and did what I was suppose to do (luckily I had my cell phone with me, and it was 1 other person in the elevator). I didn't become bothered until 15 minutes into being stuck, I finally was able to reach front desk staff by phone. Well, they were very nonchalant about the entire thing! After 30 minutes of no check in or reassurance from them, myself and the other guy decided to call 911. We'd had enough. Once the ambulance gets there, we were out in no time. We had been in there 1 hour total.We realize that this can happen anywhere (things happen), but it was the nonchalant, uninterested, lazy apology that bothered. After all, I was stuck for an hour on Sunday morning. This caused a huge inconvenience as my husband and I were late to worship, not to mention it was terrifying and unsettling! I was sort of scared to get back on the elevators after, but my room was on the 18th floor.Apparently being trapped in their elevators were "no big deal" because the staff never approached us after the incident, management did not personally apologize and you'd think they'd have the decency to check on me and the other guy. The apology was a sorry note and a bag of "Honolulu cookies" on my bed after my return back that evening. I can't say that I appreciated the gesture because it was very impersonal and little effort. It would have been nice to receive a REAL apology, a reassurance that issues as such do not normally happen at their establishment and the proper way to apologize would have been to offer something a bit more extravagant than cookies! A complimentary night stay, a discounted stay, dinner on Vive, a free excursion, massage gift cert.Am I being ridiculous? I just didn't FEEL the apology. Unfortunately because of this incident, I will not be staying again nor recommending Vive as a hotel.

The staff were excellent especially the tour advisers; kristan & george and the front desk officers! They used their initiatives to make our stay extremely comfortable and value for the money spent. They often bent a bit without breaking the rules. That is customer service!!

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this lovely new boutique hotel located 2 blocks from Waikiki beach. It's walking distance to all the good eats, shops, international marketplace, beach.Rooms are on the smaller side, but I hear that's norm in Waikiki, the free bfast is simple: 2 choices of fruits, some sweet breads, juice, coffee/tea, Valet parking is $25/night with in/out, there is a public parking garage across the street for $20/night but no in and out priv. We preferred parking at the hotel anyway, the staff always available to get your car and super friendly. Rooms super clean, great bath & body works soaps, shampoos & lotions. Great experience overall, would recommend & stay again if back in Waikiki.

Had a great stay at Vive. Everything is brand new and tastefully designed. Lots of amenities like free internet, free breakfast, free beach towels and chair hire. Only down side is no pool / outdoor area but you're so close to the beach that it shouldn't really matter. Also right next to the bus stop. I'd highly recommend this hotel, staff were very pleasant as well - very good value!

We spent a night at the Vive on our way back from Kauai. This hotel is a couple of blocks up from the beach which was great to be away from the craziness. The staff were amazing, the room was perfect and our entire experience was stellar! We will definitely stay at this hotel when we fly through Honolulu again.

Junior Suite Ocean View - room is standard hotel room, no lanai /balcony, ocean view if you are standing at the window, no tea/coffee facilities in room if we want hot water we need to go to the lobby from 20th floor, no ice bucket, air con is 2 window units in overdrive. We are booked here for a week! When I asked about a balcony I was shrugged off, so I am not sure if there are any rooms with a balcony.Advertising was somewhat misleading!

As a local business traveler, i usually shop rate, not location or service. This newly renovated boutique hotel has all 3 and then some. The lobby is spacious, clean and very well appointed and the inclusive breakfast was perfect. Valet staff was really helpful with airport transportation and the check-in experience was seamless. I loved my room decor and, while I agree they are small, I doubt many people need more space than what is provided. Who stays in their room while visiting Waikiki anyway? The bed was comfortable, pillows super yummy and I loved the 'Bath and Body' amenities. Can't wait to go back! Thanks VIVE!!

Everyone knows Waikiki is very expensive, but if you don't need (or can't afford) a very highly priced 5-star resort hotel right on the beachfront, then we'd warmly recommend the brand new Vive Hotel. Sure, it doesn't have a pool, a gym or a fancy in-house restaurant but it's well located just a couple of blocks back from the noisy crowded beach and is smart, clean and comfortable. The rooms are well designed to save space (and so save money) and the staff are first class - very friendly and helpful. Add in complimentary continental breakfast in the lobby and free wifi - what more do you need? Compare the room rates and you'll see the Vive is really good value for Waikiki.

We are local so this was a staycation for us and we truly loved it and plan to stay again the room are a little small but comfortable, clean and cute. The staff is extremely friendly always smiling doing even the small things like pressing the elevator button for us. We will definitely stay again we will just get one of the larger rooms. Also price very reasonable compared to other and there were no hidden fees and we were walking distance from everything The Clarke's

I had a wonderful time at the Vive Hotel! Even though the room I had was small, it was still very comfortable, with a great view, and always very clean. The staff were always pleasant and smiling, willing to help, and knowledgeable about the city. I had an issue with the shuttle service getting back to the airport, and the staff called them for me, helped with my bags, and made sure I got to the airport on time. The hotel is right next to a bus stop, which is very convenient, and a 3 minute walk to the beach. Truly an ideal location! Thanks Vive!

This was our first trip to Hawaii and we are in love! My wife is always worried when going to a new place because you never know what you'll end up with. Vive was everything you want in a hotel. The rooms are small, but clean and modern. A/C kept the room comfortable the entire time.Clean - Vive was very clean, from the rooms to the lobby, even the elevators. The cleanliness was a remarkable feat because sand is everywhere. Especially because of people like us that are constantly on the go. Location - The hotel is 2 blocks from the Duke statue, which is a meeting place for many activities and a major entrance to Waikiki Beach. Me BBQ across the street is Korean bbq to die for.Staff - The staff was always smiling and happy to help. Especially Kevin at the front desk. This guy was our go-to for everything from tours, activities, food, nightlife and maximizing our fun in the sun. If there was an award for greatest front desk guy ever, it would be Kevin. Also housekeeping deserves a round of applause because the sand is cleaned up as soon as it's tracked in. How they keep up, I'll never know but greatly appreciate it.

This new chic hotel is situated 2 ½ blocks from Waikiki. I stayed at this hotel with my mom and daughter for 6 days on business. The entire staff was absolutely wonderful and made our experience enjoyable. The managerial team including Robb, Beverly, and Daniel are friendly and professional. VIVE provided free breakfast every morning, beach towels, beach chairs and boogie boards at no cost. Since they just opened, we were able to catch a new promotion and we received a $40 Visa gift card each night of our stay. Wow! Rates are reasonable and the view of Diamond Head and the ocean are amazing. Are you planning your trip to Oahu? Stay at the VIVE! Dr.Nicole J

Vive Hotel Waikiki definitely has a boutique hotel feel. Upon entering the hotel I was greeted by friendly staff in the salubrious lobby. Although new to their positions, all the staff members performed well above my expectations, constantly pointing me in the right directions, answering all my questions and finding me the best deals in a foreign land. I enjoyed their positivity and smiles as i passed through the lobby throughout my 8 day stay.Hotel rooms in Waikiki are notorious for being on the small side, Vive is no exception! However, unlike the rest of the hotels, Vive offers newly renovated and refurbished rooms. The bed was very comfortable and the outside noise was minimal. Vive also offered complimentary WiFi (quite fast), use of beach gear (good condition), and breakfast (fresh fruit and juice was great).If you are looking for holiday where you want to lay next to the pool and relax in bed I wouldn't recommend Vive. If you want to actually enjoy Hawaii for it beaches and natural beauty I don't think you can beat the value offered at Vive Hotel Waikiki.Cheers JB!

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for four nights. Once we arrived, we were greeted by a wonderful staff that were not only incredibly helpful, but also very willing to provide us with useful information on Waikiki beach and surrounding areas, restaurants and stores. Our room was beyond small but was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. They're still working out a few kinks in this newly renovated hotel, such as an ice machine. The coffee was excellent and available in the large lobby area, even at 130pm. This was too small for us, but overall, the staff made this stay memorable. Highly reccomended to younger people, college age, surfers, and couples who are not planning to sprawl out in a spacious room. Great location, great service, great front desk and great concierge, beyond great valet. And did I say Great staff?

I travel a lot to Hawaii - mainly Oahu - and wanted to try something new. I had heard that this new hotel was opening up, so I took a chance on it. I'm glad I did. First of all, the price was right. Hopefully they will keep the prices at a reasonable level as they start to build a following! When I priced it in July 2013, they were by far the best value for price-location-room. It's really a beautiful hotel. Lots of vibrant colors, but nothing too flashy or cheesy, like some of the "aloha hotels" can be. It's not a big resort hotel, but a smaller independent hotel. They have a nice continental breakfast with Hawaiian coffee, juice, rolls and fruit. It was all fresh...not packaged cheap food like some big chains offer up. I ate it every morning I was there - saving time and money. Wi-Fi is free and it was pretty swift. The beach is a straight shot...just two short blocks away from the hotel. The hotel is on Kuhio, the second most street running through Waikiki. It's not on the street that runs right along the beach (Kalakua?), which can be kind of loud, even at night. Kuhio seems to have more restaurants...and affordable ones...than are on Kalakua Street. Bottom line...I will go back there when I revisit Oahu. I'll ask them what "Vive" means next time. Aloha.

I am in Hawaii regularly for business and the Vive is a very good boutique style addition for Waikiki.One of their first guests during opening week, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay in a junior suite room on the 20th floor.Very good facilities complimented by attentive and friendly staff. Absolutely recommend after my experience.Russ, Auckland, New Zealand.

Flat out took care of the guest. This is a hotel only one block away from the beach and all the action. They just opened and not many locals were familuar with the place but they soon will be. All of the behind the desk staff was kind and helpful. They provided beach accessories, towels and everything. The room was comfortable and boutique style living i was seeking. The only problem came during check in, I originally received the wrong room due to an expedia booking mix up but it was quickly corrected. Ask for Rob he was the man, got our bags moved, booked our shuttle and recommended pleanty to do. Pictures of hotel are very accurate on line. I will stay again and recommend for couples of all ages. No car was needed , u are right in the mix trust me.Signed the 1st guest to give a happy review. Way to go Vive, the Marshalls are some happy guest.
